reviews.author: Michael Aaron
reviews.text:
I really enjoyed the food and atmosphere here. They are very well decorated especially for Halloween.

I had a crock of onion soup. It was nice and hot. They used croutons instead of the slice of bread.

I had a chicken sandwich with micro greens and cheese and avacado. The cheese could have been a little more melted on the sandwich but this is totally nitpicking.

Everything tasted great and the service was quick and friendly. Very locals only vibe. The bartender knew her clients kids and asked them about how they are. This is what it‚Äôs about. I‚Äôd come back.

reviews.author: Alex VanOrman
reviews.text: They initially told us an hour wait but we've been dying to try it so we said we'd wait. Went across the street to this amazing little bar and they ended up calling us after 35 minutes! We had beautiful weather and got lucky that they sat us in the patio. The atmosphere was super chill and beautiful. The wings were delicious and crispy and the mozzarella sticks were good. Definitely our top 5 wing spot in Buffalo!

reviews.author: Jim linaburg
reviews.text: Wings and chili cheese fries were great. Service was a little slow to start but once we got served they did a good job. Atmosphere was pretty cool. If ever in Buffalo again, I would probably go back.

reviews.author: Marco Lopez
reviews.text: So wifey and I are on a typical road tripping vacation.   The hotel staff found out I wanted wings of course.  They recommended Gabriel's gate as a local favorite as opposed to the hyped up one.  The wings were good.  We got mild spice.  Their blue cheese burger was a bit dry considering I ordered it cook medium.  Wifey had a cheese steak sandwich and it was very good.  Especially the next day with a light nuke in the microwave.   The server was fabulously helpful and friendly.  Place was super busy and everyone really seemed to be enjoying the vibe of the place.  It's a shame that we live a few thousand miles away because we would definitely be back.

reviews.author: Cat
reviews.text: Food was absolutely amazing!! We had multiple recommendations to go here and it did not disappoint. We went for the wings (10, medium heat), chilli cheese fries and spinach bread and everything was beyond delicious. Thank you!

reviews.author: Eugene C
reviews.text: This restaurant is a true gem. The pasta is absolutely amazing‚Äîfresh, flavorful, and clearly made with care. The staff is incredibly friendly and welcoming, which makes the whole experience even better. It‚Äôs easy to see why this place has been around so long. A wonderful spot for anyone who loves authentic, delicious food paired with genuine hospitality. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Nigel Ottman
reviews.text: Best pasta and bread in the 315! Every time I‚Äôve been the food and service has been top notch. Today I had chicken riggies which were incredible! Nice and spicy with delicious pasta and plenty of chicken breast. It‚Äôs hard to get reservations so be prepared to wait, or join the wait list on line. It‚Äôs worth the waitüëç

reviews.author: Darth Bane
reviews.text: Not my proudest moment choosing to combine gnocchi with carbonara sauce but I was tired of vodka sauces.  So don't make my mistake, but the gnocchi were perfect clouds of goodness and the sauce was still perfect.  The calamari was cooked perfectly, but maybe a tad too much salt.  The hot tomato oil is addictive. Definitely worth the wait.

reviews.author: Ellie
reviews.text: been wanting to come here for years - finally went the other day, and i was not disappointed! the food was spectacular (especially the bread and hot tom oil to start!) i got the ravioli and it was amazing! do yourself a favor and come to pastabilities if craving some delicious fresh food!

reviews.author: Adam Morgan
reviews.text: I'm visiting from out of town my friend made a reservation here for us. It's clearly a popular place and I highly recommend getting a reservation. I got a seasonal special (Harissa Glazed Salmon) and the Forbidden Fruit cocktail. Put simply, everything tasted great and the bread served prior to the entree was a nice touch. Staff were prompt, friendly, and helped to troubleshoot a minor miscommunication at the end of our meal. Easy 5 stars from me!

reviews.author: Jimmy Liang
reviews.text: If you‚Äôve been around Dumbo before, you know that restaurants will charge an arm and a leg for the same dish half the price elsewhere. Not the case here! The food here was really authentic and flavorful, the walls were just covered with notes from visitors all over the world, and the service was incredibly fast considering there were about 2 servers and maybe one guy in the kitchen. The atmosphere is also festive all year round‚Äîjust a cool taco joint overall! Glad I stumbled in and discovered this gem of restaurant! Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Kai Mendez
reviews.text:
Honestly, this place is a hidden gem! A Mexican restaurant with the most beautiful touch: amazing Venezuelan people running it with so much love and kindness. From the moment you walk in, you feel like family.

I have to highlight Valentina!! her energy is absolutely radiant. She‚Äôs beyond attentive, sweet, and makes you feel at home instantly. She doesn‚Äôt just serve food, she serves joy. People like her make the whole experience unforgettable.

The food? Delicious. The vibe? Warm. The service? Impeccable. I can‚Äôt recommend this spot enough it‚Äôs the kind of place you‚Äôll want to come back to over and over again.

If you‚Äôre looking for a restaurant with incredible flavors and even better people, this is it. Full recommendation from me! üíØ

They made my birthday a whole celebration!!

reviews.author: Krishna pino
reviews.text: After my running session last Sunday I decided to stop by Pedro‚Äôs to get Mexican food. Everything was delicious, I ordered the Ceviche and a plate with four different tacos. OMG if you are by Dumbo area this is definitely the spot to stop by. The server Stephanie was awesome and super friendly, she took the time to explained to me the menu and also gave me recommendations.

reviews.author: Michael L
reviews.text: This has been, for years, my favorite restaurant in Dumbo. Solid Mexican food (get the enchiladas, they always hit the spot) good drinks, and damn good prices, especially for the overpriced Dumbo. The fact that it's steps from the subway so I don't have to drive after so many margaritas is a bonus.

reviews.author: Mx. Daniels
reviews.text: I wouldn‚Äôt recommend the watery bread soup. The music was too loud, I waited close to an hour for my food. I wasn‚Äôt like amazed by most of my food choices. Some of staff were laughing at patrons, including myself. I had this hype up for a long time, and wasn‚Äôt impressed, too hyper stimulating environment for me.

reviews.author: Michael Karelis
reviews.text: Great little Thai spot with tasty food at reasonable prices. The drunken noodles were delightful. They were able to make it without fish sauce. Would definitely go back next time I‚Äôm in the area.

reviews.author: Diana
reviews.text: We really enjoyed this restaurant. It was the first time for me but my friend Pat has been there multiple times (her new fav spot!). The store is owned by an elderly couple and I believe they run it on their own. We got take out. We shared the chicken curry puff , amazing with the cucumber sauce! I got the chicken drunken noodles and it was actually one of the best I‚Äôve had so far (even compared with the city), yes it‚Äôs mildly spicy but I love spicy so it had a nice kick and i was happy that it was so flavorful and not heavy!  Pat had the massaman curry and peanut noodles, also delicious! All meals were fresh  and made me feel like this is how they would cook at home. We would definitely go back and keep recommending it !

reviews.author: Emily Francisco
reviews.text: it was 2 blocks away from the outlet mall and very delish. They prices are kinda pricey but the service and food makes up for it. i got the chicken curry puffs and the viet iced coffee. The coffee was good and sweet and the puffs were flavorful. the cucumber sauce was refreshing. i went around midday and it was pretty empty so i was able to sit inside.

reviews.author: Love Love
reviews.text: The chicken Pad Se Eew (flat noodle) tastes so much better than I expected, own  by elderly couple. Food taste much better than expensive Thai restaurants in Manhattan.

reviews.author: Emma McKenzie
reviews.text: Ordered the yellow chicken curry very flavorful and delicious. Also got the Tom yum soup and Pad Thai that hit the spot.

reviews.author: Isabelle
reviews.text: Overall great experience with all the dishes tasting pretty good; a few of my favorites were the whole steamed fish (great flavors from the soy sauce and ginger on top), salted egg fish fillet, the oxtail soup, all the dumplings. They also serve Sichuan dishes like Mapo tofu but given its a Shanghainese restaurant theres zero spice level to those dishes (still taste good though). Enjoyed dining in the old Shanghai vibes and ambiance

reviews.author: Nilima Shet
reviews.text: Came here for dinner a few weeks ago and thought it was pretty good overall. We unintentionally got to the restaurant still within dim sum happy hour pricing so got a variety of little things like soup dumplings, scallion pancakes. Overall, solid choices. For main dishes, I really loved the prawns and would definitely recommend. The menu is fairly extensive and we tried a few things but I feel like there's much more! While nothing stood out as truly stellar, it was all fairly good and reasonably priced.

reviews.author: Jimmy Lee
reviews.text: It's a nice place with premium priced dishes, OK quality food. The smoked carp has a strong earthy taste (ÂúüËÖ•Âë≥Ôºâand overcooked; it doesn't deserves a premium price. The Xiao Long Bao (pork soup dumplings) are not my type since their wraps are too thick. A surprise is that the restaurant offers a curry fried rice where it's difficult to find among other Chinese restaurants.

reviews.author: Hayli Bazan
reviews.text: Decent but no wow factor. Out of the 4 dishes we got, my favorite was probably the ribs. The poached dumplings in chili oil were good but not spicy at all. The curry chicken dumplings were a generous size but didn‚Äôt have a lot of flavor. The crab was a bit too briny for me. Service was really good though and prices are decent.

reviews.author: Francy Z
reviews.text: Almost authentic Shanghai dishes which are restricted by the local supplies and frozen imported ingredients. The chief creates the dishes much better than the big name international Shanghai style restaurant in the basement, especially the XiaoLongBao. This is place one can enjoin the moment when dine Real Shanghai dishes. The dishes with the photo below can be rated 9 out of 10. Friendly and knowledge waiter.

reviews.author: LaShawn
reviews.text:
We had such a great time at Mikado! I was worried about going with young kids who are picky eaters (9 and 7)  The food looked and tasted amazing, the vibe was relaxed and welcoming, and everyone was super friendly. It‚Äôs also really kid-friendly ‚Äî our kids can be tough to please, but they were obsessed. The server even gave them kid chopsticks, which they thought was the coolest thing ever.

The food was awesome all around:

‚Ä¢Yakitori‚Äì tender with a really good sauce. You could tell it was fresh.

‚Ä¢Teriyaki chicken‚Äì soft, flavorful, and the rice was perfect.

‚Ä¢Gyoza ‚Äì veggie dumplings with great texture.

‚Ä¢Maki rolls‚Äì California and shrimp tempura rolls were both hits. We also tried the salmon avocado and cucumber avocado!

‚Ä¢Yuzu dessert‚Äì light, fluffy, and just the right hint of lemon and blueberry. I was really impressed with the flavor and texture and wished the slice was a bit bigger it was so good. We don‚Äôt usually eat dessert so that‚Äôs saying something.

‚Ä¢Matcha pudding-  not our thing, but if you‚Äôre into matcha, and not so sweet dessert you‚Äôll love it.

We‚Äôd 100% come back. The kids were already telling our waitress that next time we‚Äôre in NYC, **this is the first place we‚Äôre going**. Couldn‚Äôt have asked for a better dinner with my boys.

reviews.author: Christopher Kong
reviews.text:
We have been in search for a new Japanese goto place and I think we have found it!

The decor is very nice and refreshing. Flowers and paint masks add a really nice touch to the atmosphere.

The food is amazing! We had gotten there at lunch and they have a lunch menu. I hear the drinks are great! Most come back to try that out another time.

reviews.author: Thanadol Chomphoochan
reviews.text: I stopped here by chance as I was running errands in the area. I ordered the premium sushi set. Just for about 60$ total (post-tax and tips), I got a good appetizer dish, a large platter of sushi, and a cute matcha pudding dessert. It turned out to be one of the most enjoyable dinners I've had here. Very good experience for very good price!

reviews.author: Bryan from 56th st
reviews.text: Very lovely atmosphere with a beautiful maple tree and cherry blossoms adorning the area. Great service and even better food followed. Cocktails were delicious and very appealing to all crowds.

reviews.author: Amy Lin
reviews.text: the lunch miso black cod bento set was sooo delicious! also recommend the salmon ikura don. great servers and cozy atmosphere

reviews.author: perle75nyc
reviews.text: Having dinner in a small garden on a breezy summer evening felt even more special because of the beautiful atmosphere ‚Äî it was just perfect. The calamari was slightly overcooked so it was a little bit chewy, but it was well-seasoned and crispy, so still enjoyable. The vongole pasta was also an overcooked, but the clam flavor came through nicely, making it tasty overall. The pork chop was again slightly overcooked, but not dry, and the side dishes, spinach and mashed potatoes were perfectly seasoned and well-prepared, making the whole dish satisfying. The frozen margarita was only $2 until August. It was very refreshing and paired well with the food. The atmosphere was great, and the staff were very friendly, which made the dining experience even more enjoyable.

reviews.author: Saint
reviews.text: Beautiful small dining spot in the heart of inwood. My go to for a coffee, grilled chicken, or just a short getaway. Outside eating in their backyard.

reviews.author: Tania Lopez
reviews.text: This place has a wonderful ambiance and vibe. I did my baby shower at this location last year and it was simply a pleasure having the celebration here. The food was amazing and the place is beautifully decorated. I didn‚Äôt need to add much decorations for my celebration. Doing business with the owner / manager, Ines, was straightforward and I had nothing to worry about from the beginning to the end. The prices were reasonable and the owner and staff were professional the whole time. I‚Äôm super glad I didn‚Äôt have any extra stress during this special day! Thank you Garden Cafe!

reviews.author: EE Grimshaw
reviews.text:
Garden Cafe gets points for being in the right place at the right time, but beyond that, it was pretty mediocre. My top tier chum who literally went to the school of hospitality and I came here for a strategic lunch/rest this past Saturday during the Great Saunter (an annual event I would heartily recommend to anyone physically and mentally able - five stars all around). After not finishing the Saunter last year, I decided at the very least it was important to get off our feet for a bit, and this location made a lot of sense, literally a few buildings away from the official route off Isham Street very close to the halfway point of our adventures. Given how we were feeling at the time, this was definitely within a quarter mile of where we needed it to be before people started getting VERY yowly.

This area of Inwood is really pleasant; I've been over here now a few times and it's super underrated because most people never bother to wander up past the GW Bridge. But it's super chill and gives off some Brooklyn vibes. And optics-wise, Garden Cafe fits right in. True to its name, it has a great outdoor seating area in the back, which was the perfect antidote on a pleasant day with sore feet. The interior though is dimly lit and very claustrophobic; each time we went through (entering and exiting), we had to wait for other people to pass in the area by the restroom/awkward bar area. I'm not sure how you improve that situation without a full-on reno, but it's not the best. The outdoor space helps for sure in that regard.

We needed carbs like the wolf with 16 miles to go on our trek. I went with the strawberry pancakes with a side of scrambled eggs and a vanilla latte (mostly so my chum and I would remain on speaking terms after only having a fraction of my normal coffee intake at the beginning of the day). Everything was fine though nothing to write home about. The pancakes were a little dry and definitely needed the accompanying syrup, and the eggs conversely were wetter than I typically like. They also needed a bit of seasoning but they did what they were supposed to do. In hindsight, the latte might have actually been the best of the lot - it had a visually pleasing design from the milk pour and was tasty. Most of the patrons we saw nearby were on mimosa benders, which sounded fun but we had a job to do. Next time.

This place got a lot of points off for the service. Our waitress was not particularly friendly - very monotone and never smiled, and once our food came? A ghost. We rarely even saw her in the patio area and we probably ended up staying an extra 15 minutes because we literally just couldn't find her to get the check. Really odd unforced error and it was actually close to the point where one of us was going to have to go inside to actively find her to ask for the bill. Not good at all.

It wasn't a terrible meal by any stretch and I think ultimately you give it a thumbs up for providing a spot to rest and eat, but most people would probably consider that the bare minimum requirement of a restaurant. I'm sure you can find better around here.

reviews.author: Danny Fernandez
reviews.text: The staff is very friendly. Seating is available in the garden and indoors. The menu has great variety and great prices. I've had the chicken sandwich, burger, wrap and many more items on the menu. Great spot for brunch or a quiet meal.

reviews.author: Emma Wheeler
reviews.text:
‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è
We hosted our wedding dinner at Baci & Abbracci on October 10th with 22 guests, and it couldn‚Äôt have been more perfect. The back patio was beautiful and intimate‚Äîexactly the atmosphere we hoped for. From start to finish, communication with the team was seamless, and the service the night of truly exceeded our expectations. Every course was absolutely delicious (as always!), and our guests are still talking about how wonderful the evening was. We‚Äôre so grateful to the entire team for making our celebration feel so special.

reviews.author: Carol D
reviews.text:
Absolutely loved this place! The fresh black pasta with seafood was incredible .The gnocchi with red beets also outstanding.
and the owners are super friendly, making you feel right at home. A wonderful spot for authentic, modern Italian cuisine, can‚Äôt wait to come back!

reviews.author: Crystal Barab√°s
reviews.text: The homemade pastas were fresh and well made. The waiters were always filling up our cups with water when needed and coming to ask how we were doing. I really enjoyed my beats gnocchi. It was different and well seasoned.

reviews.author: Erika Kapler Chen
reviews.text: This restaurant is amazing!! I have come here multiple times, as a local favorite, and they never fail to provide a great experience. The food is great, delicious, and my kids love it. The staff is extremely nice and the food is always hot and tasty. Even if you order takeout, the food comes just as tasty, if you‚Äôre tired, and the delivery is very quick! If you are looking for a new hit Italian place, you should totally come here!

reviews.author: Alejandro Reyes
reviews.text: Fantastic experience. Popped in on a Tuesday night, one of the quieter nights and it‚Äôs so private, so cozy. Perfect little spontaneous date night. The atmosphere is incredible. The carbonara is delicious and the service phenomenal.

reviews.author: Charlie Laramy
reviews.text: Always a great time at this place. Not only is it very unique, literally down a graffiti lined alley - very cool in and of itself, it is so very much more. This time we say at their back bar and had drinks and apps. I highly recommend the Devils on Horseback. Great drinks, great food, great staff, great place.

reviews.author: Britt
reviews.text: One of my favorite restaurants I have ever been to. I went for my 30th birthday dinner and the vibes were immaculate. It was so cozy and homey; it felt like you were visiting a European pub or hunting lodge. It‚Äôs a hidden gem tucked away in an urban art alley. I had the roasted duck and it was superb. I loved the interior design and seating of the place; it was so unique and eclectic and brilliant. Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Dana Bashi
reviews.text: Super friendly service and great food. And even the coffee was amazing. It is a place tucked in freeman Alley, that gives the vibe of an old English house. Old decor (including stuffed animals on the walls which some of plus found disturbing). The Norwegian Benedict was great.

reviews.author: Tiffany Rupp
reviews.text: When it comes to wedding receptions, generally those with allergies are left in a lynch. People with confused expressions and gestures of good luck. But not here! This place has servers that actually care. With each course that came out, they made sure we got food that wasn't going to torture our insides. The amazing news doesn't stop there though. While you might not like this place if you're with Peta (or at least the decor) you'll find that everything inside is very homey. You'll forget you're in a restaurant. The adventure begins the moment you turn down the alley and walk among the various works of art that surround you. Come with an empty stomach and a sense of wonder.

reviews.author: cecilia ellerbe
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stopped here to grab a quick breakfast and the food was unbelievably amazing! I got the sourdough pancakes and they were some of the best pancakes I‚Äôve ever had. He got a burger and it was amazing and so fresh! We also got lattes and the taste was so rich, they also decorated the top with hearts. Our bartender was amazing and was very attentive and gave us quick service, even though we were to-go orders he still attended to us as if we were eating at the restaurant. The artwork in the alley as you walk up to the restaraunt is amazing as well! We definitely plan to sit down and eat when we have more time!

reviews.author: Tara Daniel
reviews.text:
They deliver on everything you could expect out of a 24 hour diner. I was able to order breakfast for late dinner and it was hot and tasty. I should call out that my French toast was made exactly how I like it. Perfection. And my shake was delicious.

Has a perfect diner atmosphere and hits the spot. No complaints and would go again

reviews.author: Nevin Kuser
reviews.text: Very nice service from Javier. The food was great. I had a corned beef Reuben. And the coffee was also very good. I got a free coffee refill. Overall it hit the spot. I wish I would've tried the key lime pie but I was stuffed.

reviews.author: Steve Gonzalez
reviews.text: So funny story about how I got to this place . We were looking for a place to eat after leaving MSG. My brother found a diner so figured it would please everyone. I originally said sure I never been to TikTok diner so should be fun to see what the  vibe is like. Not realizing it was Tick Tock like a clock lol. Needless to say it was still a good place to eat. The place feels a little tight but what should you expect for NYC real estate. The food was good our service was pretty fast. The waiter wasn‚Äôt pushy and checking in on us every second but available if we needed anything. It worth a try and wasn‚Äôt too busy midday on a Saturday.

reviews.author: Bill s
reviews.text: We were staying at the New Yorker for a night and ate here before a concert. The Chipotle chicken bowl was nice and big but had zero Chipotle flavor. It was like a salad with chicken tossed in mayo. Chipotle has a smoky flavor...... the service was very friendly, though. And the food came out quickly so we could get to the concert on time.So that's a good thing

reviews.author: july jllo
reviews.text: I really liked Tick Tock! It‚Äôs a classic American restaurant with generous portions, a varied menu, fair prices, and great service. One nice detail is that it has direct access to the New Yorker Hotel lobby, a beautiful spot worth checking out.

reviews.author: Zaina Shtaiwi
reviews.text: Loved this place! Stopped for a quick gyro break and it was amazing! The owner was so nice and friendly. We had their Greek coffee. It was very similar to Arabic coffee. I recommend you to come here!

reviews.author: Christina Yebba
reviews.text: Stop what you‚Äôre doing right now and treat yourself to Piato Kitchen. The food is unbelievably fresh, flavorful, and prepared with so much love and care that you can taste the quality in every bite. The menu offers a great variety, and everything I tried was not only delicious but beautifully prepared. Piato is a family-owned restaurant and you can feel it through the warmth of the atmosphere, the genuine hospitality, and the pride that goes into every plate. The staff is welcoming and attentive, making it feel less like a restaurant and more like being invited into someone‚Äôs home, service is quick without ever feeling rushed, and the space is clean, cozy, and inviting. Between the generous portions, fair prices, and amazing food and service, if you‚Äôre craving an authentic taste of Greece right here in New York, this is the spot. I couldn‚Äôt recommend it more highly and I will always look forward to my next visit.

reviews.author: Fran Downey-Smith
reviews.text:
It was lovely! We had the grilled chicken breast with feta cheese and spinach AND
the pork chops. With the delicious lemon potatoes. They were both the best we‚Äôve had!
For dessert we shared the strawberry yogurt. It was topped with great strawberries and honey straight from Greece!

reviews.author: Mike
reviews.text: Decided to visit here for the first time looking for a "light" lunch the day after a huge Christmas dinner.  Place was super clean and well decorated.  Service was prompt and very friendly.  Food was delicious and exactly what I was looking for.  Expansive menu.  Will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Gigi Hines
reviews.text: Found this restaurant on Google maps and decided to try it. The chicken flourentine was delicious. Also had Moussaka and orange cake for dessert. Staff was very friendly and the chef came by to check on us and was very friendly as well. We are traveling so we won't be able to come back. Would definitely recommend this little gem.

reviews.author: Brad Peterson
reviews.text: First night in NYC and came straight to Juniors off of a recommendation and it did not disappoint! I had the steak sandwich which was cooked to a great medium and seasoned well. We also had the pastrami sandwich that was tasty and had a great thousand island dressing to go with it. My boys split the chicken and ribs dish which was super tasty. We also had a crease chicken salad that had great flavor. Overall, great food at a reasonable price and good portions.

reviews.author: Ryan Mark
reviews.text: Junior‚Äôs in Times Square delivers solid classic deli comfort, and the food overall was very good. The pastrami is the clear standout‚Äîtender, flavorful, and exactly what you want from a New York deli sandwich. I‚Äôd recommend sticking to that, though, as the turkey and corned beef were on the leaner side and ended up a bit dry. Still, for a hearty meal in the middle of Times Square, Junior‚Äôs is a reliable choice.

reviews.author: Rich de la Torre
reviews.text:
Went to Junior's just for dessert and everything was great. We got their:

- Pumpkin pie cheesecake - this is a slice from a pie that was half pumpkin pie on the bottom with a cheesecake on top.

- Carrot cake cheesecake - a real, hearty carrot cake layered in between cheese cake.

- Fox's U-Bet Brooklyn egg cream - old-timey chocolate soda.

Service was polite, quick and accommodating. Don't sleep on Junior's famous cheese cakes and desserts!

reviews.author: Harold PK
reviews.text: For a chain restaurant serving North Americana staples I‚Äôm impressed.  This isn‚Äôt high end eating, rather its greasy spoon type dishes that are executed really well.  For example, I had corn beef hash‚Ä¶but man, that had to be the best I‚Äôve ever had in this genre.  The retro 1950‚Äôs atmosphere was very fresh & fun.  I wanted to sample their cheesecake but I had no space left.  And lastly it‚Äôs a nice escape from the noise & lights of time square.  Price points are high, but so is everything else in NYC.

reviews.author: Johnny Zambrano
reviews.text:
A family-friendly restaurant with a long history in New York, located in the heart of Times Square. They offer a variety of cheesecakes, very good Burgers, and Delicate Sandwiches. I was expecting a better Matzah Ball Soup, but I found it a little salty. The waiters were busy and a bit rushed when taking our order.
Thank you JUNIOR'S üëç

reviews.author: URENDA21
reviews.text: Visiting from Texas in business and stopped here for a quick lunch. We'll it shiyld have been quick but I sat unattended for nearly 20 minutes. I had to ask someone for service and luckily ended up being assisted by a male worker. The food was amazing. I tried the chorizo and chicken. Very flavorful. I did like the environment and the festive vibes.

reviews.author: Anna Kash
reviews.text: Met some girlfriends for a late lunch on a Sunday afternoon. We were seated right away and it was not too crowded at all. Our server was attentive and pleasant, accommodating each of our requests. Our party tried the strawberry daiquiri, the coconut daiquiri, and the mango. Each one was equally delicious, though my preference is the strawberry. We all ordered the birria chimichangas and they were absolutely phenomenal, and even better the next day. The refried beans were great unlike any I‚Äôve ever had, definitely a must try! We saw some birthday celebrations for other guests, which was awesome. Our server even helped us take some photos before we left. I highly recommend this restaurant for a laid back, chill vibe.

reviews.author: Casey Kozlowski
reviews.text: Enjoyed a margarita here! It‚Äôs a newer spot with a really great atmosphere. I didn‚Äôt order any food this time, just had chips and salsa, but if I‚Äôm in the area again, I‚Äôll definitely stop back to try the food.

reviews.author: Bill Furman
reviews.text: Overall very good food and drinks.   My 2 complaints are .. they wouldn't make a steak chimichanga (they would do beef, chicken, shrimp, but not steak).  I ordered steak/shrimp fajitas (choose up to 3 proteins) and the portion was huge but came with only 2 tortillas??  I asked for more, they charged me $1 for 2 more which is fine I guess but it still wasn't enough tortillas for the amount of fajitas.   My margarita was very good and the atmosphere was great

reviews.author: Mak C
reviews.text: I had fun from the second I walked in! The host had a huge smile on his face and was dancing as he greeted me. Birthday song and song for the margarita tower. The food was delicious. Staff were very accommodating. We ordered food and it was served within 10 minutes of us ordering. Presentation on point for all meals. I genuinely enjoyed my experience here & will be returning. We made reservations in advance for a table of 7. Mocktail beverage options available.

reviews.author: tenzin tenz
reviews.text:
Yesterday I had an amazing experience at this Indian restaurant! From the moment I walked in, I felt welcomed and at home. Lady owner is such a
warm and kind person-her hospitality truly made the visit special. You can tell she cares deeply about her guests and their experience.
The food was absolutely delicious-authentic flavors, beautifully presented, and full of love.
Every dish we tried was flavorful and perfectly spiced. The server was also fantastic: attentive, friendly, and made great recommendations.
On top of everything, the vibe of the restaurant is just perfect-inviting, cozy, and full of positive energy. This place has definitely become one of my favorites, and I can't wait to come back!

reviews.author: Amanda Gorges
reviews.text:
The service is sloooooooowwwwwww. They seemed severely understaffed for the amount of customers they had.  Definitely dont come here if you are in any rush.

We started with the Alu tikki chat, the appearance was not all the way there but it tasted significantly better than it looked. It was very savory, sweet and also spicy but not too spicy. I wish there was more.

I got the Karahi Paneer, the veggies were undercooked and there was something very hard and chewy. Overall the flavor for the sauce was good though.

My favorite part was trying the lamb shahi korma. The gravy portion was delicious. The dish was supposed to be medium, but turned out mild but that was okay because it still turned out great.

reviews.author: Richan Cahya Pribadi
reviews.text: One of my favorite restaurants in Ithaca! I very love with Goat Mango, which is rich and full of flavor, and the mango lassi is the perfect sweet combo with it. Great food and friendly service. Highly recommend this place to anyone craving authentic and satisfying Indian food!

reviews.author: Isabella Hackett
reviews.text: My favorite restaurant in Ithaca by far. The food never misses ‚Äî if I‚Äôm ordering from here, it‚Äôs never a question of what the quality will be, it‚Äôs always amazing! Also with celiac disease, I know I can always trust Sangam to be safe and not make me sick, which I really appreciate. The staff is so so so so nice. Service is great, they are so friendly and helpful, even when they are really busy :) lots of gluten free and vegetarian options.

reviews.author: Jeff Seamans
reviews.text: I will go back. I really enjoyed my lamb curry. They were kind enough to serve us even though we showed up right before they were closing.

reviews.author: Marty Byrde
reviews.text:
great family owned and run tandoori spot.
The oven is going and they offer many different options in addition to pizza. their dough is thin, soft and perfect amount of chew. you don‚Äôt even need dipping sauce to enjoy the crust. Had the Margherita pizza, they loaded the cheese and the marinara sauce was tangy and cut through the cheese.

reviews.author: Nora A
reviews.text: Legends is one of the only pizza places, my husband and I frequent in upstate. Everything we‚Äôve had from there has been amazing. Hector is a great pizza maker. I also LOVE that they cater to the Palestinian population by serving their zaatar manakeesh! Amongst other Nationalities . I have literally ordered at least one zaatar manakeesh a week since I discovered that they sell it and their dough is perfection. I‚Äôve also had their cheese, pizzas and their margarita pizza which is really good also. As a big foodie I would highly recommend anything from there.

reviews.author: Sachin Vangala
reviews.text:
Legends‚ù§Ô∏èüòã

Pizza ‚Äì The pizzas are just right! The crust has that perfect crunch on the outside but stays soft inside, and the toppings are always fresh and loaded with flavor. You can really taste the quality in every bite. Definitely one of those places you keep craving again and again.

Kebab ‚Äì The kebabs are next level. Juicy, well-seasoned, and cooked to perfection. You get that proper grilled taste that makes the whole experience so satisfying. Plus, the portions are generous, so you always feel like you‚Äôre getting value for your money.

On top of the food, the staff are super friendly and welcoming, which makes the whole experience even better.

If you‚Äôre thinking about where to eat, you can‚Äôt go wrong with either Legends Pizza or Legends Kebab‚Äîthey both hit the spot every single time.

reviews.author: T K
reviews.text:
Honestly the best and freshest food !!!
Just got the beef shawarma in a bun and it was amazing. I also get the Cesar salad often and it‚Äôs so fresh. So many fav items from here, they are truly legends üòä

reviews.author: Fawn Brown
reviews.text: This was the best Mediterranean food we have found in a restaurant in our area.  Honestly best I have ever had!!! Everything was fresh and delicious. Service was excellent. very helpful in explaining dishes and processes. Cant wait to return!!!

reviews.author: Jordyn Bartlett
reviews.text: Sushi King is delicious and consistent! It looks like there‚Äôs one couple who run the place and are always busy. Their volcano roll is amazing!! I recommend going here for takeout, not dine-in since it‚Äôs a small sitting area.

reviews.author: Chad Mazzarella
reviews.text: Best sushi you will ever eat. Below is the Sushi King Lobster Roll and the sushi for 2 on the right. Absolutely delicious and a great selection of rolls and appetizers. The sushi was so fresh and carefully crafted. Great staff and friendly atmosphere an absolute must go if you like sushi or are interested in trying it for the first time.

reviews.author: sarah
reviews.text:
THE BEST SUSHI PLACE IN ROCHESTER.
Been to Multiple other sushi restaurants and they dont match Sushi King. The sushi is not room temperature which I absolutely love it gives it a fresher cleaner taste. The portion sizes are great and the lunch specials are out of this world. The mochies and fried cheesecake are simply unforgettable. My favorite is the Gyozas.

reviews.author: Tony Miranda
reviews.text: Words can't really describe how good this place is. I refuse to eat Sushi at any other location. I have still not found any place that's better let alone close to the quality of the food that Sushi King serves. Their service is a little slower because of the time it gakes to make their masterpieces. The service is not their strong point, but I assure u that the food highly makes up for it and is well worth the wait. Please disregard the service as they are totally family run and they do their best to serve you. Trust me, when u eat, it will be well worth it. Places like this should be protected at all cost and people should support this business at all cost. Been going there since 2012!

reviews.author: Daniel Happ
reviews.text: Some of the best sushi in Rochester. Fair price and delicious. We normally order out from them and they are always friendly and timely!

reviews.author: Sonali
reviews.text: Great vegetarian restaurant. I had heard a lot of good things about it on the parent‚Äôs group & it surpassed our expectations. Wonderful ambience, great service & delicious food. Definitely recommend. The sweet potato & black eyed pea soup & batatas bravas are a must try.

reviews.author: James Poulos
reviews.text: This is a bucket list item for me and it did not disappoint. Everything about this restaurant is joyful especially the food experience. The dishes were vibrant, colorful, and delicious. A worthwhile experience and I am so grateful to have experienced it and look forward to trying out the cookbook. Wish there were more restaurants like this one.

reviews.author: Lake Kubilius
reviews.text: This is the "highbrow" vegetarian spot near Cornell.  The food quality is generally quite good, but it can fluctuate with the seasonal menu changes.  Sneaking in a salt-shaker just in case the chef is phoning it in that month isn't a bad idea.  They have occasional special events that are more tempting for vegans.  In short, keep an eye out for special events and a menu rotation that looks tempting if getting vegan food is a top priority!

reviews.author: Robert Bozeman
reviews.text:
Having owned the Moosewood cookbook for decades, I was excited to visit this culinary icon of vegetarianism.
We loved the green pea hummus especially, but all three dishes we ordered were delicious. Emily provided excellent service on the covered patio.
The nicely appointed gift shop, displaying many of the MW cookbooks, had unexpected delights. I purchased a locally made candle with an unusual yet pleasant scent.
My only negative which resulted in 4 stars is the inside tables are very close to each other and the original table was crammed next to a wall and was very wobbly. We opted for the outdoor seating as a result. We suggest they consider giving patrons a bit more space indoors.

reviews.author: Sayoni Ghosh
reviews.text: The restaurant was a find during my impromptu visit to Ithaca. I read up on the place and saw that it was one of the pioneers in promoting vegan forward cuisine. Even though I love my meat, the menu was so interesting that I had to try it out. And I will say this place did not disappoint. The food was amazing, it was just what I expected. Vegan forward with some amazing ingredients and really tasty. What was a surprise were the amazing craft cocktails, they were banging! Shout-out to the bar folks they have created an amazing menu and the drinks are good! All in a great place to unwind with some great food and cocktails.

reviews.author: Helen Kearney
reviews.text:
Probably the best hamburger I‚Äôve ever had.
We had a lovely meal tonight, we ordered mozzarella sticks which were great followed by 4 different burgers and they were all fantastic. The chips were great too and the portions were enormous!
Will try to revisit earlier in the day to sample the breakfast/brunch/lunch options.
The service was quick & staff were extremely friendly and helpful.

reviews.author: Mehak Malhotra
reviews.text: Absolutely loved this place! The breakfast options are excellent and everything tastes fresh and delicious. There is usually a long queue but it moves quickly and the service was efficient even after being jam packed. We tried their burgers (veg & non-veg), pasta, and pancakes ‚Äî each dish was flavorful and perfectly cooked. Good part, they have options for vegetarians too. The portions are generous and definitely filling. Highly recommend for anyone looking for a hearty and satisfying meal! The best meal I had in my whole NY trip ‚ù§Ô∏è

reviews.author: Marcin Kozera
reviews.text: Great spot for classic American comfort food! I had the chicken tenders with pancakes and my wife ordered the classic eggs Benedict - everything was absolutely delicious. The portions were huge, and the service was friendly and helpful. Even though the place was packed, we waited maybe three minutes for a table. Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Chris Kohout
reviews.text: This place is the epitome of hustle and bustle but the weight staff make it look like an elegant dance! Service was great and so was the food. We got a pastrami Reuben and a stack of strawberry banana waffles. Absolutely amazing and worth the wait!

reviews.author: Caroline Haruki
reviews.text: Had a deliciously juicy burger and the fries were crispy and fresh as well! The side salad was also very refreshing. The service was excellent and pretty quick. We‚Äôve known that this place is known for their layered chocolate cake. It was very moist but on the sweeter and rich side. If you enjoy that type of dessert you‚Äôll really love this option. Overall, a great first experience.

reviews.author: sam si
reviews.text:
We had a great team lunch at Pera Mediterranean Brasserie‚Äîterrific staff, a welcoming ambiance, and definitely a spot worth considering for events or business meals. The space feels polished yet approachable, and other reviewers have noted how it shines for group dining and upscale gatherings.  Ôøº

Here‚Äôs how our meal went:

Starters
‚Ä¢	Grilled octopus: Cooked well and crisp at the edges, but I felt it could have used more seasoning to truly stand out.
‚Ä¢	Hummus: Creamy, smooth, and flavorful‚Äîa strong start that I enjoyed.

Main Course
‚Ä¢	Beef shishlik: Tender and well executed in terms of cooking technique; however, it lacked a bit of seasoning punch. I‚Äôd rate it about 3.5 out of 5‚Äîgood, but left a little room for improvement.

Overall, we really enjoyed ourselves. With the strong service, atmosphere, and overall experience, I‚Äôll definitely be returning to try more dishes. If you‚Äôre planning a lunch with friends or colleagues and want somewhere that balances style and comfort‚Äîthis is a solid choice.

reviews.author: Bradley Miller
reviews.text: A delightful spot for lunch and impressive ambiance. Cocktail No. 5 is now absolute favorite. The soujouk were the undeniable best way to start a meal but the lamb adana on top of the watermelon heirloom tomato salad stole the show. Easily top 5 lamb preparations I‚Äôve ever had. Welcoming and higher tier staff. Beautiful open kitchen. Finely curated spot that is definitely worth a visit.

reviews.author: Taylor
reviews.text: We visited this place for a happy hour nightcap, and it was absolutely beautiful! You could actually hear yourself think and the person next to you! Their happy hour offers a drink with some appetizers, but I believe they should have a separate happy hour with just drinks, as you‚Äôd otherwise have to order from the regular menu. Regardless, I‚Äôll definitely be returning to try their food! Their wine was incredible!

reviews.author: Sydney Lovro
reviews.text:
I had a phenomenal experience at Pera! The ambience was incredible‚Äîsoft lighting, pleasant music that was at the perfect low volume so that we could all hear each other  clearly, and a beautiful interior. The service was fast, yet at the same time we never felt rushed and that was super nice. The staff was super friendly and professional.

And best of all, the food was immaculate! We got the trio dip and calamari to start, both of which disappeared instantly, and I got the chicken as my main, which blew me away with its depth of flavor despite being a very simple dish. Perfect portion sizes too‚Äînot too much, not too little. Everyone in my group was praising their food, and we all left full and completely satisfied.

Thank you to the lovely staff at Pera, I will definitely be coming back soon!

reviews.author: Beng√ºsu ARSLAN
reviews.text: Food are amazing. Adana kebab is the best  in town, definitely. But tables are so close each other and We literally couldn't hear each other at the table. We asked them to change our table, but they were not interested. They have no raki BTW.

reviews.author: Michael Delgado
reviews.text:
Easily one of the best restaurants in Saratoga. The Smashburger was delicious and full of flavor. It came on time and I was not disappointed.

My wife thoroughly enjoyed the chicken and waffles. It was all white meat chicken breast. Crispy and flavorful. I took a few bites and I was envious but I also enjoyed my burger. It just makes you want a little bit of everything.

We got the picture of Bellini and it was perfect for both of us. Great value.

Overall, we will return very soon.

We went for brunch around 3 PM on a Sunday and it wasn‚Äôt too busy. Granted we had a reservation so if you have the opportunity make a reservation and you won‚Äôt be disappointed. Worst case you‚Äôll have a 10 to 15 minute wait

reviews.author: Melanie Izquierdo
reviews.text:
I absolutely loved the food here. We ordered the tomato bisque soap as a starter and OH MY GOD! That was amazing ! And then I ordered the merc burger and my husband the chicken sandwich.. absolutely delicious 1000000% recommend.
P.S the bathroom was so cute and clean

reviews.author: Kristen King
reviews.text: Had a wonderful brunch at the Merc! Service was great and the atmosphere can't be beat. Love the old historical vibe. If you like a Bloody Mary you should definitely order one. I had the French Toast which was super yummy.

reviews.author: m massey
reviews.text: We came here for the brunch menu. And I ended up being slightly disappointed. The mimosas were great. And my girlfriend absolutely loved her eggs benedict. The adult grilled cheese initially came out with onions that I did not order and the rush to make the plate again resulted in cheese that was not melted and half warm truffel fries. We would definitely recommend the eggs benedict and the mimosas.

reviews.author: Susan Nerenberg
reviews.text:
The most delicious salmon dish! Chocolate Mousse cake was divine.
Everything was so delicious and our server was fantastic. Wonderful meal!

reviews.author: Edward Molina
reviews.text: Drive 30 minutes here every time just pho the heck of it. I've had multiple soul warming meals here and the thai iced tea is backflip worthy. My favorite is the short rib and rare beef pho and the chicken clay pot. Do your soul a favor and get the pho over here now!!

reviews.author: Liu Lisa
reviews.text: Saigon Spring is a great restaurant. We had the green papaya salad and rice noodle soup for lunch ‚Äî both were very delicious!

reviews.author: Mike Mike
reviews.text:
We came here for lunch, and it was so good that we came back for supper the same day. We tried a range of dishes‚ÄîBun Bo Hue, Pho with brisket, half chicken dinner, ginger salmon with rice, beef and spring roll vermicelli, and chicken curry with rice‚Äîand everything was delicious.

The Bun Bo Hue had the perfect level of spice, just how I like it. The half chicken dinner was a pleasant surprise‚Äîmoist and flavorful, and it‚Äôs the first time I‚Äôve seen it offered at a Vietnamese restaurant. The beef and spring roll vermicelli was spot on, with the beef having a jerky-like texture that made the dish even better. The Pho was comforting and well-balanced.

One thing that stood out was the fish sauce served with the dishes‚Äîit had a unique twist. It wasn‚Äôt the usual sweet variety, and while I couldn‚Äôt quite figure out the ingredients (maybe apple cider vinegar?), it was delicious.

If you‚Äôre craving authentic and flavorful Vietnamese food, Saigon Spring is a must-visit. We‚Äôll definitely be coming back again when we‚Äôre back in the area

reviews.author: Victoria Vo
reviews.text: Food was average. I would prefer Van's Vietnamese restaurant in Albany. Service was not good. Waitress did not check on me or say anything at all. Right after I finished my last bite, she only put the bill on the table, came back, took the card, and then gave me back the card, WITHOUT SAYING A WORD. It was 2:30 pm there were 2 other tables so I dont see why I was being ignored. Never come back again

reviews.author: Keith Mills
reviews.text: Got a Pho dish, a pork & noodle dish and ribs. And I can say that I was not disappointed. This place is pretty popular around dinner time, but the food is amazing. Would recommend for either take out or din-in.

reviews.author: Lee Bridenbeck
reviews.text: Wow. 1st time at this restaurant. It was awesome in every way! Nathan, our server was wonderful. Angel did a great job assisting. The old style vibe was great and the food was sensational. We loved it and will definitely be back. 5 stars!

reviews.author: Richard R.
reviews.text:
My wife had an amazing meal here a couple of months ago and has been wanting to bring me since. Schenectady has no shortage of amazing Italian restaurants so the bar was set pretty high.

The impression you get when you walk in is that not much has changed since the 1960s! The small bar is easily imagined with old friends and cigarette smoke after all hard days work. The restaurant is fairly small and it was crowded and somewhat noisy but that is certainly understandable on a Saturday night. We were seated in about 15 minutes having made a reservation.

The service was great even though they were obviously overwhelmed. The menu was full of southern and Northern Italian dishes, including things like a red, roasted pepper and provolone appetizer. You don‚Äôt see that on many menus. We were probably presented with a basket of bread which tasted like it came from Perreca‚Äôs. There was butter and no dipping oil. There is a lovely cocktail selection each very unusual and two of us went for the.Revello, which is blood, orange gin, Cointreau, orange juice, and club soda. It was great, even though a bit strong for my taste.  The salad was served family style, which was a lovely touch. Amazingly fresh with lettuce, tomato, celery, black olives, and small cubes of provolone. Served with a balsamic vinaigrette dressing wonderful.

The first issue is that our entr√©es came out too soon. It‚Äôs an unusual complaint but when you are enjoying a salad like that and may want to have seconds out of the big bowl, it‚Äôs nice to have a little bit of time. That being said as busy as it was, I‚Äôm not sure they had the luxury of optimal timing.

As for entr√©es, one of us had chicken francese, reported as being wonderful. The eggplant Parmesan, likewise, and it was lightly fried or saut√©ed, and did not have a breading on it. I should report that the portions are very large. I had the seafood platter, which is more like a.zuppa de pesce, which I had in red sauce, but you can have in white sauce as well, which contained a huge amount of clams shrimp calamari scallops. The shrimp were large 16/20 or possibly larger.

The one food issue of the night is the haddock piccata. When my wife first ate here, she found this dish to be amazing and brought some home and I agreed. What made it amazing is it had a very light coating and was saut√©ed. The coding seemed like just egg and flour. The haddock piccata we had last night was deep fried with a thick breading. It totally took away from the dish, and the breading prevented the sauce from mixing with the fish. I‚Äôm not sure if it‚Äôs a difference between chefs, but if they read this, I hope they go back to the prior preparation. We did not try the homemade pasta, but it is available as an up charge.

We left full and happy and will be back. We were in no shape for dessert although I‚Äôm sure it is amazing.

reviews.author: Paul Frye
reviews.text: Ferrari's it's one of my favorite places to go! The food is always super fresh and super delicious! The wait staff is always on point and very quick to assist you.

reviews.author: kramille
reviews.text:
It‚Äôs been many years since our last meal at Ferrari‚Äôs. Somethings remain the same; on street parking is hit or miss ‚Äì this time the parking deity shined upon us with a spot near their front door ‚Äì with the one person entrance step into their small yet comfortable bar. The bar is the dining room entrance. Ferrari‚Äôs dining room was nicely updated and well lighted. All their tables filled quickly.

Our ample broccoli rabe appetizer had the perfect balance of olive oil and garlic that was cooked to tender perfection. A bottle of il Principe Nebbiolo was the ideal wine for our entire meal. It was smooth and flavorful, quite frankly it slid down way too fast.
A sizable eggplant parmigiano, with an equally huge spaghetti side, was tender, flavorful and perfectly breaded and prepared. My linguini with clam sauce took a while to decipher on their menu. The preferred white clam sauce was one of several offered. When presented it was spot on. A mound of al dente, linguini with tender, sliced garlic and a dozen clams in their shells. The clams were sumptuous, quickly shelled and mixed into the linguini.

A tartufo, presented with a sizable soup spoon, was cracked and enjoyed by all.

Our leftovers, substantial, were enjoyed the next few nights.
It was comforting to know that Ferrari‚Äôs maintained its high standards and service.

reviews.author: Kalli White
reviews.text: We love this place my favorite is always the veal pepe which is pictured and then the side pasta with Alfredo sauce. We always have great food and service here.

reviews.author: Jason Rutkauskas
reviews.text:
Outstanding Catering Experience ‚Äì Thank You, Little Italy Canton!

We recently celebrated our daughter‚Äôs high school graduation this past June, and we had the pleasure of having Little Italy Canton cater the event. From start to finish, the entire experience was exceptional.

We began planning back in December with Jessica and her incredible team. From the very first meeting, Jessica took the time to walk us through each dish, offering thoughtful suggestions on what would work best for our event. Her knowledge and professionalism were immediately evident, and we felt confident we were in great hands.

The food was a hit! We started off with a ‚ÄúWing Bar‚Äù for appetizers, followed by a delicious main course spread, and later in the evening, ten pizzas were brought out for a late-night snack‚Äîwhich turned out to be a huge success with our guests! Every dish was exactly as promised‚Äîfresh, flavorful, and beautifully presented.

Jessica‚Äôs attention to detail was beyond reproach. Her team arrived on time, helped with setup, and ensured everything ran smoothly. What stood out most was the consistency‚Äîher original quote from our first meeting stayed the same right through to the day of the party, with no hidden fees or last-minute surprises.

We received so many compliments from our guests about the food and the overall presentation. Without a doubt, Little Italy Canton played a big role in making our celebration memorable.

Thank you, Jessica and your amazing staff‚Äîyou did a fantastic job, and we truly appreciate it!

reviews.author: Donna Cerone
reviews.text: After several days, I have decided to make a review.  BEWARE OF EXTRA CHARGES!   We decided to come here because it had a dine in.  It was my son's birthday and I treated him to dinner.  I just want anybody that comes here to BEWARE of the hidden fees and EXTRA CHARGES. The first one is for $3.50 for some kind of OPEN FOOD TAX, never heard of it.  The second, is if you pay with credit, I understand most establishment charges for using credit, but nowhere on the menu or walking in the door did they tell you there was a charge for using a credit card. After getting my receipt I was charged over $6 for using a credit card, when it was questioned I was told the prices on the menu WERE credit card prices and yet I was still charged for using a credit card. Just beware of all the hidden charges I paid $11 above and beyond my bill FOR USING A CC CARD. As for the food their garlic knots are the size of golf balls plus paid extra for sauce( don't they normally come with sauce) , portions are VERY small, and do not come with bread or salad, for the price.  We had a child's spaghetti and was charged $4.00 for sauce, PLUS charged for sauce on boneless wings,  BEWARE OF  All THE EXTRA CHARGES.  Typical college town pizza place.

reviews.author: Matt Evans
reviews.text: Stopped in for a slice and a cheese steak. The pizza is solid 9 out of 10. I had a reheated slice, I believe that a whole pie fresh out of the oven would rate even higher. I will go back for the pizza without hesitation. If you like traditional thin crust, they have nailed it, crust, sauce cheese all great. Now the reason for the 3 rating. The cheese‚Äùsteak‚Äù., you don‚Äôt want to order. Roll solid 8 out of ten. Amount of onions 9.5 out of 10. The onions were pretty big  chunks as opposed to to thinly sliced so that detracted and the saut√© on the onions was close but they needed more time. Cheese, non typical mozzarella, not my first choice but worked and the amount was good. Moving onto the ‚Äústeak‚Äù. No seasoning. Amount pitiful. The real challenge was figuring out out exactly what the ‚Äústeak‚Äù was. Unlike any other ‚Äúmeat‚Äù I have ever had on a cheese steak. I will go with the assumption that it was beef, hopefully for a bovine, but cheese steak meat it was not. Cheese ‚Äústeak, overall gets a 3 out of 10. Pizza hell yes, mystery meat cheese steak, hell no.

reviews.author: Aidan Hays
reviews.text: The service was outstanding! Made me soup from scratch on a day they didn‚Äôt have soup already made simply because I was sick. Also threw in some honey and bread rolls for free and were overall incredibly friendly and helpful! Thanks so much to everyone working there and I will definitely be ordering from them again!

reviews.author: Valeria Escrich
reviews.text: Delicious dough, feels genuine...calzone filling sometimes is undercooked. I highly recommend the mozzarella sticks, make sure you get the parm on top!  Clean space, nice and friendly service. Got my order messed but went a second time and everything was better. Better than Sergis for sure !!! BEST WINGS!!

reviews.author: R
reviews.text:
I had such a lovely experience at Trattoria Aroma! The atmosphere was warm and inviting, with a cozy Italian charm that makes you feel right at home. The staff was friendly and attentive, creating a welcoming vibe from the moment we walked in.

The food was absolutely delicious‚Äîfresh ingredients, beautifully presented, and full of authentic Italian flavors. From the appetizers to the pasta dishes, everything was cooked to perfection. The wine selection paired perfectly with the meal, and the desserts were the sweetest way to end the night.

Overall, Trattoria Aroma offers not only great food but also a wonderful dining experience. It‚Äôs the kind of place that‚Äôs perfect for a date night, family gathering, or simply treating yourself to authentic Italian cuisine in Buffalo. Highly recommended!

reviews.author: staticbird11
reviews.text: I thought i posted this already. 4 of us came for breakfast/ lunch on a Saturday morning. We had the pancakes, baked eggs breakfast, steak sandwich and the bruschetta board.  Everything was excellent. Jeannie was an excellent server and we all enjoyed talking to her.  We were drinking mimosas (VERY good) and didn't know what they were priced at.  The menu posted in the restroom had them listed at $9 each, but they came up at $10 on the bill.  If you search for the menu online right now, they are listed at $6.  6 vs. 10 is a big difference.   This is my only complaint as i think the food was priced right. The drinks are definitely overpriced!  I love the atmosphere and wall decorations here and would consider returning!

reviews.author: Norm Byron
reviews.text: Excellent restaurant. Nice cozy atmosphere in the room with the wood oven. Cute Italian decor. The food was very  authentic with beautiful flavors. Excellent wood oven pizza. Fantastic calamari in a delicious sauce. Mussels were full of flavor. Very reasonable prices. Great service as well. Do not hesitate to try this place. You will not regret it!

reviews.author: Cheryl B
reviews.text: Always love the food here! Definitely a great Williamsville staple. Usually have gone for dinner (the Pappardelle del Piemonte and Bolognese are amazing) but recently went for brunch and it was also very delicious (Crab Cake Benedict). Was celebrating my bday with my Dad and it was made even better by our wonderful server, Jeanne! We realized we knew each other from her time at another restaurant - she is the kind of server you don't forget - very friendly and attentive to our needs the whole time. Highly recommend!!

reviews.author: Janet Chou
reviews.text: It's a mix review for me. My dining companion's dish was well done. Mine was so so. The flavor was good but the chicken was a little dry. The service is meh. We had to ask for water refill. I understand our server might be busy as there were only 2 them from what we could see. If we didn't have to ask for the water refill, I'd had tipped her 20%. I only tipped 18. Sorry.

name: The Fox
address: 2224, Frederick Douglass Boulevard, New York, NY, 10026

reviews.author: Alice Weber
reviews.text: Tonight heading out to the iconic Apollo Theater we stopped for a bite to eat. The Fox Harlem has good solid bar food. The butterfly shrimp and the angus burger were both cooked well and delicious. Unfortunately that was the best of the night. The coffee after dinner was old and burnt. I am a coffee lover and will forgive a lot but not that. As for dessert, you‚Äôre better off flagging a Mr. Softee truck because they only have one dessert and they were out of it.  You could do better than The Fox - but you could do worse

reviews.author: Saaketh
reviews.text: Got the nachos with chicken and all the flavors of wings (mango chili was so fire). Food and service were pretty solid, ambiance was pretty classic for a sports bar

reviews.author: Joe
reviews.text: I was referred to this restaurant by a sister restaurant lido, lido is so exceptional so I knew the fox would be amazing. But unfortunately it wasn‚Äôt very good at all. I felt the service was very slow in general, but my biggest craving was steak and eggs. The potato‚Äôs ‚Ä¶ perfect. Eggs good. But the steak. I asked for medium rare. I wanted that bad boy bleeding. But I was served a well done steak that was definitely cooked in an air fryer and not a grill. So disappointed. That‚Äôs all I can say,

reviews.author: Lamine Thiam
reviews.text:
Went here randomly after work on a Saturday evening. Clean with a nice vibe. Food was fresh and tasty. Prices on the drinks are a little above average, but they are amazing and certainly worth the extra bucks.

Plenty of TVs broadcasting live sports and the bartenders are all extremely accommodating and attentive. Will be back!

reviews.author: Kimberly Everette
reviews.text: 3pm Happy Hour! It's early,  and that's cool,  but nothing to write home about.  'Hot' wings had no heat. Mozzarella sticks were standard freezer-to-fryer fare, but came out hot and crunchy. Went at 3pm and found staff friendly,  but inattentive. $25 for 4 wings, 4 mozzarella sticks,  and a beer.  Content Hour, at best.

reviews.author: Amanda Gallagher
reviews.text:
We tried this restaurant tonight & I could not be more impressed!

Every item is, or is available, gluten-free. The only things not gluten-free is the pasta & rolls, but gluten-free is available. The fryer is gluten-free only so fries are safe for even Celiacs!

I personally had the fish & chips, which is fried gluten free cod, & was incredible! Other menu items (curry & fried rice special with GF fried tofu pictured) also looked amazing! There is no doubt that will be back again soon!!!! Need to try the mac & cheese and so many other menu options!!!!

reviews.author: Wally Herrera
reviews.text: Visiting from San Antonio and wanted a local spot away from The Commons.  Found Northstar after our visit to Ithaca Falls and wow, did we strike gold. Great vibe, stocked bar (that's also a pop culture scavenger hunt), great service and the best meal we had the whole trip.  Fried green tomatoes that are Gluten Free, yes please!  My wife had the salmon & grits and I crushed the Tamari glazed chicken. Flower Power IPA & the Gentle Violet for the drinks. Thanks Jed & team for a great experience, we'll be back.

reviews.author: charles lawhun
reviews.text: This vegetarian leaning restaurant serves up some delicious dishes, including some with animal protein.  I selected the pork and mushroom special.  The pork was slowly roasted with spices and herbs.  There were several types of herbs flavoring the mushrooms.  Blood orange margarita was a great accompaniment.  Appetizer was squash fritters with a delicious sauce.   We also tried the squash curry and yum, definitely worth trying.   This is a must try restaurant.

reviews.author: Mary Rose A
reviews.text: We arrived on time for our reservation, which we had made to allow time for dinner before a show we had tickets to. When we arrived, the "host" walked away with no greeting. We assumed he was checking for available seating or something. He was actually running food, although sauntering along slowly was more accurate. Meanwhile people came in behind us that told us they were extremely late for their reservation. When the host came back and finally acknowledged us he said he would need to figure out a place to put us. We moved out of the way, and he talked to the people behind us and seated them immediately, even though they were admittedly really late and the policy indicated that the reservation is only held for 15 minutes. We were both two-tops. When we did get seated a few minutes later at a large table, the menus were thrown at us. We then waiting for a full fifteen minutes without anyone even greeting us or taking our drink order. My wife had to flag a server down to get service at all. We told them that we had a show that we needed to get to. Our drinks took another 15 minutes to come out, and our food, even though it was an appetizer, salad and mac and cheese, did not come out for a half hour after ordering. People around us who were seated after us had their food and drinks much sooner. My wife is a long-time server and she was livid at the treatment. Nobody that worked there showed any sense of urgency, and there was no dress code to indicate that someone DID work there. The host wore a graphic T shirt and athletic pants with stripes down the side. We only knew people were servers because at some point they walked by with food. It was a Saturday night- if you don't have the staffing to handle it, don't take reservations and only seat the amount of the people you can take care of and take care of well. Never ever will we return, and absolutely do not recommend. There are PLENTY of other places to eat.

reviews.author: Giveita Shank
reviews.text:
Love, love, love this place! Can't wait to come back when it's warmer and we can sit outside.  There's lots of Gluten-free and locally sourced options. I would say the only negative was music was kind of loud for a casual dining experience, so perhaps they could turn that down so people can converse more. The other thing was the tables were a little small for all the delicious food we wanted to order lol.
We had the Gluten-free Mac n cheese which had an exquisitely creamy cheese sauce with a nice sharpness to it. The Gluten-free fish was crispy and moist inside  (we switched out the fries or rather "chips" to  side of coconut rice) which was a nice contrast so that it wasn't a completely fried plate. Also had the locally sourced wings, which were HUGE. We recommend the Baltimore style wings.

reviews.author: Christine G
reviews.text: We had a wonderful meal here. The server was attentive and very friendly and knowledgeable. I would recommend this place highly but also recommend checking out the menu online as it is limited, limited but excellent. Desserts are small and perfect!

reviews.author: Mario Alex Gonzalez
reviews.text: Among the best dining experiences in Ithaca, Simeons is a classic fine dining experience that executes its dishes to perfection consistently. Their appetizer game is strong, with fresh and delicious choice. Their entrees also always blow me away, and if they have the ribeye, it is truly spectacular here. The prime rib is also amazing; and the sides for any entree I‚Äôve ever had have lived up the entree quality. Even if you do not want any, make sure you ask to see the desserts! They have an awesome presentation and are some of the best single serve desserts I‚Äôve ever had at a restaurant. The key lime pie one is my personal favorite and a must try if you are here. This place is expensive, but worth it, and if I were in Ithaca, i would come here and then walk off my meals in the commons, because it is also in a beautiful area.

reviews.author: Andromeda Dickey
reviews.text: The food was so good and the atmosphere was comfortable. We had a wonderful server too! Really loved that this is a sit down place, but still cozy enough to be casual. The food overall was really good, we had a little bit of everything in our group. I had one of the burgers and fries and it was made perfectly for me. The fries were so good too, crispy but soft inside. My dessert was the inside out cannoli and it was amazing. Definitely recommend!!!

reviews.author: HMT
reviews.text:
I have been to Simeon‚Äôs multiple times, both for dinner and brunch. Our must order is Lobster Mac & Cheese and Bistro Plateau - the black tiger shrimps were amazing! Steaks and Roasted Salmon were great, too. Rigatoni & Sausage is fine.
Definitely ask about their daily specials - I once had a really good sea bass dish, an awesome pear walnut salad, and a seasonal apple French toast - all no regrets.

reviews.author: Ray
reviews.text:
Cozy restaurant with friendly servers. Good beer and wine selections. We went with others recommendation and went for Chicken parmesan, lobster mac & cheese and Oysters. We also order the mussels. The oysters were fresh and the chicken was great. I didn‚Äôt think the lobster mac & cheese was good and the mussels were tiny.

Overall food is average but the restaurant is nice and the servers were also nice.

reviews.author: Antoinette Hare
reviews.text: Went here on a Sunday for Afrobeats & Brunch. The service was good, and the music and vibe are both amazing. They also have Hookahs if that's you're thing. We had a giant Mimosa and a giant Strawberry Margherita. Both were on point. The food however was not as good as I thought it would be. ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê for atmosphere and bottle service!

reviews.author: Andrew Scarle
reviews.text:
The Sliders Platter is superb.
The pulled pork burger is outstanding.
The new surf and turf burger is the best I've had. Burger was great anyway but the added lobster is awesome.

We often stay at the New Yorker Hotel so the Hudson Station is our favourite local bar. It shows live sports and serves food. I don't drink beer but my friends tell me the selection is good. The Vodka choices I can, however, vouch for.
We've found that it is busy as people get off work but then quietens after 8. In two occasions we have been the only people in there gone half 10/11. This only adds to it's charm.

Nice staff. Allow our disabled friend to use staff toilets as they are normally downstairs. Didn't even have to ask them.
Recommended

reviews.author: Andrea Santos
reviews.text:
came here for lunch since work was nearby but didn‚Äôt enjoy the burger at all. the place also felt dirty and sticky. staff was friendly though.

- specialty burger of the week: peking duck style burger but the flavors didn‚Äôt match at all and the patty was a little dry. the fries were probably the best part

reviews.author: Coolniggatillidie RealgangSta
reviews.text: It was fun involved party of quite silence event. Great view plus bar are available to drink and more. The atmosphere was awesome with headphone 3 difference channels. The foods close at 9 pm. Yes there kitchen there as well. It was located at west 34 th street & 9 th ave.

reviews.author: Morsy Music
reviews.text:
Fun spot at a random location! I never venture to the west side of Manhattan but glad to have walked into this spot.

Apparently they have a crazy good open bar  deal for $15 from 5 to 7:30pm which I will try out next time.

As for bar selection, it seemed good. The taps were a bit warmer than I like. For $8 a glass I was expecting something much colder.

Atmosphere was your typical sports bar and music was more on the oldies classic side which I can appreciate to an extent. I believe it was a jukebox situation so it's up to crowd.

reviews.author: Adam Amir
reviews.text:
‚≠ê‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ Very disappointed
I came here for breakfast and was charged more than the prices listed on the menu. When I asked about it, no one gave me a clear answer, and they didn‚Äôt fix the mistake. It‚Äôs not right to surprise customers with extra charges. The food was okay, but definitely not worth paying more than expected. Make sure to check your receipt carefully before you pay ‚Äî they might add extra charges without explaining. I won‚Äôt be coming back.

reviews.author: Marlene Dos Santos
reviews.text: Service is always great. Greeted when walking in. No wait to be seated. Staff is always friendly. Always come around asking if you need anything or refills. Food always hot and tasty. Burgers cooked to your liking. They also have a bar.

reviews.author: Andrew Briller
reviews.text: Stopped in Saturday night for a late and quick dinner with my wife. My wife just had eggs and I had the Woodrow Panini. Food was fresh and delicious. The Service was excellent. The prices were extremely reasonable. My only complaint is the restaurant is very run down. All the upholstery is peeling and worn out.

reviews.author: Chad Perry
reviews.text: Rice pudding changed. Very chalky and powder tasting. Food was blah. Maybe has a new chef or ownership

reviews.author: Ed KoE Rivera
reviews.text: Great for rossville but Staten Island diner scene has a high bar

reviews.author: Life Of A Nomad
reviews.text:
SHMON√â NY. A True Culinary Experience, Not Just a Meal

What an incredible night! My friend told me SHMON√â was amazing, so we decided to walk in and grab two seats at the bar. Best decision ever. From the moment we sat down, the staff made us feel like regulars. Everyone was super friendly, professional and clearly passionate about what they do.

The open kitchen setup is something special, it feels like you‚Äôre part of the show. The chef himself came over to chat with us, explained the specials and even served a few dishes directly from the kitchen to the bar. You can see and taste the creativity and care that goes into every plate.

We had several small plates, each one beautifully presented and full of flavor. The fig salad was refreshing and perfectly balanced, the meat skewer was juicy and smoky, and the short rib absolutely unreal, melt- n your mouth good. Every dish looked like a piece of art.

The atmosphere is cozy, elegant and energetic the kind of spot where you lose track of time and just enjoy great food, drinks, and conversation.

Must-try: The short rib and the chef‚Äôs seasonal specials.
Pro tip: Sit at the bar if you can ‚Äî you‚Äôll get the full SHMON√â experience.

A memorable dining experience from start to finish. Can‚Äôt wait to come back!

reviews.author: Artyom Baibuz
reviews.text:
Five stars ‚Äî without question. The atmosphere is relaxed and welcoming, with great music that sets the mood just right.

When we arrived, our table wasn‚Äôt ready yet, but the host was incredibly kind and suggested we wait at the wine bar next door. We were warmly welcomed there, had a lovely drink, and honestly didn‚Äôt mind the wait at all.

Our server Anya was absolutely fantastic ‚Äî knowledgeable, attentive, and full of warmth. She could tell us about every dish and drink in detail and made the whole evening feel special.

The open kitchen is beautiful to look at, and it‚Äôs genuinely fun to watch the chefs work ‚Äî the whole team is impressive.

As for the food: everything was spot on. Our favorites were the tuna, grilled vegetables, beef rib, sweetbreads, and the lamb kebab. All were must-tries.

Shmone isn‚Äôt flashy or over-the-top ‚Äî it‚Äôs the kind of place you want to keep coming back to. I only wish I‚Äôd discovered it sooner. Already planning my next visit.

reviews.author: Efri Dowek
reviews.text:
‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

Last night at SHMON√â felt like one of those perfect New York nights you wish you could replay again and again. We walked in early, thinking we‚Äôd just grab a quick dinner‚Ä¶ and then four hours later, we were still sitting at the bar, eating, laughing, drinking, and watching this wild kitchen ballet happening right in front of us.

üî• We had front-row seats ‚Äî chefs flying, pans sizzling, olive oil dripping like gold. You could feel the energy. Everyone‚Äôs working hard but smiling, throwing jokes around, pouring martinis, and making it all look effortless.
