ü•Ø We started with that famous Jerusalem bagel ‚Äî warm, fluffy, olive oil and za‚Äôatar dripping off the edges ‚Äî honestly, I could‚Äôve stopped right there and called it a night. But then came the tuna, so fresh it practically winked at us, and the octopus, smoky and soft with those beans‚Ä¶ unreal.

üòã The sweetbreads hit the table next ‚Äî I don‚Äôt even know how to explain it ‚Äî crispy, tangy, creamy, somehow a salad but not really a salad. The pistachio pesto pasta was so good we stopped talking for five minutes.

ü•© And then the 76-layer Wagyu. Oh my God. The waiter brought us challah after and said, ‚Äúyou‚Äôll need this to soak up the juice,‚Äù and he was absolutely right ‚Äî we cleaned that plate like it was the last supper.

üç∑ Between bites and martinis, we kept saying, ‚Äújust one more dish,‚Äù but we didn‚Äôt want to leave. Everything was shareable, everything was perfect, and every bite was better than the last.

Must-haves: ü•© Beef short rib ‚ù§Ô∏è Sweetbreads üêô Octopus üêü Tuna ü•Ø Jerusalem bagel

If I could move in and sit at that bar every night, I would. This isn‚Äôt just dinner ‚Äî it‚Äôs a whole New York moment. SHMON√â, you got me. I‚Äôm hooked.

reviews.author: Polina Yukhaev
reviews.text: I had high expectations for Shmone, especially given its recognition by the Michelin Guide, but unfortunately the experience didn‚Äôt live up to the hype. While the atmosphere was lively and the open kitchen concept is a nice touch, the food was disappointing‚Äîoverpowered by salt and spices, lacking balance and nuance. Service also felt inattentive at times, which affected the overall experience. It wasn‚Äôt a terrible evening, but for the price point, I expected something more refined, thoughtful, and consistent.

reviews.author: Amir Shevat
reviews.text: We sat on the bar and enjoyed the amazing chefs making the food in front of us. The food was fantastic, fresh and flavorful, just like we love it. The drinks were great and the vibes happy. We will definitely come back here again.

reviews.author: Jennifer Diaz
reviews.text:
I visited this restaurant with a friend and was instantly impressed by its beautiful, welcoming atmosphere. It was a crisp, sunny day, so we loved that the restaurant had an open-space concept; perfect for enjoying the weather. The food and drinks were absolutely amazing; everything exceeded our expectations, and I‚Äôd definitely come back again!

We had the chicken satay (so flavorful!), pineapple fried rice with chicken, and some crispy French fries all so good. The drinks were also fantastic; we tried a few and loved every single one.
There are two more things not added to the description but i did take pictures of them/ ones beef and ones chicken all of the sauces provided were devine.

reviews.author: Becky
reviews.text:
First I got the cancer ‚Äîcoffee or me . It has coffee beans in it. At first I wasn‚Äôt too sure about it but the bitterness from the coffee mixed with the sweetness and then the nice smell of cinnamon made it nice.

Then the appetizer came out. I ordered the five star Thai dumplings . Steamed ground chicken and shrimp dumpling. Served with soy vinaigrette sauce. The dumplings were soft but had texture and had weight too it. The soy vinaigrette was sweet and thick which I liked.

Lastly , I got the basil sauce . With chicken, mixed veggies ( onions, sweet red pepper, green pepper, orange pepper and some basil) with a side of jasmine rice. Eventhough I asked for it to be made spicy, It wasn‚Äôt too spicy.

reviews.author: Mohammed Alanazi
reviews.text:
One of the hidden gem restaurants in NY city, Cozy and lovely atmosphere , friendly service .
The food very delicious , hot and very tasty.
Vegetarian spring roll was hot and yummy.
Chicken wings so crispy.
Thai curry with chicken and rice with rich flavour.
Seating area so beautiful and clean.

reviews.author: JJ X
reviews.text:
My sister and I stopped by for a quick dinner while waiting for our mom, who was having surgery at the nearby hospital. We were worried and hungry, and came across this local Thai restaurant with many good reviews. We decided to try it, and it turned out to be such a wonderful experience.

The food was absolutely delicious and authentic, the service was warm and attentive, and the background music was gentle and calming‚Äîjust what we needed to ease our anxious hearts. By the end of our meal, we received a call from the surgeon telling us that our mom‚Äôs surgery was a great success.

This dinner brought comfort and joy to us on such a stressful day. I would love to come back again when I get the chance.

Highly recommended‚Äîauthentic, tasty Thai food and excellent service!

reviews.author: Julia Ferraro
reviews.text:
Fantastic pre-theater discovery in East Harlem ‚Äî Chu Ros Thai: great selection, tasty, authentic, generous, reasonable, quick, friendly, and a beautiful space.

To support this, here are our duck selections ‚Äî basil and sriracha over flat noodles. Honestly, the variety of duck options here is like I have never seen before and we have two duck aficionados in the family.

There were also green curry, obligatory papaya salad and tom yum. With all that, the most memorable selection among us carnivores was a vegetarian entree called Eggplant‚Äôs Garden ‚Äî the texture and mildly spicy sweet sauce are not to be missed.

Our carefully boxed leftovers lasted two more lunches.

reviews.author: J.D.
reviews.text:
My wife & I went for Sunday Brunch and it was delightful.
The Huevos Rancheros reminded of mi Tia's cooking back in California. Service was wonderful too. Drinka were great!

reviews.author: Daniel Mintz
reviews.text: The Lexington Social offers an outstanding brunch experience. I went looking for a place to watch the US Open and left having found gold. One of the owners greeted us at the door, and excellent service ensued. Great food, great drinks, great prices. Would highly recommend for a casual visit.

reviews.author: Olivia Celice
reviews.text: The menu features food that seems simple but tastes wonderfully complex. The Lexington Social delivers excellence in every aspect. The staff has a level of beauty that's noticeable. The food here deserves high praise. This spot offers apparent skill.

reviews.author: Casey Dahl
reviews.text: We visited on a rainy Saturday afternoon.  We were the only ones there and it was fantastic.  The bartender was friendly, the food and drinks were great, and they put soccer on a projector screen.  Get the chicken sliders and the Negroni. The chocolate martini is ü§åüèª.

reviews.author: Gina M
reviews.text: My partner and I had a wonderful experience here this past weekend!  Great food, a little pricey but delicious.  Wine and beer were good and happy hour really helped! Very quiet on Sunday but a nice vibe. Please support this small business if you can!

reviews.author: Julia G.
reviews.text: A go-to lunch spot! Friendly service and an awesome value for money. You pay by weight. Lots of great options to choose from. So far I‚Äôve had the beef stew and jerk chicken with Rasta pasta and mac n‚Äô cheese. So yummy!

reviews.author: Sandhya Yadav
reviews.text: Great little deli with amazing Indian food! The fried shrimp are a must try, and they often have special Indian dishes in addition to the regular menu. The owner, Aziz uncle, is super friendly and cheerful, which makes the visit even nicer. Not much seating inside, but its perfect for takeout. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Max Johnson
reviews.text: Bawarchi makes the most delicious kati rolls and dosas in the whole city. Their prices are amazing and Aziz really cares about the quality of his food and provides excellent service. I have been coming here since before the pandemic and it's never fallen short of superb yet. This is one of my most treasured casual spots in the city, and I hope they are around for a long time. If I lived in the upper east side instead of Sunnyside, I would order dinner from here once a week minimum. Ok, enough talk, time to eat this dosa.

reviews.author: Sylvia Wood
reviews.text: I love going to this place for lunch! The lunch buffet is a great deal and always good food. The owner is also super nice. Highly recommend going here!

reviews.author: Anita Haravon
reviews.text: Great lunch spot for yummy Indian and Caribbean food! Love the Chana masala and saag paneer!

reviews.author: T. Swartz
reviews.text: Sipsteria (UWS) - have you been here? I was looking for a sophisticated but reasonable happy hour venue with my husband and found this lovely place that has recently opened in our neighborhood. During the day they are a charming coffee shop and in the early evening they convert to a wine bar with delicious Georgian appetizers and entrees. Standouts are the traditional Khachapuri cheese bread, Boquerones en Vinagre with Oven-baked Potatoes (marinated anchovies with potatoes), and a lovely selection of organic and natural low impact wines from Georgia, Moravian wine from the Czech Republic as well as  wines from more familiar regions including France, Germany, Greece, Italy, Spain and the US. The food photos are a little haphazard, as we were voraciously eating our food before remembering to take pictures first, but hopefully they accurately represent the fare. Of note, the entire kitchen is behind the bar so you can watch the food alchemy that is occurring right before your eyes by the experienced and congenial team. We will definitely be back to enjoy their dinner menu for my birthday - if not before!

reviews.author: Ameya Bhakay
reviews.text: Reviewing just for coffee at the moment, but we'll return to try out their Georgian food. Ambiance and setup is very cozy. Service can be a little faster especially during coffee pick-up. Coffee was good too, Cappuccino's on a slightly expensive end, but understandable I guess!

reviews.author: Ulugbek Patkhullaev
reviews.text: Tried Silsteria Restaurant today ‚Äî an excellent experience from start to finish. The dishes truly reflect the authentic taste of Georgia, crafted with great skill. Friendly and professional service made it even better. As a food blogger, I plan to return soon for a video review, pending management‚Äôs approval. A must-try for lovers of genuine Georgian cuisine.

reviews.author: Jessica Sung
reviews.text: Love this neighborhood spot! Was so excited to walk by during construction, and I‚Äôve been a few times since it opened. Friendly service, and everything I‚Äôve ordered ‚Äî from pastries and coffee to dinner bites and wine ‚Äî has been fantastic. Plenty of gluten-free options too. Sitting at the cute sidewalk tables is a must.

reviews.author: Davit Barblishvili
reviews.text:
One of the interesting Georgian restaurants in NYC; they offer a good selection of Georgian food and wine; also they offer cocktails that use Georgian wine.

Food is delicious and staff is really friendly and helpful. Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Nehal Ahmed
reviews.text:
Made a reservation to ensure our spot, and good thing we did, cause it got packed within 20 minutes of opening during lunch hours on a Sunday. Upon entering, I was so impressed with the interior, gorgeous wall art, beautiful ceiling, and a small bar in the back corner.

The menu had so many exciting dishes. They were pricey but that‚Äôs expected in the city. We picked a bunch to have a full on family style meal. We ordered the roti canai, roti telur, ilat bakar (fish), duck curry, Singapore crispy soft shell chili crab, baby bok choi, Hainanese roast chicken with rice, Malaysian curry with shrimp and side of bao buns. The dishes started coming out one after another within short intervals. All the dishes were so amazing, huge portions, full of flavors. My favorite were the chili crab, duck, roti canai and the Thai iced tea. All of us were belly full as we throughly enjoyed all the dishes. We even had some leftovers to take home.

The service was good. Our server was so friendly. Empty dishes and plates were taken out quickly. We were able to take our sweet time dining in. Overall we had a delightful lunch experience here with our friends and kids.

reviews.author: Tanvi Desai
reviews.text: Laut Restaurant absolutely delivered! The food was full of rich, authentic Southeast Asian flavors, and everything tasted so fresh. The staff was warm, attentive, and helped us choose the perfect dishes. The atmosphere was cozy and inviting a great spot for a casual night out. Definitely coming back!

reviews.author: Arlene James
reviews.text: I was so excited about visiting Laut but was sadly underwhelmed by the food. I had the sampler and a lackluster cocktail.  My buddy had a chicken dish and left 1/2  of it on his plate.  I did enjoy the coconut rice, and the service was great. Most of the reviews were so favorable that I think I'll go back one more time. I'll update this post once I do.

reviews.author: Maria O‚ÄôLeary
reviews.text:
Our waitress was super friendly and helpful (it says, Sajana, on the check). Food was delicious!
We had Curry Puffs, Vegetable dumplings as starters. We enjoyed a lot, especially, Curry Puffs were the best!
As an entree, we had Curry Laksa Noodle Soup and Pineapple Rice. I enjoyed the Curry Noodles the best!

reviews.author: KK
reviews.text:
The worst dining experience of 2025 was here.

We had a reservation, and we came 10min earlier, and it ended that we waited for more than half an hour to be seated. I mean‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs okay to wait till the scheduled time; but it makes no sense at all waiting extra 20min past the reservation. This just tells how badly the restaurant is managed.

And so do the foods.

The foods are terrible. Soft shell crab and the signature noodles are just way too sour, no other flavors, just being sour like chewing a lemon. Cocktails are plain as sweet water.

I don‚Äôt know how you guys rate 5 stars for this place‚Ä¶‚Ä¶can we be real?

reviews.author: Mia Huynh
reviews.text:
This dumpling house is a quick and casual spot for some cozy Chinese food. You can order at a kiosk here or at the counter and the food comes out fairly fast. They have a variety of dumplings here as well as some noodle dishes and scallion pancakes.

I got their duck scallion pancake and their pork and chive pan-fried dumplings. I thought that their duck scallion pancake was great, but could use just a bit for sauce. Meanwhile, their pan-fried dumplings were delicious, full of meat, and juicy. I also added spicy sauce, which I felt like was a bit too salty for me. Next time, I would go without the sauce. Nonetheless, it's a great no-frills spot for a quick bite.

reviews.author: Deanna Lee
reviews.text: Nothing fancy, ordered by kiosk. found a table and in 15 min food was ready. Dumplings are good. The noodles with peanut sauce is a little to thick for us, maybe fine for others taste though.All in all I would come back again.

reviews.author: FreshCoolClean
reviews.text:
üî• Perfect Dumplings!

Boiled to perfection ‚Äî tender and juicy on the inside ‚Äî then pan-fried until golden and crispy. Add a touch of garlic, and you‚Äôve got a flavor explosion. The contrast of soft and crunchy, savory and aromatic, is simply unbeatable. These dumplings are not just food ‚Äî they‚Äôre a masterpiece. Highly recommended! ü•üüßÑüî•

reviews.author: Michael Padilla
reviews.text: WE WANT DUMPLINGS ! OMG this place is incredible and the coconut smoothie was out of this world ! I can‚Äôt wait to come back here with some more friends , OR maybe I‚Äôll just keep this place a secret . PS came here looking for Vanessa lol inside joke , THE FOOD IS GOOD I HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

reviews.author: Ujesh Vora
reviews.text: Dumplings where amazing! I got the vegan beef and by far the best thing I ate. Could skip the sandwiches and the noodles - just get dumplings!

name: Katz's Delicatessen
address: 205, East Houston Street, New York, NY, 10002

reviews.author: Joe Knows Best!
reviews.text:
What can you even say about this place. Katz‚Äôs is one of a kind. It is the best deli I have ever visited. The whole experience is chaotic in the best possible way. Old school. Wholesome. Packed with people from everywhere. It is busy so expect a line outside and inside. If you want full service with almost no wait, walk to the back. But half the fun is joining the organized chaos and doing it the classic way.

My server was amazing. He let me taste different meats before deciding and that small gesture made my day. I tipped him twenty dollars because he deserved it and he genuinely appreciated it.

The pastrami and corned beef are next level. The pastrami is the star for me. Juicy and full of flavor. If you prefer something a bit less spiced, go for the corned beef. You cannot go wrong with either. It was so crowded that there were no open seats so we invited a couple of strangers to join our table. Ended up having a great time. People from all over the country and the world all enjoying the same beautiful meal.

The coleslaw was fresh and delicious. The fries were solid and hit the spot. The portions are generous and the value is incredible. There is a reason they have tens of thousands of reviews.

If you are in New York, Katz‚Äôs is a must. The food is fantastic and the experience is unforgettable. It is truly a unique place.

reviews.author: Dessa R
reviews.text:
I really wanted to LOVE the pastrami sandwich; but I didn‚Äôt, it was just ok. Probably wouldn‚Äôt pay $28.95 again for a sandwich. Also, even if you are not sitting down for waiter-service, you have to tip a few dollars to EACH station (cutters, sides & drinks) - now that is a $35-40 sandwich.

Highlights are the fast service each respective station (cutters and sides/drinks). The line from around the block to inside moved reasonably quick and all-in-all, perhaps a 25-30min wait on a Saturday evening.

The pastrami sandwich itself‚Ä¶.maybe I‚Äôm just not a fan of deli-style pastrami cuts, but it just seemed dry versus a BBQ-style pastrami.

Seating was first come-first served; and staff won‚Äôt really go out of their way to clean up unless you depart and they get around to it. There is a section of seating all the way back that has servers, but we seat in General dining area and shared a 4-seat table with others for a short period.

reviews.author: Omair
reviews.text:
Pastrami with cheese with no sauce on bread with a side of coleslaw is the only thing one should order here üòÅ. Great pastrami sandwich and coleslaw goes well with it.

Each individual must get a ticket at entrance no matter eating or not!, If ordering meat then get in any one of the ~10 lines and order your food which they make in front of you, that alone is worth 5 star to me :). Then customize right there with cheese or which spread and that is it. The cook is gonna mark your ticket before you get the food. Then go to another place for order drinks and cole slaw etc and they will mark on your ticket. Then go find a table and get in. The way they are letting people in , you will for sure get a chair but might have to share a table with a stranger, heck it's NYC so why not. I got a movie recommendation for Sisu 2 !!!.. now if you want more then get back in line and order and get your ticket marked again. Keep goin until you need to leave where you checkout and must present your ticket to get out after paying the dues cash in one corner and credit in the other corner of restaurant, heck it's NYC so you know.. forgot your ticket? Well if not ticket then pay at the least 50 bucks and some rough housing perhaps before you are let out. All in all definitely worth the expensive cost. Its a manhattan experience better then summit it WTC IMO! On the way out back to subway get your El churros with dulce caramel dip sauce from "El churros" and that is a nice Dinner experience all together! Have fun

reviews.author: Lauren
reviews.text: Oh my goodness. We ordered one Pastrami, one Corned Beef, and of course  the assorted pickles. Perfect. Expensive, at almost $30/sandwich, so definitely more of a luxury sandwich, but worth it. The meat was so tender and juicy, the mustard sauce was great (a little more spice would have made it perfect), and we were able to get a good seat to eat our food. There wasn‚Äôt much direction from the staff‚Ä¶. They gave general instructions and we had to figure out quite a bit‚Ä¶. What to do with the tickets, where to stand for the lines (they were more groups of people than actual lines), where to pay (we thought up front, until we got there, waited, but then learned that was cash only and cards payments were in the back of the restaurant). Same with the tickets.. the cutters put both orders on one ticket, and we used that one to pay, so we had no idea that the other was needed to exit. Had to empty our bag off to the side to retrieve it from the bottom. All in all, a delicious, though not seamless experience. Will return ready to navigate this deli adventure.

reviews.author: Life Of A Nomad
reviews.text:
Katz‚Äôs Delicatessen ‚Äì An Absolute NYC Classic!

If you‚Äôre in New York and want to taste authentic deli history, this is the place. I ordered the legendary pastrami sandwich, a matzo ball soup and a side of half sour pickles and every bite felt like stepping back into New York‚Äôs golden era.
The pastrami is juicy, smoky, perfectly spiced and piled sky high between slices of fresh rye bread. The soup is comforting, with a fluffy matzo ball that melts into the rich broth.

Yes, it‚Äôs busy but that‚Äôs part of the magic. Watching the carvers hand slice steaming pastrami behind the counter while neon lights glow and the crowd buzzes with energy is an unforgettable NYC experience.

I finished everything to the last bite worth every penny and every minute in line. Katz‚Äôs isn‚Äôt just food it‚Äôs a New York institution since 1888.

Must try: Pastrami on rye with mustard, matzo ball soup and pickles.
Tip: Keep your yellow ticket safe, find a seat after ordering, and just enjoy the show.

Update: The team was super kind to reply! I‚Äôll be back for another sandwich next time for sure‚Ä¶ üçûüíõ

reviews.author: Alexandra F (Alex)
reviews.text: Decided to try the app Too Good To Go, and this place was our first decision. Absolutely DELICIOUS food. I am not sure what we got, but the foot was quality and is most definitely worth your dollar. Can‚Äôt wait to sit down here someday and try more of the menu.

reviews.author: Stephen Bruno
reviews.text: I went to Rinc√≥n Melania yesterday with my wife, my parents, and my sister for dinner. My wife and I had been there once before and convinced my mother, a native Ecuadorian, to come try the food. We ordered the grilled octopus and bolon mixto as appetizers. Both were really great. My sister and I I enjoyed a drink similar to a margarita (forgot the name), which was also good. As an entree, my wife ordered the enecebollado de pescado (fish soup made of tuna), which she loved. I tried it and loved it too. It was filling and she brought home the leftovers. I had la bandera, which was good, but not mind blowing. The rice was great; but I thought the goat was mostly bones. I had substituted the tripe for hen, and thought that was mostly bones too. The ceviche was REALLY good. For dessert, we ordered the flan and chocolate mousse. The flan was very bland, but the chocolate mousse was great. I honestly wish I had tried the caldo de bola. We had ordered it the first time and I loved it so much. If it ain‚Äôt broke, don‚Äôt fix it! The service is great here and they let you dance salsa :) We‚Äôll be back!

reviews.author: Cecilia Lee
reviews.text:
Food 4.5/5
Service 5/5
Ambiance 4/5
Value 4.25/5

First time trying Ecuadorian food and it was a great experience here. Good food. Big portions. And reasonable prices too. Loved the house green sauce and parking right infront of the restaurant too!

Skirt steak 4.5/5
Mixed seafood ceviche 4/5
Picalo (chicken, sausage Rib) 4/5

reviews.author: andrea yarad
reviews.text: Really good place , the food and the portions were amazing  , brunch bolon with meat was delicious and sexo de pollo rate 10 stars

reviews.author: Melanie
reviews.text: We ordered four dishes. The meat was made from a cheap cut of the steak, however it was still made quickly and very well. The server was attentive to my needs as well. 10/10 would recommend considering the service, food quality, and portions that you get per order.

reviews.author: Ryan Tammaro
reviews.text:
Taste of the pizza was great with a nice char, really great cheese / sauce ratio and nice sourdough taste to the crust.

But it‚Äôs letdown by the small slice size (this was the smallest slice of pizza I‚Äôve ever had), the floppiness of the crust and the cash minimum

reviews.author: Darian Feysa
reviews.text: Whenever I come to NYC, I try different pizza places. Philomena‚Äôs was DELICIOUS. The Jersey Shore slice is amazing! Owner was incredibly nice, and the atmosphere is warm and welcoming. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

reviews.author: Kyana Ifill
reviews.text:
UPDATED REVIEW 4/10/2025
The review below was Super Bowl Sunday 2025. The owner Dave was very nice to offer me a free pizza and to give his shop another chance. I‚Äôm on a bit of a review kick so it was unlikely I would have returned any time soon. The ninja turtle was really good, I loved how chewy the crust was and the pizza was quite cheesy how I liked. All the toppings were quite hearty and it  was filling. I would have liked it a little less floppy but I know that would have been quite hard with all the toppings on it. Flavor was quite good so yes I would definitely eat it again. Most of all I appreciate an owner willing to take criticism and eager to correct it and not brush it off. He clearly cares about his product and customers. Please give the pizza a try when you‚Äôre in the neighborhood!

So I ordered takeout online and the regular pie was not an option so I got square. They told me 5 more min, I stepped out and came back and it was another 5 more min. Fairly slow and pizza was not good but I don‚Äôt really like square. I just wanted to prepay and get out. I would go back to try a regular slice but my first experience annoyed me so I won‚Äôt be back soon.

reviews.author: june xie
reviews.text: Always amazing pizza. Dave cares about his craft! Flavors are balanced, toppings are classic with a subtle delightful twist sometimes, and the crust is always on point. Get a square and a slice, they're very different experiences and you owe it to yourself to try both. For the garlic lovers, the broccoli rabe square is not to be missed. The eggplant slice is a whole meal onto itself!

reviews.author: Pete Hatzakos
reviews.text: WOW! Was flying out of LGA and I had some time to kill. I've had this spot on my to do list for two years now and finally made it in and wow! I tried the white slice just because I had a light lunch a little earlier and I was blown a away at how airy and fluffy the crust was yet it had an amazing crunch too. I could taste the high quality flours used for the dough and the combo of cheeses. Absolutely hands down the BEST white slice I've ever tried.

reviews.author: Calen Heise
reviews.text: Came here with my girlfriend on a Sunday afternoon. The brunch buffet and unlimited selection of certain cocktails for 2 hours was amazing. The service kept coming with the drinks and the food was amazing. Drinks were very delicious and strong. Highly recommend for brunch.

reviews.author: Kyle McCarthy
reviews.text: Great food and buzzy Latino vibe. Expect (loud even outside!) music, as the fun well-dressed crowd passes by their patio cafe. Love their appetizers, especially the plantains stuffed with crab and the croquettes. The paella, salmon stuffed with crab, and lechon are always good.. And the sangria and mojitos, a winner.

reviews.author: Gaby
reviews.text: The chips for my guacamole were insanely stale. The steak in my steak salad was cold. The lettuce in the salad was drowned in avocado‚Ä¶. I couldn‚Äôt taste the dressing or the salad and didn‚Äôt even eat the salad because it was all sticky and chunky because of all the avocado. Truly disappointed because I‚Äôve been coming here for years. I order 2 of the same mojitos and both tasted differently. One had more lime and liquor than the other. Idk what is happening here but I‚Äôm calling my bank for a refund asap.

reviews.author: Des KF
reviews.text: I have been to a few of the other locations, so I was looking forward to this visit. When I arrived I parked on the street nearby. I walked in and was greeted by Leaha, and she was great. I sat and started with the limitless brunch, and the food on the buffet was good, and the sangria was ok. I was served by Yuri and Anthony, and they were great. I ordered the octopus for appetizers, and it was delicious! I then had the stuffed red snapper, and it was good but a little sweet! Lastly, I had the brownie dessert, and that was delicious! All in all I had a good experience!

reviews.author: Esther P
reviews.text:
Visited on a Sunday. We did the All You Can Eat buffet for $39. It included the unlimited drinks. Great vibe, and music. The music wasn‚Äôt too loud where we couldn‚Äôt hear each other and the food was good. Drinks were strong, no complaints. Our waiter was great! And there‚Äôs hookah available too. Just remember to bring cash if you don‚Äôt want to use the ATM.

There was a few people celebrating their birthdays and Mamajuana certainly helps with the celebration. It was nice to see. Def recommend.

reviews.author: jessica M
reviews.text:
I had a reservation for Saturday at 5 PM and was very much looking forward to the experience, as it came highly recommended by a trusted friend. Our meal began pleasantly‚Äîthe calamari appetizer was delightfully light, airy, and crispy.However, the service we received was disappointing. While we were still enjoying our appetizer, a staff member asked if we had finished, despite the plate being nearly full. It gave the impression that we were being rushed. Later, when our pasta dishes arrived, I requested additional bread for the table. The same gentleman (I use that term loosely)visibly grimaced and replied, ‚ÄúI already brought you bread.‚Äù I clarified i am aware we wanted more, to which he responded, ‚ÄúI‚Äôll bring you more bread, but I‚Äôm going to charge you.‚Äù
This exchange felt unnecessarily dismissive and unprofessional. While I understand there may be policies regarding additional items, the tone and manner in which this was communicated did not align with the warm and welcoming service I expected from your establishment.

reviews.author: Nazneen Malik
reviews.text: I went back for an encore. The main course was flavorful and delicious. The dessert was yummy as well. The service was attentive and atmosphere stellar. I would live to go back for a quiet evening with some indulgence.

reviews.author: Glenn'Philip Operations Manager
reviews.text:
Delicious Italian food with the best pasta filled with flavor.  Vegetarian options like minestrone soup filled with vegetables and of course pasta with vegetables. Large indoor and outdoor seating perfect for large parties.  We had 7 people sitting very comfortably.

A 5 star experience!

My friends had clams and enjoyed the food very much.

Friendly staff great service

~> If you like my review please press follow on my google profile.  If you are the owner and you‚Äôre responding to my review and saying thank you please thank me by following me on Google.
Thanks Bali Sky

reviews.author: Caitlin Kazunas
reviews.text: Nice quiet spot for a good priced and tasty dinner. We came by with no reservation on a Saturday and were sat immediately. Very relaxing inside with a cute interior. Food was delicious and server was nice!

reviews.author: Rebex
reviews.text:
@ilgustowinebar is an authentic italian restaurant located on the upper west side!

ft:
-pirata livornese: packed with so many delicious seafoods such as clam, mussel, shrimp, salmon, calamari on top of angel hair pasta. this was beyond delicious. the portion size was huge and everything was perfect!
-calamari: such a classic dish, and they make it so well. the outside is crispy and the inside is tender!
-red wine

üìçTrattoria iL Gusto
625 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10024

follow @rebeccatakesnyc for more nyc content!

reviews.author: Katherine Ng
reviews.text:
West Side Wok is a small, no-frills sushi and poke spot tucked into a convenient corner of the Upper West Side, just steps from a major subway stop. While it‚Äôs not necessarily the kind of place for a long sit-down meal, its location makes it perfect for a quick pickup before heading to one of the many nearby parks.

I tried the spicy poke dish and was genuinely impressed by the freshness of the ingredients. The fish and vegetables tasted like they had been prepped to order, and you can tell the team puts care into the quality of what they serve. That said, the vegetables in the poke were fairly plain‚ÄîI personally would have enjoyed some pickled or marinated elements to add variety and balance to the bowl. The portion of fish wasn‚Äôt overly generous, but they were not shy with the sauces, which added a flavorful kick without overpowering the dish.

Service-wise, they‚Äôve always been reliable and on time with pickup orders. On my visits, they‚Äôve been warm and grateful, especially noticing and appreciating repeat customers‚Äîwhich is rare and always a nice touch in a busy city.

Overall, West Side Wok is a solid neighborhood option when you‚Äôre craving fresh poke or sushi on the go. It‚Äôs convenient, friendly, and consistent‚Äîa dependable spot for a casual meal, especially if you‚Äôre planning to enjoy it outdoors.

reviews.author: Fleur Touchard
reviews.text: One of our favorite delivery option! Fits the taste of the entire family. We are never disappointed and love to order there as much as we can. I love the chicken noodles soup and pad tai; they are my favorite!

reviews.author: Andrew Geha
reviews.text: The food here is fine at best, but not good enough to justify the high costs. Their sushi platter was decent, and their scallion pancakes were good. I was disappointed that there was no mention on their website of their cold sesame noodles containing peanut butter sauce. For folks with severe peanut and tree nut allergies, that would be good information to have up front.

reviews.author: Yaakov Bressler
reviews.text:
Good quality Kosher hole-in-the-wall type take out. Really great Thai food, and sushi too.

Note, there is no indoor seating. Order ahead of time and pickup only. (Or have it delivered.) For pickup, I walked in and ordered. My food was ready in less than 10 minutes, really rapid turnaround!

reviews.author: Claudia Greenspan
reviews.text: West Side Wok did a great job with our catering order on relatively short notice. They were friendly, flexible, and went out of their way to deliver to us on time and to our specifications. We ordered six large platters of sushi and our guests were delighted with the chef's sushi selections. Thank you West Side Wok!

reviews.author: Blake Rasmussen
reviews.text: A real gem on the upper east side. The food is excellent - while we didn‚Äôt eat this trip we‚Äôve had the schnitzel in the past. The beers are special - czechvar is a very special, hard to find lager that only select bars will get. Glasses are cleaned and served in the authentic Czech style - via Lukr pour and washed by hand, to ensure the temperature is not too hot to warm the beer and there is no soap residue. The staff is friendly, kind, inviting. This is an incredible place to eat and drink and we‚Äôre so lucky it‚Äôs right here in Manhattan!

reviews.author: Jasmin Izad
reviews.text:
We heard about this restaurant on social media and had it saved on our to go list for a while. We had never had Czech food and they're the only Czech restaurant in Manhattan. So, we finally decided to take the 1 hour trip and try it out for our date night.
Staff was helpful, warm, and friendly. They answered all our questions and made sure we felt confident about everything. Restaurant itself was clean and inviting, the bathrooms were kept up and everything was good.

We ordered the goulash, jagershnitzel, sviekova, a Czech beer, and fruit pudding for dessert. Unfortunately, both of us got pretty sick by the next morning. I'm not sure if it's just the cuisine itself since we'd never had it before and maybe it was heavy on our system or if something maybe wasn't cooked properly and we didn't catch it since we're not familiar with the dishes. I don't want to point any fingers, because we truelly don't know but this ended up not being a fun experience. I tried calling the restaurant to just let them know, but the line goes to voicemail. We're still recovering from our visit, I personally haven't been able to leave the house because it's been that bad. Not really the experience we were aiming for.

reviews.author: Hannah W
reviews.text: I'm giving this restaurant a top rating even though I barely ate anything - the person who made the reservation didn't know I was vegetarian. Nonetheless I had a great time, as I love experiencing cuisines that I've never been exposed to, and this time, it was Czech food. We were a party of 7, all carnivores except for me, all drinkers except for me and my husband, and one of them is a beer connoisseur, so I learned that Pilsner, a pale lager, is the most famous Czech beer. The only option on the menu for me was a selection of salads, and I opted for one of my favorite vegetables - beetroot. Their servings are quite generous, and according to my fellow diners, the taste was impeccable. They ordered a lot of beer, and together we ordered a lot of food - salads, appetizers, mains, breads, and desserts. It's a large space, its walls covered with photos and objects of antiquity. One can definitely go around like in a museum and learn a bit about the history of Czech immigrants in New York City. If you love hearty meat dishes, exotic flavors and great beer, this place is definitely for you!

reviews.author: Benedict Capacio
reviews.text: What a gem tucked away off the main drag. Im hesitant to even mention them because everything about the place is fantastic. Czech beer on tap, a huge menu with tons of great food. Top options from our visit were the duck confit, red cabbage, potato pancakes, and drowned sausages. Apparently they also have brunch which also looks good. I would come back here every week until I try everything on the menu and have a beer each time!

reviews.author: Beatrice D.
reviews.text: When I stepped into Bohemian Spirit, I felt like I had been teleported straight to the Czech Republic. The interior design is spot on and really captures the atmosphere. I ordered a Pilsner and wasn‚Äôt given water, which actually made me laugh because it reminded me of Prague, where beer is cheaper than water üòÇ. I also had the goulash, overall it was good, though personally I felt it could have been a little better. Still, the experience was enjoyable and worth checking out.

reviews.author: James Johnson
reviews.text:
We had just made it to town, were hungry, and didn't want to shop around for food. My wife and I dined here the last time we were in town and loved our meal. So, dining hear again was a no brainer.. Del Frisco's it is.

Our second time didn't disappoint either We ordered steaks, cocktails, appetizers and wine.

For the cocktails, she had the Passion Fruit Margarita, and I had the Whistle Pig Barrel Aged Manhattan. The cocktails were on point. Additionally, we both had a glass of Cabernet Sauvignon with our meal.

For the appetizer we went with the Thick-Cut Nueske‚Äôs Bacon and the Charred Octopus. The Bacon was excellent, smokey and delicious. The Octopus was disappointing.  It was overcooked and chewy, so we had to send that one back.

For our main courses, my wife ordered the Braised Angus Short Rib and was  later informed  that it was sold out, so she settled for the Filet Mignon, and I had the Bone-In Prime Ribeye.  For our sides we had fries, broccolini and the Classic Caesar. Oh, and not to mention, that wonderful warm bread for the table. All of the meats were cooked to perfection, the sides were great, but on a side note... the side of fries was way more then we expected. I would say was enough for 5 people.

The steak house itself has a nice sexy ambiance, but still chill enough for the fellas to grab a meal or hang at the bar.

The service was great, our waiter M.D. was very professional and attentive. He was very apologetic for the mess up on the Short Rib order and the over cooked Octopus. Even the Supervisor,  (Kristin), came over and checked on us to make sure we were good and chatted with us about the New York food scene.

Thank you both for a good time.

reviews.author: Rosalie Reyes
reviews.text: This is my goto place when I have family and friends visiting from overseas. They haven‚Äôt disappointed me so far! The steak ‚Äî cooked perfectly to your liking üòãThe lobster Mac and cheese has good chunks of Lobster, creamy sauce and aldente pasta. We also had the octopus appetizer and it‚Äôs soooo good. Flavorful, right chewiness and good portion size. The other thing I look forward to is their honey bread and  the best part ‚Äî it‚Äôs complementary. üòâ

reviews.author: Jerryvan Rosado
reviews.text:
Del Frisco‚Äôs offers the kind of classic steakhouse experience that lives up to its reputation. I visited for my birthday at the recommendation of my partner‚Äôs brother, and the evening was exceptional from start to finish.

The centerpiece of our meal was a 34-ounce porterhouse, perfectly cooked to a medium-rare that balanced a charred exterior with a tender, juicy interior. The steak delivered exactly what one expects from a top-tier steakhouse, both in flavor and execution. Accompanying sides often risk being an afterthought, but here the mashed potatoes were a highlight in their own right, rich, buttery, and layered with garlic that enhanced rather than overwhelmed.

For dessert, the kitchen presented a celebratory dish that closed the meal on a high note, a thoughtful and indulgent finish to an already memorable evening.

Del Frisco‚Äôs succeeds in maintaining an atmosphere that feels both refined and celebratory, making it an excellent choice for special occasions. From the quality of the steak to the details in service and presentation, it is a dining experience that justifies its reputation and one I would readily return to.

reviews.author: Mansoor Almulla
reviews.text:
Del Frisco‚Äôs Double Eagle in New York never disappoints. Every visit feels like a masterclass in how a true steakhouse should be run. The steaks are consistently outstanding‚Äîperfectly cooked to your preference, tender, and full of flavor. You can tell the kitchen takes pride in getting it just right every single time.

One standout for me is their crab cakes. They‚Äôre unlike any I‚Äôve had elsewhere‚Äîperfectly seared, packed with fresh crab, and elevated with a subtle touch of Indian masala that adds just the right amount of warmth and depth without overpowering the delicate seafood. It‚Äôs a unique twist that sets them apart from the typical steakhouse appetizer.

On top of the excellent food, the service is always impeccable. The staff strikes the perfect balance between professionalism and warmth, making you feel genuinely welcomed. The atmosphere is elegant yet lively, which makes it ideal for both business dinners and special occasions.

reviews.author: Cindy L
reviews.text:
I finally went to Del Frisco's after a couple of friends raved about it. I ordered the usual bone-in ribeye to ensure a fair comparison to the many other steakhouses I've been to. Upon receiving the steak it came overcooked. We ordered medium and it was more like well done. They quickly replaced the dish, even took away our side dishes to ensure we can enjoy the sides hot with our replacement steak.

The replacement quickly came as they happened to have another order of the same temperature and gave us that one instead. To my disappointment, the bone is quite small and they also wet-age their steak, which I find less flavorful.  Both the corn and the mushrooms were good, however, I find their portions are on the smaller side. With the same number of dishes ordered from my favorite steakhouse, I'd be leaving feeling fairly full and satisfied. It wasn't the case at Del Frisco's. Granted, we usually order a mashed potatoes instead but I wanted to try their corn.

Overall, it was a nice dining experience. The service was good and the environment was nice.

reviews.author: Paige Amble
reviews.text: Excellent service as we felt welcomed and the staff took care of us. The inside was beautiful and made the ambiance great! Had great little appetizer at the beginning which included bread and salami and cheese. Order the special of the days that were well priced for the menu. Had 2 additional fish options. Reservations are recommended but they were kind enough to squeeze us in. For tourists I would recommend trying it even if you feel underdressed as exploring the city deserves a great meal. I recommend!

reviews.author: Albert Law
reviews.text: I really enjoy dining in the restaurant.  It is a great place to mingle with friends.  This is a very solid restaurant offering Italian food. Pasta and appetizer is nicely made. Like many restaurant the dessert can‚Äôt make me to give them a 5 stars.

reviews.author: Kundan Sen
reviews.text: Superb Italian restaurant within walking distance of Wall Street. Beautiful, expansive ambiance. Attentive and professional wait staff. The peppers added a level of spice to the usual bread table starters. Calamari and herbed potato wedges were nice for starters. The main course - I went with the homemade black gnocchi with lobster tail, and was lip smashingly delicious to the last bite. Post lunch espresso was served at the right temperature - not scathing hot. Thoroughly recommend!

reviews.author: Lynn Greco
reviews.text:
Lovely old school Italian restaurant.
Super nice staff, very attentive.
Menu had great variety plus many specials of the night. Not sure why it was quiet on a Friday night - might be that it is summer ending in nyc and the Wall Street interns are gone. Branzino in Francese sauce (special) side of carbonara spaghetti for me - yum. Veal parm for hubby. Nice peppers and olives with bread (complimentary).
Def a solid choice for Italian in FiDi.

reviews.author: Omi T
reviews.text: Ate dinner here with some family last night and the whole experience was incredible. Luigi our server was top notch and so was the rest of the staff. The food was delicious in every way. The quality and freshness of the meal was something special. I go out to eat at many places and this is right up there with many of my favorite places on Arthur Ave in the Bronx. After you meal make sure you save room for dessert. Tried three of them; the panna cotta, the cr√®me br√ªl√©e, and the chocolate cake. All decadent and delicious.

reviews.author: Ahmed Farid
reviews.text: When I entered the restaurant, there was no one at the counter. Three workers were outside talking, and I had to call them in for assistance. They came in with a bit of reluctance, which didn‚Äôt feel very welcoming. I ordered the Pataka Fries with chicken ($12), which turned out to be delicious, topped with a sweet sauce and served in a generous portion, perfect for one person. I also tried the Beef Smash Burger ($9); although it was quite small in size, it had a good flavor. The ambiance was pleasant and comfortable for dining. Overall, it was a good experience, and I would recommend visiting.

reviews.author: Hatice B√º≈üra K√ºrk
reviews.text: We ordered nashville and tikkaville burgers. They were delicious, I did want my food to finish actually. The personnel was very kind and helpful as well. We ordered smash burger for the kids without spice, pickles etc. and they ate all of it, even though it was just cheese and meat and we ordered another. Pataka fries has a special sauce with garlic and spices, it was addictiveü•π I will tell my friends about this place and certainly come here again.

reviews.author: Vincent Li
reviews.text:
Chicken sandwich and fries both came out cold.

Also they charged us for an extra grilled cheese sandwich and when we brought it up they said it would get fixed before they charged it but it didn't.

Food looked good, but 100% not worth

reviews.author: Penguinrating
reviews.text: Excellent place, excellent atmosphere, good service. The sandwich was excellent. The waffle was very fresh. The chicken was fresh. All the ingredients were fresh, a little spicy for my taste, but everything was good. The bathroom was a little dirty. The entire place on the outside was very clean. I liked hearing the chefs singing in the kitchen. A little expensive. The chicken had a lot of flour. Speedy 6/10.

reviews.author: Fateema Akter
reviews.text: Namkeen is such a pretty restaurant and the staff are so sweet, especially Angie in the front :) We got the chicken and waffles, ‚Äúhot‚Äù is not for the weak.. and the waffles were so tasty!! Everything comes out fresh. Definitely a great place to go with friends.

reviews.author: Tareq Alshujaieh
reviews.text: I don‚Äôt know what kind of deal this pizza place made with the universe, but that sauce? Life-changing. I took one bite and briefly forgot all my problems. Student loans? Gone. Existential dread? Who? The pizza was so good I considered proposing to it. And the owner? He‚Äôs hands-down the nicest person I‚Äôve ever met. Like, weirdly nice. The kind of nice that makes you question your own personality. This pizza sauce must be made with magic (or some ancient Albanian secret),  Honestly, I came in for a slice and left emotionally healed. 11/10, someone give them a Michelin star and a hug.

reviews.author: Georgie Vargas
reviews.text: Dani‚Äôs House Of Pizza located in Kew Gardens, such a iconic pizza spot with great tasting pizza ! Best known for their signature pesto slices, would recommend adding pizza sauce on it for exquisite taste. Best to call ahead to place any catering orders or a pie itself.

reviews.author: Catalina Sears
reviews.text:
This is my non-negotiable stop every time I‚Äôm back in Kew Gardens, especially after a long train ride. The line? Worth it. The sweet tomato sauce? Iconic. The vibe? Late-night local magic.

Their classic cheese slice is always hot, perfectly cheesy, and nestled on a golden, crispy-but-soft crust that folds just right. This place is legendary for its sweet sauce, and once you try it, there‚Äôs no going back. If you really need the salt, get a pesto with bacon, omg!

I was helped quickly and kindly even with a full counter. The staff keeps things moving, and the energy is always just right‚Äîbusy but never too stressful.

‚ú® What I loved:
‚Ä¢	That unforgettable sweet sauce üçÖ
‚Ä¢	Cheesy, golden slices that actually fill you up
‚Ä¢	A perfect stop post-LIRR or late night out

Local gem. Total comfort. Slice heaven.

reviews.author: Eddie Peng
reviews.text: Since 1959. Best pizza in Queens? The sauce is on the sweeter side, but for someone like me who drinks black sugarless coffee, I find it surprisingly tasty. Lots of ppl ask for more sauce on the side  Absolute nostalgic. The cash register is looking 50 years old, and the usual music you will hear is Sinatra. The most recent visit was Moon River in the background. Expect a 10 min. line every night. NYC gem.

reviews.author: Hassan Hashi
reviews.text:
Dani‚Äôs House of Pizza in Kew Gardens just became my go-to spot in Queens. I tried their pesto pizza first, and it was incredible. The perfect mix of garlicky pesto, melty cheese, and a crispy crust. Then I had their classic cheese pizza, simple but packed with flavor. But the real surprise was the pesto pizza with red sauce on top. I didn‚Äôt even know that combination existed, but it was next level. The tangy red sauce mixed with the creamy pesto was something special.

Now whenever I‚Äôm in Queens and craving pizza, I know exactly where to go.

reviews.author: Big Marvel and Chicken
reviews.text: We had the fried chicken burrito, shrimp taco, barbacoa taco and the salsa and nachos. The food was flavored to perfection and the portion sizes were great. We also tried the churros for dessert and they were equally as amazing. Not too sweet and went perfectly with the Nutella dip. Also, 10/10 service, the servers were super attentive and so welcoming!!! I cannot recommend this place enough!ü©∑ü©∑

reviews.author: Hemakshi Pathak
reviews.text: Cute Lil spot with really good food. It was fresh and delicious. The server brought out a meat filled taco instead of black bean on accident and she threw in a side of fresh guac and chips for me to munch on. Very kind staff. Atmosphere was a very chill,  low key vibe with a nice bar area. The price was great also. Got a taco and a burrito bowl for the low

reviews.author: Fanise Cannon
reviews.text: Calexico is convenient, consistent and has become a go to for my friends and I. The food is quick and tasty, the staff is always so nice, and the portion size for the price is incredible. We love the queso dip, chips and salsa, burritos and burrito bowls. They also have a great brunch deal where you get 2 for 1 drink specials! We each got an entree, 2 brunch drinks, and 2 apps - split the bill evenly between 6 of us and the bill came out to around $32pp (pre tip) Love this place!

reviews.author: Ido Simyoni
reviews.text: The food at this spot was tasty overall. I especially enjoyed the fish taco and the chicken taco; both were delicious and quite filling. The rolled quesadilla was flavorful but a bit dense for my liking.

reviews.author: Nathan Yakuza
reviews.text: Loved the happy hour, 2for1 margaritas is always a Top tier, and the bloody Mary‚Äôs are so freaking good! Just missing the bacon!!! The shrimp taco is really good flavorful and enticing! (Pricey but worth it). Nachos were ok not great.

reviews.author: Jewelz TeeHe
reviews.text: The atmosphere is great for night time dining, and service is just about right. Only problem is miscommunication. Food wise, personally I got the chicken parm, the dish its self was good and nothing special, although I found it hard to cut into the chicken itself from the burnt cheese on top. The sauce was salty and left a lasting taste in my mouth.

reviews.author: Emmanuel Rodriguez
reviews.text:
Fumo is truly one of NYC's hidden gems! This is one of my favorite Italian restaurants in all over NYC. I truly love to come here and get favorite dishes or try something new.

The fried Mozzarella is a signature here. I get it every trip but I also love the Vegan pesto with grill chicken add on! Best of the best ! The pizza here is amazing as wells. The margarita pizza is another signature here.

I honestly never have complains coming here! If you haven't yet, go soon ! Also use @resy for reservations !

reviews.author: Takara SL
reviews.text: Great spot for meeting up with friends, a date or a family dinner. Met up with coworkers for afterwork drinks and food. The servers were wonderful. Food was piping hot and delicious.

reviews.author: J Ubiwa
reviews.text: I went to both this location and the location in Harlem. I would say that this location is better however I do not believe I will be returning as a customer. All of the food was mediocre. I did not have high expectations because the location in Harlem was very disappointing. I will say they are a smidge better but not enough for me to spend my money again.

reviews.author: B Lopez
reviews.text: Very generous portions. Spaghetti with Alfredo sauce and shrimp it‚Äôs a must have. The food was fresh and made to order very quick. Better with reservations but they were open to accommodate us. Great atmosphere, family friendly.

reviews.author: Michelle
reviews.text: Little bar/restaurant in a super convenient location. Great for drinks after work or a snack in the summer outdoors. Food and drinks are kinda exactly what you expect, nothing super stand out but does the job. Very expansive menu with a bunch of cuisine options too. Burger was actually pretty good! Would recommend for a casual vibe

reviews.author: Jay T Blondek
reviews.text: Went in for a great brunch yesterday.  The electrolyte brunch! The maracuj√° margarita was üî•üî•. So good. The burger and spicy fries were amazing as well. The oysters were good but got a few teeny ones.  They happens everywhere though.

reviews.author: Madhumita Sawant
reviews.text: Went for a brunch on a random Saturday afternoon. The place was pretty full but luckily I found a last minute reservation. We were seated outdoors. The food was great and the bottomless mimosas were pretty strong. They were out of peach for the Bellini‚Äôs which was slightly disappointing to us, but we had a good time overall.

reviews.author: Georgia G
reviews.text: Just had a fantastic meal at The Laurels in NYC! The smash burger was incredible‚Äîjuicy and perfectly cooked, with all the right toppings. And their lavender spritz? So refreshing! But the best part was our server, Ben. He was super attentive and made the whole experience even better. If you go, definitely ask for him!

reviews.author: Andres Aguirre
reviews.text: We hosted a birthday party at The Laurels and it was fantastic. The staff was attentive, the brunch menu was delicious, and the cocktails kept everyone happy. Five stars all the way

reviews.author: Barry Gragg
reviews.text:
The Grilled octopus salad appetizer was amazing delicious and portions generous. (I had eaten most of it before I thought to take a photo)
Many of the specials included in various types of fish.
Once again, the waiter was indifferent and bitchy. He brought the wrong bottle of wine and when I pointed that out he told me it was the one that I ordered and uncorked it and plopped it down on our table.

reviews.author: Aggie Waggie
reviews.text: We come here whenever we come to NYC because the food and ambiance are amazing! Just remember this place isn't open on Tuesdays. You really can't go wrong with anything on their menu but especially the tart with potatoes, beets, goat cheese and arugula is incredible, and the spaghetti alla chitarra is amazing. One time they had a beet ravioli as a special and that was fantastic too. And their burrata is also amazing. There's really nothing bad to say about this place; you won't be disappointed.

reviews.author: Matt Torres
reviews.text: I cant rave about this place enough, the food is delicious and comforting, i believe everything is made in house. They have a large menu and so much to choose from. The grilled calamari was tender and delicious and the oxtail ragu from their specialty menu was rich and flavorful

reviews.author: Jorge Melendez
reviews.text: I loved this place the food was amazing and the wine selection is always amazing.  I‚Äôve been coming here for years.  But this time I was very disappointed, I ordered my usual stake which is the best I‚Äôve had but this time was the worst I‚Äôve had.  The meat was tough and tasteless.  The pompano fish seemed to be made at a vapor and also tasteless.  The salad was the fig cheese and arugula was delish and so was my wine.  For the price I paid I was very disappointed.  Remember today to go out for a nice dinner is a luxury.  Restaurant need to serve better quality food.

reviews.author: Nyah Jones
reviews.text:
Such an amazing spot in NYC!
The food is absolutely incredible and everything is made in house. Everything was so fresh and the dishes were unique.
The staff is extremely friendly and attentive!
I highly recommend visiting Gennaro‚Äôs when in New York, definitely worth stopping by!

reviews.author: Berele
reviews.text:
Let‚Äôs start with the good part: the atmosphere is incredible. Red velvet, candlelight, and live jazz so close you can feel the bass through your glass. The cocktails are top-tier, and the food easily outperforms what most music venues even attempt. My crab cakes were crisp perfection, the salad was fresh, and the service stayed calm even with a packed house.

Now for the part that ruined the vibe. The mandatory entr√©e rule. I came for drinks and small plates, happily spent several times the cost of an entr√©e, and was still told I had to order one or leave it uneaten. It felt like a cheap money grab at a place that otherwise screams class. Nothing kills the mood faster than being told your perfectly good dinner order isn‚Äôt ‚Äúenough.‚Äù

I still respect the music and the kitchen, both are excellent, but that policy left a bad taste I can‚Äôt ignore.

Three stars. Great night, unnecessary greed.

reviews.author: Jacqueline Caserta
reviews.text: We went to Smoke Jazz & Supper Club last night and had an incredible time. The show was absolutely amazing, especially the Monk tribute, which was unbelievable. Both the food and the performance exceeded our expectations. We had the octopus, NY strip, and coq au vin, and everything was cooked perfectly. Such a great experience all around.

reviews.author: Andy Fairbairn
reviews.text: We had a great night at Smoke after a difficult start. Somehow I managed to confuse bookings and we turned up the day after our reservation - I guess the product of a busy few days. Obviously this was disappointing, however the team made sure we had a table in the late show at no cost. That was unexpected, as it was my mistake but says a lot about the place. Beyond that the food was delicious , bar and serving staff knowledgeable and friendly and the Joey Alexander set wonderful. What could have been a sad end to our trip was very memorable and we couldn't be happier. Thanks to everyone involved.

reviews.author: Elliot Hoare
reviews.text:
Took my partner for her birthday and it was superb!
The food was excellent, we shared the polpette and bread for starters, followed by steak frites for main and chicken parm for main course, this was served and eaten mostly before the jazz started.
Then once the music started the cocktails are excellent! Overall perfect spot for a special evening, we will be back!

reviews.author: Rochel deOliveira
reviews.text: Beautful glam club with wonderful artists. However... we have been coming here for 25 years and the other night was the worst experience ever. It was a cold night and the ACs were on high and we (and the folks at the neighboring table) were FREEZING. Had to wear coat throughout show and still cold. The ACs were blowing right on us and not only that - you could actually HEAR the air blowing which interfered with the experience of enjoying a solo piano concert. We mentioned it to the waiter and the manager and nothing was done. The room was only 1/3 full and it was cold out: why would they not take this into consideration and turn down the AC's? Given the high cost of their food and the tickets, plus requiring that you order 2 entrees (1 $68 steak +1 appetizer is not enough for them), we felt ripped off and upset and will probably not come back for a long time. Plus my partner's food came out lukewarm. With high prices like this they should be much more customer-oriented. It's too bad because we've had so many great musical experiences at Smoke.

reviews.author: Britny Rogers
reviews.text:
We absolutely loved this place.

We made reservations for Sunday night. The restaurant is spacious, not too loud and the vibe was perfect for an intimate dinner.

The food was amazing. Everything that came to the table was a solid 10/10. We ordered the arancini, meatballs, fettuccine ragu, cacio e pepe, espresso martinis, wine, a few other cocktails and tiramisu. All the ingredients were fresh and in house olive oil was spectacular. The portions were a good size and the vegetarian options were bountiful.

George, Rosie and Joyce were great. George could read our mind and made sure we were well taken care of. We will be back for sure.

reviews.author: Mario V. Rijo
reviews.text: Wow! We had an amazing Easter lunch at Felice Montague! The food was delicious and the service was excellent. We loved the lasagna and the conchiglie al salmone! The shareable gelato dessert was so good! Definitely coming back soon!

reviews.author: Adithya Raghuraman
reviews.text: Cool italian joint in the heart of Brooklyn heights. Cozy spot. Overall nice vibes! The arancini was spectacular

reviews.author: Kirsten C
reviews.text: The linguine fruitti di mare was delicious, the milanese was good too but they seemed to have forgotten to add salt to the chicken. Can be fixed by adding salt myself but thought it was a miss. A good selection of summer cocktails and outdoor seating was perfect on a nice, not extremely hot summer day.

reviews.author: Midori Grabowski
reviews.text:
Came in for lunch on a Saturday without a reservation. They were definitely fairly full, but my friend and I were still able to snag a table.
The outdoor area was very pleasant to sit at on a warm spring day.
I ordered a Bianco spritz and the shaved Brussels sprout salad. The spritz was delightful and the whipped goat cheese on the salad was so yummy.
We were very well taken care of by the servers. Overall a very pleasant experience!

reviews.author: Mkaurene
reviews.text: I came to Sushi Mike's because I had some business in Dobbs Ferry. There is paid parking all around and strip of spaces adjacent to the restaurant. I dined at around 4:15 pm on a Saturday; I was 1 of two parties dining and another party came in as I left. I only tried one roll and it was incredibly tasty. I did find the prices to be high for me, but I don't have anything else in the area to compare it too. I can say the dining area seemed clean and once the servers gave me the menu they were pretty attentive. I think if I was back in the area I would try it again. Either way, tasty good, clean restaurant, fine service.

reviews.author: Thaddeus Whitney Cochrane
reviews.text: The food was fantastic! Very unusual selection, delicious and obviously high quality, and it all arrived pretty quickly. We sat near the chefs and had a wonderful, relaxed dining experience. There were many other items we would love to try if we ever get here again (we live far upstate), but we loved everything we tried! The abalone sashimi was a real standout for us and well worth the cost!

reviews.author: Judith Pulicicchio
reviews.text: Very small restaurant with every bit of space utilized. Every table was taken in a Tuesday night. Service was in point. Food was delicious as this was my first time trying Sushi. Crispy Rice rolls are a must.

reviews.author: Lesly H145
reviews.text:
I arrived as a walk in and was greeted immediately. Once I said how many, I looked at the tables and saw that it was basically full and expected to have some wait time or get changed to outdoor seating. Instead I was happily surprised the server was just looking at the tables to see which ones they would be able to separate for me. I personally ordered a S&S roll and a bottle of ‚ÄòCHOKARA delicious and fruity‚Äô for the table. The drink and the sides were the first thing we received with our first round poured for us in soju cups.i don‚Äôt typically like the taste of alcohol but this one was easy to bear and we were able to finish the whole bottle with our meal leaving one last toast at the end. Though the service was friendly and attentive our final toast was a bit ruined for me as the server lightly tossed the check presenter at the table which caused my glass to spill. The server immediately walked away as their job was done but with no napkins left(as we only had one for each person) a little mess was unfortunately left.
I recommend anyone have my order but especially try the miso soup as it was very easy, deliciously simple and the perfect temperature that lasted our foods wait time.

reviews.author: Eda S
reviews.text:
I dont know how to feel about this. This place used to be amazing.... unfortunately now that they have the clientele they are cutting corners or worse....
I ordered soft crab, when the plate came there were 2 pieces of crab. Confused i asked if it was suppose to be the whole crab, the server decided to count the pieces. She must have thought i was blind, as she started counting fried yam and mushroom as the crab. I said that was incorrect and opened in half the yam and mushroom. She brought a new plate, when i requested for the crab not to be cut she said the chef had already diced it. Red flag number one. I also ordered chirashi. When asked what was the difference between it and the delux, i was told sea urchin and salmon fish. For about 5$ more i decided on the delux. Now about this plate, the fish looked sketchy and i decided to smell the uni, boy o boy! The smell alone would put someone in ER! i asked the server if she could smell the uni, she said thats how it was suppose to smell, however her face and nose betrayed her. As she walked to the chef, he said the whole box smelled the same ...red flag number two. He asked me if I wanted him to open a new box.This told me all i needed to hear. I am not here to tell you to have integrity on what you serve, but if you are willing to poison me i will take my money to an establishment that takes a bit more pride in what they serve. The last thing that shows they dont care about their patrons was the chipped glass. I could have cut my hand while drinking if i wasnt paying attention.

reviews.author: Fahahaha ha-Haa
reviews.text:
The pizza was excellent, the service was great, the portions were substantial, & the atmosphere was casually comfortable. We had a great time & sat for a long time after we finished eating without any pressure to hurry along by the staff.

We enjoyed our visit very much.

reviews.author: Amber Duke
reviews.text: Pizza, and steak Milanese were delish! The steak was huge and smothered with Milanese! Also tried the custard!

reviews.author: Joe Laskowski
reviews.text: I ordered takeout. I had the sausage Parmesan with pasta. The people were very friendly. The food was affordable. The only thing that threw me off was I got the pasta and the sausage in separate containers. I've never gotten that from other takeout places. Friends tell me a lot of people prefer it that way. It wasn't a downside just unusual for me.

reviews.author: Tim Hall
reviews.text: I am in Endicott for 3 months working at a local hospital. I am ashamed that it took 2 of those months before I found Joey‚Äôs. I tried their Large Quattro Carne pizza and it was delicious! I also tried the Joey‚Äôs sampler platter. With the sampler, the fried cheese ravioli was amazing. I admit I wasn‚Äôt a fan of the ponzarotti but that was a person preference. Everything else was great! Friendly service as I picked up. I look forwarded to trying their subs!

reviews.author: Kaci Le
reviews.text: Best custard ever! Both the cheesecake and espresso flavors were delicious.

reviews.author: A.
reviews.text:
Overall the quality and value here are incredible for most places in NYC. The fries are astounding. The burgers are always delicious and greasy quality.

A full meal can range from about $16-26 with taxes. if you get a shake you‚Äôll still be under any dinner at most places for the cost of an entree which will get you to around $30.

**** ALSO ORGANIC ü´∂ü§©
Staff is always nice and helpful. They are thoughtful about their servings and check at just enough time.
‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî
Addressing the issue(s):
I‚Äôm not sure how it happens, but in NYC random renovations do cause things to occur.

Repeated issues do mean there‚Äôs issues in storage and cleaning, but I have to report that it doesn‚Äôt look like it‚Äôs still present.

reviews.author: Aminah Imani
reviews.text: We came here after floating. This food was just what we needed. It didn‚Äôt make us say moo but the milkshake made my body dance. The falafel burger was good. My friend inhaled the nachos. I would definitely come back here if Im in the area for sure! The service was friendly and super welcoming. Thank you!

reviews.author: Leo Gordon
reviews.text: Nice and cozy place and staff is very pleasant. The only drawback was that a $16 burger was very tiny.

reviews.author: Gwendolyn R Houston-Jack
reviews.text:
Found this spot on the walk back from a day at the Brooklyn Bridge park and I'm so happy we stopped. It was an early Sunday evening so not busy at all. The weather was nice so we chose to sit outside.

Our waiter was so cool and aware. He did a great job with all the customers sitting outside. I was impressed.

My hubs had a cheese burger and I opted for the hot dogs and fries. The dogs were good, but far too many onions and too much deli mustard for me. The fries were also hot and crispy.

The showstoppers were the root beer float and chocolate shake. We couldn't stop talking about them.

Next time I'm in Brooklyn, I'll be making another stop for sure.

reviews.author: Patrick Price
reviews.text:
The food was great aside from the ONION RINGS. Beer battered but they came out very oily and the batter was too thin for my liking.
The FRENCH FRIES were to die for loved them, even stole my daughter.
Ordered the LAMB BURGER and that was awesome.
My partner in crime ordered a CHEESE BURGER with FRIED EGG and AVOCADO and she freaking loved it. And theSWEET POTATO FRIES knocked us out

reviews.author: wadigzon Diaz-wong
reviews.text: Great ambience, great service good ok (omelettes Greek and veggie did not impress - had better ones at many other places), decent prices

reviews.author: Michelle Dooley
reviews.text:
If you're going to the natural History museum this is a great spot to eat with your family!

My family had a really delicious dinner here tonight! I have some very picky kids. It's rare that the adults and kids all loved their dishes! The smash burger was amazing, my husband loved the Ruben. There was a kids meal that included a drink which is rare and a nice treat. The staff was lovely, food came quickly. It was a perfect end to a museum trip.

reviews.author: Nelia Acosta
reviews.text: I ordered through postmates and my steak was made perfectly!! I will definitely be ordering from here again! The onion rings were delicious as well as my baked potato!! The way they packaged my food was great. Nothing spilled! Thank you Viand Diner!

reviews.author: Daniella Thompson
reviews.text:
Spending the weekend in NYC and looked for a place to have breakfast near Central Park and to our good fortune found Viand!! Solid reviews and really deserves more than a 4.3 rating..come on folks, hype up your favorite spots‚Ä¶ because this place a strong and steady flow of local New Yorkers for breakfast (especially families with young kids).
My breakfast sandwich, The Modern, was delicious! I was able to change the ciabatta bread to the brioche bun which was soft and sweet and the tomato bacon jam was out of this world, yummy. I‚Äôll definitely add bacon to this sandwich next time. My partner got the steak and eggs, good sized steak, well seasoned, cooked to the desired temperature and the eggs they use here are huge and hearty! We don‚Äôt usually like shredded hash browns ( prefer breakfast potatoes) but their hash browns are pretty good with onions and peppers and again, well seasoned.
Atmosphere is very nice, small but not cramped, clean, and the staff are wonderful; friendly and attentive without being overbearing and they seem to work well as a team to serve all customers. Overall this was a really great experience, slight dings for the fact that the coffee was pretty weak (and o don‚Äôt like strong coffee so that‚Äôs saying something), and the orange juice was a bit tart/bitter. But that aside we enjoyed it so much we ordered a salad and Cuban sandwich to-go for lunch later!
Awesome food, great service‚Ä¶ stop by!!

reviews.author: Anna Broadhurst
reviews.text: This is a diner with service and food like none other! Brunch is AMAZING! The weekend brunch and drink specials are perfect! Nikki, Valentina, and Lisa, and of course Victor are awesome and so on top of every table. No one is left wanting. We live in the neighborhood and know all the restaurants and if you want great food, great service, and delicious drinks you should eat at Viand! Oh and I believe the manager, Nick (?) has something to do with hiring the best of the best!

reviews.author: B Jung
reviews.text:
I was served by a terrific waiter from Morocco. He was very friendly and helped me decide on my order. His recommendations were great.
MUJADDARA CROQUETTE: Green lentil and rice croquette, makdous, caramelized onions, bechamel, feta - tenderly crisp outside, and warm and soft inside with a please and slightly tangy sauce.

MUSAKHAN: Sumac chicken, red onion, olive oil, almonds over flat bread - generous serving, red onions were just slightly cooked with still a bit of the good raw flavor, the sliced almonds adds a nice focus and but it's crunch, flatbread was good and kept it's consistency without getting soggy

Both were excellent, and I was full, so I ordered dessert takeout for later: Homemade Knafeh (also excellent)

Atmosphere was nice. Kinda chic-y, but noise level was a bit high.

reviews.author: Nicola
reviews.text: Hubby and I came here for brunch last week on a Sunday morning. The place was still empty and we had an outdoor table. Staff was friendly and attentive. Food was served fast. I liked the Shaksuka and Babaganoush. My husband found the french toast average. Overall good experience for an early Sunday brunch.

reviews.author: yousef dash
reviews.text: Love the menu and authenticity. Very skilled and professional star. Food was delightfully quick but still made well. Portions were relatively small but that just allowed us to order more. I just love how authentic and proud this place is all around. Chic chill setting on top of that. Wetriesd more than half a dozen dishes, the muhammara was shockingly tender grilled chicken. The octopus was the best I had it was unlike octopus I had anywhere else, and the fattoush salad with the pomegranate was certainly notably nice.

reviews.author: Chao Ji
reviews.text:
Great middle-east food with strong Palestinian influence. The chicken was juicy, and the rice with mutton was yummy and excellent!
The only minor issue here is the background music was on a louder end to me, making conversation quite exhausting. They might be short of staff on the evening I was there. Only one major waiter was servicing, taking the order and cleaning.

reviews.author: Shee Yan Chin
reviews.text: We love the food so much here. Food was amazing, staffs were super friendly and engaging, me and partner definitely enjoyed our time here and wish to come back again!

reviews.author: Susan Chen
reviews.text: Fantastic wine local wine shop with a great curated selection of natural wines. They are my local go to. Love their friendly service too.

reviews.author: Jonathan Hirshowitz
reviews.text:
My go-to liquor spot since they opened about 8 years ago.
A refreshing change from the typical bank-style liquor shops ‚Äî this place has character. The staff are always helpful and up for a good conversation. Great selection, weekly specials, free tastings, and convenient hours. It‚Äôs one of those local gems that sets Clinton Hill apart from all the other neighborhoods

reviews.author: Marlena Fauer
reviews.text: Great selection and wonderful friendly staff! Always discover new favorite bottles here!

reviews.author: Cory Long
reviews.text: Great selection and knowledgeable staff. They are always happy to provide a recommendation based on my preference.

reviews.author: Lauren King
reviews.text:
