I always leave Tipsy with a great bottle of wine and a smile on my face! Excellent choices of wines, very knowledgeable and friendly staff. Friends from Manhattan who go with me always say they wish they had a Tipsy in their neighborhood!

EDIT DEC 2024: The wine selection is unrecognizable under new ownership/buyer. Gone are the small woman-owned wineries and thoughtful selections. Very disappointing as a loyal customer.

reviews.author: Katherine Czyzewski
reviews.text: My favorite dining spot in the neighborhood! The staff is always super kind and they treat you like you are their neighbor! I‚Äôve had breakfast, brunch, lunch, and dinner is here and every time it is always a hit. Great drink menu and great atmosphere!

reviews.author: Ana Popovic
reviews.text: LOVEEE this place! You can never go wrong coming to Taralluci UWS whether it‚Äôs for a brunch with friends, a quick stop for a cappuccino or spritz, or a phenomenal spread of apps and entrees for dinner. My favorites are definitely the orichetti and the lamb skewers that were just recently added to the menu, amazing! Oscar is truly incredible and makes the atmosphere very welcoming. He is so attentive and makes some of the best spritzes I‚Äôve had in the city!! Highly recommend this restaurant and will continue coming back :))

reviews.author: W E
reviews.text: Cute corner restaurant on the upper west side, reliable and good service. The food was pretty good but I nothing stood out as amazing from all the dishes my party had ordered. The service was good and they did a really nice job with the birthday candle and cake for my friend.

reviews.author: Ameya Bhakay
reviews.text:
Had made reservations for NYE which had a Prix Fixe menu with a decent split of vegetarian and meat selection across three courses. We went for the early seating and it was relatively quiet on a rainy last day of the year.

Alex, our server, was friendly and was kind enough to offer us a glass of wine on the house, after he felt bad having charged full price for our little one on the Prix Fixe menu.

Food overall was pretty decent. There was a Pappardelle pasta for our little one, and a few great options for meat lovers, including a Rib-eye steak which unfortunately lacked flavor, in spite of adding their rather heavy garlic and heavy cream sauce. The lobster tail was thoroughly enjoyed by the seafood lover on our table, and was enough to knock a person out on the table next to us, who possibly had a shell fish allergy. We were glad to see the person doing fine though, towards the end of the meal. Definitely not a nice way to end the year!

Noise levels were on the average end throughout our time there, and their menu and service were pretty good, definitely on the expensive end though. Will definitely visit again sometime in the near future!

reviews.author: Jenny Beth Stenquist
reviews.text: Italian transported to the UWS! Get the Rigatoni if it‚Äôs your first time here. Get the Cacio E Pepe if you appreciate peppery dishes. I loved the intentionality of the pepper‚Äîit was clearly the main flavor yet it didn‚Äôt overpower the whole dish. A+

reviews.author: Ko S.
reviews.text: Stopped by Batata Cafe and really enjoyed it. The chai tea was amazing, full of flavor and perfectly balanced. The service was friendly and quick, making it an easy and pleasant stop. I‚Äôll definitely be back.

reviews.author: Ariah H
reviews.text:
Ordered a hot honey chicken sandwich on a day I swore I was eating healthy, so I asked for it bun less on lettuce. They nailed it exactly how I ordered. My coworkers' meals looked just as good and were thoughtfully packed, so points for presentation.

The chicken itself? Crispy perfection. I'm extremely picky with chicken because I can't stand when it has that "chickeney" taste (you know exactly what I mean), but this was fresh, flavorful, and downright tasty.

Super happy they're around delicious food, great attention to detail, and honestly, I'm already planning my next

reviews.author: M K
reviews.text: Food is always top notch. Our go to spot when we are near Northport. The staff are always helpful and pleasant. The dining area is always clean and food is prepared fresh. Highly recommend this place.

reviews.author: David Green
reviews.text:
I literally work across the street from Batata Cafe in Northport, and have the great luck of being able to walk over anytime; a great thing indeed!

I am not a vegan, but like to vary my diet, especially when having lunch, which is usually on the fly and not always so healthy. Lol. Batata has a really great variety of options, from the Impossible Burger, Soups, Wraps and more. I have tried a wide variety of these options and they are all fresh and delicious! They have all been seasoned nicely, not too heavy a hand, as sometimes you get with Vegan meals.

Great food and great service. The menu is stacked with so many delicious options.

Moreover, the Staff are all friendly and greet with smiles and warm welcomes. They all seem to enjoy working at Batata and it shows. The restuarant is always clean and they take pride on their appearance with clean glass and nice decorations.

The store is conveniently located on a 25A/Ft Salonga Road with plenty of parking. If you choose to dine in you'll always have a seat as they offer indoor and outdoor dining options. They also offer wine in a can which is interesting. They offer various discounts so ask and you can accumulate points towards future meals if you order online with the Toast App.

Regardless of meal time or food preferences, Batata is always worth a visit - Go and enjoy a great meal experience!

*Bonus tip: In Batata's "Cold Case" you will find round containers with homemade "Bites". (see picture) There are 2 varieties, I only half-jokingly call these my "crack" ...:) Literally addicted...make sure to try these too!

reviews.author: Danielle Woods
reviews.text: If you, like me, stopped going to Batata for a time because their food and service seemed to decline a few years ago, I recommend you revisit soon‚Ä¶ food and service was excellent the last 3 times I ordered. I have been going to Batata since it opened many years ago and through all of its changes. A few years ago, it seemed that mostly some high school kids were working and always messed up our orders and had awful customer service skills.  I gave up on eating there for a time, but recently revisited to find everything excellent once again.

reviews.author: Cayden Chu (UMC)
reviews.text: It was a wonderful experience, one I‚Äôll never forget. The staff were extremely friendly, to say the least, and the food was out of this world. The mix of Asian and Japanese flavours will blow your tastebuds away to heaven. One of my favourite dishes of the night was the foie gras. The duck liver will melt in your mouth, flavours unstoppably seeping in. It was then combined with outstanding rice and bean curd skin, it fits perfectly. The fusion of taste don‚Äôt just add up to each other, they multiply each other and increase the already amazing tastiness. It was so good we had to order another plate. Next came the pork knuckles. We ordered both flavours, the vinegar and the garlic. Both were remarkable, but the garlic one was truly  magnificent. Considering I‚Äôm not a huge fan of cilantro, it fitted surprisingly well with the extraordinary texture. The dessert was also exceptional. The cheesecake was a mixture of New York style and Japanese style, a soft crumbly exterior and a gooey interior. It wasn‚Äôt too sweet, but hit the spot. This spot is a must try, truly ground breaking. I am amazed and do recommend it for everyone.

reviews.author: Aziza WONG
reviews.text: This a hidden gem (believe it or not in Chinatown) a Japanese restaurant found is by far THE BEST discovery after the pandemic.  The food is beautifully presented & dishes are delicious.  Price is more than reasonable compared to Soho, midtown, or uptown.  Service is also attentive, polite & prompt.  Can‚Äôt ask for more these days with the burden of food cost, sales taxes , & 20%+ service charge, eating out is no longer fun & affordable + frequently deal w/ nasty food.  I would like to give this new food establishment 6 STARS.

reviews.author: Glenn C
reviews.text:
Short review- order the goma, kani, wagyu, tonsoku. Nabe/hot pot is alright.

I went here a while with a group.

The first thing that arrived was probably my favorite bite of the night which was the Goma Hamachi for $20 with baby yellowtail with scallion, seaweed, and sesame sauce which is poured table side. The hamachi was excellent quality being buttery with a soft texture and the nutty sesame sauce (said goma) worked nicely with it. This was excellent and I would recommend it heavily.

Also very tasty was the Kani Harumaki for $14 with a blend of snow crab, pork, mushroom, and vegetables served with spring roll skin which came with a light soy based dipping sauce. There was a bit of sweetness, a bit of earthiness, and some richness and it all fit well with the crispy skin. This was very good as well and was decently portioned for the price point.

Also very tasty was the Wagyu Yakiniku Wrap for $18 with BBQ washu beef with lettuce, pickled vegetables, and mayo wrapped in a scallion pancake. This was perhaps a bit messy due to the mayo as well as the sweet sauce especially when paired with the slightly oily pancake but the flavor was excellent. The beef quality was high and it had some sweetness to it but not too much so and the pickled vegetables added a nice crunch.

The Tonsoku Ponzu for $13 with grilled pork feet with scallion and ponzu sauce is one of their signatures that you can't really find in many other Japanese spots. The dish of course has a lot of collagen so it's rich and fatty but the ponzu helps cut down the richness of the pork. There was also a Japanese hot sauce on the table which helped as well. This was also good though I would recommend more compared to other small plates to share.

The Kara Age for $9 consisting of Japanese fried chicken with mala mayo was pretty standard outside of the price point being relatively cheaper for the portion size compared to most other places. The chicken was pretty tender though I have had much crispier versions before but I can't complain with the light batter and the amount of chicken given. Though the color was different, the mayo also didn't exactly have any type of mala seasoning either but it still worked with the chicken.

The Koji Ebi Chili for $20 consisting of shrimp with sweet chili over egg omelette was pretty standard western Japanese/Yoshoku style comfort food. There was plenty of shrimp/ebi in there and the sweet chili was standard. I wish the egg was a bit fluffier but that is only a minor fault in an otherwise standard tasty dish.

Last was our large main to share which was the Tonton Hotpot (or nabe) which is $68 for the large or $38 for the small and we got the large one which was large and fine. This came with pork feet, chicken thigh, pork belly, dumplings, tofu, vegetables, and your choice of soup where we got the spicy miso tonsoku soup. The primary meat in there was the tonsoku/pork feet with there being some thigh and a little bit of dumplings and pork belly. Outside of the size which is easily big enough for four people as it should be for the price point, it's hard not to compare it unfavorably to some other nabe spots such as Kimura or even some other recent ones such the izakaya Toriya on the LES which both had much better broths, a little more variety in terms of vegetables, and was not focused on one meat in particular. Possibly the motsu/intestine pot is better here but I would recommend sticking with their other dishes instead.

This place is tasty with plenty of highlights and a worthy successor to the original excellent izakaya.

reviews.author: William Nobutomo Shinwo Kim
reviews.text:
The food was delicious. I ordered the small tonton pot and the portion was enough for two. The fried oysters were delicious and came with a delicious sauce (I think it was mentaiko egg mayo but not 100% sure). The pork in the hot pot was so soft and delicious, and the dessert was a perfect not-too-sweetness.

The service was also excellent. We had the pleasure of interacting with multiple staff members and they were all extremely friendly and welcoming.

reviews.author: Lee
reviews.text:
food is just as good as the old days. service is still exceptional. i love Tonton hotpot with Red Miso.
Good to know this place is still running.
been visiting this place since 10 years ago in West Village.

reviews.author: –ê–ª–µ–∫—Å–µ–π –®–µ–≤—á–µ–Ω–∫–æ
reviews.text: Lovely place, perfect for brunch. I ordered a dish from lunch menu (turkey club sandwiches). They were tasty, turkey meat was fresh and bacon was cooked well. Loved the vegetables inside too. Moreover, they serve french fries with sandwiches, pretty big portion. They have sauces for different dishes, used ketchup for my french fries. Also loved a little pickle. My wife ordered a breakfast item: Brie French Brioche, and it was massive and tasty too. Moreover, they also gave a cup of syrup, which was nice. I didn't have a drink, but she had a coffee and liked it. Definitely worth a visit.

reviews.author: Shay Teoli
reviews.text:
This was our first stop on our trip to Ithaca and it was the perfect start to our trip. From the atmosphere, to the friendly staff and the amazing food...5 stars across the board.
The atmosphere is a combination of 70s diner but with an add of updated sophisticated vibe with the rose gold lighting fixtures and the ceiling details. The food was absolutely amazing. The menu has a variety of options to choose from for anyone. The hostess was charming and quick to greet us at the door. And our server, she was an absolute delight. I would highly recommend this place to anyone visiting Ithaca.

reviews.author: Chaz Tuck
reviews.text: The food was amazing and reasonably priced. The service was incredible. From the second I walked in until I left I felt so comfortable and welcomed. The aesthetic is beautiful. Reminds me of a classic 40s dinner but still very stylish. I traveled from Rochester to try to baked apple pancake and I was not disappointed. Well worth the travels !! Will be returning again very soon

reviews.author: Taylor Karim
reviews.text: By far the best diner experience I have ever had in all my travels. We were transported back in time with the music and atmosphere topped with the beautiful and polite waitress by the name of Quin. She was very attentive to our needs providing a memorable service by which I will return again.

reviews.author: Erin Paik
reviews.text: Such a memorable, elevated Brunch and Breakfast area!! Milkstand offers a refreshing twist on American comfort classics, elevated through thoughtful presentation and creative flavor combinations. The Apple pancakes were so delicious offering such generous portions and strong cinnamon apple seasonings. I also savored the avocado toast, chicken and waffles and vegan chorizo skillet. Milkstand has such friendly interactions towards their dietary restrictions and is a standout gem in the Ithaca dining scene!!

reviews.author: Sy W
reviews.text: Very delicious dim sum. Served in an authentic way, with carts around. We got a bunch of small dishes to share and they‚Äôre absolutely delicious. Our favorite is the durian dessert ÂÜ∞ÁöÆÊ¶¥Ëé≤, so creamy and fresh. Apparently they make it fresh everyday so they didn‚Äôt have it when we first asked for it. The leek dumplings are so good! Lots of ingredients like shrimp, egg and lotus root. Beef tripe with turnip is so refreshing paired up with the chili spicy oil. The tofu wrap is so tasty. Porridge‚Äôs absolutely amazing. You can tell it‚Äôs freshly cooked and prepared with lots of time. When it comes to the sticky rice dishes, I prefer the pearl one more because it‚Äôs softer and with more kinds proteins. The other one is just so plain and rice is dry. Popular place and friendly service!

reviews.author: Steven Nhan Ngo
reviews.text:
My family and I was in NYC to visit from Philadelphia. We have dimsum in PA as well but the experience and the food here taste so much better!

Everything was steamed hot in the carts and every dishes was so savory and tasty. They have a wide variety of option and deserts. I definitely recomended the shumai, chicken feet, and the tofu skin rolls.

We had a great time here and we‚Äôll definitely come back if we‚Äôre in the city the next time!

reviews.author: Tan Tang
reviews.text: Been here when studying in East coast long while ago and thus want to revisit. Love the interior and spacious seating and of cause the food carts pushing around the tables for you to choose are much fun and missed, most dim sum restaurants not offer the food carts nowadays, even in Asian countries. Food are delicious generally, we enjoyed a lot on all dim sum dishes. We had brunch on a weekday and thus no wait time. However, the second want to revisit on a weekend lunch time, we had waited almost an hour downstairs outside the elevator and still so crowded. Had to change to another nearby dim sum restaurant after an hour wait. Recommend to go on weekdays or go earlier over weekends and prepare for long wait.

reviews.author: Emil Yao
reviews.text:
ABSOLUTELY the BEST Dim-Sum restaurant in the Northeast area!!
Fresh, tasty and very authentic Cantonese cuisine just like what you can find in Hong Kong.
Although the dining room could be a bit noisy, the service is actually quite fast/good.
Reservations are highly recommended. If you want to just walk-in, it‚Äôs better you show up before 11am on Saturday and Sunday. Otherwise you may have to wait up to one hour.
They also have a to-go only entrance on the ground floor.

reviews.author: diegobatt
reviews.text: My first DimSum experience, but definitely one that is going to be hard to beat. The place is extremely crowded, full of real Chinese people so you know it's good. Prices are ok for new York standards, 45usd including tax and 20% tip. For a Sunday, arriving at around noon, the wait is totally bearable, around 15/20 minutes for 4 people.

reviews.author: Leo Zou
reviews.text: No joke one of the best Thai places in the city. The massaman curry with beef is incredible. Not too spicy with plenty of flavor. The peanuts really provides a good crunchiness to the savory curry. Loved how the potato‚Äôs absorb the flavors. The pad Thai with shrimp also great, and I asked for a drink that‚Äôs not too sweet and the lemon Thai ice tea was just it. Really washes away the curry and refresh the palate for another round of flavor. The lunch special pricing is amazing, would be here on the regular and if not order delivery.

reviews.author: Mia ZHONG
reviews.text: Tried this Thai restaurant for the first time and was really impressed. Every dish had its own unique flavor and stood out in a different way. Nothing tasted generic or the same. The spices were well-balanced, the portions were good, and the overall meal felt thoughtful and authentic. Definitely worth a try if you‚Äôre looking for solid Thai food in the area!

reviews.author: Nicole ‚ÄúNikki‚Äù Sue Low Chee
reviews.text:
Excellent quality, authentic food at fair prices. Space has a neighborhood Thai place vibe but the food is better than your normal neighborhood Thai place, with the inclusion of a street food menu ‚ù§Ô∏è. Attentive, friendly service.

I ordered the crab fried rice and Chinese broccoli with crispy pork and was impressed by both. I was even impressed by the pork to broccoli ratio because it‚Äôs usually most broccoli. This is the first time I‚Äôve had the proportion reversed.

The lunch special is only $12 or $13 from memory. But I would go with the street food menu!

reviews.author: Dee Cam
reviews.text: The food at Myrtle Thai was delicious. The vegetables and berry rice was delicious. The pineapple rice was also very delicious. My favorite was the sticky rice with mango compote. It‚Äôs amazing how they make a delicious dessert out of rice. The service was great and the restaurant had nice music and a nice ambiance. I recommend this place for delicious and affordable Thai cuisine.

reviews.author: Margo Phillips
reviews.text: Came here on a recent trip to New York, and this was my favorite part of the trip! The staff is amazing! They were super friendly. The food here is also really good! The picture is their new mango sundae and the ‚ÄúSo High School‚Äù drink.

reviews.author: L.
reviews.text:
+ Get $25 off $50 using the link on my profile!

They have a nice happy hour till 6pm so make sure to catch it. The food and drinks were all decent, nothing spectacular but good and homey. The chicken was alright; I‚Äôd recommend the cavatelli more. One thing to note is that contrary to some reviews I‚Äôve seen, they don‚Äôt do anything for birthdays ‚Äî in case anyone comes expecting something based on those reviews and gets disappointed like we were.

reviews.author: Jasraj Singh
reviews.text:
All around wonderful restaurant, they also have a great happy hour with good priced cocktails and tasty beef tartar and kale salad.

The French onion soup was some of the best I have had in NYC, combined with sitting outside on a summer or fall evening it was just all around a perfect feeling.

The steak was extremely tender and the sauce was so good, they should consider serving extra sauce to dip your fries in it. The pasta was creamy and filling without being too heavy, the short rib in it was robust with flavor as well. Only thing could have been improved was a little more salt on the fries and fried mushroom, otherwise almost everything was perfect.

Service here was extremely accommodating and everyone was very nice.

reviews.author: Jennifer Fairholm
reviews.text: This place is an absolute gem. We came here for brunch and the atmosphere food and service are top-notch. We can really tell that there‚Äôs a lot of love that goes into each aspect of our dining experience. We would definitely recommend this to our family and friends and hope that you get a chance to try it as well.

reviews.author: Angel Torres
reviews.text: It is certainly worth experiencing. The French and modern cuisine is excellent. The service was top-notch and respectful. It is a wonderful place to celebrate an anniversary, a birthday, or simply to relax and enjoy delicious food.

reviews.author: Kevin Costa
reviews.text:
This place‚Äôs prices were offensively expensive. $20 for a French onion soup?! $36 for a bowl of mid pasta?! Absolutely not.
One cocktail and 2 bowls of pasta + tax and tip should not cost $112. INSANE and out of control. I‚Äôm fine with an expensive meal if the value and quality are there but this wasn‚Äôt it. Never again.

The food, drink, service, and atmosphere were fine‚Äînothing to call home about. Specifically, the truffle gnocchi was decent but the actual truffle shavings were dry‚Äîwould‚Äôve preferred less actual truffle for a more reasonably priced meal. The short rib cavatelli was disappointing, lacking depth and flavor.

reviews.author: Kevin Tenorio
reviews.text:
The best 5 course meal my wife and I have ever had thus far. Our hands down favorite, and rightfully so as sushi fanatics, was the hamachi. Talk about fresh on fresh on fresh on fresh. Fresh fish, fresh fruit, fresh sauce, fresh cream, fresh presentation‚Äîinsanely delicious and refreshing.

The tiger bread was some of the most exceptional bread we've ever had as well. The garlic was as buttery smooth to spread as the whipped butter itself, and was pleasantly flavorful without being overly potent.

My next course was the butternut squash rigatoni. The garnish on top was light and crisp and added that extra accent to the whole dish to round it off beautifully. My wife got the iberico pork, which was cooked to tender perfection. The broccoli mash concoction that came with it was reminiscent of broccoli rabe but basically in it's ultimate form anime-style. Crazy inventive.

The next course for me was the beer battered monkfish with risotto and was actually the best beer battered anything I've ever tasted. Superior crisp encasing that mouth melting fish. The risotto had crispy chunks in it as well and helped offset the heaviness of the fried fish like a wife offsets her husband's hard shell exterior and gives way to his heart of flesh. Speaking of, my wife got the lamb with risotto and it was yet again a perfectly tender cut of meat. It was smokey and carried a more intense flavor, which also was rounded out by the gentleness of the risotto, complimenting it on that marital level yet again.

Lastly, the desserts came in and ended the whole show the same way it began‚Äîwith favorite-level energy. It was the solid second favorite course for both of us. Mine was the panna cotta. Yo. It went crazy. It was like a salted caramel apple cheesecake, but after finding a way to dial in each ingredient to the max before artistically laying it all out on a plate without any of the cheesecake crust. I LOVE sweet/savory, and it encapsulated that in a dessert beautifully. My wife had the chocolate cake with ice cream, and like we don't even know how to properly describe how good that one was‚Äîbut here goes nothing. The cake was dark dark and rich rich from the sauce oozing on top to the moist pastry itself. The ice cream had a citrus undertone to it that balanced out the richness of the cake. Literally, yin and yang on a plate with the freshest chocolate drenched cherries on top. Good Lord, the Lord is good indeed.

The service was top notch, from the warm greetings, to the coat check in, to the menu break down, to the seamless water refilling and course transitions. We are big on omakase type meals as sushi heads, and this was up there while being a fraction of the price. There was a chill and comforting vibe to the whole restaurant as well. Take a trip here and let them take your palette on a trip it will sing praises on the whole way through. Bless.

reviews.author: Rachel Truong
reviews.text:
I had such an incredible dining experience at 6 NYC in Carroll Gardens. Every single dish we ordered was outstanding‚Äîfull of flavor, beautifully presented, and thoughtfully prepared.

The standout for me was the gnocchi with confit duck leg‚Äîit was rich, perfectly balanced, and truly unforgettable. But honestly, every dish we tried was a hit. The restaurant has a great atmosphere as well, making it a perfect spot for a date night.

Highly recommend for anyone looking for creative, flavorful dishes in a warm Brooklyn setting.

reviews.author: Yasemin Sahin
reviews.text: Such a gem! We had the 5-course tasting menu and really enjoyed it. Each dish was thoughtful and delicious, with just the right balance of flavors. The vibe is relaxed but still special, and the service was friendly and attentive without being too much. We feel so lucky to have this place within walking distance ‚Äî it‚Äôs already become one of our go-to spots. For $95, the value is amazing. Highly recommend for a great night out!

reviews.author: Alex Serebrov
reviews.text:
Carol Garden is my new favorite area for a fine dining yet stopped to surprise me. Here is another brand new gem in its crown.  This place will provide you with very fine example of Netherland culinary. The place is very classy, yet cozy and perfect for a romantic dinner.  It has very open contemporary design with probably the most open kitchen that I ever seen.  Imagine that you're in the loft, the dining area just continues into the kitchen without any, even formal barrier or separation.  As for the food everything that we tried and I mean everything was simply delicious! The hamachi, gnocchi,  mushrooms everything was top notch! The dessert was equally great, especially passion Fruit- a perfect combination of taste and texture without being too sweet.  The portions on the conservative side, but were very filling and price is also very comfortable for the quality of this place.  The only advice I would have to get them their tiger bread a bit bigger.
The place is open just in March 2025, but already made a very recommend place if you want to have a great dining in Brooklyn.
I would definitely come back for more.

reviews.author: William Mougayar
reviews.text:
We went twice within the same week, because we left wanting more, and the 2nd time allowed us to experience different dishes.
From the moment you enter, you get this very pleasant, cozy & modern Parisian bistro feeling.
Kirk‚Äôs hospitality is off the charts. He is an owner who really cares about his patrons and it shows.
The food is very well executed, and beautiful to the eye at the same time. We went from one discovery to another, as the tastes matched the beauty of the presentations. There is a lot of attention to details in this restaurant.
The Lamb Guiso might as well be their signature dish, along with the creatively presented Pork Schnitzel. Both are not to be missed. We went a la carte for both nights but begged for 2 dishes from the tasting menu that were quite appealing.
If I was living in Brooklyn, I would be there routinely. We will return for sure, as this restaurant seems to ambitious enough to evolve even further.
The wine list is also creatively concocted.

reviews.author: Jo T
reviews.text:
Customer service was wonderful. Went with my partner to try the 40th annual game festival phase 1. Biggest con is the portion sizes compared to the price point. The pro is being able to try special wild game that many other places dont have, but also, everything but 1-2 dishes were very average and forgettable.  Overall a fun experience, but not sure if it‚Äôs worth the money.

Wild boar potstickers - it was good but it just tasted like a pork dumpling, nothing exciting. I would order again if it wasn‚Äôt $21 for 4 pieces.
New orleans turtle soup - super tasty but again, it kind of just tasted like a tomato soup with some ground beef. some crackers wouldve gone great with it to add some texture as well.
Stuffed quail - texture was perfect, outside was slightly crispy but easy to cut through. the sauce that came with it on the plate was the star. not worth $45 to me personally but defintely something to try at least once.
Vension - absolutely delicious! one of my favorites of the whole meal. our waiter gave us a little fork to get the marrow out of bone and that was the cherry on top. could have ate 3 of these plates. very savory. kind of tasted like beef stew?
Antelope - my first time trying and I wasnt the biggest fan of the texture but the taste of the antelope with the potato and sauce was delicious. hard to explain what the taste is but at $49, defintely a fun special treat yourself dish.
Elk chops - have never tasted something like this beforr and the herb murturd crust was perfect. 2 chops for $61 but it was definitely worth it. I would order it again and kind of crazy but definitely worth the price in my opinion.

Also got the Henry Burger as my partner loves burgers and we always try to get a burger to go when we go out but it was very bland and not noteworthy. We also asked for medium but it came out more well done. Fries were crunchy and crispy!

reviews.author: sylvia sideris
reviews.text: WOW! Truly an amazing and delicious food experience! Their menu is extensive and offers a variety of dishes, however we decided to try several of the special wild game courses on their fall menu: elk chops, quail, antelope, rabbit ragu over tagliatelle and boar potstickers. Each dish was meticulously prepared, very tasty and delicious!! The recommended wine was a perfect match! Definitely going back soon!

reviews.author: Ioannis Malekos
reviews.text: Excellent steak and mash (Diane steak on the menu) complemented by very tasty spinach, broccoli and asparagus side dishes. To start with, we were served bread and Spanish olive oil. Friendly prompt service, very nice music to accompany dinner.

reviews.author: Sharma Pinas
reviews.text:
Food was awesome. Had the oysters which tasted like they were caught the same day. Lobster rigatoni and veal as well as the Henry‚Äôs burger. We almost ordered the whole menu. Food was incredible. The server who
I assumed was either management or
The owner he was great. Definitely would come back again. The food was worth the price. Immaculate restaurant and the place is the perfect spot with outside seating as well as indoor personal seating and a bar. I loved it. üòç

reviews.author: Sunil Agarwal
reviews.text: Everything was good the burger, the turkey sandwich, the egg preparations but nothing was exceptional. The french fries accompanying the burger were very thin and cold. I didn't relish them. I found the seating a bit congested but well I am aware space is limited in New York. I wouldn't mind going to the restaurant again but not my first choice hence 4 stars instead of 5.

reviews.author: Darcy Weidman
reviews.text: The inside is cute and we appreciated the creativity! The food was 50/50: monkey bread and lemon pasta were ah-mazing and worth the trip! The fried figs, while individually delicious, was overall a clunky dish. The scallop dish missed the mark. The service was good, however, it was really odd to have the utensil drawer being restocked at our table multiple times during our meal.

reviews.author: Vicki
reviews.text:
Caf√© Mars is such a funky place from their creative dishes to their interior design. The staff were all super friendly and welcoming throughout our time there!

My favorite was the girelle pasta. Very strong lemon flavor that reminded me of similar dishes I‚Äôve tried in Italy.

Overall, we thought they were all tasty but not too memorable. Ended up being pretty pricey for each person (I somehow forgot to take all photos, but we‚Äôve ordered more than what‚Äôs shown here).

reviews.author: Andrea Correal
reviews.text: We had an amazing experience at Caf√© Mars, the food is as unique as the space, flavorful and delicious, some of the highlights were the scallops, girelle pasta and the ice cream sandwich. While the vibe is fun and relaxed, it‚Äôs a true fine dining experience full of creativity. Every detail has been thought out from the interior design to the pop-up thank you cards!. The service was outstanding and everyone was very friendly. Can‚Äôt wait to come back to explore more of the menu!

reviews.author: Yelena Conaway
reviews.text: The place is fun, the decor is great, the service was very attentive. Fun surprises, like a complimentary drink at the beginning of the meal. The cocktails had really strong flavors. The menu is interesting, features creative dishes that are well executed. The menu changes regularly which is great. Have been here twice and would come back again.

reviews.author: Kirk Peterson
reviews.text: This place is just a gem.  Any time i‚Äôve gone, the staff is absolutely wonderful.  Welcoming, attentive, and just work really hard to make the experience feel unique and special. The space itself is also very cool, again an amazing attention to detail.  I‚Äôve had food that‚Äôs been amazing, some dishes that have been alright - but give them total credit for trying new things and being playful and inventive.  Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Anthony
reviews.text:
Very nice inside. Needs more air flow a little stuffy is all. The waitress was very helpful and pleasant (Chrissy) Gave some great insight on the dishes.

Food
Fried Catfish dish was better than I expected from a restaurant in the north.
7.5/10

Fried calamari
Think they were trying to do too much. Not a fan of pesto bathed calamari.
5/10

Grilled Meatloaf
This was amazing and you must try it. Everything tasted great in the dish and complimented each other well.
9/10

Carmel lava cake
Was good reminded me of a thick pancake with homemade whip cream and Carmel as the syrup.
8/10

All of these were great big portions all worth the price.

reviews.author: Daisy Krenn
reviews.text: Food looks and smells fresh and great quiet atmosphere. Very pleased with taste and cleanliness. Restrooms are clean and bar is neat. Thank you!

reviews.author: Giovanni Minozzi
reviews.text: If you're looking for good vibes and good food come on a Friday night the pasta and prime rib were fantastic.   A long with the live music.

reviews.author: Debbie Slobe
reviews.text: We are so grateful to the staff and management of Bistro 197! We hosted my father-in-law's celebration of life memorial luncheon there in August. From day one of planning the event, the manager (Bill) was super responsive and accommodating, especially when our numbers grew from 25 to nearly 45! We ended up taking over the whole restaurant! The food was amazing, portions generous, and the wait staff so kind and helpful!

reviews.author: Kimberly Glassford
reviews.text: We had reservations for 6:30, waited a long time for a waitress to show up to take our drink orders. Drinks weren't ready so we ordered our apps. Drinks finally came and were either not what we ordered  or not what they were described as on the menu. Apps came out and soon salads came out. I was given the wrong soup, waitress brought me the soup I ordered and it wasn't even warm. We finally got our meals at 7:50. The food was not good and the service was horrible. I won't go there again.

reviews.author: Keti C
reviews.text:
What a hidden gem! We‚Äôve had a few dishes here and they were all delicious.
The Arroz Meloso had such a unique flavor. This is a must order dish for sure. Pulpo (the octopus) was not only delicious but really nicely presented. Cochinillo was just melting in the mouth. The Gildas and Shishito peppers were just like the ones we tried in the Basque Country. Honestly, this place could easily stand out next to any popular San Sebastian spot.
And if you‚Äôre in Brooklyn, their restaurant La Vara is also excellent and worth checking out.

reviews.author: Gabriel Miranda
reviews.text:
I didn‚Äôt have high expectations since there is no hype for this restaurant, but the food is really good, especially the octopus and the croquetas. Totally recommend them.

They missed one appetizer that was ordered late, but besides that the service was good and the atmosphere was great.

reviews.author: Marie Yang
reviews.text: The tapas here are just sublime! The choices of fresh seafood and meat combined with simple but layered flavors are truly unique. Will come back to try out all the dishes on the menu!

reviews.author: Jack Tuggle
reviews.text:
I‚Äôll admit there may be slight bias in the fact that I think tapas these days in major cities are over priced based on the amount of food you get.

This place is on the nyt list of best restaurant.  The only seat we could get was 5 pm which was perfect actually time wise

We got quite a few things. Most of the chilled items were tiny as to be expected and didn‚Äôt blow me away. The best might have been the oyster mushrooms  they tasted better than the rich somehow.

The risotto was perfect. Best flavor of all the dishes.  But again just small. Can‚Äôt cost much to give a few more rice.

We ordered the special turbo fish. Which presentation was amazing. But honestly the meat of the dish didn‚Äôt have the flavor we really wanted in a special.  Taste didn‚Äôt meet presentation.

The sausage was also good. The allowed us to have a 3rd for 5 more dollars.  U can get so much sausage for 5 dollars u get a tiny price with pickled veggies.

The wall mural inside is cute too

reviews.author: Cass
reviews.text:
Insanely delicious. Everything we tried was simply amazing. Aaaammazzzinngg. And the service was great.
Our favorites were:
- swordfish belly
- mushroom carpaccio
- heirloom tomato salad
- basque cheesecake
- another fish that I forget

Don‚Äôt skip dessert. The desserts are great.

They recommend ordering around 2 dishes per person. All shareable. Most dishes are $20-$30. So it comes out to $50ish per person before drinks.

Ordering wise, you can‚Äôt go wrong.

reviews.author: Michelle
reviews.text: Cool dining experience. Thought there were some great dishes and some that were just exactly what you expect. I really liked the 4 spicy instruments, the bread salad, and the spicy moroccan chickpeas and chicken thighs. Got a few other dishes but they didn‚Äôt really stand out. Overall, great service and such a vibe place - it‚Äôs buzzing and it feels like a great place for friends and drinks. But at the same time the seatings a little crowded and for the price - the portions felt quite small.

reviews.author: Omer
reviews.text: The experience was absolutely fantastic! The food came out at a perfect pace, paired beautifully with some amazing cocktails. The quality of the ingredients really stood out - everything was balanced, flavorful, and cooked just right. The Denver steak was just a touch on the salty side, but still right at the upper edge of perfect. Overall, an excellent experience from start to finish!

reviews.author: Shachar Ashkenazi
reviews.text:
Wonderful service and great atmosphere.
Some of the dishes we tried were phenomenal, while other dishes weren't too special.

Overall we had a great experience and we will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Rachel Lander
reviews.text: Went here with a friend on a Thursday night. The food was excellent and the vibes were immaculate. There‚Äôs Vinyl DJ spinning records at the perfect volume to enjoy your meal while also feeling like you‚Äôre in Tel Aviv. I highly recommend the branzino which gets lit on fire. Staff and management is incredibly accommodating should you need anything. One of my favorite hidden gems in New York!

reviews.author: Sofia Esguerra
reviews.text: Omg!!! I was sooo surprised by this place! Not only the food was AMAZING, but the whole vibe of the place was great (and I went there on a Monday)! I just can‚Äôt get over their vegetables, specially their amazing salad with tahini and their cauliflower! Not to mention the lamb kebab! Honestly, everything was great, I don‚Äôt think you can go wrong. Btw, the bar/speakeasy they have next door is amazing. Overall, this place made me happy! Would come back so many times!

reviews.author: Mandoo Mul
reviews.text:
Fantastic. Excellent service & food. Great staffs, respects their customers. We both ordered L.I. Burger w/bacon + scotch soda highball.

fries were out temporarily, replaced with chips

Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Hannah Bartch
reviews.text:
Long Island Bar is perfection. The food hits that sweet spot of comforting but inventive, and the drinks flow so easy you lose track of the decade you‚Äôre in. Part of me doesn‚Äôt even want to write this because I don‚Äôt need TikTok mobs storming our neighborhood gem.

Start with the cheese curds and pretend you‚Äôre balancing them out with the gem salad. The deviled eggs are a must, and the burger never misses. Even the white Negroni, glowing radioactive yellow, tastes like it was invented here. Every detail is dialed in and the bus boys somehow always know when you are done even if their are fries left?? How??

It‚Äôs the kind of place that feels like yours the moment you sit down. No gimmicks, just timeless perfection. Easily the best restaurant in South Brooklyn.

reviews.author: Daniel French
reviews.text: Really busy local spot - can be a wait for table/bar space. The burger is excellent, well worth it (and starting to appear on some lists), the martinis are great too. Really friendly barstaff too

reviews.author: Anton S.
reviews.text:
Atmosphere: 7.5/10
Located in Cobble Hill, Brooklyn, The Long Island Bar exudes classic American diner vibes with its neon signage and chrome accents. Inside, the high-backed booths, chrome-trimmed chairs, and laminated menus reinforce the nostalgic theme. While the decor is charmingly retro, the backbar is minimal, featuring mostly glassware without an extensive display of spirits. Music volume was well-balanced, complementing the ambiance without overpowering conversation.

Drinks: 5/10
Recommendation: Improved Pendennis Club
The cocktail menu is concise, presented in a simple, laminated diner-style format. Drinks leaned towards the sweeter side, lacking depth and complexity. Presentation was basic, with standard glassware, no coasters, and minimal garnishes.

Service: 6.5/10
The staff was friendly and attentive throughout the visit. Water was only provided upon request. Prices were slightly below average for New York.

reviews.author: Heather Kouveras
reviews.text: All anyone wants to do is fit in at a place like this. Asking for a window bar seat felt a little like I was putting them out, but food was great, drinks were amazing and we will be back to see if we can get a smile and a thanks for coming in. Didn't want to mention that we'd been there before they were born, probably. There to celebrate an empty nest and it was perfect on a steamy day.  I'll try to endear myself to them next time.

reviews.author: Han Chung
reviews.text: Fun spot with changing daily specials - their $8 obanzai is the main attraction. We had the pork shiokaji which was incredible, so smoky and just the right amount of fat. Their roasted veg dish and salmon tartare don were also delectable. Their barley tea was also superb with unlimited hot water refills. Their sushi however - somewhat underwhelming - average fish quality but fair price. I would come again for hot dishes

reviews.author: Daniel Oas
reviews.text: I love this place, I did not expect for the sushi rolls to be so big with so much fish! Also it is so amazing how they have a large variety of options. The pumpkin croquettes were great. Service and atmosphere is like a diner almost, but with Japanese features.

reviews.author: belkys c patino f
reviews.text: With the spectacular flavors of the East, exquisite sushi, as well as its desserts... beers... accompanied by excellent service

reviews.author: Louise
reviews.text: The pricing is pretty reasonable. The space is adorable and conveniently located near the train station. I highly recommend the panko-fried eel, which was absolutely delicious. The salmon skin sushi was also a great choice. However, I wouldn‚Äôt recommend the smoked salmon. The menu described it as having spicy mayo and jalape√±o, but it didn‚Äôt quite live up to that expectation. Overall, it‚Äôs a great spot for a casual meal in a nice neighborhood..

reviews.author: kyle azua
reviews.text: Had such a delightful time at this restaurant. The staff is incredibly welcoming, friendly and accommodating. It felt like I was a guest in their home! I got the yellow tail salad, miso salmon, and some of the specials they had for the day. Everything came out hot, fresh, and at such a reasonable price. Even the miso soup was delicious - which I didn‚Äôt expect to be so good! For my entree, I got the miso glazed salmon. It was well cooked, fresh, and had a great umami flavor. I also appreciated the good selection of sake they had available. Would definitely visit again, especially if I‚Äôm the neighborhood!

reviews.author: Kelly Punch
reviews.text: We had a wonderful experience. Our server was very nice and helpful. Drinks were pricy but really well crafted. Everything we ate was delicious.

reviews.author: Gabe Ross
reviews.text: Always my neighborhood go-to. The best sushi in the area by far. Always consistent, authentic, comfort food, fresh fish, a New York classic. Not stuffy like all the omakase spots popping up all over, but much more high end and elegant than the other Japanese restaurants around. It‚Äôs the perfect in between, and the quality is always there!

reviews.author: Henri Merceron
reviews.text:
This place is so easy to miss..I‚Äôm actually not sure it has a sign out front. It probably does but I just went in without looking because my friends told me about it. Seems that that doesn‚Äôt slow down business. I went on a Thursday night an hour before closing and although the space
isn‚Äôt large, it was packed. Lots of energy. I sat at the bar and had my usual ‚Ä¶uni and fatty tuna. Both were fabulous (although the uni was $24 each vs the $15 I usually pay at other sushi houses). Can‚Äôt say that it was better than those for the price. I had a salmon sushi and immediately noticed
that there were none of those white veins (the typical grain that you see normally). I‚Äôve never seen such a uniform slice of salmon. And it was as velvety as it could be. Along with it I had the seared king salmon belly. Truly wonderful flavors along with the richness of the species. The slight char offered a nice flavorful accent. I had the salmon roe only because I‚Äôve never seen such large beads. Not sure that the flavor was different from normal sized roe but the texture was enjoyable. Finally, I had the hijiki seaweed salad. It was unlike any seaweed I‚Äôve had. Don‚Äôt know that I can describe it as it was a totally new flavor for me. Perhaps a little earthy. Again, hard to describe but worth the experience. Sitting at the counter where 6 chefs were actively plying their trade, I saw some very uniquely presented sushi and maki rolls that made me want to try EVERYTHING. But I didn‚Äôt. I wasn‚Äôt that hungry and I would have departed with a $300 bill just for me WITHOUT beverages. I will definitely return. It is not common to have a sushi menu absolutely replete with creative options as could be found here. Great staff too. Very attentive and informative.

reviews.author: Olga NYC
reviews.text:
The Chicken Teriyaki was perfectly cooked‚Äîdefinitely among the best I‚Äôve had. The "Sushi Regular," with eight pieces of sushi and one tuna roll, was fresh and flavorful, though the wasabi inside was a bit unexpected. The seaweed salad was delicious and beautifully presented.
We were treated to complimentary Konacha tea, though I would have preferred it to be served during the meal rather than at the end. The service was attentive, and the ambiance was cozy, enhanced by beautiful wall art. The only downside was the limited dessert menu.

reviews.author: Zo
reviews.text:
Beautiful and delicate food, beautiful balanced flavours and authentic. Some of the most tender and tasty outside of Japan.

Cannot understand the negative reviews other than to think they don‚Äôt know what good quality Japanese food is.

reviews.author: Britt van der Poel
reviews.text: Who doesn‚Äôt love fresh noodles? This place is amazing. The spicy cucumber salad was so saucy and punchy. Sizzling noodles have a bite and are a bowl of comfort. Freshest ingredients. The open kitchen creates a wonderful atmosphere. The service is uniquely sensitive and attentive. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Natalie
reviews.text: Food was delicious. We had the shrimp rolls, popcorn chicken and savory pancake scallions and they were delicious, especially the chicken. I had the beef noodle soup and it was so hearty, delicious and filling. Our waiter Galvin was great and guided us with recommendations. Will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Xintong Huang
reviews.text:
Great Sichuan spot just steps from Columbia! üè´
The Pea Pasted Noodles were rich, spicy, and super comforting ‚Äî perfect on a cold day. The Tang‚Äôs Fried Rice (with minced pork and preserved veggies) totally blew me away ‚Äî must-try! üî•
Affordable, flavorful, and super student-friendly. Definitely coming back for more!

reviews.author: Ann Sullivan
reviews.text: The Tang is a cozy, contemporary eatery serving creative Chinese noodles and other classic plates on¬†the¬†Upper West Side. It‚Äôs nice for a date or dinner with a friend. We had such a great meal from the Braised Beef Noodle Soup to the Zhong Dumplings and Tang‚Äôs Bliss Chicken Wings‚Ä¶ So delicious!!

reviews.author: nivesh vaze
reviews.text: Had a great time at The Tang NYC! The mango cocktail was super refreshing, and both the spicy chicken fry and kung pao chicken were packed with flavor and perfectly cooked. The crunchy potato wedges were dynamic and full of spicy flavor. Great food, fun vibe ‚Äî definitely worth a visit!

reviews.author: Yeollie Peollie
reviews.text:
The tacos were incredibly juicy, and the Jamaica agua fresca was simply delicious. The ‚Äúchurros sandwich‚Äù was also exceptionally fresh and tasty!
The customer service was top notch. We visited yesterday and returned today!

reviews.author: Adrianna Rekas
reviews.text: Food is fantastic, atmosphere is fantastic, and the servers are so so kind and attentive and lovely. The best authentic tacos I've had have always been from stalls or food trucks, but this is the first sit-down taco place in the US that had me wanting to come back. It really is the perfect place to go if you want good tacos in Manhattan, and the theme of the 1986 World Cup is so fun and different, it's a really cool vibe on a Friday night. In terms of dishes I recommend the Guadalajara and Al pastor tacos, elotes, and horchata.

reviews.author: Kevin
reviews.text: Steak tacos were decent. On the pricer side when it comes to tacos but overall was fine to taste and enjoy for a quick meal or dinner date in the area. Place feels more like dive bar vibes in the evening because of the lower lighting but nice for casual dates and friend meets during day and evening as well. Close to central park as well.

reviews.author: N S
reviews.text: Great tacos, not too expensive. Fast and easy service. I came on a Friday around 12:30 and there was only one other table eating, though someone else came in for a pick up order. I got the pulled chicken tacos and the amount of meat per taco was good. They must get busier in the evening. Either way it‚Äôs definitely worth stopping by!

reviews.author: Madhulika Murthy
reviews.text: One of the best tacos. Haven‚Äôt felt like going back to Los Tacos or any of the other popular ones after eating here. Excellent spicy margaritas. Service is quick and staff is friendly! Definitely one of my fav go to neighborhood joints.

reviews.author: Tye McCutheon
reviews.text: Let me tell ya that they're racist the manager tried to hold my receipt hostage(hence why it looks so rough) and say "don't come out if you're broke" meanwhile they're the one charging prices that's not even on the menu and not disclosing full transactions. I also found out they added a 7.40$ that I didn't solicit and somehow hid the tip section/part from me. They put whatever prices they wanted, they overcharged for drinks. Mind you we sitting there like what's taking him so long to close out the check (the server aka employee on receipt) NOW WE KNOW WHY but Thank you now I'm gone get the whole transaction disputed with my bank. STAY AWAY from this business they're very shady and mad because people didn't like their food. We had ordered nasty plain chicken quesadilla no seasoning and fish tacos, took one bite of each and didn't like it. Told them to return it we don't want it and would like plantains instead(never got those btw). Server gone say you didn't pay for the food. That's their reason and defense here ya, so that means charge however and whatever you feel that's ILLEGAL. I mean we were the only people of color there but damn. Now I'm gone let all my followers on all my socials and platforms to know to NEVER TO DINE HERE ‚ÄºÔ∏è

reviews.author: Jairo Melara
reviews.text:
The food was great. Flavors and portions were ok point.
My only issue was the server. She was dressed like she just got out of bed and was playing with dogs and serving food without washing her hands.

reviews.author: Omar Genao
reviews.text:
Had a nice evening here with friends. Staff was very friendly (Brian). The food was not good. I ordered a burrito that was tasteless and some of my friends ordered quesadillas ( the same ones), but the flavors were not consistent. One of them was so salty, they couldn‚Äôt finish it.

Nice place for drinks and maybe snacks.

reviews.author: Local Everyday
reviews.text: Can a great operation be extraordinary in only a couple of details? I think not. That‚Äôs why I am giving 5 stars here. My specific experience tonight is one cocktail and one appetizer. But both are write-home-about good. I have a bit of regret that I eat only so much in a day because I believe all the food here is likely beyond the ordinary. So skip my novel. Order the fried Brussels sprouts. Resist licking the plate.

reviews.author: Ellie H
reviews.text: Great outdoor seating to bring your dog in the neighborhood. Delicious margaritas and food is good. I love that the outdoor floors are clean and my dog can lay down comfortably while we enjoy happy hour and nice weather. Great atmosphere to wind down after work.

reviews.author: Nadia Curren
reviews.text: Johnny was so welcoming and amazing.  The Burgers, mozzarella sticks and the turkey club was amazing. It‚Äôs quaint and cozy. The atmosphere lives up to the name. The Greek cuisine is authentically good. I‚Äôll be back for those meatballs. The special sauce was delicious!

reviews.author: Isabella Grandic
reviews.text:
Amazing local diner vibe not overrun with tourists. Fast and efficient energy (in the best way possible). Extensive menu. French onion soup and the pizza burger were pretty good. Wish the fries were crispier.

Feels like you‚Äôre transported to the 70s/80s.

Very refreshing establishment.

reviews.author: Blue Lobster
reviews.text:
Nacho Burger! A must-try! One of the best burgers I‚Äôve ever had!

I had dinner here a few nights ago, and the atmosphere is very charming with an old-school touch‚Äîa true American-style burger joint, worthy of the name. The staff was kind and courteous, and since I couldn‚Äôt decide between the various options, I asked for a recommendation. I have to say, I couldn‚Äôt have chosen better! Great prices for the area, and the burger was ready in just a few minutes. Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Kevin Anannab
reviews.text: Had a yummy meal at Cozy!  And they have this great new sauce that I think is great for burgers and fries.  I will be back for more!

reviews.author: Mattia
reviews.text:
Loved it. Definitely not a Michelin starred restaurant, but everything tasted nicely. I recommend the homemade cheesecake (but you‚Äôll definitely want to share it, it‚Äôs like a billion calories).

The staff were amazing.

reviews.author: Mag Tulsi
reviews.text:
Why is this place so underrated? Situated in Manhattan, East Village, this place is a must go when you‚Äôre in the neighborhood. It‚Äôs probably my third visit in the last five years and everytime I come back I leave happy after having the meal there. The food is really good and don‚Äôt get me wrong - it‚Äôs not just me but also my Chinese friend who knows her cuisine. Try it for yourself. What I love the most is Baked BBQ Pork Buns, they are to die for.
The service was very professional.

reviews.author: EJ
reviews.text:
Overall: A huge disappointment
Ambience: outdated decor, but very good for solo lunch, quite a few tables are solo diners
Service: not the waiter‚Äôs fault but the cheap plastic green chopsticks are a mode killer‚Ä¶
Food:
Huge disappointment: everything screamed previously frozen. The classic chicken feet is barely cooked (the traditional dim sum chicken feet should be so soft they melts in your mouth). The coffee and milk tea is very mediocre as well. The only redeeming dish is BBQ pork bun.

Honestly don‚Äôt know how this shop can make it so far in the competitive food scene of New York City. Will never come back for sure.

reviews.author: Brayden Ainzuain
reviews.text: Solid dim sum place if you cannot make it to Chinatown. Some of their bites needed a little bit of seasoning but nothing that their chili oil and sauces couldn‚Äôt fix. I generally liked it and I‚Äôd go back. Their lychee hot tea was awesome. They were also pretty quick to serve up the dim sum.

reviews.author: Arys N
reviews.text: Midday on a weekend, I was able to get in. No line or wait. It was an impulse. The service was quick, friendly and when you asked the staff what item you were receiving, they kindly explained the dish. Certain dishes were exceptional. Bao buns wow. There were items I did not enjoy but I cannot rate low due to a limited dataset associated with similar items. Recommend for sure. Try as many things as you can.

reviews.author: F P
reviews.text:
Hidden Manhattan Eats: Tim Ho Wan
üìç85 4th Ave NY

Tried out Tim Ho Wan ü•ü‚ú®the famous dim sum spot known as one of the most affordable Michelin-starred restaurants in the world. I went in ready for a dim sum feast and ordered their signature baked BBQ pork buns and some deep fried dumplings.

The pork buns? Soft, pillowy, with this sweet crackly crust on top that threw me off at first‚Ä¶ but the savory caramelized pork filling balanced it out. Not bad, kinda grew on me. üëåüèΩ

But the fried dumplings‚Ä¶ y‚Äôall. They were sweet inside. I wasn‚Äôt ready for that at all, and honestly it ruined the vibe for me üò©. Like, are sweet dumplings a traditional thing? Or did I just order wrong?

If you‚Äôve been to Tim Ho Wan, drop your recs ‚Äî what‚Äôs good here, what should I try next time? Because I‚Äôm still curious, but that dumpling situation‚Ä¶ nah.

reviews.author: MATTHEW SODIKOFF
reviews.text: Good lunch in NYC, portions were balanced and everything tasted fresh and great.  Had Jacks breakfast and would have ate more had it been there but for $30 felt like a lot of value.  Jasmine tea was really good and brewed in pot.  Service was friendly and helpful.

reviews.author: Alex Vano
reviews.text: The atmosphere was amazing and the waitstaff were absolutely lovely. Usually I wouldn't give such an expensive place 5 stars but the quality of their food made up for everything. Not huge portions, but enough to keep you full and delivers on taste. Also many options which makes it hard to choose but also good for gluten free people.

reviews.author: Kevin Corey
reviews.text:
My girlfriend and I visited Jack‚Äôs Wife Freda in SoHo for a late breakfast after reserving a 10:45am table, and it was the perfect brunch experience. We sat in the outdoor dining area. Seating was a bit cozy, but the atmosphere was lively and welcoming.

She ordered the Mediterranean Breakfast paired with a refreshing matcha, and I went with the Jack‚Äôs Breakfast, cooked perfectly medium rare. To fully take in the Jack‚Äôs Wife Freda experience, we shared their famous waffles, and they absolutely lived up to the hype. Light, crisp, and delicious.

The service was phenomenal from start to finish. Everyone was attentive, friendly, and made us feel right at home. Highly recommend this spot for anyone looking to enjoy a flavorful, charming brunch in SoHo. We‚Äôll definitely be back!

reviews.author: Benjamin Freeberg
reviews.text: Really friendly staff, very engaging. Nice airy atmosphere inside with a beautiful patio outside. Food was spectacular, I'm coming back to try more of the menu for sure. Drinks were all great. I rarely order cocktails off of a menu but it just made sense to do it here. Can't wait to come back.

reviews.author: Sawako Y
reviews.text:
Jack's Wife Freda is an iconic brunch spot in SoHo, especially busy on weekends. My friend and I finally had a chance to try it for the first time yesterday.

If you're a group of 3-4 people and have a booth, the experience may be better, but we were seated at a table for 2, squished between two other tables. The noise level was quite high and the person sitting right next to me was talking so loudly I could barely hear my friend.

As for the food, I ordered a Salmon Burger with french fries, which was quite tasty. My friend ordered Jack's Breakfast (including skirt steak, 2 eggs, roasted tomatoes, fingerling potatoes, pickled onions and sourdough toast), which was a lot smaller than we'd both expected, especially considering the price.

We didn't leave with the best impression, but perhaps if you're seated outside, at the end or in a booth, the experience would be better.

reviews.author: Sameer Malhotra
reviews.text: Undoubtedly the best Thai in the city (comparing some of the other popular west village and UES places). I believe they were the popular joint Uncle Boon‚Äôs which became uncle boon‚Äôs sister delivery only around the pandemic and now this is their latest incarnation. Magnificent flavorful Thai food. I had the hot toddy cocktail, green curry clams and the short rib preparation- perfect combination.

reviews.author: David Joseph
reviews.text:
I came here on a seasonal and dry Saturday night in late October around 830pm with a friend who was in town visit.

We didn‚Äôt have a reservation and there was a wait for a table which we were quoted by the host from the little host window to be 45 minutes. We decided to walk around Soho while we waited as they text you when the table is ready and then you have 10 minutes to claim the table. After i put the phone in my pocket to walk around and wait, I was texted 3 minutes later to say my table was ready‚Ä¶ but unfortunately I didn‚Äôt see the message until 15 minutes after I put my phone in my pocket. We walked back to the restaurant and we were told we could have a seat at the counter which we took.

The counter was great although the service was a little light and slow but I think that might be a theme throughout the restaurant. The restaurant was filled with young people but not super loud. The cocktail I had was good. The food was fine; not really remarkable compared to any other Thai restaurants throughout the city that can easily book reservations. I would not recommend the fries everyone talks about. The decor of the restaurant was cool.

I‚Äôm glad I went, but I probably wouldn‚Äôt go back unless someone else initiated the meal.

reviews.author: Mi Z
reviews.text: Very good food. Really like their Green papaya salad (must-try). Disco fries are pretty good too. Laab is on the spicier side, but it‚Äôs very flavorful. Laab comes with a bowl of wild rice. But due to its spice and flavor, I would order additional bowl of rice if you are in a group of 2-4 people.

reviews.author: Adel
reviews.text:
We came here for brunch. Just be aware. They don't take reservations, just walk ins, so be prepared to wait. This was actually our second try if you want to get seated right away, come early. Otherwise, the wait can be up to 2 hours. This time we got lucky and didn't wait too long.
The restaurant is cute, but it's small and seating is limited. We tried quite a few dishes such as
Uncle Boon's Crab Fried Rice, coconut chicken thailandese, thai tea babka french toast, disco fries,  Pha Thai with Crispy Fried Chicken, Crispy Eggplant Maytinee, Rooibos and Chrysanthemum Tea.
Our favorites were the roti, crispy fried chicken, eggplant, and the fried rice. The disco fries were also really good. The Phat Thai was decent, but had a too much peanut for my taste. The babka French toast was a miss for me it was too dry and the spread had an odd flavor.
Overall, it's a cool spot to check out if you're into Thai food and don't mind a wait. There are definitely other great Thai places around too, especially if you're short on time. Staff were nice but understandable can be very busy.

reviews.author: Lori Lam
reviews.text: this is one of my go-to places for brunch. i really enjoy their thai twist on brunch foods. i used to come all the time for their thai babka french toast but they have changed it to an elephant ear french toast which essentially felt kind of like a crispier cinnamon roll, and i loved it. their disco fries are also a must try and this time we also tried the panang neuh which was super flavorful and tender.

reviews.author: Melody Asherman
reviews.text: Last night I had the pleasure of dining at Mango Bay and let me tell you, the food was divine! Every bite was bursting with authentic Caribbean flavor. If you're a fan of Caribbean cuisine, this spot is a must-try! For food I ordered: Goat puff pastry & the Ras & Pasta. For drinks: Passionita Bay & Mango Bay! Everything is good there. The staff is so welcoming and service is on point. Definitely check them out.

reviews.author: Epicurean Belletrist
reviews.text:
This weekend we had the pleasure of visiting Mango Bay restaurant in Fort Greene, Brooklyn. This unique little gem offers an elevated Caribbean menu that highlights authentic Caribbean flavor with an upscale spin.

To begin we ordered the Greene Lit cocktail.  This beautifully crafted cocktail blends vodka, prosecco, lime and mint and served as a perfect starter for what was to be an amazing brunch!

For our main courses we ordered the Pepper Prawns and Grits and the Steak and Eggs.

I am a huge shrimp and grits fan and have spent time trying this dish all over the country. I was very curious how Mango Bay would measure up with their unique take that includes a Scotch bonnet sauce as well as a pimento sauce. I can say unequivocally and without hesitation, this is the absolute best shrimp and grits I have ever had in my life!!! The balance of flavor,  texture and freshness was only outdone by the masterful preparation of each component of this dish. One might be intimidated by the thought of a Scotch bonnet sauce but this chef has an unparalleled understanding of balance and it is clear that this dish was born from pure artistry and know-how!!! If you are a lover of shrimp and grits, as I am, this one is not to be missed! I would go so far as to say you have not had it right until you've had it here.

I am told the steak and eggs were exquisitely prepared and the accompanying spicy aioli  highlighted the beautiful, perfectly prepared steak, sunny side up egg  and crispy ridged potatoes.

The service was warm and friendly and the restaurant's overall atmosphere is transportational to the islands.  Mango Bay is a true star of Caribbean flavor in Brooklyn. Try it, try it, try it! You will not be disappointed, nor will you find a flavor experience quite like this anywhere else in the city.

reviews.author: Rojin Taheri
reviews.text:
Amazing atmosphere, amazing dishes. My favorite dish was probably the goat puff pastry. I also loved the oxtail and the seafood pasta, but I wish it was mentioned on the menu that the pasta is spicy. I have a very low tolerance for spicy food, but it was still so buttery and delicious. The mango bae cocktail was my favorite and we even got a free drink, thank you!
My only complaint is the included gratuity of %20 which was odd for our party of two and it was nowhere mentioned on the menu. That‚Äôs the only reason for my 4 star review, but overall definitely worth checking out!

reviews.author: Anna H
reviews.text: Wow. One of the best meals I‚Äôve had all year. Great service in a beautiful brownstone. The lychee mojito good but the grand bay was phenomenal. Now the appetizers are a must. All outstanding. The props shrimp and Johnny cakes 10 billion stars. Big prawns and the sauce I drank the bowl.  The Johnny cakes were the best I ever had. My favorite. The coconut ginger mussels again phenomenal. Drank that sauce too. The eggrolls were good. Nice contrast with cool creamy spicy dipping sauce. The homemade seafood pasta was fantaStic. The red snapper with cool Bacar sauce yes. The oxtail insanely good. Browning sauce great. The rice n peas were yummy. Very automatic. Mango chow is cool and refresh. The rum cake was the best I ever had a worth it.

reviews.author: Cherise Fraser
reviews.text: So I would rate this restaurant a 7/10. I would say the atmosphere is nice, the food is good and the service was okay. The ackee n saltfish rolls was the best thing I had that night. The jerk chicken was very spicy, which I know how jerk is supposed to taste but it was overly spicy. The festivals paired with it, weren‚Äôt as sweet as expected and they felt very airy almost as if it was empty. I wish my dish came with rice n peas but I had to purchase that separately while the oxtail came with rice n peas. The rice itself was spicy which wasn‚Äôt expected either but it was still good 7.5/10. Then being that it was my birthday I was expecting maybe a little free dessert but unfortunately I didn‚Äôt get any. No one asked us if the food was good or not, kind of just seemed like a rush. Weren‚Äôt even finish with the appetizer and the entrees were brought out like 5 minutes after. Also the table we had was circled and small compared to everyone else‚Äôs so it wasn‚Äôt much room to eat. OVERALL 7/10. Wasn‚Äôt really worth that amount of money in my opinion.

reviews.author: Marcely Marte
reviews.text:
Lizeth was our server and was very happy to serve us. She gave us options when we asked for suggestions and very attentive what we didn‚Äôt want/ didn‚Äôt like.

Mamazul food was very delicious and full of flavor, will definitely come again especially with it‚Äôs ambience and music.

+ the hostess and manager helped us get another table for our brother who came along

reviews.author: Anysha Plasencia
reviews.text: We had such a great experience at Mamazul. Our server Pamela was amazing, super friendly and helpful the whole night. When we found out they were out of the lava cake, she surprised us with shots on the house which totally made our night. Great service, great vibes, and the food was delicious. Definitely recommend asking for Pamela if you go.

reviews.author: Brown Sugar
reviews.text:
My drink was very delicious the did not skimp on the alcohol. The appetizer was good could have been a little more the portions was small
Especially for the price. My entr√©e would have been great except it came out cold. My waitress forgot about me she took my appetizer order and never came back. Had to call another waitress over to take care of me. The waitress did try to accommodate me but it didn‚Äôt help the situation. The decor was nice.

reviews.author: francesandfrancis
reviews.text: One of the better Mexican Restaurants in Broadway. We ordered their pork and chicken specialties and it‚Äôs delicious and nicely presented. Price is reasonable. We finished up with churros which I must say is the best churros in Manhattan.

reviews.author: phillip salli
reviews.text: There are only a few places that will get me to travel into Manhattan for food, and this is one of them. Service was ok, but the atmosphere and the food were amazing. It's worth the congestion pricing!

reviews.author: Nicole
reviews.text: Wow! My aunt is gluten free/dairy free and was in town visiting when we came here for an early dinner on a Saturday night. Lovely setting and interior. The service was great and the food was amazing. Incredibly delicious and the warm bread, this is always where they win me over. So good. Pleasantly surprised and I can't wait to come back again.

reviews.author: Libby Albaugh
reviews.text: Romantic atmosphere, amazing service, the drinks are strong and well worth the price, all of the food is so delicious. The lamb was tender, mashed potatoes were rich, green beans perfectly cooked, chicken parmesan was incredible and the DESSERT!!!! The chocolate cake with raspberry sorbet is to die for. Will be coming back over and over again, such a wonderful experience. I can eat gluten but my husband can‚Äôt and this is the most delicious gluten free restaurant I‚Äôve ever been to.

reviews.author: Olivia
reviews.text: I had such an amazing anniversary dinner at Senza. Eating authentic Italian food was never something I imagined I could ever do after being diagnosed with celiac disease. It was not only the best gluten free food I have ever eaten but my favorite restaurant of all time now. The atmosphere was perfect, quiet little spot that feels like a slice out of Italy. I cannot wait to return!!! Round of applause, seriously. Thank you so much!!

reviews.author: Ash Elise
reviews.text: We had the best meal at Senza. I‚Äôve eaten and cooked so many gluten free recipes and honestly these were some of the best desserts and calamari I‚Äôve had. NGL the tiramisu was better than what I had in Italy. Don‚Äôt tell Nonna. Totally worth a visit.

reviews.author: Mariah carpenter
reviews.text: Great gluten-free experience in New York. I had a great weight staff and cute little blankets for sitting outside. The fried calamari was out of this world I hadn‚Äôt had any for almost 6 years!

reviews.author: Lindsey Sampson
reviews.text: This vegan restaurant can please even the non vegans. We tried the "chicken" sandwich, the bbq buffalo wings, and the bbq steak hero. Everything was absolutely delicious! The wings and chicken are a must though. The atmosphere is so so welcoming and warm. Our service was outstanding, and Jade the owner is one of the nicest people I've had the pleasure to meet. They go way out of the way to make sure you have a great experience. Im not a sweets person but they brought out a piece of chocolate cake and I'm still thinking about it.

reviews.author: A-Z Vegan
reviews.text:
A great restaurant with much more to offer than what we ate and definitely worth a second visit if/when we return to NYC.

We both opted for their vegan wings, one with the BBQ buffalo sauce and one as the Hot Ones challenge, which comes with a bottle of every hot sauce used in the 24th season to apply as little or as much as you want.

The menu is extensive and looks amazing, but we only had time for a light-ish lunch and I couldn‚Äôt pass up an opportunity to take on the Hot Ones lineup (as a chilli-head).

A place definitely worthy of your custom and support, and one we‚Äôll make certain to visit to try more of their offerings when we can.

reviews.author: Barbara Bt
reviews.text: My favorite types of food are chicken, shrimp, and vegan options!! üòã I love having a platter so I can try more than one delicious thing, especially those chicken wings. I was so full I couldn't try everything, but I definitely plan to come back for that popcorn shrimp. The service was great, so I think I‚Äôll be returning s.

reviews.author: Ray Pak
reviews.text:
One of the best feelings is stumbling upon a restaurant that is unassuming but just offers delicious, no frills food. That is Red Bamboo. Stepping into the restaurant and speaking with the owner, Jade, is like stepping back into a time from when I was younger, before every restaurant was filled with gimmicks or aesthetics and portions were meant to fill you up. It's always nice to support small businesses in these times and especially when the owners are as kind as this one.

I had never gotten Filipino food before and did not think I could ever have it as a vegan. I'm glad that this restaurant offers some authentic Filipino food (I had the adobo). For those who may want something different, they also have a wide variety of other foods and desserts. Their wings are some of the best vegan wings I've had. Also for those who don't know, these are the wings that were featured on the Hot Ones with Ariana Grande (the barbecue wings are great). They also offer a Hot Ones challenge for those who want to try some spice.

Having been here for 31 years, Red Bamboo deserves more attention. I'd highly recommend checking it out. I think it deserves a spot as a vegan staple in NYC amongst the many others.

reviews.author: Vinita Dugad
reviews.text:
This place is 10/10 in terms of taste, staff and vibe. The food was delicious, loved it. The prices are reasonable and portion size is good.
We ordered :
Creole Soul Chicken - 8/10
Almond Coconut - 8/10
Tiramisu - 10/10 (The best vegan tiramisu ever)

The staff is super sweet and nice, they recommend you the best.
So visit here if you are in NYC.
There are so many vegan dishes to try, you will be confused!
100% recommended!

reviews.author: FreshCoolClean
reviews.text:
Outstanding seafood restaurant!
The food is absolutely delicious, and the sauce is simply divine.
The cocktails are exceptional ‚Äî perfectly balanced and creative.
The staff is attentive and friendly, always ready to help.
A solid 5 stars ‚Äî I‚Äôll definitely be back and always recommend this place!

reviews.author: DidIt ToYourself
reviews.text:
