Randomly walked in for a table at 5pm with no reservations and was still seated.
Seafood boil was a 8 out of 10, the crab cakes were a 7.5 It was missing some flavor. As far as the drinks, they can be stronger..

reviews.author: Kiki H.
reviews.text: If you‚Äôre a seafood fan like me this place is a dream come true! I couldn‚Äôt get enough of the clams they were tender, juicy, and perfectly seasoned and freshness. The seafood boil? A masterpiece! Every bite was packed with flavor, from the plump shrimp to the buttery corn and the perfectly cooked crab legs And the calamari was light and crispy. Overall, this spot delivers on quality, freshness, and taste. Whether you‚Äôre a seasoned seafood lover or just dipping your toes in, you‚Äôll leave here completely satisfied. I‚Äôm already planning my next visit! Drinks are good and strong as well ü•∞ I didn‚Äôt get a picture of the boil because I dug right inüòÇ

reviews.author: Kait
reviews.text: Crab legs were fresh and easy to Crack. My boyfriend that never cared for crab kept talking about how good it was. A little pricey but I left feeling so happy. They have $1 happy hour oysters, so ill be back for that. 10/10 will go back again.

reviews.author: Mekayah L.
reviews.text:
We‚Äôve been wanting to check this spot out for a while now. After a long day running errands, we finally decided to give it a shot. They add a 20% gratuity regardless of how many people are in your group. It was surprisingly calm for a Monday night, but the service was super fast. The aroma from the kitchen really drew us in; you could tell someone was cooking up a storm.

We went for the soft shell crab basket, and I definitely recommend having it there; it was super fresh. Each entree comes with two sides, so we picked the ribeye with broccoli and potatoes, and the butterfly snapper with Brussels sprouts and potatoes.

Both dishes were amazing, so we asked to meet the chef. Since it was a slow night, he was happy to chat. His name is Mohammed, and he hails from Senegal. If you get the chance to visit, I highly suggest trying either of the entrees. He was really appreciative of our compliments, saying he doesn‚Äôt get them often and seemed genuinely surprised.

He‚Äôs an awesome chef and is really bringing some fantastic flavors to theBoil Prime.

reviews.author: Andrew Dabydeen
reviews.text: So I was craving Chilaquiles and saw that Bandido had the dish for brunch, glad I stopped by because it hit the spot. I came between brunch and dinner so there weren‚Äôt too many people in the restaurant. The food came out fairly quick and everything was delicious though sometimes lacking in a few areas. The mole sauce was on the sweeter end but still good, I much prefer the verde sauce. Our waitress was great and friendly so shoutout to her. Wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to stop by again if I‚Äôm craving a particular dish, definitely stop by if you‚Äôre in the area.

reviews.author: Denise Valera
reviews.text:
I recently visited Bandido Brooklyn, and it was an amazing experience! It's a brand new restaurant, and I was thoroughly impressed with the food ‚Äî everything was absolutely delicious! From the appetizers to the main dishes, each bite was full of flavor and perfectly prepared. The drinks were equally great, with some fantastic options to complement the meal.

The staff here is phenomenal! They were friendly, attentive, and really made us feel welcome. As a nice touch, they even gave us a shot on the house, which was much appreciated. If you're looking for a great spot with delicious food, drinks, and exceptional service, I highly recommend checking out Bandido Brooklyn. I‚Äôll definitely be coming back!

reviews.author: Jennifer Avila
reviews.text: We got the chicken quesadilla & the torta and it was soo much more than I expected! The quesadilla was delicious and had a good portion of meat. The torta was also very good, the chicken was perfectly crispy. The service and atmosphere was excellent. We will be back!

reviews.author: Kate McNamara
reviews.text:
What a solid and review-worthy experience. The tacos (pastor and battered fish) were done RIGHT. The salsa that came with‚Ä¶chef‚Äôs kiss. Mezcal margarita on happy hour‚Ä¶WIN!
I do want to add this part most of all. There were 3 hard-working, fast moving women running the front of house tonight and they were SO impressive. I actually asked if any of the 3 were part owners. The HUSTLE and obvious care they put into this beautiful corner spot needs to be recognized. It was like experiencing a perfectly choreographed dance. I come from an industry background so yes, I notice this stuff. But really, shout out to these 3 badass ladies holding it downnnnnnn.

reviews.author: DANIEL CASTILLO
reviews.text: Great drinks, nice ambiance and flavorful tacos! It's really close to Barclays Center. So if you have a concert or game, come visit them early. They also have HH on drinks so you may want to get a pre-game before your event.

reviews.author: Md Syful Islam
reviews.text:
An Authentic Taste of Bangladesh in Jamaica, Queens: Dhanshiri Restaurant.

If you're looking for authentic Bangladeshi "Deshi" cuisine in Jamaica, Queens, Dhanshiri Restaurant on Hillside Avenue is a must-visit. This isn't just a place to grab a quick bite; it's a culinary escape that feels like stepping into a home kitchen, right down to the nice, cozy seating area that genuinely gives off a comforting, familial vibe.
The Food: Flavorful and Diverse
Dhanshiri's menu is a comprehensive tour of Deshi classics, and everything I've tried has been bursting with flavor. The Biryani and Beef Taheri are standout main courses‚Äîperfectly spiced and incredibly satisfying. For a lighter but still hearty meal, their Khichuri is a winner.
Their curries are the heart of the menu. From the rich Beef Curry and tender Goat Curry to the comforting Fish Curry, you get the true taste of home-cooked meals. Don't skip the lesser-known gems like the savory Chicken 65 Curry or the simple yet perfect side dishes like Mix Vegetable and Dall.
For a quick snack or appetizer, you have fantastic options like Puri, Samosa, Piyaju, and Vegetable Rolls. They also offer classic grill items like Chicken Tikka. To finish, you can't go wrong with their Deshi Dahi (yogurt) and traditional Sweets, paired with a hot cup of their fragrant Masala Tea.
Event Catering: Your Next Party Solved
What truly sets Dhanshiri apart is their catering service. They expertly handle orders for any kind of event or family party you can imagine‚Äîfrom large functions like wedding and marriage ceremonies to more intimate gatherings like birthday parties. Knowing the quality and authenticity of their food, I highly recommend them for your next event. You can trust them to take care of your order with delicious, home-style cooking that will impress your guests.
Final Verdict: Dhanshiri Restaurant delivers an authentic, flavorful Deshi experience in a warm setting. Whether you're dining in for a delicious lunch or planning a big party, this place is a gem.
Have you ever tried Bangladeshi food before, or is there a specific dish on their menu that caught your eye?

reviews.author: Nipa Akter
reviews.text: This is the fifth time I‚Äôve ordered from them through Uber eats, and they‚Äôve gotten it wrong again. Every time I order peyaju, they somehow give me singara or something else instead. I don‚Äôt understand why they think it‚Äôs okay to just toss anything into the bag without asking or informing customers if they‚Äôre out of something. It‚Äôs so unprofessional. People are kind enough to support them by ordering, yet it‚Äôs nearly impossible to get the correct food nowadays without a mix-up.

reviews.author: promi
reviews.text: As a Bengali women, I have to say the food here is AUTHENTIC. The service was top notch, and CLEAN. I enjoyed every bite, and each moment of great service the workers have provided for my dining in experience. I cannot wait to show my friends this spot, when I want to introduce them to my culture. Thank you dhanshiri.

reviews.author: Alessa Alex Chernyakov
reviews.text: I am not a local. I selected the place strictly based on the cuisine. The food was delicious. The service was perfect. The prices were lower than where I live. You can tell the place is a favorite among ethnic people, which is always a good sign. Highly recommend.

reviews.author: arpana dc
reviews.text:
Today I visited the restaurant for the first time, and I must say, I was genuinely impressed‚Äînot just by the delicious food, but by the warm and welcoming service I received. There was one Nepali girl in particular who truly stood out. From the moment we walked in, she greeted us with a bright smile and such a respectful, humble attitude. She made sure we were comfortable, patiently took our orders, checked on us from time to time, and served everything with so much grace and positivity.

Her kindness, soft-spoken nature, and professionalism made our entire dining experience feel special. It felt like being cared for by someone who truly loves what she does. Good food brings customers in, but it‚Äôs service like hers that makes people want to come back again. I want to sincerely thank her for going above and beyond and making our visit so memorable. Keep shining and spreading good vibes wherever you go! üå∏üí´üôè

reviews.author: Duran S
reviews.text: Goodness me! This place is absolutely beautiful, gorgeous and amazing. The taste lingers on your tongue and lips. The staff is sociable. The drinks are mastersclass. I come here regularly.

reviews.author: Tatiana
reviews.text:
I stopped by Belli in Clinton Hill and honestly loved the vibe at the bar. It is super chill, has warm lighting, and is the kind of place where you actually want to sit and sip a glass of wine or cocktail.
The bartender was super friendly and made me feel welcome without being over the top. Unfortunately, I don‚Äôt remember his name(((
If you‚Äôre looking for a low-key spot with great drinks and a nice vibe, Belli‚Äôs Bar is a solid choice.
Thank you!

reviews.author: Mairead Parnow
reviews.text: Friendly and funny service, delicious food and cocktails, and fun atmosphere. Perfect serving sizes too! The meal on top in the photo is the bolognese, and the one on the bottom is a special of spaghetti with shrimp and cherry tomatoes in a light sauce! Everything was amazing!

reviews.author: Brandon
reviews.text: Belli has become our go-to neighborhood pizza spot. We ordered the Vodka Neapolitan pizza and the funghi pasta - since we‚Äôre vegetarians, they were nice enough to replace the meat ingredients with mushroom. The pizza was especially excellent and has great bang-for-your-buck. Francisco and Alejandro were our servers and they‚Äôre both awesome - you can tell they put a lot of thought and care into the food and experience.

reviews.author: Helen S
reviews.text:
We visited Belli Osteria on Sunday for brunch. We hadn‚Äôt booked but turned up at around 1pm and were the only people there (the place did start to fill up later). I decided to to the bottomless brunch offer and my partner ordered beers. The bottomless brunch is a great deal as the price, $39, includes any entree from the menu and drinks (which they are super quick to refill for you).

I ordered the smoked salmon Benedict and my partner went with our server recommendation of the burger (with the stracchino cheese). Food came quickly and we both really enjoyed our dishes. We also ordered the olive oil cake for dessert, which was probably the stand out of the meal.

All in all the total cost came to $120 (including tax and tip) which we thought was good value. Would definitely revisit (we live close by) and recommend if you are in the area and looking for a good value brunch spot.

reviews.author: Zoe
reviews.text:
We had such a wonderful experience at this hidden gem in the Greenwich Village / SoHo area. Having just returned from Japan, we were blown away by how authentic and delicious everything was. The atmosphere is cozy, charming, and genuinely Japanese ‚Äî it truly transports you.

What really stood out, beyond the incredible food, was how honest and reasonable the pricing is. In a neighborhood where most restaurants are constantly raising prices, this place feels refreshingly grounded. We later learned the owner is from Osaka and has been running this restaurant for nearly 30 years ‚Äî no wonder it feels so real.

We‚Äôll definitely be back regularly. This spot is seriously underrated and deserves much more recognition. A true gem! ‚ù§Ô∏è

reviews.author: Alberto dV
reviews.text: A classic in the Village. I used to come here almost 20 years ago, when I lived in the city, and I am happy to see that they keep the great attention and the old vibes. I especially like to sit in the backyard, that gives a sense of isolation from the city. Today I reencountered this favorite sushi place and everything is almost intact: the real japanese style and decoration, the quietness, the food and the attentive service. I hope I will keep coming in my next visita to the city.

reviews.author: Elizabeth T.
reviews.text: Walked in on a weekday for a post work dinner. I ordered the chirashi bowl and was pleasantly surprised with how much fit into this little bowl. The prices are about average for NYC, but the food is made well. The outside area is pretty cute too, but service was a bit limited out there.

reviews.author: Siena WD
reviews.text: Best sushi I've had in NY, which may not seem impressive given I haven't had much sushi here, but I've spent a life having a lot of great sushi in Seattle so my standards are high. I hadn't heard of this place, but we popped in for a late dinner.  Great space, very classy interior, just look at that picture, look how shiny and warm the wood looks. Anyway, I had some miso and split the Sushi & Sashimi for two with my dad. Not cheap, but well worth it for the quality, plus they don't skimp on the serving size. The fish was so good. Oh my god. The salmon?? The MACKEREL??? Probably added at least ten years to my life. Exceptional quality, the rolls too, all of it. All the staff were wonderful, they all said goodnight when we left. 10000/10. I'll be dreaming about it until I return.

reviews.author: solosian
reviews.text: Inexpensive sushi, and the lunch sets are nice. A cozy little spot by the park. The nigiri was very good but the rolls a bit too ricey for my taste. Cash only!

reviews.author: Linda Franzen
reviews.text: We had the prosciutto and burrata appetizer to start and then the Pepperoni Alla Diavola and the Tartufata pizzas. The pepperoni pizza was a little too heavy on the hot peppers, but otherwise everything was excellent, the crust is thin and crispy. We went on a Monday night so it was pretty slow, but staff was really nice.

reviews.author: Rachel Rodin
reviews.text: My family and I went here for some delicious pizza. The arancini were delicious! Really flavorful and a good portion to split amongst us. The drinks are also great, and they have an excellent selection of wine. Anything with the fior de latte cheese is actually amazing, so I definitely recommend any pizza with that.

reviews.author: Ben Vollmer
reviews.text: Great wood fires pizza, wings and salads. Loved the food and the atmosphere was great. They had some great Gluten Free options.

reviews.author: R F
reviews.text: Delicious food- came out really fast. The salad was great and so are their pizzas

reviews.author: Thomas Murtagh
reviews.text: Great neighborhood spot with good food. The French fries were top notch, solid chicken parm sandwich, and the coal oven pizza is solid

reviews.author: Grkgemini 94
reviews.text: Everything was delicious. The tomato soup with little baguette grilled cheeses was my personal fave. My only critique is they could easily halve the salt in everything. Even the salad was salty which I had hoped would be more of a refreshing break from all the savory.

reviews.author: Julie Tran
reviews.text: The food matches the service and for sure the food is stellar. Their cocktails are also perfect. I got their version of a whiskey sour, the Black Kettle Sour, which was so good I had to stop myself from chugging it.  Their French onion soup was stacked with melty cheese and onion. I ordered the beef bourguignon pot pie which was so tasty. I will say the onion soup filled me up quickly with all the cheese so I had to take my time with the beef. Dessert was the wonderfully light pear panna cotta with oat crumble. Others in my party had the pork, burger,  steak frites, and rigatoni plus souffl√© and doughnuts. No complaints anywhere. Is the price point higher than average neighboring places? Yes - but it‚Äôs a thousand times worth it. This is a must go for sure! The service was incredibly attentive. Water was always filled, table was kept clean, and the nicest people everywhere. I look forward to my next meal here!

reviews.author: Rivkah Weiss
reviews.text: Fantastic new restaurant in Bay Ridge. The service, food, and ambiance are all fantastic. They care about the details (cleaning the table in between courses). The concept of having the chef cook in the dining room is great. Joe was born to be a server - he goes above and beyond - his energy and friendliness make the experience at the corner even better. His food recommendations were perfect!

reviews.author: Fala Li
reviews.text:
I love the open kitchen concept and the way this place looks, but it is very noisy. I normally don't mind a little chatter here and there, but it was so loud that I was borderline screaming just to have a conversation with the person across of me. Also, the food was so salty that it was unbearable. (It's not about flavor, just the excessive salt!) We kept drinking one glass of water after another. We had high hopes, but unfortunately, we will not be visiting this cafe again.

The "Souffle" dessert was good, but it was more like a lava cake than a souffle.

reviews.author: Christine Fitzsimonds
reviews.text: The Corner is such a welcome addition to the neighborhood! Tommy‚Äôs food is next level ü§åüèº‚Äîthoughtful, flavorful, and just what you‚Äôre craving after a long week. Gabby took care of us and her service was exactly what you hope for: warm, attentive, and with just the right touch of conversation and great recommendations. She pointed us to the samosa empanadas, and they absolutely did not disappoint. We also had the peaches and burrata, the scallops, and the pork chop‚Äîwhich was to die for. Can‚Äôt wait to come back!

reviews.author: Iryna Glushchenko
reviews.text: We loved fried calamari, so we had to order it twice. Passion fruit mojito was absolutely delicious. Didn't like the guacamole at all, it had this aftertaste like from the store. I am not sure if it was fresh.  We felt like shrimp ceviche was not worth it, serving very little plus lots of avocado and tomato, really little shrimp. Love Ropa Vieja ,but was little salty. The pork was great. Service was good, no complaints here. Not sure if we come back, but this is my honest review.

reviews.author: Ivonne Mendez
reviews.text: Another's gem in Bayridge, food was excellent, service was great, definitely will come back again. The great thing is they have a variety of food, Puerto Rican, Mexican,... I should have take a poc to the menu, but it will for next time.

reviews.author: Jasae Rivera
reviews.text:
10 out of 10 highly recommend!!
The Food was Delicious very authentic!
Drinks were very good strong in a good way! Lol service was fast and friendly.
Beautiful atmosphere really captures the feel of puerto Rico.
I ordered the skirt steak with the mashed potatoes and chimichurri sauce on top
My partner ordered fried pork chop with arroz con gandules. Both very flavorful!

reviews.author: Kimberly Cordero
reviews.text:
‚ú®‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚ú®
If you haven‚Äôt been to Puertas Restaurant in Bay Ridge yet, you‚Äôre seriously missing out! The food was beyond amazing ‚Äî every bite packed with flavor ‚Äî and the drinks? Absolute perfection üçπüî• The vibes, the service, the presentation‚Ä¶ everything was on point. Definitely a new favorite spot! üíØ

reviews.author: Adriana Mitchell
reviews.text:
I love that this restaurant has live music
From when you enter the staff greet you  and welcomes your with a smile. The staff is super friendly. The food is amazing specially their arepa and the arroz chaufa.
The highlight of the evening is their bartender Jesus Gonzales new to the team who delights you with his well balanced cocktails .
Overall an amazing experience !
Will be returning üòä always make it a point to stop at puertas  for their excellence in service and their attention to their customer.
A big fan . Thanks Puertasü´∂

reviews.author: Daria Barashkina
reviews.text:
We love Meet Wise Meat ‚Äî we often come here for breakfast or lunch. The food is always delicious, fresh, and high quality.
Sometimes it gets a bit crowded and there are no available seats, but that‚Äôs pretty rare.
Ordering through the self-service kiosk is super convenient and saves time.
The staff is friendly, and the food is served quickly. The place is clean, cozy, and has a pleasant atmosphere.
A great spot for a quick bite or a relaxed meal with family. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Diinonn V Brooks
reviews.text:
Asian Fusion. Absolutely fantastic. The taste quality texture mixture of chicken with cabbage and the sauce gave it a lovely kick! Just right...
I would recommend this place instantly if your ever in the Sheepshead Bay.
Brighton Beach Ave
Brighton 1 place

reviews.author: Abanoub Boshra
reviews.text:
‚≠êÔ∏è ‚≠êÔ∏è

The staff here are really nice ‚Äî honestly some of the friendliest people I‚Äôve met in a restaurant. You can tell they‚Äôre working really hard and doing their best to keep up, and I really appreciated their good energy. I even had some nice conversations with them while waiting.

That being said, I did notice the service was very slow. I waited about 45-55 minutes just for my order to start, and overall it ended up being over an hour. The young lady working was juggling so much at once ‚Äî taking orders, running food, and even making drinks. It looked like way too much for one person to handle, and I felt bad because she really was trying her best.

As for the food, it wasn‚Äôt exactly my taste, but I know everyone has different preferences, so I‚Äôll leave that part up to others to judge.

Overall, I‚Äôm not upset ‚Äî I just wanted to share my honest feedback. From what I saw, this place could really shine if they had more help for the staff. The employees are wonderful, but they definitely need more support.

reviews.author: Emma Akopyan
reviews.text: I want to express my sincere appreciation for the excellent service! ‚ù§Ô∏èA special thanks to the manager young lady at the front desk who took my order ‚Äì she was very polite, attentive, and friendly.üôèüèªü•∞I would also like to highlight the whole team ‚Äì they work together seamlessly and professionally, creating a warm and welcoming atmosphere. The food and coffee were absolutely delicious ‚Äì everything was fresh, flavorful, and made with care.üòç I will definitely come back again and recommend this place to others! üåü‚ù§Ô∏èüòç

reviews.author: Nikolay Borovinskikh
reviews.text: The only question about the size of portion for the price, in general shawarma was good, but almost $20 for the king size which is looks like regular small and feels like 100gram of chicken? In my opinion it‚Äôs too much especially that right after I tried next place (Georgian place) and there is for the less price half of shawarma were like full here ü§£

reviews.author: Fio Loza
reviews.text:
Very good place, first time here, was a little bit concerned of being here as an afro-latina women (I was the only dark-skin person in the place) but I didn‚Äôt feel uncomfortable at all‚Ä¶ Food and service was delicious, live music show exceptional, so sad I couldn‚Äôt try the desserts because when I finally decided to, kitchen was already closed‚Ä¶

Thanks so much, I had an amazing time‚Ä¶ keep in mind the dress code, I wasn‚Äôt planning on going there, so I felt very underdressed, don‚Äôt forget to wear your most elegant outfit üëåüèΩüëåüèΩ

PS: highly recommend the octopus salad and the sesame tuna!

reviews.author: Amanda Strong
reviews.text: Food was good, a little overpriced + they added gratuity but I guess for the location that‚Äôs what it is.  The owner was friendly but the staff was uptight.  The ambience was great and the restaurant was beautifully decorated.

reviews.author: T B
reviews.text:
Beautiful venue, they have 2 floors & an outdoor terrace elevator with street exit, very popular place and pretty expensive.
Definitely book way in advance as they are often booked out, very popular with weddings and other big events.
First floor and a terrace are less formal, while 2nd floor is as formal as it gets.
Formal weddings & other big events are normally hosted on the 2nd floor.
However, you might be sharing a floor with other people & parties , unless you are ready to rent out the whole floor.
They have live music , dancing and live show ‚ÄúArabian nights‚Äù themed.
The food is mostly good, and beautifully presented.
I would highly recommend both lamb chops and all whole fish dishes, as well as combination seafood in white sauce, they are excellent.
During big celebrations we often ordered their signature dish, salmon baked in salt , the portion is pretty large, I would say enough for party of upto 20 persons. They make a whole show of serving it, chef comes to the floor, accompanied by fire, very presentable and fancy. It normally normally is served with side of rice.
All salads are excellent.
However, during our last visit, I had ordered filet mignon combo with lobster tail and cannot recommend it - a huge disappointment - I asked for filet medium rare and it arrived way overcooked, looking more like a beef stew and lobster tail hardly had any meat on it .
Service was good, a lot of waitstaff, everything arrived timely, especially considering that they were fully booked, having had about 8+ large parties going .
Their Napoleon dessert is delicious.

reviews.author: Marina Miller
reviews.text: We had our party here on Sunday and it was absolutely incredible! The manager, Gabriel, went above and beyond‚Äîhe called several times before the event to make sure every detail was planned and perfect, and he was there during the party to ensure everything ran smoothly. The food was outstanding; all of our guests kept raving about the variety and quality of the dishes. The music was young, fun, and lively‚Äînot your typical Russian restaurant vibe. The singers were energetic, fresh, and really kept the atmosphere upbeat. The service was top-notch from start to finish. I honestly can‚Äôt wait to plan more parties here!

reviews.author: Othman A
reviews.text:
An unforgettable experience at Baku!

We chose Baku in Brooklyn to host our wedding reception, and they absolutely exceeded every expectation. From the moment we walked in, the entire team went above and beyond to make our night special ‚Äî but Nick deserves a special shoutout.

Nick was truly a Godsend ‚Äî warm, professional, and incredibly accommodating. Every request we made was handled without hesitation. He made sure everything ran smoothly, and thanks to him, our evening felt effortless and magical.

The private dinner area was elegant, the live entertainment was outstanding, and the entire atmosphere made our night feel truly unforgettable. Baku didn‚Äôt just serve us dinner ‚Äî they gave us a memory we‚Äôll cherish forever.

If you‚Äôre looking for a restaurant that combines phenomenal service, delicious food, and genuine hospitality, look no further. Baku is where perfection lives.

reviews.author: S P
reviews.text:
Shoo Shoo is one of those spots where the vibe instantly pulls you in‚Äîlaid-back yet stylish, with such a warm, welcoming atmosphere that makes you want to linger. The energy of the place is just as memorable as the food, and together they create such a standout dining experience.

We started with the hummus, and it was absolutely outstanding‚Äîso fresh, silky smooth, and bursting with flavor. It paired beautifully with the warm bread and set the tone for the rest of the meal. The fries and sweet potato fries deserve a special mention too: perfectly crispy, piping hot, and honestly addictive. They‚Äôre the kind of sides you keep reaching for long after you‚Äôre full.

For mains, the lamb shawarma was excellent, with a distinctly gamey flavor that made it rich and satisfying without being overpowering. It felt authentic and hearty. But one of my favorite parts of the meal was the Israeli chopped salad on tahini. It was bright, refreshing, and balanced, with that creamy tahini base tying everything together beautifully. It was light yet flavorful, the kind of dish you could eat every day and never get tired of.

Everything about Shoo Shoo‚Äîfrom the fresh, flavorful food to the great ambiance and attentive service‚Äîmakes it a place I can‚Äôt wait to return to. It‚Äôs perfect whether you‚Äôre coming for a casual meal, a night out with friends, or just to enjoy really well-executed Mediterranean dishes in a space that feels good to be in.

reviews.author: Aparna Shankar
reviews.text: Excellent food and lots of vegetarian options. Loved the hummus, the eggplant dish, and the shakshuka. Cocktail was too sweet, would not recommend.

reviews.author: –î–∞—Ä–∏ –ë–∞–¥–º–∞–µ–≤–∞
reviews.text: I was with a friend a couple of weeks ago, I heard a lot of recommendations. The atmosphere, the service is very pleasant. We took tea with mint and schnitzel with french fries, as well as vegetables with zaatar. I expected more from the food, but in the end it was averagely good. The sauces were delicious, especially green, but the schnitzel itself is boring and the potatoes are not sluggish.

reviews.author: Marc Starvaggi
reviews.text: I've visited twice with my girlfried and I think this is one of my absolute favorite restaurants in the city. The chopped Osraeli salad is the best I have ever eaten. The schnitzel is as well. I have really enjoyed the shakshuka both times, especially the challah that comes with it. The knafeh is good too. Love the mint lemonade!

reviews.author: Maddy A
reviews.text: It‚Äôs fine - the food itself is quite good but we had a large party and were seated in the basement, which was giving cellar vibes. Did not like the ambience and would not come back here because of that. Service was good - servers were very friendly.

reviews.author: Megan Wilson
reviews.text: Wonderful food. The lamb manty had a very rich tasty filling that paired well with the fresh herbs and sour cream. The crispy fried eggplant was an unexpected delight. We opted for two of the most popular hand pulled noodle dishes, and both were excellent. I would recommend the lamb over the beef - but I am partial to lamb. The server was very friendly and helpful. Portions are huge, we had tons of leftovers to bring home!

reviews.author: David Asekoff
reviews.text:
Went to the 20th Avenue and 62nd street location of laghman express in Bensonhurst, Brooklyn nyc.

Written up by the ny times in 24 and 25 as one of the top nyc restaurants.

Central Asian cuisine: laghman, chechvera and compote. Phenomenal food. Indoor and outdoor seating. Great staff! 3% credit card fee

reviews.author: Junaid Ali
reviews.text: The food at this restaurant is nothing short of exceptional, boasting vibrant flavors and exquisite presentation. The service is equally impressive, with attentive staff who ensure a delightful dining experience. Additionally, the portions are generous, providing great value for reasonable prices. I truly have no complaints‚Äîthis place exceeds expectations in every way.

reviews.author: Fatema Poushi
reviews.text: Today we went there for dinner and the staff were really welcoming. They are really well behaved. And the food is soo good ! The portion is also very good. Definitely gonna visit again soon. No wonder why they have so many good reviews! Love love love. My 3 year old toddler loved their dumplings. ü§åüèª‚ù§Ô∏è

reviews.author: Janice C
reviews.text: I could eat this everyday, the fried manty are the ultimate comfort dish!! The dumplings were juicy and full of meat and the main courses were spiced to perfection. On top of the amazing food is the incredible staff and cozy environment. must try you won‚Äôt regret taking your friends here just to try out every appetizer.

reviews.author: Isabella White
reviews.text: We had such a wonderful dining experience at Cena Brooklyn! The food was absolutely delicious‚Äîevery dish was full of flavor and beautifully prepared. The atmosphere was warm and inviting, and the staff made sure we felt taken care of throughout the evening. A perfect spot for anyone looking for great food in Brooklyn. The music playing in the background was a welcomed addition.  We Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Juan Delacruz
reviews.text:
Arrived at 8pm, the waiter took our order at 830pm, we received food at 915pm on a lazy Wednesday evening with 4-5 couples seated in the restaurant. Wait staff was completely negligent. Couldn‚Äôt be bothered to do much. Food was bland, under seasoned and far from the quintessential flavors you come to expect from a Mexican restaurant, even if they‚Äôre going for a more modern take the flavors are just non existent. Add to this No salsa, no hot sauce, nothing of that nature to be found at a Mexican restaurant, just not good IMHO.
And I hate giving less than 5 star reviews, but you add the bad service on top of that and you just have a disappointing night out.

reviews.author: Chantelle Ray
reviews.text: Neighborhood gem! The sizzling fajitas were very fresh and tasty with a great portion size. We came here for brunch with my toddler and they were incredibly friendly and accommodating. Looking forward to coming back in the warmer months

reviews.author: Christine
reviews.text:
I really wanted to like this place, unfortunately found my dinner experience disappointing.

Service:
The service was incredibly slow and inattentive. They took forever to take our order and then brought out our entrees but forgot our drinks.

Food & drinks:
My $21 chicken quesadilla was a bit bland but greasy. My Paloma was good!

Atmosphere:
Tables were quite close together so it was hard to hear the person I was having dinner with. My clothes ended up smelling like food long after I left as well.

Overall, found it to be too expensive for what it was, especially for the area. $50 can get me a better experience elsewhere.

reviews.author: Paul
reviews.text: First of all, the food was not bad, but the service was atrocious.  We ordered two sodas and an appetizer and 20 minutes later the gal asked if we had ordered the appetizer‚Ä¶ we were the only party in the restaurant so who else ordered the appetizer and she never even brought our drinks.  Four people for breakfast with no alcohol was $130 before tip.  Like I said, the food was fine, not spectacular, but you could do better for half the price somewhere else.  And the female server definitely needs to find a new profession where personality is not a requirement.

reviews.author: Aixa Galarza
reviews.text:
‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è
Absolutely amazing experience at Giovanni‚Äôs Brooklyn Eats!

From the moment we walked in, the atmosphere was warm and welcoming the perfect blend of cozy and classic Brooklyn charm. The service was exceptional; everyone was friendly, attentive, and made us feel right at home.

The food? Incredible. Every dish was beautifully presented and full of flavor from the lobster pasta with fresh mussels to the pistachio cream puffs that were out of this world. We paired it with a lovely Montepulciano d‚ÄôAbruzzo Riserva that complemented the meal perfectly.

If you‚Äôre looking for a true hidden gem in Brooklyn with amazing food, amazing service, and a genuinely inviting vibe, Giovanni‚Äôs is the place to go. Can‚Äôt wait to come back!

reviews.author: Anna H
reviews.text: There is true hospitality here. Dino the don and Giovanni is the dad and they do everything right here: the food is quality ingredients and I say this because you can taste it. My montipulchiano wine and Sardinian wine were top tier like when I go back to Italy to visit my cousins. The frito misto was amazing. Light and tasty. Good mix. Actually outstanding just like the table salad. Best I ever had. The fried zucchini flowers were so yummy like zeppoli almost. The vegetarian lasagna was the best I ever had in a restaurant. Seriously. The pasta was homemade and every layer was separate and well executed. Good pesto. The housemade squid ink pasta ravioli stuffed with lobster outstanding. Thh lobster was fresh. The lemon cello cake was the best dessert of my year. Live music. Friday and sat. We heard a great New Orleans band and got to hear Giovanni singing. What a treat. Packed out the door with people.

reviews.author: Ana Myles
reviews.text: Wonderful gem in the neighborhood. We have been dining here consistently for over a year now, both the brunch and dinner are excellent. We especially love coming Friday nights for live music. They recently had a fantastic porterhouse special, cooked and sliced perfectly with pasta and wine, as well as a unique clam gnocchi which was a favorite of our group. What makes this place even better is Giovanni himself, who is always so warm and welcoming, and made the night for my parents who were visiting from out of town. They already want to come back next time. You may even catch him singing a song on Friday!

reviews.author: Alexa D
reviews.text: The best chicken parm. The Tuesday special is one that I‚Äôd come back to Brooklyn for. Incredible ambiance, the staff was great especially the sous servers cleaning up our plates shoutout to them for being so on top of it. Loved everything about this experience. If I‚Äôm ever back in town I‚Äôd love to bring a bigger group.

reviews.author: Alyssa Kabel
reviews.text:
We came in 10 minutes before the kitchen closed as a group of 8, a restaurant‚Äôs nightmare, but the staff was accommodating & great.

The food was delicious. Some had seafood but most of us had pasta & everyone was thrilled.

As a vegan, there were many options. I had the spaghetti ortolano without pecorino & loved it.

Next time I will try to homemade limoncello!

reviews.author: Derek Lao
reviews.text:
Food was excellent. It feels like the food is organically cooked, with good attention to detail, making for a very good presentation and experience.

I got the beef blood sausage, and DjonDjon paella. Blood sausage was nicely juicy and flavored, the tomatoes and sauce paired very nicely, adding a nice touch of acidity and sweetness. The DjonDjon paella is nice and satisfying. It is not boldly flavored, which meant I could eat a lot of it in one sitting without feeling overwhelmed.

The atmosphere is nice, like casual fine dining. I highly recommend giving this place a try, I will certainly be back.

reviews.author: Ruthy M
reviews.text: I came here for a family gathering. They accommodated all 30 of us. I know it was probably a little hectic, however everyone was very attentive. My server Moe was amazing. The food was served family style since it was a large group. Everything was really good, but my favorite dish was diri blan sos pwa, and the goat. The goat was so tender, the sos pwa had so much flavor. My experience was 10/10 & I do recommend!

reviews.author: Minora Barthelemy
reviews.text: As someone who loves Haitian food coming from Miami, Florida, my experience at Djon Djon was underwhelming. The service was fine, but the food was disappointing. The diri djon djon (black rice) lacked all kinds of flavor. The sauce and banann was meh. The griot wasn‚Äôt bad, but I would‚Äôve enjoyed it a lot more if the pikliz alongside it had any flavor. I can say the salmon was good. Overall I was disappointed with the lack of authentic Haitian flavors and would not return. Definitely not worth the price. üëéüèΩüëéüèΩ

reviews.author: Amarachi
reviews.text: I had an amazing time at Djondjon. My friends and I went here for dinner and we were impressed. The food was absolutely delicious. Our waitress, Julissa O, was outstanding. She constantly checked up on us, offered great recommendations, and was overall a vibe. I highly recommend this spot for delicious Haitian food.

reviews.author: Raquel Stjuste
reviews.text: Traveled from Jersey to try this restaurant and I must say it did not disappoint. Comfy, cozy, and stylish restaurant. The staff and services were excellent. The food and drinks was absolutely delicious 5 stars. I will definitely return and drag some friends ands family to experience this lovely Haitian restaurant.

reviews.author: Raymund Gotiangco
reviews.text:
My partner Tracy and I got to finally to try this spot in the area and I must say the food was impressive. I got the mixed grill plate and everything was absolutely cooked perfectly. It was flavorful and not dry. The hummus and tahini were amazing. I believe the owner Yadin (I hope, I didnt butcher the spelling) also gave us home made hot sauce and it was great. You can tell he takes great passion in what comes out of that kitchen.

I will say if you expect a quick bite or a grab and go then this is not the place. The food was made to order with great flavors and ingredients. Patience is a virtue with this spot but definitely worth it. Would easily recommend and come back. Glad to know this is in the area.

reviews.author: Beth Dacquisto
reviews.text: An amazing neighborhood spot that has life-changing hummus that puts all other hummus to shame. Delivery has always been accurate and on time without issues. I love their falafel, but the sides are so fresh as well - it tastes like actual REAL food and you can tell it was made with care and love. You can‚Äôt go wrong here!!

reviews.author: Kaddy Feast
reviews.text: If you live in this neighborhood I don't need to tell you... a Hidden Gem with spectacular food! Stellar service, so friendly! Top 5 of my best falafel in the WORLD! Must eat!

reviews.author: Paul Vassar
reviews.text:
Walked in and thought we were at the wrong place.

It‚Äôs a super small shop with an open kitchen.

Food was excellent, everything tasted incredibly fresh and you could tell it was being made right then and there from the salads to the meat.

Mon-Thur they also had a 20% off for dine in.

10/10 would go back for meat platter and salad

reviews.author: Tony Leon
reviews.text: Everything I've ever tried is great but the falafel sandwich + fries is unbelievable! Possibly the best falafel, ever. Also, definitely get the skhug sauce on the side. It's v hot and v tasty.

reviews.author: Rachael Martin
reviews.text: came here for my last dinner on my nyc trip and was very impressed. we dined on a monday and the restaurant was still quite busy and had a great ambience. the wine list is extensive and their chilled red is honestly one of the best that i have tried. we ordered arancini, the grape salad, tagliatelle, and radiatori. all were incredible, i especially loved the radiatori. the pasta tasted very fresh and the service was attentive. we also tried the date cake for dessert which was delicious. i wish we had somewhere like this in australia but i will definitely be returning on my next nyc trip.

reviews.author: cl√©mentine huertas
reviews.text:
Great food! We had the Arugula and radicchio salad, which paired perfectly with the Calabrian pinsa. We also tried the Medaglioni pasta with the butternut squash. We paired the food with the chilled red Trollinger. Yummy!!
For dessert we chose the date cake - I loved the contrast between the sweetness of the cake and the saltiness of the ice cream.
The atmosphere was very cosy with the dim lights - staff was kind and efficient. I would definitely go back!

reviews.author: Melissa C
reviews.text:
This place is amazing. For starters, my server Madi and the bartender Manu were great company. Manu played great music, made delicious drinks, and was a fun conversationalist. Madi showed me a bunch of great wines from across the world with super detailed flavor profiles, truly a fun wine-tasting experience. From Italy, to Slovenia, I tasted notes of strawberries, chocolate, raspberry and more.

She also made impeccable food suggestions and I was blown away by the focaccia, ravioli and arracinhi. We topped it off with a tiramisu.
Focaccia- crispy on the outside, soft, warm and buttery on the inside. The garlic and chili pepper paste to dip was a nice contrast to the usual olive oil at most spots.
Arracinhi- also very crispy. The star of the show here was the tomato sauce. Sweet and savory. Just straight up some great tomatoes.
Ravioli- Wow. Just WOW. A very happy marriage between lemon and creaminess. You would never guess it‚Äôs vegan. While it only came with 3 pieces, it was pretty filling. It also had these juicy mushrooms and sweet grape tomatoes that really added to the deliciousness.
Tiramisu- Delicious. Not too sweet, surprisingly a bit chocolatey. Great way to end the meal.

I don‚Äôt eat a lot of vegan food but after this meal I‚Äôd like to add some vegan spots to my rotation. Even my boyfriend, who said he didn‚Äôt want to eat vegan food, will most definitely be coming back. I would be more than happy to try the rest of the food, cocktails, and wines at this spot. Soda Club is my newest obsession and go-to elevated date spot. The vibe is homey, romantic, and intimate, while also being funky and innovative with their menu.

reviews.author: Lynette Kamimura
reviews.text: Delicious vegan Italian in NYC.  Great craft cocktail menu, nice pasta.  My only critique is that the Tagliatelle was a bit bitter, perhaps they got some lemon pith in there, but the Gigli and our starters were very good!

reviews.author: Justin McClelland
reviews.text:
I received a gift card for Christmas to Soda Club and finally got around to using it at the end of June. I hadn‚Äôt heard of this place, but I‚Äôm so glad I went! Truly, the other reviews are spot on - this place is a diamond in the rough when it comes to treating yourself to a nice vegan meal.

I was celebrating an anniversary on the night of the meal and the entire staff could not have been more kind and attentive. The staff went above and beyond to make the evening feel special, which is a rare find nowadays. The service was just‚Ä¶well, outstanding.

The vegan ricotta appetizer with bread and fresh tomatoes was my favorite of the couple we tried. As for the pasta, for me I really enjoyed the ravioli. The pasta is freshly made and you can definitely tell. I would definitely go back and would recommend anyone wanting a good meal with great service to enjoy their evening at Soda Club!

reviews.author: Ameya Bhakay
reviews.text:
Made dinner reservations and we got an amazing family style table in this really amazing, rustic looking, happy vibes place! Noise levels were on the higher end and you had to speak loudly to hear the other person across the table!

Jos√© our server was friendly, attentive, and quick with his service. This is a very kid friendly place - so highly recommended for families with kids. At the same time, a great place for date night too.

An extremely well priced menu, with great options is how I'd describe their menu. Our order consisted of Crostini Misti ($10.50), Calamari ($18), Funghi di Prato ($12.50) - an excellent mushroom salad, for appetizers.

Mains included a very tasty (and slightly cheesy) Spinach Gnocchi ($18.50), Penne Arrabiata ($16), and Tagliatelle al Ragu ($18). Kids thoroughly enjoyed their butter pasta which they polished within a few mins!

Overall, we had a great time at this place, and I can clearly see Malatesta become our go-to Italian dinner place on weekdays or weekends. Great service, excellent quality food, and a very well priced menu! Can't ask for more.

reviews.author: Adrienne Costello
reviews.text: This was our second time visiting Malatesta and it is still exceptional! Food is gourmet and delicious, service is friendly and attentive, and prices are reasonable. Our first time here was in 2021 - we spontaneously chose it for dinner as we were visiting the west village and got hungry while exploring. We had such a memorable experience that we made it a priority to come again in 2025 with our whole family. Same quality and service! We showed up at 5:20 on a Sunday with a party of 5 and got seated right away.  I‚Äôm both gluten intolerant and egg intolerant and found plenty of options in the menu with the guidance of our waiter. Each dish came out hot and everyone loved the culinary experience! (The grilled calamari appetizer is amazing!) Highly recommend Malatesta and can‚Äôt wait to come back again when we visit NYC!

reviews.author: Jelica A.
reviews.text:
If I could give 10* for this Restaurant, it would be great!
Very cozy and nice ambient, the staf is great, really friendly and helpful, and the food - top of the tops!
Everything what we ate was super delicious!
We had a reservation, so we didn't wait at all.
Overall, this Restaurant is really worth visiting!

reviews.author: Dionne Chen
reviews.text: Great cozy Italian place. Food is pretty good, not the best in NYC but very fair. The star is definitely coziness. Really like the vibe and it‚Äôs nice to sit outside as well. The portions are a bit small I will say.

reviews.author: Susan DeAngelus
reviews.text: We had our 2nd visit on Saturday evening and oh my word, molto bene!!! The ragu is worth the effort to get to this lovely space in the West Village. Prices and portions are perfetto! Grazie mille!!!

reviews.author: Max Feliu
reviews.text:
Meal was very lackluster, especially for the price charged. The salad (with figs and gorgonzola) was very underwhelming in its flavors. The anchovy dish in particular was extremely disappointing: untoasted, cold slices of average bread, with unmelted butter and the anchovy on top is simply not a pleasant mouthfeel and it fails to bring out the flavors of each of the ingredients. The cocktails had a very syrupy mouthfeel and overly sweet flavor that masked any notes of the liquors used. Perhaps we "ordered wrong" but for the price it seems unacceptable that there would be wrong dishes to order.

We had one of each pici and they were good, but not enough to turn the evening around. The space is very nice. The waiter was very friendly.

reviews.author: Brian P
reviews.text:
After walking through the streets of Brooklyn I wanted some authentic Italian food. This place came heavily recommended and I tell you what it did not disappoint. We got their kind of late however that did not matter at all they stayed open until we finished eating.
The service was out of this world he was incredibly knowledgeable and friendly and definitely helped set the mood for the night.
The menu was expansive but wasn't overwhelming and the food was definitely a delight.  I would definitely visit this place again next time I'm in town..

reviews.author: Eric Ambel
reviews.text: Locanda is the finest restaurant in Clinton Hill, Brooklyn. Terrific food, fantastic wines and a great staff in a hundred year old building that used to be a pharmacy. House made gelato too.

reviews.author: Sarah Myers
reviews.text: I got the truffle tagliatelle. While I was greeted with a lot of truffle on my plate, the taste itself was not anything special and I only was willing to spend the $35 because of the truffle. I've had better tagliatelle. The Gelato, however was absolutely amazing! My favorite was the olive oil and bread crumb and the Italian cream. The serve staff was incredibly hospitable prompt, jovial, and so friendly! I would come here again just not for the food. The restaurant is in a really nice part of Brooklyn too.

reviews.author: Mikayla Agrella
reviews.text: I love this spot. First and foremost, excellent wine list (by the bottle) and cocktails (Negronis and Amari-forward). Service is top-notch, vibe is right, food delish.

reviews.author: OmeKa
reviews.text: Tbh, Taste Korea is a total win! The food was incredible, especially the kimchi fried rice , and the staff made me feel right at home. Such a cozy spot for a solo meal. Definitely earned its five stars! Would highly recommend.

reviews.author: Taehyun Nam
reviews.text:
A hidden gem in the Brooklyn neighborhood. The place has dim lighting that creates a warm, comfortable mood.

The food was great. The soondae was fresh and surprisingly good, the jjajangmyun was impressive, and the budae-jjigae was tasty‚Äîall served in generous portions.

The staff were kind and easygoing. They even let us in about ten minutes before opening, which was a nice touch. There‚Äôs also a small, charming bar that adds to the cozy vibe.

It‚Äôs not a fancy spot, but definitely good enough to become a regular go-to.

reviews.author: Patrick No
reviews.text:
Solid Korean food in Bed Stuy / Clinton Hill. Likely one of the only options here as well.

The Hot Stone Bibimbap was great, especially w/ the added bulgogi. I enjoyed the rice crunch. The Mandu Guk was also good too, a familiar dish for most Koreans. I liked it better than some places in Flushing, where other restaurants add a lot of black pepper. This broth was great on a cold day. The Topokki was standard, they all taste quite similar.

Prices are a bit on the higher side, but the portions are quite large. I wouldn‚Äôt recommend getting a starter, we couldn‚Äôt finish all our food because we were so full. Good food !

reviews.author: Rj D
reviews.text: Best place with the best server. He truly deserve all the appreciation. We had an amazing party (30s the best) and everything was perfect (he are so honest with recommending food) We loved it. We‚Äôll definitely be back üëãüòä

reviews.author: John Chen
reviews.text:
Way better than expected.

I'm a NY native and I've tried a lot of Korean food before. I have Cho Dang Gol almost once a month. I've tried Jungsik, Kisa, Tosokchon, Miss Korea, Kunjip, Olle, Her Name is Han etc...

I went to Korea 3 times this year, for a total of 3 months in Seoul, Daegu, Busan, Jeju, Gyeongju, so at this point I feel like I can say you can trust my opinion on Korean cuisine at least a little bit.

And what I think is, honestly, this may be the best Korean food in Brooklyn, and second best in the whole city only beaten by Chodanggol, which is saying a lot.

The food tastes nice and clean, showing that the cooking was done with care and good technique. The flavors actually reminded me of the same dishes from popular local restaurants in Seoul.

I would recommend the
- Hot Stone Bibimbap (Bulgogi)
- Sundubu Stew (Pork)

I also think eating in would be far better than takeout just so your food can be eaten at the ideal temperature and texture.

Definitely should give it a try!

reviews.author: James B
reviews.text:
Mike‚Äôs is our go-to breakfast whilst we‚Äôre staying near Fort Greene. You absolutely have to go here.

It‚Äôs a truly classic diner with great food Nd a really warm, buzzy atmosphere. To top it all off, the service is exceptional!

They were really helpful with allergens too. No dairy, no problem.

reviews.author: T. M
reviews.text: Loved this place so much. Super friendly, fast service, tasty food for a good price. Only visiting but came back twice in 2 days!

reviews.author: Tchanavia Bryant
reviews.text:
Great local diner! The staff was very friendly. I was in NYC for a few days and ate breakfast here twice. The portions were a good size and the food came out piping hot. I‚Äôm from the south so I wasn‚Äôt sure about how the grits would come out. Overall, not bad for NYC. They were a little watery for my taste, but again not bad.

They had counter seating if you are rolling solo. Space is a bit tight, but manageable. I went around 9am and had at most a 10 minute wait the first time and no wait the second time.

I would definitely go back again for breakfast.

reviews.author: Elijah Bader
reviews.text: Stopped by Mike‚Äôs Cafe on a Sunday morning and really enjoyed it. It‚Äôs a laid-back, classic New York spot with friendly service and a steady stream of regulars. I got two eggs, toast, bacon, and homefries, everything was really good, though the homefries could‚Äôve been a bit crispier. It was super busy, which makes sense for the weekend, and while we had to sit outside, I was glad we found a table. Would definitely go back.

reviews.author: arthur king
reviews.text: passed by this place a couple times decided to go in,and boy i wasn‚Äôt disappointed,service is great ,nice and comfortable and food is delicious

reviews.author: Isabella Ton
reviews.text: Vegan options! Loved this place, the staff is so friendly. We got the edamame, fried brussel sprouts, impossible bun and the spicy creamy yasai ramen which the broth and noodles were üî•. Got spicy for the ramen and it was so yummy. Definitely try this spot!

reviews.author: Zhiyu Wang
reviews.text: We took kids here for dinner after a long day out, and it was such a great experience! The host was incredibly kind and welcoming, which made us feel right at home. The kids especially loved the buns and edamame ‚Äî they couldn‚Äôt stop eating! The ramen was also fantastic ‚Äî rich, flavorful broth and perfectly cooked noodles. Definitely a spot we‚Äôll be coming back to!

reviews.author: Aleksei Samoilov
reviews.text: I‚Äôve been to Toyo Ramen several times now, and it‚Äôs consistently great. The service is always fast, the staff are friendly, and the food comes out hot and delicious every single time. The broth is rich, the toppings are super flavorful, and the whole place has a cozy, welcoming vibe. Definitely one of my favorite ramen spots in the neighborhood.

reviews.author: Maria Romanov
reviews.text: Tried this ramen spot for the first time and it was absolutely amazing! The broth was rich and flavorful, the noodles perfectly chewy, and every bite felt like comfort in a bowl. Our waiter was super patient with us while we decided what to order, which made the whole experience even better. Plus, they have this awesome deal ‚Äî write a Google review and get any drink of your choice on the house! Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Bernard Wiggins
reviews.text:
I‚Äôve just finished eating here today. I was in the neighborhood and had a want for ramen and was surprised I‚Äôve not been to this place as I‚Äôm familiar with some of the other Ramen shops in the area.

I have to say this was a pleasant experience at this particular ramen spot.

I will say the only downside isla that the pork was very few considering that some of the other places are a little more generous with pork for what you‚Äôre paying.

However, the atmosphere for the most part is very inviting and calm which is very different from other places that seem busy and super loud.

I also do appreciate that they do not give me the bums rush and they let me sit and relax after eating their good food and was even attentive to my want of water and refills.

I didn‚Äôt eat their good food brown shredded stuff that was in the ramen as it is my first time trying it and my stomach wasn‚Äôt comfortable with it (Google just showed me that this stuff is called Wood ear mushrooms. Definitely not for me. I‚Äôll ask them to leave it out next time).

I definitely recommend this place if you‚Äôre in town or just wanting a different atmosphere to relax and eat.

UPDATE: I am not a fan of bubble tea. However I tried this Milk Green Tea they shared with me and I have to say it‚Äôs quite delicious! I actually like it more without the bubbles! I know that sounds weird, but I‚Äôm very simplistic when it comes to food and sometimes simple is best! You should definitely try this drink!

reviews.author: ReedH
reviews.text: ‚Äôm from Texas, so I was curious to see how their chicken fried steak stacked up. And it‚Äôs legit. Crispy, well-seasoned, topped with great cream gravy, and served with a solid side of mashed potatoes‚Äîit‚Äôs a serious meal. I finished with the pecan pie. Not my favorite - the crust didn‚Äôt have much flakiness, but it was still decent. The overall vibe was great though, and the service was really friendly. I‚Äôll be back.

reviews.author: David Joseph
reviews.text:
For this review, I came here on a nice weather Sunday in late August for brunch. I‚Äôve been here many times before and I absolutely love the place. The atmosphere is so fun. I‚Äôm originally from Texas and even though I‚Äôve been gone from Texas for over a decade, it still gives me a lot of nostalgia vibes.

Most times I‚Äôve come here, I‚Äôve made a reservation but it usually seems like walk-ins are available. I don‚Äôt believe they take reservations online, but you can make one over the phone.

As far as food, the queso and chips are so great and feels like TexMex quality. This is not a TexMex restaurant, to be clear, but it seems like standard Texas restaurant that offers a combination of Tex Mex and southern cuisine. Think of it as quirkier Willie‚Äôs Ice House. I also love the frito pie and the quesadillas. The frozen margaritas are some of the best in the city because they have a margarita machine whereas many places try to make them in a blender.

Sometimes certain servers can be a little cold or aloof, but generally they always get you what you need. I look forward to coming to this restaurant all the time and recommend it frequently, especially for groups.

reviews.author: Amanda Reagan
reviews.text: We loved it here. The vibe was so great and the decor was quirky and fun. Awesome bartenders and the drinks were delicious!

reviews.author: V Morton
reviews.text:
The service and Atmosphere was welcoming and Grand. It was Halloween and the decorations were up and exciting. Our waitress was very polite and had great recommendations. I really wish I went with the country fried streak, mashed potatoes and gravy.  It looked good from across the room!!!

Thanks for having us!

reviews.author: Allison L.
reviews.text: This is such a fun, southwestern-themed restaurant! I loved the style and flair in every direction and the food was fantastic too! There are great soul food options, lots of vegetarian and classics. I loved the catfish which comes either grilled, blackened or fried. Lots of people got the chili and ribs, also great cornbread! Would recommend the prickly pear margarita which you can also get frozen! This is great for a post-work outing or night out, highly recommend!

reviews.author: Ankush Thakur
reviews.text:
We started with the pretzel with the beer cheese. Personally not much of a fan of it but it wasn't bad.
Rib were pretty good when you had it with the mustard. Without the mustard they were alright.
Hungarian schnitzel - the pork was crispy and tasty. We did not like the pasta thing it came with however.
Warm apply strudel with Ice cream was good.
Service, vibe and cleanliness was ok point.

reviews.author: Lee Stat
reviews.text: The service was great. Very welcoming. Go for a burger and beer alone or with friends and it won‚Äôt disappoint. Food was good too. The pretzel was good but it was cooked twice because it got really hard too fast.

reviews.author: Mo Chai
reviews.text: Pretzel was top tier. Would say everything else was just okay. Ginger ale tasted off

reviews.author: Carina G
reviews.text: I have nothing but good things to say about the food, staff, and owner here at Manner. I have been coming here since I can remember and have always had the best of times. I've had so many meals here, from my communion to graduation parties to even just Friday meals with my family. Nothing but love for the Manor Community! If you are in the area, I totally recommend checking it out. My go-to recommendations are always the wings and bacon for appetizers.

reviews.author: K VC
reviews.text:
My large group was seated in a separate area, though not very private, and was tight bec not enough space for the number of people reserved for.
Found the meat dry in the schnitzels and pork chop dishes. Didn't really like the pork chop flavor. Apps and sides were just ok.

reviews.author: Charoy Thurston
reviews.text: This place felt like we were dining in a museum. The atmosphere was beautiful, like a modern-ancient rendition of an Asian art house. We dined over the lobster tacos, the "Out of Control" roll, Sweetheart roll, Smoked salmon sushi (amazing!), the Kani and Tuna hand rolls, and shrimp dumplings.  We will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Ann Su√°rez
reviews.text:
Second time at MoCa and it's always a pleasure. Our server was very nice and suggested great dishes.
Went with a party of 4 for a birthday and even got free shots.
The food was amazing, we ordered multiple appetizers and 1 entree that was shared which was the crispy duck, definitely good, just wish it was more fulfilling.
Definitely check out the bar appetizers even if you're not at the bar, they are worth it.
I personally love the atmosphere and the semiprivate booths, wonderful for a small party of 4-5 people.
It's definitely a bit expensive, some dishes and drinks are above the average price so keep that in mind, but for special occasions it might be the best Asian fusion option in forest hills.

reviews.author: shineden
reviews.text: The overall experience at was very pleasant and wonderful. The staff was nice and the food I had was delicious. The sangria duck is the best I ever had. The sake paired nicely with my meal. I had a lovely time and it's worth going back.

reviews.author: Craig Pelletier
reviews.text: Took my mother here for her first experience. She was positively raving about the shrimp dumplings. My wife and I have always enjoyed dining here. It's upscale. You should dress accordingly (optional, of course, but in my opinion, helps set the mood for you).  Well worth the trip down Austin st. (Or one of their other locations)

reviews.author: Bald-kugo
reviews.text: Very wonderful experience! Ordering was very easy and there were so many great options to choose from. We had a pescatarian dining with us at the time and our server helped pick out good tasting fish options and even substituted other things in the bento boxes for them. Speaking of the bento boxes, the presentation of the 4 ordered were so well done, and it was pleasing to both the eyes and the stomach. So delicious! Even the miso soup was great. We ordered something for takeout as well and it came nicely packed and very quick. The place itself is very comfortable to be in with a little chill now and then from the door but lights and even the cupboards looks very stylish. Everything was so clean and put together, and even the way they handled the plates made me feel safer about eating raw fish since it seemed so tidy. The only issue I had was that the ginger ale seemed to be watered down which was a bit strange, but it might have just been the ice

reviews.author: Yolanda M
reviews.text: I have passed this place a few times and actually planned for this visit with a group from work for lunch. The waiter was excellent. He was patient when taking orders for a table of 7 with three checks. We ordered from the $20 lunch menu which was a pretty good value with a starter and meal. Portion was good for lunch. I actually had enough to take for later. The only thing none of us liked was the steak on the menu was an additional $10 which we felt shouldn't be an option if not in the $20 price point for the options. I had the chicken pasta with pesto sauce which was tasty. We sat outside and the water assisted us with the table placement so we could all sit together. The chairs weren't all that comfortable but it was nice being outside. I would return if in the area again.

reviews.author: Barbara Milano
reviews.text: The food was excellent.  Very fresh. The veggie frittata had a unique variety of fresh vegetables and was cooked to perfection. The waiter was very attentive and we never had to wait for anything. We were so lucky because it was a perfect day so we got to enjoy our meal outside.  It was truly delightful dining experience!‚ù§Ô∏è

reviews.author: alexandra levdar
reviews.text:
I placed an order today and unfortunately received completely wrong items. I ordered pesto pasta with shrimp, burrata, Greek salad, and steak tips, but got pasta with beef and other dish I never requested.
When I called the restaurant to let them know, the person who said he was the manager insisted with strong attitude everything was correct, refused to look at a photo, hung up on me multiple times, and wouldn‚Äôt give his name.
The lack of professionalism and customer service was very disappointing. For the sake of your nerves, I wouldn‚Äôt recommend ordering from here.

reviews.author: Michael Grieco
reviews.text: Came here for dinner with a friend on their recommendation.   All food we ordered was good, I personally thought the burrata appetizer was delicious.   The crab cake was tasty, and it is mostly crab (which was excellent), but I felt for the price of $24 it was a bit small for that price.  Both my friend and I ordered steaks, her's was a touch over cooked as she wanted rare, mine was well cooked as I asked for medium-rare.  I really enjoyed the overall ambiance of the restaurant.  We opted for the outdoor seating as it was a gorgeous, cool summer evening.  I'd recommend this as a solid place to take a date as the establishment was great for having conversation, wasn't too loud at all.

reviews.author: Blake Tyler
reviews.text: The service was really good and atmosphere is great. Place is beautiful and plenty of space. We had the tuna tartar and calamari. Both were great especially the calamari with the spicy kick. For dinner my wife had the half chicken that she says was really good. I had the ribeye, I did not like the steak. Meats was meh and char wasn't good. More medium than medium rare and extra fatty.

reviews.author: Stephanie Jenson
reviews.text:
I hadn‚Äôt been in New York in 10 plus years but this neighborhood restaurant on election night made me feel like a real New Yorker. This is clearly a local favorite from the conversations we had with our neighboring tables but this was all destination dining for me and my best friend, Linette.

Linette and I celebrated 35 plus years of friendship and are both originally from D.C.
I live in New Zealand now and booked a hotel in Brooklyn specifically near Gertrude‚Äôs as I follow the chef Eli Sussman @gertrudesnyc - Partner/Exec Chef @talkininthewalkin on social media and was keen to try Gertrude‚Äôs with high expectations.

This election night  was magical  with the city feeling upbeat and positively giddy. I had told Gertrude‚Äôs it was our Frienniversery of 35 years and Allie the bartender greeted us with vodka beet juice shots that got the party started! Great introduction to Gertrude‚Äôs! Scott was our server with Lisa the floor manager stepping in at times to serve or check on us. Jacob and Reni were other servers that night on the floor.

The service was impeccable. Professional, of the highest standards, while warm and intimate. It‚Äôs an absolute pleasure when the service matches the excellence of the meal.

Gertrude‚Äôs was  outstanding Jewish Soul food, elevated comfort food to gladden the heart. We started with Challah Park rolls,Latkes with Cr√®me Fra√Æche & Trout Roe and Beef Tongue Tartine. We were treated to Whitefiish & chips and housemade Spaetzle,  complimented from Gertrude‚Äôs. Everything was presented well: correct temperature, lovely plating. and delicious flavors. Ingredients balanced and complemented each other.

Linette & I both had the 10oz Bavette Steak with sherry bordelaise, pickled shallot medium rare ( the best way!). The meat was beautifully marbled and perfect cooked. There was a choice of fries or salad greens. We chose fries.
Wonderful curated wine list to match and excellent recommendations from Lisa!

To finish, we had the Black & White ‚ÄòSeven Layer Cake‚Äô. My mom use to make us a chocolate layered cake with Sarah Lee pound cake (when guests over!) and it reminded me of being around the kitchen table with family and friends.
A truly memorable dining out experience and evening that puts us in a New York State of Mind! A must experience in Brooklyn, New York.

reviews.author: Mariya Proyss
reviews.text: Gertrude‚Äôs is the kind of place that quietly wins you over from the moment you walk in, it‚Äôs cozy, elegant, and effortlessly welcoming. The space has that signature Brooklyn charm: lively but relaxed, with a sense of care in every detail. The menu strikes a beautiful balance between comfort and sophistication, fresh, seasonal dishes that feel both homey and refined. Service is warm without being overbearing, making the visit feel personal. Gertrude‚Äôs is where you go when you want a meal that feels special, but never pretentious, a true neighborhood gem. Travelled all the way from LES!

reviews.author: Adam
reviews.text: Came here Friday night with a bunch of friends and it was really great. We got oysters and a whole platter of different smoked fish and all sorts of stuff and it was just really an amazing way to spend happy hour right before dinner. The food was great. The service was great. The drinks were awesome and I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for some great drinks and great bites in Brooklyn.

reviews.author: Dilan A
reviews.text: We had one of the best dinners ever at this restaurant, thanks to the exceptional bartenders Allie and Karla. Their recommendations for both food and drinks were spot-on. I can‚Äôt wait to return and explore more of their drinks and food! (The layer cake was INSANE)

reviews.author: Ryan Tammaro
reviews.text: Great spot in Prospect Heights with a cozy atmosphere! The burger was juicy, and the latkes were crisp. I also enjoyed the Black & White Seven layer cake which was rich without being too heavy.

reviews.author: Ari Grabova
reviews.text: We had an amazing dining experience at Ortomare Ristorante Pizzeria. When me made the reservation over the phone, the service was exceptional, with friendly and attentive staff making us feel welcome. The atmosphere was warm and inviting, creating the perfect setting for a relaxed evening. As for the food, it was absolutely delicious. Each dish was beautifully prepared and full of flavor. Overall, it was a fantastic experience, and we will definitely be returning!

reviews.author: Jairo Melara
reviews.text:
Food was great. Got the tortelloni, rigatoni, and the baked eggplant. Delicious.
The vibe was romantic, dim, and action packed if you sit next to the pizza maker.
The service was lackluster. The server seemed like he didn‚Äôt want to seat us because we were dressed too casual. We waited 20 minutes for menus and then just pulled it up from Google photos. Once he noticed we were looking at the menu online, he rushed over with paper menus and rushed us to order. The server had also just smoked a terrible cigarette so you imagine the smell.

reviews.author: Jay A.
reviews.text: Visiting from Texas and WOW, what a find. I was craving a ribeye and this was the best I have ever had. Octopus was grilled to perfection, calamari and marinara was spot on. Atmosphere was cozy and romantic. Staff was very polite. We even got a limoncello on the house. New go to when we come back to NYC. Best news, they are expanding to Austin. Highly recommend and regret we didn't take pictures.

reviews.author: A.L. Harris
reviews.text: Still my favorite family owned Italian restaurant.  Good is excellent here.  Wood fire pizza and delicious classic Italian dishes.  Meatballs are just like nonna makes.  Great attentive service. Gets crowded so make sure you have a reservation.  It‚Äôs worth the trip uptown for some great food.

reviews.author: Rhona Kummerer
reviews.text: The staff are super nice and I felt really welcomed, the price for food is a little expensive, but it was yum!

reviews.author: Kahshanna Evans
reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed delicious catering from Miss Mamie's Spoonbread Too for a the launch of a new perfume. Little did we know we were in for such a surprise to actually meet the iconic former fashion model Norma Jean Darden, known for her role in "The Battle of Versailles" battle between French and American fashion designers, and subsequent documentary and book prior to founding her restaurant, Miss Mamie‚Äôs Spoonbread Too, which catered our event. What really helped our team was the helpful thoughtful discussion we had prior to the event, to be sure our selection would delight guests. The catfish bites, jerk wingettes, deviled eggs, fruit kebobs, and brownies were perfect and delivered with care.

reviews.author: Mikael Mihranian
reviews.text: This place just tastes like a home away from home. Mamas love in every bite. I suggest the sampler for a unique flavor profile of all flavors you can get. Audible sounds of flavor from my friends as we ate. A special place with romantic New York charm

reviews.author: Edward Kroll
reviews.text:
I truly enjoyed the experience I had at Spoonbread! The ice tea was delicious (per the menu!). I was in love with the cornbread hash and candid yams, a surprise treat and flavor that was new and exciting. I had the platter to sample a few sides and the shrimp, ribs and chicken (üôåüôå - pictured below).

The waiter was helpful and appreciate their willingness to let us stay a little late to get a few sides and dessert to go!  Also, I thought it was very cute that the staff sang happy birthday to some other guests that were having dinner next to our table.

reviews.author: Judith Vasquez
reviews.text: I discovered a gem here and will become a frequent customer. The workers all displayed friendly attitudes. The meal options, affordable costs and excellent service create a positive experience. The food had just-made quality and excellent flavor. People speak truth about Miss Mamie's Spoonbread Too - it's genuinely excellent.

reviews.author: Amanda *****
reviews.text:
The experience was super good, and the food was super taste.  The owner was so sweet to greet our table and check in on us.  Thank you for such an awesome experience.

Miss Mamie's Spoonbread Sampler with three veggies (spinach, cabbage, and potatoe salad).  Fish sandwich with French fries.  Peach cobbler with vanilla ice cream.

reviews.author: Natalie Veronica
reviews.text: If you‚Äôre from Indonesia, this place will feel pretty ordinary, nothing special. Honestly, it‚Äôs not worth joining the day tour; it‚Äôs a waste of time and money. We booked it through Klook. The vibe feels just like back home in Indonesia, and there‚Äôs really nothing much to see, just a small river. The kayak trip only takes about 15 minutes before you turn back.

reviews.author: Sreejesh Nataraj
reviews.text: Journeying through the narrow Mekong waterways provides a unique and genuine window into a rich riverine culture moulded  by natural elements, time-honored customs, and close-knit community ties.

reviews.author: Su Su
reviews.text: Mekong River at Luang Prabang. Stunning at sunset. There is a lot of rubbish on the riverbank though unfortunately

reviews.author: Shatz13 S
reviews.text: knock it out of the park#  the best expericed in 2 days and. 1. Night# gaining insight into the daily lives of the people along the river# simple life. #must. Try

reviews.author: Siddhartha Agrawal
reviews.text: Mekong Delta tour was one of the most captivating tour of my Vietnam trip. The boat trip was awesome. We also went to a village where we tried local honey and tea. It was very tasty and we end up buying Honey. Local food was also good and there was live Vietnamese music too. We also saw the coconut candy making process.
