The tour ended with an awesome boat ride in the delta along the mangrove trees.

reviews.author: Caleb Ju
reviews.text: This might be one of my favorite Chinese restaurants. Reservations at 6:30 on a Sunday, although plenty of seating thanks to massive space. Food was great. Our selection was on the spicier end (mung bean noodle with chili sauce, dry pot), but the chefs did an excellent job balancing spice with texture with other flavors. Service was one of the best (cleaned out oily plates, asked when we want our food to come out). And ambience is also elegant. Will come again!

reviews.author: Julie Wiggers
reviews.text:
This was recommended by a security guard outside the Metropolitan Museum of Art who said it‚Äôs the best in the city.

We ordered spicy garlic sauce chicken and braised beef noodle soup. This was faster than fast food!! It was hot and delicious with tender-crisp veggies, perfect noodles and meats.

Great value, attentive wait staff, excellent food.

reviews.author: liat amano
reviews.text:
The atmosphere was nice, we walked in and immediately got a table, the service was very quick and nice.
We got iced tap water and a tea pot for the table which was very nice and all of the dishes came very quickly
Me and my roommate got the dumplings in chili oil, the Dan Dan noodles and for entrees the garlic sauce style with pressed tofu
The only complaint is that the Dan Dan noodles weren‚Äôt as spicy as we expected (actually the entree was more spicy and it was supposed to be the opposite)
We also got two cocktails that were very tasty
The total was 81$ without a tip and with a lot of leftovers to take home
Overall a great experience!

reviews.author: Bleesy Dy
reviews.text: We love this spot! Ain‚Äôt go wrong with Chinese food! We went on a weekday so it was not that crowded but we had early dinner, and the restaurant wasn‚Äôt that crowded but as soon 6pm hits, the place got packed. We had reservation. But no need if you are planning to visit not on a rush hour. I love how generous the servings were! Cumin Fries is a must try, not the usual fries you would usually have. We ordered fried dumplings too. General Tso‚Äôs chicken was good too! And eggplant stir fried would always be the best. When the place started to get packed, the servers were not enough to cover all tables. Good ambiance too.

reviews.author: A.L. Harris
reviews.text: I always love the food here.  Take-out is always good and when you eat in it‚Äôs such nice experience.  Service is always good, whether you come for the lunch special  Monday - Friday from 11-3, or Happy Hour at the bar from 4-7, or sit down in the beautiful main dining room. Won ton soup is excellent and the Garlic style chicken has such an amazing flavor.  What ever you order you can‚Äôt go wrong.

reviews.author: Ana Turkienicz
reviews.text: We came to celebrate my birthday. From the moment we came in, we were greeted with a gracious smile and happy birthday wishes. Our table was waiting for us, and we started with great cocktails, the eggplant and Haloumi salad , which were both delicious. Our party of four shared the lamb kebab and the shish kabab, also to die for. We were surprised to learn that the restaurant didn‚Äôt charge us for our dessert, the vanilla- kadaif (also delicious)- as a treat for my birthday- which was of course truly appreciated. This is our second time celebrating at Miriam UWS and we will certainly come back soon!

reviews.author: Tiaranad Gerjarusak
reviews.text: I went in without the reservation on Saturday lunch. They managed to sit me at the counter bar. The brunch menu looks really good unfortunately I already had breakfast. So my husband ordered Chicken schnitzel which came with mash potatoes, beets sauce, chop cucumbers, onion, avocado and tomatoes. The chicken was don perfectly, crispy and moist. I had Kofta Kebab which is meatballs with humus, vegetable, and pita bread. There are still a lot of things on menu that I want to try. The service at the bar was pretty good, the bartender was very pleasant. The ambiance is airy with interesting art pieces displayed.

reviews.author: Zhenya Globazh
reviews.text:
Extremely Disappointed ‚Äì Served Raw Chicken and No Real Apology!

We‚Äôve been to this restaurant several times before and always enjoyed it ‚Äî great food, atmosphere, and friendly staff. Unfortunately, our last visit completely changed our impression.

I was served raw chicken, which is not just unappetizing but a serious health risk. Our waiter agreed it was unacceptable and offered to replace the dish, which we appreciated. However, when the bill arrived, the replacement meal was still charged, and nobody apologized or made any gesture to acknowledge how serious the situation was.

Serving undercooked chicken is a major food safety issue, and the complete lack of accountability was shocking. I genuinely hope the management takes this seriously ‚Äî this kind of incident simply shouldn‚Äôt happen in any restaurant.

reviews.author: Donovan Moffre
reviews.text:
Without a doubt the greatest brunch I‚Äôve ever had. Menu items were simple but incredibly flavorful, the sauces that were served alongside them were the stars of the show.

We LOVED the pickles, too!

We will absolutely be returning.

reviews.author: Jacqueline Kloos
reviews.text:
ADDENDUM: The general manager at Miriam reached out in response to our feedback, apologized, and offered to replace the ruined clothing. We are truly grateful for her customer service! Will be increasing our rating from 1 to 3 stars to average our initial experience and the steps taken to rectify it.

Original review below:

We dined at Miriam this evening. The food was good, the patio atmosphere was pleasant. Unfortunately at the end of the meal, the staff member cleaning the dishes off the table accidentally toppled the dishes onto my partner, spilling on his shirt and pants. Both are ruined. Initially, we were told his meal would be comped. I expressed some dissatisfaction with this (his shirt and pants cost more than a burger) and they then agreed to comp the whole bill (there were three of us dining). This was a step in the right direction, but it took about 15 minutes for this to be offered after the incident. No manager ever came to speak with us/apologize. I think the proper way for the restaurant to handle the situation would have been for the manager to come out immediately and ask (and then cover) the price of the outfit. While I appreciate the offer to cover the table‚Äôs bill, the outfit still costs much more than our total, and it was naturally a major inconvenience. While I don‚Äôt blame the staff member for the accident - things happen! - I do think the restaurant should have handled the aftermath better.

reviews.author: Ari Perkins
reviews.text: Was surprised how good the food is here. Had the whole dorade and just as good as anywhere in Greece. The trio of dips and hamachi was excellent as well. Service and atmosphere matched. Will repeat

reviews.author: Christopher Yandell
reviews.text: Very elegant vibes at this place. We got three spreads, the almond-garlic was my favorite, and the pepper-feta was good as well. The moussaka was delicious ‚Äî very rich and the portions were generous.

reviews.author: Andrew Hazelrigg
reviews.text: This restaurant is so delicious. The feta red chili pepper spread was our favorite. Also the lamb chops were great along with the cucumber chips. The only dessert we liked was the chocolate mouse thing. The cheesecake is too light. The baklava was too dry.

reviews.author: Ameya Bhakay
reviews.text:
Absolute fab experience. Reservations recommended on weekends, plenty of seating outdoors and indoors with a spacious basement perfect for family seating.

Vegetarians also have plenty of options which was surprising!

What to order: Tasting of 5 Spreads ($32) - Skordalia stands out, Grilled Halloumi ($18), Gigantes ($16), Asparagus ($12) - all cooked to perfection!

Non Vegetarians won't go wrong with Lamb Chops ($55) or Grilled Shrimp ($25).

Service was absolutely fantastic but our server Arthur was friendly and attentive. Very welcoming and friendly staff.

We will be visiting again with friends and family!

reviews.author: Carlos Hernandez De Pena
reviews.text: Thank you guys! You made our wedding the happiest day of our lives. Everything was flawless. Andrew was integral in creating this special day, and the staff were so efficient at helping everyone with all of their needs. The food was perfect, the celebration was perfect, everything went perfect.

reviews.author: H J
reviews.text: I went there on a Friday night and was able to snag a last-minute reservation for early dinner. As always, their pizza didn‚Äôt disappoint. The classic Margherita is my favorite. I also tried the octopus salad, which was good, but I‚Äôm not sure it‚Äôs worth the price.

reviews.author: Rus
reviews.text:
I‚Äôve been a loyal customer of Motorino Pizza in the East Village for years. I used to love their clam pizza and always brought friends here. But after my recent experience, I won‚Äôt be coming back.

While eating the clam pizza, I bit into several hard, sharp pieces of clam shell baked right into the slice. It was painful and dangerous ‚Äî I nearly cracked a tooth. For a place that prides itself on quality, this was completely unacceptable.

What made it worse was how the situation was handled. I called a few days later to report the issue, hoping they‚Äôd show some concern or offer to make things right. Instead, I was met with complete indifference. No apology, no offer to help, nothing.

It‚Äôs really disappointing to be treated this way after years of being a loyal customer. I can‚Äôt recommend this place anymore ‚Äî and I definitely won‚Äôt be returning.

reviews.author: Kate Lee
reviews.text:
The best pizza in NYC, I guarantee it. I've tried more than 15 pizza places in Manhattan and Brooklyn.

I ordered an extra spicy soppressata pizza with grilled peppers on top, and it was mind-blowing. The dough was very chewy and puffy. My husband ordered a sausage pizza with mushroom toppings, and both were really good.

reviews.author: Nathalie Ramirez Rodriguez
reviews.text: Food was delicious! Service spectacular! Our waiter Axel was super kind and helpful. Definitely recommend this place!

reviews.author: Mark LoGiurato
reviews.text: It's disappointing when the salads are better than the pizza!  The pizza was served room temperature - almost cool. The crust could also use more salt and olive oil to enhance the flavor.  However, the ingredients are very good and the wood-fired oven makes up for what they lack elsewhere.

reviews.author: Harry Ballas
reviews.text:
Absolutely loved this place, from the second we walked in amazing service and the vibes from the energy from the place was excellent. I wish I remember our waitress name but she was fantastic! The focaccia was amazing! My octopus was 10/10 and my daughter pasta was full of flavors I was lucky enough to finish it. Plus let‚Äôs not forget the salad with artichokes in it , that itself was 6 stars !
They have other places and you have to try it

reviews.author: Emily Chao
reviews.text:
The food was so fresh and light. There was a touch of lemon zest in many dishes that gave it an extra layer and made it very summery. Was slightly disappointed that the grilled octopus appetizer was mostly salad with only some octopus bits on it‚Äî we expected the more octopus but it was still good.

The chocolate torta was the best I‚Äôve had at Italian restaurants in nyc so far‚Äî the light whipped cream and tangy lemon zest brought out the creaminess and thickness of the chocolate even more.

reviews.author: Emily McNally
reviews.text: Although I have been to Rosemarys many times before (all locations - even Miami!) this review is to highlight a private event we held with them. From the moment we reached out to gather information, to the actual event itself, everyone was beyond helpful, organized, and easy to work with. We planned a welcome dinner for our wedding in the Gallery space and it was absolutely perfect and beautiful. The room was set up so nicely, the staff were attentive and helpful, and the food was phenomenal. Our guests were so happy with the evening and the dinner. They even accommodated very specific dietary restrictions with no issue. I would highly recommend using Rosemary‚Äôs for an event and hope that we can have another event there in the future!

reviews.author: JAY BLESSED
reviews.text: Had a beautiful lunch here. The atmosphere was fun and light, yet I left focused and full‚Ä¶of delicious food. T‚Äôwas a sensory delight that surpassed gustatory and olfactory amazement. Rosemary‚Äôs Midtown is all consuming; in a let-me-invite-you-to-my-family-home-and-prepare-the-pull-out-sofa-for-your-post-meal-rest. Kudos to the amazing service and kitchen teams for delivering exceptional service. Thank you Ashley.

reviews.author: Peter Mathys
reviews.text: We really liked this place! It was near our hotel, and it was easy to make a reservation. The atmosphere was pleasant, albeit a bit dark (which we didn‚Äôt mind). The service was great and fairly fast, despite it being busy. The appetizer we had - Ricotta e Tartufo Nero - was a very pleasant combination of bread, whipped ricotta, honey, and truffle. The pastas we had, Rigatoni and Pappardelle Verde, were delicious and fresh. We are glad we tried this place out!

reviews.author: Lorelein Gonzalez-Joseph
reviews.text:
We first discovered this catering at my father-in-law‚Äôs birthday, and I instantly fell in love with the food. When it came time to plan our wedding, choosing them was one of the easiest and best decisions we made.

Their online menu made everything simple to choose from, the prices were exceptional, and the service was so thoughtful every step of the way. What made it even more special is that we were able to honor my husband ‚Äôs Greek heritage through the menu, and then we paired it with Venezuelan desserts‚Äîit was the perfect blend of our families and cultures.

The food was absolutely delicious and our guests are still talking about how much they enjoyed it.

We are so grateful for their role in making our celebration unforgettable and would recommend them wholeheartedly!

reviews.author: Lauren Sachs
reviews.text: King David's catered my wedding and they did a fantastic job! My guests all said this was some of the better wedding food they've had, and we loved it! They have something for everyone,  gluten free, vegan, dairy free, etc. They accommodated a wide range of allergies and dietary restrictions and everyone had plenty of delicious options! They are so easy to work with,  very organized and knowledgeable, and they are a family owned business which is another plus! Definitely recommend.

reviews.author: Diana Sponsler
reviews.text: I always love their food, the grape leaves are a special treat! They accommodate special requests when possible, and the Baklava with Turkish Coffee highlights any moment and can brighten my mood from any despair I‚Äôve had thus far. Merely thinking about it makes me anticipate my next visit eagerly!

reviews.author: N N
reviews.text: I've been enjoying King David's Mediterranean food since the mid-70's. The original restaurant on Marshall Street was established by the father of the current owners who worked for their dad as young men. When the father retired, the business was divided, with one son opening a new restaurant in Fayetteville and the other taking over the Marshall Street location, but moving to a smaller upstairs space. Having eaten at both restaurants, it is my opinion that the larger Fayetteville restaurant serves the best food. The chicken pesto pizza is an excellent starter for 2-4 to share. The platform is a 12" piece of crispy pita bread topped with delicious cheese, chicken, black olives, tomatoes, and pesto sauce. For your main course, try the babagnouge ala carte platter which includes salad, pita bread, and a falafel patty, or order the chicken shish kabob over rice which comes with salad, falafel, pita bread, and hummus. Other items on the menu that we love include the beef chawarma sandwich, the Greek salad with chicken, and when it's available, the mushroom soup. For something different, try the apricot nectar as a beverage. I think it pairs well with the food, particularly if you make liberal use of the hot sauce. At the far end of the dining room, there's a door leading to a skylight-lit patio that's pleasant in the summer. For lunch, you place your order at the register as you enter and it's delivered to your table. At dinner, you are seated and the waitstaff takes your order and brings your food. Service is excellent and the environment is relaxed and comfortable. UPDATE-1: It seems that the pita bread may be thinner than it once was. The beef shawarma sandwich falls apart pretty easily. Delicious with added Frank's Red Hot, but a little messy. UPDATE-2: I was up for a light lunch and chose a Greek salad without chicken. It served the purpose perfectly and tasted great. UPDATE-3: Even though the fattoush salad is no longer on the menu, the staff kindly prepared it for me. It was very good, but I do prefer the Greek salad.

reviews.author: Shew nay Way
reviews.text: I went there today with my boyfriend, I ordered the chicken platter combo and was VERY disappointed‚Ä¶ I was serve a plate of white uncle Ben‚Äôs rice with what seems like boiled chicken! There was no garlic sauce and the lady taking our ordered even offered salt and pepper because she too knew how bland and flavorless it was! I couldn‚Äôt even finish my meal! Left there STILL starving!!! NOT REAL MEDITERRANEAN FOOD

reviews.author: Joe Martin (EvilSkull093)
reviews.text:
A.W Wander
145 E Seneca St
Manlius, NY  13104

Good music, amazing staff, great to bring the kids to have fun family time together. Great food choices to choose from. I recommend the supreme pizza. If you don‚Äôt like all those toppings, I would also suggest the pepperoni. The pizza had an excellent tasty sauce, all the the toppings were spot on, and wood burning taste of the smoke just gave it the extra flavor like it should have. For their drinks they have different kinds of soda and alcoholic beverages. Also during spring and summer you can enjoy your food outside.

reviews.author: LDLTV Live
reviews.text: Spectacular place. Born and raised in FM Schools K-12 and now a 35 year Florida resident,  I came to town with my client for a Movie Event next door at the Manlius Cinema.  I'm wondering why someone in Manlius didn't dream up a place like this 42 years ago when I was in high school. The Pizza is insane. As good as any place, anywhere I've been including NYC and Italy. I had some special pizza that had like everything I love..cabbage roasted pork and some kinda cooky, delicious hipster sauce drizzled over it and the first bite was heavenly as was the last. Wood fired, crunchy and savory all at the same time. The staff is and was fantastic the two nights I was there. They are on top of everything and polite (a lost art form). Everyone is  happy to be working there and super helpful with picking out the beverage and pizza of your choice.  The atmoshphere is just as cool as the name of the business. It's a bustling and super hip joint thats both modern age and old school for us old people with authentic decor true to the year it was built (which I love). It checks every box for a 10 outta 10 establishment. The owners hosted a movie showing  last weekend and took care of the movie guests really well so that was just amazing too. Great work Dan and Joe you hit a grand slam. Can't wait to get back there to M town.. Cudos to the Mayor too!

reviews.author: Mark Myers
reviews.text: Great food. My favorite is the BBQ chicken bacon ranch pizza. Great flavor. Amazing atmosphere and great craft beer and wine.

reviews.author: Bill Meidenbauer
reviews.text: My girlfriend had been here before but I hadn't . Food was outstanding. Staff was absolutely awesome. The one manager noticed I was in a sling and didn't everything he could to make my visit much more comfortable and accommodating . Although that wasn't necessary it was greatly appreciated. People don't care how much you know till they know how much you care . And these people care. Was overall an outstanding experience and we will be back.

reviews.author: Teresa Corrigan
reviews.text: This is the best pizza place in America! The monthly special is always excellent.  I don't bother looking at the ingredients anymore. I just order it. The beer selection is phenomenal.  The smells are great and their set up is perfect. Works like a well greased wheel.

reviews.author: Angelo Garcia
reviews.text: I have visited Ithaca several times and every time I am in town I eat here!!! Prices are modest and the food is delicious!!! Service is friendly and courteous!! Facilities are kept clean and orderly! Plenty parking and plenty to choose from!!! Bring your friends, family and colleagues you will love it!!!

reviews.author: Amanda Gorges
reviews.text: Palento fries were lacking flavor and I was expecting way more from them. The sacchetti pasta and ravioli were good but the lobster ravioli was on the sweeter side wheras the sacchetti was very rich with cheese. Portion sizes for both were on the smaller side.

reviews.author: Erin Karpich
reviews.text: It's an okay experience. If I wasn't vegan I'm sure it would be better. I did enjoy the Bruschetta. The dish I ordered for my entr√©e was just okay, the gnocchi.

reviews.author: Streaming Iraq War Veteran
reviews.text: $20 for 4 lobster ravioli. Thats $5 each. In this economy that is just ridiculous. Not to mention the water they force on you is disgusting. Im not happy with the price and the staff was ok but a bit slow. I cant really recommend this place. If you do go I would definitely ask how many your getting of something before ordering

reviews.author: Lbyor
reviews.text:
Found Ciao on Trip Advisor under ‚Äúbest gluten-free restaurants in Ithaca.‚Äù Lived up to the hype. Love the stylish yet casual environment. It was busy when we arrived but it still took less than 5 minutes to sit. The host gave us a booth with a view of the wood-fired pizza oven, which was greatly appreciated. I‚Äôm glad my girlfriend was in the mood for gluten-free Italian, which is what prompted my search in the first place. We wanted to try something new in the Ithaca area.

Service was excellent from start to finish. Our waitress was great. She was very attentive without coming across as overbearing. She did a great job of staying one step ahead at every opportunity.

The house bread dipped in the garlic-infused, seasoned oil was amazing. It set the right tone for our taste buds. Our entrees arrived before our appetizer. Although we didn‚Äôt mind, management apologized and didn‚Äôt hesitate to deduct the appetizer from the bill. They proceeded to serve the appetizer a few minutes after that. This made quite the impression on us because they did not have to do that. And I love a business that acts in good faith.

The meatball appetizer is highly recommended. I had a pasta dish that was similar to Utica‚Äôs chicken riggies. Every dish we had that involved red sauce tasted amazing.

My only constructive criticism is regarding the pear and gorgonzola pizza. I think this pizza could use more pear slices to help balance the dominant flavor of the gorgonzola. The tastiest bites included the pear. And perhaps this pizza could benefit from a drizzle (the aforementioned garlic oil, pesto, or balsamic would be perfect). I should have asked about adding a drizzle, given that this pizza was a bit on the dry side. It still tasted great and we were super happy with our food.

We wanted to try dessert and we opted for the chocolate mousse. It was the perfect dessert because you don‚Äôt need much room to eat it. And the chocolate mousse had a rich flavor without being too sweet.

Overall, Ciao left a great impression on us. I would highly recommend this place. And next time I‚Äôm in the Ithaca area, I can‚Äôt wait to return to Ciao.

reviews.author: Catherine Gray
reviews.text: This is one of my go to places. There‚Äôs never a wait. The interior is decorated in a very fun way and I love the outdoor seating in the summer. The outdoor seating is dog friendly too! The food is the best part. It‚Äôs unbelievably good with a beautiful presentation and unbeatable drinks! The staff is always friendly and attentive as well. Can‚Äôt recommend this place enough!

reviews.author: Maria Martha
reviews.text:
A really cute Mexican restaurant. The staff was very friendly and attentive.
We came for lunch and enjoyed our fajitas.
They have all types of yummy drinks.
My steak fajitas needed a bit more seasoning but my friend enjoyed hers. I wish they would‚Äôve served us some complimentary chips and salsa.

reviews.author: Rose Daraz
reviews.text: My husband and I randomly stopped by and ended up loving it! We got the shrimp fajitas and fish tacos‚Äîso good. The staff was really friendly and we loved sitting outside.

reviews.author: Thomas Murtagh
reviews.text: Easily a top 3 margarita that I have ever had. Great service, cheap drinks with a great happy hour deal. Food was amazing as well. Only negative was that chips aren‚Äôt free but that‚Äôs typical for NYC mexican

reviews.author: Christina LeMoine
reviews.text:
This place has grown on me as I've continued to go back. The wait staff are mostly warm and authentic accommodate requests.

I love that there's vegan options for almost every section of the menu. The food is yummy, especially with the fresh elements, such as, special cilantro, lime, radishes and flavorful salsas.

Haab is a good neighborhood casual dining option for dinner, brunch or lunch (with specials).

reviews.author: Anthony
reviews.text:
Oiji Mi

Food:
The chili oil lobster ramyum is the move. Rich, savory broth with just enough heat, perfectly chewy noodles, and tender lobster. It‚Äôs the kind of dish you think about the next day and consider going back for. The rest of the menu is beautifully plated and thoughtful. Portions lean upscale (not huge), but the flavor more than makes up for it.

Service:
Friendly, polished, and just attentive enough without hovering. Our server gave great recommendations and didn‚Äôt make us feel rushed, even on a busy night.

Ambiance:
This place is sleek. Dark wood, soft lighting, cool touches everywhere. The bathroom was a standout. It‚Äôs one of those places where you walk in and go, ‚ÄúOh‚Ä¶ this is nice.‚Äù Great for a date night or a special occasion dinner that‚Äôs not stuffy.

Overall:
Oiji Mi nails that upscale-but-still-fun balance. Come hungry, get the lobster ramyum, and maybe take a bathroom selfie while you‚Äôre at it. Definitely worth a visit.

reviews.author: KEVIN
reviews.text:
Our dining experience at Oiji Mi was a study in contrasts, showcasing moments of genuine quality alongside significant operational flaws. Considering the substantial bill of $1,119.26 for four people (excluding service) in a casual setting, the disparity between expectations and reality was notable.

Cuisine Identity and Execution:
While positioned as 'Korean fusion,' many courses across the menu felt confused in their identity. The utilization of certain spices and vegetables did not clearly anchor the dishes within a distinct Korean gastronomic framework, leaving the fusion border ambiguous. However, specific dishes excelled:
‚Ä¢ The Main Galbi (Short Rib): Perfectly cooked and served with a beautifully balanced soy-based sauce that offered deep satisfaction.
‚Ä¢ Black Sugar Bingsu: A sophisticated and impeccably executed dessert that served as a fantastic conclusion to the meal.

Beverages:
We selected two bottles of wine, including a Dr. B√ºrklin-Wolf (Pfaltz) white and the Littorai (Anderson Valley) red. The Other Half Brewery Green City DDH Hazy IPA was also ordered and impressed with its rich aromatic profile. The quality of the beverages themselves was not in question.

The Critical Failure: Service and Management:
The service was the most disappointing factor, falling far short of the standard one expects from a Michelin-starred establishment.
‚Ä¢ Staff Engagement: Waiters and front staff displayed a noticeable lack of focus and enthusiasm for guest interaction, exhibiting an indifferent, minimal-effort approach more aligned with a casual eatery.

‚Ä¢ Sommelier's Conduct: The sommelier was overtly promotional, intentionally topping up partially full wine glasses to empty the bottle quickly and pressure an additional purchase. This felt like aggressive salesmanship rather than professional beverage service.

‚Ä¢ Operational Oversight: Staff members were frequently observed engaging in personal conversation, distracting them from attending to dining guests. This highlighted a serious lack of focus and suggests an amateurish approach to floor management.

While flashes of excellent flavor were present, the experience was ultimately overshadowed by the restaurant's ambiguous culinary direction and the indefensibly poor quality of service that did not justify the high price point. Given the wealth of more refined and consistently executed Korean fine dining options in New York City, a return visit is highly unlikely. Oiji Mi urgently needs to address staff training and management oversight to align its hospitality standards with its Michelin accolade.

reviews.author: Zoe
reviews.text:
My husband surprised me with a birthday dinner at Oiji Mi, and while I knew we were going somewhere special, I didn‚Äôt realize just how special it would turn out to be.

He had reserved a table facing the open kitchen ‚Äî essentially a chef‚Äôs table ‚Äî and it was such an unexpected treat. The setting was beautifully designed: the round table felt intimate and romantic, giving us a perfect view of the chefs at work, adding a layer of magic to the whole evening.

Every dish was a visual delight ‚Äî absolutely stunning plating that I‚Äôve never seen before in Korean cuisine. Each course was refined, flavorful, and full of personality. From seafood to meat to elevated takes on traditional Korean flavors, we were blown away by the creativity and depth of the menu.

The cocktail is exceptional !The staff were warm, super professional, attentive, and so thoughtful, absolutely top service! They even surprised me with a beautifully presented birthday dessert, which made the night feel extra personal.

Chef Brian Kim‚Äôs vision is remarkable ‚Äî elegant, modern, yet deeply rooted in Korean tradition. The location is great, the vibe is sophisticated yet cozy, and we just found out there‚Äôs another concept by the chef right inside the same space. We‚Äôre already planning to return and explore more of his brilliant work.

A truly unforgettable evening ‚Äî one of the best dining experiences we‚Äôve ever had in New York!

reviews.author: Cecilia Lee
reviews.text:
Overall 4.25/5
Food 4/5
Service 5/5
Ambiance 5/5
Value 4/5

We celebrated my hubby's birthday here and the side dishes felt more memorable than the main course! Our fave part of the entire meal was actually the desserts.

For a $150 pre-fixe 5-course meal, it felt like decent value, but when considering both taste and overall value, I still lean towards JUA.

Scallop 4.75/5: Cooked to perfection with beautifully balanced flavors.

Trout 4.25/5: Very refreshing and delicious.

Lobster Ramen 4.5/5: A delightful cold ramen with chili sesame oil, and the lobster was nice and meaty.

Jook 4.5/5: The black cod paired really well with the jook; the flavors were just right.

Dry Aged Duck 3.5/5: This was a bit disappointing, not as tender as I would have liked.

Seabass 4/5: The clams were very meaty, but the sauce was a tad on the saltier side.

Shaved Ice 5/5: The tapioca was a perfect match for the brown sugar shaved ice.

Doughnut 5/5: Loved, loved, loved the mochi doughnut with the ice cream! Couldn't get enough of this!

reviews.author: Emma Chang
reviews.text: Spent my birthday here! Every dish was delicious. We ordered the Bossam for two, which was the perfect choice, and I was glad I went with the Oiji Bowl, it was so fresh. The staff were very welcoming, and the chocolate birthday cupcake was also tasty. Had a wonderful night here!

reviews.author: Bob Cummins
reviews.text: Excellent Food! Upscale Bar! Perfectly fitting to be the USC Trojan Alumni hangout on College Football üèà game days! ‚úåüèΩGet the Pork chop! The best that I have ever had! Wait staff wonder & kind.

reviews.author: David Peragallo
reviews.text:
Perfect solo brunch spot

Had a fantastic solo brunch at Pennsylvania 6. Sat at the bar and enjoyed the bottomless Bloody Marys ‚Äî the mix is house-made, rich, and perfectly spiced. Service was smooth, and drinks kept flowing at just the right pace.

Started with oysters, which were fresh and served with a freshly ground relish ‚Äî a standout.

Also tried the wings ‚Äî not bad, but I‚Äôd skip them next time. The rest of the menu felt more refined.

The vibe is upscale but relaxed, and ideal for solo diners. Big thanks to Mackenna, who was friendly, attentive, and made the experience feel genuinely welcoming.

Definitely coming back.

reviews.author: Andrew Murfett
reviews.text: Great place to watch NFL and college games. Excellent beer selection, wings were very solid and great game day happy hour specials. Awesome vibe from fans watching. Will be back.

reviews.author: John F
reviews.text:
First time for me being away for a Bills game. Looked for a Bills Backer Bar and it was perfect. Felt like I was watching playoff football in a WNY bar back at home !  Awesome vibe, great service from attentive bartenders, wings were great.

I‚Äôll definitely return on my next trip to try out their full menu as it looks excellent.

They do get a small line before the game so if you have t. Made reservations be prepared to stand and wait.

reviews.author: Becky Silverberg
reviews.text: Super Bills backers!! ‚ù§Ô∏èüíôGreat experience. I sat at the bar and Emily  waited on me. I had literally the very best small side salad Caesar salad ever. So rich and flavorful. I‚Äôm picky about salad haha And Pancetta pizza. Great food. Great service. Fun vibe.

reviews.author: Bleu Parks
reviews.text: Their food is delicious. Their manager is sweaty and rude. There was a misunderstanding regarding my pickup order and instead of listening and understanding, the manager escalated the situation to where I had to physically back up to create space. Once the guy finally understood what was going on, he ran into the kitchen never to be seen again and without an apology. Don‚Äôt eat here for service and the food doesn‚Äôt make it worth it.

reviews.author: michael rabiner
reviews.text:
I ate here recently with my mother. It‚Äôs a charming restaurant on the corner of 18th street and 2nd Avenue.

The food was delicious. My Lamb Saag was the perfect level of medium spicy that I requested. My mother loved her dish of mild buttered chicken. The Somosa was delicious and the spicy food was cooled by the Mango Lhassi.

Of you‚Äôre in this neighborhood and looking for a delicious and reasonably priced restaurant I‚Äôd recommend eating here.

reviews.author: Shahid Iqbal
reviews.text:
Dal Makhni is India‚Äôs signature dish ‚Äî but what arrived here was nothing short of a culinary crime scene. A baffling mix of yellow and black lentils with random Rajma thrown in, cooked in a ‚Äúunique‚Äù way that defies human understanding. Let me be clear: by no standards on this planet is this Dal Makhni.

I asked for HOT spice level and got‚Ä¶ dessert?? A bizarrely sweet dal that left me wondering if they confused ‚Äúspicy‚Äù with ‚Äúsugary.‚Äù

The rice? Weapon-grade hard. I nearly broke a tooth trying to crack them ‚Äî clearly designed for people with titanium jaws and cast-iron stomachs. And the naan? Good luck. It was like chewing through a piece of hardened leather; I‚Äôm pretty sure medieval shields were softer.

Honestly, this feels slightly less than a conspiracy against Indian food ‚Äî more like a full-blown attack. What a shocking waste of time, money, and calories.

If they want to keep serving ‚ÄúIndian food,‚Äù someone on their team urgently needs to get on a plane to India and take notes. Completely, utterly disappointed.

reviews.author: Sunny Ma (Sunny)
reviews.text:
Decent indian restaurant!
I ordered Chicken Takka Massala (?)

I liked it!! But the chicken was quite so dry for me...except for the chicken, the curry was good. I chose medium spiciness for my curry.

Also, I got Mango Lassi,too.
I think Lassi taste is depending on restaurant s. This Mango Lassi was more sweet than sour flavor.

But it was good!!

I got here during lunch special time.
I thought I had to choose either rice or Nan, the bread. But those two will come when you order!

reviews.author: Omer Hayun
reviews.text: Great Indian restaurant! Usually I don't order the vindaloo because it's too spicy, but here it was just perfectly spicy. The saag paneer was really good and so was the chicken tikka masala. Very recommended!

name: Song‚Äô E Napule
address: 146, West Houston Street, New York, NY

reviews.author: Jeff
reviews.text:
Food was not great. The Caprese salad was not salted, so it was difficult to appreciate umami flavor of the tomatoes. The buffalo milk mozzarella had a sour taste, and I suspect it has gone bad, though our server explained it is supposed to have a tang. The basil leaves were added on top as a decorative bunch and not torn, so there was no basil flavor in the salad. Arugula seemed out of place in a Caprese.

The octopus in tomato sauce with capers and olives was flavorful, though it had a fishy smell and may not be the most fresh.

The two pizzas had large black burnt areas  that were bitter.

The fancy-looking olive oil on the table smells like paint thinner.

reviews.author: Maria Pia Arevalo Silva
reviews.text: My third time here and always had the same great experience! Thank you Adelaide for your service!. This dinner was so especial for me because it was the first time for my dad in this spot (who is visiting me from Peru) and the first time of my best friend from Germany too and everything was fantastic, the service, the atmosphere, the food! Thank you so much guys!! We‚Äôll come back definitely! ü©∑ü©∑ü©∑‚ú®‚ú®‚ú®‚ú®‚ú®

reviews.author: Francisco Gonzalez Rey
reviews.text:
One of the best pizzas we‚Äôve ever had ‚Äî if not the best.
The dough had the perfect thickness, and the cheese was absolutely delicious ‚Äî truly unmatched.

We tried the Margherita and the truffle pizza. The truffle one was next-level ‚Äî simply outstanding.

The service was exceptional. They even offered us complimentary Aperol Spritz, which was a lovely touch.
The whole place has a great vibe ‚Äî it genuinely feels like a little slice of Italy

reviews.author: Max NoName
reviews.text: I tried Song‚Äô E Napule in Manhattan, an authentic Neapolitan pizzeria. The pizza was tasty, juicy, and beautifully packed with nice presentation. However, I felt the price was a little on the high side. The sauce had a slightly sour note and the dough was a bit plain, so for me it didn‚Äôt reach a perfect 5 out of 5. Overall, I‚Äôd give it a solid 4+, though personally I still prefer SIMO‚Äô Pizza for now.

reviews.author: Andi Shahu
reviews.text: Fun Italian place in West Village. Main focus is neopolitan pizzas which were delicious (the dough was fantastic). The atmosphere is fun and lively and the staff was very nice. We also had some great meatballs.

reviews.author: Joe T
reviews.text: The food and staff are excellent here. Came here last minute with my daughter who is in a wheelchair and they got us seated right away. The pizza looked and tasted amazing. In fact, I watched other as their pizza came and every single person of took pictures of their food because of how good it looked. We also had the arancini and it was the best I‚Äôve ever had.

reviews.author: Gabriella Braga
reviews.text:
Absolutely amazing food, service and atmosphere, which definitely looks like a little Italian restaurant from the inside!

The pizzas are absolutely delicious and the pastas as well. I would strongly recommend the Busiate al pesto and the gnocchi!

Definitely will be coming back next time i come to nyc.

reviews.author: Cher A
reviews.text: Super delish meals and awesome gluten free pizza. Lots of flavor with everything we had . Loved the regular bread . Gluten free pizza was super good . Great service - didn‚Äôt wait long for our meals to arrive. Loved this place

reviews.author: cecilia cordova
reviews.text: Norma in Hell‚Äôs Kitchen has a charming, intimate atmosphere ‚Äî the space is a bit tight, but the food more than makes up for it. The dishes are full of rich Italian flavors and feel thoughtfully prepared. The staff is welcoming and attentive, adding to the cozy vibe. A great spot if you're looking for delicious Italian food in a warm, inviting setting at reasonable prices after a Broadway show.

reviews.author: Dave Zatorski
reviews.text: Sat outside on a beautiful summer NYC day to enjoy a classic Sicilian-Italian lunch. We ordered the Buffalo Ricotta with orange honey, meat stuffed rice ball, and Norma pizza with tomato, mozzarella, basil, eggplant, and ricotta. The Buffalo ricotta tasted sweet and could have been served as a dessert. The pizza dough had a flaky crust and the eggplant melted in your mouth which I really enjoyed. The rice ball was stuffed with meat and tasted savory but not too salty. Great restaurant to try before seeing a Broadway show.

reviews.author: Nestor Camarillo
reviews.text:
Cabana in Forest Hills is hands down one of the best Latin restaurants in Queens! The food is absolutely delicious ‚Äî everything comes out fresh, full of flavor, and beautifully presented. The fried calamari was crispy and perfectly seasoned, and every dish had that homemade Latin touch that makes you want to come back for more.

Service was excellent, the ambience is perfect, and the music adds a fun and lively vibe without being too loud. You can really feel the welcoming atmosphere from the moment you walk in.

Compliments to the chef for the amazing food and flavors ‚Äî truly a standout dining experience. Highly recommend Cabana to anyone looking for authentic Latin cuisine and great service!

reviews.author: Mike Reviewed It!
reviews.text:
We got there at 10:20. I was concerned that they closed at 11 and had the waiter sure us we had enough time to not be rushed.
Turns out we had plenty of time and we were welcomed.
We went with the calamari appetizer
The Ropa Vieja and Arroz Con Pollo.
Simply delicious   They give you a choice of dark meat or white meat for the arroz con pollo.  We went with a mix. That‚Äôs the first time I was ever asked what type of meat for this dish. It came oven hot in a cast iron grill. Stayed hot the whole meal.
The tops vieja was very filling and equally as tastey if not even more.

reviews.author: Kevin Zeng
reviews.text:
Great food.  I was so full. Service is friendly. Atmosphere is well decorated.

I was chatting with the bar tender and he suggested their famous mojito. He‚Äôs not wrong.

We ordered paella and some mor dishes. They are all well cooked and delicious.

Thanks for the wonderful birthday celebration.

reviews.author: M G
reviews.text:
The yellow rice and red beans alone - so goood. I had the steak and sweet
plantain. Very tasty. The mojito!!! Yum!! Will be back. Thank you to Oscar for the wonderful service.

reviews.author: Sean Blair
reviews.text: Good Cuban food (hard to find in NYC and especially this part of Queens), GREAT TOP NOTCH service, especially from Marco. Friendly staff all around and a good lively vibe, feels like a mix of an upscale Cuban restaurant and good old friendly neighborhood spot. Sunday lunch kind of place. üôè

reviews.author: Tatiana Hoover
reviews.text:
We stopped in for lunch before a show at a theatre nearby.  The location is great.  The diner is small and a bit cramped.  If there‚Äôs a line, people are huddled together waiting for an open table.  It‚Äôs a mixture of tourists and locals.
The servers are nice, but hurried.  Food is served fast, our fries could have used more time in the fryer‚Ä¶ however the cheeseburger was delicious!! Perfectly made but needed addition of salt and pepper.  Large menu‚Ä¶ Pricey.

reviews.author: Aleen K
reviews.text: This is a quick stop spot. I‚Äôm not sure I‚Äôd enjoy coming back, but it seems to have a-lot of foot traffic. The menu is pricier than I expected. The location is great, that‚Äôs a win.

reviews.author: Hilary P
reviews.text: Fast food like your brother can cook served in the atmosphere of a traditional diner. Pricey, but hey, its New York near the park, what di you exoect!

reviews.author: Iun Chen
reviews.text:
Quick and easy if you are nearby and need to get in and out, but other than that it‚Äôs expensive for what it is and probably not worth the visit.

I can see a nostalgic factor to the seniors who frequent here but if you‚Äôre looking for a good diner with lots of options and bang for your buck, this one‚Äôs not it. We got two fairly small, standard dishes (egg and ham sandwich + BLT) and it was over $50 incl. tax/tip.

On top of that, this place is very small and even walking in the aisles was hard‚Ä¶ and I‚Äôm a relatively tiny person. The setup isn‚Äôt good for lounging and with the prices high, food quality pretty OK, safe to say we won‚Äôt be coming back.

reviews.author: Cee Andsee
reviews.text: Decent but $70 for 2 for breakfast. My coffee was half done and realized my mug had lipstick on it, I wasn‚Äôt wearing any, so that‚Äôs cool. The food tasted good if I‚Äôm honest but not $70 good. That B grade was missed by me though. Yikes. Try to stick with A‚Äôs. Had pancakes eggs and bacon x2 and 2 drinks and it was $70.

reviews.author: Indy Life with Lexus
reviews.text:
This restaurant was so big with 2 levels and busy . They open until 5 AM early morning.
They have  so many side dishes and I love Kimchi & Fish tofu,Staffs were fast services, nice and helpful, decent food, and reasonable prices.
Tofu soup is so good , but need to be careful die to they served with the hot pot it was full of the flavor.
We love LA Galbi combo , Spicy raw crab combo , Spicy stir fired squid were so good and delicious.
For the drink , I was recommended draft makgeolli , good together with Korean food. Confirmed.

I was recommended this place and I would come again by soon.

reviews.author: Guy Eichler
reviews.text: Nice casual Korean spot in K town. This is a good place for walkins we were two and we got a table in less than 10 min. The food is good. They don‚Äôt really specialize in classic Korean bbq so don‚Äôt expect that. You order the dishes and they come to your table. I really love their spicy tofu soup. Galbi was okay too but I think their bulgogi is better.

reviews.author: Julia H
reviews.text:
Almost like a standard Korean restaurant. ‚ú®Many side dishes, fast services, decent food, and reasonable prices. Tofu soup is definitely a must and worth the price.

Intestine tofu soup was intense since the soup will be full of the flavor. It came with an egg and rice, you can be full after this meal.

Spicy sauce crab was a raw and cold dish. Super Korean thing which I loved it. But the taste was pretty heavy and spicy.

reviews.author: Naveen Kumar
reviews.text:
Went out for dinner with friends and had to wait over 40 minutes for a table of six. This place seems better suited for smaller groups (2‚Äì4 people)‚Äîotherwise, expect a long wait.

That said, the food was excellent! They offered a few complimentary snacks, which was a nice touch and gave us a preview of the menu. The standout dish was definitely the Seafood Tofu Soup‚Äîrich, flavorful, and perfectly balanced.

If you‚Äôre not in a rush and enjoy good food, it‚Äôs worth the visit. Just plan ahead if you‚Äôre coming with a bigger group.

reviews.author: Emely Romo
reviews.text: Food is great for lunch, I usually always come here for lunch with coworkers or by myself. But I honestly was left really disappointed this time and won‚Äôt be coming back. I always get the spicy squid and ask for very little spice. It‚Äôs never been a problem until now. It wasn‚Äôt just the mistake, but the fact they tried to convince me that this was the least spicy possible. This isn‚Äôt even the mild version, this is extra. You can see the clear difference in the two pictures. The less ‚Äúspicy‚Äù one is visibly different. Honestly, they wont treat you very good if you‚Äôre a solo dinner. If you‚Äôre gonna go, go with a group or go somewhere else.

reviews.author: Lisa Myers
reviews.text: Went here for brunch as I was craving shakshouka but I have to say that I was a little disappointed. Serving was generous but the sauce was minimal and not overly tasty. I also didn‚Äôt like the pita served with it and would have preferred toast. We also had a share plate of dips and falafel. The falafel was very tasty. The service was satisfactory and I liked being able to sit outdoors. I would recommend it, but I‚Äôm not sure I would go again - unless perhaps to try some other dishes , as the food coming out for lunch looked good.

reviews.author: Harvey Messing
reviews.text: One day I had their baked meatballs ($18.00), which were satisfactory. On a different day I tried their meze combination platter ($26), which I expected a lot better of. They offer a pleasant sidewalk dining area. On a Sunday I ordered their hummus topped with lamb. The menu did not state that the chopped lamb topping was spicy, which it was. I did not enjoy it because of the spicy lamb topping. I followed that with the lamb burger, it was not spicy because it had virtually no flavor, and was dry. Although the hamburger was about an eighth of an inch thick, it was not cooked the way i ordered it, medium.

reviews.author: N.C Harri
reviews.text:
On a beautiful spring day, I visited Meme Mediterranean with a friend, and we were not disappointed! We were seated at a nice table, and our server was friendly and attentive.

The food was delicious‚Äîour appetizers were seasoned perfectly, and we thoroughly enjoyed them. The main course arrived promptly and was delightful.

I liked the flourless chocolate cake, but I wish the kitchen had put more effort into the presentation.

Overall, we had a fantastic time at this charming little restaurant and will definitely return!

reviews.author: Jamaica Aali
reviews.text:
Delicious!  The table to our left complimented the chef and the table to our right ordered the same appetizer twice because the first one was so delicious (a beet dish).

We started with an incredible hummus and perfectly fresh falafel. I ordered the salmon with risotto, which I highly recommend. My husband had the scallop risotto and ate every bite. Dessert was a bread pudding with a fresh whipped cream that was heavenly.

We‚Äôll return. The lamb looked amazing as did the spicy margarita.

Recommend opting for an early dinner if you don‚Äôt like a weekend crowd. It was fairly quiet at 5:30 but to the brim an hour later.

reviews.author: Joseph NewYork
reviews.text: Basically a fast choice and we ended up at this small local Mediterranean spot for dinner. They have a friendly staff, but they're very busy, especially when it's full.   I would like to have given them a higher overall rating but the main plates were uninspired. The food looked fresh and appetizing but was kind of bland. Apparently, the cook likes red pepper flakes, but that is only one spice. The mains were hot temperatures but the sides weren't. The staff were busy and never asked if we wanted drink refills or dessert. A $30 appetizer platter was good but only came with what looked like one cut pita for four to share... Then they charged $2 when we requested one more. They are in a very busy neighborhood full of very good restaurants. Please up your game.

reviews.author: Eli Haboosh
reviews.text:
I gave 4 stars for food just because of the deserts.
The Meath part was awesome. Great and tasty cuts kept flowing to our tables. We didn‚Äôt have to ask for something and it just came. There are parts we just tried to stop the waiters from keep coming with meat.
It‚Äôs was very tasty and plenty of it.
The salad bar was ok. Seen better but we didn‚Äôt come for the salad bar. It has plenty of option but it just didn‚Äôt talk to us.
We ordered deserts. You can leave without deserts. It was ok but not great.
I would stick with the meat. Unless you just have to finish with something sweet.
Overall it was a good experience. A bit pricey but compared to what you get and compared to NY prices it was reasonable

reviews.author: David Lorenzini
reviews.text: Employee's totally awesome. It's a must go. all u can eat meat was unbelievable. Food outstanding salad bar was one of the best I seen very fresh.

reviews.author: Arthur Merk
reviews.text:
As a Brazilian, I was so incredibly happy with the experience we had at Churrascaria Plataforma. My family and I had previously gone to the Fogo de Chao in NYC and we were utterly disappointed in all aspects. For my birthday, we decided to give this a try having heard good things online, and boy were they right!

The food is fantastic. Good quality, comes out fast, well seasoned. The salad bar, the meat, and the deserts! It met the expectations we had of an authentic Churrascaria. The Passion Fruit Mousse and Fried Polenta in particular was to die for.

Maybe even more impressive than the food was the service. Everyone was very warm and attentive, and with a pace in their step. You can tell that they have the Brazilian work ethic of BEING A TEAM, everyone helps each other with everything. You never feel like you need to find "your waiter". Again, it was my birthday, and they made it special with a cheesecake and everything.

A special thank you to Angel, Marcondes, and Portoncello for taking care of us and providing us with warm service.

We finally found a good Churrascaria in NYC! Will be back!!

reviews.author: mike dutch
reviews.text: Stopped here yesterday after a Mets game. It's a beautiful place. It's Brazilian style meat with a good salad bar. We had all kinds of steak ,pork and lamb then hit the salad bar. I had a bunch of different stuff from the salad bar my favorite being the potato salad. My gf loved the sushi and other fish from the salad bar. We got back to the table and record our appetizers which just keep coming I choose cheese balls and she picked fries. The whole experience was very good. They also brought us out a piece of cake after for our anniversary. We left very happy and very full. Just be ready to pay, it is not cheap  but definitely worth a try üôÇ

reviews.author: RyWill
reviews.text:
Yes, I got the meat sweats. No, I wasn‚Äôt mad about it.

We went for restaurant week and man, this place is WILD. There‚Äôs a full on buffet in the middle with everything from salad to tortellini  to sushi. I thought that part was crazy until the PARADE OF ALL YOU CAN MEAT STARTED. I‚Äôve never had so much meat in one sitting. It was all quite tasty but included chicken, sausage, steak, steak, lamb, parm crusted pork, garlic steak. And we had sides as well.

My server was an older man who was actually quite hilarious. He took great care of us.

reviews.author: Chrissy Monroe
reviews.text: I love this place. It is such a classic atmosphere with exceptional service. Every bite was delicious. The caviar was perfection. I love their Bellini‚Äòs and lemon cake. I had the spaghetti with Seabass and cherry tomatoes. It was so good. Everything here is so fresh and you never know who you‚Äôre going to see sitting next to you such a fabulous New York experience. .

reviews.author: Ryan Mark
reviews.text: Harry Cipriani unfortunately did not meet expectations. The food was decent, but the experience felt far more pretentious than the Beverly Hills location I‚Äôve dined at. The atmosphere had an almost luxury designer store vibe - polished and exclusive, but not at all welcoming. There‚Äôs also virtually no privacy; you‚Äôre seated barely a foot away from other diners, which makes the whole experience feel cramped and uncomfortable. The dishes themselves could‚Äôve used more seasoning, especially for the price. Beware - an automatic 20% gratuity may or may not be added to your bill, even when your party doesn‚Äôt exceed 6 diners indicated on the menu (we only had two and it was added to our bill). Overall, it clearly caters to a very specific crowd, and the visit left me more disappointed than impressed.

reviews.author: Margaret Delbridge
reviews.text:
Our meal was  outstanding! We were able to be seated around 5:00 PM without a reservation.
Weren‚Äôt we lucky! We dined early before going to see Wicked.   Will definitely return to try the desserts.  Thank you for the excellent service and meal!

reviews.author: Anastasija Tasevska
reviews.text:
We had the most incredible experience at Cipriani today, thanks in large part to our outstanding server, Ricardo. From the moment we sat down, Ricardo made us feel so welcomed and cared for ‚Äî his warmth, professionalism, and attention to detail were truly top-tier.

My family and I were celebrating a special day, and Ricardo went above and beyond to make it feel memorable. He was attentive without being intrusive, made fantastic menu recommendations, and ensured that everything came out perfectly timed and beautifully presented. His genuine kindness and charm added such a personal touch to our meal ‚Äî we honestly couldn't have asked for better service.

Thank you, Ricardo, for making our day so enjoyable. Cipriani is lucky to have you, and we‚Äôll absolutely be back soon ‚Äî hopefully to be seated in your section again!

reviews.author: Emely Lopez
reviews.text: THE BEST SERVICE EVER!!! I was walking by Central Park and randomly decided to walk in just to check it off the bucket list. From the beginning the man who opened the door for me was so respectful. The staff were all so friendly, shook my hand and even conversated with me. The manager Miriam and my waiter Fernando were both so lovely. As scary as a bunch of high end restaurants are, Cipriani‚Äôs wasn‚Äôt at all! I will be coming back here ‚ù§Ô∏è I was just a random table for 1 but they made me feel like royalty :)

reviews.author: Jodilynn DiPiazza
reviews.text:
Went here for Lunch with CoWorkers.. Service was great.. Food was very delicious really surprised me..
My coworkers had the Mexican Street Corn and Loved it.
THE guacamole although very tasty was not the best I've had..
The restaurant is dimly lit and cool vibe, decorated very authentic and cute..
Definitely would go back

reviews.author: Divya D Nayak
reviews.text:
I went to the midtown Mad Dog for a girls night dinner recently and was kind of disappointed. I remember going to the other location in downtown and having an amazing time, especially the food, drinks and the vibe! This location didn‚Äôt quite measure up.

The spicy guacamole lacked real heat and was more mild. The shrimp tacos were just okayish‚Äîit missed that fresh, vibrant flavor I was hoping for.

We ordered a guava margarita pitcher and it was a letdown as well! Tasted more like a syrupy cocktail mix than a refreshing drink.

What did stand out for me though was the friendly and attentive host. She made the experience more pleasant for us.

While nothing was particularly bad, but nothing really impressed us either. It‚Äôs a good spot for a casual meal, but it doesn‚Äôt deliver the same quality or flavors as the other location.

reviews.author: Tristen Gabourel
reviews.text: went there last night with my friend we got seated almost immediately on a friday night and it was full inside. everything we ordered came out very quickly as well. Thank you to John he was very kind and he found my friends card and my sunglassesüôèüôèüôèüôè

reviews.author: Joel
reviews.text: After being here a few times it's time for a review. I underestimated this place. The food is way better than I expected especially since they are continuing to experiment and try new flavors. I was just served the most amazing wings with custom hot sauce. It was incredible. Perfect flavor and spicy level. That being said every time I've been here the food has been good and the service at the bar especially has been exceptional. It's truly an underrated place in midtown for quality service and very tasty food.

reviews.author: Carlos Soler
reviews.text:
The sign on 5th Ave  caught me to go there.  The best guacamole and margaritas. Effectively it was 100% true.
Loved the freshly  just smashed guacamole, generous portion and crispy chips ü§§ü§§ü§§.
Staff was very kind from manager to servers. 100% recommend. I asked for fajitas and they were so tasty. My wife and I had great experience in this place.

reviews.author: Katherine
reviews.text:
Fantastic Thai restaurant in midtown east. The interior is so cozy and aesthetic and service was attentive. We had a great meal here and would absolutely come back!

Crying Tiger: Grilled NY strip that was flavorful and tender. Also loved the sauce that it came with. I personally prefer my steak a bit more rare, but the flavors delivered

Keaw Tod: Crispy fried wontons with a delicious chicken and shrimp filling. Super snackable and great to share

Short Rib Massaman: Rich and comforting with tender short rib. Loved the roti to dip into the curry too!

Larb Salmon: From the winter seasonal menu. Fresh, citrusy, and tangy in the best way. Definitely balanced out the other dishes

Mango Parfait: I didn‚Äôt know what to expect but loved this. Think mango sticky rice meets ice cream parfait

Drinks:
My Summer (mango mocktail): Super refreshing!
Melon Lar (melon mocktail): More syrupy than I expected, but still tasty if you like sweeter drinks

reviews.author: Pauline Cheng
reviews.text:
If you are down for a good time, good vibe and especially great food? Say less, come over to Yezo Thai!
Drinks- fantastic!
Food- fabulous!
And for my first drunken noodle, it was delicious!!!!
I would look nowhere else!

And look for May because She will be the LIFE OF THE PARTY!!!!!

reviews.author: –ö–∞—Ç—è –ë–µ–ª–æ–≤–∞
reviews.text:
Just had an amazing experience at Yezo Thai Isankaya! ‚ú® The cozy vibe and welcoming atmosphere immediately made me feel at home. The flavors are authentic and full of character ‚Äî every bite was delicious üòçüç¥.

If you‚Äôre looking for real Thai food in New York, this place is a must-visit! üíõ

reviews.author: Jill Warner
reviews.text: Dinner was delicious and portion sizes were great! We were seated quickly on a Saturday night and the happy hour was every day until 7 pm.  Highly recommend their version of the Druken noodles if you like a bit of spice!

reviews.author: Steffanie Godoy
reviews.text:
Tried the Pad Thai and Thai Fried Rice and both totally delivered! The Pad Thai had tender shrimp, a slightly sweet tamarind sauce, and great texture though I would've loved a bit more tang. The Fried Rice was comforting and flavorful, with perfectly cooked chicken and just the right amount of wok char.

The food was so good I completely forgot to take a photo and that says a lot!

The ambiance is warm and modern, with soft lighting and a clean, minimalist vibe that makes it ideal for a chill dinner or date night. Service was kind and attentive without being pushy.

Will definitely be back to explore more of the menu!

reviews.author: Tiffany
reviews.text:
this place was so delicious and the service was fantastic!

we had 4 appetizers (spiced cucumber, tofu pockets, pork gyoza and fried octopus) and they were all so tasty and fresh. as a main, I had the beef udon noodles and my boyfriend had the fried udon with steak. we both loved everything and our waitress was so friendly and helpful! definitely a spot to come back to

reviews.author: Millie Shi
reviews.text:
Not to sound harsh but I think the other reviews are a bit too generous to this place. The food is just fine - we got the ebi ten udon (order a classic to judge a place) and the yakiniku udon, and a shio saba for appetizer. The saba was seasoned nicely although a bit tough, but the udons were disappointing. The noodles were overcooked and much too soft, they tasted like any mass produced packaged udon you could get at a grocery store. The shrimp tempura weren‚Äôt bad though, nice crisp.

Service is really nice though, and the ambience is perfectly homey and as good of a Japan-in-America vibe as you could hope for!

reviews.author: Siwaree Amornsupparat
reviews.text: Went there for dinner with friends. The place is cozy and homey. The foods were delish. I really like spicy cucumber. It‚Äôs tasty and refreshing. Service was awesome. The servers are very attentive. I definitely come back to try others menu.

reviews.author: Jennifer Lee
reviews.text:
Def worth a try if you want to try good udon. The udon was perfectly soft yet chewy enough. The Yakiniku udon was my fav as the stir fried made the noodles very flavorful (sweet and savory taste). The steak was cooked well - crispy on outside, soft on inside.
The servers were very nice. Checked in on us multiple times and made sure our water was always full.
Inside was a bit small but cozy enough.

reviews.author: Amy Lu
reviews.text: Loved the ebi niku udon! The soup was very flavorful. I came with a friend at around 5:30pm for dinner. Just be mindful that the place may get booked for parties during certain hours but the staff will post a sign stating so at the door. Also they'll give you stickers if you ask!

reviews.author: Luz Marie Mercado
reviews.text: I stopped in just planning to have a mimosa and ended up having such a wonderful experience. The owner was so kind and welcoming, and you can really feel how much care and pride goes into everything here. The peach Bellini was absolutely amazing! Perfectly refreshing and made with attention to detail. Everyone was so warm and genuine, and the whole atmosphere felt special. I‚Äôll definitely be coming back soon! Thank you for everything!

reviews.author: S Hwang
reviews.text: Food here was amazing and service was even better. Our server Austin was the best and made us feel so welcome at the restaurant. We got bruschetta, codfish, and the Tonnarelli Cacio e Pepe which was so good. Would definitely recommend!!

reviews.author: Ganling Zhou
reviews.text: The service is warming. We keep coming back and they recognize us since the second time. The food is truly amazing. It always feels home cooked and everything is so fresh. Specially mention for the post-meal limoncello.

reviews.author: Stephanie Cheng
reviews.text: Everything here was delicious. Amazing soft focaccia, marinara sauce was delicious and I don‚Äôt even like marinara. Squid ink pasta is my go to dish.

reviews.author: Ahmet Fitch
reviews.text: Had a fantastic pre-marathon dinner at L‚ÄôAngeletto! The owner was incredibly warm and hospitable, treating us to limoncello and biscotti, both absolutely delicious. I had the lobster ravioli special of the day, and it was perfection. We were a party of 10, and everyone raved about their meals. The atmosphere was cozy, the service exceptional, and the food authentically Italian. Highly recommend for a memorable dining experience!

reviews.author: Richard
reviews.text: Fantastic quality and unforgettable flavors! The wagyu was buttery, rich, and grilled perfectly over charcoal. Everything was fresh and beautifully presented. A bit pricier, but absolutely worth it for the quality. Will definitely come back!

reviews.author: Dolly H
reviews.text:
This beef tongue was an absolute standout ‚Äî beautifully marbled, tender, and full of flavor. Each slice was perfectly cut, giving that ideal balance of chew and melt-in-your-mouth texture once grilled. The presentation was elegant, served on a golden plate with a vibrant orchid and a wedge of lemon that added a refreshing brightness. The accompanying sauce had just the right amount of kick to complement the rich umami of the meat.

If you‚Äôre a fan of yakiniku or want to try something unique and luxurious, this beef tongue is a must-order. It‚Äôs as photogenic as it is delicious!

reviews.author: Lisa Wong
reviews.text:
We had a great experience at Japanese BBQ Toraji. The service was attentive and friendly throughout our meal. We ordered a la carte and everything we tried was delicious.

We order everything with salt and not the sauce.
The kalbi was tender and flavorful definitely a highlight. The Toraji Salad was refreshing and had a nice balance of textures. We also got the signature Toraji Cut, which was rich and juicy, perfect for grilling tableside.

Overall, a solid spot for Japanese BBQ with high-quality meat and great service. We‚Äôll definitely be back to try more!

reviews.author: Eva
reviews.text: The environment is very comfortable ‚Äî clean, cozy, and with a relaxed atmosphere that makes it perfect for chatting and enjoying good food. The meat was fresh and tender.

reviews.author: Jamie L
reviews.text: I absolutely love this place! I booked it on a whim since it's close to my job, and it turned out to be an incredible find. We grabbed seats at the bar, and the menu, while simple, offers a few course options alongside √† la carte selections. Totally worth it! The A5 Wagyu was exceptional--so tender, with perfect marbling, it practically melted in my mouth. It was both filling and deeply satisfying. Overall, an outstanding experience, and I highly recommend giving this spot a try!

reviews.author: Julie Alvarez
reviews.text: In an area where options for Thai food are not hard to find, Udom stands out with its impressive menu and reasonable prices. The service was warm and friendly, and the inside of the restaurant was very cozy. Other customers seemed to be regulars, and the staff know them, which I found very charming. And after tasting the food, I can definitely see why people keep coming back! Everything we tried was delicious, and the portion sizes were very generous. I enjoyed the variety of both more standard Thai fare as well as creative and modern twists on the old favorites. The Tom Yum Fried Rice was something I had seen home cooks make online, but I don't think I've ever seen it on a restaurant menu before (and I've been to a lot of Thai places!). I knew I had to try it and it did not disappoint! Of course everything was delicious but that really stood out. It's obvious why Udom is a neighborhood staple that has stood here for many years: with a friendly and warm atmosphere and delicious food served with fresh ingredients, no matter where you come from it makes it feel a little bit like home.

reviews.author: Deidre Matthews
reviews.text:
Q strikes again! üí•

She whipped up a pistachio martini for me tonight and WOW‚Äîcreamy, dreamy, nutty perfection! üå∞üíö The flavor was spot on, like pistachio got a glow-up. Q seriously never misses. If you haven‚Äôt tried her creations yet‚Ä¶ what are you even doing?!

A Taste of Thailand Right Here!

I‚Äôve been searching for an authentic taste of Thailand for the longest time, and let me tell you‚ÄîUdom Thai delivers! The flavors are spot on, and the crab fried rice is an absolute must-try. It‚Äôs easily one of the best dishes I‚Äôve had in a while.

The atmosphere is warm and welcoming, and the service makes the experience even better. July is incredible‚Äîshe‚Äôs so courteous, always smiling, and truly goes above and beyond to make you feel at home.

I love it here and will definitely be back soon. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: JiaXin YU
reviews.text:
‚ú® Hidden Thai Garden in Brooklyn üå∏
Who knew you could find such a cozy little garden spot in the middle of NYC? ü™¥
Outdoor garden, greenhouse vibes & hearty Thai dishes ‚Äî and guess what? Almost everything is under $20 üî•

ü•¢ Volcano Shrimp ‚Äì crispy & tangy perfection
ü•¢ Hawaiian Fried Rice ‚Äì sweet pineapple & chicken combo
ü•¢ Roasted Honey Ribs ‚Äì fall-off-the-bone, huge portion for just $18 üëÄ
ü•¢ Fried Wontons ‚Äì crunchy bites with sweet & sour dip
ü•¢ Rock and Roll Duck ‚Äì tender, flavorful & comforting

reviews.author: Kat Reed
reviews.text: I had the soft shelled crab and it was absolutely delicious. The place was very cute with so many options would definitely go back

reviews.author: Karen Stephanie Monsalve Reyes
reviews.text: We came here for the first time just looking for a good fried rice but what we found was a menu full of options, it has plenty of variety, and the portions are generous enough, and the prices are the best part, cuz you don‚Äôt have to overpay for a really good meal and people is very kind, they also bring a bottle water with cucumber inside and it tastes delicious, and a plus is that they close late in the night so is lifesaving, we will definitely without a doubt come back soon and try more of the dishes

reviews.author: Pasha Javadi
reviews.text: For an airport restaurant, this place really stands out! The food was fresh, tasty, and served surprisingly fast‚Äîperfect when you‚Äôre on the go. The staff were friendly and welcoming, making the quick stop even more pleasant. Definitely one of the better airport dining experiences I‚Äôve had!

reviews.author: Alan Mizell
reviews.text:
The worst chips and salsa I‚Äôve ever had in my life. The chips are very hard. What is supposed to be salsa is really just some sort of marinara sauce with a bunch of pepper in it.

Add a $4.55 Coca-Cola and The meal becomes a $15 snack. And people just say, it‚Äôs airport prices, as if that excuses it.

And if you don‚Äôt leave a tip for a $4.55 Coca-Cola, the clerk‚Äôs smile fades and the service becomes slow.

Do not recommend but you are a hostage here so you‚Äôll probably buy it.

reviews.author: LL
reviews.text: I had a decent experience overall, but the food itself left much to be desired. While the service was absolutely a 10 out of 10‚Äîattentive, professional, and friendly‚Äîthe food didn‚Äôt quite live up to the rest of the experience. Everything was clean and well-maintained, and the ambiance was pleasant, but unfortunately, the food quality was not the greatest. Some dishes lacked flavor, and the portions didn‚Äôt justify the price. It felt highly overpriced for what was served. I expected more considering the cost. It‚Äôs a shame because everything else‚Äîfrom the cleanliness to the staff‚Äîwas truly impressive. If the kitchen stepped up the quality and flavor of the food, this place could easily be a top recommendation. For now, I‚Äôd come back for the drinks or atmosphere, but not necessarily for the food.

reviews.author: Lena T
reviews.text: I had the most wonderful experience at LaChula‚Äôs waiting for my flight. The bar tender Millie was so friendly and provided excellent service. She even told me stories about her grandchildren. It was such a nice experience until this man started causing trouble out of nowhere. He was loud and obnoxious, accusing her of being rude, when all shs did was ask him if he needed anything else. I was worried this man might assault her, I don't understand why he was upset, I saw the entire interaction. Why did management allow him to behave that nasty with the staff? Otherwise 5 stars and anytime I fly at laguardia that's my spot!

reviews.author: Skylar Warren (Sky Kennedyy)
reviews.text:
This was one of the worst airport dining experiences I‚Äôve had. There was no seating available, which made it uncomfortable from the start. They also didn‚Äôt have water available, which is ridiculous considering it‚Äôs a basic necessity, especially in an airport. The menu was extremely limited, and when the food finally came, the portion size was tiny for the price. I understand airport food usually costs more, but in this case the quality didn‚Äôt even come close to matching the cost.
On top of that, the service was terrible‚Äîunhelpful and inattentive. Overall, a complete waste of money. I would strongly recommend avoiding this spot and finding a better option elsewhere in the terminal.

reviews.author: Rashad Chowdhury
reviews.text:
Torishin is worth it. Incredible experience - great execution.

You‚Äôll get to experience a great yakitori course paired with fantastic banter from Jacky, the chef cooking our skewers.

Each skewer was delicious and perfectly seasoned. Should you wish, you can add the sancho pepper or the shichimi which are available at your counter.

I loved the chicken heart. Soft, steak like and juicy. It really is the best piece. You‚Äôll also have the option of adding additional skewers - do this.

Really wish I got the pudding instead of the shiso gremolata/ice dessert. The pudding is phenomenal. Sweer, rich, and decadent. Perfect ending that I sadly did not get through my own idiocy.

reviews.author: Lauren S
reviews.text: Wow, I went here tonight and it was the perfect meal. It‚Äôs the perfect place to go to before or after a Broadway show it‚Äôs a few steps away from all the Broadway shows!! I love how chic the restaurant is. you walk in and you‚Äôre totally transported to a whole different world which I absolutely love the food was so good. It was so freshly yakitori was the best I ever had. It‚Äôs Michelin rated and the service was excellent. The yakitori chefs really listened to what my preferences were so I really enjoyed every bite. The prefix Omakase meals totally worth it. It‚Äôs so much food. Totally worth it!!!

reviews.author: Elena Ho
reviews.text: Yakitori Torishin is America‚Äôs first Michelin-starred yakitori restaurant in tucked in Midtown West. They offer a full yakitori omakase experience for $148pp which takes you on a full journey through the art of Japanese yakitori. Each skewer is grilled over binchotan charcoal bringing out a smoky aroma and juicy, layered flavors that are absolutely mouthwatering. Seasonal selections keep the experience fresh and surprising, and pairing everything with different sake makes it even more memorable. Torishin staffs are warm, attentive, and genuinely passionate about what they‚Äôre serving. They take time to explain each skewer, offer thoughtful recommendations, and strike the perfect balance between professionalism and making you feel completely at home. If you‚Äôre looking for authentic yakitori elevated to the highest level, this is the place to go!

reviews.author: ReedH
reviews.text:
I miss yakitori from my time living in Asia, so I decided to give Torishin a try last weekend. It‚Äôs definitely more upscale than the spots I used to frequent, but I was excited to see what they‚Äôd do.

I went with the omakase, though I liked that they also offer individual skewers a la carte. Sitting counter side was a lot of fun‚Äîthe team clearly knows their craft, and it was great to watch everything being cooked right over the charcoal. Every bite was excellent‚Äîtender, flavorful, and full of smoky charcoal depth. My favorite of the night was the chicken oyster. If you like chicken, it really doesn‚Äôt get better than that. Service was outstanding and made the evening even more enjoyable. Overall, a wonderful experience. I‚Äôll definitely be back.

reviews.author: Kira Bernhard
reviews.text:
I visited Torishin in April 2025 and had such a memorable experience! From the moment I stepped inside, the staff made me feel so welcomed and at ease - I instantly knew I was going to have a good time. I chose the Omakase option, which was a perfect way to try a range of dishes even though I'm not the most adventurous eater. The staff were incredibly thoughtful, checking in with my friend and me ahead of our meal to see if we preferred certain cuts of meat so they could tailor the experience to our individual tastes.
