Throughout the meal, our server was attentive and knowledgeable, always nearby to answer questions and make sure we were comfortable and enjoying everything. Watching the chef prepare each course right in front of us made the atmosphere even more special and added to the night!

As for the food itself - it was absolutely incredible. My favorite dishes were their popular chicken "scallops," which were so juicy and flavorful, and the gindara fish, which was perfectly flaky and delicious.

Between the warm service, the amazing food, and the lively, welcoming atmosphere, Torishin truly gave me a night to remember. I can't wait to come back!

reviews.author: Erika Baker
reviews.text:
Surf and turf was out of this world!

If you were looking for a classic iconic steakhouse in your Times Square to enjoy a nice meal with your family, I would highly recommend this establishment .

You get what you pay for so do not sacrifice your time and rereview on anything less than your best.

reviews.author: zeracohw
reviews.text: This centrally located NYC steakhouse delivers a solid dining experience. We had the veal and lobster ricotta ravioli, which was flavourful and well-prepared. The service, however, was the real standout‚Äîattentive, friendly, and perhaps better than the food. The atmosphere is classic New York, with walls covered in vintage movie posters and black-and-white photos that give it an old-school charm. It‚Äôs definitely on the pricey side, but that‚Äôs expected for the area. Note: a 20% tip is already included in the bill, so keep that in mind when settling up.

reviews.author: Keisuke Hirata
reviews.text:
Staff is kind and humorous. Had short conversion about meal, male staff gave me good information and suggestion.
Ordered the T-bone steak, and it was so tasty and temperature was perfect.
They also have pork chop and lamp chop so you can chose many selections.
Thank you!
I had no booking but could take a counter seat. Coz it was lunch time of weekend.
If you wanna get the table, should you make a bookingin advance, especially on weekend.

reviews.author: Raymond Zhao
reviews.text: Service is great. Waiters are very attentive. Waiter saw my knife was broken and immediate gave me a new one without having to ask. Unfortunately the food is subpar, USDA Prime steak was very tough and chewy. Did not taste like usda prime at all. On top of that, the Hash Brown Potatoes were completely butchered. Ambiance and decor was nice, but I would not dine here again.

reviews.author: Novi Beerens
reviews.text: We went for dinner after searching for a good old steakhouse nearby our hotel on 10th Ave. this restaurant has another location on 37st. We made reservations, and were greeted attentively by the host and she also got both of our coats store at the coat room. We got a nice booth table in the main dining room area. It was a busy time for them, however service was really great. We got watermelon spritz to start (refreshing!). We started with bread service and we shared tenderloin, sea bass, potato au gratin, mushroom and onion and finished with tiramisu. Simply one of the best meal we had in NYC.

reviews.author: PhilYouIn
reviews.text: Terrific choice for dinner. Beautiful restaurant with delicious food and excellent service. Our server, Diego, was very engaging and pleasant and knowledgeable. The cocktails were perfect, as was the food. The place is noisy with happy patrons, but not too noisy to have a conversation. Very relaxing, enjoyable dinner. ‚ôøÔ∏è

reviews.author: Harvey Messing
reviews.text: They have a very sophisticated and attractive decor here. While some OTHER Italian restaurants will be closed at 10 p.m., THIS restaurant still has a lot of people dining in it. A complimentary bread basket comes with a small dish of lentils, bread, and bread sticks which are delicious. I tried their salmon with mustard sauce ($39.50), ordered medium. It was served that way, it was moist and I enjoyed it. On another visit there I had their Chicken Paesano. The chicken pieces were not tender. On another visit there I tried their rabbit that came with mashed potatoes and Brussels sprouts. The rabbit ($49.50) had lost a lot of its flavor due to its preparation. The mashed potatoes were very enjoyable, the Brussels sprouts were good. A thin electric candle ads a nice touch to each table. They serve the same menu for lunch and dinner.

reviews.author: Rebecca Clark (Becca)
reviews.text: Outstanding experience! Huge, beautiful venue with excellent service. The Rockettes were even better than I imagined. Friendly, professional staff and a phenomenal show to enjoy with family and friends. Of course it‚Äôs really crowded!

reviews.author: Ulyana
reviews.text: Not sure how this place has such high rating - one of the worst meals we‚Äôve had in the past few months. Absolute waste of money. The worst calamari we‚Äôve ever had. So soggy and soft. My pasta was okay. Asked about mocktails. All our server could offer virgin mojito at an Italian restaurant?? Thank you, no. Over $180 for a terrible dinner with a terrible service. Server never checked on us or how the food was. Would never go back here.

reviews.author: camelia motoc
reviews.text:
La Masserie is truly a gem. From the moment you walk in, the warm atmosphere makes you feel like you‚Äôve stepped into an authentic Italian countryside farmhouse. The service is attentive and welcoming without ever feeling rushed, which makes the dining experience even more special.

The food is exceptional ‚Äî fresh ingredients, beautifully presented, and full of flavor. The pasta is perfectly cooked, the seafood is fresh, and the sauces are rich and balanced. Every dish feels like it was made with care. The wine list is also impressive, with options that pair wonderfully with the menu.

For dessert, I highly recommend trying the tiramisu ‚Äî light, creamy, and just the right amount of sweetness.

Whether you‚Äôre coming for a romantic dinner, a family celebration, or a night out with friends, La Masserie delivers an unforgettable experience. It‚Äôs the kind of place you‚Äôll want to return to again and again.

reviews.author: Matthew Frankowski
reviews.text:
Some of the best udon in NYC! While the wait can definitely be long during peak hours(1hr 30min on a Sunday evening), Raku SoHo is a cozy spot that delivers authentic noodles and thoughtful dishes once you‚Äôre seated.

For an appetizer you must try the chicken tatsuta-age which is wonderfully fried and seasoned. We loved the dipping sauce which perfectly compliments the chicken. We tried two hot udons, the tantan and the nabeyaki.

The tantan offered a rich and flavorful broth while not being too overwhelming. My only complaint would be that most of the pork and other components were under the noodles so I didn‚Äôt discover them until I was almost finished. The nabeyaki was a nice light soup with the same perfect noodles. It offered a lot of protein and a nicely balanced fishy flavor. The stand out of this dish was the shrimp tempura which was fried to perfection.

My only complaints would be of the tight seating arrangement. You will be practically sharing a table with the people around you if you are seated near the front. Overall, I cannot wait to come again and try more of their udon!

reviews.author: Amenita T
reviews.text: The restaurant not too big, cozy, but pack, rsvp totally recommended if coming in rush hours. 90 mins to complete your meals since they are very busy so other customers can have an opportunity to dine in as well. Their steam eggs surprisingly so tasty and it took at least 20 to 25 mins wait for that dish. Their spinach and mushroom very simple yet very tasty as well. Udon was also good, overall I loved this place and I was glad that my hubby discovered it lol. We walked there since we were there on a vacation. There‚Äôs no way we would drive around NY. Too crazy and parking sucks. Good for kids, family as well. Serves beers and wines. Of course there is parking along the streets. But not easy to find one sometime. We either walk or uber when we come to NY.

reviews.author: Wesley Gan
reviews.text:
Raku is known for its udon, but that will be a separate review for me. This time I was craving Katsudon which I decided to order. The flavor was good, I wish that the pieces of meat were a little larger and most crispy, however everything mixed together really well. It came with a small soup which was delicious. And the pickles were solid as well, I wish there was more.

I did have a big group, but I felt like the service was not as good as I expected. It was busy but also clear that the group next to us was getting more attention and care than mine - when it came to ordering, getting the attention of the waiter, drinks, etc. they also sat down after us‚Ä¶

reviews.author: J Sun
reviews.text:
The good: The udon noodles are excellent and perfectly chewy.

The bad:
- bathroom sinks are insanely small. I don‚Äôt know who looked at that and thought it was a good idea
- they ran out of fried appetizers ‚Äî three hours into service. That‚Äôs unacceptable, you‚Äôre open for another 6 hours!
- you get very little protein for the amount of money you pay
- we got zero service, nobody came to ever check up on us and it was extremely hard to flag someone down.
- found a piece of black plastic in my food. I‚Äôm assuming it‚Äôs a piece of black nitrile glove??
- we opted to not tip because of these reasons, and the server thought it would be appropriate to ‚Äúremind‚Äù us that tips aren‚Äôt included in the bill. When we said we knew, he asked if we were tipping in cash.

Overall, for the price Raku is charging, this level of unprofessionalism doesn‚Äôt make sense. I would not recommend or return.

reviews.author: C A
reviews.text: Delicious udon with a large menu where everyone can find something they enjoy. I was very impressed with the quality of the food. The noodles tasted freshly made and the broth was comforting. The restaurant was clean and the service was prompt. The bowl of udon was large and you‚Äôll definitely leave satisfied!

reviews.author: Augusto Paulino
reviews.text: The lunch specials ($17 each for the Panang curry and the Tom Yum fried rice) were decent-sized portions with a good amount of spice. The meal includes an appetizer and a drink. A soft drink may be a better option than the Thai iced tea. Service is super friendly and fast. The space, though, is elbow-to-elbow cramped.

reviews.author: Jalisa James
reviews.text: This cute, cozy Thai spot is such a gem! The food is absolutely delicious, and the atmosphere makes it feel really special. If you‚Äôre looking for a place with amazing food and a warm vibe, this one‚Äôs definitely worth checking out.

reviews.author: Raksina Winaitammakul
reviews.text:
Lenox Thai is a true gem for anyone seeking authentic Thai food. As a Thai person myself, I can confidently say the dishes here are incredibly delicious and taste just like a home-cooked meal in Thailand. The flavors are spot on and the ingredients are fresh.
Beyond the fantastic food, the staff is exceptionally friendly, and the cozy atmosphere makes you feel right at home. Whether you're a Thai food connoisseur or just looking for a wonderful dining experience, Lenox Thai is a must-visit.

reviews.author: Vanh Saeng
reviews.text:
Wow this place surprised me. I was looking for a Thai restaurant to eat at with my family and this spot blew me away.

It is a small cozy little joint located at the bottom of the upper east side. Due to the size it is limited seating. Can possibly fit around 12 people or so. There's a nice little mural that someone painted. The menus on the TV are bright with clear pictures.

I noticed they get plenty of door dash/Uber eats, etc.

Our hostess was super sweet and caring. She attended to our needs and was very helpful. I had a question about what one of the dishes was and she looked it up on her phone to show me what it was.

The food definitely blew me away. It was surprisingly good. We had the crispy spring rolls, classic fried rice(Chicken), pad Thai (chicken), and a mango avocado salad. The fried rice was amazing. I've always prefer Thai fried rice compared to other Asian fried rices. It didn't taste super greasy and it had the right amount of eggs and chicken and vegetables. The salad was perfectly riped. A great combo of mango and avocado with onions/cashews and an Asian sauce. Very fresh and delicious. The crispy spring rolls came in a set of 4. They tasted great are also a nice size, not too small. It was paired with a sweet chili sauce for dipping.The pad Thai was delicious ü§§ not too dry and just the right amount of oil. The noodles were cooked perfectly. The portion was a great size. I ended up taking the fried rice and pad Thai in a to go container. She was nice enough to box up the food for us.

We also ordered Thai tea. It was the final piece of the puzzle to balance out the spicy meals.

We definitely recommend this place. Everyone please try it. Would definitely try again if we're in the area.

reviews.author: Anish Sinha
reviews.text: Lenox Thai is a cozy, small cafe-style spot with seating for about 12 people. We tried the green curry, and it was full of flavor‚Äîrich, aromatic, and satisfying. The menu offers a good variety of both vegetarian and non-vegetarian options, making it a great choice for mixed groups. Perfect for a casual meal with authentic Thai flavors in a relaxed setting. Would definitely come back!

reviews.author: Maria Russo
reviews.text: Great food and service. Authentic thai cuisine with great flavors. Was very busy upon arrival but got a table fairly quickly. Cozy spot for food and great atmosphere on the UES. Even had warm/heated bathroom and was super clean. Mameiw was super attentive and conscious about any allergies and was very knowledgeable about the menu. She noticed we had not given our order yet and came right over to assist. Hardworking and super helpful!

reviews.author: Praveen solanki
reviews.text:
Thep Thai truly stands out, not just for its vibrant atmosphere, but for the exceptional quality and flavor depth found across its entire menu, especially in its vegetarian and chicken offerings.

For those seeking plant-based dishes, Thep is a revelation. The menu is clearly labeled with excellent vegan options, and the kitchen handles substitutions perfectly. The Vegan Pad See Ew with tofu is arguably the best I‚Äôve ever had‚Äîrich, smoky, and perfectly textured. Don't skip the Avocado Massaman Curry (available vegetarian/vegan), which is wonderfully creamy, savory, and loaded with tender sweet potato. The commitment to flavorful, authentic vegan food here is top-tier.

On the non-vegetarian side, the chicken dishes are equally impressive. The Chicken Pad Thai is a classic for a reason, hitting that perfect balance of sweet and tangy tamarind flavor. However, the real showstopper is the Chicken Khao Soi (Northern Thai Egg Noodles)‚Äîthe creamy coconut curry broth is incredibly deep and comforting, and the chicken (often bone-in, which adds to the authenticity) is cooked to perfection. It's an absolute must-try.

Whether you're visiting for a comforting chicken classic or looking for sophisticated, flavorful vegan Thai, Thep delivers consistently high quality and is highly recommended.

Minnie was awesome to help us with our order. A big thanks to her and entire staff for making our lunch good

reviews.author: Kristen Darby
reviews.text:
I love THEP Thai. I‚Äôve been here so many times and I was last here for my friends birthday dinner.  It‚Äôs my favorite Thai food on the UES. We were a group of 10+ and we had called to get a reservation earlier in the week for a Friday night and they were able to accommodate.

I got a Thai iced tea and the khao soi. I love the food here (have tried most of the menu items).

The service was super quick and friendly - we had a nice lady named Four as our host/server.

Love this place and will be back!

reviews.author: Brooke Waller
reviews.text: Thep was absolutely delicious! We got the chicken pad Thai, chicken pad see ew, and spring rolls and all were delicious and I can‚Äôt wait to go back. Definitely get a Thai iced tea as well‚Äîsuper tasty and an all time fav. Thank you to our sweet waitress Kade for great service and recommendations! üòã

reviews.author: michael vilcapoma
reviews.text:
Had the pleasure of having outdoor seating in the fall of the UES. Tables and area was clean and lights were romantic.

Our server Mameiw was knowledgeable and helped zero in on what to choose on the menu and the Spicy Udon noodles did not disappoint!

Overall a nice corner spot and you can tell why there is a short wait time during weekend dinner rushes (~20mins for table of two).

reviews.author: Kiu Siu
reviews.text: Upper East Side neighborhood Turkish restaurant serving good food at a reasonable price. We were a party of two and went to A La Turka on a Saturday night. It was lively and crowded. Our waitress was friendly and efficient. We ordered the A La Turka salad and Falafel for appetizers. And for the main we had the Lamb Shank and the grilled whole Branzino. The portions were generous and the food was good. Overall we enjoyed our dinner at this restaurant.

reviews.author: Dawn Nargi
reviews.text: We loved our late lunch, early dinner.  After spending the afternoon admiring Halloween decorations, we worked up an appetite.  (I love wandering around my NYC like a tourist even though i lived here 30 years)  Too hungry and tired, we asked our waiter, Ali to recommend his favorites.  He created a spectacular meal for us.  All delicious and the end to a perfect day.@widowshelpingwidows #stoopandthecity

reviews.author: Jeffrey Liss
reviews.text: This is one of our new favorite restaurants!! The ambience is unique - great design and colors. The energy is high.  The food and service are wonderful! The manager/host is highly attentive to EVERY customer's needs, as are that of the wait staff. We have sat at the bar for drinks and snacks and also sat at a table for a full dinner. I highly recommend the Hummus. Their breads are amazing!!

reviews.author: Rita Asso
reviews.text:
The best Turkish restaurant in NYC!
Everything was absolutely delicious ‚Äî so fresh and full of flavor. The presentation is beautiful, and you can really taste the quality in every bite.

The owner is amazing and makes you feel right at home. You can tell he truly cares about the food and the guests.

Highly recommend to anyone looking for an authentic and unforgettable Turkish dining experience in New York!

reviews.author: Anna Yegorova
reviews.text: Came here for brunch and was blown away by the excellent service, beautiful ambiance (even from choice of cups and tablecloth combos) and a delicious unique breakfast! That pastrami bureka was the most delicious lightly fried rolls of deliciousness with a generous helping of eggs on the side. Can‚Äôt recommend this place enough for actual good food that both looks and tastes good!

reviews.author: rebecca
reviews.text:
LUNCH SPECIAL, you will always be my favorite.

Such a chill spot to grab lunch at. My bestie and I went for the lunch special and it was so much food for such a reasonable price. The staff was kind and the bathroom was clean. Thank you for having us, Spice Thai! :)

reviews.author: Christine George
reviews.text: Amazing food, great service. You won‚Äôt be disappointed by the menu and their consistency. Atmosphere and quaint and comfortable. I didn‚Äôt wait long to be served. They accommodated my cake someone surprised me with and did everything to ensure you were satisfied. Great food, great price!

reviews.author: The Foodie Architect
reviews.text: Good decent Thai food. The waiter is very attentive!

reviews.author: Victoria Leon
reviews.text: Great food at good price. I ordered Massaman curry with seafood mix and jasmine tea. The curry was rich and flavorful. I didn‚Äôt enjoy getting shell pieces between my teeth a few times, but the food itself was delicious. I also loved the interior, cozy with lovely fresco at the back and beautiful tiles. The staff were very nice.

reviews.author: Miranda A. Walker
reviews.text: A Lovely, quaint authentic Thai cuisine that‚Äôs delightful and delicious. I ordered the appetizer sampler since I was going to a show after work. The variations were good and filling. The drinks are awesome too! Go during happy hour! (Location 1479 1st Avenue @77th Street$

reviews.author: Victorandmanuela
reviews.text:
I highly recommend this restaurant.

I took the menu Maki 2.
It was very generous and good for $22.
The fish was fresh.

For me the place is very great in terms of quality and quantity for the price.

I will definitely go back

reviews.author: Linsey mackey
reviews.text: Came with a friend for an early dinner. It was good. My favorite rolls were the Sweet potato tempura. The other rolls were good too. Had the Yuzu white peach to drink and the Dragons egg for dessert. We got all 3 flavors.

reviews.author: Le Coucou
reviews.text: This is a good spot for a quick lunch! I placed a takeout order that was supposed to be ready in 15 minutes, but came out in just 10. Apin, who runs the place solo during lunch, was very friendly and even offered me a glass of water while I waited. The chicken katsu was decent, and I plan to order from them again.

reviews.author: Fiona Camm
reviews.text: Sushi was incredible! The fish melted in my mouth & they were very generous & lovely. Couldn‚Äôt recommend more. Also such great value.

reviews.author: Korie Carr
reviews.text: The best sushi in the neighborhood especially at this price point. Has been my go to pick up food for over a year. The owner and staff are always extremely friendly when I pick up and the food is amazing! I ate inside for the first time and ordered a glass of wine while I waited for my Togo food and the owner came over and gave me a glass on the house! Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Celeste
reviews.text: My husband and I celebrated our birthdays recently at the restaurant. Every dish we ordered was impeccable.  The creamed spinach and crispy onion string sides were amazing! The steak and halibut with beet risotto were unbelievable too!  Very attentive waiter and  classy atmosphere.

reviews.author: vincent xue
reviews.text:
This place is just about what you'd expect from a steakhouse. Good service, decent atmosphere, decently portioned sides, and a nicely cooked steak with optional accompaniments. In my opinion, the sauces were too weak to really enhance the entree. However it came in a medium sized pot with a handle, making it easy to use and share.

The only thing that stood out to me was the creamed spinach. Every bite was quite rich but wasn't too dense.

Did I have a good time with my meal? Yes.
Did the flavors blow my mind? No.
Would I come back? Probably no. But I don't regret coming here.

reviews.author: Bradley C
reviews.text:
I came here by myself tonight. I ordered a raspberry sidecar to start my dinner. The drink was very nice. Very balanced. It was smooth and beautiful.

I ordered lobster bisque, a NY strip cooked medium rare, and a side of toasted wild mushrooms.

The bread was quite nice. They gave me one nice looking one and a one that was kinda ugly. Turned out, the look did matter. The nice looking one was way softer than the ugly one.

The lobster bisque was nice. Very pungent and thick. It also had a generous amount of lobster claws meat chunks. However, some of them were a bit overcooked and some were perfectly tender.

The NY strip came out pretty well. The meat was pink and tender. Very flavorful. It came with roasted garlic. The garlic was smooth like mashed potatoes, and it was fragrant but not stinky.

The side of roasted wild mushrooms was very nice, too. Usually, they can be a bit oily and greasy, but here, they were cooked to almost perfectly. Almost, because they were a bit bland, and they were a bit too dry.

Overall, it was a nice restaurant with a good atmosphere. Even though, I still wish they could pick up the speed a bit. Between the time I finished my lobster bisque and my NY strip was served, I waited for 35 minutes. They can probably do that for the party of 2 or more, but for a person who was eating by himself, I‚Äôd like to just finish and leave.

reviews.author: george grinnell
reviews.text: Great looking place ,cool vibe , nice decor but it‚Äôs basically a step above pub food. Hardly a Steak house however informal it‚Äôs described on google. Service is slow and non attentive at best. Steak was bland , sides were same and the bacon barely cooked even when sent back and asked for it well done came back out the same . Waiter was robotic no personality , not what you expect from a ‚Äústeakhouse‚Äù waiter . Overall aside from a drink and maybe a quick app at bar this place really should do better or change the name . Sub par across the board minus the atmosphere.

reviews.author: Olga Tymshan
reviews.text:
I recently discovered this establishment on the UES and it‚Äôs become one of my favorite spots on Friday nights! It was easy to make a reservation through Google maps, the table was ready right away, the staff is very courteous and accommodating.
We came primarily for drinks üçπ and were not disappointed: all three tequila cocktails were unique and delicious. Our server was also very knowledgeable about their origin and the making. The buratta salad is at the top of my salad list now! It‚Äôs like a meal by itself to my European standards and the concoction of tastes makes it truly unforgettable and wanting me to return there for just this one dish üôÉ

reviews.author: John Gonsalves
reviews.text: Lexington Candy Shop is one of those true New York classics that still keeps its charm after all these years. It has that old-school diner feel with counter seating and friendly staff who actually remember regulars. They still make their Coca-Cola the traditional way from syrup mixed right in front of you which gives it a flavor you can‚Äôt find anywhere else. The coconut cake is a must-try, super moist with that perfect balance of sweetness. They also serve all the classic diner favorites like omelets, egg sandwiches, and pancakes, all made fresh and served hot. It‚Äôs a simple spot, but that‚Äôs part of what makes it so good  just classic comfort food in a nostalgic setting. Definitely worth a visit if you want a taste of old New York.

reviews.author: Food Soul
reviews.text: It was a long waiting line but totally worth it! We got babana split and cherry coke float. They all were amazing! Perfect sweet. We got the bar seats and I like to watch them making the Cola, adding the syrup and soda. The atmosphere was so warm welcoming, cozy and unique. We got good service, they all have smile on the face. Also, I enjoying watching the coke bottles in the front of the shop.

reviews.author: Chiara Rizza
reviews.text:
The Lexington Candy Shop is an absolute gem, an original spot where you can enjoy Coca-Cola served the old-fashioned way. The atmosphere is wonderfully vintage, full of charm and character, but never feels outdated or worn. It‚Äôs like stepping into a piece of New York history that‚Äôs still very much alive. The staff is fantastic: friendly, down-to-earth, and genuinely welcoming. Their warmth makes the whole experience even better. Everything we tried was excellent, and the overall vibe of the place is unforgettable.
A must try if you‚Äôre looking for something authentic, nostalgic, and delicious!

reviews.author: Walenska Florencio
reviews.text: The staff is very kindly and the food is very good. The cheeseburguer was better than The one that I tried on Times Square. There was a line but we are 4 and around 30 minutes our table was ready.

reviews.author: Hishaam Bin Masood
reviews.text:
I was curious to visit this establishment as it was pretty popular on Instagram but somehow the Google rating was not promising so I decided I need to go and see it for myself.

The review on Google was right. This is just hyped up to be a tourist trap.

But don‚Äôt get me wrong, the vibes and ambience is spot on! Typical American diner but the rude behavior of staff and the prices are exorbitant like grilled cheese is $10 and it‚Äôs not even on sourdough bread.

The only reason we went to try was the Coca Cola float as they seem to be making the Coca Cola the old school way.

So in short, the ambience 10/10 as it has a pretty decent history around the upper east side, the food not so much.

reviews.author: Gaby Ortiz
reviews.text: Definitely not our favorite place‚Ä¶ the Food took 20 minutes to arrive and the place was empty. The salmon omelette was the best of everything we ordered. The portions are huge!

reviews.author: Olivia
reviews.text:
Went for Sunday brunch - group of 4. Reserved table beforehand, no wait. Brunch comes with a drink - Bellini, mimosa, orange juice, or coffee. OJ tasted fresh, pulp which I like. We spent about $35 pp. Felt on the pricier side especially waffles, pancakes for $25-27 which we did not opt for. Still, would return as a special outing with friends for good food at a convenient location with good ambiance.
Pictured: crab cake burger, omelettes, eggs Benedict.

reviews.author: Stinson Parks III
reviews.text:
Stopped in after an evening at the Guggenheim not too far away and were automatically greeted by such a warm and welcoming host.

We were promptly served our pitcher of red sangria by our attentive server as he guided us through our selections of delicious bites including the Bocado fries, sea scallops, and flatbread with prosciutto.

reviews.author: Ana Sanabria
reviews.text: After work dinner and drinkns. Service is incredible.  The food..so tasty. I had the fried fish sandwich with mango salsa. Sooo yummy....I would definitely come back

reviews.author: janae metz
reviews.text: Oh my god, the food was so good here!! The service was def not the best, as we had to ask for bread, and had to ask for check after quite a bit, and then still wait a bit more. But I will most def be returning as my meal was heavenly!! Portions are big too!

reviews.author: Emre Aslan
reviews.text: The pancakes were absolutely incredible. Fluffy, flavorful and perfectly cooked. The atmosphere was just an amazing and welcoming with a great vibe that makes you want to stay longer. Also Dayan is my fav server. She was fantastic thank you for the excellent service‚ù§Ô∏è. Definitely a place I‚Äôll be coming back to !!!

reviews.author: Nigiar Zanger
reviews.text: Such a lovely and clean spot in West New York! I‚Äôve been there several times and everything is always delicious. Their food and desserts are really tasty, and the fresh smoothies and juices are always made right in front of you. It‚Äôs cozy, the quality is great - I honestly don‚Äôt understand why the rating is so low. This place definitely deserves more appreciation!

reviews.author: Hanan A
reviews.text: I had Turkish coffee and falafel! Both were fantastic. The owner is working there too so you‚Äôre so everything feels just right. The vibe is pretty cozy. I liked the seatings. It‚Äôs the kind of spot that makes you want to come back again for sure.

reviews.author: Gerard Smith
reviews.text: I was visiting my grandson and had breakfast at the caf√© every morning... They had a very nice view of the midtown skyline and park... The service was excellent...  I had excellent Lavazza coffee (black) and my grandson had fresh made orange juice... We both had omelets the first day and then croissant sandwiches the remaining mornings... They croissants were crisp and fluffy with good cheese, eggs, and bacon...  I'll be back in December and will definitely be back to the Park Caf√©...

reviews.author: Jose Vasquez
reviews.text: Found this place by coincidence, we were vacationing and stayed at an Airbnb in Jersey, this place became our ‚Äúgo to ‚Äú spot for breakfast. The food here is made fresh to order with quality ingredients. Everything we ordered was so good, the owners and workers were very friendly and welcoming. I highly recommend this cafe and will definitely come back when in town.

reviews.author: Holly
reviews.text: Went to Salumeria Rosi with my handicapped Grandma. The owner/manager was super helpful and accommodating. He did a lot to make sure that my Grandma was comfortable. All of the food was outstanding, with the exception of the lamb chops which were nearly impossible to eat. It‚Äôs a typical New York City restaurant so not very spacious and I would definitely recommend making a reservation to ensure that you get a table. I would definitely come back here, I want to try everything on the menu!

reviews.author: IndyKevin317
reviews.text: We‚Äôve been searching for an authentic Italian experience outside of Italy and Salumeria Rosi fits the bill.  This place was recommended to us by complete strangers and we were not disappointed.  Really enjoyed dining outside on the patio on a beautiful day.  Great food, great vibe, and great staff.  We are not locals, but will definitely be back on our next trip to NYC.

reviews.author: u.g. Lodwig
reviews.text:
Food is good although portion size is quite small. Spaghetti with clams had tiny clams and the flavor was quite ordinary‚ÄîI‚Äôve had this dish at many Italian restaurants in the United States and in various towns in Italy. This dish here is only ordinary. The pasta is not al dente, and the olive oil didn‚Äôt taste like high-quality Italian olive oil, and the clams are just too small, and perhaps it‚Äôs lacking some garlic flavor (in Italy this dish is usually cooked with garlic and the olive oil and parsley flavors should stand out as well as the vongole). For the price they charge, I expect better. Appetizer was very good though, still portion size is quite small compared to other Italian restaurants in UWS. The puttanesca is good though a bit salty.

They have both indoor seating and sidewalk seating. Sidewalk seating is on a busy main street so you might get some strange reactions from passersby.

reviews.author: Meredith Moore
reviews.text: Best spot in the UWS hands down. Always excellent service and you can taste the love put into every authentic bite. The blue cheese martini's are a must. The pastas are fresh and appetizers are so unexpected and delicious. We have never had a bad meal. A must try-you will keep coming back!

reviews.author: Kathy D
reviews.text: Tiny cute restaurant with nice service and good food.  The ricotta and peaches was delicious.  The peaches were sweet and the cheese was creamy and rich.  Adding some mint and nuts made for the perfect bite.  Meat and cheese platter was also very good, the meats was sliced very thin which was great, but I would have appreciated if they told us the types of cheeses we were eating (the meats were obvious). Also would have like to have known what the garnish was as I couldn‚Äôt place it, it didn‚Äôt taste strong enough to be candied ginger but it may have been.    I did ask what all of these were and was told someone would come and explain but they never did. Bread basket was a combination of toasted and fresh bread served with tasty olive oil.    When you first walk in there is a counter where they sell their meats, cheeses and salads, all looked delicious and while we were they the counter was very busy. Overall liked this restaurant and would recommend.

reviews.author: Mohammed Alanazi
reviews.text: Delicious Indian food with authentic flavors! The curries were rich, the naan was fresh, and the portions were generous. Friendly staff and a warm atmosphere

reviews.author: S S
reviews.text: Excellent service, beautiful ambience, incredible food‚Ä¶ only have good things to say. The garlic naan was exactly what you could hope for!! Delicious

reviews.author: ry
reviews.text: Absolutely delicious food and amazing service. We were given the lunch special despite it being the weekend (when the special isn‚Äôt usually available). Our server was incredibly accommodating and kind. We couldn‚Äôt have asked for a better experience. Definitely coming back, would recommend to anyone

reviews.author: Anthony Lord
reviews.text: I recently ate at this lovely little treat of a restaurant on Amsterdam Ave, Upper West Side, NYC for my birthday. The food was cooked to a very good standard and had a great atmosphere in the restaurant itself. We liked it's location and would go back anytime in the future, if the opportunity presented itself. Great flavours combined with fresh ingredients made for a great bithday evening meal out for myself and my family!

reviews.author: Ari T
reviews.text: The food was excellent, came out quickly, and everything was so flavorful. The servers were incredibly nice and accommodating, making the whole experience even better. It‚Äôs also a great place for big groups ‚Äî highly recommend! Gluten free options too.

reviews.author: Courtnie Clemens
reviews.text: Delicious food all around! The aj√≠ de gallina was fantastic, creamy, flavorful, and perfectly seasoned. The maduros were absolute perfection, caramelized just right. Service was friendly and attentive, and they were so accommodating, even adding an extra person to our table last minute without any issue. A great spot for comforting Peruvian dishes and a relaxed, welcoming vibe.

reviews.author: Fabiola Rojas
reviews.text: I found this restaurant because I was looking for Peruvian Chicken and boy did this place exceed my expectations. This is a Chinese/Peruvian fusion so their menu is quite extensive. My family of 5 loved everything they ordered, service was friendly and timely. Would definitely come again!

reviews.author: Susana L
reviews.text: I absolutely love the food at Flor de Mayo restaurant. The service was great and we received it fast. The food tasted fresh and was hot. They have a wide selection of food, and all the dishes I have tasted are delicious.   It‚Äôs hard to locate parking, but I highly recommend it when in the area. It‚Äôs a must try üòÄ

reviews.author: John ‚ÄúChance‚Äù Acevedo
reviews.text: Florida De Mayo has been a staple of the community. It's one of the few still standing. It's been there more than 20+ years serving the community their Chinese Latin food. Part Peruvian and Chinese this location has something for everyone.  Regardless of your preference you can not go wrong at this location or their sister location.

reviews.author: Lori Lam
reviews.text: i usually go to the location on 86th street but this location is just as great! the food, the drinks, and the people were all so good and lovely. menu highlights were: broiled pork chops, the shrimp soup (my all time favorite), squid fried rice, and can never go wrong with some pi√±a coladas.

reviews.author: shirley ‚Äúshirlz‚Äù f
reviews.text:
Cute, quaint spot. The customer service was great.
What we initially came in to try wasn‚Äôt available but I was not disappointed with my visit. The food was absolutely delicious. My sister who dislikes ham thoroughly enjoyed her quiche Lorraine. I enjoyed the croque madame. I do wish the side salads had dressing. The caramel macchiatos were some of the best coffee I‚Äôve had in a long time. The crepe was perfect balance of tart and sweet.

reviews.author: Walker J
reviews.text:
I was looking for a quiet place to have a nice glass of wine and a bite to eat. After a beautiful concert at the Cathedral of St. John the Divine. After trying a few different places that were way too loud, I found Cafe du Soleil.
The host tonight was Miguel. He was so gracious and welcoming. Even though I just wanted a little something, he showed me to a beautiful little table outside that is inside a plastic bubble! Very cozy and private. It was the perfect quiet experience to have a glass of wine and some delicious escargot on Broadway in New York City! I will be back, for sure. Very grateful to Miguel for the welcome.

reviews.author: Vladislava Kursheva
reviews.text:
What an amazing discovery.  Great atmosphere, wide menu selection, welcoming and professional service.
Every dish we tried left us curving to return for more.  My personal surprise was a blood sausage.  I tried plenty of them cooked Slavic style, but one we had in Cafe du Soleil - best of the best!!!

reviews.author: Amanda Vasquez
reviews.text:
Absolutely wonderful!!! Tried snails for the first time and I have to be honest I was skeptical..but they were absolutely delicious!! Especially when paired up with the delicious bread they give you! Had steak and eggs with fries, omg!! The best steak and eggs I‚Äôve ever had in my life! The bartenders were amazing and very communicative and comforting. Definitely coming here again!! 10/5!!!

Sorry I didn‚Äôt take pictures of the steak and eggs, I very much inhaled that food lol oh and the fries were spectacular too! Perfect amount of crunchy, crispy and flavorful!

reviews.author: Nicole Arsenault
reviews.text: Ordered on uber eats October 4 around 4 in the afternoon. Missing a drink, fries were old and cold, bottom of bag fell out as soon as l lifted it from the counter. Burger bacon was raw. No toppings as described (Lettuce tomato pickles etc). Mousse was warm. Onion Soup was tasteless.

reviews.author: Bry T
reviews.text:
Saiguette is one of those hidden gems in NYC that consistently delivers when it comes to Vietnamese comfort food, especially for takeout. I‚Äôve tried a good amount of Vietnamese spots in the city, and while Saiguette doesn‚Äôt offer a dine in experience (it‚Äôs strictly takeout), they make up for it with flavor, portion size, and speed.

The banh mi here is definitely the standout. Unlike some places that skimp on the fillings, Saiguette really loads it up. The bread is fresh with the perfect balance of crunch on the outside and softness inside, and the fillings are generous you don‚Äôt feel like you‚Äôre paying just for bread. I also appreciated that the balance of meat, pickled vegetables, and fresh herbs is done right, giving it that satisfying bite every time. Portion wise, it‚Äôs more than fair for the price, especially considering NYC standards where you often pay more for less.

Pho and other noodle dishes also come packed with flavor. The broth is rich, and the portions again don‚Äôt leave you hungry. For a takeout-only spot, the packaging is practical and sturdy it travels well, and you can enjoy it at home without everything spilling or getting soggy.

The one downside for me was more about the ownership and authenticity. When I asked if the restaurant was Vietnamese owned, one of the workers told me yes. Later on, I found out that the owner is not Vietnamese, which was a bit disappointing, especially after I tried speaking Vietnamese to him and realized it wasn‚Äôt the case. It doesn‚Äôt take away from the taste of the food, but as someone who values authenticity and cultural roots, it felt misleading.

Overall, though, Saiguette is worth trying if you‚Äôre in NYC and craving Vietnamese food. The quality, portion size, and fair pricing make it a solid choice, especially for banh mi lovers. While I wish the ownership had been upfront about the background, I can‚Äôt deny that the food itself is good and consistent.

reviews.author: Kate Mao
reviews.text: Saiguette has a really excellent Banh Mi. The lemongrass pork shoulder is my absolute favorite, the spicy creamy sauce is delicious and the pork is juicy. The veggies inside are generously portioned and the bread is crispy and soft. I probably eat it once a week and its genuinely almost a perfect sandwich.

reviews.author: Pippa Harding
reviews.text: Incredible pork shoulder lemongrass Banh Mi! Best I have ever had. The fresh bread is delicious, perfect flavour balance. Can't recommend enough.

reviews.author: Anthony Huang
reviews.text: Worth every moment. Their Grilled Juicy Boneless Chicken Thigh and the Grilled Lemon Grass Pork Shoulder banh mi was a whole new experience worth trying! One of my top choices!!

reviews.author: Emily Francisco
reviews.text: i went during lunch time so it was 10% off the Vietnamese iced coffee was strong and sweet. The pork sandwich was delish and so filling. The place doesn't have any indoor seating. however, its 2 blocks from central park

reviews.author: Robert Kachroo
reviews.text:
A typical bar with a restaurant vibe. A few TVs with sports, friendly staff, a few good draft beers on tap.

Amazing happy hour. $5 margaritas are tasty and they don't skimp on the alcohol. My favorite food are the wings and truffle fries.

Outdoor seating too. It can get busy and very loud. But at the same time lively.

It's classic sports bar style is familiar, has great food, friendly staff, a bargain happy hour. What's not to like. Stop by here if nearby.

reviews.author: Ji Seok Lee
reviews.text: One incompetent action after another. I ordered pick up it took 85 minutes. I should charge them for waiting my time. They told me they lost my order after 55 minutes and that a menu order was unavailable for take out after 80 minutes. I think i was too polite and accommodating for service this poor. I was forced to stand around for half an hour and they did absolutely nothing to make it up to me or try to kake things right. Not even an apology. The food is fine, but not worth this. Maybe if the food was even great but it's just good. Dishes are hit or miss. Some are really bland. I was not my decision to eat here and definitely won't ever be again.

reviews.author: Steve Bundy
reviews.text: Staff friendly and professional. Atmosphere/decor a bit dated but in a familiar way not worn out. It's a pub feel that you would want to visit often with your closest friend group. Chicken was dry. All greens fresh and tasty in salad. I think the pretzel was frozen and prepackaged then heated up or microwaved. Beer was great!

reviews.author: Doc Golden
reviews.text: We hosted a private party here for 50 people. The space was great and the staff was excellent! Bart, Max & James took care of absolutely everything we needed, were available whenever we needed anything and they were all delightful to work with.

reviews.author: Guy Eichler
reviews.text: An above average sports bar close to Columbia university. Good variety of food around $18 for a burger and fries which is not bad nowadays. Big variety of drinks and they always show main sports events on their many screens. You can watch a game from any table except for outdoors. It‚Äôs a big place but can get crowded sometimes. They have a standing area close to the bar.

reviews.author: Angela Rodriguez
reviews.text: I was looking for some Cuchifrito and stopped by La Isla. Over all it's is Puerto Rican food and tastes like it too. The service was ok but the staff had somewhat of an attitude (but who in NYC doesn't have one?). Not bad overall.

reviews.author: Terixo Smitix
reviews.text: They've proven their worth through reliable quality. The meals here truly impress. The food amount exceeds expectations at costs that work. The moment they saw us, every employee showed exceptional warmth. I plan to return and tell my friends to visit.

reviews.author: Elsa Bennett
reviews.text: I appreciated the thought put into how this place feels. The food satisfies consistently and the location saves me time. The meal preparation and worker care exceeded expectations. The food quality went past merely great. This spot is EXCELLENT!

reviews.author: Judith Vasquez
reviews.text: La Isla presents a challenge in knowing what to highlight first. Their meals taste fresh and come beautifully arranged. This spot fulfilled my expectations completely. Good food. Truly excellent staff. I appreciated the consistent quality.

reviews.author: Jilliann Thomas
reviews.text:
Overpriced and Rude Service

I've been here before, but after today, I will never return. I ordered a small soup, which used to be $6, and was shocked to see the price jump to $8.50. When I asked why, I was completely ignored. On top of that, the older lady at the register showed zero interest in serving me. She pinched the money from my hand like she didn‚Äôt even want to take it. The combination of ridiculous price hikes and rude service makes this place a hard pass for me. Definitely not worth it!

name: Safari
address: 55, Saint Nicholas Avenue, New York, NY, 10026

reviews.author: Idrees Khan
reviews.text:
Because of Safari, Somali food has now become one of my favorite cuisines ever! We ordered the Beef Suqaar, Mango Curry Chicken, and Hilib Ari. Literally everything was absolutely delicious!
The owner was extremely hospitable and I honestly cannot wait to go again. Make sure to ask for bananas to enhance the experience with your rice!

reviews.author: Tracy Wu (Yu-Lun)
reviews.text:
The food is good, but I suggest not going without a reservation.
We came in on a Friday night around 7 p.m. There was a huge group and a few other tables. Sadly, we were unable to get our starter until 8:30 p.m. and our entree at around 9 p.m. We were very frustrated to see that the staff was busy serving other tables and ignored us.
However, the food is delicious and authentic. If we can revisit this restaurant, we will definitely make a reservation.

reviews.author: InTheName OfFashion
reviews.text:
We stopped into Safari in Harlem for lunch, and at first, the completely empty dining room made us question our choice‚Äîbut I‚Äôm so glad we stayed!
Service-wise, our waiter wasn‚Äôt the friendliest or most attentive, but honestly, the food was so good it didn‚Äôt even matter.

We started with the Chicken Sambuca‚Äîperfectly thin, flaky dough wrapped around juicy, flavorful meat. Light, tasty, and a fantastic appetizer. For mains, we had the Goat (Hilib Ari) and the Lamb Shoulder. The lamb was a little on the dry side, but the goat was absolutely sublime‚Äîso tender it melted in your mouth, with amazing flavors and seasoning. The accompanying rice was aromatic and beautifully spiced, pairing perfectly with the meats.

Next time I‚Äôm in NYC, I‚Äôll definitely be coming back!

reviews.author: Gabriella Nicole
reviews.text: I was skeptical at first. I heard good things about this restaurant, but it was empty when I came in. Don‚Äôt be fooled by that though, the food is AMAZING. My friends and I barely spoke while we were eating. Just silence and the occasional joyful giggles because our bodies were in heaven. Please come in and make sure you try the chai, hibiscus juice and mango lassi. Also come with friends so you can get the full experience.

reviews.author: Betty Chen
reviews.text: The seating in the back is really traditional and cozy. Server was so nice and keep our chai tea warm all the time plus we got extra chai on the house. Food is well seasoned. The sauce was super delicious.

reviews.author: Irina Gu
reviews.text: I ordered the lunch special. The spicy tuna was very strange in color (yellow to gray), had no taste, and was not spicy. I would not recommend it. The eel avocado roll looked like a skin-ell avocado roll. :) The phyladelfia roll was okay. The food deserves 3 stars.

reviews.author: Locale Monkey
reviews.text: Sapps is the best for Japanese food. Good environment, good price and a lot of space! Specially if you wanna do birthday party or celebrating something special for your special moment and with special person.

reviews.author: tessa Lennox
reviews.text: Food was great! I enjoyed the tempura and takoyaki. The servers are very nice and the bathroom has a ton of anime and manga references :)

reviews.author: Steven Miller
reviews.text: My favorite neighborhood spot in LIC. Staff remember you, your order and are great people. Food-wise - I don‚Äôt know better sushi at this price point in the city. Is it omakase counter level? No. But, for a causal spot, this place is excellent.

reviews.author: Charlotte Cockburn
reviews.text: Honestly AMAZING meal! Food, service, atmosphere were all 10/10!! The teriyaki tofu was unreal and the sushi was delish!

reviews.author: Ori ‚ÄúLora‚Äù
reviews.text: Today had a horrific experience at this restaurant El Nuevo caridad  . I ordered baked chicken with beans and a salad, but when I started eating, I was disgusted to find a bug in my food. I immediately called the restaurant and asked to speak to a supervisor. He apologized and offered to send me a new order, but I was too sick to my stomach after seeing the bug. I asked for a refund instead, which he provided. I returned the remaining food, bug and all. Needless to say, I do not recommend this restaurant‚Ä¶ No compren comida aqu√≠ es asqueroso encontr√© una mosca, cucaracha en mi orden que asco!!!

reviews.author: Dess R
reviews.text: Most of the workers barley know English which is why I‚Äôm rating a 3. Very hard to explain what you want if you do not have or see someone who speaks both languages (English and Spanish) but I  came for the lunch special . Great price and great food . The rice and the chicken were very good .

reviews.author: Stacy P
reviews.text:
Food was okay, but the bill was totally different than the printed menu prices. The menu said sides were included but when the bill came we were charged separately. Total scam, the waitress didn‚Äôt say anything about sides being charged separately even though we asked when we ordered. The food was definitely not worth the overpriced cost.

Do not trust this restaurant to be honest. Stay away.

reviews.author: Sha J
reviews.text: I placed an order on uber eats. The restaurant called to say that they didnt have the food that I wanted. I told them that I would cancel on my end on uber eats and while I'm on the chat with customer service to get my full refund back, they canceled my order and I got charged for food I didn't receive. I will never patronize this restaurant ever again

reviews.author: Shanni L
reviews.text: Please please be careful me and my fiance do not feel good after eating from heregiving you guys another chance our stomach's hurt it was a whole chicken rice beans and mojito will not be ordering I remember years ago before covid 19 you guys actually cared were very clean never any issues with food but never again we will not order again no more chances

reviews.author: Violetta S
reviews.text: A wonderful place for lunch with a warm and cozy atmosphere. Every dish is thoughtfully prepared and full of flavor ‚Äî you can truly taste the love in every bite. The service was exceptional, and the staff were friendly, attentive, and welcoming. Huge thanks to the team for making the experience so special. Keep up the great work ‚Äî I‚Äôll definitely be coming back soon!

reviews.author: Karuth Williams
reviews.text: The aesthetic was super cute‚Äîdefinitely a cozy, stylish spot. We started with the Crispy Feta Cigars and the Beef & Pork Dumplings with caramelized onions, and both were absolutely mouthwatering. For the main, I had the Steak Frites (petite tender), which was incredibly satisfying‚Äîespecially paired with those perfectly crisp truffle fries.  We had a fantastic server‚Äîwarm, attentive, and really added to the experience. And the cocktails? Total hits. Definitely looking forward to coming back! Also The music selection was very cutesy very mindful. ü§ç

reviews.author: Diego C.
reviews.text: The food here is absolutely fantastic! The atmosphere is also really lovely; it's the perfect place to relax and enjoy a good meal. And the best part is, you usually don't have to wait for a table. I can't understand why this restaurant isn't as popular as it should be ‚Äì it's a real gem! I highly recommend giving it a try.

reviews.author: Kimberly Dugan
reviews.text:
The food was good. Let me start with that. It wasn't anything spectacular. The menu was fixed, but the variety was pretty good. I don't personally think it was worth the price. Now the details.

The beet salad was delicious. It was one of the appetizers. The oysters were good, however, one of the oysters had a pea crab in it. That really put us off.

The lamb was the best part of the meal. It was cooked perfectly, and the brussel sprouts they sat on were so flavorful.

The lobster ravioli were rather underwhelming. And again, for the cost, the quantity and presentation were both lacking.

Overall a good meal. We most likely will not be back

reviews.author: Jimmy Davis
reviews.text: I love this place. It‚Äôs so casual and comfortable and the food is sooooo good. Feels like one of those neighborhood gems. With unpretentious atmosphere and homey vibes. Everything I‚Äôve eaten has tasted great, like authentic home cooking. Borscht with meat, beef stroganoff, kale salad. All yum.

reviews.author: Ladii E
reviews.text: I was looking for a spot to grab lunch and walked by this place. Did a quick google search and the reviews were good so I decided to give it a try. I ordered 2 lunch specials and paid about $30 total. It was around 2 pm on a Friday and there were just 2 people dining in. The decor is probably the best thing about this place. It makes you feel like you‚Äôve stepped outta Brooklyn, right into Thailand. The dumplings were yummy but that‚Äôs about it. Food was basic and bland. The presentation was there at all (they could‚Äôve done better even for take out). The crispy fried chicken that‚Äôs supposed to go with one of the rice looked like a damn joke. The girl behind the bar seemed annoyed that I asked for a menu like ma‚Äôam. Let‚Äôs be so forreal ! She also had an attitude with the couple who were drinking because their meal was incorrect. I would NOT recommend !!

reviews.author: Veronika Parchevska
reviews.text:
During my recent visit to Rua Thai in Brooklyn, I was impressed by the perfect combination of a cozy atmosphere and attentive service. The restaurant's interior, designed in Thai style, exudes warmth, making it a welcoming space suitable for both casual dining and special events.
From the appetizer menu, we tried the Shrimp Donuts, which were wonderfully creamy, accompanied by a sauce that was truly delicious, along with the most exquisite Cheesy Crab Rangoon. For the main course, the Kai Tod Had Yai special was beautifully prepared, flaky, and seasoned to perfection. They even adjusted the spice level of the Rua Volcano to be milder just for us, and it was delightful.
The team at Rua Thai demonstrated remarkable attentiveness. Our server offered valuable suggestions, quickly refilled our drinks, and made certain that our dining experience was pleasant.
I highly recommend Rua Thai Restaurant.

reviews.author: Xintong Huang
reviews.text: Amazing Thai spot in Brooklyn! The Tomyum grilled river prawns were flavorful and beautifully presented, and the teriyaki fried rice with steak and egg came sizzling hot and perfectly seasoned. Great Thai tea too ‚Äî rich and creamy. Cozy vibe and super friendly staff. Definitely coming back! üáπüá≠‚ú®

reviews.author: Jimmy Zhao
reviews.text:
RUA Thai is a cozy Thai restaurant in Brooklyn with a warm and relaxed atmosphere. The staff is friendly and the service is smooth.

The Grab Curry (soft shell crab curry) is the highlight ‚Äî rich flavor, real Thai spice, and very delicious with rice. The Thai Iced Tea is creamy and helps balance the heat.

The cocktail Chili & The Moon is fun and unique. It‚Äôs made with mezcal and mango puree, and it comes with sweet crispy fish snacks on the side ‚Äî surprisingly tasty.

The Steak & Egg Teriyaki Fried Rice is also very good. The steak is tender and the egg on top makes the rice extra flavorful.

For dessert, the Mango Coconut Sticky Rice is fresh and sweet, with strong coconut flavor.

Overall, great food, real Thai taste, and a nice place to relax. Definitely worth trying!

reviews.author: Yongyi Li
reviews.text:
Really great Thai spot in Brooklyn! The food was full of flavor and everything tasted super fresh.
We tried the Mala Wings, Tom Yum Soup, Drunken Noodles, and the Teriyaki Steak ‚Äî all amazing!
The staff were really friendly and the atmosphere was cozy but stylish. Perfect for a casual dinner or date night üçúüíõ
Highly recommend if you‚Äôre around Smith Street!

reviews.author: Lindsay Alexander
reviews.text: Great pancakes and cute atmosphere. We didn‚Äôt have to wait to long even with no reservation. Bacon was crispy. I want to come back sometime for dinner! CASH ONLY

reviews.author: Princess Williams
reviews.text: I've been here about 6 times. I haven't been disappointed AT ALL! Which is why my husband and I keep coming back. I've had the tacos, salmon, pancakes, and today my husband had the French toast. The food is awesome. The service is great. The atmosphere is cool. They even have a cute, quiet, little corner to eat if you're dining alone which I've done and read my book. They also have an outside area in the back. I plan on becoming a regular here. 10 out of 10 HIGHLY recommend!

reviews.author: Jeff Tsang
reviews.text: I‚Äôve ordered delivery from here quite frequently and it‚Äôs normally good, but I ordered a medium rare salmon today and got something that was ice cold and mealy in the center, something like 80% raw past the surface. I‚Äôm guessing they might have cooked the filet straight from the fridge??? Either way it‚Äôs not medium rare.

reviews.author: Liz Cong
reviews.text:
Tasty Brunch Spot, fluffy pancakes and mimosas
üòãü•ûüçæ

Came here back in November and just now getting around to this review‚Ä¶but it was memorable enough for me to remember this Sunday morning with my sister and hubby.

Wait wasn‚Äôt too long but there is a queue‚Ä¶earlier is better.

Menu has standard breakfast, brunch and lunch fare.

I ordered the salmon salad and was pleasantly surprised with the generous portion of salmon, avocado and crisp fresh veggies. Salmon was cooked perfectly.

Pancakes were so good. Crisp edges and fluffy goodness. Hard to share this.

Eggs Benedict - good, potatoes could have been a tad more seasoned but they were cooked nicely. Love that you can order just one portion.

Mimosas were a good accompaniment to a great brunch.
Service was fast and attentive.

Nice, lively neighborhood eatery.

reviews.author: Kyana Ifill
reviews.text: So crazy thing but I must say, worst thing here is the pancake. I know it gets all the hype and the other reviews are true, crispy edges and fluffy inside but that‚Äôs literally it. The actual pancake has no flavor and needs syrup. I am a fan of specialty pancakes with the fruit in flavor baked/cooked in. If you want a classic pancake that requires copious syrup, here you go! Otherwise skip that. Otherwise the food was shockingly good. We got a couple sunny side eggs and sausage (delicious of course), the open faced grilled chicken sandwich and chips and guacamole‚Ä¶.that might have been the best chips and guacamole I‚Äôve ever had. And based on the comments about the chilaquiles I think the sleeper here is the Mexican food. The grilled chicken sandwich was good, great sauce and stuffed once you tried to close it. The sourdough was delicious and toasty. I saw another table order chips and guacamole and clearly got more chips than us so they aren‚Äôt standardized with that unfortunately. Our service was also incredibly slow. I saw people who sat after us get food, drink, and get order taken before us. We waited about 20 min to get our orders taken and the food took long to come out. Unfortunately sandwich is not pictured. The Shirley temple was quite good per my bf but I gave up soda for lent so didn‚Äôt try. But it was so good he ordered two. I got apple juice and I‚Äôm not sure why I got a smaller cup, that‚Äôs always a pet peeve of mine, different size cups for juice vs soda or tea. Anyways I would definitely come back for Tex mex night or something else. Menu was extensive and a lot of things (salad, sandwich, pasta) looked good. Once again MUST DROP A STAR IF YOU‚ÄôRE CASH ONLY IN 2025.

reviews.author: Michael ‚ÄúMarion‚Äù Pena
reviews.text: Had brunch with a good friend, we both had meal sets with happy hour drinks and dessert! Came out to about $48 each, and the sake cup with the panda design is free to take back home! This is the best, authentic izakaya-style Japanese restaurant in Washington Heights. Music wasn‚Äôt too loud but still contributed to the good vibes. Shout out to our server Peter!

reviews.author: Francelys Abreu (Curlyceliss)
reviews.text: My partner and I love this place for it‚Äôs authenticity. The food is very fresh and ridiculously delicious. I love they included a new combo of a mini ramen bowl. Our recommendation will be that the place should upgrade to a bigger spot because it feels very overwhelming when its full and there are other people waiting inside for a spots to be available.

reviews.author: Darren Thompson
reviews.text:
Its a small location, but its got a vibe! The staff were nice. The floor is a bit uneven, bur thats typical of hole in the wall NYac restaurants. Not complaining, though.

Several vegetarian/vegan options.

Loved it

reviews.author: Kevin hernandez
reviews.text: There‚Äôs a ton of ramen spots in NYC. But this one is FIREüî•everything from the appetizer to the entrees and their home made ginger ale goes well with a spicy bowl of ramen ! I got the spiciest ramen I think it had dragon in its name and my girl got the spicy miso ramen‚Ä¶definitely recommend! Try their fried chicken and pan seared pork and veggie dumplings too! This spot was a solid 10 for me üò≠

reviews.author: Claire
reviews.text: The mini-sized ramen set was satisfying and well put together. I wanted more dumplings, so I ordered another one. I think I‚Äôll be craving that ale beer again, too.

reviews.author: Abedallah darwish
reviews.text: My first 5/5! I truly enjoyed my meal here. The service was good but the star of the show was the atmosphere and of course the food. would come again anytime i‚Äôm back in NY.

reviews.author: Aatiq Antique
reviews.text:
I recently visited Saggio, a Sicilian restaurant, and found the experience mixed.

The interior was inviting, with a warm and cozy atmosphere that made for a pleasant dining environment.

As for the food, the fried calamari was decent‚Äîcrispy and tender, but it lacked the standout flavor I was hoping for. The chicken was okay as well; it was well-cooked but didn't have the depth of seasoning I expected.

Overall, while Saggio has a nice ambiance, the food could use some improvement to truly shine.

reviews.author: Kilgore Trout
reviews.text:
Saggio is a far and away a main staple of the neighborhood and has been for years. I've been here many times and have never left unsatisfied.

Is it the best Italian you've ever had, especially in a city like New York? Probably not. But they're insanely consistent and the service is warm and friendly--especially their bar staff. They have a lot of employees that have been there for years and very much care for the clientele they serve and they make an effort to actually remember you.

I'm a fan of their frequent rotating dinner specials that change from season-to-season. They rarely miss. I've also never had something off of their main menu that I've ever disliked, and I love to try new things, so it's nice to have a wide spread to let you adventure out, but you can always find the regular go-tos as well.

It's a relief to have somewhere that you can trust like them in Hudson Heights.

The wife and I are a big fan of their bottomless brunch on the weekends. Their back patio is a gorgeous little cozy nook in the middle of the city that blocks out all of the noise from the busy street in front of it.

Since they changed out the old tables to booths, the ambiance has felt very cozy. Vibes are on-point.

If you come back frequently, you'll see a lot of regulars at the bar during happy hour, and people aren't afraid to engage in conversation, which is abnormal (and welcome) in recent times. I've randomly met some pretty cool people.

reviews.author: jana moubarak
reviews.text: This restaurant is a hidden gem. It is the perfect ambience for a date, but also for a chill hang out with a group of friends. The waiters were professional and it was a very quick service. I had the penne pomodoro pasta, which I highly recommend. It was very flavorful and delicious. I also had tiramisu for dessert, which is the best tiramissu I have ever had. The prices are also very affordable for such a beautiful place.

reviews.author: Nathan Useche
reviews.text: I was out with my family when we came in out of nowhere. With no reservation, we entered to be welcomed by a great ambience and aroma. The service was exceptional and my black pasta was amazing. My family greatly enjoyed their meal too. Everything was fresh and I couldn‚Äôt be happier. The Ricotta Cheesecake for dessert was very nice and unique, not too sweet but of great flavor. I will for sure be back in the future!

reviews.author: Blair Boyer
reviews.text:
GREAT food! The Pizza is real New York and the sandwiches are amazing. I have the Meatball Parm or Eggplant Parm Panini...both very filling and tastes. They also have great salads. My favorite is the Kale & Fig Salad. Also try the Garlic Knots!
Prices are very affordable. The staff is super friendly.

reviews.author: Crash Gregg
reviews.text: A great place in the Washington Heights neighborhood for a slice of good homemade pie, pasta, panini, or even a salad. Friendly folks clean tables, and good customer service. Try the Margherita, the Sicilian, or any of their great specialty pies.

reviews.author: Andre Schoolman
reviews.text:
A local pizza place, with specialty pies beyond your basic cheese, pepperoni, etc. not tons of seating, very crowded on Fridays and weekends, but always a good vibe.

The one problem I have with this local establishment is the prices; $6 before tax for a speciality slice (basically anything not cheese) is shooting way over the average city price, especially because you can go a few blocks away and get a reasonably priced slice of slightly lesser quality.

Restaurants are not immune to inflation, but this place seems to be taking it to a new level, and disregarding the actual value of their product. Because of the prices, I am a less frequent customer.

reviews.author: me4tisbivayutsya
reviews.text:
I usually like this place, but there is one FEMALE CASHIER who makes the whole experience terrible. She is extremely rude, disrespectful, and talks to customers in a very unprofessional way. Yesterday she even overcharged me for two slices ‚Äî almost $14‚Äî and I only noticed when I got home. I paid with a credit card, so I didn‚Äôt see the total right away.
Her attitude is unacceptable. I hope the management pays attention to this, because customers shouldn‚Äôt be treated like this.

UPG: Please listen to me for a moment. I completely understand that you are a family-run business, and maybe this cashier is your relative ‚Äî your sister, daughter, or someone close. But that does not give her the right to speak to customers in a raised voice, be disrespectful, rude, or make personal comments.

To be honest, I really like your pizza. I like the place, the atmosphere, everything. But I will never come back again ‚Äî not because of your food or prices, but because of this one cashier. And as long as she continues to work there, I personally will not return.

I have also spoken with several neighbors in our area, and everyone says the same thing ‚Äî her rudeness is not only toward customers, but also toward delivery workers and even other staff. It creates a very unpleasant experience.

Please don‚Äôt reply with a standard template message. Just take this seriously and pay attention to the situation.

reviews.author: Kilgore Trout
reviews.text:
Fresco's is a reliable, no frills neighborhood pizza joint that you can rely on.

They're consistent, but full disclosure, they're going to charge you out the wazoo for just about everything. Even a basic slice is as pricey as you'd pay down on Bleecker Street, so don't expect any uptown discount. But their Vodka Slice worth every damn penny. The wife and I prefer to come in and get various slices between the two of us, because a whole pie can set you back over $30 at times.

Pro Tip: Pay in cash. Pay a little less.

As with most other spots in the 'hood, you'll be left supplementing your own salt and seasoning, because the aging demographic has a stranglehold on every restaurant in the area in regards to sodium content. The white-haired rabble generally want the bare minimum. And they complain about. A lot. I guess they're salty enough.

Fresco's also has a nice spread of different slices--especially white pies--which is pretty unique to most other spots in the city, who only offer red pies. They're absolutely a class above most other pizza joints in the neighborhood.

It's a family run shop, so you'll see the same people behind the counter time after time. Most of the time they're pretty friendly, especially the dudes baking your slices, they go the extra mile to keep you returning and will make small talk if they're not overwhelmed. Good fellas.

If you haven't been inside and only walked by outside, you've assuredly dodged the swath of bikes and delivery guys outside that make it look like a post-apocalyptic bicycle gang occupies their space, but it just turns out they're one of the most delivered pizza joints in the entire US, so I can only assume they know what they're doing to keep people happy. I sure am.

reviews.author: Cecilia Perez
reviews.text:
Omg this place was amazing!! Everything was super freaking delicious where we were happy to spend the money. I do have one small complaint that we opted to order the LARGE Henny Colada cocktails but were not warned that they were $60 each!! Luckily,we could afford it but I know that it could be a problem for some people. The drinks were tasty, strong and had 3 small Hennessy bottles as floaters do they were totally worth the $ but still, a little warning would've been nice.

Every single dish had soooo much flavor!!

reviews.author: Nery Espinal
reviews.text: This restaurant exceeded all my expectations. The food was delicious, and the service was outstanding. I will return and bring family members to enjoy the excellent Honduran cuisine.

reviews.author: Pinero QGTM
reviews.text: Restaurante catracho todo estuvo delicioso. Las baleadas and pupusas were delicious . Will be coming back for the fried chicken

reviews.author: Michael Ruggieri
reviews.text: This has become my new favorite place to eat‚Ä¶ I highly recommend it!! Food is so good and if you want to drink this is the place‚Ä¶ask for a large drink, I dare you‚Ä¶incredible‚Ä¶so good!!!

reviews.author: Dionne Grinage
reviews.text: I had am amazing time at Seis Vecinos. Shelley was my waitress. She was amazing. The food was fantastic as well. I ordered the Seafood Paella. It was perfectly seasoned and came with a salad . They sung Happy Birthday to me and made me feel so special.  I will definitely be back. I'm so lucky to have this gem of a restaurant so close in my neighborhood. You don't need to go to Manhattan for excellent service.

reviews.author: Dieter Ferreira
reviews.text:
Solid 4.5 here. When are they going to allow half-points?
Excellent cocktails variety. Indulge if you must.
First time here at the UrbanCoveSociety (is this related to the Guernsey Literary & Potato Peel Pie Society?), drawn by the promise of good branzino and real tablecloths üôÑ, part of the 33 Seaport Hotel.
Quietish early on a Sat evening. The decor could use a hand, me thinks, but great low-key music.

The branzino (European seabass) came fileted (not whole per pictures) and did not disappoint! Was so impressed I forgot photo... maybe it was the cognac... Intriguing lemon chili dressing, supported graciously by oodles of garlic in my spinach side order. Recommended.
Last but not least, the banana bread pudding was a bit firmer than my dessert fork grip expected, but matched well by excellent caramel ice cream so overall very good.

reviews.author: Lisa Hall
reviews.text:
So we bought a travel zoo voucher and went for brunch on a Sunday. When we arrived there was no one in the front. We waited about 4 mins before we actually saw someone.

We were seated and offered some water.  No one introduced themselves through the whole process. The restaurant was cool, and the atmosphere was chill. It was not a busy afternoon at all. There were only 4 groups in total in the whole place.

We waited about 10 minutes before a young lady came over and we showed her our voucher and told her what we wanted. THEY HAD NO CHICKEN AND NO STEAK! It was not okay because my friend only eats chicken. Anyway we adjusted and I got a burger and she got French toast.

We waited 45 mins for our food....did I mention it was not busy. The pastry basket was very sad, and no one checked on us after we got the mimosas. A gentle man came over to say sorry there was no chicken 2 mins before the food came out. The burger was salty, I ate it because I was hungry. My friend said her French toast was good.

We waited long in general for everything, the food, the bill, the service. Really had to rethink the tipping but she did leave a tip anyway.

reviews.author: Alizabeth
reviews.text:
This restaurant was an incredible find! I used a Groupon for a three-course dinner for two, and everything went perfectly ‚Äî no issues at all. The food was outstanding, especially the mashed potatoes (seriously, don‚Äôt skip them!). The cocktails were not only gorgeous but also tasted amazing.
The staff were warm, attentive, and made us feel right at home. The ambiance was calm and elegant, with great music that set the perfect mood. Honestly, I‚Äôd give this place more than 10/10 if I could ‚Äî I‚Äôm already looking forward to my next visit!

reviews.author: Kaliana Martinez
reviews.text: This place is absolutely amazing!!! I had a groupon for a 3 course dinner for 2 and no complications at all. All of the food was phenomenal especially their mashed potatoes (must try!!) Their cocktails were beautiful and so great. The staff were very attentive and super sweet and welcoming. The place was very quiet with a gorgeous atmosphere and a plus for great music too. 100/10 and I hope to come back soon!

reviews.author: josh hill
reviews.text: The shellfish platter was outstanding, featuring fresh head-on prawns, chilled lobster tail, and locally sourced oysters. Everything was incredibly fresh and cooked to perfection. The specialty bourbon cocktail recommended by our server paired beautifully with the meal. I can‚Äôt wait to return!

reviews.author: Joel Hernandez
reviews.text: Wow, the wait to get in was long! Was it worth it? Well the favor was different from the Chinese food I‚Äôm accustomed too. Not offensive but definitely different. Egg rolls were amazing! Service was top notch we got along with our server, an instant rapport was created! He was witty, sarcastic, funny and genuine. They can cook to your dietary needs.

reviews.author: Mona Posti
reviews.text:
Do not go here!!

Family dinner. We ordered two kinds of vegetable low mein. Our usual chinese favorite. But in this restaurant the noodles tasted like burned grease. Neither of us was able to eat the noodles. The vegetables were ok. Our child had chicken fried rice. He could not eat his food either. I told two members of the staff that we could not eat the food and definitely we did not want to take it with us. They did not care.
As soon as we paid, they started emptying the table although we still had our drinks. While I used the bathroom, they actually took my daughter's drink from her and asked her and the child to leave the table.
Advice: do not pay before you are definitely ready to leave immediately. Staff is extremely rude.
Only one unisex bathroom available :(

reviews.author: Eliesabeth Gasser
