reviews.text: Delicious and absolutely classic NY restaurant. The service here is direct and fast paced, as is common in Chinatown. I celebrated my birthday here with a party of 10!! They set up a table just for us, despite not taking reservations. We had a FEAST of food, for less than 25$ per person, including beers. Come here with friends and eat up! Make sure to order the duck fried rice, a Lo mein, and the snow peas with bean sprouts. They do all of the Cantonese-American classics well, so really order anything. Everyone was so fun and kind. We were cracking jokes all night and they even gave me a free Wo Hop t-shirt for my birthday! Love these guysssss.

reviews.author: David Cabanzo
reviews.text: What a classic nyc Chinese restaurant! Very cool atmosphere. The service is quick and servers are super nice. The fried rice was incredible and the veggies but the pineapple duck wasn‚Äôt good! It was super sweet and the pink sauce definitely doesn‚Äôt help. Maybe next time will get classic dishes not some sort of specials.

reviews.author: Marie Fetzer
reviews.text:
The place was super busy, but surprisingly there was a table for me. I enjoyed the fried fish. It was delicious. I wish my friends were with me because I wanted to try more food but didn't want to be wasteful. I have already planned my trip back to try more.

It's a really cool and unique place serving authentic Chinese cuisine. The price was so reasonable. My meal was under $20. I left feeling happy and full. The service was great.

The place is in a basement and it is a bit cramped. Lots of orders going out the door for takeout.

I did not wait to be seated.

This place has unique decor and vibe.

reviews.author: deepan prabhu
reviews.text:
Mapo tofu rocks,

Usually all chinese places give a liquid like water with tofu, but here it‚Äôs so savory, flavor filled, spicy and up for grabs!

The cedar fried rice tastes awesome, usually has a motor oil/wok taste to it - but thats what  I bought it for.

Tasty chow fun, mild, flavor rich and yummy.

Beef coriander soup was okish.

Don‚Äôt get the dumplings, they seem fresh but just have a bland doughy taste.

reviews.author: Adnan Jehan
reviews.text: We got the gluten free beef chow mein and it was a very underwhelming dish. They straight up brought exactly that and nothing else. No vegetables in the dish, no soy sauce and no chili sauce. For the cost, a little crazy. We had to channel the vegetables previously cooked in the same wok through the noodles to pretend to enjoy it. A little effort in dish would have gone a long way. When you order ask what else is in your dishes before trusting the menu. I get simplicity but for $20 bucks that was under simple.

reviews.author: Isabella Furrick
reviews.text: For an appetizer, we got the jellyfish. It was so bouncy. The daikon and carrot slaw cut the saltiness nicely. For an entree, we got the chef‚Äôs special and asked for it very spicy. It did not disappoint!! We also got the lamb and mixed vegetables in garlic sauce. The lamb texture was on point, and the dish was very flavorful. Would absolutely recommend if you have dietary restrictions, they‚Äôre very accommodating!!

reviews.author: Robert Vilches
reviews.text: This place is the real deal. Great food. Great portion sizes. Always end up ordering too much, but always end up finishing everything because the food is great. Super clean restaurant. Cool staff. Dinner menu is awesome, but the Dim Sum menu is where it‚Äôs at. Shark fin dumplings, mushroom rice rolls, sticky rice lotus leaf are favorites of mine but you can‚Äôt go wrong with anything.

reviews.author: Bradley C
reviews.text:
This is my favorite vegetarian Chinese restaurant. We ordered pan fried dumplings, tofu skin with cedar sauce, mixed sea food with cedar sauce in taro bowl, eggplant in spicy laksa sauce, Buddha‚Äôs delight pan fried noodles, and Fujian fried rice.

Everything was so delicious. I love their cedar sauce. It goes so well with everything, and it‚Äôs so fragrant and savory.

My favorite dish was the mixed seafood with cedar sauce in taro bowl. It has been my no. 1 for a long time. I have to get it whenever I‚Äôm here. I also love the Buddha‚Äôs delight pan fried noodles. The crunchy noodles with slightly gluey sauce were just perfect. Especially when the noodles were mixed with the sauce and got a bit saggy, it was the most delightful texture. The braised tofu skin with cedar sauce was also very good. I especially love the cabbage they put in the bottom of the plate. It absorbs the flavor and with the sweetness of its own.

It was my first time trying their Fujian fried rice. The idea was very similar to the Buddha‚Äôs delight pan fried noodles, but replaced the noodles with fried rice. I love the bits of the ham in the sauce.

Everything was simply delicious, but just like almost all Chinese food, it‚Äôs a bit greasy. Good thing was they had some tea to go with it. The servers were also pretty pleasant and friendly.

reviews.author: Sam
reviews.text:
The food tasted and looked as though it was the free offering on a continental economy flight. The steak was so bad we questioned whether it was steak at all. Absolute robbery at the price they charge.

The service was friendly and attentive and they accommodated a large group. Granted the restaurant was empty, which after eating the food, was understandable.

It reminded me a bit of food one would find at a gas station in regards to its freshness.

It is scraping an extra star on account of the service alone. Which wasn‚Äôt breaking any records but was nonetheless inoffensive.

Will gladly not return to ‚ÄúEastwood NY‚Äù

reviews.author: rich caplan
reviews.text: I love this place! The food is perfect.  Perfectly presented with attentive and friendly service within a space that has vinyl spun tunes and great beer. I‚Äôm going very soon.

reviews.author: Brendan A. MacWade
reviews.text: A really nice restaurant that is very committed to outdoor and ventilated dining. The menu is a little eccentric! It's American-European-Israeli. Like Oliver Bar nearby, it can only serve spritzes, beer, and wine (no cocktails). But their spritzes are inspired. It's a cool place. Service is super friendly. The bar is excellent, and it spins music on vinyl. I can't wait to go back!

reviews.author: Rebecca Emilia Malley
reviews.text: This is a neighborhood hang. The food is bar food but that doesn‚Äôt mean it isn‚Äôt tasty just is solid food that‚Äôs simple and gets the job done when hungry, plus the drinks, location and the amazing staff take all this up to a 5. It‚Äôs a place you want to come back because it has a heart and soul - theirs are regulars, working folk, meetups that are occurring for business or friends that haven‚Äôt seen each other in sometime. One of those unique and beautiful community waterholes.

reviews.author: Matty Lee
reviews.text:
A beautiful, casual but intimate bar/restaurant. Great for those private days when you want to read a book during lunch or bring friends in the evening.

Beautiful wine selection, their falafel, French fries, cauliflower pita sandwhich, hummus dishes are tasty.

Would recommend.

reviews.author: Kiril Kuzmin
reviews.text: This places serves real Spanish food, which does not happen too often in the United States, unfortunately. Lovely. The only thing that I would change is that majority of tables are in the open area, I would prefer a bit more intimate atmosphere.

reviews.author: C B (CB)
reviews.text: Much√≠simas gracias por todos los a√±os de excelente servicio y deliciosa comida! Y por celebrar conmigo un a√±o mas! I work in the area and I have been a loyal customer for almost 15 years and although many things have changed food quality and excellent service haven‚Äôt! Staff is attentive and knowledgeable, I always feel welcomed there! Whether you want a solo lunch at the bar or come with a happy group of friends for yheir delicious sangria and paella you won‚Äôt be disappointed!! Lunch specials are great, so is the paella, solomillo, bacalao and pollo al ajillo.  Desserts are delicious! tres leches flan was a chef‚Äôs kiss! Come for the sangria stay for the service!! Thank you guys for all the years of service and good memories!

reviews.author: Patrick Lopez
reviews.text: I have been going to El Pote since I was a baby and while I don‚Äôt remember those early visits I remember the recent ones with fondness. The staff is excellent. They have always been friendly and accommodating, but beyond that they are remarkably good at their job. The food has always been delicious and the portions are usually more than my family and I can handle, leading to the arguments of who gets to eat the leftovers. The red sangria is a staple for my family followed by some combination of paella and most recently the fideua. El Pote is an establishment of New York and should be revered amongst New Yorkers who enjoy quality.

reviews.author: Zorica "Zora" Poljak, eXp Realty
reviews.text: The food at El Pote Espa√±ol was absolutely delicious! The staff was friendly, welcoming, and made the experience feel warm and personal.

reviews.author: Mike Miguel
reviews.text: El Pote Espa√±ol offers a delightful dining experience with a cozy, intimate atmosphere. The service was attentive and knowledgeable about the menu, making for a pleasant evening. We had a great time! Staff is very friendly and the food is exquisite! Highly recommended! Thank you!

reviews.author: Amandip Kaur
reviews.text: I came here for my birthday brunch with friends and had the best experience ! Staff was very kind and service was excellent. All the dishes were very tasty and you could tell the ingredients were fresh and very good quality (they use seasonal produce from their farm). I took the biscuit & poached eggs and French toast: each dish was flavorful and well balanced. They also had freshly squeezed orange juice so 10 / 10 for me. Thank you for the hospitality; will be back for dinner soon :)

reviews.author: Jeniree Candurin
reviews.text: This is the best place I've been. They did an excellent job at every single step. First of all, the service was top notch, everyone seemed to come out of a happy movie, always kind, sweet and more. Then it came the food, OMG, I ate my place with my eyes closed just savoring every bite, and my husband's burger was not far behind, the flavor of the meat was amazing. Finally, I truly enjoyed that the environment allowed conversations without loud music blasting my ears. Overall, a great place to have a wine and relax.

reviews.author: L.
reviews.text:
Get $25 off your bill through the link on my profile!

The restaurant is located in a lovely neighborhood in Williamsburg, perfect for walking around in the summer. Aware that they used to have a Michelin star, I went in with somewhat heightened hopes but also not too expectant ‚Äî then was surprised with an incredible meal start to finish.

The whisky cocktail was really well balanced, clean and on point, crafted better than most bars. The octopus chorizo and spiced duck breast were even more delicious; from the first mouthwatering wafts when the dishes are placed on the table to the wonderful blend of flavors, everything delivered perfectly. When you ask for the bill, it comes with a small coconut dessert that‚Äôs warm and chewy. I savored every bite of it and still think about it now.

Beginning to end everything delivered! Even the leftovers I brought home and shared apparently tasted very good. Would strongly recommend this place to anyone who is considering going.

reviews.author: vfernandez515
reviews.text: Had a great time with my girlfriends. Everything from the cappuccino, to the green fried tomatoes, the huevos rancheros, the chorizo omelette and mimosa tray were amazing. Great ambience and service. Definitely coming back with the love of my life. The doughnuts were not my fave though.

reviews.author: Ken Wong
reviews.text: Meadowsweet exceeds expectations with its expertly prepared dishes in a chic restaurant near the Williamsburg Bridge. Roasted chicken with gnocchi stole the show for us. Great service too!

reviews.author: Pamelaj Payne
reviews.text: I stopped by Win Son for brunch. The line was long, but it moved pretty quickly. I ordered the fried chicken box and it was really good! Well-seasoned, crispy and juicy. I would recommend this place located in the hip neighborhood of Bushwick on Graham Ave. Outdoor seating is also available.

reviews.author: Sammy Q
reviews.text:
A modern and innovative bakery with strong potential to keep growing.

Order: Scallion pancake cheese and egg, mochi donut, fan taun, nian ago sesame fig, jasmine lavender milk tea, latte = $53~

The scallion pancake and mochi donut I've seen meet viral status on social media, for the amount of hype it's received Id say it's more the innovation behind it that's appealing than the taste. Nothing extraordinarily groundbreaking but it's an interesting refreshing twist to try. Same goes to the humble fan taun. What my friend and I mutually agreed is absolutely delicious is the seasonal nian gao fig pastry. Nian gao batter, layered with creamy custard, fig jam and topped with smooth mascoropone cream and figs - WOW. You don't have to be a sweet tooth to enjoy this, you just need to love yourself enough to treat yourself with this. Kudos to the pastry chef.

The drinks itself was fine but I felt the food does the storytelling here. I'd revisit to give the menu another shot out of curiosity. This place is for those who want to broaden their taste palette.

reviews.author: Annie Robertson
reviews.text:
Incredible Taiwanese-American Bakery. Mochi donut is to die for, unlike any other place. The scallion pancake wrapped sandwiches are also killer. My go to is the Juicai package and add bacon and of course, the BEC is yum as well. Lately I tried the shrimp milk bun (available after 3:30) and that was amazing as well. Top tier spot!

It is definitely fusion so I wouldn‚Äôt go in with expectations for it to be authentic Taiwanese food because that‚Äôs just not what it is. Lines are long on the weekends but it does move fast. It‚Äôs in my neighborhood so I like to go weekday afternoons after work ‚Äî if you‚Äôre in the area on a weekday it‚Äôs perfect and there should be plenty of spots to sit outside.

reviews.author: Sheila
reviews.text:
This review is about sustainability! ‚ò∫Ô∏è

By 2050, there will be more plastic in the ocean than fish. Which is why I so appreciate, that in this waterfront city, you choose to offer your customers the dignity of real silverware, ceramic mugs, and glasses for water.

I love to support businesses that are mindful of our impact on the environment, locally and globally.

So thank you for setting an example of how a caf√© can operate sustainably. I hope more local spots follow suit!

And of course, delicious food and a perfect cappuccino.

reviews.author: Jason Masong
reviews.text:
So fun and tasty I came here twice during my short 3 day stay in Brooklyn.

Playful Chinese-fusion bakery treats. Get the pancake wraps.

Other overlooked items are the soymilk (with dough sticks to dip in) and asian salads

Trrated myself with a red rice donut too.

reviews.author: Indy Life with Lexus
reviews.text:
Good atmosphere and very nice decoration.
I got lunch spacial eggplant basil with mock duck. They served with soup and salad(I love it)  , Quck & crunch was very good and yummy. Staffs have provided good service , nice and helpful.
Recommend this restaurant and I will come back for sure.

reviews.author: Thanapol Engel
reviews.text:
We had such an amazing experience at Forever Thai! Their Fall Special Menu truly impressed us, every dish was beautifully presented and full of bold Thai flavors. The Aquatic Duck Dance was tender and rich with red curry and fruit, while the Velvet Egg Octopus was perfectly cooked with a hint of sweetness. The Quick & Crunch duck salad was refreshing with a great balance of tangy and spicy flavors.

The cocktails were just as good, we tried the Lychee Martini, Mai Tai, and their Buy 2 Get 1 Free mystery drink, all delicious and fun for fall evenings.

The restaurant itself is cozy and elegant with great lighting and a welcoming vibe. Service was attentive and friendly throughout. Definitely one of the best Thai spots in Bushwick, we‚Äôll be back soon!

reviews.author: Curtis Bernadeau-Pierre
reviews.text: Forever Thai is an absolute delight! The food is fresh, flavorful, and beautifully balanced ‚Äî every dish felt like it was their specialty. The atmosphere is warm and inviting, perfect for a cozy dinner or casual night out. What truly made our experience special, though, was our server, Toey. He was, attentive, and took his time to explain the menu. Made us feel completely at home. It‚Äôs rare to find service this thoughtful. We‚Äôll definitely be coming back!

reviews.author: Fatima Hashem
reviews.text: My friend and I came here because we were craving thai food, and honestly this is probably one of the best places for thai we have ever tried! We loved the Thai Iced Tea and we both praised how perfectly sweet it was. I got the Basil Fried Rice and it was stunning. My friend got the Drunken Noodles and she said she loved how saucy they were, and were a good warming spice. Overall, highly recommend coming here for good food and a good atmosphere!

reviews.author: Ruben
reviews.text:
Forever Thai was truly delicious and amazing quality all around üôå I came for the $15 lunch special and also got a beer ($8 for Chang or Sinha and they brought it with a chilled glass üíúüç∫). Total after tax was 24.99 (before tipü§û). In my opinion it‚Äôs one of the best deals in the neighborhood and it lasts until 4pm

Pineapple fried rice was great and tasted fresh with a good amount of veggies, the chicken in it was solid too

They also offered me an extra Thai tea drink they had made and it was super tasty üôè disclaimer that free drinks aren‚Äôt guaranteed lol but this does show that they care about customer satisfaction and don‚Äôt want to waste food ü§ò

reviews.author: CL G
reviews.text: I loved this place. I was treated well. I walked in and ordered a latte and paisano hero. The cashier told me that it was the same price for a roll, hero or white bread. I just got it how it normally comes and told them spicy. It tasted great. The latte was legit, excellent tasting. The female working there made it for me. The place is out of my way plus I have to feed the meter, so I know I won't be coming that often. It is definitely worth a try, though. I like that they sell many different types of ravioli in the back in the freezer (among them crab and lobster).

reviews.author: Isaiah Hyman
reviews.text: After seeing this place for months on my IG feed, I decided to pop in while I was in Brooklyn to try the Matt & Steve 2.0 and The Paisano. Both sandwiches did not disappoint. The service was quick and and they also have a lot of pre-made dessert options as well. There's a couple of picnic tables outside on the side of the building but other than that, there's not much else regarding seating.

reviews.author: Adam Arciola
reviews.text: Had this place on my bucket list for a long time. Happy I finally got here, and what an awesome experience.  I got a bunch of sandwiches for myself and my family.  They were awesome!!! My wife got the FDNY, I got my mother the Anthony & Daughter and added beaded eggplant, I took home the Soza and split the Almost Perfect with my friend!!!! Everyone loved what they ate. Sampled some their's and let them try mine. The Almost Perfect was actually PERFECT!! It was such a unique sandwich that was on an amazing  semolina hero. Can't wait to go backüíØüíØüíØ!!!!!

reviews.author: Emmanuel Rodriguez
reviews.text: Just stopped in this spot for some lunch, thank goodness I did. The Tuscan delight sub was amazing, literally hit the spot just with half. I'm super glad I walked into this spot. I'll definitely come back if I'm the area.

reviews.author: Will M
reviews.text: Got the FDNY, the vodka sauce chicken cutlet sandwich with mozzarella. It was good but felt a bit dry, had to pay for an extra vodka sauce which feels a bit much considering the sandwich is already $20. Either way it was good sandwich which could last 2 meals.

reviews.author: John Gonsalves
reviews.text:
Birds of a Feather is a beautiful spot tucked away in Williamsburg that really stands out for its atmosphere and design. The space has this perfect balance of industrial and modern d√©cor exposed brick, soft lighting, and elegant touches that make it feel both stylish and welcoming. It‚Äôs one of those restaurants where you notice the details right away, from the furniture to the way the dishes are plated.
I stopped in for their lunch special, which I thought was a great deal. The prices are fairly affordable considering the quality and the portions the servings are actually quite large, so you definitely won‚Äôt leave hungry. I ordered the chili fish, and it was excellent flavorful, fresh, and just the right level of spice. The food came out quickly, which I really appreciated during lunch hours.
I also tried the egg and scallion stuffed pancake, which ended up being one of my favorite parts of the meal. It‚Äôs crispy, savory, and full of flavor the kind of dish that makes you want to come back just for that. Overall, Birds of a Feather is a great place for a relaxed but elevated meal in Williamsburg. Highly recommend checking it out, especially for lunch.

reviews.author: Andreas Kaiser
reviews.text:
‚ÄúIn‚Äù-people go to Brooklyn, not to Manhattan anymore. Many excellent restaurants are found in that corner of the dense metropole. Among them birds of a feather, a Chinese-inspired cuisine of highest quality. The interior is cool with multiple individual tables and a major communal table in the center. The atmosphere is hectic but the staff remain calm and friendly. The food was outstanding with too many choices untested and requiring us to return in the future.

(Originally posted by me on Yelp)

reviews.author: valeri bolkvadze
reviews.text:
5-Star Review for Birds of a Feather (Williamsburg, Brooklyn)
Birds of a Feather ‚Äì A True Gem for Foodies and Friend Hangouts!
If you're looking for that perfect spot where incredible food meets unbeatable vibes, Birds of a Feather in Williamsburg is your answer. This Sichuan-inspired Chinese restaurant, born from the genius minds behind Michelin-starred Cafe China, nails the balance of authentic flavors and chill atmosphere every time.
I've made it a ritual to come here with my crew ‚Äì it's hands-down my top go-to place for group hangs. The space feels warm and inviting, with those subtle nods to Chengdu's laid-back greenery that make you forget you're in the heart of Brooklyn. Whether we're splitting plates after a long week or celebrating a birthday, the energy just flows ‚Äì spacious tables, dim lighting, and that effortless cool factor that keeps conversations going all night.
But let's talk food, because oh man, it's on another level. Top-tier doesn't even cover it ‚Äì every dish is a flavor explosion. The Dan Dan noodles? Silky, spicy, and nutty perfection that had us all fighting for the last bite. We couldn't resist the cumin lamb skewers (smoky, tender, and addictive) or the mapo tofu, which brings just the right heat without overwhelming. Portions are generous for sharing, and the cocktails (shoutout to the yuzu margarita) cut through the spice like a dream. Service is spot-on too ‚Äì attentive but not hovering, which lets you focus on the good times.
Price-wise, it's a steal for the quality ‚Äì expect around $50-70 per person with drinks, and you'll leave stuffed and smiling. If you love bold, authentic eats in a spot that's as fun for friends as it is delicious, do yourself a favor and book a table. Birds of a Feather isn't just a meal; it's a vibe. Can't wait to go back! üå∂Ô∏èüçú 5/5 stars.

reviews.author: Felix
reviews.text:
Really delicious Sichuan dishes. The menu isn‚Äôt overwhelmingly large but has a good variety.
Twice cooked pork belly and chongqing chicken were both really great.
Soup dumplings and duck fried rice were pretty standard but solid and the food comes out really quick even though the place was full.
Worked out to about $50pp with only tea for drinks and before tip.

reviews.author: Linh Pham
reviews.text:
This is my favorite Chinese restaurant in New York. The space is nicely decorated, comes with outdoor seatings. Service is fast.
The food is the star of the show. The portions are large at this restaurant. The quality doesn't miss no matter if I dine in or order delivery.
Chungking chicken comes with crunchy small chicken bites, loaded with chillies, packed with flavors and that mouth numbing spiciness. Kung pao chicken is tender, velvety texture. Spicy fish filled is my favorite dish; it's comes with small fried fish fillers, crunchy, perfect moisture level with that signature spiciness of szechuan chilies. Mapo tofu is also one of the must try dish, hot tofu on a bed of spicy ground pork sauce. It's perfect for any dinner meal. Spicy cumin lamb is absolutely the most tender and flavorful lamb I have had in a long time. Tea smoked duck offers juicy smoked duck slices, pairs well with buns and sauce.
The restaurant can get really crowded during dinner time. It is suggested to get a reservation ahead of time or to stop by at odd hours to avoid waiting in line.
Overall, I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who loves to enjoy Chinese cuisine or just loves to incorporate chilies in their meals.

reviews.author: Caylea
reviews.text: Charming and quiet spot in Wburg! HH deal is great for the oysters and drinks! The chicken and the octopus were standout dishes. The grilled hake fillet was just okay, a bit rubbery. Although we didn‚Äôt get the fries, they looked great!

reviews.author: Beyza Akk
reviews.text: We spent around $100 for 2 people and totally worth the experience. Everything was so delicious and stuff were kind enough to make us feel happy. They kept asking how‚Äôs the food and if there‚Äôs anything we need etc I‚Äôd highly recommend Burger, fava dip, and octopus. The sourdough bread they use is also AMAZINGLY delicious. I feel so bad that I didn‚Äôt ask where they got the bread:(

reviews.author: Jan Ezer Dominguez
reviews.text:
Came here for a light dinner date with my partner, and we ended up mainly ordering the seafood.

The grilled octopus was amazing! Not a big portion, but very tasty.

The mussells were perfectly cooked as well. Couldn't get enough of that sauce!

reviews.author: Elle
reviews.text: Caf√© Colette is such a gem. They have a great oyster special during the week that‚Äôs definitely worth it, and the staff was super friendly and welcoming. The vibe is cozy and stylish, which makes it a perfect spot to unwind after work or catch up with friends.

reviews.author: melody wilson
reviews.text:
My friend and I went here the other day for some brunch. The waitress was nice but not super attentive.

The food was definitely not worth the cost‚Äî it was overpriced for one slice of toast per person.

I got the eggs and hash and it was not worth $17. There was too much random presentation and not enough actually filling food. My friend says it‚Äôs the same for her food‚Äî she got an avocado toast with an egg.

I also ordered a frozen coffee which was tasty.

The vibes of the place are nice.

reviews.author: Ava Johns
reviews.text: Came here with my friend for a nice girls night! We got a reservation at 9 pm and it was crazy packed when we walked in. A bunch of people waiting. Took a bit to get our table but seemed like it was just people staying too long that caused backup. The place was sooo cute and cool and the bathroom was like a mini club which I loved. Music was perfect, playing all my favorites. Waitress was AWESOME and super helpful. We got espresso martinis which came out quick and green beans and wontons to start. Green beans turned out to be our fav fish and were delicious with some fried bread on top. Great flavor. Wontons were good too and had a curry/Indian flavor. I thought they could have been hotter (temp and spice level), but we enjoyed them. we also got the noodles. I personally don't like the rolled noodles and I thought the flavor was weird. But my friend loved them.  Overall really thought this was a cool place and enjoyed our experience but didn't wow me like other spots in NYC. I'm also really tired of cocktails being $20, but I guess that's just what the reality is these days.

reviews.author: C J
reviews.text:
Made the ‚Äútrek‚Äù to Brooklyn and was excited to try Bonnie‚Äôs. Service was good- the server was knowledgeable about the menu and very pleasant. Had heard ravings about the MSG martini which we tried, and also tried the sour cherry Negroni - neither were spectacular and the martini had a strange aftertaste.

For food, we ordered the chrysanthemum salad (Don Angie‚Äôs is so much better) - which was a large portion but mostly cabbage (?), the long beans were too mushy for my liking (liked the fried crullers but they were overly salty), the fuyu cacio e pepe mein which was just ok, and the sundae for dessert which was not that interesting (I liked the fried condensed milk). We also had the shrimp with walnuts and broccoli which was pretty basic. Overall, the food was pretty disappointing and I would not go back‚Ä¶

reviews.author: asmaa odeh
reviews.text: OK, so I came here tonight and I have never heard of this place before. Everything was pretty good nothing was amazing and nothing was terrible. I will say that the shrimp with the candied walnuts were really good and the long beans were also pretty good. I ordered the mussels with the shoestring fries and when it came out, it had pieces of what looked like some kind of pork on top so I asked the server is that pork? and they said yes and I said oh no I can‚Äôt eat that so they brought it back and gave me the menu to pick something else, and I asked if I could have the same thing but with no pork and they said they couldn‚Äôt do that because it was in the broth so when I looked at the menu again, I realized it mentioned nowhere that there was pork in there, which is kind of annoying because if it wasn‚Äôt directly on top, I would‚Äôve never known it was in the broth. I heard this place is extremely popular and I don‚Äôt know I‚Äôve had much better food for lower prices and just better food in general. I also was not a fan of the flounder at all. It tasted like it had pi√±a colada sauce on it, but my partner liked it so..

reviews.author: Rachel Michelson
reviews.text:
The mussels were good, the broth was extremely flavorful and creamy, but way too salty. The fries also ended up a bit soggy, and we needed more fries for the broth, if that was the intention. We ended up with a bunch of leftover broth that was too salty to drink on its own. Some bread would have been nice for this.

The chow feung was pretty good, but really small and underwhelming for the price. I also thought this was too salty. The texture of the rice noodles was nice though, and i really liked the flavor of the dried shrimp.

The bkrib.. It was good. I really liked the fluffinesses and the flavor of the bread, the sauce on the meat, and it was cooked okay. Maybe a bit overcooked. The onions and pickles provided a nice contrast. Not show stopping though. This was also too salty.

The half chicken was pretty good as well. The broth was my favorite part. The flavor and cook on the chicken was good, but the rice didn‚Äôt really make any sense. It was yummy, but it felt as though the rice and the chicken were two completely separate dishes. The chicken was also too salty.

I would say the food is pretty good, maybe not worth the price, and my  main issue is the overall saltiness of the dishes. I typically eat saltier foods than my peers, but even after drinking 3 full glasses of water during this meal, my mouth is left with a tingling feeling and I need more water.

reviews.author: Christian Ramirez
reviews.text: THE PANZANELLA. I haven‚Äôt stopped thinking about the PANZANELLA since I last went 2 months ago. Best bite in Brooklyn??? We ordered 2 for a group of 6 and we probably should have just ordered 6. Everything is good‚Ä¶ the noodles are awesome.. the green beans are divine‚Ä¶ and the outdoor patio tables are super uncomfortable

reviews.author: Vicki
reviews.text:
I usually hear people going before they open to get a table, and was so excited that I was able to reserve online!

The staff were nice and helpful with deciding our orders, and we were glad that we did not skip on the focaccia!

I was way too full afterwards, so I think the 2 of us could‚Äôve just gotten one pasta instead of 2 (or just one appetizer)!

reviews.author: Bianca R
reviews.text: Lilia is an outstanding modern italian restaurant. I would rate it 4.5 stars, and rounding up to 5 this time because we ordered one of the dishes a second time. The agnolotti is to die for. Perfectly balanced and very rich and complex. We also enjoyed the focaccia and the little gem salad as appetizers. The prosciutto was okay, and the arancini were also only okay. Mafaldini pasta was good. The italian job dessert was good but we expected better from all the hype. Would come back, lovely place, and great setting.

reviews.author: Katie Infelice
reviews.text: i love coming to lilia!!! the food is literally always so stellar (highlights: focaccia, clams, spaghetti, italian job) and the hospitality is unmatched (shoutout britt and elle). i try to come back whenever i can. such a special place :)

reviews.author: Gaetano DiNardi
reviews.text: The Rigatoni was solid. But the Mafaldini lacked flavor. The Agnolotti was the star of the show. The fettucini rag√π was flavorful but it was a lot of noodles and not enough sauce. We also ordered a rib eye steak that came out cold and rare, which had to be sent back. Overall this place is average, but overhyped. It‚Äôs a 3/5 stars and that‚Äôs an honest review. And I‚Äôve eaten at hundreds of Italian restaurants.

reviews.author: Kathy D
reviews.text: Great food and service in a very casual but eclectic setting.  There were a couple misses for us but overall absolutely delicious fresh food and we will definitely return.  Mozz and bread is a large portion but absolutely worth trying. Cheese was soft and flavorful and bread was thick and crusty.   Little gem salad as pretty to look at as it was to eat.   Grilled artichoke, I probably could have eaten 5.  Perfectly cooked and seasoned. Bagna Cauda was a miss for us. The anchovy dip was overpowering and I think I just didn‚Äôt understand the dish.  We tried the agnolotti based on our server‚Äôs recommendation and so glad we did.  Soft creamy pillows of deliciousness. Spaghetti also delicious, pasta was al dente with texture from the nuts.   Escarole was another recommended dish and it was very good and a nice side. The lamb steak was our other miss. It was cooked well but if I didn‚Äôt know I was eating lamb I would have thought it was a bland steak.  It had no gamey lamb flavor.  We didn‚Äôt know but will try next time that there is an off the menu steak and potato dish you can order. It looked and smelled amazing.  This restaurant serves unpretentious delicious food, can‚Äôt wait to return and try more options.

reviews.author: Susie Su
reviews.text:
Burger and focaccia were delicious, the burger especially stood out.

A side of focaccia is perfectly sized for 2 people actually - and cheaper than the dish.

Coffee with orange blossom cream was interesting, would recommend to try at least once.

Chicken and pancake was way too buttery and the chicken ended up tasting dry. Next time would skip that. It had good intentions though, just maybe excited slightly poorly.

reviews.author: Heidi Mayer
reviews.text: This is my kind of place! A fabulous wine list, a limited menu, excellent food. The crispy chicken is amazing. Clearly I forgot to take the pictures before we started eating. It was so good.

reviews.author: Kathleen Zhou
reviews.text: really lovely little gem in Greenpoint: a classic American restaurant with seasonal dishes that are executed very well. we‚Äôll be back to sample the wine menu & desserts!

reviews.author: Kaitlyn Murdock
reviews.text: We LOVE this cozy neighborhood spot!! After 5 visits, we‚Äôve tasted most of their menu and not a single dish has missed. Excellent cocktails and wines. Incredible value. I love that we can always get a last minute seat - but am always shocked that they aren‚Äôt busier. You must go!

reviews.author: Bl√°thnaid Conroy
reviews.text: Gator is a standout restaurant. Definitely in the running for best brunch in Greenpoint. I‚Äôm absolutely shocked that this place isn‚Äôt full to the brim every weekend. Every item on their menu is carefully devised, unique, and created to a very high standard. Their green eggs and ham are OUT OF THIS WORLD. Full of flavor, perfectly cooked. The flatbread?? Incredible. Great service too, everyone is always welcoming and friendly. I hope they‚Äôre around for a long time to come!

reviews.author: Ghayas Salem
reviews.text: Had a business lunch here. Everything we ordered was tasty. Also good drinks. Tons of TV's to watch any game you like. The place was buzzing, even midweek at 3:00 PM. Reservations are recommended.

reviews.author: tomasz j
reviews.text: nice old school style pub and restaurant in maspeth. with a big bar in the center. definitely for sports fans. if you want to eat something, have a beer and watch a game this is the perfect place! the staff is nice and helpful, the food is good. if you order a steak be sure to ask for their own sauce - it's great! i recommend the swordfish and the steak! the desserts are also delicious. i recommend and enjoy your meal

reviews.author: alice hsieh
reviews.text: I had a baby shower for my daughter here. I was totally impressed. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The room was set-up elegantly with white tablecloths and cloth napkins. The food was delicious. And the cost was very reasonable. I highly recommend O'Neill's Maspeth for your next party.

reviews.author: Lisa S
reviews.text:
I came here for the first time recently because of an event that I attended. This place is truly exceptional with its hospitality and service as the staff was fantastic.

This restaurant is a well-known institution in Queens and has been in business since 1933, and I could see why they have been around for so long.

I really didn't get a chance to try anything from their food menu, but the drinks I ordered were really good, and the bartenders are super nice. This place has a great sportsbar vibe, and it is a great place for hosting events since this restaurant is quite large.

I noticed other reviewers complaining about the parking situation in this area, but since I came quite early, I didn't have any issues finding street parking near the restaurant.

Based on my first impression of this place, I will definitely stop by again in the near future to grab a bite and a few drinks.

reviews.author: Teresa Marie
reviews.text: Attentive staff. I had a really awesome young lady who waited on us. She checked on us and even answered my daughters questions on a specific drink.  We had a wonderful time.

reviews.author: Rodney Champaco
reviews.text:
I‚Äôve been ordering delivery from Tito Rad‚Äôs for years (ever since I moved to Forest Hills four years ago) and it‚Äôs hands down the closest thing to homemade Filipino food I‚Äôve ever had. I‚Äôve been around Filipinos all my life, and Tito Rad's dishes always bring that authentic, comforting flavor that feels like it came straight from an auntie's kitchen.

I‚Äôve only had the chance to dine in once when I happened to be running an errand right across the street. The food fresh from the kitchen was even better... hot, perfectly seasoned, and clearly made with care.

Yesterday, for Filipino American History Month, my office facilities coordinator (based in San Francisco) provided our NYC team with lunch from Tito Rad‚Äôs... delivered to our Manhattan office near Bryant Park. I had no idea they delivered that far! If I‚Äôd known, I would‚Äôve been ordering for my coworkers years ago.

Everything was a hit... Pritong Lumpia, Pancit Bihon, Adobo Fried Rice, Beef Steak, Chicken BBQ Skewers, Lechon Kawali, and Turon. Every dish disappeared fast and now my coworkers want to make Tito Rad‚Äôs one of our go-to team lunches.

To top it off, someone from the restaurant even called afterward to check in and make sure everything went well (sorry I missed the call). That thoughtful touch really says a lot about how much they care about their customers.

If you‚Äôre looking for authentic, delicious Filipino food, Tito Rad‚Äôs is the place to go. And if you need catering or delivery (even to Manhattan), that‚Äôs just the cherry on top!

reviews.author: R Ho
reviews.text: Passing by to stop at Renee‚Äôs Kitchenette and noticed Tito Rad‚Äôs. Never been so I decided to try a new spot. I should‚Äôve went with more people so I could order more food, but we went with ‚Äúbasics‚Äù - tapsilog, tocilog, and longsilog. I didn‚Äôt even get to order lechon! Anyway, I got ukoy to try as an appetizer, and ginataang langka (never tried this before but I know I like jack fruit) and ginataang calabasa. I like the calabasa. I ordered it with garlic fried rice to eat. The ginataang langka was ‚Ä¶ different. I‚Äôll stick to it being a fruit that belongs in dessert or turon. The tapa was sweet, which I wasn‚Äôt a fan of but really, it‚Äôs your preference. Everything else was good. The hot calamansi was so warm in my stomach. It felt nice. The halo halo was good too. Big portion in a big bowl so I‚Äôm not struggling to eat it from a drinking cup. The ukoy was different for me too. I don‚Äôt like bean sprouts but this was fried and it wasn‚Äôt bad. Bonus: the waitress told me their ube ice cream is home made. Overall, I would revisit with a larger group. I would advise calling to make a reservation. I waited an hour to be seated. The staff was extremely kind though. They did check on us from time to time while waiting and updated us when our table would be ready. Very family-oriented.

reviews.author: judy
reviews.text: Ordered the grilled tuna collar, baboy sinigang, and ginataang kalabasa/okra. The tuna collar was grilled perfectly, and comes with a vinegar dip (I thought it would be a sweeter dish). The sinigang was a bit sour, could definitely taste the tamarind! Although I wish it was pork ribs with bone in. The ginitaang kalabasa was not too coconut milky. There was a party being set up and a huge lechon prepared! The aunties working there were very nice, and looked so fun with karaoke already starting.

reviews.author: marina dee
reviews.text: The food was so good, hit the spot. The back.room is great for big dinners or parties.

reviews.author: Christina Yung
reviews.text: I was sick and Tito Rad‚Äôs delivery came through with pork sinigang, garlic rice, lumpia, and chicken adobo. Delicious! Healed my soul, was exactly what I needed.

reviews.author: Jay M.
reviews.text:
Went to the place on the way home from Queens Center.

It was a little hole in the wall. There was only outdoor seating. The service was good. It was a wait for the food because they were busy and the food was fresh.

We got a series of dishes that were good! They definitely were more of a modern style of Bolivian food.

Everything had good flavors and they give you a lot of food!

reviews.author: Karla Ruiz
reviews.text: Bolivian Llama Party üáßüá¥ü¶ô‚ù§Ô∏è So many things to say about this place‚Ä¶ to start, service is always great, people at the counter, and the owners, that sometimes take care of you, are always kind, nice and extremely helpful! Then the food, OMG, best truffle fries you can try in NY, Salte√±as are always a good to go (chicken is my favorite!!), all the bowls are delicious, their chicken sandwiches, veggie choices, everything is amazing there, I am not even vegetarian but I love their jackfruit sandwiches! One of the best places in Sunnyside for sure, I highly recommend trying BLP, they never disappoint! ‚ò∫Ô∏è

reviews.author: Akimohai
reviews.text: Customer service here is absolutely awesome ‚Äî full of passion, and you can tell they truly love their food. The food itself is amazing. It was my first time trying Bolivian cuisine and I instantly fell in love with it. The way they cook the chicken is just perfect: crispy on the outside, tender and juicy on the inside. Damn good! Highly recommend this spot!

reviews.author: Beejay-Grace J
reviews.text: The beef empanada, trancapecho, and cilantro fries are all delicious. Everything is full of flavor and perfectly cooked. Highly recommend this place if you‚Äôre looking for authentic and tasty Bolivian food!

reviews.author: Ryan Tammaro
reviews.text: Beef Salte√±a‚Äòs are delicious, like a soupy empanada with a chewy, slightly sweet dough. Seating is outside only so these are better for on the go or quick stop dining

name: Wonder Pig K-BBQ
address: 37-08, Queens Boulevard, Long Island City, NY, 11101

reviews.author: Nicole Cruz
reviews.text: Everything was great, the food was excellent and the service was incredible. Our server Jane made us feel very welcome and elevated the whole experience! Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Raymond Wong
reviews.text: All you can eat Korean bbq. Many cuts of meat to choose from. Sides were delicious as well. Staff is friendly and always asks if we need anything or if everything‚Äôs ok

reviews.author: avirut lerddirekrat
reviews.text: I had an good experience at this restaurant, largely thanks to our exceptional server, Karry. She was incredibly attentive and well taken care of us throughout our visit. The food was delicious, and I especially loved the wide variety of options available on the menu. Karry's outstanding service, combined with the great food selection, makes this place a must-visit. I can't wait to come back and try more of their delectable dishes!

reviews.author: Dan Oyan
reviews.text: All-you-can-eat Korean BBQ for $46 super affordable! We got the premium meat and it did not disappoint. The ribeye and brisket were my favorites. really good quality! Our server Eric was so nice and easy to talk to, very accommodating with all our requests lol. Definitely coming back again!

reviews.author: L Ramos
reviews.text: We decided to go here as a central meeting point for folks coming from Jersey and Long Island. I had been to a Japanese BBQ place where you cook your own food, this was a little different. The place is spacious and brightly lit as the sitting areas need to be spaced out(cooking areas and smoke hoods), you sat on stools that you can store your items in. You chose the type of meat selection from 3 choices. The whole table must choose the same menu course. You are on a timer but we weren't affected. There are many selections, so make sure to try all of them at least once. The tray can cook 2 portions at a time and once it gets cooking 4-5 adults will having trouble keeping up, but we have it our all. The food was delicious, they cook it all for you. Pork, beef was best we didn't try the chicken. The Soju was awesome; pomegranate, lychee and blueberry... All very tasty. Make sure to get lettuce and rice. The salad was also very tasty. Just be careful and observant; when the server pulled back from placing meat on the cooking tray, some of the meat juice fell on the salad. We set that salad aside immediately. I definitely want to come back the seats were ok, but I dunno how long we can sit on those seats. Price was reasonable. Definitely go here and check it out.

reviews.author: Kristina Zhegunova
reviews.text: We love this place ‚Äî we‚Äôve been here more than 10 times, and every time it‚Äôs a hit! Our friends enjoyed it too! We love everyone who works there! Bahut bahut dhanyavaad! üáÆüá≥üíõ

reviews.author: H M
reviews.text:
My favorite Indian in the neighborhood, the food is always fresh, hot, and delicious. I love hoe crispy the naan is when you dine in.

This time we got the garlic naan, chicken caldeen, cardamom mix grill, lemon and garlic shrimp, and lamb potato croquettes.

reviews.author: Kab Ra
reviews.text:
NVM just got food poisoning after my meal
‚Äî
Very good. Wish the malai kofta had more than 4 dumplings. The entrees are a little pricey ($20+ per dish) but the service was excellent. I love that you can add tofu to any curry.

reviews.author: Andrea Luper
reviews.text: This cozy neighborhood spot happens to be not only some of the best Indian fare in the area, but in the greater New York area. Never disappoints. The naan is perfection. The curries are perfectly balanced, and the saag is so thick and luxurious. Can‚Äôt wait for my next visit.

reviews.author: Ticia Tialetagi
reviews.text: The best Indian food in town, recommend it! You‚Äôll not disappointed! Cosy place

reviews.author: Faed Ahmed Arnob
reviews.text:
Really nice place with a cozy vibe! Kinda gives off that Himalayan caf√© feel ‚Äî if you‚Äôve been to Nepal, you‚Äôll totally get what I mean with the big glass windows and the warm lighting. The staff seemed super authentic Nepali too, both in how they talked and acted, which was a nice touch.

Food was good! I‚Äôd say go for the beef (yes they are halal) options if you‚Äôre into meat ‚Äî the chicken momos were okay but had more veggies than chicken. Loved the Thai Soup Momo (gave off a bit of a butter chicken vibe) and of course, the Chilli Momos are always a win.

Bonus points for the super clean washrooms ‚Äî seriously, top-notch. Overall, I‚Äôd give it an 8.5/10. Great spot, just a little pricey for students.

reviews.author: Tanvi Desai
reviews.text: These momos are out of this world! My absolute favorites are the Chicken Tandoori Momos and the Chicken Chilly Momos ‚Äî but the real showstopper is the Chaat Momos. Truly unbeatable!

reviews.author: Arth Shah
reviews.text:
We were craving some Momo's. Looked around for some places, and Momo crave came up. Decided to give it a try. The momo's were delicious. Most of the time, at other places, the momo are overloaded with ginger. Momo craved, momo tasted delicious. We got tandoori mom which had good smokiness. We also got chili momo, which was good and spicy.
They have plenty of vegetarian options. We would visit again to try different momo.

reviews.author: N Nuha
reviews.text: I come here very often and for a few years now. All the momos here are packed with flavor. They're all good. The spicy sauces can give a kick. My favorite is the chili momo. They added a new soup- the Thai soup momo and it's Thai coconut with the steamed momo. Tased very good as well. The artwork around the shop is fun and creative. Definitely look around. I felt like the portions have gotten smaller since it took more Momos to make me full and the flavor has been adjusted somewhat. Hope it doesn't stray too far from what made this place great

reviews.author: Tanoy Dutta
reviews.text: A gem of a place to satiate the momo cravings. In fact, all the dishes are outstanding to say the least.

reviews.author: Shawn Shawn (Shawn)
reviews.text:
So I made my way from Manhattan over to Queens to try out SVL in Astoria for a midweek lunch meal.
Was super excited to try this spot as all of the reviews have been pretty popular and it's on my "Saved List of Eats".
The spot is right off the Triborough bridge to the right train, or the 1st stop off the M60 bus coming across the Triborough from Manhattan.  The restaurant was very clean and the staff was pretty attentive as it was midweek and it wasn't too busy.
I ordered the Lunch Special Chicken Yeero pita sandwich with a Mesculan salad and some of their famous SVL sauce.
The chicken was perfectly seasoned,  super moist, and plentiful.  It was layered with french fries, tomatoes, and fresh red onions all on a fresh off the grill pita bread.
The mesclun "side salad" was also super fresh and well proportioned with red and yellow peppers, petite cucumbers and balsamic vinegar
Overall I had a great experience at SVL and will definitely come back as I want to try the chicken sticks and rice next.
Also this french fries were seriously seriously good and well seasoned.
Can't wait to visit again.

reviews.author: Joselin Menocal
reviews.text: Incredible food! my friend and I were both pretty hungry and we ordered the mixed platter for 2- and we could NOT finish it- although we REALLY wanted to! every bite was fantastic and we thoroughly enjoyed it, would most definitely come here again :)

reviews.author: ben zander
reviews.text: A charming spot conveniently located by the subway. Delicious food good atmosphere nice portion sizes. We got the haloumi fries.

reviews.author: Vasilis Dux
reviews.text: One of the best experiences in gyro plates outside of Greece.. big portions, fresh ingredients..unbelievable hand-cut fries..our compliments to the chef

reviews.author: vale
reviews.text: This place is awesome-possum! It is very clean and put-together, great system. Kind and polite customer service. The food is perfect here. It contains many flavors and great seasoning. Cooked to perfection! Thank you so much!

reviews.author: Chris Escala
reviews.text:
This is the top place not only to eat food from Spain but also to enjoy a great time as it truly makes you feel at Spain. The food is vast, diverse, and superbly delicious.
From the paella to the tapas and the sangria. It's a great spot to reminisce Spain üá™üá∏  you'll definitely feel at Iberia. Ole! üíÉ

reviews.author: Lexi
reviews.text: We ran into the nicest old Spanish guy on the street. He doesn‚Äôt speak too much English, but he was so warm and really tried to tell us to try this place. It turns out to be amazing!!

reviews.author: Vivianne Barretto
reviews.text: This place was recommended to us and I'm very happy that we followed up on the recommendation.  The food was üòã.  I had the Madrid Strew (Chickpeas and Tripe with Chorizo), my Mom had Mussels, Scampi style and our friend had Fried Calamari.  We were all very happy with our appetizers.  Then for our entr√©es, we all had Merluza which in English is Hake.  We each had it in a different preparation.  There was grilled, stewed and breaded.  Mine was Grilled and it came with vegetables and a choice of a side.  I chose Boiled Potatoes.  My Mom chose to have it in Stew which is served in sauce and with Potatoes and our friend chose the Breaded version with a choice of a side.  She had the French Fries.  We were all happy with the preparation we chose.  The servings were large.  We all took food home.  We all had Flan for dessert and it was very good.  My Mom had Wine, our friend had Sangria and I had Estrella, a beer from Spain.  The prices are very good here.  The service is excellent. We came in the afternoon but in the evenings they have entertainment.  I don't know if it's every evening or only on certain evenings.  I have to look into that.  The space reminds me of a small scale Supper Club.  There is also a area off to the side with a Bar, t.v.'s and seats.  We will definitely go back, maybe when they have a show.  I also have to say,  we've been to Spain on several occasions and the food here is as good and even better than in some Restaurants in Spain.  Forgot to mention that we each got a Bailey's, on the house.  It's very rare for restaurants to do that nowadays.

reviews.author: Karilu Ruiz-duran
reviews.text: The restaurant is beautiful.  The staff is very attentive.  The steaks and sangria were very good.  The seafood paella was okay. My only complain is that they have a stage and they didn't do any show for mothers day weekend.  They talk about doing events on the second floor last week. If they had a flamenco üï∫üíÉ dance show on the stage, I can assure you the restaurant would be packed.

reviews.author: Armando I
reviews.text:
Hidden gem off of Broadway and Steinway Street.
Food is always prepared with love and everything on the menu is a must have!
I recommend the sangria with any paella option.
Check the site for shows and dances. I‚Äôm sure they will have a special for New Year‚Äôs Eve!

reviews.author: Hailey Richards
reviews.text: I am not the type of person to leave reviews on anything whether it‚Äôs a positive review or a negative but this place truly deserves it. Yesterday was my 4th time coming to eat at Calibun and I must say their food is 10/10 and the customer service was amazing as well. You can tell that this place cares about their customers because when I walked in, I was greeted by the cashier with a big smile and positive attitude. I couldn‚Äôt decide if I want a heavy meal or something light like wings but then the person at the front helped me out saying I should try their mini classic combo. I took his advice and tried it and when I tell you this burger was really amazing I truly mean it. Also it took less than 15 min for my food to be ready and they make everything fresh. Tables were clean too. My experience was 10/10 if you‚Äôre looking for a place to eat around your area or if you‚Äôre a foodie in general I would highly recommend you going there. Will come again!!

reviews.author: LongIslandHalal
reviews.text:
Calibun is an HMS-certified restaurant in Astoria, Queens. Calibun, in my opinion, has one of the better fast-food beef burgers in New York.

The cheeseburger is unlike any other halal fast-food beef burger spots. You can tell that they dont use completely frozen meats and really care about the quality of food they serve. The beef is extremely tender and it melts in your mouth. Definitely going back to try out all the other burgers.

reviews.author: Mereann F
reviews.text: Place was really clean and cute. Had a lot of seating. Ordered the Lava Burger with bacon and fries. The fries were not fresh at all and the burger was mediocre at best. It wasn‚Äôt nasty per say but the flavor wasn‚Äôt there. If the fries were fresh they might have tasted better. Overall I was very disappointed.

reviews.author: Ahmad Karim
reviews.text: Amazing Burgers, they know how to make your burgers special! Zabiha Halal üçîüçîüçüüçüüçüüçî üçóüçóüêî still a fan! I hope they keep it up! Keeping it fresh and quality over all!

reviews.author: Jade
reviews.text: Just ordered a turkey burger from CaliBun and it was by far the worst turkey burger I‚Äôve had in my entire life. A thin inedible, old, freezer burned patty that broke down like stale bread in your mouth. The most upsetting aspect of this is that the patties are clearly not being stored properly but it‚Äôs obvious they don‚Äôt care enough about what the customers eat to provide better quality food. If turkey patties are unpopular, take them off the menu rather than give your customers stale items that could potentially cause food poisoning!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.author: Kelly Leung
reviews.text:
Very Authentic Cantonese Food,
Glad to have found a spot that tastes like food back home (HK). I ordered the Wonton and Braised Beef noodles, Pork Ribs Claypot rice, and Choy Sum(Vegetables). Wonton was big with shrimp and pork in it, you can taste that it's the freshly made and not frozen ones. Braised Beef was tender and there were many pieces in it. Noodles are just like the wonton noodles in Hong Kong, cooked great, a bit chewy. The clay pot rice was made to order and came burning hot after cooking it over the fire. Can‚Äôt wait to come back and try more dishes.

reviews.author: Nerdy Macropus
reviews.text: This Cantonese restaurant stands out as the best I‚Äôve discovered so far. The prices are reasonable, the portions are generous, and most importantly, the flavors are simply incredible (Âπ≥ Èùö Ê≠£). I highly recommend trying the chicken, siew mai, and the claypot rice.

reviews.author: Ashley Liu
reviews.text: As a devoted dim sum lover, this is my favorite spot in Manhattan. The food is incredibly fresh and authentically made, but what truly moved me was tasting a real Hong Kong-style herbal soup in New York. It‚Äôs the kind of soup that takes at least 12 hours of slow simmering to extract the very best essence of the ingredientsÔºÅ

reviews.author: Christine C.
reviews.text:
Long overdue review. I discovered Moon Kee soon after they opened 2 yrs ago.  My  BFF lives on 103rd so it's just 2 blocks away. I can't believe there is an **authentic** Canto restaurant up here!  I grew up in LA, lived in NY for 6 yrs and now in No CA.  Yes I'm an ABC, but my husband was born in HK and I know good authentic Chinese food. They even have BBQ meat hanging in the windows and people yelling in Cantonese to each other, haha.  Sign of authenticity in a dim sum place.  The only "non-authentic" thing? It's very very clean, no food stains on the chairs or tables but I haven't seen the bathrooms  (I know I'm risking offending some ppl on here...it's a *joke*).  There are always lots of Chinese ppl in here too.

I was hungry after flying in from CA and why spend $7 on a ham and cheese croissant heated in a microwave when you can have 3 gao choi gao (shrimp and chive dumpling) cooked fresh for the same price? Look at the size of the shrimp!  And you can sit in a clean booth with a/c (it's 90 deg outside). They're really nice and weren't upset that I just ordered $7 worth of food.  Very good service.

I've been here ~7 times and everything has been excellent. The big test for me in any dim sum place is the wu gok (taro dumpling). Many reputable places have other excellent dishes but their wu gok tastes of ammonia meaning old taro.  Or they're really oily.  NOT here - they're crisp, made of fresh taro, and not oily at all.  The dan tats (egg tarts) are perfect- flaky crisp dough. They just told me they are hand made here and the chef has over 30 yrs experience making dim sum.

I told my friend about this place and now her family gets food from here all the time.

Someone mentioned the prices- ummm look at where they are.  And it's not more than what we spend in SF and some places in NY Chinatown.

reviews.author: C.A. Young
reviews.text: Best Chinese food on the UWS. A quick delicious lunch with soup for $15 is a treat... with leftovers! Generous portions. True test is the old crowd favorite of crunchy steamed broccoli and tender orange beef. Perfect. But you will find there are lots of Asian patrons who order their favorite dishes here no doubt because it tastes authentic. Am so glad to be back home in NYC to eat here, try new flavors of dumplings, roast duck and a wonderful array of other dishes from this welcoming place.

reviews.author: Maisha Rahman
reviews.text: I bought from Al-Aqsa last night. I‚Äôm not a local but I heard reviews from some locals and they suggested that I should try it out. At first glance I didn‚Äôt like any of the food. They all looked like it was either cooked the day before or in the morning. Everything looked dry and not so appetizing. Anyhow I still wanted to give it a try. This Tehri is tasteless, super bland, what‚Äôs even more disappointing is that it has almost no meat and all of it is just rice. I got tehri from Khalil biriyani house as well just to compare. Although it wasn‚Äôt that great either but it was way better. It was flavorful and had meat in every bite. Bhai taka diye kine ebhabe manush ke dhoka dewar kono mane ami dekhi na. Eke toh mangsho kete kete small turka banai tar upor aitao dai na. It‚Äôs very disappointing.

reviews.author: Tasfia Islam
reviews.text: I was really looking forward to enjoying some good biryani, but this was a huge disappointment. The rice was dry and clearly stale‚Äîit tasted like it had been sitting out for a day or two. The flavors were completely off, and the meat was tough and chewy. Honestly, it felt like I was eating leftovers that had been reheated without any care. Not only that but the guys that work there are very rude and full of attitude. Would not recommend this place.

reviews.author: Tawhidur Rahaman
reviews.text:
‚ÄúThis post reflects my personal experience as a paying customer in a public-facing restaurant setting, supported by receipts and photos, it is intended to let the owners know about their service/employee only, not to attack anyone personally.‚Äù

This review is directed to the owner or management of Bronx Al Aqsa Restaurant. If you cannot manage your online orders properly, then please stop taking them. Your two employees outright denied my order. Even after I stood inside the restaurant, they did not respond. When I asked if they were busy, they said ‚Äúwe‚Äôre not free‚Äù while they were just sitting and chatting.

My pickup time was 9:30 pm, yet they claimed they never received my order. I reminded them that I had placed the order nearly 1 to 1.5 hours earlier and asked why my food was still not ready. At this point, the employee wearing a cap, instead of speaking politely, became extremely rude. He said, ‚ÄúWe don‚Äôt know about online order issues, call the owner.‚Äù I asked him to call the supervisor, but he repeated, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs your need, not mine, so I won‚Äôt call.‚Äù

If your restaurant hires people without training them in customer service, this is the result. If you cannot manage online orders or do not have skilled staff for it, you should not be advertising online orders on Facebook.

I have been a regular customer of your grocery and restaurant for the past four years. Starting today, I will boycott your business. I know my leaving alone won‚Äôt harm your business, but I am writing this so you are aware of how your employees behave. If you think keeping my $22 makes you wealthy, then so be it. I often give to the homeless; today I‚Äôll consider you as one of them. May GOD bring you in front of me on the Day of Judgment‚Äîthat is my prayer.

Edit: This guy had the audacity to reach me on my social media from a fake profile and asked me to remove his photo or else he'll file a lawsuit. My guy thinks that he can't be filmed or photographed while he's working at a publicly open restaurant, he should learn the law. First of all he's rude and their owner is also encouraging these kind of money grabbing things and then they have this much courage of playing a victim card while he's treating me like that.

reviews.author: Karan Chaudhary
reviews.text: Their fish curries are very delicious. Chicken seekh kebab was very good but half chicken was dry and bland. Their chilly chicken is good too.

reviews.author: Md Surman Ahmed
reviews.text: I ordered 4 fresh paratha with other dishes and they gave me cold, hard and overburned three days old paratha. I came home opened the foil and was so disappointed. I called multiple times and the line is purposely on busy mode not going through. After paying $50 takeout and not being able to eat peacefully is unacceptable. WHY IS THE FOOD QUALITY GOING DOWN? Can owner take a look at why this is happening.

reviews.author: Sheikh Ahmad Shah
reviews.text: I previously went to the Hillside avenue branch, where I liked the food. Here, I don't how know many days ago the biriyani was prepared. They heat up the food in oven, but that heating goes away very soon, and food feels cold within a few minutes. But I am mostly disappointed with their restroom. The hand dispenser was blocked by a mop. I don't know how much they care to make this restaurant successful. Unfortunate. And also, as a biriyani house, they were out of Borhani. That was disappointing too. I guess hillside avenue branch is better. Never will come to this branch. And the food felt expensive.

reviews.author: Tasmia Hoque
reviews.text: We called early to reserve our table for Iftar but when we got there our table was not ready. We had to wait 10 minutes for them to set up our table. They seemed disorganized with the reservations.They did not have most of the items from the menu so we had to get a iftar box, Kacchi biriyani, Tanduri chicken. They gave us complementary dates and juice to break our fast. The juice was really tasty. Kacchi biriyani and Tanduri chicken were tasty too. The servers were nice and friendly. The management should manage the reservations properly to make sure the tables are ready when the guests arrive or use reserved sign for the tables. I will take out but not dine in again.

reviews.author: MH Rahman
reviews.text: Khalil Biryani foods not good such as salty,reek,bad smell & uncooked Biryani rice and also too much bad service.That‚Äôs why I don‚Äôt like it Khalil Biryani House foods.

reviews.author: Gobbi ‚ÄúGobbiGames‚Äù
reviews.text: Nearly empty all the time. Service is somewhat slow, food isn't fresh but is made on the same day from what I can tell. I don't really like the biryani, the noodles are much better in my opinion. The chapli kabob is very tasty, meaty, a little spicy, and a little grease never hurt anyone, right? I didn't get it this time but I highly recommend the chili chicken if you get the noodles. It's an immaculate combo! I went with my mom and my sibling. They always give some green chilies, some lettuce, and a quarter of a lemon. Maybe some onions and carrots. The restaurant has little to no decor. They have campfire sounds playing on the speakers. There's also a sink near the entrance so you can wash your hands. I like it here! It's a bit pricey for this area, feels like Manhattan.

reviews.author: MD.Mamunor Rashid
reviews.text: We came from Dallas to taste the kacchi which turned out one of our bad decision during our trip. The food was worst than their service. Let‚Äôs talk about the service first, we asked for extra plates because we have ordered 3 kacchi, 2 beef beiden, 2 tehari, 2 vortas, 2 daals and vaat, so that we can try each of the item together. But the waitress brought just one plate, as usual we have asked for couple more plates then she brought four plates. Okay!!  We asked for extra cups so that we can try their borhani which usually comes in a bottle, then she literally brought 6 cups for 12 people. None of the waiters has any idea of the service and their food.  Okay now let‚Äôs talk about their food, The pictures of Salad will talk for me, I will not even try to explain. Kacchi was like goat, oil and rice mix. Beef Biden was like beef, oil and rice mix, tehari was so so, borhani has more water than yogurt no taste at all, daal was like a swimming pool of turmeric powder but no taste.

reviews.author: Ann Powers
reviews.text: Lovely neighborhood spot. Excellent coq au vin and ratatouille. Don‚Äôt come for the steak frites, but this place does the other classics well. Cozy atmosphere, non-fussy, great for a night with friends. A touch understaffed on the bar (Melissa is amazing), but drinks great and food came out fast. Charles was our waiter, he was endlessly patient and friendly.

reviews.author: Rumpelstiltskin
reviews.text: Great hang! The crepe menu here is really interesting and you can create your own crepes. The eggs benny were standard and coffee was nice. The ambiance is really what makes this place special tho. Super nice and warm vibes.

reviews.author: Jeff Melvin
reviews.text:
Had a fun little date night here. The whole place felt really homey, and I loved the decor. Service was super friendly, and made sure they could accommodate my peanut and cashew allergy.

I tried ratatouille for the first time, and I loved it. Perfectly cooked salmon as well. Will be back!

reviews.author: matea prljevic
reviews.text:
Love the backyard in a summer time!
Food is amazing! Oysters are must have!
And pasta fruit del mare is my favorite!! And mussels were amazing! (Photo of the finished mussel dish üòÅ)
I am glad I live near by so I will be coming back!

reviews.author: NESLY
reviews.text:
The location of the restaurant is definitely in a very good place. The atmosphere is really great. I sat in the garden and it was very comfortable. Chill.. You are in a quiet garden in the center of the city. I ordered a hamburger. It was the worst hamburger I have ever eaten in New York. I mean, a hamburger you eat at McDonald's is probably much better. I had a bad experience in this regard as well. But it is definitely a place where you can come with your friends, have a drink and sit. The bar looks very strong but I haven't tried anything. I only had a bad experience with the food. But still
Thanx ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçüî•ü§òüèª

reviews.author: Y T
reviews.text: My first time ordering and found a strange hair in it. Not sure if it hair on the head or not? Didn‚Äôt even bother finishing it. Was expecting phenomenal food.

reviews.author: paul gnu
reviews.text: I really liked this place, i have ordered from them numerous times this order was different since it was going to be a delivery. They have a system where you pay Zelle and then you pick up your food close to old school as you‚Äôre going to get you can place the order over the phone everything was very convenient. Not sure what happened tonight to the woman taking the order, but she was rude and condescending after I called for update on when the delivery was coming.  I didn‚Äôt appreciate that since I have spent over it $180 at this place over the past few months not to mention, I had my Job used them for a large lunch that we had for concert that we were producing In Flushing meadows Park I was shocked lost my appetite for my dinner. I sent My Son to go pick it up instead of me going there in person because I‚Äôm pretty sure I would‚Äôve told her exactly what I‚Äôm writing here today in this review of Pekin Empire. her out, I was disappointed in her behavior as a business owner. That‚Äôs not how you talk to customers if you‚Äôre busy to say hey I apologize we‚Äôre busy but to tell your customer that you‚Äôre not the only customer rudely unacceptable, especially since we live in Flushing and there‚Äôs so many choices of food to choose from they just lost a customer

reviews.author: SH Yoon (NYster)
reviews.text: Typical of many Americanized Chinese menu & price, but a bit better than most, as per a lot of Asian population & competition. Once in a L~ONG while, I feel like these things. Greasy & just plain. I would not recommended to cynical real Chinese cuisine aficionados, but if u grew up in suburbs & had this sometimes then eh~

reviews.author: Tahmina Hoque
reviews.text: Worst Chinese food I ever had in my life. I ordered Mongolian beef with fried rice. 70% of my food was onions! They literally cut up an entire onion and served it with my food. I had to take out all the onion because I could barely taste my food. All I could bite on were onions and rice! The fried rice was literally white rice fried with soy sauce. No eggs, peas, carrots etc. I also got an order of fried chicken which was soo salty. How can you go wrong with fried chicken? Never again.

reviews.author: Mikaela
reviews.text: Tried this place out due to the good reviews I have been reading. However I think it is overrated and will continue to go elsewhere. One, the person over the phone was rude and I was practically screaming over the phone because he couldn‚Äôt hear me. Second, the food took about 45mins to deliver despite only ordering two items. And finally the food was awfully bland (I got general tso) no spice or saltiness. Only reason why Im giving 2 stars instead of 1 is bc the delivery guy was very friendly.

reviews.author: Amy Coopersmith
reviews.text:
We had a fantastic dining experience at Patsy's of Queens! The food was absolutely delicious‚Äîevery dish we tried was a hit. The Fried Calamari was crispy and perfectly seasoned, the Traditional Pizza had a wonderfully balanced flavor, and both the Fettuccine Alfredo and Baked Ziti were rich, creamy, and comforting. The Chicken Parmesan was also outstanding‚Äîcrispy on the outside and tender inside with just the right amount of sauce and cheese. Dessert was fun and delicious... S'mores Pizza!

Our servers, Dean and Cynthia, were attentive, friendly, and made us feel right at home. The ambiance was charming and cozy, creating the perfect setting for a relaxed meal. The location is great, and to top it off, parking was easy and convenient. Highly recommend for anyone looking for great Italian food and warm hospitality!

reviews.author: Raymond Lian
reviews.text:
After ordering our food, we were served with complementary garlic bread that was really really tasty!! It is essentially cut up flatbread with their garlicky flavor and I couldn't stop eating it!! We got our food after a fairly long wait but the food was solid. However, there are definitely places that would have better food for a similar price. After getting the bill, I saw that I was charged extra for the side of pasta that comes with their entree. I was not informed prior to ordering that there was an extra charge for certain sides given that the menu states "All entrees come with a side pasta, vegetable or potato croquettes." The word "come" means it is complementary and therefore not an additional charge. The menu should be more clear with the costs. Since the charge wasn't too much I wasn't too mad.

Patsy has a really good pizza deal which is two 16" traditional pizza for $20!! This is ONLY for takeout orders and on Tuesday to Thursdays. There pizzas are one of the BESTT I've ever had!! It is thin and crispy and they have the perfect balance between the sauce and the cheese so that neither is too overpowering. I also love their brick oven gives the pizza an uneven char on the cheese and the crust. You should definitely come to Patsy's to get this deal!

Overall Rating is a 4.3/5

reviews.author: Ivan Perez
reviews.text:
I've been to patsys all over NYC.  The food at this location was just as good.

My chicken parmigiana with spaghetti was perfect.  The drinks weren't too bad as well.  The lights were a little too dim, my only knock but would 100% go back.

reviews.author: Mario A
reviews.text: I‚Äôve been going here for years. Staff is friendly. Cruz, Cindy, and everyone are always great. Food is very good. It can get busy on weekends.

reviews.author: Sunny Dronawat
reviews.text: The best pizza in Queens. The cook/pizza artist was amazing. The place has a great selection of Italian dishes. Everyone was friendly. The location is perfect with plenty of parking.  The pizzas I tried were simply out of this world, especially the NY style Margharita Pizza.

reviews.author: –ù–∞–¥–µ–∂–¥–∞ –î–∂—É–º–∞–µ–≤–∞
reviews.text:
Stopped by for lunch and was pleasantly surprised. I ordered a main dish that included a potato pancake, a large cabbage roll in tomato sauce, and a side of sweet braised cabbage. Everything was delicious and well-balanced. The potato pancakes were finely grated, giving them that perfect classic flavor ‚Äî especially good with the sour cream sauce. The cabbage roll was juicy, and the cabbage itself was tender and slightly sweet ‚Äî cooked to perfection.

Before the meal, they served two slices of bread with butter ‚Äî the butter was rich and flavorful. For dessert, I had three cheese-filled crepes (nalysnyky) ‚Äî huge, creamy, and served with a refreshing lemon sauce. I could only finish one and took the rest to go.

The service was quick and attentive, the food was fresh, and presentation neat. The total bill came to $34 ‚Äî a great value for such quality. I‚Äôll definitely be back!

reviews.author: Jennifer D.L. Smith
reviews.text: We had a great meal, everything was hot and fresh. I LOVED the fresh kielbasa! The sauerkraut was divine! Wish I could go back to Polish Villa daily!! It was that good! There were 5 adults in our party and we all raved about the great food and 2 of the 5 grew up with their mom's authentic Polish food!

reviews.author: Patrick Wilson
reviews.text:
We were in Buffalo for the weekend and knew we had to get Polish food, and the Polish Villa turned out to be the perfect place to do so!
