We went for lunch on Saturday and there was plenty of seating.
We ordered a pierogi plate and a breaded pork chop plate.
The re are three pierogi options: cheese, sauerkraut, and meat for an additional $0.35 charge  We got the sauerkraut pierogi, which was tangy and tasty, but the meat pierogi was truly the star of that dish. It was served with a mushroom sauce that complimented the comfortable savory flavor of the meat filling.
The breaded pork chop was almost fork-tender and had a pleasant savory flavor.
Both plates came with a vegetable and potato option. We opted for the potato pancakes.
I wholeheartedly recommend getting the sweet and sour cabbage as your vegetable option, since it goes well with everything!

We didn't quite have room for dessert üòÖ

reviews.author: David Baker
reviews.text: Best Polish food ever. Just like grandma used to make! Polish Villa is good as or better than some restaurants I went to in Krakow Poland. I usually come in with my service dog üêï‚Äçü¶∫ and have never had any issues. Staff is very friendly and helpful. I drive 1 hour to eat here. It's definitely worth the drive.

reviews.author: Keith Carey
reviews.text:
Traditional Polish Comfort Food with Great Service

Review:
On a business trip in Buffalo, I was looking for something unique and stumbled upon Polish Villa, a traditional Polish mom-and-pop spot. The restaurant isn‚Äôt flashy, but it was bustling with locals even on a Thursday night, which felt like a good sign.

The server was friendly and helpful, offering suggestions for a first-timer like me. I went with her recommendation, the Polish platter, which included a hearty spread: one golabek, one kielbasa with onions and sauerkraut, two pierogi, a potato pancake, and a bowl of soup. The soup was a nice surprise‚Äîdifferent but delicious. The meal came out simply plated, not fancy, but everything tasted fresh and comforting. The pierogi were my favorite, and the kielbasa was flavorful. The golabek was good, though I wasn‚Äôt a huge fan of their sauce.

Overall, it was a solid, authentic Polish meal with attentive service. A good spot to try traditional dishes, though I probably wouldn‚Äôt go back again.

reviews.author: Sophia S
reviews.text:
Libbi is honestly one of the most creative spots I‚Äôve been to. The flavors are amazing, everything tastes super fresh, and you can tell there‚Äôs real thought behind every dish.

The staff is warm and on top of everything, and Chef David and his wife deserve a shoutout - their dedication really shows in the food. You can feel how much he cares.

Overall, just a great vibe and even better food.

reviews.author: Rachel Kahen
reviews.text: Let me tell you, the ues NEEDED a place like this. The gals and I hit it for a lovely Sunday brunch and every single bite nourished our souls. The food was fresh, the ambiance was delightful, and the service impeccable. I must say it's a tad pricier than other brunch spots but they aren't kidding when they say "fluffy" pancakes. Every bite was phenomenal.

reviews.author: Elirom Kalatizadeh
reviews.text: You can truly taste the love and care they put into every dish. From start to finish, everything was exceptional, the service, the atmosphere, and of course, the food. We especially loved the Halibut and their homemade Gelato! We can‚Äôt wait to come back soon.

reviews.author: Angeline Godeux
reviews.text: Beautiful place and delicious food! The whole team was so kind and very accommodating. The food was tasty and well presented. Loved Libbi! Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Jung Eun Lee
reviews.text:
It was our first time at a kosher restaurant, even though we‚Äôre Asian.
We loved all the little details, and the food was absolutely delicious.
Even the honey that came with the tea felt so refined, and the sugar served with the coffee was adorable and elegant.
When things are beautifully presented, they just taste better, don‚Äôt they?
The pancake we ordered was fluffy and perfectly suited to my taste.
The service was great, too.
And if you come here, you must try the desserts ‚Äî they were incredible.
I loved them so much that I couldn‚Äôt help but ask for four to-go, and we enjoyed them at home later.
I‚Äôm so glad a restaurant like this opened on the Upper East Side.

reviews.author: perle75nyc
reviews.text: There used to be many late-night spots in Manhattan, but post COVID, many places with high foot traffic started closing earlier. This restaurant is a great exception ‚Äî it opens late and offers a wide variety of delicious food. It‚Äôs the perfect spot for a late bite after a show nearby or for a nice date night. The staff are always friendly, and the food is consistently excellent!

reviews.author: Andrew Byrne
reviews.text: Absolutely delicious, authentic Japanese cuisine. A great place to have a quiet bar-table meal, or enjoy a night out. Highly recommend the Pork or Chicken Katsu curry- I‚Äôve had it a dozen times and it never disappoints.

reviews.author: Di Lu
reviews.text:
The salmon don has a miserable amount of salmon on a big bed of rice (see picture).
The eel set was really nice, comes with tea for chazuke and seasoning too.
Friendly staff although understaffed for the large space.
Nice little dinner spot.

reviews.author: Matthew Ho
reviews.text:
I‚Äôve been here a handful of times - it‚Äôs deliciously well-priced authentic Japanese food (with a very nice izakaya vibe), and the space is large enough that I have never had to wait for a table.

The menu is pretty long (can be a bit difficult √† la decision paralysis) and they have a (cute handwritten) menu of specials, so I must admit I haven‚Äôt tried most of their dishes (nor any of their drinks). But what I have gotten has consistently been fantastic - some highlights include:

- Oroshi tonkatsu set:¬†the katsu is so yummy with a wonderful texture (fried to a good balance of not being too oily or soggy). The whole set comes with a generous amount of food (soup, salad as well), and specifically I just love the taste of oroshi in the light dashi broth. I‚Äôve also had the curry katsu before - the curry itself was pretty good, nothing too notable to point out, and the katsu was similarly delicious.

- Sukiyaki donburi was a particular favourite. The sweet flavour went with the tender sliced beef so nicely, and it came with a good assortment of tofu, veggies, and egg for a very well balanced dish. Yakiniku don was yummy too - not too salty, beef savoury and well-cooked, and the rice/sauce combo complemented everything nicely.

I‚Äôve had the chicken karaage as an appetiser a few times before, and it was a bit inconsistent each time (sometimes a bit soggy breading / not tender meat). I feel like it‚Äôs not really worth the price (especially compared to the cost most of the main dishes on the menu).

Indeed, overall the price point is very solid here - esp for the neighbourhood. Even though I read some reviews suggesting that they are a no-tip restaurant, I fear this may no longer be the case, sigh. Would love to come back again soon!

reviews.author: KP
reviews.text:
This place is a hidden gem in the city. I have been to Japan a few times and I can confirm the food here is very authentic.

The staff are very friendly and accommodating. I would definitely return!

reviews.author: Carl Harris
reviews.text: Great Service, Great Food, good value. I usually get the Italian Mixed Sub, always a good choice. The Pizza is very good as well, buy it by the slice or a whole pie.

reviews.author: Joshua Sykes
reviews.text: I ordered a 12 cut pizza half mushroom and half sausage pepperoni and onions! When I got there they made me a 8 cut half mushroom half sausage pepperoni and onions! The only reason I ordered a 12 cut is because we prefer thicker pizza and the only 12 cut they make is Sicilian thick style pizza! So I do not understand how the communication got mixed up! I kept the 8 cut but ordered a 12 cut cheese because I wanted the thicker pizza! The pizzas were both really good just wish the mix up never happened!

reviews.author: Richard Ferrari
reviews.text: Excellent pizza. I thought the sauce and spices were done just right. An excellent treat for a family visiting Lake George for the week. I also liked the garlic knots. The prices were quite reasonable. I‚Äôd definitely come back.

reviews.author: Alana
reviews.text: Great pizza, clean bathrooms, friendly staff, and fast service!

reviews.author: Ryan Mazierski
reviews.text:
The pizza here is pretty good. I really liked the buffalo wings. Generous portions in the meals that I have had there. Good number of options and choices on the menu. Convenient
location. Friendly service. Orders are completed on time. The restaurant is a good pick up or delivery spot to order from. They have only a few tables inside. Worth a try if in the area!

reviews.author: Becca
reviews.text: Great calamari, great martinis! Loved the Christmas decor. The place felt very much like 'home' in a sense that it was far less crowded than many other bars in NYC! Would definitely go back.

reviews.author: Julie Icardi
reviews.text: We loved it... food great service great and it was warm & a safe &  friendly place especially out of the cold weather. Sorry we missed you Matt. Trish said Hi take care cheers Julie & Russell

reviews.author: DIY Dan
reviews.text: Good food, excellent service. The reason for 4 stars? The online menu isn't accurate as it lists items that aren't available and there are not many choices if you are vegetarian.

reviews.author: Ansar M.
reviews.text:
Found this lovely bar while walking around the city with my better half.   The original plan was one and done and to keep bar hoping., but they were playing excellent tunes and it was such a good vibe in there.

I decided to switch from beer to a proper drink (an old fashion) and our bar tender Josh S. was not only incredibly friendly but he convinced me to try Rye instead of Bourbon and it was the best Old Fashion drink I ever had!  It was Soo good I ordered 2 more and it was a great way to finish our day.

Shout out to Bar Tender Josh S.! Thank you for the excellent service and friendly conversation.  Cheers!

reviews.author: Shama Aziz
reviews.text: Delicious Australian food (kangaroo pie, minced meat pie) cozy atmosphere. Friendly staff. Sports on but not loud. Highly recommend for an afternoon break or an evening hang out in midtown Manhattan

reviews.author: Phylicia M
reviews.text: I had a blast. The food was amazingly fulfilling. The atmosphere was sweet. Elias Meister And his band played; awesome music. The food, the atmosphere, the employees.. simply amazing. I highly recommend!

reviews.author: Cukie The Foodie
reviews.text: This place is purely good vibes. Good music, tasty food, good drinks,and they even play a drinking contest. this is the perfect spot to celebrate Oktoberfest but I believe they keep the theme alive year-round

reviews.author: Marcus Hilka
reviews.text: Oktoberfest all year round! üç∫ The Bierhaus NYC offers a great selection of German beer and hearty food in a lively, authentic atmosphere. The outside seating with a view of Third Avenue makes it an especially nice spot in good weather. Inside, the vibe feels like a piece of Bavaria right in Midtown ‚Äì long wooden tables, festive d√©cor, and a welcoming staff that adds to the experience. A great place to enjoy a beer, some classic German dishes, and to dive into Germany for a short moment while in New York.

reviews.author: Shelley Biemans
reviews.text: This is going to be controversial! The Hofbr√§u Dunkel Weizen was tasty, but not particularly well poured. The K√§sesp√§tzle with bacon was very authentic...BUT I could hardly to find the noodles! A bit less cream and cheese would make this more of a traditional sp√§tzle dish. The caramelized onions and crispy bacon were nicely prepared and I loved the mild cheese and velvety cream sauce. (Consider I was contemplating sp√§tzle with a J√§ger sauce and a side of red cabbage.) I loved stopping in and hearing about a fifth of the place speaking German or having a touch of German accent. I would recommend others coming and return for future afternoon happy hours!

reviews.author: Andra Leeke
reviews.text: So fun. Highly recommend for a cute and fun German vibe. Great beers, great music and great service. Good location too.

reviews.author: John Camire
reviews.text: One of my favorite Japanese Restaurants, wish they were open later but the selection of Izakaya Yakitori and Sushi & Sashimi Japanese home style cooking is top notch ! Sake selection on point. Must have All Yakitori, Tako Taro Salad, Hama Kama, Hamachi + Maki Rolls as well as Hot Pots + Ramen. Prices are reasonably and affordable doesn't break the bank. Must have list! Arigato !

reviews.author: Woo Young Kim
reviews.text: Love the izakaya vibe and the yakitori were pretty good! My one gripe was they had some super spicy pepper out of nowhere that made my evening very painful. Service is so so. We would want to come back again for the yakitori, and doding the peppers so i can keep my tatse buds.

reviews.author: GrAcIE W
reviews.text:
Me and my friends went to a nearby restaurant and the food (appetizers) wasn‚Äôt good, so we left without order entrees. We hopped in to this joint on the same block and thankfully, also glad that they had a table available for us.
Good vibe, friendly staffs and good Yakitori. We couldn‚Äôt be happier after the 1st place. We didn‚Äôt order much here since we ate a little before, but would definitely come back for a full meal experience.
Thank you Izakaya Nomad for saving our night :)

reviews.author: Ali Bakhsh
reviews.text: Izakaya NoMad‚Äôs menu manages to stand out  in a city with many different Japanese restaurants. Overall, we both really enjoyed our dinner here and the diverse menu

reviews.author: Mia Huynh
reviews.text:
I came here for dinner with friends and we all enjoyed it! The interior of the restaurant is cozy and we got a booth seating. Service was fairly quick, and staff was friendly.

We ordered a variety of dishes: the cucumbers, kaisendons (the mini and uni ones), the squid, the chicken and meat assortments, chicken karaage, and okonomiyaki. Everything was delicious. My friends loved their cucumbers and mini kaisendon, while I loved their squid and uni kaisendon. The skewers were delicious and juicy, and I highly recommend trying their assortments. Definitely one of my favorite izakayas in the city, so far.

reviews.author: Amari hines
reviews.text:
Yesterday I was about to grab some fast food but decided I needed real comfort food instead ‚Äî and I‚Äôm so glad I did. I stopped by Sticky Rice, and from start to finish, it was such a cozy experience (especially on a rainy day).

I originally planned to just get the calamari, but let me tell you‚Ä¶ it was the best calamari I‚Äôve had in a long time ‚Äî perfectly crunchy, flavorful, and cooked just right. My server was super kind and convinced me to try the basil fried rice with shrimp, and I was not disappointed. Every bite was amazing.

The staff was so warm and welcoming, and the whole atmosphere just made me want to stay a little longer. Sticky Rice will definitely be seeing me again‚Ä¶ and again‚Ä¶ and again. üíï

reviews.author: S S
reviews.text: The food is absolutely delicious. The service was amazing. I appreciated the recommendations by the waitress. I loved everything that we got. The calamari was delicious and flavorful. This is such a cute spot good vibes. My new go to for Thai food.

reviews.author: Briana W
reviews.text: I come here every time I‚Äôm in nyc. The food is the best Thai food I‚Äôve had yet and the service is always great! The drinks are delicious also, highly recommend

reviews.author: Harsha Jayakody
reviews.text: Had a delicious Thai rice and dumplings at Sticky Rice ‚Äî both were full of flavor and absolutely satisfying. Great spot for tasty comfort food!

reviews.author: Giulia Turano
reviews.text: Great service and great food! Amazing lunch spot for something quick and delicious. Very comfortable environment. The green curry and pad thai are phenomenal:)

reviews.author: Pedro Giovanni
reviews.text:
I just sat there for a juice and a mocktail on a dead-breeze summer evening. They have caf√© tables outside if you only want drinks, and regular tables if you want to eat something.
The place inside is nice, and outside is just outside ‚Äî but it‚Äôs a good spot if you enjoy people-watching
The service is 4 stars because the menu was super dirty and the waitress couldn't hide her frustration when we ordered mocktails.

reviews.author: Javier Kohen
reviews.text: I really liked the food, especially the tuna tostada for its complex flavor, and the mole was a close second with its intense flavor. I found the shrimp taco's flavor too mild in comparison, but not bad. I really wanted to like the place, it looks nice and the staff is friendly, however the food took forever to come out and the space indoors is extremely loud.

reviews.author: Chris P
reviews.text:
Cute Mexican restaurant with great drinks and friendly staff.

We stop in for margaritas and chips and salsa a few times per year and always have a nice time.

reviews.author: Lisa Bilinski
reviews.text: If you're looking for a charming spot to enjoy a delicious meal, this place is a must-visit! We recently dined here and loved it. The chicken enchiladas were amazing, and the steak tacos were so flavorful! The atmosphere is so quaint and cozy, making it the perfect setting for a relaxed dinner. The service was fantastic, and we couldn‚Äôt get enough of the margaritas‚Äîdefinitely some of the best we've ever had. Overall, the food was a solid 5 stars! We can't recommend this place highly enough!

reviews.author: Caitlin Begg
reviews.text: Adina made our experience here great! Went for my husband‚Äôs birthday dinner and she was an incredible server. Food was tasty (recommend trying a bunch of the tacos, liked the shrimp and steak), drinks very good, and a cozy and intimate atmosphere. Highly recommend for a date night or small group!

reviews.author: Lena K.
reviews.text: My friends hyped this place up to me so I went with high hopes. The sound of a cocktail lounge with small bites is really good but they were playing the most random songs that did not add to the ambiance at all. If i am going to eat and drink on a crammed table the ambiance can make up for it but it was not the case. The only food item worth the money is probably the Short Rib Sliders. Pass on the croquettes and pigs in a blanket, they only come with a couple of them and leave you wanting more. Lastly the cocktails. They sounds really interesting and tasteful but when you drink it, its very lacklustre. The sweet ones are too sweet and the savoury ones are not savoury enough. I really was disappointed unfortunately. The waiters tried their best to recommend drinks i would like but the menu did not allow me to be satisfied at all.

reviews.author: Taylor
reviews.text:
A friend and I stopped by for happy hour after work. The food was honestly just okay ‚Äî not terrible, but definitely not memorable. You can find better bites elsewhere, so I wouldn‚Äôt come here specifically for a meal. That said, the drinks were fantastic! This feels much more like a ‚Äúlet‚Äôs grab a drink‚Äù spot rather than a sit-down dinner destination.

The staff was friendly, and I loved the free popcorn they give out ‚Äî such a fun touch. Their happy hour is solid, with $1 oysters and a pretty good menu overall. What really stood out to me, though, was the atmosphere. The vibe makes it a perfect place to grab a couple of drinks before heading out for the night.

reviews.author: Elsa Olivier
reviews.text:
Bar Belly is a cocktail lover‚Äôs paradise! Hugo is an absolute artist behind the bar ‚Äî every drink he makes is crafted with skill and style. The Pineapple Express was my personal favorite ‚Äî bright, refreshing, and perfectly balanced. And the Pink Pony frozen cocktail? To die for! Sweet, fun, and dangerously delicious.

The vibe is cozy yet lively, making it the perfect spot for a night out. Between the incredible drinks, the welcoming atmosphere, and Hugo‚Äôs top-notch service, Bar Belly has officially become one of my go-to NYC bars.

reviews.author: Alice Rodrigo
reviews.text: Was given a warm welcome. The high tables with stools were wobbly but that's okay. Our waitress was attentive. The food was DELICIOUS! The drinks were yummy. However, there was a lady who approached me and asked me to surrender my water bottle that wasn't opened. I don't know her name, but I can say she looks like a distressed Margot Kidder. She told me when I left. I can ask for my water bottle back and I told her I may forget. But she was persistent and insisted on the water bottle until my fianc√© took the water bottle, opened it and poured it into his cup of water. I don't know what the problem was, but she totally ruined my entire experience at this restaurant and that's what prompted me to close out my visit. If a customer is sitting at a table with a closed bottled water, they shouldn't have to be pestered to surrender it.

reviews.author: Mikayla N.
reviews.text: Amazing $1 happy hour oysters served with complimentary truffle popcorn. The drinks are phenomenal as well. I got the Casanova and it‚Äôs my fave!

reviews.author: Juan Marcano
reviews.text: Nice casual setting. Many dishes to choose from. We mostly chose appetizers. The ribs, fried shrimp, spring roll, fried banana cheesecake were excellent. The soup was not to my liking, the vegan pad see ew was ok, the fried calamari was rubbery & the pi√±a colada was so so. Overall I would say as long as you know what to order you'll be in good shape. I admit the service was really excellent

reviews.author: Diana Kenkolaukis
reviews.text:
Everything was so tasty ‚Äì highly recommended!

The mango salad was absolutely delicious ‚Äî super fresh and flavorful. But honestly, it‚Äôs just as good as the appetizers! The fried tofu and the calamari with that sweet and spicy sauce were amazing. So tasty!

It‚Äôs a bit of a shame they don‚Äôt offer bubble tea anymore, since that used to be a nice bonus. Still, this place is definitely worth visiting, and I‚Äôll be coming back many more times!

reviews.author: Sou Corley
reviews.text: This is a very welcoming Thai restaurant. Great ambiance and attentive staff. After stumbling in here after a show from the city. I had the best drunken noodles I ever had in a while. My friend had a similar dish Shrimp Pad See Ew. Even the Tamarind Hibiscus Tea was refreshing. My friend is vegan and trued their tofu dumplings. Calamari was also fresh.  I was very satisfied and would return again to try more on their menu. üòçüëèüèºüëèüèºüëèüèºüôèüèº‚ù§love it.

reviews.author: Kristina Kovalyova
reviews.text: I really liked this cafe. Nice atmosphere, very clean, the interior is comfortable and cozy. The Thai tom yum soup and noodles were so delicious. I want to try all their menu). The staff is friendly and serves very quickly. I saw a lot of delivery guys coming for orders, which means the food here is really delicious. I highly recommend visiting.

reviews.author: nico h.
reviews.text: Went in completely randomly on a Saturday afternoon. It wasn‚Äôt crowded. The waitstaff is very friendly and attentive. Ordered the Lay rolls, which was the only dish that was not satisfactory. They were dry and had what I believed to be insufficient filling. The brief taste of the filling was quite good however. Ordered the wings for an appetizer. They were crispy, cooked perfectly and the saucy was sweet and delicious. We had the red snapper for an entree and it was also perfect. The fish was whole cooked and perfectly fresh. Snapper is my favorite and this was soooo delicious. It was enough for two to share. We ordered a plate of rice - the pineapple which was equally delicious and paired wonderfully with the fish. I would definitely return. I live in the area and this a great local spot!!! Yummy üòã

reviews.author: Jimmy Si
reviews.text:
This place is amazing for Thai food. We started off with the papaya salad which was refreshing. The Khao Tom Haeng was excellent, the mixture of all meats (pork belly, Chinese sausage, minced pork & shrimp) were all delicious. The Gaeng Hung Lay Nuar was super tender and flavorful. The stewed beef in curry was so soft and was excellent when paired with the rice. The last dish, Pla Tod Samun Prai which is a fried branzino with lots of herbs and spices. It was super soft and flaky and the herbs, onions and garlic and other items went so well with it. Probably one of our favorite dishes of the night.

The staff was super nice and very attentive. The table we had was small but it managed to fit everything! There's seating inside and a canopy for outside seating. You can make reservations ahead of time. The atmosphere is great and lively and a very busy come popular dining times.

reviews.author: Sharon Chan
reviews.text:
This ambiance is so cute & the food presentation is amazing. Tony was a great server!

The Hor Mok is nothing like I‚Äôve ever had before & it was incredible. The thai tea & papaya salad were also tasty!

Kang Pu (Crab curry) & Pad Pong Ka-ree were punchy, spicy & paired perfectly with the fluffy white rice.

reviews.author: Alison Ryu
reviews.text: My favorite Thai restaurant in NYC! The fried branzino is amazing, and they have the best papaya salad. We also tried their winter menu, and the Lhon Pu appetizer was unreal. Would definitely recommend any of their crab dishes, they use high quality ingredients and you can‚Äôt go wrong with anything on their menu. So many Thai restaurants in NYC but if you go to one, you must try Sukh!

reviews.author: Foodie Elite
reviews.text:
NYC‚Äôs traincar-themed Thai restaurant is your ticket to a beautiful dining experience. @sukh.nyc combines rich flavors with stunning ambiance ‚Äî think vintage railcar interiors and thoughtfully plated dishes that feel like a journey through Thailand.

Unique presentation is a big part of the experience here‚Äîjust like the Hor Mok ‚Äî a steamed branzino curry custard topped with jumbo lump crab meat.  Their presentation and refinement took it to another level ‚Äî both visually and flavor-wise. Another must-try is the fried branzino ‚Äî perfectly crisp on the outside, tender and flaky inside.

Whether you‚Äôre a longtime Thai food lover or just looking to try something new, this Brooklyn gem is worth the ride.

Follow me @foodie.elite on IG and Tiktok for more!

reviews.author: Pat B Boon
reviews.text: Then you will not be disappointed. For the food, the food that tastes delicious and flawlessly delicious. It is the original taste of Thai food, including the model. The raw materials used are specially of high quality. It is definitely suitable for the price you have paid. The staff is smiling and paying attention to details. And you will be amazed with the special food that the restaurant offers in every season. Of course, I will come back to eat here and it is another restaurant in Brooklyn and in New York that is the top that will not disappoint you for sure.

reviews.author: Esfira Shakh
reviews.text:
Dining at Aquavit was a refreshing and inspiring culinary experience that fully lived up to its prestigious two Michelin stars. From the moment I stepped through its modern, chic entrance, I knew I was in for something special. The attention to detail, both in the ambiance and the service, was pristine and thoughtful.

We were warmly welcomed by Catherine, our server for the evening, whose grace and professionalism, along with the attentive support of the entire team, made the night flow effortlessly. Each course was served with impeccable timing, and dishes were changed seamlessly between courses, every gesture contributing to the seamless dining experience.

I opted for the Chef‚Äôs Tasting Menu, a seven-course exploration that was nothing short of extraordinary. The kitchen kindly and impressively accommodated my dietary restrictions (no dairy or shellfish), without compromising on creativity or flavor. Every plate was a work of art, visually stunning and masterfully composed with bold, yet balanced Nordic flavors.

The starters included a delicate fluke with cucumber, a beautifully presented cod with white asparagus, caviar, and apple, each dish showcasing refreshing elements with a rich complexity of flavor.

The entrees featured a vibrant salmon with Meyer lemon, a perfectly cooked Chilean sea bass with turnip, and a standout lamb with morel mushrooms. The fish was impeccably fresh and cooked to perfection, highlighting the natural taste of the sea, while the lamb served medium, was tender, herbaceous, and deeply satisfying.

Dessert was a lovely finale: a luscious chocolate mousse paired with strawberry, a sweet and elegant ending to an evening of pure culinary delight.

Aquavit is not only a restaurant, it‚Äôs an experience. A beautifully orchestrated blend of Nordic innovation, seasonal freshness, and flawless execution, it absolutely deserves every accolade and star it has received. A must-visit for any gourmand seeking something unique and memorable in New York City.

reviews.author: Ian Pilgreen
reviews.text:
Aquavit was my first 2 Michelin Star dining experience. Having had the privilege of dining at a handful of 1 Star restaurants before for lunch and dinner (like Le Pavillon, one of Daniel Boulud's restaurants in NY), I wanted to see what, if any, discernible difference there was between the two.

The thing I truly appreciate about Aquavit is its lack of pretentiousness and inviting model. I snagged a day-of 5:30pm reservation for 1 person in the bar area (a la carte menu only) at a gorgeous 2 Michelin Star fine dining restaurant and spent *under $100* for a 3-course meal WITH an aquavit flight. Incredible! They even take walk-ins at the bar if you're feeling the itch for excellent Scandinavian cuisine one night.

As soon as I walked in, I was greeted and my coat was checked by the woman at the front of house. To my surprise, she guided me to a booth table in the bar room (I was assuming I'd just be relegated to a high chair at the bar, but those are just for walk-ins).

My waiter quickly introduced himself, and there was a brief awkward moment when he put a second menu down and asked if I'd like to wait for my guest. I made a reservation for one and was dining alone, so I had to tell him it was just myself üòÇ Not a huge deal at all, but a more sensitive guest might not have appreciated the assumption.

He then asked for my water preference (still and sparkling are both complimentary) and a second waiter quickly filled my glass from behind once I indicated my preference. I ordered the Nordic Breads (sourdough & Danish rye), a flight of 3 aquavits (Fig & Cardamom, Br√§nneri, and H√∏vding) and the Swedish Meatballs.

The surprise stars of these was the Danish rye and the Fig and H√∏vding aquavits. The rye was arguably the best bread I've ever had (and I'm not a lover of hard seeded loafs), and the complex depth of flavor present in the drinks was a pleasure to experience.

The meatballs were nothing to sniff at, though. They certainly will go down as the best meatballs I've ever had, and the dish as a whole was beautifully balanced. The meatballs' texture was perfect, the pommes puree was luscious, the lingonberry provided a bright sweetness, and the house-made shaved cucumber pickles added a much-needed crunch and acidity.

After much deliberation and a recommendation from my waiter, I opted for the Apple Vacherin dessert as my final course. When it came out, it was accompanied by a small birthday Princess Cake, as I was having this dinner as a birthday celebration. It was a very cute moment, as the diners next to me, seeing I was alone at the table with my small birthday cake, all wished me a happy birthday üòä

Both desserts were excellent, but the Apple Vacherin was truly sublime. Each element gave way to a depth of flavor I wasn't expecting. The apples were tart and crisp which contrasted beautifully with the light vanilla creme fraiche. It was followed on the palate by the crunch of the tarragon-infused meringue, and the toasted sunflower seeds at the bottom laid dormant in your mouth until the very end when they gave a gorgeous kettle corn note to round out the meal.

Truly excellent experience from start to finish. I look forward to coming back in the dining room and trying out the tasting menu, especially the famous bird's nest dish which was not present on the a la carte menu.

reviews.author: Victor Borowski
reviews.text: First time dining at a Michelin star establishment. Incredible experience. Walking into the restaurant introduces you to a pleasant, relaxing aroma, as well as kind staff ready to help. The ambient music established a super serene atmosphere, and I was looking forward to dining. The dining experience itself was phenomenal. The staff was incredibly polite and accommodating for dietary restrictions of any kind. The food was incredibly creative. Some dishes were innovative, while some were meant to be cozy and nostalgic. Every dish performed how it was meant to. We were each given a gift: a complimentary container of the restaurant‚Äôs smoked sea salt along with the day‚Äôs menu. I‚Äôm excited to use this sea salt in my own dishes, and I hope to return soon.

reviews.author: Desmond
reviews.text:
Honestly, I've dined at Aquavit over 5 times now, having making the trek from Eastern Long Island to Manhattan just to come here.

This place is world class. From the relaxing ambiance, the vibe, the serenity, and the friendliness of all the staff. The food is simply divine.

Everything about the dishes presented as careful thought and execution. And it shows. I've had the Chef's tasting menu on my first visit, and enjoy the Bar menu consistently there-after.

Last night I had a remarkable Steak Tartare, Chilled Corn soup, and my date had the pancake shrimp skagen. As usual, world class food. For the seconds, we enjoyed the Atlantic cod and Kroppkakor. Again, everything outstanding.

The steak tartare should remain on the offering all year round, in my opinion!

Dessert I had the Swedish Pancake Huckleberry with the heavenly vanilla whipped cream. On previous visits, I had a wonderful Chilean Sea bass burger.

Aquavit is a place that feels like home and I hope they never change it. For the price point, its insane value and this cannot be denied. I'm shocked they do not have a 3rd Michelin Star.

I've attached photos from my multiple meals here, most recent from last night. My compliments to the entire Aquavit team for making this such a fantastic experience, every time.

Desmond Bhimull, MD

reviews.author: The Chef's Table
reviews.text: An unforgettable dining experience shared with my favorite dining companion. Beautiful technique was executed in each and every dish, with depth of flavor throughout. We started the meal with an Amuse of Elk Tartare which definitely amused the palate and got us ready for the whole experience. We shared a bottle of Timorasso which was perfect with many of the light dishes we enjoyed in the Chef's Tasting. The kitchen is in full sight with a glass wall and we enjoyed seeing them at work. We opted to add the Caviar supplement which was a nice touch. Service was top notch. Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Jennifer
reviews.text: I got the 2-roll lunch special for about $15. I‚Äôve definitely had better sushi‚Äîthe shrimp and shrimp tempura weren‚Äôt crispy, and both rolls lacked flavor overall. The taste just didn‚Äôt come together for me. The space is small but the service was quick.

reviews.author: Rolling Mutton
reviews.text:
Be careful if you are taking out. They play sneaky game not telling you the size.
$42 dollars in total. Just this much. I understand the fried oysters are written on the menu to be 4 pieces. But your specialty roll is not even 6 of them for 16 dollars! I ve seen pictures in the comments. Others got specialty rolls and it was way more than what I got.

reviews.author: Amelia Smith
reviews.text: really cute cozy place. i had a great service experience, the servers are direct but take good care of you. fish is fresh and well seasoned (i had spicy tuna roll) would definitely recommend but its small so come early to make sure you get seats. they also have take out available! (also they give really big mugs of hot green tea usually it's smaller at other places) if we lived here we'd be regulars!

reviews.author: Jacqueline Marks
reviews.text: I eat sushi all the time on the west coast, but in NYC I‚Äôve struggled to find a place with truly high quality fish for an affordable cost. Earlier this year, I found this place on doordash and now I order from them all the time. Not once have I been disappointed. The prices are amazingly low and the fish is consistently high quality, plus they are very generous with the size of their nigiri. Also‚Äî you can never go wrong with their ‚Äúyellowtail boy.‚Äù

reviews.author: Andrea Segarra
reviews.text: The sushi is decently good. I recommend ordering the lunch special, which includes soup, salad, and rolls. The place is small, and don‚Äôt expect much from the service‚Äîthe waiters are not very friendly.

reviews.author: Meghan Ng
reviews.text: First time eating here and Zara didn‚Äôt steer me wrong! She recommended the chicken schnitzel with the sides of mash pur√©e and broccolini and it was sooo good! I took the rest home because I couldn‚Äôt finish it all but I couldn‚Äôt wait to eat it the next day!üòã‚ù§Ô∏è

reviews.author: Hannah Kittrell
reviews.text:
Food was on the pricey side for brunch (not shocking for Nolita), but delicious.
All made worth it by my amazing waiter CHRIS. Hilarious server who absolutely lit up the restaurant on a slower Tuesday afternoon. He was very attentive and helpful with menu selections. Come over and cross your fingers that Chris greets you.

reviews.author: Faye Zhong
reviews.text: I absolutely love this place! Especially the friendly host Chris, he had me at hello!!! Will be coming back frequently! Oh, and the food is amazing!üíôüòç

reviews.author: Chipper Spice
reviews.text: Loved this entire experience!  Our server, Chris, was amazing!  Great energy and warm personality and not overbearing.  What a pleasure to dine here.  The food was fantastic and all the staff were very nice and had great vibes.  I loved this restaurant and look forward to returning!!  Thanks for the wonderful lunchy!!!

reviews.author: Clayton DSouza
reviews.text: It was a small and crowded place but the food and drinks were really good. I would definitely go back. The service was wonderful and each plate was very tasty. The cocktails were very well madwas wonderful

reviews.author: Laura Clarke
reviews.text: Daniel was an incredible server! His personality made our experience incredibly enjoyable. The food was outstanding, we got one of their specials, the Thors Hammers and it was beautifully presented, the polenta it came with was delicious. We will be back!!

reviews.author: Priyu Suryawanshi
reviews.text: Modern Italian dining in a super chill vibe. The food is tasty and the service is attentive. Nice bar with great cocktails! Will definitely come back again.

reviews.author: S. Chen
reviews.text:
Splendid dinner. Chicceti tasting option great for trying out a taste of the variety of allergist on offer- octopus, potato, with green and black olives; shatteringly crispy gnocco with silky capicola, peachy-orangey  floral marmalade; today's special of fried crispy pork belly chunks with marinated pickled peach atop buttery polenta. Main entr√©e also a special of gnocchi verde with handpicked crab meat, season fresh shaved asparagus, rich savory bechamel. Dessert of pistachio cream carrot cake (such rich cream more like custard, doughy tender moist cake) with chocolate pearls and pistachio gelato. Sparkler candy for the cake to celebrate the special occasion.
Super professional staff. Our superb waiter Brian K was utterly professional and anticipated and accommodated not only needs but also preferences. Tremendously patient with answering menu questions and sharing guidance. Helped make for a standout dining experience.

reviews.author: Kathleen Reilly
reviews.text: We had a wonderful dinner there last evening. My husband had the lasagna special and I had the Bronzino, which is always excellent. The staff are friendly. The cocktails are wonderful and they have a nice wine selection. Highly recommended family friendly too.

reviews.author: Jason
reviews.text: Amazing restaurant. First time here and we were very impressed and will definitely be back! Service was exceptional as were all the drinks and food! Highlights were definitely the patatas (crispy potatoes), chicken parm, focaccia bread and bomboloni for dessert! Great experience all around

reviews.author: Henri Merceron
reviews.text: A wonderful restaurant. Very well appointed ambiance‚Ä¶light and bright. Friendly staff and waiter. The food, both specials and regular, were excellent. We had the special Pumpkin ravioli, faroe island salmon(nice crispy skin), cauliflower appetizer and crispy artichoke hearts. All very good. But I have to say, the tiramisu is standout and the best I‚Äôve ever had. Not the typical presentation and not as sweet as most which we appreciate.

reviews.author: malcolm green
reviews.text:
Stopped in for a quick lunch on a beautiful August day, they were bustling so we waited for longer than usual to be acknowledged and finally seated.  The gazpacho was perfectly executed, nice acidity light flavorful. I had the chicken Parmesan with the Jr. portion of pasta. The mini dollop of ricotta was a nice touch although I definitely had issues with the portion size. The chicken itself was nicely seasoned, but wasn‚Äôt exactly the most tender piece of chicken I‚Äôve ever had in a restaurant in a Parmesan.
We enjoyed the fries, those were well dine and the aioli was tasty.
The cocktails we had were not memorable in either presentation or taste and thus no pics of the drinks.  The environment was loud  and it was busy and the wait staff seemed to be having a low energy day. It is a fairly large restaurant with mezzanine seating. Overall, It was ok. I would have loved more attentive service and slightly bigger portions of pasta in the parmesan dish.

reviews.author: Tiaranad Gerjarusak
reviews.text: Lovely restaurant with good food and great service. We came around 3 in the afternoon on Wednesday and the restaurant was pretty packed. We made a reservation so we were able to seat right away. They offer a set menu at a very good price 2 course for $30 and 3 course for $40. I ordered from a set meatballs for appetizer and pasta with broccoli and sausage for main. My son had shrimp pasta. We also ordered a fried calamari. All the dishes were so tasty and cooked to perfection. I truly enjoy my experience dinning here.

reviews.author: snowy
reviews.text:
some of the food is great. a person i was dining with described the chicken parmesan as life-changing. some of the pasta seems a bit slimy though.
the atmosphere is very unique and pretty, and i was in awe when i walked in. it seems very fancy in general. the prices are expensive though.

reviews.author: Jonathan Tanner
reviews.text: All the food was amazing. We really enjoyed it. They did take my order incorrectly, but what they brought me was still really good and I was pleased with what I ate, but they did not get the order right which isn‚Äôt the end of the world for me, but might be for others and I‚Äôm sure they would‚Äôve exchanged it if I would‚Äôve asked

reviews.author: Bill Jenkins
reviews.text: Came here on a Saturday afternoon.  The Roundhouse was a mob scene and this place was quiet.  I'd much rather be here than the mob scene.  The food was good.  I did have to Google what each curry was but I knew having had Thai before that curries are my best option.  We had the Massman and the Panang curries; both are very similar in taste.  The one negative here is the mens room - very run down and scary.  I have to rate low just on that alone.  Please do a deep clean!

reviews.author: Tara Priest
reviews.text: Cute place!  Nice staff!  Chicken Pad Thai was delish!  Best I've probably had.  Thai Tea was good too!  Definitely a must when in Beacon!

reviews.author: Migdalia Garcia
reviews.text: Good was delicious.  We had the pad Thai and red curry.  The Thai iced tea was good, just a tad sweet for me. Service was ok.

reviews.author: tammy maeiro
reviews.text: As a small business owner, I understand the significance of reviews for my business, so I am fulfilling my part. Today marked my first order from this establishment, and the cuisine was truly incredible!!!!!!!! It was so exceptional that I felt compelled to reorder and enjoy it for dinner, an absolutely AMAZING experience! Thank you for the outstanding service.

reviews.author: Lindsay Taylor
reviews.text: Very good Thai food! I ordered the Thai fried rice with chicken, paid Thai with chicken, and a side of sticky rice. The atmosphere was very cozy and service was very friendly. I highly recommend

reviews.author: Bleesy Dy
reviews.text:
What a great spot! Their food was really a hit! I had some Omelette. The perfection of the goat cheese spinach and eggs did a good job. I really loved the atmosphere, they have a good number of seats, a bar and the ambiance really is nice.

Can‚Äôt say more and everything better in person, but the ambiance really won my heart. A great spot to hang out and enjoy the weather.

Servers were really attentive and very accommodating making the visit more pleasant.

reviews.author: Nicole Pugliese
reviews.text: We had our wedding at Arte Cafe and it was absolutely perfect. We had the most wonderful picturesque old school New York Italian-American ambiance. The manager Ariel was extremely generous and accommodating. The event coordinator Alexis was attentive, thoughtful, organized and knowledgeable. The general wait staff, bar staff, and kitchen crew were incredibly professional, experienced, and gracious. They made our dreams come true!

reviews.author: Sherri Lilienfeld
reviews.text: I love this place. I had my daughter's Bridal Shower here in the Skylight Room and I couldn't be more satisfied. The food was exquisite, the service was exceptional and they were very accomodating and easy to work with. Everyone said how great everything was. Thank you so much Arte Cafe for making our event special.

reviews.author: Victoria Borja
reviews.text: We had our wedding dinner at Arte Cafe in the Skylight Room. Alexis helped us plan the whole day and gave us so many options to work through, and Auriel and team ensured the day-of went perfectly. Not to mention how much our guests loved the food!

reviews.author: Simon Mesber
reviews.text: Arre is more than food, is an amazing experience. Starting with the decoration; is a beautifully delicate and cozy place to enjoy with family, the variety in the menu, coffee, and their sweets treats. The attention is amazing! Nico, The manager is always thinking about every detail, trying to give you the best service. We are new in the neighborhood and this is our place for breakfast or brunch, but I‚Äôm pretty sure that they have many options for dinner and even live music on weekends. It‚Äôs a place that you have to visit in Kendall, in my opinion, is a hidden treasure in the Neighborhood.

reviews.author: Alexander Kherodinashvili
reviews.text:
What an incredible find! Nota Bene delivers a truly authentic Georgian dining experience right  in the Brighton beach. From the moment we walked in, we were greeted with warm hospitality and a cozy, inviting atmosphere.
The food was nothing short of spectacular.
The staff were friendly, attentive, and passionate about sharing the richness of Georgian culture and cuisine. Whether you‚Äôre a first-timer or a longtime fan of Georgian food, Nota Bene is an absolute must-visit.

‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è ‚Äî A true hidden gem!

reviews.author: Mellie Lynch
reviews.text:
This restaurant does not even deserve one star.
Service was extremely terrible, the table was never cleaned once, the music was very loud for the space they offer,  the bathroom was very dirty.
Our bad review comes from the fact that we experienced the most unhygienic service ever. Please see attached picture; Plates placed on top of each other and on top of other dishes and meals. This is against sanitary, regulations, and protocols of New York State.
Please be mindful before you plan a big gathering there.

reviews.author: Iren A
reviews.text: Hands down one of the best restaurants! The food was delicious - the taste the variety. Atmosphere was so nice. But most importantly live music with the talented singer made the party one of a kind. I recommend this place so very much!!!!

reviews.author: Bubba
reviews.text: We came in late for dinner, first time experiencing any Georgian cuisine. Absolutely blown away by the flavors, textures, and timing of all the foods. Highly recommend any of the Khachapuri Staff was very friendly, and service was excellent. I‚Äôll be coming back next time I‚Äôm in NYC for sure.

reviews.author: Rachel Dzanashvili
reviews.text: Came here with a group of friends as walk-ins and we were promptly seated at an unreserved table. The service was prompt and the food lives up to the culinary expectations of Georgian cuisine. The menu items were the Imeruli khachapuri and Georgian bread, which was served warm and truly made my mouth water. In addition, they also have live music, which gives give you an opportunity to burn off all the food you ate.

reviews.author: Good Eats (Traveler)
reviews.text: Shout out to the bootleggers bar and Grill for fire Saturday nightü§óü•∞.  I originally wanted sushi but they chef wasn‚Äôt in so I walked around the corner and bootleggersü§ó was here. Food amazing ,service amazing , atmosphere feels like home. Thank you for your great service and good eats.

reviews.author: Kaleb Mendoza
reviews.text: My wife and I held our wedding dinner at Bootlegger's. The staff was more than excited to help us plan our special night. We didn't want to deal with the craziness of hosting a huge wedding, so when we came to Bootlegger's they instantly made us feel heard and seen. We used their "Perfect night" catering package and added on some extra sides. The staff went above and beyond in getting the white linens and low rounds to really make the aesthetic work well for our event. All our guests were amazed at how tasty the food was and they haven't stopped raving about it since! The staff tended to my wife and I the whole night. We made the best decision to host our party here, highly recommend!!

reviews.author: Jackie Adler
reviews.text:
We had a great experience here yesterday night.
The atmosphere is a nicer pub, with lots of tvs above the bar if you want to watch the game. The tables where we sat were for enough away that it felt separate from the bar area, though. Also of note, bathrooms were very clean, which says a lot.
Our waitress was friendly and attentive. She took our order promptly and the appetizers (mozzarella sticks and soup) came out quickly. The entrees arrived hot and as we asked for them.
Last, but definitely not least, the food was awesome! The mozzarella sticks were 6 to an order (I love when it's an even number) and I really loved the marinara sauce. The Buffalo chicken chowder was so good! A little bit of heat, lots of chicken and veggies, and just thick enough.
We ordered the chicken tenders, which had a light and crunchy beer batter coating. If the batter is the same, I can't wait to try the fried fish next. We also tried the Cowboy burger. It came out medium well as we had asked and had just the right amount of bbq (I hate when they pour it on and soak the bun). Fries were good too.
Overall, a pleasant experience all around and we will be back to try other items too. You should stop by yourself and give it a try.

reviews.author: Susan Corr
reviews.text: Best wings we‚Äôve had in a long time!!  We sat outside and the service was a bit slow but other than that it was great.  Cocktails were delicious

reviews.author: Dustin Staires
reviews.text: Everything was perfect here today! The amount of Lobster meat in the Mac & Cheese is quite impressive and it is ridiculously good! I also got some of the Creole Slaw and it was phenomenal! It's crazy because I usually won't go to a place with this low of a rating on google. I was pleasantly shocked! I can't speak on anything else. This is my first time here and I got the best service as well. I highly recommend.

reviews.author: Andrea Rubio
reviews.text: We had a fantastic meal here. This was our second visit to the resturant, and it was just as great as the first visit. The guac did not disappoint! We had Claire as our server, she was the BEST! We will be going back on our next visit.

reviews.author: Valentin
reviews.text:
Harvest Kitchen is a hidden gem! I went for the burger and it was absolutely delicious, juicy, flavorful, and cooked to perfection. The ingredients are super fresh, and you can really taste the quality.

The vibe is cozy and welcoming, and the service was great too. If you‚Äôre looking for a spot with amazing burgers in a chill atmosphere, this place is a must. I‚Äôll definitely be coming back!

reviews.author: Clarissa Pace
reviews.text: The Prosciutto focaccia, burger and the lamb stew were amazing, service was great!! Our waiter Miguel was great, and very nice. Loved the apple pie and chocolate cake.

reviews.author: Nick Coombs
reviews.text: Burgers were huge and very delicious.  Fries were also very good.  Good size portions and good presentation.  Waiter was really quiet.  Not sure if he just didn't speak good English or what.  Clean and quiet place.

reviews.author: Taina O
reviews.text:
Great focaccia is a great place.
The burger was big!
Great indoor seating as well outdoor seating.
I would like it if they had vegetable options besides salad.

reviews.author: camelia motoc
reviews.text:
I had such a wonderful experience at Osteria 106! The food was absolutely delicious ‚Äì the pasta tasted fresh and homemade, and the bruschetta prosciutto were full of flavor. The atmosphere is cozy and inviting, with just the right mix of rustic and elegant.

The service was warm and attentive without being rushed, and the staff made me feel very welcome. It does get lively during peak hours, but it adds to the authentic, bustling Italian vibe. Prices are fair for the quality, and portions are generous enough to share.

Definitely a place I would return to ‚Äì whether for a date night, dinner with friends, or simply to enjoy some great Italian comfort food in Manhattan. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: K M
reviews.text: Phenomenal experience from the ambiance, to the waitstaff, and then to the delectable food.  They took me in as a walking but they also recommend reservations as they have busy period.  I chose one of the appetizer specials along with a dinner and later a dessert special.  All were very good.  Definitely recommend.

reviews.author: Andr√°s Szuromi
reviews.text:
Small cozy Italian restaurant with a family like atmosphere. They have a daily offer that is different to the regular a‚Äôla carte menu. Always talk to your waiter they are knowledgeable. It does worth to have a go with the daily offer. There is a wide choice of appetizers. I chose from the daily offer. As far as I can remember it was stuffed fried peppers which was outstanding. Duck and pea soup are also 5*. Tiramisu is a must have top choice. Panna cotta is also very good and luckily not on the sweet side.
This place is a must visit. There is also an excellent wine menu.

reviews.author: Lisa Kim
reviews.text: I recently dined at this Italian restaurant, and overall, it was a delightful experience. The food was delicious, and the staff provided excellent service. My only critique is that the serving dishes were consistently cold. While this wasn't an issue for cold dishes, warm plates would have enhanced the experience for hot meals. Despite this, the flavors and service make it a worthwhile. I would definitely come back for other dishes.

reviews.author: StewartGerard
reviews.text: Wow!! Totally unexpected amazing Italian restaurant. We came for my birthday very low key and was pleasantly surprised! I must say having just been recently in Italy it‚Äôs the closest to the real thing I‚Äôve had in a while in the city. Good wine selection, amazing service and the food was outstanding! Bravo!

reviews.author: Zimmi Coker
reviews.text: El Mitote is a casual but delicious Mexican restaurant located on the UWS. Every time I go, it never fails to disappoint. Don‚Äôt let the margs fool you, one will usually suffice. Personally, I prefer the frozen as they have the perfect consistency. I ordered the frozen coconut (which is out of this world) and my friend got the frozen blood orange marg which was also incredible. My one little critique is that what is labeled on the menu as a ‚Äúquesadilla‚Äù is indeed NOT at all a quesadilla. It‚Äôs literally a soft taco with little to no cheese, but I will give them this- they are delicious. The chorizo is a big hit here and is full of flavor, but please just add more cheese!!! That‚Äôs the entire point of a (quesa)dilla, LOL. The service is great here and the atmosphere is relaxed, but it‚Äôs also very fun with the festive decor and upbeat tunes in the background.

reviews.author: LOURDI
reviews.text: El Mitote is in a great spot for after-work happy hours. It‚Äôs a smaller, quaint location, but it‚Äôs filled with so much ambiente and lively energy. The drinks are solid, and the food is absolutely amazing... definitely the kind that makes you want to come back. The d√©cor gives major D√≠a de los Muertos vibes, colorful and full of personality. I didn‚Äôt check out the bathrooms, but given how clean and well-kept the restaurant itself is, I‚Äôm sure they match that same standard. Overall, definitely a repeat visit in my book!

reviews.author: Christine Betts
reviews.text: Fun atmosphere (even in the rain). I had the mushroom tinga tacos, which were pretty good. The chips and salsa was delicious, but we assumed it was standard 'free chips and salsa' and it turned out to be $9 for a little basket of chips and some (albeit extremely delicious) salsa.  Not that big of a deal but when the waiter offered I wish they'd mentioned they were nine bucks.

reviews.author: Meera Mohan
reviews.text: Perfect evening weather led us to El Mitote, and the outdoor seating didn't disappoint. Pleasant, well-spaced, and lovely ambience. Our server, Guel, was attentive, kind, and friendly - even offering a taste of different mezcals for my partner. Drinks were top-notch: Passion Fruit Margherita and Alipus San Andres Mezcal were really good. The El Tecate beer was a nice complement. Food was decent, if not spectacular - Carnitas Platter and Spicy Chorizo Burrito were enjoyable, but not the most flavorful Mexican food we've had. Given the great ambience, exceptional staff, and excellent drinks, we're willing to overlook the food's shortcomings. Pet-friendly outdoor seating is a bonus. If you're looking for a great spot for outdoor drinks, El Mitote's a solid choice.

reviews.author: Mildred Santiago
reviews.text: Had to wait long time because it was full. But when we sat down the service and the food was excellent. Very fast. Delicious.

reviews.author: Doli D
reviews.text:
Food is not as good as before since new management. I used to love the food here..
the Peas pulao had more peas than rice. The Lamb Rogan Josh and butter chicken didn‚Äôt taste good.  Also the lady who work there was so rude she asked me to go wait outside while the restaurant was empty and I was waiting for my order.

reviews.author: Simran Bir
reviews.text: Ever since the new management began operating this restaurant, the food and service have improved so much. Now it's a family-run business apparently, and the owner is the uncle that created India Cafe in Richmond and Floral Park previously. He sold both those establishments and said his only focus is now on Royal India Palace, and you can tell ... the food is great.

reviews.author: karma8kitty
reviews.text: I wanted to do a take out order by phone but was unable to get the ingredients in the dishes over the phone. Thank goodness üòÖ I was staying in the hotel next door. Once I went in person, I was very happy with the detailed descriptions of the menu items and their ingredients. If you are vegetarian or vegan there are a few menu delicious options. Overall I was very satisfied with the food quality and I was able to do take out even though I did have to go in to make the order.

reviews.author: Ehsan Partovi
reviews.text:
There are many good Indian restaurants in this neighborhood, but the service, management, and ownership at this place are absolutely ridiculous.

I walked in and told them I‚Äôd like to try their buffet. After I took a small sampler plate, the waiter came over and told me they were closing the buffet soon and that I should take whatever I wanted before they put it away. I asked why he hadn‚Äôt mentioned that before I sat down, and he just looked at me and walked off.

I took some food, but it was cold. I asked for a container to take it home, and they refused. When I asked to speak with the manager, they said he was busy on the phone. I waited while he stood in the corner talking in Hindi and laughing‚Äîclearly aware of me standing there. I called out to him three times. After 20 minutes, he finally came over and told me there‚Äôs no takeout allowed for the buffet. He also claimed to be one of the owners.

I explained what had happened, and instead of apologizing, he accused me of threatening the waiter with a negative review‚Äîwhich I hadn‚Äôt done. Then, once he realized I had been there before, he brought me a container. But at that point, I told him I no longer wanted the food. I didn‚Äôt want to eat it later and feel all the stress and disrespect all over again.

Just to be clear: I make over half a million dollars a year. I wasn‚Äôt looking for any favors or free food‚ÄîI simply wanted to enjoy a warm, unrushed meal, with basic courtesy and professionalism.

reviews.author: G C
reviews.text: I thought the food was pretty good. I normally don't eat buffets cuz I don't feel the quality is usually the same when you order a specific plate. But this was pretty good. And because it's buffet the price was really good compared to how much you could get. Overall I would do it again.

reviews.author: Vexer 4000
reviews.text:
I‚Äôd never been to a German restaurant before, so I decided to give Heidelberg a try. We went for Saturday lunch, and overall, the experience was enjoyable.

We started with the potato pancakes, which we really liked. They were served with both applesauce and sour cream ‚Äî my first time trying that combination. The applesauce was an interesting (and surprisingly tasty) pairing.

For my main dish, I ordered the Sauerbraten. The sauce it came with was described as sweet and sour, but I found it mostly sweet ‚Äî which worked well for me. The beef was a little on the dry side, though I‚Äôm not sure if that‚Äôs typical for the dish. It came with a potato dumpling that was more like a scoop of mashed potatoes, and a side of red cabbage that had a pleasantly sweet flavor ‚Äî not what I expected, but I really enjoyed it.

The wifey ordered the Wiener Schnitzel and absolutely loved it. It came with a small serving of lingonberries, home fries, and the same red cabbage that I had.

Overall, we both enjoyed our meal and would definitely come back to try other dishes on the menu.

reviews.author: Clara Julia
reviews.text:
Incredible Oktoberfest Experience at Heidelberg

I visited Heidelberg to celebrate Oktoberfest, and it was fantastic! The seasonal beer was amazing‚Äîcrisp, flavorful, and perfectly refreshing. The mashed potatoes and cucumber salad were delicious, and the pretzel was the real star‚Äîsoft, perfectly baked, and the best I‚Äôve had in a long time.

Even as a vegetarian, there are plenty of great options, and everything I tried was fresh, flavorful, and satisfying. The cozy, welcoming atmosphere makes it a perfect spot for weekend outings, friends and family gatherings, or birthday celebrations. I highly recommend Heidelberg‚Äîit‚Äôs a must-visit for anyone looking for an authentic German dining experience!

reviews.author: Vyacheslav ‚ÄúSlava‚Äù D.
reviews.text: True German restaurant. We‚Äôve been here with German friend and enjoyed our visit. Traditional food and great choices of tap and bottled beer! Prices for the food a little bit higher then average in NYC

reviews.author: Justin Hill
reviews.text:
This place is like stepping into Germany/ Alsace.
First thing I noticed was the smell which brought me to another place.
Recommend the sausage platter with 3 different sausages, red cabbage, sauerkraut and german potato salad.  Single platter can def serve 2 unless you are starved. Mustards complemented them perfectly.  Pretzel delivered and spatzle is amazing.

reviews.author: Lillian L
reviews.text: This is the best authentic German restaurant I could ask for! The pork shank was perfectly done: tender on the inside with a deliciously crispy outside. It‚Äôs a huge portion, easily sharable between 2‚Äì3 people. The potato pancakes were out of this world. Crispy on the outside, soft on the inside, and full of rich potato flavor. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Emily B.
reviews.text: It felt like we were back in Italy, we were tended to by Angelo (he's Italian!) who was very sweet and engaging. The food was lovely. Reservation is a must. We went here for my husbands birthday, we got a tart for dessert. I was surprised by how dainty and thin it was, yet perfectly ratioed.

reviews.author: Tyler Crull
reviews.text:
We got the Ceaser, fettucini ragu, and NYStrip rare with a bottle of wine.

Perfect amount to split without getting overly stuffed. The ragu and strip were superb.

The mushrooms and mushroom sauce were outstanding with the NY Strip. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Paul Paul
reviews.text: Cozy and relaxing restaurant near the Met with the friendliest staff. So glad I stumbled upon this gem. They adjusted my salad dressing for my arugula salad with grilled chicken catering to my preference.

reviews.author: Jamie Prince
reviews.text: First time and our party of 3 really enjoyed our lunch here. Made a reservation by phone and I recommend doing so - it's a small room and seating is on the tight side. Warm, helpful, professional service; our waiter let us taste an unfamiliar wine which we loved and wound up ordering. Food was delicious - I had the meatball sandwich (not sure if only avail at lunch): tender, flavorful meatballs, excellent bright sauce and not too much bread, with a peppery arugula salad on the side. Companions were very happy with their food as well. Really good place, will definitely return.

reviews.author: Lenny H
reviews.text: The space is small but cozy and very clean. The star of the menu is mainly pasta. I really like the green color and basil flavor of the Fusilli Pesto, and the Shrimp Linguine has a delicious sauce mixed with the shrimp! The tiramisu is a bit sweet, but the creamy flavor is rich and tasty. It would be even better with slightly less sweetness!

reviews.author: Jos√© del Rosario
reviews.text:
Tandoor Oven is a true neighborhood secret on the Upper East Side. The ambience is wonderfully quaint and intimate.

The food is exceptional. The chicken tikka masala is perfectly spiced with tender, melt-in-your-mouth chicken. I‚Äôve also tried the eggplant dish, which is very spicy but has incredible, complex flavors that make it worth the spice.

What really sets this place apart is the service. The staff is friendly, attentive, and remarkably fast, even during busy times. Outstanding food, welcoming atmosphere, and top-notch service‚ÄîTandoor Oven is an excellent choice.

reviews.author: Kaden Cordova
reviews.text: Go to this restaurant. It is absolutely amazing and I would recommend it to anyone who is even vaguely hungry. Go in, grab a seat, and get ready to have some of the best Indian food in your entire life. This food is to die for, the service is more than excellent and better than some restaurants at even double the price point. Food is on point Every. Single. Time.

reviews.author: Qiana Oglesby
reviews.text: I normally ordered the food via Uber Eats, but just so happened to be around. I walked in the atmosphere was delightful. The food was delicious. I definitely will recommend and be back.

reviews.author: Jordannah Schreiber
reviews.text: I got takeaway from this place and ordered the chicken tikka masala, samosa, naan with zaatar and Gruy√®re cheese‚Ä¶ oh my goodness IT‚ÄôS AMAZING!!! I‚Äôm always trying to find a good Indian take out and hate taking risks to be disappointed. I was certainly not with Tandoor Oven. The chicken tikka is fresh and succulent, not rubbery, and feels like good quality meat and ingredients. It‚Äôs spiced to perfection, I don‚Äôt like when it‚Äôs too creamy, but the ratio of cream to curry is on point and the flavor is just perfect. It‚Äôs exactly what you‚Äôre looking for when you‚Äôre craving chicken tikka masala. I‚Äôve been eating Indian food all my life and I have to say this place is top 5 for me at least. I‚Äôm so impressed and can‚Äôt wait to try more of their food! If you‚Äôre contemplating where to order on the upper east side, look no further.

reviews.author: Annabel Azaro
reviews.text: Delicious food, great service, and quiet comfortable ambience.

reviews.author: Byron Meneses
reviews.text: First time I came here. Food was good. Beautiful atmosphere, Service was 100.. with the male bartender outside was really nice Dude. The second time I go there, female bartender, we order our food  Why do they bring out the appetizers in our food together? Really?  I had to change my five star review to a two star review!; I hope they get it together.

reviews.author: Sarah Becker
reviews.text: Cute place,  probably former train station. Free parking with pass available with manager. Pretty water views. A little crowded inside. Service a little uneven on timing but friendly.  Worth it to be able to park here and walk around outside for a few minutes.  Interesting trees by the water. Manager was nice.

reviews.author: Tania Lemus
reviews.text:
I had a great experience with the food here! The Brussels sprouts were amazing‚Äîcrispy and full of flavor. The loaded nachos were also a hit, and I ordered a salad that was fresh, tasty, and surprisingly filling. Overall, the food was absolutely delicious and definitely worth recommending.

The only downside was the service. Our server seemed quite young and maybe a bit inexperienced, which showed in the level of attentiveness and pace. That said, it didn‚Äôt take away too much from the overall experience because the food really stood out.

reviews.author: Frank Grillo
reviews.text: We recently held a private event for our wedding celebration.  We were very happy with the service and the great location. We paid for the entire space for our event and the staff was accommodating and helpful throughout and allowed us to add all the things we wanted to bring in for decorating. Everyone enjoyed the food a lot as well. Would recommend.

reviews.author: Victorio Van Dunk
reviews.text:
My wife and I have eaten here 3 times over the last 5 years, each time more disappointing then the previous. The more recent reviews seem to tell a similar story. Lunch service seemed to be staffed well, plenty of people circulating and the seating  was instant. Our food was prompt to arrive at the table, hot and ready to eat. Overall service was good. We sat down to a gorgeous outdoor October lunch.

Wings were a great appetizer, crispy and sizeable but the BBQ sauce seemed to be the entire flavor profile and the chicken offered nothing of its own; not a deal breaker. Budget pretzel bites with your standard grocery store brown mustard are genuinely overpriced for what they are; lesson learned if there is a future visit. Sadly, the pulled pork sandwich my wife ordered disappointed us the most. The pork was hardly pulled, more of a chunked consistency which gave careless vibes from the kitchen staff and the pork offered nothing without the (same) BBQ sauce to save the day.  The fries that came with both dishes seemed to be from 3 separate time zones. Some were fresh, some were dry, others were stale.  I ordered the Fried Cod sandwich ( with fries ) which I can't say bad things about, but I wouldn't pay for it again.  We love to support our local businesses and eat out regularly in the river towns so I hope this was a fluke.

reviews.author: Liz Joyce
reviews.text: I got this ramen delivered so can‚Äôt comment on the atmosphere, but it was quite good and a pretty reasonable price. I got the spicy miso ramen and it was very flavorful. It was not very spicy unless you drank a lot of the broth and got a clump of spice all at once. One thing to note, if you do get delivery, you will need your own chop sticks or spoon because that was not included.

reviews.author: Taylor Hubbard
reviews.text: Very cozy, clean restaurant. Service was great. Loved the tuna crispy rice & The Ramen. It was very good, lots of flavor. I'll definitely be back to try some other options! I had the Hinomaru ramen, crispy tuna rice & lychee mojito (very good, not too sweet, great cocktail)

reviews.author: Jesse Yuan
reviews.text:
OMG so happy to have stopped by and shame on me for waiting so damn long. This is definitely one of the best Ramen joint in NY and very reasonably priced. Broth is super flavorful and noodle is perfect firmness.

A must on your Ramen bucket list

reviews.author: Ryochan Otaku
reviews.text: The Ramen quality and quantity are superb. This is our fam. to go to ramen place in Astoria ditmars ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è since 2013 or 2014 if I'm not mistaken üòÖ

reviews.author: James M
reviews.text: staff is super nice! ordered takoyaki, crispy rice maki, 2 Hinomaru ramens, 2 yuzu sodas. good stuff! was about 110 including the 20% tip. place is empty in the afternoons! with the occational ramen pickups.

reviews.author: John Kane
reviews.text: Great service from Anthony and the staff. Reasonable prices and street parking. Food was very good to match the wine selections. Atmosphere was cozy and easy to hear each other. Acoustics were great even though the wine bar was about 2/3 full.

reviews.author: Alberto Ruiz
reviews.text: Really cool and relaxed wine bar in the LES. Service was great and they explained a lot of the options to fit your taste. Happy hour prices are great, ranging from $7-10 with an ample selection of red and white as well as small bites. The outside is perfect  to drink solo and people watch or read. The inside is also intimate yet relaxed. Highly recommend this wine bar.

reviews.author: Debby
reviews.text: My friends and I randomly walked into Jadis after a friends show. We loved it here! We were a group of 12 and Jadis quickly accommodated us in a cute back area. All exposed brick, which I love. The service was great, super attentive, people who work here are so nice,  everything came out quickly. Brussel sprout salad was delicious! Great date and group spot. We would definitely come back again!

reviews.author: Jaclynn Moschetta
reviews.text: We came to Jadis to celebrate my roommate‚Äôs birthday with a group of 11 girls, and it could not have been a better experience! The family-style meal was incredible ‚Äî every dish was fresh, high-quality, and full of flavor. The service was just as amazing as the food ‚Äî every single staff member was so kind, attentive, and accommodating to our large group. You can really tell how much care they put into both their food and their hospitality. Highly recommend Jadis for any occasion ‚Äî we‚Äôll definitely be back!

reviews.author: Nicole Kim
reviews.text: An intimate dining experience. It‚Äôs a bit tight at the front but plenty of space in the back. We ordered escargot and ahi tuna tartare for appetizer then beef bourguignon and skirt steak for entrees. We thought it was tasty but not amazing. We also shared a bottle of C√¥tes du Rh√¥ne. Would recommend for a date spot.

reviews.author: Dessa R
reviews.text: Wonderful service, warm greeting by the hostess, courteous wait staff; server was super friendly; extremely fast delivery of food and beverages once ordered! Had reservations for 11:15P on the Saturday before Halloween, but arrived a few hours earlier at 8:15; and there was either bar seating or outdoor seating. We opted for the patio seating versus the sidewalk seating, y‚Äôall be careful because to get to the covered patio, you gotta cross the bike lane, and these uber delivery drivers / citibikers are pedaling fast! Our table also had a wobble, but the staff were pretty attentive and fixed the wobbly table. Got the margherita pizza, which had a nice fluffy crust, nice char and lovely cheese and sauce ratio/flavor. Wonderful time, reservations highly recommended. Want to come back to try other entrees and pizzas.

reviews.author: Scott Albrecht
reviews.text: Lots of negatives but lets focus first on the positives.    Open late.  Fun atmosphere.  Interesting crowd.  The pizza looks like it could be good as does the chicken parm...  but I didn't order these.  I would order the Chicken Parm if I were to do it all over again.  Why didn't I this time?  Well, this dish is so much better with veal, I figured I would be disappointed and they don't offer it with veal.  Quite frankly one measure I use for a good Italian spot so fail number one.  Unfortunately if you didn't want pizza the menu was challenging -as in to find something interesting-  and the server staff not helpful at all.   I ended up getting the spaghetti with garlic and oil; and it was extremely disappointing.  I personally could have cooked the same dish a 100x better easily.  Basically tasted almost like plain noodles.  In other words you get very close just by boiling noodles in water.  At $21/22 dollars before tax it was just a ripoff.  Easily the worst Italian dish I've had in as long as I can remember...years and years.   Making it worse this place was cash only, just making the bad food inconvenient as well.   Nothing here to make me ever go back.  Given that other people have rated it higher, I guess I just ordered poorly....

reviews.author: Alice Rodrigo
reviews.text: This place never disappoints! I make it a point to come here at least once or twice a year. My most recent visit was great. One downfall is that this place is cash only. There is an ATM tucked away by the bathroom so you can take cash out for a $2.75 fee. The garlic bread was delicious. The pizza was great because my son talks about it all the time. I ordered the penny pasta and it was covered in ricotta cheese. So mouthwatering. My fianc√© got the gnocchi and he said it was the best gnocchi he's ever had. The drinks were good. The dish with fresh mozzarella balls were so delicious! We didn't have a chance to indulge in desserts because my son was tired and cranky. But I'll be back for sure. I can't wait to return!

reviews.author: Teagan Alexander
reviews.text: Absolutely delicious! Pizza was great, the dough and crust are fantastic. Good drinks, good salad, good mozzarella appetizer. Complementary bread and olives and olive oil would definitely recommend, and come here again!

reviews.author: Paul Mark Morris
