reviews.text: Late night best - Little Frankie‚Äôs is exactly what it sets out to be‚Äîgritty, no-nonsense, old-school Italian that nails the essentials. The homemade pasta special of the day (ours was a tagliatelle Bolognese) was a standout‚Äîsaucy, savory, and clearly made with care. Same goes for the pizza: thin, crisp crust with a char that tells you someone back there knows what they‚Äôre doing. This isn‚Äôt fine dining and it doesn‚Äôt pretend to be‚Äîthankfully. It‚Äôs cozy, loud, slightly chaotic, and full of charm. The chicken Parm is textbook in the best way: crispy breading, gooey cheese, rich sauce. Service was fast and unfussy. It‚Äôs the kind of place that feels like it‚Äôs been holding it down for decades because it has. If you want polished and pretentious, go elsewhere. If you want legit red-sauce comfort and a room with character, Little Frankie‚Äôs delivers.

reviews.author: J B C
reviews.text: It was close to lunchtime when I was passing by & there were some open parking spots on the ave so I decided to stop in for some takeout. I got a ham & cheese rice ball from their signature sides & a roast beef hero with mozzarella, onions & gravy which they‚Äôre know for. Which came to a little over $25. I then noticed a sign for desserts & I couldn‚Äôt pass trying a red velvet gelato truffle which ended up being a little less than $8 (I didn‚Äôt ask the price). The rice ball was  tasty & the roast beef was pretty good & very filling. Later in the day I had the gelato truffle which was ok. If you‚Äôre in the area & in want something simple for lunch you should give it a try.

reviews.author: Eric Mel
reviews.text: This is some good food. The roast beef is tender, and the gravy is not too salty, but still has flavor. Make sure you get a medium cup of gravy because the small cup is like a shot glass sized cup. Great spot to try once in awhile. It‚Äôll really fill up your belly. I suggest the 9‚Äù heroes to really hit the spot.

reviews.author: Kosta Rica
reviews.text:
High quality sandwiches and fast service at this famous Brooklyn oldtimer!   They can make literally anything you wish.
Brooklyn bread is very tasty, especially when you ask for a toasted version.
Parking hard to find.
Bring your Brooklyn attitude! Foggetaboutit!

reviews.author: Butter Fly
reviews.text: I never took the time to visit and eat and perhaps one day I would consider it. Unfortunately I always ordered takeout so I can not speak upon the atmosphere there . What I can say is that every time I ate from there I was not disappointed. Firstly their bread is top notch . The food is always hot . The food seems always fresh and even cooked with love. The delivery men are sweethearts .The wait on the order is short . The food comes at a timely fashion . I‚Äôm sure you can get something affordable that makes your full under ten dollars ; which is hard in nyc , with that being said if you around or driving in this area and want to eat something quick for yourself or family don‚Äôt forget this deli in which I got food here November 2024 to be exact getting a chicken sandwich that I still remember to this day that being the one with bbq and cheese and chicken but this one was just as flavorful and fulling . Thank you for reading ; have a grand day . I was told that salad was phenomenal so be sure to look at the menu careful.

reviews.author: Ozzie
reviews.text: Great sandwhich spot. They offer so many different options all named after a movie character which I liked. It has seating inside and outside which is a big plus. It also has some parking right next to it. I had the roast beef with mozzarella on the 9 inch sub and it was very filling. Very flavorful sandwhich with a good amount of gravy. You can request more but I didn't feel like I needed it. Good amount of beef and you can request as many caramelized onions as you want. I could have used a little more mozzarella but it was still a great sandwhich. I will be returning to try other sandwhiches. Service was quick and friendly.

reviews.author: Alla Mets
reviews.text:
What a charming and cozy place! Upon entering you feel like you are in a true french bistro. Every singe dish was delicious and tasteful. Steak tartar - wow! I order it every time I see it on the menu, and this one was one of the best - one can taste the freshness of meat without overpowering sauces.
- fried Artichoke  - crispy and yummy (without greasy or oily taste to it).
And the start of the night was the steak! Holy Shmoley! I This steak was by far one of the best (everyojebin our party agreed with this)! Perfectly done with thin, crispy french fries and terragon sauce -(I am salivating just thinking about it:)
Service was absolutely amazing! Our waiter was not only professional but very friendly (that you will hardly find in FranceüòÜ), he was always there when we needed anything. His recommendations were on point.
Do yourself a favor - and go for a nice family dinner or a romantic date - this place will become your favorite low-key restaurant.

reviews.author: Daniel B
reviews.text:
Let‚Äôs start with the fact that I‚Äôm just a year removed from living in Paris and miss it deeper than he sea covers the ocean above.  There are special few places for me that transcend local, this is one of those restaurants, I feel like I‚Äôm back home in Paris, for even a brief moment.  I recommend the escargot for an appetiser and I would like to have tried the fried squid but I picked the fois gras while excellent the matching apple sauce pur√©e was more miss than hit.  I have had the steak,duck, and lamb.  I recommend them in that order personally, with the steak barely passing the canard.  The service is simply devastatingly good and the people as kind as can possibly be.  There‚Äôs no negatives I have and if you read my other review‚Äôs you know that‚Äôs rare.

UPDATE:

Oliver‚Äôs: Once a Favorite, Now a Maybe

I‚Äôve been a longtime fan of Oliver‚Äôs ‚Äî the ambiance, the French bistro aesthetic, the sense that you‚Äôve stumbled into a little corner of Paris tucked into Brooklyn. But my most recent visit made me question if the magic is fading.

üëé Service: Cold and Defensive

Our waitress was‚Ä¶ difficult. Dismissive, oddly defensive, and unwilling to take accountability. At one point, she claimed I didn‚Äôt get the dessert menu because I had stepped outside to smoke ‚Äî which I hadn‚Äôt. Instead of simply placing the menu on the table like any competent server would, she made it my fault. That kind of interaction just kills the mood.

ü´§ Food: Technically Fine, Totally Forgettable

Everything was cooked well, sure. But nothing tasted like anything special. Sauces were bland. Seasoning was minimal. No dish stood out. It all felt uninspired, like the chef was following a script but forgot the soul.

üí∏ Price: $127 ‚Äî For What?

With service that felt icy and food that didn‚Äôt deliver, $127 for one person felt absurd. I‚Äôve had better meals at half the price where I was treated like a human being, not an inconvenience.

‚∏ª

I‚Äôm hoping this was just an off night. Oliver‚Äôs has been great in the past. But the vibe, the food, and the service all missed the mark ‚Äî and for now, I can‚Äôt recommend it the way I used to.

reviews.author: W. L.
reviews.text: One of my go to restaurants in the neighborhood. Their lentil curry (not spicy) is my comfort meal. The gnocchi was good too.

reviews.author: Andriy Rshkvn
reviews.text: This is a wonderful small French restaurant. There is a very cozy and homely atmosphere here. Here is a very friendly and cheerful hostess and excellent service! There is very tasty food and no less delicious desserts. The prices are quite reasonable. You should definitely look here and enjoy this indestable atmosphere!

reviews.author: V
reviews.text: The food was soooo good! I really enjoyed oysters, foie gras with apple sauce and steak with fresh fries ‚ù§Ô∏èwine was also great! The service was also good despite the fact the waiter forgot to give me a fork (but that was Valentine‚Äôs Day, there were many people and it was already late, maybe the waiter was tired)

reviews.author: Adeline
reviews.text: Came here for lunch with a friend. We both got the $23 combo. We enjoyed the sides that came with the ramen, such as the pork bun and dumplings, but we weren‚Äôt a huge fan of the ramen itself. The meat was okay, but that was really it. The noodles and the broth didn‚Äôt have that much flavor. Even the egg tasted weird. The deserts were okay, but they also didn‚Äôt taste like anything. We honestly preferred the $1 microwave noodles. The service was okay. It took them a while to realize we were done with our food. We most likely wouldn‚Äôt come here again, or at the very least, try a different meal.

reviews.author: Martin Mbuthia
reviews.text: Absolutely amazing place. The aesthetic is really pleasing, the food was delicious and well priced and the service very good. I'm no Japanese, but it felt authentically Japanese!

reviews.author: T Liu
reviews.text:
Wonderful food ! The meat wasn‚Äôt as tender as the queens location is , the taste of the ramen is still good but I would still recommend going to the queens location instead, as the food is better there.

The server dropped our chicken nuggets as he served it to us , he took a look at it before heading to the next table which I found funny, but also minus star for service.

This location is definitely more busy than the queens one, if you don‚Äôt mind that.

Overall pretty nice place, but for this chain I still recommend going to the queens one.

reviews.author: Beyase Warton
reviews.text: Wow! This place is amazing! My sister is visiting and I decide to choose this place. Best decision ever! The food was delicious and they even have Taiwan Beer!!! I‚Äôve missed Taiwan so much so having it was nostalgic! Service was very nice and our server comes to our table right away!

reviews.author: Pan A Thar Kyaw
reviews.text: Signature Honey Comb Bowl: thick, creamy tonkotsu with a sweet-savory braised pork that melts, perfectly runny egg, and the dramatic honeycomb seating layout for the toppings. Noodles have good bite. Broth is rich but slightly on the salty side if you finish it all. Fast service, Instagram-ready presentation, big portions. Around $18‚Äì22 depending on location. Solid 8.2/10 ‚Äì great for a fun group outing or when you want flashy ramen that tastes better than it has any right to at that price. Not the absolute best broth in town, but way above average for a chain.

reviews.author: Jimmy Liang
reviews.text: No brainer spot for casual eats. There are only a few places where almost every menu item is consistently great‚Äîdozens of times we‚Äôve dined here, delicious every time! Plenty of seating for larger groups and great vibes/music for all kinds of outings. Such a friendly staff and warm setting! 40min drive for us, but worth the trip!

reviews.author: Amira A
reviews.text:
Ana was absolutely wonderful!
She served us delicious drinks with a warm smile and such great energy ‚ú®‚ù§Ô∏èThe tacos were also very tasty üòã Highly recommend, l‚Äôll definitely be coming back

reviews.author: Bianca R
reviews.text: One of the best mexican dining experiences I‚Äôve had in the city. Everything was super fresh and not over seasoned or too oily like most places around. Loved the nachos, they‚Äôre a must order. The union street salad was great too. Will come back to try more tacos and burritos for sure. Great vibe and service, and excellent prices!

reviews.author: Karina K
reviews.text: The veggie enchiladas are so worth a try! I was a little scared about the corn in the enchiladas because I hate corn but man did I barely taste them!

reviews.author: Wil Perez
reviews.text:
I had an incredible dining experience at Calexico restaurant!

The tacos were absolutely delicious, bursting with flavor and perfectly cooked. The chicken and waffles were a delightful surprise, combining savory and sweet in a mouthwatering way.

The restaurant's beautiful decor added to the overall ambiance, making it a fantastic place to enjoy a meal.

I can't wait to go back and try more dishes!

reviews.author: Shahaan Khan
reviews.text:
The good: The server and wait staff were very kind and nice.
The bad: The food was barely better than Olive Garden and depending on the day, Olive Garden would have this place beat. We got the chicken parm and grilled chicken & broccoli Alfredo.
The ugly: The chicken tasted like frozen store bought chicken, there was a certain texture that screamed frozen. Both the breaded and grilled chicken.
Verdict: Not worth eating here.

reviews.author: MITCH CLINKENBEARD
reviews.text:
Talk about nostalgia hitting you in the face!!

The one in Oklahoma City closed in 2016 after 30 years. It was one of our goto places for date nights many years ago.

Thought they had all closed, but found that this one is still open. Had to try out and came away with the same feelings of years ago. Good food at fairly reasonably prices

Too bad I had to drive all the way to Syracuse to eat here again!!!

reviews.author: Mike Ray
reviews.text: Always get a great meal for a very reasonable price. Staff is very friendly and the building is very unique and fun. Our table looked like a large poster bed which was great as we were there for a granddaughter's 6th birthday. She had a great time.

reviews.author: charles stockmeister
reviews.text: Dinner was on point, stopped in for a bite after a day of running around. Waitress was awesome and super friendly. I miss having a location in rochester but this makes it all that special to stop in when i make a run into syracuse

reviews.author: Nicole Gabriel
reviews.text: 3.5 stars.....Very interesting old building. They have an arcade area . They have what looks like a trolley car you can sit in. Lots of solid vintage wood pieces throughout.  I ordered the chicken and  broccoli Alfredo. My friend had the lasagna. Overall I liked the dish. Lots of broccoli which I liked. It was cooked to perfection. The sliced grilled chicken was delicious. The sauce however was lacking. Very bland, I didn't taste any parmesan. The sauce tasted more like just a heavy cream. I could clearly see grated Parmesan on top.  However it seemed to be lacking in the sauce. The lasagna was good. For the prices. It would be nice to have a small house salad included.

reviews.author: Stephanie Machado
reviews.text: Had a lovely dinner here when visiting Syracuse with my partner. Service was wonderful, they let our dog sit on the patio with us and even brought her a water dish. The food was delicious, everything was cooked beautifully. The Saffron Scallops and Garlic Shrimp were our favorites. Great environment all around, would definitely return next time we're visiting.

reviews.author: Yuco I
reviews.text:
It was my first visiting.
It was a busy night but luckily we got seats.
We were told that the paella would take about 40 minutes, but the drinks and small plates we ordered were very delicious (even the olive and bucket's small free plates were very delicious) and I didn't feel like waiting too long. And I highly recommend their paellas. The seafood paella has lots good flavors and it was very delicious totally worth waiting.  I'd like to try another paella next time.

reviews.author: Gabby Dee
reviews.text:
Loved finding this cute restaurant. The ambiance, food, and service were all fantastic!

I ordered their soup of the day which was a butternut squash soup as well as their vegan nachos. The vegan nachos were also a special for the day! Both were delicious with rich flavors and beautiful presentation. The soup was a small portion but it came with chips and that alone almost filled me up! I really enjoyed the lighting and our waiter whose name I never got.

Overall, the experience was great and I'd be willing to go back if I'm ever in the area!

reviews.author: Caitlin
reviews.text: Lovely restaurant with great atmosphere. Food was good though some things could use a little tweaking. Some of the potatoes in the appetizer were undercooked slightly, and the paella could have used a little more flavor. The chips and salsa was very fresh, and the mojito was nice and minty. Service was very friendly and helpful. Look forward to going again.

reviews.author: Bill Bullen
reviews.text:
Great ambiance. Exquisite flavors. Recommend:

Chorizo y Jud√≠a Blanca / Chorizo & White Bean mixed greens, cannelini beans, roasted chorizo, pickled red onion, grape tomato,
and chimichurri

Vieiras Sofritas / Saut√©ed Scallops
adobo rubbed scallops, spinach roasted garlic and manchego polenta, arugula, and sofrito

Pato Confitado / Duck Confit
With apricot and guajillo glazed crispy duck leg, fingerling potatoes, and sauteed kale.

And of course, had to try the Crema de Palemo (grapefruit custard) and top it off with a Corrado (espresso with a touch of steamed milk)

Come early to avoid crowds and noise.

reviews.author: Donna S
reviews.text:
Food is solid here. Really like how fast the food came. Everything is made fresh and the fried chicken is super crispy on the outside the juicy on the inside. Cheese corn was very flavourful. The pancake was also very solid. Japchae was seasoned perfectly.

Expect service to be a little slower because it is a mom and pop shop. It looks like there is one person cooking, one person taking the order, one person prepping other things and a busser. Be patient and they will get to you.

Atmosphere is nice. Very casual place for authentic Korean food. Could be good for casual date night or friend gathering. Would come again.

reviews.author: Ty Ty
reviews.text:
Ordered Japchae and Fried Chicken, both are fresh and hot. Recommend japchae and do not recommend boneless fried chicken. It is chicken breast and dry, next time will try wings. Kimchi doesn‚Äôt have good crisp fresh texture and seem like factory made.
Servers are great and atmosphere is also welcoming.
Would recommend this place.

reviews.author: Alex
reviews.text: A solid choice for Korean food. The wings are tasty and the japchae was also very good. Very friendly staff and reasonably priced (for NYC).  A good option if you want a decent but not over the top place

reviews.author: Leesa Thomas
reviews.text: I had a wonderful experience at The Jin. The restaurant is beautiful, the service was amazing, and the fried chicken in the soy garlic sauce was the best fried chicken I've had in a long time. The portions were much larger than I anticipated, which for me was wonderful. I was able to take home left overs to have for dinner. I highly recommend this spot. It's a gem for sure!

reviews.author: Â∞öÁæéÊ±ê
reviews.text:
The Cheese Tteokbokki with Katsu and Bulgogi Japchae were perfect. I would definitely recommend trying this place.
Yet the fried chicken was a bit under-seasoned, the sauce flavor was mostly just on the crust, and the meat was slightly dry.

reviews.author: Wendy Wu
reviews.text:
Only in NYC can you recall once upon a time moons ago working in the same actual space as Toukouleur Cafe- and frequenting it later regularly as "Oaxaca tacos", and then years later only to return and stumble upon super "oishii" (tasty) local yumminess round 3!  AGAIN!

The term 'izakaya' is a fusion of 'i' (to stay) and 'sakaya' (sake shop) so we did just that- small plates tapa style and ideal to bring a partner in crime to try more- and otherwise "izayaka" typically described as a local food tavern / pub- but hands down appeasing our hungry palettes and and certainly plan to go back! Taste and enjoy... slowly! We got super lucky that on a Saturday night after 7 there was a table for 2 as walk-ins!

Admitting I've tried making Takoyaki at home (still work in progress), but soooo tasty here (main pic) as was the grilled hamachi collar ( yellowtail collar aka "fish cheeks"- portion behind the gills that I don't see often & loved when I lived in LA near LIttle Tokyo- and could find more regularly), pork belly mazemen (comes on a bed of ramen), softshell crab roll, seaweed salad and - and well, I'm usually too excited partaking to take pics, but just sharing a few here for good measure. Staff was busy and for such a small crew working small plates- and doing so much- yet super nice and friendly!

Definitely hope to go back myself for the sashimi and rolls- and for dinner again with my honey to share and try the blue fin tuna rib, short rib, and Karaage (fried chicken)... and meanwhile simply confirming how much dinner last night hit the spot- SUCH a nice treat- and ready to return for round 2! üòçüôèüèΩ

reviews.author: Malina
reviews.text: This casual izakaya was perfect for our friendly dinner. The food was fire and affordable, and their staff were friendly and attentive. The guy I went with who I was visiting moved into the neighborhood recently, and was very happy to find this spot and said he would be frequenting this place often. ü´∂üèº

reviews.author: Nahiyan Naser
reviews.text: Came here for a date. Their service is top notch. Food arrived fast and everything tasted amazing. The hamachi collar is a must try

reviews.author: Howard Edelbaum
reviews.text:
Very attentive and kind staff. Good coffee. I had the shrimp and avocado on gluten free bread with a very creamy sauce that was delicious. This was my first time here and didn‚Äôt know what to expect.

I definitely am looking forward to coming back for dinner to try other menu items. Their breakfast menu is very unique not just having the traditional egg menu. So, if you want a yummy breakfast, good coffee and great wait staff then go here.

reviews.author: Jen Wong
reviews.text:
We‚Äôre so thrilled to have this new spot right around the corner and went to check it out the first week they were open! It‚Äôs nice to have some asian flavors in the neighborhood üòä
All the food tastes great. The pork belly mazemen was our favorite! The pork was really well seasoned and the poached egg and sauce that coats the noodles was so luxurious. The whole squid and the grilled vegetables were probably the weakest dishes. The squid was nicely cooked and the sauce was tasty, but it could have used some lemon. The sauce on the grilled vegetables was also really yummy but we felt the vegetables themselves could have been cooked a bit longer; they were on the harder side to bite into. Everything else tasted great! Next time we‚Äôll make sure we order one serving of yuzu cheesecake per person, instead of sharing üòÖ
The servers were very sweet and attentive though the food took a while to come out. Probably just due to it being the first week of opening and assume they‚Äôre still smoothing out the logistics.
It was a little bit on the pricey side‚Äîwe spent $100+ for two people with no drinks.
Overall we‚Äôll definitely be back and will bring our friends in the neighborhood too!

reviews.author: Mark Olson
reviews.text:
Very quiet sushi bar in the back that is very quaint and peaceful. Nice quiet place with good ambience to bring a date.

Ordered some sushi to go. The sushi was very good!!!!

When I walked in Muchael the waiter tried to drop kick me. But thankfully. The sushi chef Khai Pa blocked his kick and saved me. Just KIdding ü§£ü§£ü§£ Excellent customer service.

reviews.author: Matt Sacca
reviews.text:
I just paid $24 for this incredibly small, no-frills, 2-roll takeout and the quality was worse than a $15 combo roll with nigiri from Wegmans.

The pieces of sushi here are half the size of the rolls I get anywhere else in Cuse. Very bland, no flavor. So much worse, and more overpriced, than the Secret Garden I remember.

reviews.author: Jes Gorham
reviews.text: I had such a lovely lunch at Secret Garden. The sushi was beyond delicious. The noodles so good. This was my first time eating at this restaurant and it will absolutely not be the last. Loved it!

reviews.author: Sanela ≈†ero
reviews.text: I only go when it‚Äôs half off sushi and it‚Äôs really delicious especially the beef dumplings and firecracker roll. You‚Äôll either wait 40 mins or 5 minutes for your food to come out but it‚Äôs worth it for the price. :)

reviews.author: Danny Ho
reviews.text: Slightly cold, bring a sweat shirt or sweater. Wait staff is very attentive and service is quick. They have a separate menu for Half-Priced sushi on Monday and Wednesday. I had the spicy shrimp and salmon roll, Ebi roll and Masago (smelt roe). I also had the Miso soup and I ginger ale. I highly recommend this place as it seems like I am in Japan having sushi...

reviews.author: Michelle C.
reviews.text:
As someone visiting from out of town, I was happy to find a dim sum restaurant close to the airport. The restaurant features a welcoming atmosphere, but the service felt inconsistent. It took a while for anyone to greet me, as the host station was unattended when I arrived. While my male server with glasses and the first host (tall lady) I interacted with were courteous, the short lady who handed me my check was noticeably unfriendly. I also observed her checking on other non-Asian tables with much more warmth, which was disappointing. She simply dropped the check on my table without a word or even a simple thank you.

Fortunately, the male server was kind and offered a pleasant farewell when I left, which helped end the visit on a better note. The food itself was mediocre - I had the shrimp cheung fun (with tiny shrimp) and siu mai, and ordered the Peking duck bun to go.

Overall, a mixed experience that leaves room for improvement, especially in consistency of service.

reviews.author: Aloysius Mark Madhok (Mark)
reviews.text:
An Absolute Must-Try: The Crispy Szechuan Lobster at Red Chilli, Syracuse!

If there‚Äôs one dish that defines indulgence with flair, it‚Äôs the Crispy Szechuan-Style Lobster at Red Chilli. The moment it arrives, you‚Äôre greeted by the intoxicating aroma of toasted chilies, garlic, and peppercorns that promise both fire and finesse. The lobster itself is perfectly cooked‚Äîtender and juicy inside, encased in a thin, golden-crisp shell that crackles at first bite.

What makes this dish unforgettable is the balance: the numbing warmth of authentic Szechuan peppercorns dancing with the sweetness of fresh lobster meat, all glazed in a glossy, slightly smoky sauce that clings lovingly to every piece. Each mouthful is a symphony of crunch, spice, and ocean-fresh flavor.
Pair it with steamed rice or simply savor it on its own‚Äîit‚Äôs the kind of plate that makes you slow down, close your eyes, and appreciate how perfect seafood can be when prepared with mastery.

Red Chilli‚Äôs presentation is stunning, too‚Äîthe deep crimson chilies scattered like jewels, the lobster gleaming beneath a light dusting of scallions and sesame. It‚Äôs a show-stopping dish that feels festive yet refined.

Whether you‚Äôre a spice lover or just someone who appreciates fine seafood, this Crispy Szechuan Lobster is reason enough to visit Red Chilli. Once you try it, you‚Äôll find yourself planning your next trip back before you‚Äôve even finished the plate.

reviews.author: Sarah Cleary
reviews.text: Beautiful restaurant with great food! Service was great and everything was fresh and delicious. Our waiter advised us well and we got sooo much food for a great price. Obsessed!! Don‚Äôt let the foot spa and karaoke room scare you lol - the space is gorgeous. Just visiting but if we lived here we would become regulars.

reviews.author: JK
reviews.text: This place looks really nice and food was delicious! The xiao long bao are juicy and the meat inside was very flavorful. The chili wontons are mildly spicy and the sauce is perfectly balanced.

reviews.author: Martin Leroux
reviews.text:
Excellent Chinese restaurant. We ordered a bunch of plates, and everything was good. The cumin beef was very spicy, which is great. The dumplings are tasty. Good portion sizes, perfect for sharing.
Very efficient service, we got our food in a blink of an eye.
Funky decor. It was really cold outside so they needed space heaters everywhere.

reviews.author: nisha sridhar
reviews.text: The price might seem a bit high, but the variety of dishes they offer in the unlimited thali is worth it. The meal was hearty and has home feel to it. There is a plate full of appetizers and another plate for mains. The gulab jamun was heavenly. I recommend going here hungry if you want to try all the dishes!

reviews.author: Yogesh Desai
reviews.text:
Vatan means Home. Authentic Indian vegetarian restaurant.
Big ganesh idol, Banyan tree,hand painted table, bg elephant in front.  .
Vegetarian thali consists of 3 dinner meals appetizer, main entree and desserts.
Open 5.30 to 9.30pm
Food was typical Gujarati.
Staff was polite, excellent service, the price are around $58 with taxes are higher but you can try once as all you can eat. Difficult to find parking outside.
Recommended this restaurant.

reviews.author: Joshua DeAngelis
reviews.text:
We host a monthly supper club (roughly 15-20 people attend) and this was a perfect setting for the large group.

The pre fix is robust and well prepared. This style of food is inherently carbohydrate heavy, the menu even mentions something about not coming if you‚Äôre on a diet!

They serve all types of alcohol. The setting is really fun, it‚Äôs supposed to make you feel like you‚Äôre visiting the region.

An experience worth trying. Not your typical NYC restaurant.

reviews.author: Taylor
reviews.text: This restaurant is so beautiful. It was my first time having a thali, and our server Sharon was so patient and informative about the dishes in each course. The staff also took extra care about my nut allergy. They accommodated for my nut allergy. Everything was delicious. Come prepared to eat.

reviews.author: santosh gupta
reviews.text:
Vatan offers an amazing all-you-can-eat vegetarian thali in a beautifully decorated, traditional setting. Every dish is packed with authentic flavors, and the variety is impressive. The service is warm and attentive, and the overall experience feels like a cultural escape. Highly recommend for anyone who loves Indian food.
One thing to mention that it‚Äôs a fixed menu and all as you can eat, so make sure you are really hungry and have enough time to enjoy everything..

reviews.author: Sicen Meng
reviews.text: Great pho spot. I love their lemon grass chicken it‚Äôs sweet, smoky, and incredibly juice. The portion is very big and the price is very affordable especially considering the location. Just to keep in mind that there might be a little wait line. We came here on a Monday 6pm and there were no available seats. Definitely will come again and try their rice dishes :)

reviews.author: Eun Kim
reviews.text:
Personal Opinion Summary:

Food Quality: is good!! should go and try
Service: There IS a way to pay with CARD!! Even though they say Cash only.

Here is the story:

I recently visited this restaurant with my partner. While the food was genuinely enjoyable and the atmosphere was pleasant, I feel it‚Äôs important to share an issue we experienced so future customers are aware.

When we were seated, the server told us that the restaurant accepted cash only and pointed us to an ATM outside. Because of that, one of us naturally went to withdraw cash. However, as we were using the ATM, the same server approached us again and suddenly mentioned that they could actually accept card payments through a QR code if the ATM doesn't work. Which it worked totally fine.

This wasn‚Äôt just a minor inconvenience, it felt intentionally misleading. We weren‚Äôt upset about the ATM fee; what bothered us was the way the information was delivered. Instead of being transparent from the start, we were pushed toward withdrawing cash first and only later told that card payment was an option. That kind of behavior felt disrespectful and unnecessarily deceptive.

What made it more concerning was that we watched several other customers go through the exact same confusion. Despite the restaurant listing debit cards as an accepted payment method on Google Maps, the server repeatedly told people that only cash was allowed. The inconsistency and the way it was communicated were genuinely disappointing.

That being said, I want to be fair: the food was quite good, and under normal circumstances, I would return. But the way the payment situation was handled left such a negative impression that I‚Äôm hesitant to come back despite the quality of the meal.

I hope the restaurant can address this issue and provide clear, honest payment information moving forward. Better communication from staff would greatly improve the overall dining experience.

reviews.author: Charlie Capp
reviews.text: I came in here on a cold, windy day, and the Vegetarian Ph«í was just what I needed to warm my bones and soul. The service was absolutely fantastic as well, I felt at home and taken care of in the space. My only suggestion would be to add a bit more of the Soy Protein to the Ph«í, there were only a couple pieces. Either way, I‚Äôll definitely be back!

reviews.author: John W
reviews.text:
The lemongrass chicken pho was transcendent! Seriously, I never order chicken pho and it was so satisfying - smoky salty sweet savory. The noodles were perfect and it was a generous portion size. I cannot wait to come back again.

The  servers were friendly when I arrived and left and I‚Äôm glad they mentioned they were cash only when I got there because it can be ambiguous at times.

The only thing that could have made the soup better was a larger side of bean sprouts, Thai basil or culantro. I can see why they wouldn‚Äôt want to give these out of people don‚Äôt use them but if personally could have used more.

reviews.author: Eli Block
reviews.text: I felt sad after my meal. The place has the feel. It has the clientele. It has the location. The bowl even looks right from the sidewalk. This pho should be straight banging but despite all that it does not live up to the billing. The pho chicken was rubbery. The bag of add ins was sparse. The broth was firmly classifiable as nothing special and where there should be an herbal almost medicinal quality to good pho broth it was just kinda sweet. Good pho should have the same restorative, ease creating, heart opening quality that every other cultures oldest soups share. Matzo ball. Korean chigae, pozole. The woman next to me at the counter said she had been going for 10 years and that they had indeed lost their touch. She said try China town. The bahn mi was alright but similarly nothing special.

reviews.author: tobobinalo bhan
reviews.text:
Food: 5/5
Absolutely delicious‚Äîthis place is a must-try. Every dish showed the chef‚Äôs passion for authentic Indian flavors, beautifully fused with a modern cocktail-night vibe. Their desserts and cocktails are a highlight.

Service & Management: 0/5
Sadly, the management ruined what could have been a perfect evening. My sister and I visited on a freezing winter night in NYC (December 2024) with a small, securely wrapped bag of lemons in our tote. Despite our confirmed reservation, the receptionist rudely assumed we intended to eat outside food and made us feel uncomfortable and unwelcome from the start.

The tasting menu we ordered was incredible, but we were hurried to place our order and finish quickly because the kitchen was ‚Äúclosing soon.‚Äù If the restaurant plans to close, why accept reservations for that time? The entire dinner felt rushed.

After paying, we waited inside for our cab, only to be asked to step out into sub-zero temperatures so they could lock up. It was one of the coldest nights of the season.

I genuinely feel bad for the chef‚Äîtheir exceptional culinary talent deserves management that respects guests and complements the food. The kitchen is brilliant, but the hospitality was so poor it overshadowed the meal.

reviews.author: Viral R
reviews.text: Stopped by Baar Baar for lunch and was really impressed. The space is beautiful and feels upscale but still relaxed. We had the malai paneer pinwheel, fries, and their chai , all vegetarian and all really flavorful. The pinwheel was rich and satisfying, and the fries were crispy with a fun twist of Indian spices. The chai was warm, comforting, and felt thoughtfully made, not just an afterthought. Prices are definitely on the higher side for lunch, but the quality and experience made it worth it. Great spot if you‚Äôre looking for elevated vegetarian options in the city.

reviews.author: Bhoomika Rituraj gahlot
reviews.text:
I am so happy that I visited Baar Baar with my family. Coming from a core Indian spice palette, i loved each & every food item that we ordered. For small plates we had dahi puri where the light & airy yogurt mousse with the aloo masala create a medley in your mouth. We also ordered stuffed tandoori mushroom ( the best tandoori item I have ever tasted outside India in US) & my personal favourite Paneer chilli (chef‚Äôs kiss)!!
For large plates we had vegetable+ ricotta kofta, malai paneer pinwheel & dal makhni. All 3 dishes were with just the right amount of flavours & spice!! For desserts we ordered basque cheesecake & stone fruit cassata (my favourite)
Baar baar food was indulgent & lip smacking! I am sure the non- vegetarian dishes are equally tasty. Look forward to more trips to the restaurant!

reviews.author: Raaj Chheda
reviews.text: Attended this fine establishment as special Mother‚Äôs Day treat. This has the perfect blend of flavor, energy, and presentation. The flavors are beautifully pronounced such as their smokey, but irresistible butter chicken, the sea bass just melts in your mouth, and those are just a sliver of what they offer. The staff is beyond impeccable and the Bollywood LIVE Music is a WELCOME addition. Gonna come here whenever I visit the Big City, that‚Äôs for sure! Only issue was the handling of the bill which should‚Äôve been dealt with accordingly.

reviews.author: Megha Naik
reviews.text:
We visited Baar Baar for my birthday dinner and opted for the tasting menu, which included starters, a main course, dessert, and wine for about $60 per person. The entire experience was fantastic! The food was absolutely delicious, and the presentation was on point. A special touch was when the chef himself came over to serve us the starters, which made the evening even more memorable.

The ambience of the restaurant was warm and inviting, making it a perfect spot for a celebration. Overall, it was a great experience, and I‚Äôm glad we chose Baar Baar for such a special occasion. Highly recommended for anyone looking for a unique and flavorful dining experience in NYC!

reviews.author: Vinee Mishra
reviews.text:
Le Bernardin is an exceptional French fine dining restaurant where Chef Eric Ripert‚Äôs refined seafood creations truly shine. Despite its Michelin-star prestige, the atmosphere feels relaxed and welcoming ‚Äî even our young child felt completely at ease and enjoyed the experience.

The service was impeccable from start to finish. The staff went above and beyond, pampering us with thoughtful attention and perfectly timed food and drink service.

We chose the three-course prix fixe menu, and every dish was beautifully executed. The appetizer trio offered fresh, flavorful bites of seafood. The bread assortment was among the best we‚Äôve ever had ‚Äî warm, varied, and perfectly baked. For our main courses, the lobster in a rich, aromatic broth and the  steamed Halibut with baby vegetables were both outstanding ‚Äî truly the best halibut we‚Äôve ever tasted.

Desserts, including a decadent chocolate tart and an assortment of small bites, provided the perfect sweet ending to a memorable meal.

Overall, Le Bernardin delivers an extraordinary dining experience ‚Äî refined yet approachable, luxurious yet comfortable. We‚Äôll definitely return every time we‚Äôre in New York.

reviews.author: Nena
reviews.text: We made reservations for Thursday, October 9th, 2025 at 12pm and both chose the Lunch Three Course Prix Frixe. The server was exceptional at explaining the menu options and he was very attentive. The service overall exceedingly made our first time there one to remember. The food was beyond anything we've both experienced and definitely savored every moment of our meal. The dessert was outstandingly perfection. We did add on an additional dessert "The Egg" and we're glad we did. Service from beginning to end was stellar. We tried non-alcoholic beverages Lychee Nectar and Raspberry Nectar both were very refreshing and perfectly sweet. We enjoyed our first experience at Le Bernardin. Will definitely revisit in the near future.

reviews.author: Taysha Litzsey
reviews.text: Every single dish was amazing! Too many courses that I lost count. I wish it was proper to ask for a whole 8" plate of their tiny portions, but that would be weird and waaay out of our budget. Cocktails are perfect. Left full & satisfied. Service is as-expected for the type of establishment. Interior and decor are a bit dated and dark. It is well-maintained and clean which is what matters most.  Overall, we would love to visit again.

reviews.author: Matt Bishop
reviews.text:
Le Bernardin continues to justify its legendary status as one of New York City‚Äôs finest dining establishments. Our recent prix fixe lunch experience reaffirmed why this restaurant has maintained its position at the pinnacle of seafood cuisine for decades.

From the moment we were seated the service struck the perfect balance between attentive and unobtrusive. Every member of the staff demonstrated genuine warmth and deep knowledge of the menu. Our sommelier deserves special recognition and his wine recommendations were impeccably matched to our dish selections, elevating each course and creating harmonious pairings throughout the meal.

The culinary journey itself was extraordinary. The opening amuse-bouches set an elegant tone with refined, delicate flavors that showcased the kitchen‚Äôs precision. The caviar service was presented with theatrical flair, accompanied by perfectly executed blinis and traditional accompaniments. The raw fish course demonstrated the restaurant‚Äôs mastery of preservation techniques‚Äîsilky, perfectly seasoned, and visually stunning.

The main course was a masterclass in technique: impeccably cooked fish adorned with toasted almonds, vibrant vegetables, and a sauce that brought everything together without overwhelming the star ingredient. Each element on the plate had purpose and demonstrated the kitchen‚Äôs respect for premium ingredients.

Le Bernardin‚Äôs continued excellence isn‚Äôt just about maintaining standards ‚Äî it‚Äôs about evolution while honoring tradition. Chef Eric Ripert‚Äôs vision remains as relevant and inspiring today as ever. This is destination dining at its finest, and our lunch was worth every moment. Highly recommended for anyone seeking a world-class seafood experience in New York City.‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã

reviews.author: Joanie Metivier
reviews.text:
We had such a lovely time at The Lounge at Le Bernardin. We couldn't get a table at the main restaurant as this was a last minute trip to New York unfortunately.  The food at the lounge was still outstanding ‚Äî the skate dish in particular was absolutely perfect, delicate and full of flavor, showcasing the precision and finesse the restaurant is known for.

What truly stood out, though, was the kindness of the team. Even though our son‚Äôs birthday is still a month away, they went out of their way to celebrate him and make him feel special. That thoughtful gesture meant the world to us and turned a wonderful meal into a beautiful family memory.

Thank you to everyone at Le Bernardin for such a warm and memorable experience ‚Äî we‚Äôll treasure it and can‚Äôt wait to return! We'll make sur to make a reservation ahead next time to try the main restaurant.

reviews.author: Julia Brown
reviews.text: I feel truly honoured to have had the pleasure of dining at this fine establishment. From the moment we walked in, we were greeted with hospitality and were sat immediately (no wait at the door). Every little detail of this place was special. The delicious food, the impeccable wine pairings and world-class service makes this place an absolute stand out. I have been fortunate enough to dine at many Michelin star restaurants all over the world, but this place will always have a special place in my heart. It truly does deserve its 3 Michelin star rating! We left happily full from our meal, and they even packaged our dessert course for us to enjoy later at home. Thank you so much for the incredible experience and for making myself and my guest feel so welcomed. 10/10 highly recommend.

reviews.author: Kristina Zhegunova
reviews.text:
We celebrated a birthday at Per Se two years ago and absolutely loved the experience. For some reason, I never wrote a review until now ‚Äî but it truly deserves one. The techniques were impressive, and the ingredients were of the highest quality. The finale with the dessert table was unforgettable!

That said, the restaurant itself could use a renovation ‚Äî the carpets and overall d√©cor feel a bit outdated and don‚Äôt quite match the level of a modern fine dining restaurant. Still, the food remains absolutely fantastic.

Thank you to the team for such a memorable evening! Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Lauren
reviews.text:
Per Se is an all around experience. We celebrated our engagement here and it was truly an unforgettable all around evening.

Per Se has been a bucket list item for me for over a decade. The experience did not disappoint - the food, I will say, not every dish was amazing. It is my first 3 star experience so I don‚Äôt have a good comparison, but at the price point I expect EVERY dish to blow me away.

They also had the largest wine list I have ever seen, they give you a whole iPad to look through!

The meal started off so strong with the classic oysters and pearls dish. Seriously this set the bar so high and left me feeling like I will never be the same after this meal lol. It‚Äôs been several months since we dined here and looking through my photos, the rest was fairly forgettable. I will note that every dish is truly a work of art, and some were prepped in a way that you couldn‚Äôt even imagine food being prepped that way. But again, nothing blew us away in terms of taste. The main meat dishes were nothing special.

The dessert was plentiful and very ‚Äúclassic‚Äù. Nothing out of the box or super imaginative.  We were actually so full by dessert we had a few of them boxed for us to take home.

The service is top tier. The staff really made us feel special and everyone was congratulating us on our engagement and it felt truly genuine.

The interior and overall vibe feel classic. I read a review it feels dated but it feels so classic NY to me.

Overall, it was a special night and a bucket list item crossed off the list. Unforgettable experience for sure but our expectations were set so high that not every dish hit the mark. Thank you to the team at Per Se for a memorable evening!

reviews.author: Alpay Ozbay
reviews.text:
Dining at Per Se was an unmatchable experience‚Äîone of those nights that reminds you why great restaurants matter. My wife and I went for dinner and enjoyed two incredible bottles of wine, a Barolo and a St. Georges Nuits, both perfectly paired with the flow of the tasting menu.

What really sets Per Se apart is how every single element on the plate has its own voice. Each bite delivers a completely unique taste identity‚Äînothing blends into the background, nothing feels repeated. It‚Äôs precision, creativity, and balance at the highest level.

Yes, it‚Äôs a splurge, but this was time and money exceptionally well spent. Between the service, the atmosphere, the wines, and those unforgettable flavors, Per Se delivers an evening you‚Äôll carry with you for a long time.

reviews.author: Anastasia M
reviews.text:
Phenomenal experience dining at Per Se. While it is a tasting menu, there were options to accommodate to our preferences and desires. My husband and I are not fans of tasting menus as a whole, but I have to stay every dish was out of this world.
The highlight of our experience were the staff. While extremely professional and adhered to the highest quality of serving standards, they adapted to our style of conversation and pace of eating. They were engaging and made our night that much better!

reviews.author: Karen Donovan
reviews.text: I came first to this restaurant upon the signing of my lease here at one of the high rises in the area. What will you find here? First off, a great cocktail. Secondly, excellent service. Thirdly, very good food. There is a reason why they have been in business as long as they have been. The place is now decked out for Christmas‚Äî my favorite holiday. Have a look‚Ä¶

reviews.author: Thomas
reviews.text:
Excellent food and service. The ambiance is very nice. Baked Ziti was perfection .

Just only one note. Do the tip manually on your own. The tips they suggest on the bill is including Tax. Tax is not part of the service so you will over trip if you use the suggestions on the bill.

reviews.author: akeera ramjohn
reviews.text: Some very tasty dishes! Lobster ravioli was especially delicious.  Had some other diners who were rude. Mussels in the appetizer was a bit overcooked.

reviews.author: Jordan Battiste
reviews.text: The food was excellent and the portions were generous. The drinks were really tasty and the wait staff was on point. It's a good spot for a business meeting, or a nice little date.

reviews.author: Elvis Jimenez
reviews.text:
Modern Restaurant & Lounge at 310 Huguenot Street is an absolute must-visit for anyone in New Rochelle looking for a superb dining and social experience. The moment you step inside, the beautiful, modern atmosphere sets a stylish and welcoming tone.
‚ÄãThe spacious layout expertly blends an inviting restaurant area with a lively bar. It‚Äôs a perfect spot to unwind, whether you‚Äôre enjoying a casual meal or catching a game, thanks to the convenient two televisions dedicated to sports.
‚ÄãBeyond the aesthetics, the food and fun are what truly make Modern shine. The menu boasts delicious, homestyle Italian classics and modern twists, all expertly prepared. From appetizers to entrees, every dish is a treat.
‚ÄãFor events, their private rooms are a fantastic amenity, making it an ideal choice for parties and celebrations. With a full bar, professional service, and a truly comfortable setting, Modern delivers an experience that is both sophisticated and deeply enjoyable. We thoroughly enjoyed the fun and the food‚Äîit's a staple for a reason!
‚ÄãWord Count: 152 words.
‚ÄãWould you like me to adjust the tone of the review, or perhaps focus on a specific dish or feature you enjoyed most?

reviews.author: Darran Smith
reviews.text: Mary's is marvelous. great staff and great food. there were so many tempting sweets but I decided to keep it savory on my visit and picked up a spinach pie, chili roasted sweet potatoes and a cheddar scallion scone. the spinach pie was delicious - great flavor and perfect texture. the sweet potatoes were amazing - just the right amount of chili to balance the natural sweetness of the yams. the scone was also tasty. I wish it had been a bit more cheddar-y, but the flavor was still good and the texture was perfect. if I lived here, I'd visit frequently (i.e. daily LOL!)

reviews.author: Pranav Khurana
reviews.text:
What an hidden gem this place is! Well ok, not that hidden :)

Great coffee, awesome blueberry muffin, spicy chicken sandwich and the best falafel roll I have ever had ( have had a few believe me) !

Also, they can teach some other local joints a thing or two about polite, friendly and respectful service.

Great job to its employees and whosoever is running the place!
Probably unlikely to be back in East Hampton soon but if we are then will definitely come back again!

reviews.author: Martin Kelly
reviews.text: Great food. Great coffee. Yes, it takes longer to prepare and cook food to order rather than nuke a prepackaged load of colored goop pumped with stabilizers and crap you can't pronounce.  Everything is fresh and made to order.  I now go there regularly instead of Starbucks.

reviews.author: Paula Seefeldt
reviews.text: Great coffee and delicious baked goods and prepared foods. The gluten free options are just as good as the regular choices and there is a  nice selection of savory foods, including a muffin shaped frittata. When in East Hampton, I like to go early, get a cup dark roast and then walk the beach. Great start to the day!

reviews.author: Shipra Jasoria
reviews.text: Wow!!  What a bakery. Ordered a cold chicken sandwhich and a falafel wrap to go with coffee and muffins and i am so glad i did as it made my morning. The service was great with owner/manager being the politest man ever. Will deff retuen to this bakery on my next trip to Hamptons.

reviews.author: Anna Li
reviews.text: Classic NY diner food in the area. Reasonable prices for near grand central. Solid cheeseburger! Fried calamari was very stale and hard though. Service was great.

reviews.author: Grace Kassimis
reviews.text:
Best breakfast I ever had.
Food was delicious

reviews.author: Rosenberg Bello
reviews.text: The atmosphere and service was great. The food on the other hand was subpar. Got the salad and it was drenched in dressing that I gained weight in eating the salad. The nachos that I shared with my family was very salty. The calamari however was good. If you come here, get the breakfast meals as they look appetizing. I regretted my decision and wish I got a breakfast meal instead

reviews.author: Gordon Watson
reviews.text:
A pretty good neighborhood diner.

I visited in the morning for brunch, the diner was a good level of busy with what felt like locals, always a good sign if construction workers are using a diner.

French toast was great, staff were attentive and helpful (even adding a side of peanut butter).

Coffee wasn't up to my incredibly high diner coffee standards,  but that aside all good.

Toilets however are down a flight of stairs, so not great for wheelchair users or anyone who's got limited mobility.

reviews.author: Lola Lopez
reviews.text:
Greeted as soon as I walk in. Being that it wasn't extremely busy I was able to pick my booth .
First time here and I enjoyed myself! Food was fresh & delicious.
It was about 12:30pm it was a nice space not to busy when I went but a continuous flow of people in and out.
Everyone that works there was nice & attentive to what I wanted. Side note( To my my bigger people the booths are kinda tight) I'm not sure if they have chair seating.

I also bought some sweets for home to share.Plain cheese cake it was good not overly sweet & A strawberry shortcake light & fluffy . Both good.

reviews.author: Victoria Yegorova
reviews.text:
Very affordable and delicious sushi gem! üíó
Me and my friend went here as well as my family afterwards, thai tea is my favorite! For the food I recommend the Kosan Pizza, Soho roll, Bagel roll and shrimp tempura, rock shrimp for the most part. The rest werent that bad but the other ones were my favorite. We also ordered kani salad as our first dish and it is definitely recommended to order that before the food! üç±

reviews.author: Deanna Lee
reviews.text:
Restaurant looks nice and clean, atmosphere is welcoming. The service was decent since we were the only customers there at lunch on a Wednesday at noon. The sushi tasted fresh and good. Will try again and order some other dishes for a broader review .
update 5/9 ordered delivery and unfortunately both orders were incorrect and not good. So sad that the food isn‚Äôt consistent.

reviews.author: Alex T
reviews.text:
Kosan Asian Fusion in Sheepshead Bay is a true hidden gem! The sushi here is fresh, beautifully presented, and absolutely delicious. Every roll we tried was bursting with flavor, and their creative menu offers a fantastic mix of classic and unique options.

Beyond sushi, their Asian fusion dishes are equally amazing, with rich flavors and perfect portions. The ambiance is cozy, and the staff is warm and attentive, making you feel welcome from the moment you walk in. It‚Äôs the perfect spot for a casual dinner or a special night out. I can‚Äôt recommend Kosan enough for anyone who loves great sushi and Asian cuisine!

reviews.author: Ignace Manoury
reviews.text: My server provided quality attention despite reports. The service quality alone validates this establishment. This restaurant offers affordable quality. The quality is top-notch! Visit this spot without hesitation!

reviews.author: Farooq Siraj
reviews.text:
Saturday evening drop by. This space is on my list for a while and didn‚Äôt disappoint a bit.

This restaurant has open view so one can see throughout. They have special seating for group of 6 to 8 for private, secluded dinner with your guests.

The space itself is nice and clean yet simple. The service is fast, prompt and more importantly attentive.

The food I ordered was two rolls (California and spicy tuna roll) both equally delicious and tasted fresh. Also ordered entree Japanese rice that came with salad.

All in all great experience, nice open space, excellent service, delicious fusion food.

reviews.author: Nacho Gonzalez Iglesias
reviews.text:
We had a fantastic experience at The Waverly Inn in West Village. The atmosphere is completely in character ‚Äî elegant yet relaxed ‚Äî creating the perfect backdrop for a memorable meal.
We ordered the eggs Benedict, the chicken sandwich and the burger which was absolutely spectacular‚Äîclearly a standout. The onion rings we had as a side were also must-order: crispy, flavorful, and just the right accompaniment.
The whole visit exceeded expectations. I‚Äôll definitely be back whenever I get the chance.

reviews.author: Julia W
reviews.text:
Made a reservation here for a Saturday evening dinner (resy opens 2 weeks in advanced), for my partners birthday. I did note this in my booking but it was not acknowledged by staff at all.
The dining room has a great, old feel to it, however tables are very close together. We were lucky to dine at 6pm, before the room was full.
We had the trout salad as appetiser which was better than expected and easy to share between two. For our mains, we had the chicken pot pie (very hearty) and roast chicken. Both were cooked perfectly.
For the price, I would only recommend for special occasions.

reviews.author: Nick C
reviews.text:
Celebrities may dine here and it may be on an abundance of NY must eat lists but if you are into food and know good restaurants then don‚Äôt bother.

Sadly this was the most disappointing meal I‚Äôve ever had in NYC. The pasta was below average and lacked creativity and flavour. The steak was small and under seasoned, the pot pie was dry and sloppy.

The highlights were small but the vibe inside is high. A beautiful building that has been well maintained. The completely biscuits were very tasty as was the wedge salad (but light on blue cheese and dressing). The dirty martini‚Äôs on the other hand were amazing. Some of the best I‚Äôve ever had. Also our waiter was perfect. Genuine and smiling with great chat.

All in all. Go for a drink and a snack during the day maybe. Don‚Äôt expect a memorable meal in terms of food more a fun vibe.

reviews.author: Alex Rademaker
reviews.text: My family of three had dinner here last night. We were very happy with our food and we tried a lot. Dining room has a nice feel. Service was incredible! James was our waiter and I think we‚Äôd all agree we‚Äôd go back just to have him again. You know when a waiter or waitress just makes the whole experience so nice you almost could care less about the food? This was our experience with James. We will definitely dine here again.

reviews.author: jade
reviews.text:
Such a good meal. Just tasty all around. Love the baby kale salad so much. Salmon is good but nothing you haven't had from a salmon entree before. Chicken is great, the real star is the castelfranco... holy wow. I don't know what they did with that dressing but it's absolutely insane. It honestly blew my mind I can't explain it. Mixed with the sauce of the chicken. Amazing. Need to come back from dessert but I was so full
And those biscuits!!!! So freaking good ugh i need them by the dozen.

Also the ambiance inside is a vibe.
I wouldn't sit outside in the front, it's noisy and buggy. But the back outside garden is nice.

reviews.author: Anna
reviews.text:
It‚Äôs my first time trying omakase and Sushi Blossoms was amazing! I went with my boyfriend for our anniversary and we chose the 17 course for $128 pp. Our experience was 9/10. The food was spectacular, staffs were so friendly and warm. They treat everyone with respect. The chefs were professional and explained the different pieces that were delivered to our plate.

Every piece of fish was delicately cut and prepped. Every piece was soft and tender. The soup and dessert left me speechless. They were sooooo good that I‚Äôm still thinking about it now.

Overall, I highly recommend Sushi Blossoms for anyone that likes sushi or omakase. I‚Äôd also recommend to book a reservation early and sit by the bar for the best chef experience.

reviews.author: Nina Anita
reviews.text:
It‚Äôs not great for solo dining.
Don‚Äôt bother coming early they seat you later especially if solo.
Once you‚Äôve had $185 Omakase in Barracks Row, this pales in comparison.
Yes the sushi was good but not omg I can‚Äôt wait to come back good like it is at Omakase in Barracks Row (that‚Äôs a whole experience) here it‚Äôs just a sushi bar. I was going to splurge on their premium omakase at Sushi Blossoms but it didn‚Äôt seem like it was worth it based off the service.
Overall it‚Äôs good.

reviews.author: J P (Delryn)
reviews.text:
If you like sushi, this is the perfect date night or celebration spot for a birthday or a big promotion. We have had Omakase at 4 different locations at various price ranges. This place ties with a Boston location for the top spot.

We've been here at least 4 times, sometimes with friends, usually on our own. Everytime the menu is different, and always delicious. The staff are friendly and attentive, the chefs are well-skilled and also hilarious. The ambience is superb with LoFi music, beautiful decoration, and mood lighting that is bright enough to see your food, but dim enough to not hurt the eyes.

We recommend this place to anyone visiting The City.

You don't have to, but I recommend you dress nicely. This restaurant deserves the best customers for providing the best food and service.

reviews.author: Aida Zheng
reviews.text: Took my mom and her friends here for their first omakase and I now understand why it is a local favorite. We got the $85 course, which despite being in Manhattan was surprisingly affordable, and the fish was just so fresh and melts straight into your mouth. The staff were very friendly especially the chefs, and the interior was super cozy. This place is definitely a must try for anyone having their first omakase experience! (Note that you might want to make a reservation beforehand, as they are busy most of the time).

reviews.author: Jody
reviews.text: The best omakase you will ever have! Everytime you go they change the menu based on what is in season. Their menu is always so creative and they have the best dishes. When I first tried their bird‚Äôs nest, I was laughing at how comical the dish was but it was so unique and delicious I ordered it again! I would recommend trying the sake as well, they have the best options. My favorite part about the resturant is they have the cutest collection of chopstick stands and everytime you go you don‚Äôt know which one you get! I got a chinese cat last time. Definitely a unique spot that everyone should go to once in their life. I always come here for my birthdays or special occasions. Can‚Äôt recommend this place enough.

reviews.author: Rachael Martin
reviews.text: delicious vegan sushi! i have been here on a previous trip to nyc and was keen to return. we booked online however we realised the booking system is for the other location, so be aware of this if you are using resy. they still fit us in and service was pretty good. food was great and prices are reasonable - the spicy salmon was a standout! definitely recommend this place!

reviews.author: Hannah King
reviews.text: A must visit vegan restaurant!! I come to Beyond Sushi every time I'm in town and the experience is top tier. Service is excellent. Food comes out quickly and looks and tastes delicious. Finally ordered an appropriate amount of food to have room for dessert and the ube cheesecake is to die for. üòçüò©ü§© I want to order seven more pieces as I'm typing this review.

reviews.author: A-Z Vegan
reviews.text:
Most likely the best spot in NYC for vegan sushi, full stop. As with all of the City Roots Hospitality Group, the meat (well, fish in this case) alternatives are mind-blowing and the flavour combos are well thought out and delicious. We went for:

-Philadelphia Maki
-Salmon Avocado
-Tuna Nigiri

And we were impressed by the presentation and taste of everything (although the Philadelphia roll was a ‚Äúwow‚Äù level highlight).

Service was prompt and very friendly. We will absolutely be coming back if we visit NYC again to try more of the menu!

reviews.author: Kristen
reviews.text:
Really great sushi! The Oshizuki Spicy Salmon was my favorite, the flavors were so delicious. The dumplings were also SO GOOD and seasoned very well.

We brought some family who are not vegan and they were really impressed and thought everything was super fantastic! Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Quendolen
reviews.text:
I stopped in for lunch on a Saturday afternoon and was immediately able to get a table for 1. The server who greeted me was super friendly and double-checked that I knew everything was plant-based and asked if I had allergies.

I ordered 2 different sushi rolls: the mighty mushroom and the spicy tuna. If you‚Äôre a fan of mushrooms, you‚Äôll love the mighty mushroom roll and I quite enjoyed the spicy tuna roll too.

Overall, I would say that Beyond Sushi had great service and quality food, and I definitely want to come back and try some of their other options too!

reviews.author: Barbara Gulten
reviews.text: Best late night snack! And this is a great spot for it. I admit that I was skeptical and didn‚Äôt think I would eat a whole slice. Ended up eating a slice and a half. We could have eaten a whole pizza. Great crust!! toppings simple and tasty. Long lines but it moves fast. Lot of people grab and go. They are making the pizzas fresh. Very tasty, very NYC, pop in and get two or 3 slices!

reviews.author: Paula
reviews.text:
We went on Saturday night and we queued twice for around 5-10‚Äô. Not too bad.

The best pizza was the champions üçÑ‚Äçüü´ one although a bit too much cheese.

The classic pizza was good but the sauce a bit too sweet for us.

The pepperoni square pizza was not fully cooked. The dough didn‚Äôt feel fully cooked. We should have returned it as we didn‚Äôt finish it/enjoy it.

We would have preferred if instead of a ricotta, there would have been a pizza with a blue cheese like Gorgonzola for example.

The staff was super kind and the atmosphere inside/outside is very friendly.

Prices aren‚Äôt too expensive and there‚Äôs the option of buying slices, which we loved.

Best part? How thin and crunchy the dough was.

reviews.author: Mike
reviews.text:
In my Summer 2025 Pizza Top 5 list, Bleecker Street Pizza comes in third place.

Bleecker St. Pizza is hyped by several NYC bloggers. I can understand the hype. The slices are very tasty. I had a Margerita (Cheese) a Peperoni with Jelapenos. The crust is a bit too crispy for me and the Mozzarella dominates the slices. The tomato sauce is great. OMG, the jelapenos blew me away - I thought I was used to hot food. I looove the level of spiciness! The ice-cold Coke saved me. The bit too much fat on the pizza can easily be wiped off with napkins. Overall it is a typical NYC pizza with pretty good quality and definitely worth trying.

The shop has two seating areas inside and one outside on the busy 7th Avenue. It's not exactly charming; there are TV screens everywhere and the rooms are very spartanly furnished. Overall, the shop fits in very well with the neighborhood, on the border of East and West Village, where five of New York's top pizzerias are located.

I guess I was very lucky because on my visit there was no waiting line at all!

I recommend Bleecker St. Pizza.

reviews.author: J M
reviews.text:
Always stop in once a year on a Friday to start our New York weekend trip (coming from VA). Greg is always very welcoming and he's always there when we (fam of 5) stop in. Never been disappointed in anything we order and we've tried every pizza on the menu. This place fills up fast and always so busy but worth it. We always make sure to have left overs to eat at the end of the night (after cruising NY).

Would have posted more photos but the kids already started eating.

reviews.author: Ash N. Smith
reviews.text: Solid pizza slice shop down in the village. It‚Äôs gonna be your go to place if you‚Äôre hitting in the bars in the area. They have plenty of seating for an nyc pizza shop and a good selection of pies. I actually grabbed one of their ready to go Greek salads and it was really good! üòä def gonna stop by here again in the future.  They will always be there!

reviews.author: Sara Soltan
reviews.text:
So tasty and generous amout
The fries so crispy and delicious
And their generosity to give free falafel before even start to order
They sell falafel packs to cook buly yourself, I can't wait to try it

reviews.author: Natalie Hernandez
reviews.text: If you‚Äôre pro pali, coming here is such a treat! Great food. Touching artwork. This is a must visit!! üòã I tried the king appetizer and chicken platter! So delicious

reviews.author: Jackie M
reviews.text:
Food was delicious!! Big portions! Pita was fluffy and flavorful! Love the decor and love how friendly this environment is from
the employees, to the owner, to the patrons. I will be back!

reviews.author: Giovanni Correa-Quinones
reviews.text: Everything from the place is phenomenal. From the entrance to the falafel to all the stickers and signs out there. I totally understand why the falafel is the best one ever. I would legit come back here every week if not every month. Food was mind blowing

reviews.author: Elif Akar
reviews.text: A proud Palestinian owned business and they have the best falafel I‚Äôve ever had the pleasure of having in my entire life and I‚Äôm not exaggerating at all. It‚Äôs shaped like kibbeh rather than the traditional round shape, they start frying them as soon as you walk in and offer you a piece as you wait in line to place your order and it‚Äôs the best starter before your meal. That is if you can fight the urge to get more and order something else instead which I personally failed at and proudly had one too many pieces that day, no regrets. Oh and the meat shawarma was also delicious.

reviews.author: Adam Giladi
reviews.text: Unbelievable Italian dinner and hard to believe it is gluten free! Loved exploring their risotto menu. Enjoyed the duck breast ragu dish with the penne. Don‚Äôt skip dessert here either

reviews.author: Russell Zagado
reviews.text: This has to be, the absolute best place for risotto. I‚Äôve had many risottos, even cooked them myself, and the lobster risotto special I‚Äôve had, was incredible. The place is nice and humble, and the owner or manager was extremely kind and attentive. All three of us got the lobster risotto. The lobster risotto was this nice risotto where the lobster was incorporated into every bite, along with other components-they all made sense in the dish. The grana padano was an incredibly tasty cheese that I put on my spinach. We also got a few appetizers like the calamari and the prosciutto and they were refreshing. It is not recommended to put cheese on seafood, as the cheese overpowers the seafood. This is my second time going to this place, and yet again, I wasn‚Äôt disappointed.

reviews.author: Morgan Watkins
reviews.text:
Wow. What a fantastic experience. We're only in the city a couple times a year so it's rare that we eat at the same place twice. This will be somewhere we return.

Carpaccio was on special. Just the right amount of shaved truffle was a highlight.

Both of us had risotto from the regular menu, we're still raving.

One server (Nicole?) was plenty for the small space and she was fantastic.

reviews.author: DBradshaw25
reviews.text: Even if you're not gluten free, I really recommend you check out this place! Everything was really excellent! We had the Fritto misto (calamari) appetizer and the Caesar salad to start - the salad was amazing quite honestly! The gluten free croutons were the best (I usually am never able to get croutons with salad!). For the main meal we had the pollo bacon risotto and the spinaci asiago pasta. The risotto - fantastic! The pasta was good but please allow the server to add cheese to it! I asked them to skimp on the cheese and I needed to add salt to it which was my mistake. When the server came back I asked them to put the normal amount of cheese on it and that fixed it. For dessert we had the special which was the raspberry chocolate tart.... OMG.... Phenomenal!!! Service was excellent and everything was fantastic. I will be back!!

reviews.author: Hannah Tori
reviews.text: We had dinner at Risotteria Melotti after our wedding ceremony a couple weeks ago. We have 3 celiac family members who all RAVED about the food here and felt safe because the entire restaurant is gluten free. They accommodated all of the needs of our party (kids who are picky eaters, someone who doesn‚Äôt eat shellfish, vegetarians). Kind servers, delicious food, excellent hospitality! Can‚Äôt say enough good things about this place, and it will always be one of our favorite restaurants.

reviews.author: Steven Kagen
reviews.text: Their website does not show a delivery charge until after you pay. I was going to buy a $38 pizza pie, added a 15% tip for a driver, and after I made a payment got a receipt with $15 previously hidden delivery charge. I totally can understand a delivery charge, but it should be disclosed before the payment, not after.

reviews.author: Shneur
reviews.text: Great pizza shop with fair prices. Salads, sandwiches.. most fresh salads and pasta plates are $10! Limited indoor and outdoor seating. Close to public transportation.

reviews.author: Ben GG
reviews.text:
The pizza here is good compared to their sister pizza location on nostrand.
BUT the fish n chips. Were horrendous..
Please just please take a look at how real fish n chips are supposed to be. Your fries are alright but the FISH bro those frozen fish sticks. HORRENDOUS.

reviews.author: K. A. Butt
reviews.text: I bought a whole pizza pie but it was over priced so I won‚Äôt go back there

reviews.author: Dave Kineret
reviews.text: Very good pizza. There were literally 20 orders and it took 5 minutes and there was a Karen acting like it's McDonald's because they don't wrap it enough they literally only have one working come on Karen but otherwise the food was insane!

reviews.author: Pnina Bar Zaltzman
reviews.text: We visited the restaurant three times, the first time about two years ago in the bar was simply unforgettable, excellent dishes. It left us with a wonderful taste. The second time in the restaurant was an extraordinary experience, everything was delicious and special. Today at the bar, what a disappointment, we left the food on the plate, the service is excellent, the food is so disappointing. The starters are not tasty, boring. The main course, lobster ravioli, smelled bad, the fried chicken felt like fast food, the only dish we really liked was the Mont Blanc, the dessert was excellent, just a waste of money and time, a big disappointment

reviews.author: k chen
reviews.text:
This was truly the best five-star dining experience we‚Äôve ever had! Even though there was a small mistake with one dish, the staff handled it with such grace and professionalism. They not only offered us a discount, but also surprised us with five complimentary desserts and a birthday cake.

The desserts were absolutely stunning‚Äîeach one a masterpiece that completely blew us away. What impressed us most was the way the restaurant turned a tiny imperfection into the most perfect and memorable service.

It ended up being the most delightful birthday celebration we could have asked for‚Äîfull of surprises, warmth, and genuine care. Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Tarek Farahat
reviews.text: Loved it ..Great place for lunch. The food is delicious, service is quick and the bar area is nicely spacious. Great for business lunch as it offers good space between tables to allow for conversations. We had a delicious hot dog with caviar (yes with caviar) and tasted amazing. Main course were salmon (always great there) and pasta with lobster. Dessert was caramelized banana with ice cream. Portions are relatively small but each dish had its own strong taste.

reviews.author: Jayson Tomasulo
reviews.text: Went for a late lunch with the family after an adventure at the met. Overall it was stellar. Started with some tomato bread that was perfectly seasoned. The salmon was cooked well and a sauce added some interesting notes. Finished it off with a delightfully chocolate dessert. Food was excellent and service was tight. Highly recommend

reviews.author: Emma Chiu
reviews.text:
Came here for a really special celebration with a few friends and honestly was very disappointed by our experience.

We got the restaurant week menu and the food was phenomenal -- highlights were the steak tartare, heirloom tomato toast, rabbit tagliatelle, and the bread and cultured served at the beginning. Dessert was great too.

What made the experience subpar was the service. We sat outside and ordered a bottle of wine, but bugs started to fall into our wine glasses that we barely drank so we let our server know. She was kind about it and even offered to seat us inside without us asking, which we were surprised about and took her upon her offer. However, once we were seated inside, the entire experience went downhill. We hadn't finished all of our food from outside, and they said they would take care of moving everything inside but they only brought in our appetizers and tossed our half eaten bread which we were hoping to finish. Our new wine glasses were filled with the remainder of the bottle of wine we ordered and we had to ask about the two glasses of wine that were taken from us due to bugs being in them (eventually someone came and refilled our glasses but I wish we didn't need to ask). We also waited 30-45 minutes before dessert was served and it only came because we had to ask for it.

Overall, I would recommend the restaurant for food but wouldn't recommend it for the service. Given its price point and reputation, my friends and I were all very disappointed and it definitely put a damper on our night and celebration. We appreciated the staff trying to improve our experience initially but we would've much rather stayed outside had we known this was the experience we were going to receive.

reviews.author: Rebecca & Caleb
reviews.text: Oh, how we love the Fernies!!! Chatting with Julia was not only incredibly helpful (we had no idea what we were doing) but also SO much fun (are we best friends?!). The whole Fern Botanica team is supremely talented, wonderfully kind, and ridiculously fun, and our florals were straight out of a dream.
