We would have Pinterest-ed our own wedding photos, which seems like the goal to achieve!! Julia entertained our odd requests & knew what we wanted, even when we didn‚Äôt. Our chuppah was breathtaking, and the bud vases across the tables were the subject of many guests‚Äô glowing compliments! Our friends even commented on the gorgeous color of the candlesticks. Truly, the Fern team pulled together the most beautiful design and exceeded all of our expectations. We couldn‚Äôt recommend them more. Thank you, Fernies!

reviews.author: Lily Momeyer
reviews.text: We gave Julia and her team little direction and full creative freedom, and they absolutely blew us away. The space was completely transformed with their ideas, designs, and florals-- it was more beautiful and unique than we could have imagined. We also loved our studio visit and felt like fast friends with the Fern Botanica team. They were responsive throughout the process, and really such a joy to work with from start to finish. We can‚Äôt recommend them enough!

reviews.author: Melissa Gaglio
reviews.text:
Julia, Sk and team are beyond talented. Flowers at least for me set the mood and are one of if not the most impactful portion of wedding visuals. I knew when I found Fern Botanica on Instagram I wanted them to curate my wedding. Julia and Sk are attentive, flexible and wonderful to work with. Julia came to see me in my apartment the morning of to tell me about my flowers. I was so thrilled and happy to finally meet her!!  Our family and friends gasped when they saw the room for our wedding reception (as did I ) it was everything I wanted it to be. Art Deco and Old Hollywood time travelled right to our wedding. My  bouquet is still thriving in water at my apartment!

Thank you so much for handling everything with such care!

reviews.author: Elle Kenwood
reviews.text:
How do you give 1000 stars ‚Äî because 5 just doesn‚Äôt cut it! I had the absolute HONOR of having Fern Botanica as my wedding florist, and I‚Äôm still in awe of what they created for us. Julia, SK, and Lenin are pure magic ‚Äî warm, kind, and the kind of people you instantly want to sit and have coffee with ‚Äî but also complete creative geniuses. They didn‚Äôt just deliver my vision; they elevated it into something more stunning than I ever could have imagined. Just beyond beautiful. If you‚Äôre lucky enough to work with Fern Botanica, you will not be sorry!

Signed,
Fern Botanica‚Äôs #1 Fan

reviews.author: emily rose kellerman
reviews.text: I used Fern Botanica's Fernies for my wedding and absolutely LOVED my arrangements! I ordered two Va Va Voom arrangements and flower girl crowns. I can't express enough what good vibes working with Fern Botanica was, they were collaborative and really listened to what I wanted. It was so nice to find such a wonderful florist who would do √† la carte orders! I got so many compliments on the flowers! Can't recommend them enough!

reviews.author: Donna S
reviews.text:
We had a fabulous date night here before our second baby arrives. Had the tasting menu so we were seated in front of the window. The views are spectacular.

Food was amazing, they even gave us several amuse bouche in between waiting for our main dishes on the chefs tasting menu. The BBQ portion was cooked in front of us so we didn‚Äôt need to cook or cut the meats ourselves. We had the regular prime rib menu and it was fantastic. The galbi was marinated for 24 hours and you could tell the marinade penetrated deep into the core of the meat. Every morsel was savoured. The basque cheesecake was the cherry on top to end the meal. Loved the overall presentation and the flow of the meal. Will come again next time.

reviews.author: Michael Moore
reviews.text: This is a really pretty place, basically fancy Korean bbq. There are set price options and the server does all the cooking and serving. So it has all the aspects of kbbq without any of the work. Great choices of meat, great service, love the view and drinks also. We had a great time. I will say it‚Äôs not the place if you‚Äôre looking for a more laid back place, it does have a certain aesthetic. But it‚Äôs beautiful so perfect for dates or dressier nights

reviews.author: Sapphira Bella
reviews.text: This place has pretty good reviews but the food was not great compared to the price- I did not eat any of the meat however. A plate of veggie bbq was at $18. The banchan was decent, dessert was good. Overall good but nothing mind blowing.

reviews.author: diana kelly
reviews.text:
I‚Äôve always loved this restaurant ‚Äî I even celebrated my birthday here once! After traveling a lot, I hadn‚Äôt visited in about two years and was really looking forward to coming back. Unfortunately, this time the experience was a bit disappointing.

We were seated but waited around five minutes without menus or attention. After calling someone over, we ordered water, but it never arrived before the waiter came to take our food order. My friend‚Äôs salad came out first, mine didn‚Äôt, and the wine we ordered never showed up. At one point, I was even served a dish I hadn‚Äôt ordered.

Eventually, one of the managers noticed and took care of us ‚Äî from that moment everything was great, and the wagyu was absolutely delicious. Still, all those small service issues added up and made the evening less enjoyable, especially since I‚Äôd been so excited to return.

reviews.author: Michael Fil
reviews.text: This isn't just any Ktown bbq. Gaonnuri boasts of beautiful midtown views from the 39th floor. Their tasting menu hinted at Korean flavors, but didn't overpower. I especially liked the white kimchi cod and the cuts of meat selected for the kbbq. Good service too. Also appreciated the recognition of our anniversary!

reviews.author: Joanne Uy (JT)
reviews.text: Thai cuisine is in my top 3 favorite cuisines ever. So much so that I've traveled to Bangkok to eat and learn to cook more than 3 times now. While I have my usual Thai restaurant go tos, Pure Thai is now my favorite when it comes to their noodle soups! I've just recently tried both their beef and roasted pork soups with rice noodles and they were so delicious and comforting! They also do their Thai iced tea just right and have good vegetable spring rolls! Service is warm and friendly even if they get so packed and busy. The restroom is spacious and clean especially in their expanded section which we usually enjoy better. Can't wait to come back soon for my Thai noodle soup fix! :)

reviews.author: Jennifer Jernun
reviews.text: The food here is absolutely delicious! The noodles have an authentic Thai flavor, and every single dish is packed with amazing taste ‚Äî yes, every single one. You can truly experience real Thai cuisine without having to fly to Thailand. The prices are very reasonable, and the staff are attentive and friendly without being overbearing. Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Madison McCanna
reviews.text:
Such a gem! Every single thing was delicious & the prices were so reasonable esp for being in NYC. Service was top tier and the restaurant is super cute and cozy.

Update: Just went here again during a day trip to NYC & it was so good once again! We got the app sampler (veg puffs are the best), chicken pad Thai, and the crab & duck noodles. Lovely service & delish food!

reviews.author: Adeline K.
reviews.text: I‚Äôve been coming here for almost 10 years and I still order the same soup every time ‚Äî Sukhothai. Over the years I became pescetarian, so they make it with tofu for me now, but I‚Äôve had it with meat before too and both versions are equally delicious. It always tastes exactly the same ‚Äî pure comfort. The place is tiny but the food is incredible, and I bring everyone I care about here when they visit. The staff is always warm and friendly. Pure Thai is truly a gem of Hell‚Äôs Kitchen.

reviews.author: Robbin
reviews.text:
12 years ago when I first visited Pure Thai Cookhouse, I was blown away. 12 years later when I came again, I was still impressed by the quality of their street style Thai food. Even better this time, it is slightly easier to get a same day reservation.

I'll take my friends to this place if we are looking for no frill high quality Thai street food with reasonable price. This may be the top one for me in this category.

reviews.author: Magda L
reviews.text: Absolutely amazing Korean spot! The flavors were out of this world ‚Äî every dish was packed with depth and spice, just like it should be. Hands down the BEST tofu I‚Äôve ever had ‚Äî perfectly cooked, flavorful, and addictive. The staff was super friendly and made us feel so welcome from the moment we walked in. Everything we ordered was top-notch. If you love Korean food (or even if you‚Äôre new to it), this place is a must. 10/10!

reviews.author: MO
reviews.text: Welcoming & attentive service but be ready to be inched out as they are very busy from early on and dishes come out fast. Kimchi cheese pancake was ok. Crispy but didnt taste any cheese, just something mushy inside. Bulgogi grill was very tasty and kepted warm on the skillet. Fried chicken was fine. Next time, will try the crab and the hot pots recommended by server. Cocktail was nice but too weak in any hint of liquor but, still a good compliment to the savory food.

reviews.author: Ivy Chen
reviews.text:
Came here for lunch and really enjoyed it! The atmosphere is cozy with a modern touch, perfect for a casual meal with friends. I didn‚Äôt order any drinks, just focused on the food ‚Äî the stew and BBQ were flavorful, hearty, and felt like real home-style cooking.

Service was friendly and the food came out quickly. Prices are reasonable for New York, and the lunch portions were very satisfying. Highly recommend if you‚Äôre looking for authentic Korean comfort food in the city!

reviews.author: Ally Xiong
reviews.text: The food was amazing!! Adding this place to my top 5 faves in Ktown! I definitely think you need to get out of the main 32nd St block and venture to 31st and 33rd-35th St because the food scene is so much better!! The restaurant does get packed so make sure you make a resy! You won‚Äôt regret trying this place out. We got spicy rice cakes which came with squash and peppers, slow cooked pork belly (so soft, not rubbery at all), and their sweet potato noodles with pork. You‚Äôll know the exact names when you look at the menu, but all of these were fire üòç

reviews.author: Wilson Ho
reviews.text: Nice place with a calm ambiance. The staff are considerate and the food is great. Got the KFC (can't go wrong with Korean fried chicken) also got the spicy pork BBQ, not to spicy and has a sweet aftertaste. All the side dishes that accompanied the dish balanced each other perfectly. Would definitely come again.

reviews.author: McKeith
reviews.text:
What an exceptional brunch experience. The cocktails were outstanding, with playful names inspired by music icons‚Äîone after my favorite Beyonc√© track, Alien Superstar, and another, Bidi Bidi Bom Bom, honoring the infectious Selena hit. Each drink was superb, with a subtly botanical character that felt especially fitting given the restaurant‚Äôs proximity to the Brooklyn Botanic Garden.

For brunch, I enjoyed the Huevos Rancheros and the French toast. The Huevos Rancheros featured perfectly cooked short rib, which proved to be the highlight of the dish. The French toast struck a harmonious balance between sweet and savory; fresh blueberries and raspberries, paired with a delicate caramel drizzle, eliminated any need for syrup.

I also sampled the shrimp and grits, which were equally impressive. Even before tasting the shrimp itself, the rich flavor of the seafood infused the grits beautifully. The shrimp were plump, generously portioned, and cooked to perfection.

The staff were exceptionally kind, attentive, and worked seamlessly as a team. I was fortunate to meet one of the owners, whose humility and graciousness left a lasting impression. I look forward to returning to explore the upcoming seasonal menu

reviews.author: Karlie Arkin
reviews.text:
Arden is darling.  Small and personal.
We had fried olives (because, what?) and they were good.  Kind of lost their oliveyness with the light breading and frying.
And the Emotional Rescue cocktails -
Delicious.
A cod special with mushrooms and eggplant and curry.  And the Roasted Hen of the Woods mushroom dish.  Everything was beautiful, balanced, had a lot of mmmmmmm going on.
Also, super cute journals carried the check to the table, with comments and drawings.  Very fun.
We would def go back again.

reviews.author: Bethlehem Gedion
reviews.text: Wandered into Arden looking for a quick bite after enjoying the Brooklyn Botanical Gardens and it was a treat! The Happy Hour menu offers a well rounded variety of bites and more hearty items. The Salmon tartare and the Hamachi on crispy rice were standouts and my companions enjoyed the burgers which were also solid. Great atmosphere and wonderful service. I look forward to coming back and trying their dinner menu. The toffee pudding was tasty, but be advised it‚Äôs less dense and more airy than a traditional pudding.

reviews.author: Mark
reviews.text:
Our first time here was a Sunday afternoon for brunch. We sat at the bar and thoroughly enjoyed everything - the food, wines by the glass, the people who work here.

Last Saturday we came back for dinner. Once again, it was lovely on all fronts. While we didn‚Äôt have anything from the happy hour menu, our meal (shared the little gems wedge; he had the octopus and shrimp starters for his main course, I had the chicken Marsala) was great. The portions were pretty large, and while I initially had hopes of bringing half my chicken entree home, I ate all of it. The side of corn cooked with miso was fantastic too

reviews.author: Jess Shen
reviews.text: a lovely small neighborhood restaurant with great drinks and the food was all very flavorful! We got the beef shoulder as our main with a side of brussels, and for starters we did salmon tartare, bone marrow, and pork belly. they also gave us a complementary bok choy dish which I loved the flavor of.

reviews.author: Victor Chau
reviews.text:
Came here for lunch on a Sunday. Took around 30 minutes to get seated after joining their waitlist around 12:30pm.

Everything here was exceptionally tasty. The banchan were all delicious and unlimited which was a nice plus.

We ordered the mini bossam, spicy tofu soup, and seafood pancake. The pork was excellent, tender and flavorful with no overly porky tasty. The seafood pancake had a great texture and had plenty of seafood. The soup also had plenty of seafood and was tasty.

We spent around $40/pp after tax and tip for two people‚Äôs lunch. I was very satisfied and would definitely come back since I felt it was decent value for my money.

reviews.author: Leo Zou
reviews.text: Really worth the long wait time. Some of the best Korean food I have. The thick slices of pork belly really hits different than the thinly sliced ones. The meaty taste is spectacular and pairs really well with the kimchi and jalape√±os. The bugolgi had a wonderful flavor that‚Äôs a bit on the sweet side. Really goes well either way the rice. The seafood tofu stew was also great but would appreciate it if the mussel‚Äôs shell didn‚Äôt break into the soup.

reviews.author: Bradley C
reviews.text:
Came here for the first time. I ordered a mini Bossam and CDG Dubu Duruchigi.

Before my food was ready. A bowl of fresh tofu was served first. It was so simple and delicious. You can tell they are really proud of their daily homemade tofu.

The first one was cooked 3 layers pork with sides of kimchi, jalapeno, garlic, and soybean paste sauce. It was so delicious. The pork was cooked perfectly. It was soft with nice bouncy texture. It pairs very well with the soybean paste sauce. I basically licked the saucer clean.

The tofu stew was also very nice. The broth was umami and spicy. The tofu was superb. Rich and elegant of natural soybean flavors. The server informed me that the broth was seafood based. The white noodles were a plus to the dish.

All the side dishes were so delicious. I think I asked refills for 3 times. Today I got stew potatoes and radishes, cold string beans with garlic, eggplant with mushrooms, pickled radishes, and a cold seaweed dish. My favorites were the eggplant and the string beans. The potatoes had nice flavor, too. I believe I tasted something like miso.

The servers were attentive and friendly. Even though they were all so busy, they still take time to make sure my needs were met. Overall, I had a great time dining here. I‚Äôll definitely come back with more people. The portions of the foods were great. PLEASE SHARE THE TOFU STEW. I was almost too full to walk after I finished all my foods.

reviews.author: Hannah Lee
reviews.text: My friends and I loved our dining experience here! The complimentary house-made tofu was absolutely delicious ‚Äî it had a firmer texture, which I actually prefer over silky smooth tofu. I ordered the spicy kimchi tofu stew and was very satisfied. The stew had a nice variety of seafood that complemented the spice of the broth perfectly, and the tofu was a real standout that brought the whole dish together. After we finished our meals, our waiter poured some tea into our rice bowls and served it to us, explaining that it helps with digestion. The tea was unsweetened, and the combination with the rice wasn‚Äôt my favorite, but the gesture was thoughtful. Our waiter was also very funny and extremely helpful in guiding us through the menu!

reviews.author: asmaa odeh
reviews.text: Food was amazing! We definitely picked the more indulgent foods and honestly they did not disappointed. So so so amazing. The sushi roll was one of the best I‚Äôve had, they packed it up with tuna and it was so fresh and tasty! I also really enjoyed the fried soft shell crab. Really good and the atmosphere was great.

reviews.author: Justin Ton
reviews.text: What an experience. Food and service were phenomenal and the food and drinks. Wow. Great Szechuan taste. Super authentic. My new favorite chinese spot in the city!! The Fried fish and green beans with eggplants were amazing. All the sides and appetizers as well were phenomenal.

reviews.author: Alex Zhang
reviews.text:
I have been wanting to try this place for a very long time. finally pop in for a visit during lunch time on a weekday. it really exceeded my expectation. there are so many sichuan restaurants in NYC and it's already hard to top one another. but the food here is really unique and the service is a top notch. Love their old shanghai decor makes it cozy and quiet enough to be able to talk to each other without screaming. there are multiple floors even seats that best for solo as well.

The dish most wows me is the spicy soft shell crab. there are so much crab in it and loaded with flavor.
Tea Smoked Duck is very juicy with smoky taste.
Pork Dumplings in Chili Oil is one of the best flavor in NYC, it's very authentic taste with a little sweet and a little spicy.
the lucky cup sake is very easy to drink if you want to take advantage of their happy hour price for only $8

There are some lunch bento specials as well, if you are not a person to share. there are also plenty to choose from.

reviews.author: Billy Xia
reviews.text:
Authentic Szechuan food with a creative twist. Every dish we ordered was delicious and hit the spot with the right amount of spice and flavor. Surprisingly reasonably priced.

Even though we didn‚Äôt try the cocktails the menu and names looked definitely interesting.

Very cute and chic decor inside. The only downside is that it was very loud so we had to shout to each other throughout our meal.

Will be coming back.

reviews.author: Kristine Stefanija
reviews.text:
One of my favorite spots for Chinese food and great peaceful atmosphere in New York!! It feels like you‚Äôre traveling in time to 1930‚Äôs Shanghai.

Peaceful, cozy, incredibly delicious! The loofah with dried scallops and mapo tofu are my favorites! I highly recommend this spot!

reviews.author: Jay Buggy
reviews.text: We visited this restaurant during weekdays at 2 pm. There was no wait, and there were plenty of tables available. The ambiance was pleasant, but the food was not particularly impressive, and the service was quite lacking. The staff seemed preoccupied with chatting in the hallway instead of attending to our needs.

reviews.author: Vanity Duran
reviews.text: Sylvia‚Äôs was good. I‚Äôm visiting from Florida and went because of its history. It‚Äôs nice to see the restaurant still maintain its charm. The service was a bit slow though and I heard that with the new owners, the vibe has changed. Nonetheless, I enjoyed the mac and cheese that came with complimentary cornbread. I drank my light meal down with Sylvia‚Äôs Uptown drink which I‚Äôd assume is her version of iced tea and lemonade. The space is cozy yet very spacious. It‚Äôs almost as if you‚Äôre stepping back into time going down the timeline of all the class act guests who‚Äôs stopped by.

reviews.author: Govind V
reviews.text:
I visited Sylvia‚Äôs after seeing it featured on the YouTube series Worth It, and it absolutely lived up to the hype!

The food is soul-warming and full of flavor. The fried chicken was perfectly crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside ‚Äî easily some of the best I‚Äôve had. The BBQ ribs were tender and coated with a delicious, tangy sauce. The collard greens had that comforting, slow-cooked depth of flavor, and the mashed potatoes were creamy and well seasoned. And of course, the cornbread was a highlight ‚Äî warm, fluffy, and perfect with a little butter.

The portions are generous, the presentation is inviting, and you can tell everything is made with care.

The atmosphere is cozy and welcoming, with a classic Harlem charm. We sat in the covered outdoor section, which was comfortable and had a nice view of the neighborhood. Service was friendly and attentive, making the whole experience even better.

If you‚Äôre in NYC and want true comfort food with history and heart, Sylvia‚Äôs is a must-visit. I‚Äôll definitely be coming back.

reviews.author: Tanisha Knott
reviews.text:
Yes the food was good, BUT‚Ä¶  Visiting my stepdaughter in New York for Thanksgiving 2025,  She suggested Sylvia‚Äôs Soul food Restaurant in Harlem. We made reservations for 5, for 5pm. We got seated at 5:10pm. One person received their food around 6pm (she ate by herself). The 4 of us got our food at 6:36pm. OVER AN HOUR LATER. We were told that the one person at our table got their food first because they thought it was a single order.  The waitress apologized but did not ask if we wanted to talk to the manager.  So one of our guest asked the waitress if we can get a 10% discount due to the long wait. That‚Äôs when the waitress said we need to talk to the manager.  The manager came and gave us 10% off.  Also, the waitress never brought out the dessert until we asked for it (comes with the meal.)  the sweet potato pie came out cold. HOWEVER, the food was really, really good. The greens were delicious, cornbread delicious. the cornbread stuffing was delicious. Yams, mac and cheese, Turkey‚Ä¶ delicious. Our desserts‚Äî  came at the end and we took it to go.  We also saw another waitress with a visible irritated face. But we take it as she didn't want to work on Thanksgiving. Next time‚Äî she should take the day off.

But Would I go back. Absolutely! The food was bomb! But I would go on a non-busy day.  I don‚Äôt cancel until the second strike.

reviews.author: Stacy Lewis
reviews.text: Service with a smile was great!  So was the hospitality.   Our waitress was pretty busy so she wasn't able to give top notch service but our needs were met.  The food... myuah!  Delicious and down home.  This will not be my last visit to Sylvia's.  We met people from the US and those visiting from abroad.  Don't skip Sylvia's!

reviews.author: Brook Riddick
reviews.text:
Honestly everything was fantastic and exactly what I'd hoped to show my friend about good soul food.
We had originally planned on somewhere else for dinner but I admit I saw the YouTube review @Jolly did and thought, okay I HAVE to try this place. Though the chicken was the big recommendation online I have to say that the ribs and the collard greens were some of the best I've ever had.
You know it's a good meal when you both feel "bad" about leaving food on the plate because it feels like you're insulting the chefs.
We sincerely couldn't have asked for a better experience

reviews.author: JoNo X
reviews.text: Break‚Äôn Eggs Creperie was a pretty good sit in breakfast/brunch place that heavily focused on crepes. I thought the food was good and cooked to perfection. I would have loved to see more traditional options that included some of the breakfast classics without having to pay an up charge. All in all, this place was a good visit and I‚Äôm glad I stopped in.

reviews.author: M D
reviews.text:
We came to Crepe ‚Äòn Breakfast in Amherst while visiting Buffalo and were so impressed, we came back twice during our trip ‚Äî and ordered the same exact thing both times: the Eggs Benedict. That‚Äôs how good it was. The eggs were perfectly poached, the hollandaise was rich and velvety, and everything was plated with care.

The atmosphere is warm and welcoming, and the staff made us feel right at home. It‚Äôs rare to find a spot that hits the mark so consistently. If you‚Äôre in the area, don‚Äôt skip this place ‚Äî it‚Äôs hands down one of the best breakfast spots around.

reviews.author: Eui Sun Chung
reviews.text:
The restaurant that was originally located on Main St. has closed and is now being run as a combined operation at this Express location.

There are enough tables inside, so you can enjoy a full dining experience just like at the original restaurant.

The omelette was as delicious as a top-tier hotel breakfast, and the French toast was incredibly moist. The coffee was pleasantly good as well. Each dish came with a small portion of fruit, adding a nice balance to the flavors.

reviews.author: James Schillinger
reviews.text: Here is my experience at this establishment 1st and last time I will ever eat there. I would give it zero stars if I could. First the portions in the menu were not as stated for the French toast the menu stated 3 slices and we got 2 on both orders. The pancakes tasted as if they were overcooked in oil and the French toast was soggy as left in the egg batter far too long and the eggs my other family member got were dry and disgusting. I am very upset not just with the food but also not once was it stated there would be a forced group charge of 20% ontop of being served this horrible food then to add complete insult to injury they charged me an additional 10 dollar tip when I clearly wrote 0 for additional tip. I cannot believe they are still in business like this. I have never in my 40 years of existence have I ever had experienced such a horrible breakfast from anywhere!!!!! I also paid 65.15  for this experience with 10 dollars being staight stolen from me. You have been warned.

reviews.author: L C
reviews.text:
Wonderful experience all the way around. Great selection of delicious food from daily egg plate specials to spectacular one of a kind crepes.
Coffee was hot and strong. The fruit was fresh and plentiful. The prices were reasonable for the amount of food offered.
The server was cheerful, friendly and attentive. She was busy but made all of us feel welcomed and appreciated.

reviews.author: Carla Daza
reviews.text: Delicious pizza and a range of other menu items available. We tried the Mediterranean summer vegetable pizza and the sunflower pesto pizza. Both were good, the pesto pizza was my favorite. Staff is nice. Depending on hunger, might be able to split one pizza for two people. Leftovers are yummy.

reviews.author: Isabella Grandic
reviews.text:
Ok actually quite good vegan mushroom pizza. That‚Äôs why they get 5 stars. Margarita would be 5/5 if it had a bit more of that cashew cream cheese‚Ä¶

Drinks were lovely. HUGE basil lemonade. Fab Arnold Palmer. Great.

Tacos were whatever ngl. Get the pizza!!

This restaurant is part of bar verde, the Mexican vegan restaurant, too. It‚Äôs a bit confusing.

They are super allergen friendly. Nut free, GF, even soy free!

They have tons of outdoor and indoor seating. Did not need a Rez for a Saturday @noon.

reviews.author: Shawn C
reviews.text:
Best vegan pizza in NYC. I could have sworn I reviewed Double Zero before and now I‚Äôm wondering if the review disappeared because it was for their old location. They moved (on the same block I think?) into a place that looks a little tighter inside but had an outdoor seating.

Came with a party of 3 and sat inside for a quiet Saturday night dinner‚Äîinterior seating was maybe half full and exterior seating was packed.

Warning interior didn‚Äôt have AC running.

Got two pizzas and jackfruit tacos

Jackfruit tacos: Good but lacked a sauce or spice that left it getting drowned out by the much more flavorful pizzas

Truffle cashew cream pizza: Excellent. Third time getting it and every time it‚Äôs been a hit. Flavorful spread of mushrooms on cashew cheese

Spicy Pepperoni Pizza: Pepperonis themselves quite good on a tomato, basil, cheese base. Note the pepperonis have coconut in them in case you‚Äôre allergic.

Also got two cocktails and a mocktail, but nothing to report there. My Moscow mule was largely ice.

Unfortunately, the owner is apparently a terrible person according to the April 22, 2024 NYTimes article, but the food is good especially for vegans.

reviews.author: Justin McClelland
reviews.text:
Had always wanted to go to the Double Zero in Venice, CA, so I was excited to finally try the location in NYC!

First off, I found the location to be a bit confusing. There‚Äôs two restaurants operating in the same space, so I nearly walked out thinking I was in the wrong place.

Now onto the food and experience! I tried the mushroom pizza and cacio e pepe (see pic of pasta in my review). The pasta was really good. Creamy, lots of flavor, and great texture. It‚Äôs not the same as cacio e pepe in Rome, but nonetheless enjoyable.

The pizza tasted good but violated the #1 holy rule of pizza making: limp crust. I couldn‚Äôt pick up the slice without it sagging. Whomp, whomp. You also have to be a big fan of truffle oil, it‚Äôs used pretty liberally on this dish.

The service was great, though. Nice servers, very eager to refill a glass or clear the table, and the food came out fairly quick. Done and dusted. Love it.

Note to kitchen: try to add some umami or fermented notes in the cacio e pepe to mimic cheese. A lot of places have a killer vegan cream sauce, but none have captured the special-ness (yes, I know that‚Äôs not a real word!) of cacio e pepe. There‚Äôs a lot of decent vegan cheeses out‚Ä¶it may yield a better result! If you crack the code I‚Äôll gladly come back to try it!! üòä

reviews.author: Jamila ‚ÄúJAM‚Äù Holman
reviews.text: The pepperoni pizza was delicious even the next day after being reheated.  However it is a bit pricey. Almost $30 for 6 schmedium slices. I savored it and ate 3 slices for dinner and the rest for lunch the next day. However I could have devoured all 6 slices in one sitting. If you're willing to splurge check them out.

reviews.author: Adam Rosenberg
reviews.text: From the lay-out of its website to the layout of its Lexington Ave. restaurant interior, Le Botaniste creates warm and inviting digital and real-life environments that reflect its emphasis on interconnected sustainability. On the website the company is open and transparent, from the philosophic values of its founders to the caloric count of its dishes. And when you walk into the restaurant, the space invites you in down a wide set of rounded stairs onto a black & white patterned floor with warm wooden cabinets and panels rising from it and boasting detailed carvings and scrollwork. Large, colorful pots sit on warmers next to tins of fresh fixings for grain bowls and salads, and the serving staff is extremely friendly and enthusiastic. My wife and I appreciated that we didn‚Äôt need to ask what was strictly plant based and what was gluten-free, since everything is! It was easy to place our order and the food was served quickly. The dining area is relaxing and inviting; my wife and I sat in the back section bound by white, brick walls and potted plants, and lit by a ceiling of skylights. Given all the positives mentioned above, I thought the food could have been better. The squash soup and the tomato sauce in the Spicy Chili Sin Carne each tasted like it came from a jar and, although it can be subjective, I felt the chili wasn‚Äôt at all spicy. The ingredients were fresh, but they just didn‚Äôt come together in a cohesive, flavorful way. I thought the same of the veggie balls, which lacked a definitive flavor. The chocolate pecan cookie was a little too sweet for me, and the omega 3 brownie a little too dry, although I did like the taste. Once Le Botaniste dials in its dish recipes, it will be firing on all cylinders!

reviews.author: Al Bunshaft
reviews.text:
We stopped in after a nearby evening event. They were only 30 minutes from closing, but they had no shortage of all of the menu items.

We chose the botanical therapy, 3 half-portion bowls to share. The bowls were prepared to order and each one was packed with flavor. Sometimes vegetarian meals are served with too much pasta or rice. This was not the case. The bowls were full of vegetables and sauces. Very tasty!

The decor looks like an old apothecary or pharmacy. Simple, clean, and welcoming. The staff were all friendly and helpful.

As vegetarians, this type of restaurant is a great addition to the New York food scene. Wish there were more of them and more similar choices of places to eat.

reviews.author: Diana S√°nchez
reviews.text: La Botaniste offers delicious, well-prepared food in a beautifully decorated space. Even as someone who isn‚Äôt vegan, I really enjoyed the flavors. While the atmosphere and food were great, the staff could have been a bit more welcoming. Overall, a tasty and visually pleasing spot.

reviews.author: Rylan Gordon
reviews.text:
If you‚Äôre looking for a meal that‚Äôs entirely plant-based, Le Botaniste is a great choice. The restaurant was thoughtfully designed, creating a calm and welcoming space that‚Äôs perfect for dining solo, with friends, or even catching up on work with your laptop.

The staff were warm and friendly, and the food presentation was beautiful. I ordered the Pasta Bolo and Tibetan Mama bowls‚Äîboth were excellent. The Tibetan Mama, in particular, was full with flavor and very filling.

Though I‚Äôm not vegetarian, I enjoyed the meal and appreciated the organic ingredients. There‚Äôs plenty of comfortable seating, and the peaceful interior makes it easy to relax and linger. Highly recommend whether you‚Äôre plant-based or just looking for a clean meal!

reviews.author: perle75nyc
reviews.text: I‚Äôm not a vegan, nor am I particularly interested in vegan food, but I ended up at this restaurant because someone in my group is. Since I generally love vegetables and eat them a lot, I was actually looking forward to trying some delicious vegan dishes. Unfortunately, I was quite disappointed. While the interior and presentation were impressive, the food itself was very dry or bland. The table, dishes, and silverware were noticeably dirty, it didn‚Äôt feel like the staff really cared about the customers. It was disappointing that, despite using a variety of ingredients, there seemed to be no real attention paid to the flavor.

reviews.author: Adriana De Pitkin
reviews.text: We‚Äôve visited this restaurant multiple times and we love it! It‚Äôs one of the best dim sum restaurants in New York City. Our favorites are the Roast Pork Bun, Scallion Pancakes, Spring Rolls, Shrimp and Bacon Rolls. While it can get busy with a long waiting line, the food is served incredibly quickly. Love the old diner-style ambiance and decor. There‚Äôs plenty of both indoor and outdoor seating. The staff is always friendly and welcoming. I highly recommend dining here!

reviews.author: Nhi Hoang
reviews.text:
All of these food and it was $23/person (tip included!!)

We got there early so there was no waiting at all. Highly recommend the Sui Mai, House Special Roast Pork Bun, Shrimp & Snow Pea Leaf!! Great comfort food and dont forget to get some tea!

Will definitely come back for good casual food:)

reviews.author: Natalie Krause
reviews.text: Great vibes and yummy dim sum! My favorite were the soup dumplings and shrimp dumplings. Excellent value for the price, just make sure you have cash :) Beautiful interior and they served us very quickly.

reviews.author: Bethany Cardona
reviews.text: this place is great. I do have to say the wait to get in is not ideal and I think you can get great dim sum at many places in Chinatown. maybe even better than here. the egg rolls are very interesting a soft creamy center wrapped in thin egg and tossed in batter and fried. I loved them but not for everyone. also loved the shrimp and onion shu mai. pan fried dumplings were great as well.

reviews.author: Konrad Strumidlo
reviews.text: Food at this establishment is phenomenal. I'm addicted to those fried sesame balls...literally. This restaurant gets packed out on the weekends due to high foot traffic and sometimes language barrier can be an issue, but the food makes up for that. Must try.

reviews.author: Des KF
reviews.text:
I got the chance to try this restaurant for lunch. When I arrived I found parking on the street nearby. I walked into a small cozy restaurant. This restaurant is on their last days which is sad so make sure you get there so you can get some good eats! I had:

BBQ Fried Chicken Sandwich
4 Piece Mexy Q Wings Chipotle Mayo Dipping Sauce
4 Piece Vietnamese Chile Mango Jalape√±o Ranch Dipping Sauce
Panko Crusted Brownie with compote Berry

I loved the food and the Mexy Q Wings were my favorite! Get to this restaurant before they close their doors in the coming weeks!

reviews.author: leothedragon inocente
reviews.text: Natalie Clark was an amazing kick ass server for us! Kicking ass taking care of tables and checking in on my fiance and me and all of my shenanigans lol. Great great great personality and great great customer service!! Definitely will come back as long as we can either have or at least see her here!!!

reviews.author: Farrah Faye Vasquez
reviews.text: Found this place on Eater and this place did not disappoint. I‚Äôve been craving traditional buffalo wings (original confession) and it was amazinggggggggg!!! I love that you can customize the crispiness. Deepak also went out of his way to make sure the sauces were pasteurized since I‚Äôm pregnant and I thought that was really thoughtful. Check this place out! I will definitely come back!!

reviews.author: Matthew Blewitt
reviews.text: Small little spot but definitely worth it.  Not a lot of seating if you are looking to eat there but I did take out and it was so good.  I got the Tandoori wing lunch special which was really good.  Tandoori is a dry rub that had a little heat but wasn't overpowering at all and thay it coming from someone who cannot handle heat.  Definitely get your fries dusted.  I went with the lemon pepper and it was delicious.  The star of the show was definitely the  chicken birria quesadilla.  IT WAS AMAZING! You cannot come here and skip this it really is thag good.  This place packs a lot of flavor and the price is very fair here.  Definitely will be back

reviews.author: Insiya Pardiwala
reviews.text:
We've been ordering in from this place frequently, but I was curious to experience the ambiance and savor a fresh, hot sandwich in-house. Regrettably, it's not a dine-in establishment, but the food is simply extraordinary. The wings are a standout, with flavors like garlic parm, chili mango, and black pepper teriyaki that were all exceptionally delicious. Alongside the wings, we indulged in two sandwiches; the BBQ fried chicken sandwich was a succulent and crispy delight.
If you are in the neighborhood definitely try their food. You will not regret it.

reviews.author: Judy J
reviews.text:
I‚Äôm giving Dirt Candy in New York a full five stars, and honestly, it deserves every bit of that rating. The food here is exceptional ‚Äî creative, flavorful, and executed with real precision. Every dish feels unique, thoughtful, and beautifully balanced. The atmosphere is relaxed but polished, making it an easy place to enjoy a long, satisfying meal without feeling rushed or overwhelmed.

One thing I strongly recommend is choosing the wine pairing. Each course comes with a different wine selected specifically to match the flavors of the dish, and they absolutely nail it. The pairings elevate the food instead of overpowering it. You can tell the team put real effort into curating drinks that enhance the entire dining experience. If you‚Äôre coming here, don‚Äôt skip that option ‚Äî it‚Äôs worth it.

The service was outstanding. The staff were attentive, warm, and genuinely enthusiastic about what they were serving. Dirt Candy is a no-tip restaurant, which I respect, but my server took such good care of me that I felt compelled to insist on giving her something extra. It took a bit of convincing, but she eventually accepted it with a big smile, and I could tell it truly made her day. That level of kindness and professionalism deserves recognition.

Dirt Candy isn‚Äôt just a place to eat ‚Äî it‚Äôs a place to appreciate food. If you‚Äôre looking for an excellent dining experience in New York, this spot should be at the top of your list.

reviews.author: Carter Moyer
reviews.text: I‚Äôve been here three times (Winter and Summer previously), and this season‚Äôs Fall tasting menu is the best yet. Truly phenomenal, abounding with creative flavor combinations and textures, and genuinely elevating the vegetables that serve as the base. The cauliflower dessert is one of the best desserts I‚Äôve ever had, and the candied beets and curry, the onion tart, and mushroom dish were standout as well. The kitchen always does an amazing job with the surprise dishes too, from radish carpaccio to sesame dumplings. Highly recommend the desert sunrise as an NA cocktail, and try to get a seat at the chef‚Äôs counter. Also love a restaurant that pays its workers a living wage and includes gratuity. Please go!

reviews.author: Aniket Fegade
reviews.text: Amazing food all around, would 10/10 recommend going for a milestone celebration like anniversary or a birthday dinner. Definitely opt in for their wine pairing option, you won‚Äôt regret it. They not only handpick their wines but also pair those superbly with their food. My favorites dishes were hands down their dessert - which was an avocado dallop of ice cream with an egg cream and tortilla chips followed by their thai lasagna and then their onion tart, in that order. I‚Äôm so glad I chose this place for my first Michelin Star restaurant experience!

reviews.author: Daryl Allen
reviews.text: I posted a video review on YouTube (search for Sodafry and Dirt Candy), but this was an awesome experience. I'm not a vegetarian, but the menu is so creative and delicious. I never felt like I was missing meat. I took my teenagers with me and with a little preparation they had a great time. A highlight for me was the green bean pasta dish on the summer menu and the carrot tamal.

reviews.author: Brad Hover
reviews.text:
We have been to Dirt Candy four times, and every visit has been nothing less than outstanding. The fully vegetarian tasting menu is incredibly creative, beautifully presented, and always packed with flavor. It‚Äôs a place where both vegetarians and meat eaters can enjoy an inventive, satisfying meal.

The pacing of the courses is perfect, with each dish building on the last without ever feeling rushed. The staff is warm, attentive, and knowledgeable, which makes the whole experience fun and memorable. Dirt Candy continues to surprise us with thoughtful dishes and unexpected flavor combinations, and it remains one of the best dining experiences in New York.

Highly recommended for anyone looking for a unique and unforgettable night out.

reviews.author: Susan Seto
reviews.text: Little Owl was established in 2006. I have had this restaurant in my radar for many years but it took me 19 years to finally dine here. I wish I discovered this gem of a restaurant sooner. The vibe is of a comfy cozy neighborhood restaurant. We enjoyed the French onion soup, meatball sliders and the Bibb and Beets salad. The salad was absolutely delicious and worth coming back for that dish alone. I enjoyed my non-alcoholic drink but found the desserts a tad too sweet for my taste. The service was excellent. Jorge was especially hospitable and made us feel welcomed. I will be back soon.

reviews.author: Hannah Clark
reviews.text: I had an incredible experience at Little Owl. Suggested to me by a friend‚Äòs mother. It did not disappoint. If you‚Äôre going, definitely get the halibut. A very unique yet simple way of cooking the fish. The story goes that it used to be grilled until the grill went out in the first week and they‚Äôve decided to broil ever since. They really go over and above to make sure you‚Äôre comfortable as well. It was very nice to feel well taken care of.

reviews.author: M M
reviews.text: Little Owl ‚Äî tucked right under the iconic "Friends" apartment building ‚Äî is a must-stop in the West Village. Cozy, welcoming, and absolutely delicious. The meatball is non-negotiable: tender, perfectly seasoned, and sauced just right. Service is friendly, the vibe is intimate, and every plate feels thoughtfully made. Come hungry, order the meatball first, and grab a quick photo outside afterward. Perfect NYC spot!

reviews.author: Cosmin BƒÉdoiu
reviews.text: We honestly came just to have a few pictures of the location and we ended up having brunch. Probably one of the best meals we had in New York so far! Really nice! Also, staff was helpful, smiling and respectful. Congrats!

reviews.author: Aida Akhmetova Demir
reviews.text: Didn‚Äôt get to eat here since it was closed, but as a Friends fan, this spot is a must-see! The Little Owl sits right under the famous apartment building, and it‚Äôs such a surreal moment standing there in person after seeing it on screen so many times. Definitely worth a stop if you‚Äôre in the West Village, even just for the photo.

reviews.author: LM H. (BigRedd)
reviews.text: This is my most favorite restaurant ever!! I have been going here for about 30+ years. My whole family loves this place. The owner Peter and his staff are the best. You always feel seen.

reviews.author: Nat T.
reviews.text: Had high expectation for this place but was disappointed. Despite restaurant half full, service was not attentive with server forgetting request or walking away as soon as they ask what we wanted to order. Food was just ok and not justify especially when you look at the price. Ambiance was ok and the restaurant is a mix of locals and tourists. Would not come back again - lots of better other option nearby.

reviews.author: SANDY Sanchez
reviews.text: Well we weren't exactly dressed for it , so we sat outside. Inside look a bit  like u should be dressed right. . I ordered the short rib with mash potatoes. Omg was it good. It was sooooo good.  The portion was big enough.Not cheap.    Came here with my uncle , mom , aunt. They eat like they on a diet . Not me . I loved my food. Would def eat here again  next time.   Price is not low but not too high.  Parking is  street  parking. . .  Ladies bring a sweater inside  the A. C was great. Felt it as I went to bathroom.  All the waiters were all very nice.     . Thank u all u made dinner very very nice.  I didn't get a picture of my food. But I did get these 2 pictures.  A small video of this beautiful  fire place. .I loved it. Not sure if it was real.

reviews.author: Christopher Fiscus
reviews.text: Excellent Italian restaurant with wonderful service and memorable dishes like the chicken parm and shrimp and spinach over pasta. Espresso and tiramisu closed it out nicely.

reviews.author: Indio Comido
reviews.text:
For being an italian place at that zone, i was expecting so much more‚Ä¶
Service was great but we where really dissapointed on the food.
We even found a fetuccine in a spaguetti plate
I mean, i guess everything was well cooked, but the lack of flavor even from the calammari starter was kinda dissapointing
Bread was nice tho!

reviews.author: Ryan Leong
reviews.text: Great experience. Came here on Saturday of Halloween weekend. Our server was Brianna and she was waiting all the tables by herself as well as taking duties as the bartender. She was friendly, knowledgeable and very flexible. We came about 15 mins before happy hour. We got our first round and tried to squeeze in a second round she told us not to rush and she‚Äôd hold the happy hour prices for us. She brought the drinks out for happy hour price about 15 minutes after happy hour ended. As working in a restaurant before I can understand if you‚Äôre the only person it can be a daunting task, but our server held her composure and smiled and kept up great service to every table. She definitely deserves a generous tip we left her and hopefully everyone has been tipping her the same as we did. I split a cheese pizza with my girlfriend and cousin. This pizza was hot, crispy, and tasteful. Man. Perfect amount of cheese and perfectly cooked. A lot of variety on the menu but we didn‚Äôt want to eat too much and settled with the pizza. Didn‚Äôt get much, so I can‚Äôt cover much in this review but the happy hour drinks, pizza and service were all worthy of 5 stars!

reviews.author: Carly V
reviews.text: I like the place, in these summer days I really enjoy take dinner outdoors in the little area outside, the service is good and fast, the prices are reasonable and you have a few options if you are vegetarian. The bread portion at the beginning of the meal was really fresh and good and the food too.

reviews.author: Zenobia Godschalk
reviews.text: Was really good, one misplaced order but corrected quickly.  Pizza had delicious,fluffy crust and calamari was lightly crispy. I recommend this place.

reviews.author: Merve Karadag
reviews.text: I‚Äôve been eating from this place for years by now and I‚Äôve never had any issue. Always on time, always delicious! You can dine-in or order to go. Especially now in this pandemic, they have an outside dine-in option which is so pretty with the little lights hanging from the tent. They make one of the best pizzas in Manhattan. Must try!!!

reviews.author: D. Greham Davis
reviews.text: Amazing food. Excellent service. The Shrimp Scampi was perfect. My wife and I will definitely come back again.

reviews.author: Oi Lin ‚ÄúChinagirl568‚Äù
reviews.text:
10/8/25

We were in the neighborhood for an appointment and decided to stop for lunch.

BBQ Ribs are delicious, most Chinese restaurant makes them but are usually tough but these were tender and so flavorful.  I wish they were near home hehehe.

Peking Duck, while it was super crispy outside and tender inside it was not seasoned.  Without the hoisin sauce it would have been a waste of money...

Bok Choy with Garlic is delicious, I wish I could make it this good hehehe.

If we are ever in the area we would definitely go back.

Lots of pig related decorations, cute! Hehehe

reviews.author: Paul Brothe
reviews.text:
With a name like Pig Heaven, I would not expect, as a vegetarian, to give this restaurant a good review. However, they have delicious vegetarian options. The waiter made a record of vegetables with pancakes. It was excellent.

The background music was funny. Piano versions of Christmas carols - in August - without words.

I would go back. It was a great experience

reviews.author: Thomas Meyers
reviews.text: We got the ribs, pork soup dumplings, and pork chow fun. The dumplings were AMAZING, ribs were great too. Chow fun was good, though nothing particularly spectacular. Place was clean and staff was friendly. Great chinese restaurant!

reviews.author: Jacob Berrigan
reviews.text: I LOVE YOU PIG HEAVEN. When I think of this place tears well in my eyes and dro0l rolls down my neck. This place is GOOD. You cannot miss the lovely duck and of course the chongqing dry hot chicken. WOW, I wish that they would open a PIG HEAVEN inside my house so I could eat there EVERYDAY.

reviews.author: christine rona
reviews.text: I just moved down the street and wanted to try this place for lunch.I ordered take out pork lo mein .  But there weren‚Äôt any vegetables in the lo mein. It was all noodle. I was disappointed‚Ä¶I don‚Äôt think I will be going back there again.

reviews.author: Robin Seay
reviews.text: Food was mediocre at best. Everything on the menu is significantly overpriced for the quality of what you get, especially when we didn't finish 1/3 of our food because there ended up being a mouse running around our table. The star of our visit was our amazing server Gio! He was so friendly, served with a huge, warm smile, and was hustling the whole time. 10/10 recommend Gio!

reviews.author: Mookie
reviews.text: Booking a reservation for this store was nothing short of a miracle. When we arrived, they had to make accommodations for the additional seating of two kids plus 6 adults. Please if you get the opportunity to book in advance do so. They get packed on a Sunday. Our waiter , Gio was exceptional. He knew the best recommendations for all of our dishes. He made sure the kids got there food first as they were the first to get antsy. All in all , with gigantic proportions we managed to take most of the food home. It was a birthday for my nephew and he stated "This is the best restaurant ever!" Success. In a way that's all we needed to hear. Adorable decor for the entire family.

reviews.author: Victoria C
reviews.text:
This was very underwhelming and not worth $18 dollars, didn't even taste good. If I knew the hot chocolate would come out I wouldn't get it. But gratefully the management was super understanding and allowed us to take it off as we only had one sip of it.

The server was extremely kind and professional I have no complaints regarding my service with him.

The kids portion ice cream was perfect .

I enjoyed the grandmas chicken sandwich was amazing I added cheese to mine.

My kids enjoyed the grown up Mac and cheese the hostess explained the kids Mac cheese and regular menu Mac and cheese are different. So we got that one.

We had a really good experience here and would definitely come back one of the main reasons I would come back was managements understanding and the server being kind.

reviews.author: Hong Lee
reviews.text:
I booked a table at the Serendipity 3 Upper East Side restaurant for dinner on my wife's actual 60th birthday this evening as we really enjoyed our last visit there 10 years ago for her 50th birthday.
Although we arrived 20 minutes earlier than our 5:15pm slot that I'd booked online, we were shown to a table within a few minutes. There's very little space between tables in the very small & cramped restaurant, so don't expect any privacy as we could clearly hear and follow the conversations of the diners on both the tables either side of us.
Our super friendly server Randy asked if we were at the restaurant for any special occasion and my wife told him it was her 60th birthday without realising I'd already put all this in the 'what's the occassion?' section of their online booking form. He also asked if we had any allergies, which again I had already said we had none in the 'Any allergies or restrictions?' section of their online booking form. So clearly the servers don't see or don't bother to read the information provided online by their customers, rendering it a complete waste of our time!!!
The birthday girl had the American cheeseburger with fries, which was OK. I had the Grandma Holt's fried chicken sandwich with a pot of tea. The fried chicken was a bit dry, the bun was a bit stale and I found the fries to be a bit too salty. My wife was really looking forward to the superb peanut butter cheesecake dessert we enjoyed sooo much on our last visit. However, it was no longer on the menu so she had to settle for the Ultimate Creme Cheesecake, which came with side servings of hot fudge & strawberry sauce.
Our fabulous server Randy put a candle on the top of my wife's cheesecake, lit it and encouraged everyone in the restaurant to sing happy birthday, which made her feel special. Whilst we were dining in the restaurant there were 4 other people celebrating their birthdays as well.
There's a photographer at the restaurant now, who went around every table taking photographs of customers and returning later trying to sell commemorative prints, which I found a bit tacky and touristy - not something I'd expect at a high end restaurant.
The decor in the restaurant looked very tired and we certainly didn't enjoy our meal there this time, compared to our exceptional experience 10 years ago. I feel sadly it's more of a tourist trap now, feeding off the embers of its former glory days, which have long gone. We didn't have any alcoholic drinks with our meal and I left feeling the $100 we spent there could have been better spent in one of the hundreds of exceptional restaurants in NYC for the special occasion of my wife's 60th birthday.

reviews.author: Samantha Cyr
reviews.text: We loved Serendipity!!! I made a reservation online about a week in advance, thank God I did. It was so busy! My husband and I and our 2 girls (ages 6 & 9) loved all our food and desserts! My husband got a bacon cheese hot dog and I got the truffle burger. Both amazing. We all had more fries than we could eat. We also got the frozen hot chocolate to share, and each daughter got 1 scoop of ice cream with a topping, which was also more than they could eat. Despite it being packed and needing a reservation, our food came out super quickly. I was really impressed by that. And our waiter, Leo, was SO friendly, which made the overall vibe amazing. We hope to be back next time we visit the city!!

reviews.author: Lyss Wolfe
reviews.text:
My boyfriend and I had the best experience ever here at Beetle House. The atmosphere, performances, and food were perfect. I had the Cheshire Mac & cheese, the Sweeney Todd steak, the pumpkin cheesecake and two pumpkin espresso martinis ALL DELICIOUS!

Beetlejuice himself had us giggling and even Bob was there! Our waitress Claire was so sweet!

If you‚Äôre looking for a fun place to go to eat and have a good time‚Ä¶obviously go here! We can‚Äôt wait to come back again next time we‚Äôre in the city! :) First time best time!

reviews.author: Michelle Alvarez
reviews.text:
If you are a big fan of Tim Burton, you‚Äôll be pleasantly surprised by the atmosphere and performances. We had Beetlejuice, Bob and Edward Scissorhands as our performers for the night. Beetlejuice was incredible! All performers had charm, wit and were highly entertaining.

The service was great! We were greeted at the door and were asked to wait about 15 mins for a table (we didn‚Äôt get to reserve; and we went after 8pm). We were entertained by Beetlejuice outside and he gave us great laughs. We only waited about 5 mins til a table was free.
Our drink of choice was the Big Fish bowl, delicious! We had the Mac n cheese and lalaurie fries which both delicious! We both got the Sweeney Todd filet mignon and it was great. For dessert we got the death by chocolate and Emily‚Äôs wedding cake. Portions are medium to small but filling.

It‚Äôs a bit pricey but gratuity is included and the performers put on a great show. They love taking pictures with you as well.

We had a blast! Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Rafael Rosa
reviews.text: This was an amazing experience. I totally recommend it. The service was amazing. The food, oh the food, im a picky eater, I liked everything I got. The drinks are delicious as well. The staff are on point. The performers stay in character and are so fun. Just over all worth it.

reviews.author: Kimberly Donaldson
reviews.text: This is my second trip to beetle house, and I am so excited that I was able to come back. It is a unique, fantastic, creative place and a tribute to New York and something that everyone should experience at least once. It is so hard to run a successful restaurant in New York City, especially through Covid, so it is speaks a lot as to what kind of place this is. If you were a beetle fan or even if you were not, this is a place you must visit in the village. The food is phenomenal, especially the steak and the drinks are even better. Small children would enjoy it if they‚Äôve watched Beetlejuice and like the characters. So highly recommend. For NYC, the reasonable Price Fix menu is a treat.

reviews.author: Michael Knippenberg
reviews.text: Dark and loud but plenty of fun and the food was delicious. You won't go away hungry.  The risotto app and burger were really good.  No one is my family had a bad meal and we tried most of the menu.  The show and ambiance are on point.  Beetlejuice/Halloween fans should not miss this place.

reviews.author: Liv Lively
reviews.text: Just popped in there for a bite before going home. I've been here before and thought to revisit it. The night staff was wonderful and sweet. Waitress was very kind and positive and attentative, the chefs were amazing and the food was delicious.

reviews.author: Vinh Nguyen
reviews.text:
This is such a hard review to leave because we are also restauranteurs.

My wife and I wanted some nice hearty salads for lunch so we looked up a few places. We ordered two salads (the mango salad and the arugula, mango, duck walnut, goat cheese salad‚Äînever had there been a more literal name for a salad which is fine‚Äîjust hard to order on the phone).

We were told these two salads were going to be 35 minutes. Even during a busy rush (which would seem strange at 2:05), two salads shouldn‚Äôt take 35 minutes.

What makes it worse is that the Arugala Duck Salad (for short) is described as tradition ‚ÄúNew Orleans‚Äù style salad. We lived in New Orleans for 4 years and ate all over the city. It‚Äôs a culinary mecca. This is not close to anything traditional to New Orleans.

The salad was quite small for a $21 salad. Two salads totaled $56 which we don‚Äôt mind paying based on the food description. I‚Äôm in the food and beverage industry so I know the cost of goods. This was literally two handfuls of Arugal, some cubed mangos, a blob of coated goat cheese, and waaaay overcooked tiny slivers of duck breast. I understand the rising cost of business in this industry, but I could never to this to my patrons.

The duck was embarrassingly bad and the beef on my wife‚Äôs salad was so overcooked, it was almost inedible. The duck breast slivers were not only small and overcooked but rubbery. That‚Äôs strange because the fat wasn‚Äôt rendered properly so the skin was gelatinous and chewy so it being overcook was just a lack of care or  lack of training for the cook who cooked the duck breast. The packaging was so half hearted for $56 for two salads.

This was rough. I‚Äôd be willing to adjust my review with a response from the owners. But, as far as first impressions go, we won‚Äôt order again based off this experience.

So unfortunate in flavor and overpriced for the result.

reviews.author: Fiona H
reviews.text: Definitely want to eat here again soon! Lots of options for both drinks and food. I got the Traditional Macaroni & Cheese which was delicious once it cooled down. The Tropical Treasure cocktail was so gorgeous and I loved the combination of fruit juices. The ladies bathroom was clean and had one normal sized stall and one handicap stall that also had a baby changing station on the wall.

reviews.author: Lex Z
reviews.text: Excellent dinner spot! This place has something everyone can enjoy. Enormous portions. Super friendly staff. The bread was fresh and fluffy. The cocktails were perfect. The tomato florantine soup was incredible. The meals were savory and filling. You'll definitely have leftovers. My husband and I love coming here for a little date night.

reviews.author: Paul Gimson
reviews.text: Excellent lunch. Food was great, service perfect. I have always wanted to eat here. It was worth the wait.

name: Valentines Pizza & Deli
address: 18, West Genesee Street, Village of Skaneateles, NY, 13152

reviews.author: Paul Harris
reviews.text: I live a 1 hour drive south and frequently drive up for awesome pizza by the slice, and enjoy them at the waterfront park across the street.

reviews.author: V M
reviews.text: Coworkers and I were just raving about this place! Great pizzeria located right near the swimming area on the lake. Fast, friendly service. Staff was helpful and answered all my questions. Amazing slices, at incredible prices. I had the spicy buffalo wing and the garlic, both were delicious! Would definitely go back next time we‚Äôre in Skaneateles!

reviews.author: Ryan Sanderson
reviews.text: Pizza was overall really great and well priced. Many different types of "by the slice" were ready to eat. I would give their cheese pizza a 3 star, as the sauce or cheese needs a kick but the 3 Cheese Chipotle Chicken pizza was a 4.5 star, as the crust and toppings were in perfect harmony. This place is worth a visit if you love pizza. The staff was very friendly too.

reviews.author: Mack Suleiman
reviews.text: Stopped by this place after walking through Skaneateles and it was an excellent decision! The service is great, I was helped almost immediately, even though it was lunch time and very busy in the place. I ordered the daily special (it was a wrap with corned beef, Russian sauce, lettuce, tomato, banana peppers and Swiss cheese). It blew me away! For under $9, I got a wrap packed with meat and veggies and cheese! I can confidently say that it‚Äôs one of the best sandwiches I have ever had! Everything just works together so well! I would strongly suggest this place for anyone looking for a hearty meal on the cheap!

reviews.author: Ames ‚ÄúTheGoogleReviewer‚Äù PA
reviews.text: Food was excellent.  Chicken salad 1/2 sandwich and a lamb gyro.  Place was super busy,  mostly for takeout.  Staff were fine but not very friendly. Would definitely go again but would take the food and eat elsewhere for some ambiance.

reviews.author: Amy Kang
reviews.text:
We‚Äôve been wanting to try this place and finally did! Pasta was tasty and seafood were cooked perfect.
There were some tout groups at the restaurant.

reviews.author: Svetlana J. Cemin
reviews.text: On a busy Bleecker Street, in the heart of West Village, I walked into this typical Italian trattoria which serves exelent seafood, pasta and fresh salads. No reservations were needed.

reviews.author: Tabitha Steemson
reviews.text: This was such a wonderful experience - feels like a proper New York institution. The staff were amazing. I made my own error of ordering my steak too well done (totally my fault) and when I ordered an additional chicken they took the steak away and didn‚Äôt put it on the bill, even though I never complained about it. It was so kind! I have a difficult allergy and they were so respectful and accommodating. When the waiter changed and so something came which I couldn‚Äôt have they took it back, no questions asked. Even without that it would have been reasonable, but it‚Äôs a rare gem of a lovely vibe, wonderful service, takes walk ins (we came at about 7 on a Saturday and there was space) and good value in a prime spot. What a gem.

reviews.author: chroma mcd
reviews.text: Lovely and hearty Italian fare‚Äîespecially their pasta and seafood dishes. The lobster ravioli stands out with a rich, flavorful sauce, and the seafood risotto is tomato-based, brimming with fresh shrimp, calamari, and scallops  Ôøº Ôøº. The mussels marinara delivers bold, authentic flavors‚Äîjust enough sauce to dip bread without overpowering  Ôøº. Portions are generous and comforting, true to classic Northern Italian style

reviews.author: Nicholas Rositano
reviews.text: Top tier traditional leaning Italian restaurant with a cozy atmosphere and a good selection of non-typically found  seafood. All while being on the low end of NYC restaurant prices.

reviews.author: Michael
reviews.text:
Relaxed atmosphere of a dive bar with killer food.

First note: they have the worst Diet Coke I have ever had in my entire life. Completely flat and tastes like it came out of a dirty gun.

HOWEVER every time I come here I get the chicken platter, Mac and cheese, and a tuna melt. The chicken is succulent with a beautiful breading and is piping hot every time. It is served with a sweet honey butter that goes beautifully with the biscuits as well. The biscuits are good but not mind blowing, they are small and served 3 per order. The Mac and cheese can be dry depending on the batch but this most recent visit was perfectly creamy but still firm enough to slice. It is a baked style. The tuna melt is one of my favorites in the city. It has a massive amount of tuna inside but feels lighter than others I have had. It almost takes like the tuna is whipped. I can‚Äôt figure out what they do to the tuna but it‚Äôs great. The best part about this place is that the kitchen is open late. We actually came this time because the restaurant we were trying to go to had closed their kitchen early. It‚Äôs really great having this option in the area.

reviews.author: Johnny Novo
reviews.text:
I got dinner here last night with my favorite food creator and big bro, Rob Martinez. I'd never been to the Commodore, but when he suggested it, I accepted without a blink. A Rob recommendation is literal pixie dust.

I entered 8 minutes before our scheduled time because my pops always told me "if you're on time, you're late." I entered and saw a 6'2 burly figure with a worn in nike hat and legendary beard sipping on a Negroni, and realized Rob beat me here. Damn... Negroni on a Monday is so beast though.

We got a little booth in the corner, and I decided to hop on the Negroni train. I normally don't drink during the week, but sometimes the Negroni gods just force your hand. My nickname in college was actually "Post Negrone."

Rob informed me that the hot chicken sandwich ($19) was the move, which checked out with my research from before dinner.

I never really stop and smell the roses, as comfort is the enemy of progress, but sitting in this dimly lit dive bar sipping negronis with one of the best food creators on the internet, and someone I really look up to, forced me to have a moment of appreciation.

Between bites of one of the best crispy chicken sandwiches I have ever had in my life, we were talking about writing, editing, our favorite restaurants, youtube thumbnails, algorithms, favorite authors, upcoming shoot schedules, and lofty long term goals that really had me pinching myself. Like damn I'm really doing this, you know? I felt like I was living someone else's life, not mine. I didn't even really know this was possible.

We deleted these chicken sandwiches, chips and queso, and 2 rounds of negronis as the table next to us turned 2 different times. What a night, provided by an iconic ambiance, sensational chicken sandwiches, and my old friend, the negroni.

IG @johnny.novo
Tiktok @jnov__
Substack @johnnynovo

reviews.author: Wen Jin Guo
reviews.text:
Came here in the afternoon just as the kitchen was closing. Debated for a bit and ultimately decided to stay because I‚Äôll not be denied of my chicken sandwich lol.

Started off with the Orange Julio, as if it‚Äôs the grownup Orange Julius. Two sips in and immediate brain freeze. The vibe is a bit chaotic but the bartenders did a great job making sure everyone is well-hydrated with drinks. Shortly before 5pm, my bartender gave me the food menu as if she could read my mind.

I got the mild breast sandwich and a small side of fries. The sandwich came out piping hot and prolly the juiciest chicken breast I‚Äôve ever eaten. Could it be a wet brine process..? However, the chicken was a tad too salty for my taste. Still, I inhaled the sandwich. The fries were okay..? Nothing special but an adequate companion to my sandwich.

All in all, I was a very happy camper. I love the Commodore and I‚Äôll be back for sure!

reviews.author: Osc√°r OA
reviews.text: I just don‚Äôt understand. Like how or why is it possible that this place has the most incredible chicken sandwich Ive ever tried in my life. Cheese sauce is  heaven‚Äôs magma . I started at the fish tank during all my sandwich consumption. Very interesting and fantastic experience. I hope that whoever is reading this review enjoys this place as much as i did.

reviews.author: Mike mandot
reviews.text: The fried chicken and a biscuit were fantastic! Definitely planning on coming back in for that! Atmosphere was pretty solid, it got really busy in the couple of hours we were there. A little frat boy/ broh'y.

reviews.author: Baba Gurjeet Bedi
reviews.text:
Slooooow. Waited 15+ minutes before anyone even showed up at an empty bar around 5pm the day before Thanksgiving.
And the guy would not take the order as he was 'not the bar tender'. Waited another 10+ mins for him.
Ordered a draft, was rung up for a $9+ draft. Then there was an issue with the keg. So was given a bottle ($6+) as a substitute of the same beer - see the picture of the empty bar and the bottle. But still charged for the draft (I have the receipt).
The attitude of the servers leaves much to.be desired. TGIF is going down the drain. No wonder they closed so many locations.
Had a beer and redeemed some points for an appetizer.  Did not argue and got out quickly after paying.
I don't think I'll ever go back.

reviews.author: Sharr Donn
reviews.text: Shut it down PLEASE! WORST FOOD IVE EVER HAD FROM TGI! ordered whisky glazed ribs and they were so hard and burnt! Mac and cheese was soup, pasta was undercooked. I was not given one of my sides either. Im so upset! $80 down the drain.

reviews.author: Nylra Arzuaga
reviews.text: Service  was üëç thank you! But I got food poisoning and it ruined my birthday üéÇ  I had upset my stomach. Not going there anymore. I don't know what happened  to one of my favorite restaurants üòï üò© üòû üò´ Also the Caesars salad was dressing drowing the lettuce. Awful üòñ Every bite was like a spoon full of dressing. Terrible, I couldn't  eat it. üò™

reviews.author: Erica Ri
reviews.text: I had the pleasure of visiting again for a 34th Birthday! We were greeted by Abdul, who was absolutely amazing! He made sure to check on us to see if we needed refills on drinks or to add on additional items such as a boneless wings order to go! We had a cake and he made sure to bring it out just in time! It was a memorable experience because we actually put all of our phones away(for once) and just engaged in meaningful conversation! All of the food was tasty and fresh! The tables and bathrooms  were extremely clean! I tried the Whiskey Glaze and Dragon Glaze sauce on the side! I will definitely be returning again for a new celebration!

reviews.author: Christopher Warren
reviews.text: The Friday‚Äôs franchise isn‚Äôt what it used to be. The pricing is misleading, and the food was overcooked. It tasted like it was cooked yesterday and warmed up today. I had a craving for their signature whiskey graze. Probably never step foot inside a Friday‚Äôs again.

reviews.author: Tina Copeland
reviews.text: The milkshake was the best part of the experience.  My wings was not cooked and I couldn't eat them. I didn't want to upset my child it was her bday so I didn't complain.  The burger fries and chicken tenders was great.  It was cold and the atmosphere got loud at times. The staff was wonderful friendly and made it a great experience.

reviews.author: Nino Cruz
reviews.text: One of the best burgers I‚Äôve ever had in NYC. Everyone needs to try this place. Our server Vaughn was great and friendly. Atmosphere was awesome. The burger I got was ‚ÄúThe Old Fashioned‚Äù. The patty was well seasoned, the bun could‚Äôve been a little bit more roasted, the horseradish sauce was not too much and the carmelized onions goes so well with the mushrooms. The fries were also just crispy and well seasoned I didn‚Äôt have to touch the salt. Overall would go back again!

reviews.author: Nicole Montana
reviews.text: The shakes are really the star of the show here the chocolate chip brownie flavor doesn‚Äôt disappoint. The Mexico City burger was tasty too with a juicy patty and pickled jalape√±os that make anything better. The Cesar salad was okay. The restaurant‚Äôs atmosphere is fun and our servers were nice, although aloof and some cleaning was definitely needed as both our table and condiments on them, were a mix of greasy and sticky. However, this could be specific to the SOHO location and not the chain as a whole. Overall, it‚Äôs worth it if you want a trendy burgers and milkshakes experience though.

reviews.author: Carmen Haigler
reviews.text:
I was recently here to celebrate my nephew‚Äôs birthday and we had a great time! The food was delicious. Vaughn and whole staff were funny, courteous and friendly!

We had the crispy chicken, pesto chicken sandwich and all American burgers & sweet potato fries, all were delicious! He also loved the Cookies & Cream supreme shake! We look forward to coming back!

reviews.author: Elizabeth O'Toole
reviews.text: Had a delicious cake shake that looked absolutely adorable. Definitely get the American burger if you are contemplating what burger to get!! It‚Äôs incredible. Had the most impeccable service from Vaughn last night. Made the night memorable and we will definitely be back :))

reviews.author: Kara S
reviews.text:
Food- Salmon was cooked to perfection with a nice crisp on top, bread pudding was soo tasty with the dulce de leche ice cream. I wish it was a little more moist, but the ice cream kinda helped that aspect. We also tried one of each of the empanadas. The kale one was the best and the caprese one threw me off because the filling was cold. It was all still very good, but room for little improvements.
Service- Appropriate length of time of time for each dish; dessert came really fast. Staff was very kind and welcoming.
Atmosphere- Nice and intimate inside with smaller tables, and something about this place is unpretentious. It's a bit rustic and inviting.

reviews.author: K.Z.
reviews.text:
Glad we tried this place. Nice lowkey vibes, great food, and the beef is from Argentina.
Empanadas were good, steak was cooked perfectly. Wonderful service, and we even got complimentary dulce de leche macarons, a very sweet touch.

Not pictured: Fifi drink, delicious and refreshing

reviews.author: Konstantinos Rizakos
reviews.text: Very cozy neighborhood Argentinian restaurant. Tasty salads, empanadas, and of course steak. We loved the entra√±a which was served with farro. Also the avocado flan was a surprise!

reviews.author: Imelda Suriato
reviews.text: Never skip this place when I go to gallery openings on Thursdays. Jorge the owner is always welcoming with his big smile. He introduced me to Torront√©s, the Argentinian grape variety, almost 20 years ago. Everyone who I brought here always find something they like, from the empanadas to the steak to the flan. West Chelsea has changed from gritty industrial warehouses where club kids used to hit the Tunnel, to a buzzy, gallery- and restaurant-filled Gen Z hub with luxury apartments.
