But Porte√±o retains its small restaurant charm, warm service, and quality food. To me, it always feels like visiting an old friend, and I always leave with a smile and a happy belly.

reviews.author: Nicholas
reviews.text:
Had dinner here last night and I‚Äôll definitely be coming back. The space is cozy, with butcher block tables and a relaxed, welcoming vibe. The staff was super friendly and attentive throughout the meal‚Äîthey even offered to move us to a bigger table after seeing how many dishes we ordered, which was a smart move.

Everything we tried was delicious, from the grilled veggies to the perfectly cooked New York strip steak. Our server recommended an Argentine Malbec that paired beautifully with the food and really rounded out the meal.

Overall, this place is a neighborhood gem‚Äîcomfortable, unfussy, and consistently great. Can‚Äôt wait to go back.

reviews.author: Kira Herbert
reviews.text: Hosted my father‚Äôs celebration of life at Storm King Lounge and Fare. The staff was easy to work with and reassuring. They answered all my questions and gave great advice. During the event, they were attentive and hard working. The food and drinks were delicious. The space was flexible to meet different guests needs. Thank you to all the staff, especially Natalie, Dave and Krista! Truly the best food, service and care for our private Saturday lunch event.

reviews.author: Alicia Dumser
reviews.text: I went here with my girlfriend for dinner and we were both very happy we did. We were quickly greeted by the very friendly and attentive staff. The restaurant was clean, spacious with a speak easy asthetic. The host and waitress couldn't have been nicer. We split the cauliflower tempura which was tasty without being overly spicy or saucy. I had the salmon for my entree which was cooked perfectly. Absolutely delicious. We tried two different cocktails and they were both so good. We will definitely be returning!

reviews.author: Heather House
reviews.text: I had no idea the restaurant had changed. Last time I was there, it was the Tressle. I absolutely LOVE the absence and decor of the restaurant and bar. Everything is electric blue and a little eclectic. The menu even has back lighting! Every menu needs this feature. The piano keys across the piano room was my favorite. Evidently, they also.habe live music on occasion. We only got drinks and apps and sat at the bar. We decided on Bang bang shrimp and Tempura Fried Cauliflower. Both were delicious... we had to get a second Cauliflower. The drinks were great and the bar tender took fabulous car of us. I will definitely be back for dinner.

reviews.author: Mike Smith
reviews.text:
We love this place! My wife and I have been here 3 times since it opened and we love the atmosphere and food. I know since 2020 staffing has been a difficult challenge to say the least! We've had 3 different servers and, for a newly opened restaurant in 2022 they were all attentive and knowledgeable... that is hard to come by for any restaurant new or old!

I must say I am a fan of anything blue and there is plenty of blue lighting, accents and d√©cor throughout but it is balanced by other textures and tones. There is a baby grand piano on the far end for the lounge/bar area. We haven't sat in the main dining room yet because the lounge is just too cool.

We've had the steak au poivre, stout braised pork chop and  prime rib entrees. For appetizers we have had the bao buns, smoked salmon that also comes with a tasty deviled egg. There is a bar/lounge menu and from that we've had the fried chicken, tuna tacos and pulled pork nachos. So, everything has been outstanding! The chef and his team are already in a grove.

When we've gone it was on the weekend and the place was pretty much full but I don't think you'd have to wait long for a seat because they have a lot of options between the bar, lounge and dining room. From what I've experienced so far the future looks bright (and blue) for Storm King Lounge and Fare.

reviews.author: Andrea Bruder
reviews.text: Everything was delicious ,atmosphere was inviting very pleased that our hometown has a new edition this location has had many incarnations over the years . Initially The Idlewild Mr. Corea‚Äôs bar and Nicky‚Äôs his son place as well as Drew‚Äôs , Painters and lastly the Trestle ‚Ä¶Super excited by the quality of the food . The staff is kind and gracious, and willing to learn, and in today‚Äôs current challenging economic climate  for the ownership to make such a large investment and commitment to our town I thank them. So please come out and support this local gem ‚Ä¶ Our meal consisted of the Tuna tartare app , Veal chop ,Chicken Cordon Bleu , Cr√®me Br√ªl√©e and Chocolate mousse cake ‚Ä¶

reviews.author: Sarah Nguyen
reviews.text: Tucked below street level, this cozy ramen spot feels like one of New York City‚Äôs hidden treasures. The space is small, with only a few tables and mostly bar seating, creating an intimate, authentic atmosphere that‚Äôs perfect for a quick pre-show meal. We went around 5 p.m. before a Broadway performance, and by the time we left an hour later, a line was already forming out the door‚Äîa clear sign of its popularity. The ramen was fantastic, with rich, flavorful broth and perfectly cooked noodles that hit all the right notes of comfort and depth. A delicious, no-frills gem that‚Äôs well worth seeking out.

reviews.author: Leisa Montgomery
reviews.text: My son and daughter-in-law took me to this hidden gem, as it is one of their favorite spots. It did not disappoint; the ramen was amazing. It is a tiny, cozy restaurant with just a few tables, but the food was so good!

reviews.author: Steph W
reviews.text:
Ambiance (4/5): This is a classic Japanese ramen shop feel‚Äîtight high top bar seating that overlooks the kitchen. There are a few tables on the side as well. It was cool seeing the solo chef prepare all the moving parts. Sadly, I did not feel like the seating was very comfortable, as the bottom part moved around on its own and there is no backing.
Service (5/5): Came in on a Friday afternoon and there was only 2 or 3 other solo patrons so I was attended to throughout my experience.
Toriburo Spicy (3/5): The noodles were a bit on the undercooked side so a little more chewy (which I like/prefer!) I like the homemade spicy paste that gave the dish another level of flavor! For the price point, I was definitely hoping that the pork charsiu piece would be a little more generous in portion size‚Äîhowever it‚Äôs really only 2 small slices. The flavor was there and a good blend of meat to fat ratio but just really to meager. The dish also does not come with any egg. I think I was hoping for a bit more flavor in the broth to wow me but it‚Äôs admittedly hard to compare paitan to tonkontsu.
Happy Hour pricing Monday to Friday 12-6:30pm during the summer looks like $3-4 discounts off beers/sake!

reviews.author: mithun suresh
reviews.text: Walkable from timesquare, delicious and quick place to grab a warm ramen and value for money. Perfect for a winter evenings. Place is really small, but the food is really good.

reviews.author: Danny Simon
reviews.text: We used to live up in Hell‚Äôs Kitchen, so this was a staple for us once we finally discovered it. Truly the best ramen in nyc, this one takes the cake! Great ambiance and quick service. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: j
reviews.text: Massive sandwiches for a reasonable price. Food was great I would definitely come back.

reviews.author: Robert Christian
reviews.text: Very unsuspecting but, some of the best Mexican food in New York City. Their Al Pastor is fantastic.

reviews.author: Emily Camacho
reviews.text: I wish I could not give a stat at all. The older lady who picks up the phone has an attitude all the time like she doesn‚Äôt want to be there anymore. I ordered food and the meat was old. The sauces they sent smelled so bad and were old. I called the lady to inform her not to give them out , out of courtesy and she had an attitude. Don‚Äôt come here to eat if you want to get food poisoning. I have been ordering here for such long time and they really have not been giving out the produce fresh like it should be. This is a violation and they should be shut down because people can get really sick from this. I currently don‚Äôt feel well eating their food, don‚Äôt bother on ordering from here. What a disappointment.

reviews.author: Katelyn Meyer
reviews.text: Hands down our favorite spot in bushwick. Seriously good authentic Mexican food. We love it, feels like we are right back in DF, Mexico City. The staff is always friendly, the food is always spot on and the al pastor tacos with their homemade avocado salsa is insanely delicious. Gracias por todo taqueria Sof√≠a. üî• üåÆ

reviews.author: Joshua Frueh
reviews.text: the birria burritos are SOOO good! the best i‚Äôve had in new york.

reviews.author: Dina R
reviews.text: My favorite Spanish tapas spot in NYC! The staff is always so attentive and polite; they truly know the menu and always recommend the best dishes. Don‚Äôt skip the bikini sandwich or the croquetas‚Ä¶ absolutely worth it every time

reviews.author: Oleg Polonsky
reviews.text: The ambiance inside of Boqueria makes you believe you are actually in Spain. We had calamari, croquettes, shrimps in garlic sauce, and Paella. All this with sangria. The chef is definitely an expert, and the staff is very friendly. Will not hesitate to visit them again!

reviews.author: CL
reviews.text: Cute little spot with amazing tapas. We got the mushroom truffle croquetas, the seafood paella and sangria which were absolutely delicious. On top of that our server Tim was super friendly as well. Definitely would go back!

reviews.author: VANESSA ZAPATA
reviews.text: Great ambiance and we sat on the patio, ordered the white sangria pitcher (amazing, tastes like juice but is indeed not juice). We got 6 things between me and my boyfriend (both eat a lot) and we were extremely full. highlights of what we got were the Gambas al Ajillo, 10/10, Patatas bravas also 10/10, great to pear with whatever meat/seafood you get. Also the Croquetas de Setas were amazing and the Montado de Bistec y Chorizo was perfection. Would recommend this place for a date night or girls night. 6 things + the pitcher was ~160 before tip so its pricey but can be made more affordable as most items are $14-$16.

reviews.author: Abril Gonzalez
reviews.text: Loved the dining experience at Boqueria! I was recently in Spain and missed the tapas atmosphere, so I was thrilled to come across this amazing restaurant while searching for authentic tapas. My friends and I ordered multiple dishes ‚Äî croquetas de setas, tortilla espa√±ola, and pimientos de padr√≥n ‚Äî and everything was absolutely amazing. Our server, Manuel, was very knowledgeable about the menu and even recommended that we try a new cheese on our charcuterie board! I‚Äôll definitely be back.

reviews.author: Vyacheslav ‚ÄúSlava‚Äù D.
reviews.text: For sure I will visit this place one more time! Charming atmosphere and big choices in menu! Our pancakes and quesadilla were delicious

reviews.author: Gavin Rogers
reviews.text:
I was there after a doctors visit and a waitress accidentally broke my cane walking by.  She tried to fix it with masking tape.  I was not worried about it but after the accident they never asked how they could help getting out or assisting with exit.  The manager avoided the situation the entire time.  I never went up to them for help or complained but their avoidance was very clear.

Had to change my mode of transportation and wait for driver at their establishment for quite sometime.

Will never return

reviews.author: Sharon M
reviews.text: The bbq chicken salad looks ordinary but it's so delicious. Had an ice coffee which was very good too. This is a quality diner, great staff there too.

reviews.author: LoMo Phillips
reviews.text:
Waited over 30 minutes for a table for 2 on a Sunday at around 1pm. It gave modern diner vibes, and it was a lil loud and crowded for my taste. It also didn‚Äôt help that we were seated close to the bathroom, so people were going back and forth by our table the whole time üòÖ
I saw they had a ‚Äúfamous‚Äù crunchy french toast, that included crushed corn flakes and slivered almonds. Thank god I ordered it with the homemade blueberry compote, because the toast was bizarrely flavorless, not even maple syrup saved it. I also thought the corn flakes and almonds would be crumbled on top, but instead it comes ‚Äúbattered‚Äù in that, creating a weird texture. I didn‚Äôt finish it, nor did I take it home.
The service was good though! Nice, fast, and attentive.

reviews.author: Maru Stern
reviews.text: The only positive about the food was the size of the portion. Soup was not good (not tasty and I could tell the chicken was super old, reheated). Pastrami tasted like anything but pastrami, it was sweet somehow and I could swear this had butter in the meat or the bread because of the consequences after, having clarified I am lactose intolerant (the server certainly did clarify as it was even specified in the check but kitchen must‚Äôve ignored it). Place is nice, the server too but certainly won‚Äôt come again.

reviews.author: Michael Pomarico
reviews.text:
We‚Äôre in Chelsea market and you need a small break in the action, especially during happy hour. This is a good stop.

We enjoyed a couple of glasses of wine in the middle of the market, which can often get very busy.

reviews.author: Manu Kashyap
reviews.text: Have visited the other locations in the past. First time here. Had quite a few wines and also some food- ham and cheese s/w and some hummus and bread. Enjoyed.

reviews.author: Zs
reviews.text: I could not recommend enough this place. The wine collection and wine quality is truly amazing, nice atmosphere. Perfect attention to detail with very professional and friendly service.

reviews.author: Vikram Prakash
reviews.text: Absolute 5 star experience. A bit less selection than the flagship location but what was cool is that there are also different wines on offer here! Champagne sold at retail prices?!?! Omg yes pleaseee!

reviews.author: Paula Cort√©s
reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic, we were visiting from Colombia, we don't regret, fresh and delicious food omg! Chef Laura and sever Mathew wonderful, good music and quick service. We will come back!

reviews.author: USUN
reviews.text:
I visited Ariari because I wanted to introduce it to friends visiting from the Bay Area. Every time I come here, I‚Äôm blown away by the quality of the food, the staff‚Äôs service, and the cozy atmosphere of the restaurant ‚Äî it‚Äôs a solid 10000/10 every time.

With the chilly weather, I was craving DAESUN soju and seafood like in Busan, and this place turned out to be the perfect choice.

We had assorted Mak-hwe, mackerel, and scallop gimbap topped with uni and sweet shrimp. The rice is the most important part of Gimbap ‚Äî and theirs is unbelievably good! The accompanying ssamjang and mayo sauces were just fantastic.

At one point, my friend accidentally dropped a spoon, and the staff immediately replaced it with a new one ‚Äî even bringing over a Tide stain remover stick just in case it got on her clothes. Their attentiveness and kindness were truly impressive...ü•π
We ended the meal with Dolsot Al-Bap and Hap-Cheon Pork Soup the perfect pairing with soju that just went down so smoothly.

My friends who were visiting said they were so touched by the taste and service that they almost cried.

Ariari is one of those rare spots in New York that never fails to make me happy. The food is amazing, complemented by the warm hospitality that‚Äôs rare to find in New York!!!!!!‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

Writing this review is making me crave it again ‚Äî I think I‚Äôll go back this week. Now that it‚Äôs getting cold, it‚Äôs the perfect time to visit Ariari. Highly, highly recommend!

reviews.author: Toffy Young
reviews.text:
I have a reservation at 6pm. When I arrived, it was a bit busy, but all the staff were so friendly, especially Nampu. I came with my boyfriend and wanted to try everything on the menu, but since it's just the two of us, we'll definitely come back to try more!
PS. I absolutely love the Kimchi here, and the Dolsot AI-BAP is the best dish. Must order!

reviews.author: Chau Giang
reviews.text:
One of the best Korean restaurants in Manhattan, hands down.

We ordered pork shoulder & stomach soup, fried sea eels, and seafood pancake. The flavors blended so well together and felt so complete, and the texture was right on point. I was especially impressed with the fried sea eels, a perfect combination of crunchy and soft, sweet and salty. I hadn't seen this dish anywhere else so credits to the restaurant's creativity.

Our waiter was very attentive, friendly and thoughtful. I brought a box coming in and he helped me put it away before dining. After we were done, he brought the box out along with a big paper bag (containing my leftover pancake) so that I could put my box in and carry it more easily. The lady who brought our receipt was very friendly as well.

Overall, incredible food and service! I'd love to come back and try other dishes on their diverse menu.

reviews.author: Glo Song
reviews.text: So glad my friend and I were lucky enough to get seated at this restaurant with no reservation. I wanted to order the Mak-Hwe, but the Seafood Butter Gui was much more tempting especially in terms of portion. The seafood melts in your mouth and the pita was nice and chewy w. a crisp. Be sure to order yourself the complimentary Seoul Night bottle they have on special when you download/pay through the Blackbird app. The service was on point and so was their dessert!

reviews.author: Nico
reviews.text: OMG this was the best Korean place I‚Äôve ever been: the fried chicken was so tender, juicy and tasty. Loved the fact the staff kept on refilling our complimentary kimchi. The duck and the domburi were to die for. Incredibly lovely stuff ‚Äî by far one of the best places I dined at in NYC.

reviews.author: D Lee
reviews.text:
Great seafood place in Texas! Never thought I would get decent sushi place while visiting in Texas, but yes I really liked the Mero seabass here. Sashimi sampler is also great for its price!
Food did take a bit to comeout but i guess they were cooking it from scratch. Would come here again!

reviews.author: snarkyguy
reviews.text: Really solid sushi restaurant. Although it‚Äôs Japanese, the waiter and the hostess were speaking Mandarin Chinese when deciding what table to put us at (totally fine, just outside my expectation). The atmosphere feels nice and relaxed. My wife got the bento box with eel and I got two types of rolls; Texas and Philadelphia. Really tasty!

reviews.author: Steven Hung
reviews.text: I ordered the California Roll, Squid Teriyaki, and Seafood Udon. Out of the three, the California Roll was the best. I was a bit disappointed to find that the seafood wasn‚Äôt very fresh‚Äîthe squid and the seafood in the udon weren‚Äôt up to par. The atmosphere inside was pretty comfortable, and the staff were friendly, but they really need to work on the freshness of the squid.

reviews.author: Savannah Grant
reviews.text: This is my absolute FAVORITE sushi spot. The nigiri is always so fresh and dressed up. I love the Kanpaccio & the Chili Escolar sashimis as well. Oooohhh and the garlic edamame!! If I could afford to eat her 3 times a week I would!!

reviews.author: Nannaphat Ann
reviews.text: This is my first time came here. The atmosphere of the restaurant is clean. The food is very fresh. There are many menus and it is very delicious. Price reasonable The staff is very nice service mild and good recommend  food for us. Also restroom  is clean. I recommend it for those who like Japanese food. ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

reviews.author: Mike Reviewed It!
reviews.text:
Interesting set up. Found tucked away in the middle of the busy k town block. If you are not looking for it you could just walk right by it.
Just like ok the sidewalk, inside the store also has Very high traffic. But just like the street it moves. Streams of people browsing past a sea of to go containers on seemingly temporary mobile shelving.
There is a variety of Asian food to choose from. Some familiar foods, some not.  Had to sift through the containers to find something I would like.
Basically,
Come in, get food, sit and eat or leave. Bargain prices. Quality is as expected for only 5.50 a tempora roll and 5 for spicey string beans.

reviews.author: Mia Huynh
reviews.text:
Not a bad spot for affordable and quick Korean food! Here, they have a variety of pre-packaged Korean bites from different banchan to japchae to even Korean soups. You grab what you want to eat (and/or a drink), then pay at counter. They have plenty of seating for you to sit down at as you enjoy your food.

I tried their kimbap and chicken and thought they were both solid. The kimbap was a good portion and made very well. And, the chicken was flavorful (although I wish it were so squishy/soft, but hey: what can you do about pre-packaged food). Although it was good, I would say that I would rather pay just a little bit more for fresher and higher quality items. But! Still not bad for a quick bite!

reviews.author: THE EXPLORER
reviews.text: We have been here to eat a few times over the years. This time we were guests at a large party of 10 people. Lots of delicious food ordered by the host. Restaurant was packed as always with a line of people waiting to get n.  Our table was downstairs in the back.  A wonderful night with good food and friends. Service was excellent.

reviews.author: Tian Carling
reviews.text:
Great service from cashier named James
(I think that was his name). Love all the selections and affordable prices. Everything is fresh and the place is clean and has ample seating! I've dined-in many years ago.

reviews.author: MaChaNillas
reviews.text: Someone tell me why this place was so hyped? Food was tasteless. Spicy was nonexistent, even their packet hot sauce was not spicy. Their staff stare at you for asking for soy sauce and hot sauce as if you‚Äôre stealing it and then they only give you 1 of each for an order of 4 items, what a joke! I‚Äôm disappointed because having lived in NYC, Korean food was much better in this area.

reviews.author: Allia
reviews.text:
This was my first time dining at Bryant Park Grill, and it was absolutely amazing! From start to finish, the experience exceeded expectations.

Our server Lena was a darling:  attentive, warm, and made sure everything was perfect. We started with the jumbo lump crab cake and salad, which was fresh and flavorful. My friend had the cashew-crusted salmon (he swapped the potatoes for asparagus,  great choice!), and I had the pan-roasted branzino, cooked to perfection. The blackberry nojito seltzer was a hit! We ended the evening with a chocolate brownie and vanilla ice cream that was the perfect sweet touch.

Despite the buzz of the city around us, the atmosphere felt calm and intimate.   A little oasis right in the heart of it all. I guess when you have an amazing date and great food, nothing else really matters üòä

Highly recommend and can‚Äôt wait to return!

reviews.author: Nina Buitrago
reviews.text: We had a nice meal, seated in the covered patio. Temperature was nice and the holiday decor was so nice for early November event. Our server Jose was very attentive and nice. Lots of options for all food restrictions vegan, veggie etc.  We will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Mister Man
reviews.text:
One of my favorite places to take visitors for a NY brunch. The main attraction is of course the wonderful Bryant Park location

Chill in the park before leisurely heading to Bryant Park Grill to eat ! If you want to sit inside then a reservation is necessary with a phone call and a confirmation via text day of.

The indoor seating was spacious and classy with friendly service.

The food is about what you expect. Not great but not bad either.

reviews.author: Stephane R.
reviews.text:
A spacious and very pleasant restaurant, in a quiet location opposite Bryant Park, with a magnificent terrace for sunny days. The food is easily among the best in New York, and the service is very friendly, warm, and attentive (thanks to Ren√©!).
I highly recommend it! A very good place to eat.

I took the opportunity to continue reading my feel-good thriller Honesty Bar, which I found on Amazon (in English and French)‚Äîa plot for the whole family set in Paris, Warsaw, and the Seychelles!üíï

reviews.author: Clint Watson
reviews.text: Bryant Park Grill never disappoints! The chicken sandwich was absolutely amazing ‚Äî perfectly cooked and full of flavor ‚Äî and the salad was just as delicious and fresh. Beautiful setting, great service, and outstanding food. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Josh Ricketts
reviews.text: Fantastic bar, great atmosphere fantastic bartender. Bourbon, whiskey, and scotch selection is on point. The recommendations from the bartender on the fried artichoke hearts, and the bone in pork chop, also the cocktails he served and the cheesecake! This has made this one of my favorite spots in NYC

reviews.author: anar virji
reviews.text: The rudest bartender I‚Äôve ever had. Said the first drink I ordered - a grapefruit cocktail on their menu - sounded disgusting. So I ordered a Tom Collins instead. He brought me a gin and soda. After I tasted it, I asked him what he put in the drink and he said gin and soda. I pointed out that‚Äôs not a Tom Collins, it‚Äôs a different drink, which I would have ordered had I wanted that. He said he‚Äôs not from the 1900s, and I passed him my drink and asked him not to make me another. At that point I didn‚Äôt want a drink from someone who‚Äôs such a jerk. Not that I felt welcome at that bar, but I‚Äôd never go back.

reviews.author: Ms. Ratatouille
reviews.text: Great bar! Lots of drinks and food choices.

reviews.author: maddy lederman
reviews.text: This hip and cozy upper Midtown gem feels like Dublin‚Äôs Palace Bar married a farm-to-table steakhouse. We had another excellent meal last night, and really can‚Äôt think of how it could have been better!

reviews.author: Chan Woo Park
reviews.text: Visited for Saturday brunch with a friend and it was quiet and not crowded at all. The bar was very pretty and I liked the inside decoration. The price was reasonable, but the food was okay. The server was very attentive and kind.

name: Cafe Mogador
address: 101, Saint Mark's Place, New York, NY, 10009

reviews.author: Jeff
reviews.text:
Great food and ambience. The couscous with the chicken had a mild and pleasant flavor. There was some extra broth on the side to pour into the couscous.

The lamb shank tagine with dried plums and apricots was hearty and flavorful. The rice was deliciously bathed in the lamb stock.

The Moroccan music and eclectic crowd provided a lively atmosphere.

reviews.author: Lloyd Feng
reviews.text: Did brunch here.  The Moroccan eggs I ordered seemed like a deconstructed shakshuka.  It tasted fine, but didn‚Äôt really stand out to me.  The bread that came with it was very tasty so if I‚Äôm back here for brunch, I‚Äôd ask abt a dish that has more of this bread.

reviews.author: Tsering gurung
reviews.text: LOVED THE FOOD. First time in a Moroccan restaurant. It was delicious. The pita bread was so tasty. The eggs are cooked to perfection. The chicken is so tender and the spicy sauce on the side is perfect with it. Get the country breakfast and the other one. OMG and the orange juice so fresh and hydrating. Good experience and excellent to the point service ü´ìü•òüçΩÔ∏è

reviews.author: Pamela A
reviews.text: I reserved a 3 PM on a Sunday. It was still brunch time so options were limited, so I ordered halloumi eggs. They were delicious. The service was good. I think dinner might be a 5 star. I especially liked that they served a little salad on the plate to add some brightness to the plate.

reviews.author: Amir Y
reviews.text:
‚ú® Dinner at Caf√© Mogador last night did not disappoint. Drinks were smooth, food was on point, and the whole place had that cozy, late-night vibe I love.

The kebab was the star, super flavorful, unique, and honestly right up my alley (maybe I‚Äôm biased, but I‚Äôd order it again in a heartbeat). Wrapped things up with a raspberry sorbet that was light, refreshing, and the perfect finish.

Service was chill, not too in-your-face, which I liked, though I had to wave for attention a couple times. Nothing major, just the pace of the night.

If you‚Äôre after authentic flavors + great energy, Mogador is definitely worth a visit. üåøüç∑üç¢

reviews.author: ig K
reviews.text:
Tiny portions. Not suitable as a meal. I should have just gone to DIG.

For a $15 vegetarian plate, it was basically a rice bowl with a sprinkle of veggies. Barely any brocoli or cauliflower. $3 extra for the sweet potatoes. Mostly rice/couscous in the bowl, you can see it was one forkfull of brocoli and one of cauliflower.

Very disappointed. Definitely NOT worth it for $15.

First visit, and likely my last!

reviews.author: Abiose Wilburg
reviews.text: Blue Park Kitchen nailed their Roasted Chicken & Cauliflower bowl! The combo of juicy chicken, healthy roasted cauliflower, and zesty pickled onions over fresh greens hit all the right notes. Took my MealPal lunch to the next level.

reviews.author: RaeAnn Serra
reviews.text: A standout for healthy food in midtown. Everything I've had here so far has been flavorful, fresh, and made with care. There are so many spots like this in the area and they don't even come close to the thoughtfulness of Blue Park Kitchen. I had a salmon bowl the first time, and it was super moist and not overcooked. Wonderful selection of veggies and tons of sauce options (the pumpkin pesto is AMAZING). Will definitely keep coming back.

reviews.author: Maria Georgiadis
reviews.text:
Our office ordered lunch here for the first time - the delivery was so speedy! We submitted our order 11:48am and by 12:07pm the delivery was downstairs. The food came nicely and securely packaged.

All the meals ordered were correct and delicious! We also got the snickerdoodle and chocolate chip cookies and they were fantastic.

Very impressed already! Will definitely order again.

reviews.author: Max L
reviews.text: The place has a lot of space to sit comfortably. The ingredients are top notch. Super fresh. Even salad oil they use is top grade and it tastes as such and also contains a hint of vinegar and garlic, but not artificial tasting like most places, actually freshly made. They brought healthy food to the new level along with DIG. The server was super courteous and tried their best to please you.

reviews.author: J B C
reviews.text: While on my way to one of my favorite chocolate shops I wasn‚Äôt sure what to have for lunch on Saturday. So I decided to try Wagamamma. My uncertainty about what to have for lunch didn‚Äôt end with which restaurant to choose but also what to eat. I ended up ordering 3 starters. I went with the chili hoisin duck bao which was delicious. Their version of calamari, a chili squid which was interesting but I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôll try again. And Tokyo fries which was also interesting but I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôll be trying again. My sister‚Äôs birthday was on Monday so naturally on Tuesday I ran to Macys (Herald Square) to get her a little something & decided to try Wagamamma once again since I felt or was cold enough to have ramen. I sat at the bar this time & ordered the Korean fried chicken bao for my appetizer & the chicken gyoza ramen for my main. Oddly enough my main was served before my appetizer. The ramen was pretty good however I wasn‚Äôt a big fan of the Korean fried chicken. Since there was hardly any chicken involved. It‚Äôs a nice restaurant with polite staff however I don‚Äôt see myself going back anytime soon.

reviews.author: Kristina Zhegunova
reviews.text:
We had a fun and flavorful meal at Wagamama! Tried a variety of dishes ‚Äî some hits, some misses. The pad Thai was okay, but definitely not like the one you‚Äôd get in Thailand ‚Äî milder and less bold in flavor. The duck ramen, on the other hand, was rich, a bit fatty in the best way, and absolutely satisfying.

The chicken salad was light and fresh, a good balance to the heartier dishes. Their famous bang bang cauliflower came with high expectations, but it was just okay ‚Äî crispy but the sauce didn‚Äôt quite wow us.

We also had two bao buns: one vegetarian and one with chicken. Both were great ‚Äî soft, fluffy buns with flavorful fillings. The chicken one especially stood out, with tender meat and a nice crunchy contrast.

Fresh-pressed juices were a highlight ‚Äî especially the positive one, super refreshing and energizing. And the teas! One with lemongrass, the other with mint ‚Äî both fragrant and calming.

A nice spot for a casual meal with a twist, especially if you‚Äôre in the mood for variety and fresh drinks.

reviews.author: Alisa B
reviews.text: Delicious ramen on a surprisingly rainy and cold late summer day. Lunch special is a decent value. It‚Äôs a low key setting which for a late lunch was quiet and relaxed. Server was fast and very friendly. Only minor issue was it was a bit cold in the restaurant.

reviews.author: John Ouellette
reviews.text:
This has become one of my favorite places to eat. The options are varied and the taste is out of this world. Specifically the soup broth is almost like it's some sort of addictive substance it's so good...

I have found that they're very open to make some substitutions and mix things up a bit as far as what's on the menu, which is super helpful to me. The staff is always helpful and friendly and I would not hesitate to come here over and over again...

reviews.author: Jihyun Min
reviews.text:
I‚Äòve visited Wagamama in London several times and always had a great experience. When I came across this location in New York, I was excited to try it. Unfortunately, this visit was extremely disappointing, and I truly feel it was a WASTE of money.

Upon entering, a female server guided me toward a bar seat. I politely asked if I could be seated by the window instead, as there were plenty of empty tables. She did not verbally respond and seemed quite dismissive.

Shortly after, a male server, who was kind and attentive, brought me a glass of tap water.

However, the table was sticky and appeared dirty, which was concerning.

Regarding the food ‚Äî I wondered how they  are managing their ingredients and the recipe.

Pork Belly Bao ($11): The pork was extremely dry, and the toppings were poorly prepared.

Beef Brisket Tantanmen Ramen ($23): The bamboo shoots and the kimchi tasted spoiled, with a sourness beyond the normal flavor. The beef brisket was very dry, and the broth and egg were cold. For a dish that is meant to be served hot, the cold egg was particularly unpleasant.

I shared my feedback with the male server, who listened carefully and was understanding. I appreciated his attitude, which at least prevented the experience from being entirely ruined. Nevertheless, I spent $40 (including tip) for a deeply unsatisfying meal.

reviews.author: Timothy Johnson
reviews.text: Always been a great spot for drinks, but very happy to see how well they‚Äôve recently expanded into a cafe during the daytime! And unlike the thousands of NYC cafes serving mediocre coffee and the same stale pastries for $$$, they instead offer two things you really can‚Äôt get anywhere else; Tim Wendelboe coffee and fresh Norwegian Waffles with the traditional toppings! Additionally their matcha offerings are very solid as well actually! Pretty quiet vibe there during the daytime too, so perfect for some casual meetings or a quick work session as well! La Cabra and Kabin will be my go-to cafe spots in lower manhattan now!

reviews.author: Gjoni Shpati
reviews.text:
Came here last night to celebrate 2 birthdays and this was honestly the best choice we‚Äôve ever made on a reservation. Chris really went above and beyond with his service and his passion behind the drinks was so special. The whole table loved learning about the time that goes behind crafting a cocktail and we didn‚Äôt even want to order our own drinks, we just trusted Chris and his recommendations.

I can‚Äôt recommend coming here enough this really was an amazing experience. The mango lassi shot was honestly life changing and the celery margarita was crazy.

If you ever are here and Chris happens to help you, literally let him do all the choosing and really get to know what you‚Äôre about to drink, this was better service than I get at most Michelin stars in the city.

reviews.author: Ryan Reynolds
reviews.text: Stopped into Kabin during the day and was really impressed. Had a La Cabra oat milk cortado that was perfectly balanced, as well as an exceptional pour-over that showed real care in brewing. It‚Äôs could quockly become my new favorite specialty coffee spot in the city, whether it‚Äôs for the coffee itself or just the vibe. Highly recommend for anyone looking for quality and craft in their cup.

reviews.author: Isabella Watkins
reviews.text: Literally can‚Äôt rate this place highly enough! The vibe, food and drinks were unreal! The team is epic!! A must visit if you‚Äôre in town! Will definitely be returning

reviews.author: Vlada Khmarska
reviews.text: We had been here once before, but we came back a second time. It‚Äôs a wonderful bar with an amazing atmosphere and excellent service. And their Cremant is honestly one of the best ‚ù§Ô∏è

reviews.author: Eva Smeets
reviews.text: We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived at this cozy restaurant. We were greeted with a very warm welcome, and the atmosphere was intimate and inviting. The menu was fantastic, offering a variety of unique dishes  not the usual standard options, but truly delicious and beautifully presented. We had such a lovely evening! I can highly recommend this place!

reviews.author: ila Moravek
reviews.text: It‚Äôs a lovely intimate establishment with a fantastic food and drink happy hour. Sal, our bartender, was attentive and made great cocktails and conversation.  Highly recommend for a date night or catching up with friends.

reviews.author: Liana Warren
reviews.text: Everything tasted so cheap and low quality, and it is overpriced for how cheap it tastes. The cheese board tasted like it came from dollar tree. The wine tasted like a $5 wine.

reviews.author: Laurie Gerdemann
reviews.text: Darkish, wine cellar type of atmosphere with tall lit candles on each table.The service was cheerful and fast.The food excellent. I had the salmon and grilled vegetables.It was a 3 course meal special starting with zuchinni pancakes and ending with chocolate baklava.

reviews.author: SP
reviews.text: Cute wine bar with indoor and outdoor seating. Service was great all around from the food to the drinks. Responsibly priced which is nice as well. The meat and cheese board for 5 ppl was the only thing that wasn‚Äôt worth our while for the price.

reviews.author: ML SMITH
reviews.text:
We stopped here for a quick Sunday brunch.  Food was great, tasty, and spot on.  Cost for 2 meals were relatively expensive but doable.  I would recommend getting here at a decent time because the space is very limited and lacks private seating.

Restaurant did not offer a baby chair, but lucky our young child wasn't hungry.  Staff was friendly and the food served to us came out pretty fast.  For 2 people, prepare to pay about $40.00.  Overall, we enjoyed our time, food was delicious.

reviews.author: Jessica Murphy
reviews.text: Cozy spot near Union Square with flavorful falafel and warm, fluffy pita. Hummus bowl w/ sweet potato falafel was tasty, but next time I‚Äôm trying the amazing looking pita sandwiches!

reviews.author: Aika Ormanbetova
reviews.text:
Food & service was great and cashier Kennedy was friendly ! I had lamb sandwich on ü•ô pita bread with potato chips ( very oily) .

I enjoyed my dinner and would recommend to try their food !

reviews.author: Danielle
reviews.text: This is such a great little spot. There is community style seating and it isn‚Äôt super spacious so I wouldn‚Äôt recommend for large groups. But the menu has many wonderful options both vegetarian and non, and the prices and portions make sense. Staff is friendly and the taste is so authentic and delicious

reviews.author: Osher Assouline
reviews.text: Came in for the shakshuka since other places were too busy. Their attempt at shakshuka is a more accurate description. Instead of eggs cooked in matbiucha (=traditional tomato stew) I received friend eggs served on a bed of tomato pizza/ pasta sauce. That is not a shakshuka. Chat gpt could have told them that.

reviews.author: Ravi Kurani
reviews.text: You NEED to go here if you‚Äôre at Columbia or in the Upper West Side. Probably one of the best Thai spots I‚Äôve been to. We got the pad ki Mao & pra ram tofu. SO GOOD. The rice is perfect, and on top of that the service is amazing. They‚Äôre super quick, always come and ask if you want anything, their hot sauces have all 4 of the sauces (the spicy pepper, small fresh pickled peppers, chili sauce‚Ä¶ and one that I forget, because I don‚Äôt usually eat it). They have 2 bathrooms in the back, and the location is super cute.

reviews.author: Bridget Ortega
reviews.text: I gave a 4 because of the customer service but food overall was really good, the interior is nice, cool and chilled. The Steamed Thai dumpling were amazing and tasty, the pad kee mao was very good and I asked for mild, the kow soy was good, not too spicy at all, chicken was very tender and the sauce was flavorful and creamy.

reviews.author: Ameya Bhakay
reviews.text:
Overcast Sunday random walk-in got us here. The place was not busy and we got an amazing window seat and got straight to ordering which included Kow Soy ($17.95), Vegetable Curry ($17.95) and, Curry Rice ($2.50) - a side portion which was enough to feed our little one!

Food overall was inline with expectations; nothing spectacular, but not disappoint either. Not much spice kick, but the Kow Soy was packed with flavor and the Vegetable Curry, not so much! Decent portion sizes too.

Service was slightly slow, but food arrived within 25-mins of ordering. Noise levels on the lower end. Will visit again for sure!

reviews.author: Jeffer Sonian
reviews.text: The food at Thai Market is possibly the best Thai food I have had in the US.  Everything we have tried over many visits has been consistently delicious, including the Branzino, Salmon, Chicken Massaman, Pad Thai, Calamari and Chicken Sate.  The only problem is that is now so popular that there is often a 1 hour wait.

reviews.author: Leonard
reviews.text:
One of the few times I give 5 stars. Aside from price, the place was like perfect. The servers, serve in a way that is there but also non invasive. The atmosphere is clean, on theme, and we'll lit for a nice mood. And the food... well is like premium/quality Thai.
I had an aversion from a previous experience with Thai in another restaurant and this place helped me get over it.
I ordered the panang curry which they easily and without hassle substituted the meat with salmon. And it was beautifully plated, the salmon was perfectly cooked tender and flaky, flavor on point, and just ask around perfection. I also ordered a pomegranate ginger ale and it was alright. Not that good. Too much sugar but the curry was bomb.
Tried my friend's curry as well and it also slapped. So good!

reviews.author: Cassy Randolph
reviews.text: Always love some good sushi, and decided to try this place. The food to me is average, not exciting. Kind expensive and small portions, sashimi is fresh and decent quality. but it‚Äôs NY, so kind of expected. The tempura cheesecake was the highlight of the meal. The service is great üëç.

reviews.author: Nolan Rumble
reviews.text: Interesting little spot that offers some good sushi. Great for a quick snack before a theatre show begins! The staff are friendly and helpful. I wouldn‚Äôt suggest ordering wine by the glass here as it might have some slow turnover (ie. oxidize wine). The black miso cod was delicious and if you want to spoil yourself, I‚Äôd recommend this. Chocolate mousse cake was also ok‚Ä¶but lacked a ‚Äúwow‚Äù factor‚Ä¶.still ate all it though!

reviews.author: Angie R
reviews.text:
We had the tempura rock shrimp and fried chicken appetizer.  Both were excellent and we should have stopped there as that was enough food for the both of us.

We also had a couple of mixed drinks (peach one pictured here) and we enjoyed a Sapporo as well.

Shared the maki platter, I wouldn't order the Philly roll again, too much cream cheese and no cucumber, it was just overwhelming.  We shared the tempura, don't skip this during your visit - delicious!

reviews.author: GrAcIE W
reviews.text:
Nice & friendly service with mediocre sushi.
The Tuna Tartar Martini was delicious, Sushi and Sashimi were average, and the Ginger Citrus Duck Breast was tasty but really dry.
Overall experience was just okay, don‚Äôt think I would come back again.

reviews.author: Lexy
reviews.text:
Can I have 100 stars? Holy moly! There are some amazingly unique treats on this menu, and of course I had to try! Green tea gnocchi? Probably easily one of the best gnocchi dishes Ive had! The capers scattered through the dish give a perfectly salty compliment to a savory dish that has the perfect dash of something almost sweet! I will be dreaming about this dish FOR-EVER! Stacy our server was an absolute delight!  To top off the meal; dessert a tempura cheesecake, crunchy and just absolutely melts in your mouth!
I will most certainly find myself here again when I visit...if not again before I leave!

reviews.author: Patrick McEvoy
reviews.text: Love this NYC restaurant every time I head into the city for NYU Epilepsy doctor appointments. Cool atmosphere.  The comfort food feeling takes some anxiety out of a doctor visit.

reviews.author: Ashay Doshi
reviews.text: Good sandiwches and burgers and great draft beer options! Spent the afternoon there for lunch! The chipotle pepper jack chicken wrap is my favourite because the chicken is soft and spiced to perfection. Draft beers have got something for everyone, from IPAs to Lagers, but there's also the regular can and bottle section.

reviews.author: Chris Zygo
reviews.text: Ate here two nights in a row because the wings and burgers were worth the trip back. Great food and very friendly staff.

reviews.author: Leah Fletcher
reviews.text: Visited this restaurant several weeks ago with some friends and I cannot stop thinking about the amazing salad I ordered. The other dishes looked and smelled delicious too! Cool vibe, felt very comfortable as soon as we walked in. Looking forward to my next time dining here

reviews.author: Marc
reviews.text:
Great place to grab dinner and a drink. Good food, good portions, and cheap drinks. Rotating nightly special menu.

The place is a little small but they have some additional seating in the back. Service is quick and friendly.

Grill burger was delicious, nice big solid burger. Side of fries was excellently crisp though a little unseasoned. Salmon salad had a nice piece of salmon which tasted good but the rest of the salad was a little plain.

Drink prices are great though. Happy Hour beer and cocktails are about $4-$6 and drink specials are $5-$7. Other cocktails are a little more but most of what you would want is available pretty cheap.

reviews.author: Sabahat Ali
reviews.text: For many people this will be FIVE STARS. I want to make that really clear because if you like a thick cut fry that‚Äôs golden on the outside with a high ‚Äúfuffly potato‚Äù ratio on the inside, you‚Äôll enjoy it thoroughly because they‚Äôve executed amazingly on that kind of fry. The problem in this case is me: I like a thin cut fry with more of the crunchy / crispy golden exterior and less of the interior of a fry. And they really are two different categories of fry. As far as execution on the former is concerned, it‚Äôs done well. I just don‚Äôt like that kind of fry. The black truffle mayo we got sounded great but fell very short of our expectations. Barely any truffle flavour and you have to buy truffle oil separately. The place does feel like a rendezvous for Diagon Alley‚Äôs shadiest wizards so that‚Äôs actually really cool especially because it feels like you‚Äôve entered an olden times tavern restaurant in 18th century England. All in all if you like the thick cut fry scene they guys have executed beautifully, but if you‚Äôre like me I wouldn‚Äôt choose to come back here simply because of my preference for cut fries. I‚Äôm sure these guys would do an amazing job making those.

reviews.author: Cem Simsek
reviews.text:
I have been running a traditional Belgian frituur ‚ÄúOma‚Äôs Frit‚Äù for 15 years üáßüá™. I walked in here out of pure curiosity, because Belgian fries are not just food ‚Äî they‚Äôre a network of tradition and perfection, built over generations.
The secret to real Belgian fries lies in the quality and variety of the potatoes, the type of fat used, and precise control of temperature and frying time. Even how many potatoes are added to the fryer at once makes a difference: if you add too many, the temperature suddenly drops, which immediately affects the texture.
A powerful fryer, the right fat, and especially the double-frying method with correct temperatures and timings are absolutely crucial.
In Belgium, potatoes are delivered fresh every day, and we mostly use Bintje potatoes because of their unique flavor and structure. Occasionally we switch to Agria, but nothing truly compares to good Bintjes.
With all that in mind, I was curious to give this place a try. I walked in‚Ä¶ and honestly, I walked back out rather quickly. The bar for fries in Belgium is simply very high, and what I saw here didn‚Äôt reach that level.

This is not meant as negative criticism, just an honest observation: real fries‚Ä¶ that‚Äôs something truly Belgian. üáßüá™üçü

reviews.author: Brian
reviews.text: Pommes Frites has always been a good to in order for me to satisfy my fries cravings. They serve great portions at a good price and there are sooo many options for sauces. They have great service , allowing you to try any of the flavors before you make you order and then in a matter of moments, youre meal is ready. The atmosphere is like an old tavern feel , but the seats and space is limited. But overall I love this place!

reviews.author: Maegan Wrubel
reviews.text: Love this spot in the west village! The fries are always fresh and perfectly prepared. This visit I got the truffle fries (pic attached) You can‚Äôt go wrong with any of the sauces - the truffle ketchup and Parmesan peppercorn are our go-to

reviews.author: Dalit Rosenfeld
reviews.text:
You MUST come here! Pommes Frites in New York is one of my favorite spots to visit whenever I come from South Florida. It is such a fun and unique concept with perfectly crispy french fries served in different sizes and an incredible variety of dipping sauces. SO MANY to choose. The flavors are creative and make this simple idea feel really special.
They have been around forever and it is always a must stop for me when I am in the city. Totally recommended for anyone who loves fries and wants to try something different in New York.

reviews.author: Heather
reviews.text: I had to swing by Lupe's while I was doing some Mr. Robot related sight seeing. The food was fantastic and the portion size was great. House marg was nice, too! By the time I was done with my meal there were a bunch of people waiting to be seated, so I'm guessing it's a local fave. I can see why! Luckily for me, the Dark Army was nowhere to be found. RIP Cisco.

reviews.author: Zoe
reviews.text:
Our Love Story (and Margaritas) Start at Lupe‚Äôs.
It‚Äôs time to write a review for the most important restaurant in Soho NYC to me and my husband. Lupe‚Äôs isn‚Äôt just a place; it‚Äôs where our love grew, from dating to marriage. I‚Äôll never forget how, when my husband was still my boyfriend, he‚Äôd always stop by before seeing me to grab a margarita. Three years later, it‚Äôs still his favorite bar,his ritual. After work, you‚Äôll find him here, greeted by the kindest bartenders who treat him like family (and pour the most generous drinks). and of course the margaritas are the best in town!!! Period‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

The corner spot, with its neon glow and lantern style lighting, feels like a secret hideaway romantic, cozy, and alive with energy. Summer nights on the patio under those red lights just so magic!

We‚Äôve ordered takeout many times, but tonight we sat at my favorite corner table outside and had a proper feast: the vibrant shrimp salad, crispy fish tacos, tender beef tacos, and the most perfectly cooked fish plate. And the flan? Hands down the best, tortillas are so yummy ü§§ üòã and authentic, the taste just can bring you back to Mexico! Portions are generous, flavors are bright, and everything tastes impossibly fresh, no surprise, since the entire kitchen team is from Mexico.

But what makes Lupe‚Äôs special isn‚Äôt just the food or drinksÔºåit‚Äôs the people. The staff radiates warmth, making every visit feel like coming home. You can always find the owner inside and make sure every dish and drink is perfect, so friendly to the customers. Lupe‚Äôs is the institution ‚ù§Ô∏è Funny enough, if I ever can‚Äôt reach my husband? I know exactly where he‚Äôll be: at Lupe‚Äôs, drink in hand, happy or (occasionally) mad at me. It‚Äôs his sanctuary.

To the team: Thank you for being part of our story. Here‚Äôs to many more years of tacos, margaritas, and memories. If you love Mexican food, Soho charm, or just feeling like family, Lupe‚Äôs is your spot. It‚Äôs not just a restaurant‚Äîit‚Äôs a piece of our hearts.

reviews.author: Amelia T
reviews.text: Good for for a good price, really fast service. We came on a Saturday night and it was relatively quiet. We ordered the chicken mole enchiladas and the beef enchiladas. They came out so quickly! Our favorite was the beef enchiladas. Server was friendly and efficient. Overall good experience and at a great price!

reviews.author: Lina Stef
reviews.text: Delicious! All the flavors of Mexico on top of fresh food, Mezcal, wine and beers. Salvador is amazing behind the bar and hosting. I got the Baja salad with grilled shrimp along with a Mezcal cocktail finished with a tasty Mexican hot chocolate. This spot has a very cheery fun colorful vibe. Highly recommend and I‚Äôll be back again. Cheers to the head chef, staff and Salvador!

reviews.author: Bellamy Woodside Ridinger
reviews.text: I was looking for a spot where I could gather a few friends for my birthday and have a margarita and something affordable to eat, somewhere that felt good to be in and fun but not so loud we couldn‚Äôt hear each other. Had an amazing time last night. The team was lovely, the food was amazing, and the space was cozy, cool, casual but beautiful

reviews.author: Kathy D
reviews.text: Typical NYC deli/diner.  Old school atmosphere with a decent sized menu and good food.  Nothing amazing but the food was exactly as I would expect.  Quickly served, basic but tasty and reasonable prices for NYC. Only surprise for me was they serve unsalted butter which you don‚Äôt usually see.

reviews.author: Alisha Kass
reviews.text: We dined in at Roxy last night 11/14 Friday. We are visiting NYC and wanted to try a diner . The food was delish. Our male server was very attentive and always checking on us to see if we need anything throughout the night. Nice evening out.

reviews.author: Celia Westrick
reviews.text: We loved this deli!! It was the cutest little street cafe for breakfast. We ended coming by every morning of our trip. It‚Äôs quiet with a perfect panoramic glass view to watch the city street. Also DO NOT sleep on the chocolate croissant! It was to die for, sadly I ate it all before I got a pic lol.

reviews.author: Candace Guardascione
reviews.text:
Great for families! Food was delicious. Service was very friendly and quick. Great location. We were so happy to stumble upon this place and we‚Äôll definitely be back.
My 6 year old was very happy with his giant bowl of yogurt and his bagel. It‚Äôs usually hard to find something on a menu he is happy about but he was super excited about his breakfast this morning!

reviews.author: Kelly Denham
reviews.text: Walked in for breakfast and was greeted by the most charming host, Pierre. The decor is also very charming. We sat by the window and had coffee and orange juice. I had the cheese and bacon omelet with potatoes and toast. The omelet was fluffy, hot, and full of bacon. The potatoes had a good seasoning. My husband had three eggs with homemade corn beef hash and potatoes and a bagel.

reviews.author: Mariam Kmh
reviews.text: Delicious spot for ramen and unreal bao. We booked a reservation for the same day but were about to sit at the bar. LOVED the spicy ramen, it‚Äôs definitely feeling. They had some popcorn chicken which was great as well as the pork bao‚Ä¶ do not sleep on it. I‚Äôd pass on the dessert or share it as it‚Äôs massive.

reviews.author: Mj Helmreich
reviews.text: Delicious food!  The chicken ramen was the show stopper!  Rich flavor!  Curry cauliflower seasoned beautifully. Cold noodles good as well with spice! And topped off the meal with pumpkin cheesecake! The empty bowls say it all!  Yum!

reviews.author: Ari Babis
reviews.text:
I had one of the best meals I‚Äôve had in NYC at Ivan Ramen. Every dish was a standout.
The small plates were perfectly balanced ‚Äî the potato salad with roe was creamy, savory, and unexpectedly addictive.
The ramen itself was spectacular: rich broth, vibrant flavors, perfectly cooked noodles, and the soft-boiled egg was unreal. You can tell every component is made with intention.

From start to finish, everything was fantastic.

reviews.author: Keti C
reviews.text: I first stumbled upon Ivan Ramen three years ago when I lived in the neighborhood, not realizing at the time that it would become my favorite ramen spot in the city. I‚Äôve probably visited every ramen place in New York by now and this one is still hands down the best. I often come back for my go to bowl - Tokyo Shio. It's just that good. The service is always warm and welcoming and the food is consistently excellent. For any ramen lover this place is definitely a must visit.

reviews.author: Kelsey
reviews.text: This is my third or fourth time here. It‚Äôs always a great time, no matter the time of day or week. I came for lunch today and tried their new spicy veggie miso ramen and it‚Äôs honestly some of THE BEST ramen I‚Äôve had in the area and city. As a noodle lover I‚Äôm always pleased when a place continues to elevate their menu.

reviews.author: Legends l
reviews.text:
I visited this restaurant a couple of times on a trip to New York. Food tastes good and is quick. Very generous portions and very competitive pricing.
Staff were friendly. If you are looking for a dining experience, this might not be suitable for you.
For me, it was perfect as I appreciated the vibe and cultural exchange/experience. If I had to be critical, I think the msg content in the meals were noticeable.

reviews.author: Rob H
reviews.text:
Taiwan Pork Chop House, tucked away on Doyers Street in Chinatown, offers a straightforward dining experience that caters to those seeking authentic Taiwanese street food.

Food:
The menu features classic Taiwanese dishes such as pork chop over rice, fried rice cakes, and wontons in chili oil. While the pork chop is tender and flavorful, some dishes may lack the depth of flavor found in other establishments. The fried rice cakes and wontons are popular choices among patrons.  Ôøº

Atmosphere:
The setting is modest, with a no-frills approach that emphasizes function over ambiance. It‚Äôs a casual spot suitable for a quick meal rather than a leisurely dining experience.  Ôøº

Service:
Service is efficient, with staff ensuring that orders are processed swiftly. However, the fast-paced environment may not lend itself to personalized service.  Ôøº

Overall:
For those in the area craving Taiwanese comfort food at reasonable prices, Taiwan Pork Chop House is a solid choice. While it may not offer the most refined dining experience, it delivers on authenticity and value.

reviews.author: Jiao Zhang
reviews.text: A good street food in a cozy alley. I wouldn‚Äôt say the quality is great but it tastes good as street food itself. I recommend salt and pepper chicken, which is very tender and flavorful. The taro ball dessert with ice is also good. The onion pancake is way too oil. The price is very reasonable. It is a place where you can just stop by and get some snacks and bathing in Chinatown vibe.

reviews.author: Isabelle
reviews.text:
The beef noodle soup was great. However I got the tofu and seaweed appetizer because I saw a photo of it on the window, but what came out looked nothing like it :( it wasn‚Äôt very good - it was kind of like boiled seaweed, topped with boiled tofu, and the sauce is drizzled on top and not mixed in. This was disappointing.
Also they only serve food in plastic bowls so will not be eating here due to this.

reviews.author: Chu Lin
reviews.text: This place is as iconic as it gets in Chinatown. Growing up in Taiwan, TPCH is definitely authentic. Their sour vegetable is delicious, I could eat that on its own. Their pork chops over rice is done nicely, sits on top of rice covered by minced meat, side of half egg and sour vegetables. The price is great. My favorite thing here is to eat on the street. Sitting on the plastic stools, eating and watching people walk by. It's a cool vibe

reviews.author: Nie Znany
reviews.text: Karczma never lets me down. It‚Äôs one of the last true Polish spots left in Greenpoint, and it honestly feels like a little piece of home. Whenever I‚Äôm feeling homesick or just need some comfort, this is where I go for food that warms my soul. The meals are always tasty, portions are generous, and there‚Äôs always something good on the menu. Love this place!

reviews.author: Monika Kraszewski
reviews.text: I‚Äôm Polish so I know what means good quality Polish food ! And this is what you would find in Karczma ! I‚Äôm really impressed! Sour rye soup aka Zurek in a bread is to die for! We came back next day for more food . Highly recommend for everyone! Do zobaczenia next time !

reviews.author: Tom Jones
reviews.text: A nice little place.  I‚Äôm maybe being a little harsh about the food.   I had pork shoulder w cabbage with a side of kielbasa.  The sausage and cabbage were respectable.  The pork shoulder was pretty gristly and not so flavorful.  But the place has a nice vibe and I will return to try other dishes.  It‚Äôs certainly great value for the money!  Whole meal with a drink was under $30.  Friendly staff.

reviews.author: Akinde Olagundoye
reviews.text: Classic Polish restaurant featuring traditionally prepared dishes. We got the sampler and the Spicy Goulash. The sampler was perfect for 2 people trying to explore several tastes from the menu.  I wouldn't call it spicy, but it was delicious.

reviews.author: Mark Garno
reviews.text:
My wife and I heard about this great polish restaurant/ bar HOME COOKING, grandparents recipe made just like my mama cooked rest her soul, specifically soup ‚Äú. Flaczki ‚Äú.  and we all know it takes 3 days to prepare the right way, Fish and chips frytki sea style.  Baked potatoes on brick stove made us feel at home.  Hey come by and check it out for yourself
You like it‚Ä¶..ps. european kitchen with brew at your discretion

reviews.author: perle75nyc
reviews.text:
As expected, the place was quite busy due to the hot weather. Watching a video of soba being made while waiting helped ease the boredom, and the food itself wasn‚Äôt bad. The tempura was crispy and tasty, but the dipping sauce for the soba was a bit too salty, and overall, the soba wasn‚Äôt particularly more flavorful compared to other soba places.

Considering how busy the restaurant was, the staff seemed understaffed. The team was moving around busily, but things didn‚Äôt seem well-organized, making their efforts appear somewhat inefficient. The host also came across as unfriendly. Rather than repeatedly telling every guest, ‚ÄúCan I put my name on the waitlist?‚Äù and ‚ÄúJust wait here,‚Äù it would probably be less frustrating for everyone‚Äîand easier for the staff‚Äîif they used a proper waitlist system like many other restaurants do. It felt like a missed opportunity to improve both customer experience and staff workflow. One staff member was clearing tables, wiping surfaces, handling new napkins, chopsticks, and cups, and then using the same hand to scoop ice from the ice bin and serve drinks‚Äîall without taking a single moment to sanitize or wash their hands. It definitely didn‚Äôt feel hygienic or sanitary. When I first received my food, something felt off. I noticed that the dishes were placed upside down on the tray, so I had to rearrange them myself. I understand they might have been busy, but it really showed how unprofessional the service was.

reviews.author: Joan V
reviews.text:
I‚Äôve gone to Sobaya even before their Michelin credentials. I was recommended here by a family member and recently rediscovered it while doing some solo-exploring.

I always grab their daily lunch combo as it gives you a bang for your buck. (If you‚Äôre a college student in the area, you‚Äôd be a fool not to give this place a chance.)
Both hot and cold soba options are solid (my brother prefers cold, I like hot) and we adore their dons.

There was one time I found something wrong with my order and they were so apologetic- immediately replacing my dish with a fresh one. I was happy to receive a fresh one (tempura deliciously hot out of the frier) and finished. That‚Äôs when they gave me a free green tea cr√®me br√ªl√©e for my troubles. They didn‚Äôt have to do that, but they were so kind and profusely apologizing for the earlier blunder that I couldn‚Äôt help but tip well and applaud their service. My water was never empty!

All the food was delicious. Not too salty, not too sweet, but just right. Love Sobaya and will definitely keep coming back :)

reviews.author: Laura R
reviews.text: First time going today this spot is good I like the style , a nice menu I went for there lunch special my friend introduced me to this spot and I really enjoyed it. The food is good as well. I am adding it to my list , i recommend

reviews.author: Kama K
reviews.text:
Didn‚Äôt expect to enjoy this experience so much! Very kind service and super accommodating.
I love the ambiance too! But mostly, the food. Truly the type of a meal you‚Äôd get in Japan. High quality soba and fish.
Spotlight on lunch menus ‚Äî great value!

reviews.author: Saahil Panikar
reviews.text:
Holy crap! This place was so good. We stopped in on the way and we're just blown away by how authentic and tasty the food was. The chicken nanban was one of the best things I've ever eaten. And the rice bowls looked so good.

Definitely stop by and try this! I also really loved their hot green tea

reviews.author: Bailey Jaworski
reviews.text:
Very fun Packer bar in the city! Come early for game days to get a table. There is also an awesome back patio for days the weather permits that allows for extra room. Love the game day specials that take you straight home to a Wisconsin tailgate. Who doesn't love a good bloody mary with all the fixings?
Great spot to come for game days.
Go Pack Go!

reviews.author: Kyana Ifill
reviews.text: Really fun packer atmosphere on game day! Only had the guacamole and chips and the guacamole wasn‚Äôt bad but the chips were not my favorite. The margarita was nice but over priced in my opinion (16.50) I saw someone sneak some food into the back so just come for the atmosphere and drinks. Skip the food if possible.

reviews.author: Christinaaa Clark
reviews.text:
Absolutely terrible service. The bartender was unbelievably rude‚Äîcondescending, short-tempered, and clearly uninterested in doing their job. Asking a simple question about music got my drink dumped out an eye roll and a snarky response, like I was wasting their precious time.

If I wanted to be talked down to and ignored, I‚Äôd go argue with a parking meter. This kind of attitude has no place in hospitality. There are plenty of bars in this city‚Äîones that actually want your business. Don‚Äôt waste your time or money here.

reviews.author: Connie Kwok
reviews.text: Woohoo Green Bay Packers bar with sound on! Love the relaxed and spacious vibe of this place, bartenders are attentive. No table service so order at the bar. GET THE CHEESE CURDS! Omg they are legit and pieces of heaven. Friendly crowd on game day, and there is more garden space outside (with a tv). Can't comment on the live music yet, but happy to come back and enjoy the games!

reviews.author: Joy St. Louis
reviews.text:
Campy western decor and a Fordham flag surround a bar and row of picnic type tables. The bar was busy which slowed down table service during the happy hour.  The waitstaff appeared after the happy hour ended. There is live entertainment and a nice if loud relaxed vibe. That vibe and the staff make the place.
The food is "mid" aa the kids say. Tex-Mex fare that is incredibly bland. The average queso can save the meal. Fresh corn tortilla chips with guacamole,  beans or queso are your best bet.  Everything else takes a while. The happy hour drinks are all ice.

reviews.author: Mario Valero
reviews.text: Place was packed. But for not having a reservation, we didn‚Äôt have to wait long to be seated. Very cool spot, a little loud but enjoyable atmosphere with decent music. The services after sitting, was fast and the food came quickly as well. I ordered the sausage and peppers personal pizza. Pizza was good for what it was ordered and old fashion as well and that was so so. It was more sweet than I‚Äôd like and very light on the alcohol.

reviews.author: Cho
reviews.text:
My little picky eater approved the pasta marinara. Chicken with garlic mashed potatoes. Not too impressed with chicken but the sauce and the rest definitely compensated. And also the portion was pretty big so yeah good.
And espresso ‚òïÔ∏è oh it was goooood!

reviews.author: Rocco Luongo
reviews.text: Great looking restaurant with a nice bar area, excellent food and service.   The weather was nice so we sat outside.  Good neighborhood vibe with lots of people walking by.   Neapolitan pizza was excellent.  Great crust. Crispy on the outside, tender on the inside with a nice undercarriage.  Delicious fresh toppings.  The waiter was friendly, professional, and attentive.  He showed pride in working here and talked with us about the restaurant and the neighborhood.

reviews.author: Nastya Dueva
reviews.text:
We came to Barbalu Bklyn just 45 minutes before closing time, not really expecting to be seated‚Äîthere were five of us, and we thought maybe we‚Äôd just be allowed to order takeout. But to our surprise and delight, two amazing guys, Matteo and Nick, welcomed us with warm smiles and no hesitation.

They seated us right away, took our full order with zero rush, and the food came out incredibly fast‚Äîand even more incredibly delicious! We honestly didn‚Äôt expect such a perfect experience so late in the evening.

I came specifically for the authentic Italian pizza, and it did not disappoint. Thin, crispy, fresh‚Äîit was exactly what I was craving. We also ordered the oven-roasted branzino with broccolini, and let me tell you‚Äîthe fish was tender and full of flavor, and the vegetables were the best I‚Äôve ever had.

And then‚Äîsomething truly special happened. It was my mom‚Äôs birthday, and Matteo and Nick surprised us with a beautiful tiramisu topped with a candle and a bottle of champagne, completely on the house. That moment made the whole evening unforgettable.

We left with full hearts, full bellies, and big smiles. This is not just a restaurant‚Äîit‚Äôs a place where you‚Äôre treated like family.

Huge thank you to the staff‚Äîyou guys are amazing. 100% recommend Barbalu Bklyn to anyone who wants a truly delicious meal and an experience filled with warmth and joy. We‚Äôll definitely be back!‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçüî•‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçüî•‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçüî•

reviews.author: Yolanda M
reviews.text: Great atmosphere, and we were seated right away. To be honest, I wasn't impressed with my meal, pasta with beef and I took a slice of my friends pizza and I felt the sauce was thin. Loved the calamari. The drink was good too, it was a flavored Moscow Mule.

reviews.author: Nick Ed
reviews.text:
Dorlan's, located in the historic South Street Seaport in New York City, is a fantastic spot that perfectly balances a classic pub atmosphere with high-quality food and drinks. I recently went there and was thoroughly impressed, especially by their take on comfort food classics.

My friends and I were craving something hearty, and we were not disappointed. We ordered a big chicken sandwich and a juicy burger to share, and both were outstanding. The chicken sandwich was a true showstopper‚Äîperfectly fried to a golden crisp while remaining incredibly moist and tender on the inside. It was a generous size and had a fantastic, flavorful crunch with every bite. The burger was equally impressive. It was cooked to a perfect medium, with a patty so juicy and rich that it practically melted in your mouth. The classic toppings and a toasted bun made for a flawless burger experience.

What made the meal even better were the sides and drinks. The fries were a perfect companion, hot and crispy, and just the right amount of salt. And the cocktails were excellent. We each had a few different ones, and they were all expertly mixed and well-balanced‚Äîthey weren't just an afterthought but a highlight of the meal. The entire place has a warm and inviting vibe, and the staff was friendly and attentive. For a spot that feels like a cozy neighborhood tavern but serves up incredible, elevated pub fare and great drinks, Dorlan's is a definite winner.

reviews.author: xyztech
reviews.text:
I‚Äôve been here a few times with the family, and the food has been excellent during previous visits, which is why we chose to return recently.

Most of the dishes were great, but unfortunately, the hamburger sliders were severely undercooked. One of the servers (not the one attending to us) took the sliders back with the intention of correcting the raw patties, only to return with them still undercooked. It appeared they put our half-chewed sliders back into the oven or a plate to try to cook them, but they were still raw.

We had to tell the server that we did not want the raw ground beef patties.

Our actual server was friendly and took the sliders off our bill.

We will be returning, but likely will not be trying the sliders again.

reviews.author: G Margary
reviews.text: By far, the BEST watermelon margarita I have tasted has been at this spot! Delicious!!üçâüçπüëåüèº Their buffalo chicken wrap and fries were very good too. The service was excellent. Recommend to try.

reviews.author: Jack Barry
reviews.text: Place is great - year round. An NYC Seaport staple. Food and service is awesome. I‚Äôve also hosted my wedding‚Äôs day-after party as well as a surprise 30th in the private room and I can‚Äôt recommend it enough. Jeanne and the owner are great to work with. Thank you again! Looking forward to the next event with your team soon.

reviews.author: Alexis Bohman
reviews.text: I had a post marathon celebration at Dorlan's after the NYC marathon this year. The food was great, service was amazing (especially Jeanne), and we had a perfect time! We had a bigger-than-expected crowd come to the party and we were able to just flood into the common room which ended up working out great! Would recommend having a party here and I will most definitely be having more in the future!

reviews.author: Kia Curry
reviews.text: Went here for a date last year and it was absolutely stunning.. the food was amazing, I had the prawns and grits and my date had the beef short ribs with eggs Benedict, both dishes was 10/10 . The drinks was hit and miss for me, ended up ordering a regular whiskey shot but the whiskey flights were fun and different

reviews.author: W E
reviews.text: Really nice service and great cocktails and tasting flight. Our waiter was attentive and had good suggestions. We went for the Jazz brunch and wish we also had a distillery tour booked! The food was good but not the main draw. We have no idea why it said that the Croque madame was recommended for two people because it is not big at all.. In fact, I was still quite hungry after the brunch!

reviews.author: Nicole Prien
reviews.text: Traveling to New York for the week and we decided to tour Great Jones to experience how New York compared to the Midwest - best decision ever! Right when you walk in your greeted with the BEST ambiance. It reminded me of old time Great Gastsby! The drinks were fantastic, the service was 20/10 - our tour guide was incredible! Such a fun personality and made our 2-1 such a fun and vibrant experience!

reviews.author: Marshall Peschell
reviews.text:
The first legal whiskey distillery in Manhattan since prohibition. The tour is brief but informative and fun, our tour guide was Amanda 10/10 very funny. The tasting was a nice verity. And they are reopening the speak easy.

The pics are of me eating all the food before we sat down

reviews.author: Tom Mustac
reviews.text: We had a wonderful time! Far beyond the big expectations I walked in with!! I even was able to sign up two new bourbon aficionados!! Miles and the entire team were extremely welcoming and knowledgeable!  It felt more like a gathering with friends I haven‚Äôt seen in a while that a tasting experience and I learned many new things about the process! Looking forward to going back soon and I am a new brand fan! By the way, I hate rye but your rye is fantastic!!

reviews.author: Amanda Moss
reviews.text: I‚Äôm not sure why everyone gives this place such a bad rating. The food is great. The soup dumplings are truly delicious. It is NOT expensive compared to other restaurants, but might be considered pricey for Chinatown. But I don‚Äôt think $5-$12 for a meal is pricey. I don‚Äôt find the service to be rude. It‚Äôs very distant, which is customary in most places outside of the states. They don‚Äôt coddle you, they just take your order and bring you food. Nothing wrong with that. There‚Äôs an ATM upstairs if you forget cash. Literally a delicious, must stop spot in Chinatown. This is my second visit and I‚Äôm just as satisfied.

reviews.author: Amanda Hahn
reviews.text: Went on a dumpling crawl and this place was second best. Soup dumplings couldn‚Äôt have been more perfect though! Super crowded spot

reviews.author: Tien F
reviews.text:
Very frustrating as this place used to be great and now the food is super expensive and it doesn‚Äôt even taste good! I‚Äôd been okay if the food is decent but it‚Äôs not.

The scallion pancake is dry and flakey. The soup dumplings have a weird taste. The dumplings are small and it‚Äôs not like the ones you‚Äôd seen at a proper dim sum restaurant.

Portion is bad and the taste is off. I really don‚Äôt want to be critical to local business but this place needs a complete rethink of their model otherwise it‚Äôll wash up on the shore of closed business

Really hoping for this place to come back!

reviews.author: Angela
reviews.text:
