The elderly owner of this restaurant clearly doesn‚Äôt care about the quality of the food that comes out of her kitchen. While the wait staff were polite and professional, she herself was an absolute nightmare to deal with.
The food was truly disappointing. The oil used tasted old and rancid ‚Äî I immediately had to spit it out. My toddler was hungry, but there was no way I could feed him that food. We ordered a Shanghai-style dish that should have included shrimp and mushrooms, but instead it was made with cheap meat and vegetables. The cutbacks were obvious, and the scallion pancakes tasted frozen and flavorless.
When we politely gave feedback about the quality of the dish, the owner became defensive and tried to bully us, insisting that nothing was wrong. She claimed they ‚Äúonly use new oil‚Äù because they have ‚Äúso many customers,‚Äù yet the restaurant was completely empty on a Saturday night ‚Äî we only ended up here because our favorite Shanghai spot nearby had a 40-minute wait.
She even demanded we pay for the dish despite our concerns. The experience was unpleasant from start to finish. I will never visit this place again, and it‚Äôs a shame to see such a poorly run restaurant misrepresenting the neighborhood‚Äôs dining scene.

reviews.author: Sara Figueroa
reviews.text: Soup dumplings are good, I‚Äôve been here 4 times, each time I come the service gets worse. This will be my last time, not worth it. So sad though, they use to be so different. Worst service in NY.

reviews.author: –ê–ª—ñ–Ω–∞ –ö–æ–Ω–µ—Ç
reviews.text:
Nargis Cafe is our absolute favorite restaurant! My boyfriend and I go there all the time ‚Äî for lunch or dinner, almost every week. We‚Äôve never found a better place than this one! The food is always fresh, delicious, and served in big portions. Everything tastes amazing ‚Äî you can really feel the quality in every dish.

The service is excellent too. Everyone is so friendly and respectful. During Ramadan, they even asked if we were fasting and kindly brought us dates and water as a compliment ‚Äî such a thoughtful gesture! When it was time to eat, they brought our food right away.

What‚Äôs also great is the variety ‚Äî it‚Äôs not only food from Muslim countries like Uzbekistan and Tajikistan, but also Russian and Ukrainian dishes. There‚Äôs something for everyone, so you can always find something you‚Äôll love.

The atmosphere is cozy, the food is perfect, and the whole experience is always wonderful. Nargis Cafe truly feels like our go-to spot. Highly recommend! ‚ù§Ô∏è

reviews.author: Dmitry Tsatskin
reviews.text: We came with my family to celebrate my dad‚Äôs birthday. All the food was delicious, the atmosphere was great, a soft music playing was not so loud and was not annoying. All the staff was very polite and grateful. Said, who served our table, did his job perfectly! We‚Äôll definitely come back another day to have super tasty kebab, manti  and salads!

reviews.author: Kimberly Cordero
reviews.text:
‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è
Absolutely loved my experience at Nargis Cafe in Sheepshead Bay! The food was bursting with flavor ‚Äî perfectly seasoned, fresh, and beautifully presented. The service was warm and attentive, and the atmosphere felt so inviting ‚Äî cozy yet vibrant. Whether you‚Äôre going for a casual dinner or a night out with friends, Nargis never disappoints. Definitely one of Brooklyn‚Äôs gems!

reviews.author: Anya G.
reviews.text: The most delicious and flavorefull food. The presentation is also amazing. Service is impecable, everyone is extremely professional, helpful and friendly.  We go often because the atmosphere is so nice and inviting as well as the food is out of this world. The only downside is- priece of coktails. So extremely expensive!

reviews.author: Chewy M
reviews.text:
This was our first time eating at Nargis and what a pleasant experience it was!  We‚Äôve had Mediterranean, Middle Eastern, & Turkish food many times in the past but this is the first time we had Uzbek cuisine. There are some similarities or cross influences I assume, but the food was unique & delicious in its own rights.  We had lunch & loved the food (see pictures of what we had & descriptions) we ordered and would definitely come back for more!  The atmosphere & ambience was beautiful & clean.  The service was very good‚Äîthe staff were polite & helpful.  No complaints overall.  Only reasons I didn‚Äôt give it 5 stars were minor‚Äîour water glasses were not refilled & staff didn‚Äôt come by to check if anything was needed as hoped.  Something minor but could be improved to make an excellent overall experience.  Here‚Äôs my TA$TE ratings of Nargis:

Taste:5 stars/delicious
Ambience: 5 stars/beautiful & clean
$: 5 stars/very reasonable
Treatment: 4stars/service was very good but can improve on attentiveness
Experience: 5 stars/overall experience was great & would definitely come back!

reviews.author: Rimma
reviews.text:
My fav shawarma spot in the city. That says a lot, because my standards are high.
Plus, the portion is huge - no way you‚Äôre finishing it in one go.

reviews.author: Ihor Chumachenko
reviews.text:
Not the shawarma you‚Äôd expect from home, but it gets the job done

I ordered the Mix Chicken & Pork Shawarma ‚Äì lavash, pork, chicken, tomato, onion, lettuce, pepper, and their signature sauce. It cost about $13 total with tax. They only have one standard size, no small or large options. Preparation was quick.

The lavash was soft at first, but in the parts where it was grilled, it had a better texture. The meat was somewhere in the middle ‚Äì not bad, not great. I‚Äôve already tried similar shawarma in another place run by a Georgian kitchen, and the sauce here had that same familiar taste. I couldn‚Äôt exactly identify the flavor ‚Äì not sweet, not garlicky, not sour ‚Äì but it reminded me of something I‚Äôve had before in that regional style. Ingredient balance was good.

The portion looked like a standard medium shawarma. It was filling, but by the end it started to fall apart, which made it messy to eat. There‚Äôs seating available inside, and they offered a choice between spicy or not spicy. That was a nice touch.

Overall, I‚Äôd rate it 3.5 out of 5. The place is decent, and the food is edible and filling. But if you‚Äôre looking for that crispy, bold Ukrainian-style shawarma ‚Äì this is not the place. Don‚Äôt expect the same flavor you‚Äôre used to from back home.

reviews.author: Jane Sh
reviews.text: A modest cafe with a modest interior. But this did not stop us from while away the time here with a friend before an apointment . We wanted to drink coffee, but there was none, but fortunately there was tea, we took a cake each, they were not bad, only a bit dry, I would have liked more cream. In general, the cafe is not for gatherings, it is better to take the order  and eat it at home

reviews.author: Azu S
reviews.text: My friends tagged this place on Instagram, and I wanted to try it too. When we received the shawarma order, it was huge, and I was very hungry. I thought, "Now I'll enjoy a tasty shawarma ." Unfortunately, the shawarma wasn't delicious. I'm not usually picky about food, but there was so much mayonnaise that it became unpleasant. The usually shawarma itself is very caloric, on top of that, there was so much mayonnaise.I thought it was just a lot of mayo at the beginning, but the entire shawarma was soaked in it. The chicken was very salty. Maybe I was just unlucky. Now imagine a large amount of salty meat, lots of mayonnaise, and a few vegetables. It lacked freshness and some additional sauce other than mayonnaise.

reviews.author: Nino Tchanturidze
reviews.text: My favorite shaurma place in Brooklyn! They make it so deliciously and the service is impeccable, especially their worker Tamara. She is always behind the counter with a big, bright smile and positive energy. 10/10, I would 100% recommend coming here.

reviews.author: Krandon
reviews.text:
Got tons of compliments because of how naturally pretty it is on its own ‚Äî string lights and lanterns are really a vibe especially at night! We were looking for a more intimate and casual setting rather than a more formal wedding in a reception hall and we fell in love with the food and the place going for dinner one night. Service was great on the night of and communication beforehand was top notch. Meryl was incredibly helpful with the logistics and provided not only reccomendations on vendors but also how to optimize the space (due to our large guest count). They were receptive to our thoughts and ideas of how we wanted the night to go and how it would fit with their space. They also lent us a projector to play a game and provided some of the decor (small candles, lanterns, and hanging linens). Overall they‚Äôre a well-oiled machine with the best food (3 course plated meal) ‚Äî they‚Äôre a restaurant after all! 100% would reccomend duck confit. Our wedding coordinator said that we were given a very good price for the superb level and quality of service that was included. Overall, the staff are lovely and shows how passionate they are about making our big day wonderful -- would rate this a 100 out of 10 experience.

Regardless if you‚Äôre looking to have your wedding here or not ‚Äî 100% you should come here in a regular day have dinner here!!! My husband and I sometimes just drop by to eat (p.s. don‚Äôt think about it and just get the bread and butter). Super accessible by train! :) We come all the way from Flushing -- that's how yummy their food is :P

reviews.author: Anastasiia Semenenko
reviews.text:
We had our wedding at Bacchus and it was everything we could have hoped for and more. From the very beginning, the team was attentive and caring, making sure every detail felt smooth and stress-free. On the day itself, the atmosphere was warm, beautiful, and intimate ‚Äî exactly the kind of setting we had imagined for celebrating with our closest family and friends.

The food was outstanding. So many of our guests kept telling us how much they loved every dish, and we couldn‚Äôt agree more. It really felt like we were sharing a meal that was crafted with love and intention, which made it even more meaningful for us.

What stood out the most was the way the staff handled everything with such calm professionalism while still being kind and personal. We never once had to worry about anything ‚Äî they made sure we could actually be present and enjoy the day.

Bacchus will always hold such a special place in our hearts. We‚Äôre so grateful to everyone there for helping us create memories we‚Äôll cherish forever.

reviews.author: Stanley Yashayev
reviews.text:
We captured a wedding (both photo and video) at Bacchus Bistro recently, and it was one of the most intimate and memorable celebrations we‚Äôve been part of.

The entire venue has such a warm, inviting vibe, starting with the beautiful outdoor space where the reception was held. It felt effortlessly charming and photographed beautifully throughout the evening. Inside, the bar and dining area gave off that cozy, timeless feel you only really get from a true restaurant venue.

The staff was fantastic, organized, welcoming, and clearly experienced with events. And the food? Genuinely incredible. It's something we always notice when weddings are hosted at restaurants instead of traditional venues: the quality and consistency of the food are just on another level.

The guest count was around 150, and it felt like the perfect number for the space, everyone was comfortable, and nothing felt overcrowded.

A really special spot for couples who want a celebration that feels personal, elegant, and food-focused. We‚Äôd go back in a heartbeat.

reviews.author: Olga NYC
reviews.text:
I recently dined at this French restaurant and had an enjoyable experience. The food was well-prepared and flavorful, showing clear attention to detail. The service was excellent, our main server was attentive, and another staff member on the floor kept us laughing with lighthearted jokes, which really added to the atmosphere.
For dessert, we tried the tarte Tatin. It was tasty but served with whole baked apple rather than the traditional peeled and sliced style, which I personally prefer. Even so, it was delicious.
Overall, I would recommend this restaurant for its great food, friendly service, and lively dining experience.

reviews.author: Collin Bowen
reviews.text:
Bacchus treats you like family. The owner of the restaurant, Bruno, gave us our first tour, the wedding and event coordinator Meryl helped us to plan every detail of an all-inclusive wedding and we were beyond satisfied every step of the way. Likewise, Meryl and her staff were responsive, kind, understanding, and patient with our persistent communication and innumerable questions. Holding to French tradition - they offered incomparable food and drink options, including options for vegan guests, and offered a variety of ways to reach the food and beverage minimum, like additional desserts and wine pairings.

On our wedding day, Meryl and her team were at our sides when we needed them and taking care of everything else such as setting up our unconventional guest book, and ensuring that we kept on pace with our wedding day schedule so we didn‚Äôt worry about it.

Bacchus Bistro offers unparalleled value, incredible familial service, and a neighborhood or backyard ambiance that made it an easy choice for my wife and I. Their food and drinks are truly incredible, change seasonally, and will always leave you dreaming for the next time you can return.

We have a special place in our hearts for Bacchus. So much so that when we returned a year later to celebrate our anniversary, Meryl and Francois greeted us by name, wished us a happy anniversary, and helped us to celebrate even while they were hosting another wedding.

reviews.author: ADI N
reviews.text: Food was moderate. If you wanna chill out and relax with good vibe this is the place where you‚Äôre looking for. Cocktail was so good and creative. Staffs were friendly and attentive. I love the atmosphere and surrounded. Recommend to reserve table!!!

reviews.author: Mimi Coleman
reviews.text: Loved the overall vibeü§ç super chill with gorgeous decor, and the outdoor seating is perfect for warm nights. My favorite cocktail was the lychee one (forgot the name), but it was so fresh and well-balanced. The food was just okay, but the drinks and atmosphere totally make up for it. Definitely coming back!

reviews.author: Alyssa Kearney
reviews.text:
My husband and I had a great time at Jungle Bird. It's located up a flight of stairs and has a fun, vacation-bungalow vibe. We went on a Saturday evening and loved the atmosphere‚Äîlively without being overly packed.

We sat at the bar, enjoyed a few snacks and rum cocktails‚Äîeverything was great! The entire staff was friendly, and the bartender was attentive and fun to chat with.

We visit NYC often and will definitely be back but if you're a local, check this place out!

reviews.author: Jared Davis
reviews.text: Jungle Bird is a spectacular dimly-lit bar in Chelsea. Me and my friends enjoy coming here. They have a wonderful happy hour and in the summer they have outdoor seating which is great. Yesterday I had the delicious mezcal spicy margarita on the happy hour menu and it came out great. I also want to highlight the La Bailadora which is fruity and delicious. The food menu is not as expansive or daring. The staff are amazing - shoutout to Angie, he‚Äôs great!

reviews.author: Nicholas Hester
reviews.text: Really exotic cocktail menu I though. All the drinks are super fun and they tell you what glass you‚Äôre going to get them in!!!!! Absolutely love that. Good spot to step in for a post shift drink, also a lot of sidewalk seating which I love

reviews.author: Lauren S
reviews.text:
Golden Wuish is an absolute gem for anyone who loves Peking duck. Their signature Peking duck is exceptional perfectly fatty, salty, crispy, and full of rich flavor. The Flaming Peking Duck is a true standout, not only for the impressive presentation but for the quality and taste that fully deliver. Paired with scallions, cucumber, and soft pancakes, it captures everything I love about authentic Peking duck.

The menu blends Asian and Latin flavors in such a creative way, making every dish feel bold and unique. I also loved the duck bone soup that comes with the meal; it‚Äôs comforting, flavorful, and the perfect complement to the duck. You can choose half Peking duck and half smoked duck or go for the full Peking duck which I definitely recommend.

If you‚Äôre a duck lover, Golden Wuish should be at the top of your list. The food, flavors, and overall experience truly make it worth the visit.

reviews.author: xuqi zhang
reviews.text:
We had an absolutely wonderful dinner at Golden Wuish last night! Four of us ‚Äî friends and family ‚Äî went together, and everything from start to finish was excellent. The restaurant has a warm, inviting atmosphere, and the staff made us feel right at home.
The food was outstanding ‚Äî every dish was beautifully prepared and full of flavor. The highlight of the night was definitely the Peking duck experience. It was carved tableside to perfection ‚Äî crispy skin, tender meat, and served with the classic accompaniments. You can tell a lot of care and skill goes into every step of the meal.
A big shout-out to Angelina, who provided truly exceptional service. She was attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable, guiding us through the menu and making sure everything was perfect. Her warmth and professionalism really stood out and made our evening even more special.
We left completely satisfied and already planning our next visit. Highly recommend Golden Wuish for anyone who loves authentic flavors, excellent service, and a memorable dining experience!

reviews.author: Mario Alex Gonzalez
reviews.text: A gem of a restaurant tucked away in the financial district. Great service, fantastic food, and relatively solid prices for a high quality dining experience. The half duck was absolutely phenomenal, and I would highly advise you get that or even the whole duck if with another person. Making the buns is a fun and delicious experience, but eating the duck on its own was the true star of the show. It was the most beautifully crispy skin combined with the perfectly tender meat of the duck, with fat that was like candy between it all. Get the duck and have a time

reviews.author: Jacob Kyle
reviews.text: Golden Wuish (The Duckhouse) is a true gem that delivers an unforgettable dining experience every time. From the moment you step inside, you‚Äôre welcomed by a warm and elegant atmosphere that perfectly complements the restaurant‚Äôs exceptional cuisine. The staff is courteous, attentive, and genuinely dedicated to ensuring guests feel comfortable and satisfied. The food is absolutely outstanding‚Äîespecially the duck, which is tender, flavorful, and perfectly cooked.

reviews.author: Jonathan (Flavor Wanderer)
reviews.text:
Had a very good experience at the Golden Wuish. The main event is definitely the Flaming Peking Duck. The show was definitely cool (If you order the HALF duck, there is NO SHOW), but the duck itself was a little on the greasy side, but the meat was definitely tasty.

Besides the Peking Duck, we also ordered the following:

Black Truffle Soup Dumplings: 8/10
Steam Clams: 9/10
Duck Egg Pea Shoots: 9/10
Squid Ink Fried Rice: 9/10
Lucky Tao: 8/10
Sunset Daiquiri: 7/10

Overall, it was was a good experience but for the price of the Full Peking Duck, it'll be just a one time experience.

name: becks TAVERN
address: 881, Peaceful Valley Road, North Creek, NY, 12853

reviews.author: Aa Aa
reviews.text: Ate outdoors with live bluegrass music, and the ambiance was nice. The beet salad itself was disappointing, beets seemed canned, there were barely any nuts in the salad either. The pierogi were clearly mass produced and cooked from frozen. The pork schnitzel was very tasteless, literally tasted like nothing. Chicken was dry.

reviews.author: Summer Wick
reviews.text: We have a cabin in North River and frequent Beck's Tavern often. As a vegan, I super appreciate their attention to dietary needs (they have a special menu to share so you know what's in your food). I love their house made veggie burger - seriously one of the best around! So many places only offer a beyond burger, so I truly appreciate the effort they put in. They have a pretty extensive menu. My hubby loves the pierogies, the kraut and the potato pancakes, and my kiddo loves the chicken tenders and fries. There have salads, schnitzel, sausages, so many options for all dietary needs. They have a great beer selection and the outside area is awesome - they often have acoustic sets on the weekends. The yurts are also really fun to just go and grab a drink. I highly recommend stopping by Beck's Tavern when in town - both in winter and summer!

reviews.author: Kate
reviews.text:
Stopped for food and was pretty good. The portions are big but pricey. Small menu. It‚Äôs a german based menu which was weird because the atmosphere is more Adirondack and ski vibes so I don‚Äôt understand the german reference. The service was not too good. Both of our servers were awkward and didn‚Äôt know how to take our order or answer easy questions about beer/food. However the food came out fast.
After the food we explored outside and it is such a cute neat little place. There are a couple yurts with a cozy atmosphere inside. There‚Äôs a bar, tables, TV, games, darts and more to hang out. The outside area is also so cool with live music and tons of chairs.
Overall, probably wouldn‚Äôt go back for food but if you‚Äôre looking for a neat place to hang out with friends/family this is it!

reviews.author: Michael Pomarico
reviews.text:
Great for drinking. Good vibe. But the food, not so good.  The schnitzel was tough and had no taste.

Be best to stock with beer and wings.

reviews.author: JS O'Connor
reviews.text: Fun local bar with a German-inspired full menu and big beer+cocktail selection. You can book lodging right across the parking lot and not have to worry about driving after an evening of apres fun.

reviews.author: Lisa J
reviews.text:
Because of the comments in the reviews, we started the line in front of the door at 5:20 pm on a Sat.  By opening time, there were10 people behind us.  By 6 pm, the restaurant was full, including seating at the bar.  There are only 6 two-tops, 6 seats at the bar and ?5 booths that can seat 6.  They do take names and numbers to contact later arrivals when a table opens.  Tonight, it was after 7 pm before one did.
We absolutely enjoyed our meal with an excellent 2006 Pomerol.  There was a large lag before our main arrived, and I forgot to take a picture until we had already dug in.  Service was friendly and efficient.  The Beef Tartare was prepared classically and was delicious.  The c√¥te de boeuf was somewhat tough inn places, but the demi-glace was heavenly and made up for it.  It was served on the rare side of med.-rare.  I splurged on chocolate cake, and it was worth every calorie! (light and fluffy with excellent cocoa flavor).  My husband loves Pedro Ximenez sherry, and deigned to eat it over vanilla ice cream. ;)

reviews.author: Mario Alex Gonzalez
reviews.text: An absolutely incredible dining experience in every aspect. The food, atmosphere, and service all complimented each other beautifully and made for a stunning night. The meal is ordered all at once and coursed out, allowing to be continuously one upped by the last item and be continuously impressed by the dishes. The appetizer dishes blew me away and somehow the food maintained or surpassed the quality at every turn.  Service was impeccable and very well informed on all the dishes, exactly what you would expect from a restaurant of this caliber. No weak points in this dinner at all. Highly highly recommend coming here if you are looking for an elegant and delicious meal that will blow you away, as long as you‚Äôre prepared to pay accordingly, but it will be worth it.

reviews.author: Sally Freeman
reviews.text:
Not sure I quite understand the ‚Äòhype‚Äô around this restaurant. We were advised by our waitress to order 2-3 plates each (hors d‚Äôoevre, salad etc) and a main course. By ordering it all at the same time, the kitchen could plan our meal experience accordingly.
However we only really wanted a main course each (and dessert) and were told that was fine but if we didn‚Äôt order a starter, we would have quite a long wait for our main courses.
45 minutes later our main courses arrived (steak frites). No idea why it needed to take so long. We‚Äôd never had steak frites served this way (steak was pre sliced) and the steak was excellent, however the frites were luke warm at best and so crispy you couldn‚Äôt eat them with a fork. We mentioned this to the waitress who said ‚Äòthat‚Äôs how they‚Äôre supposed to be served‚Äô‚Ä¶..wrong. She did then go back to the kitchen and in due course we received a basket of perfectly cooked, hot frites, just as we were finishing our steak. Clearly the first batch had been regenerated and were not fresh. At $40 dollars a piece I would have expected better quality control from the kitchen. This totally spoilt our experience so we left without ordering dessert.

reviews.author: B. E.
reviews.text:
Excellent service and exceptional food, best of the sit-down dinner restaurants I've eaten at in Ithaca.

Photos:
French 75
Salad Lyonnaise
Ricotta Gnocchi
Duck Breast

reviews.author: Sophia Chiang
reviews.text:
Fantastic French onion soup. Also ordered the steak for two (daily special) upon recommendation by waiter - disappointing (no flavor and a little tough) the gnocchi was also mid. The celeriac salad was very good.

We arrived 20 minutes before opening and just made the first seating.

reviews.author: Joe Bergovoy
reviews.text: I just visited this location and it did not disappoint! First of all, Patrick who was behind the counter was so patient and kind. Eventually I ordered and it was a wholesome and hearty chili tofu noodle bowl! The space was clean and quiet and I thoroughly enjoyed my lunch there.

reviews.author: Anthony Khalifeh
reviews.text:
After a full week in New York‚Äînavigating a minefield of processed indulgences, seed oils, and dopamine-loaded distractions‚ÄîSpringbone wasn‚Äôt just a meal. It was a realignment.

I walked in at the tail end of a 24-hour fast, gut inflamed, spine tense, and nervous system fried. What I found was clean fire‚Äîreal food engineered for recovery, regeneration, and performance.

I ordered the BBQ Chicken Bowl and the New Roots Beef Bone Broth. Here‚Äôs the breakdown:
‚Ä¢	The Bowl delivered on all levels: clean protein from chicken breast, glycogen-replenishing sweet potatoes, cruciferous detox from cabbage and kale, and a kick of fermented brightness from pickled turnips. The BBQ sauce? Subtle, smoky, and not a sugar trap‚Äîflavor without compromise.
‚Ä¢	The Broth was elite: grass-fed beef simmered into liquid collagen, infused with ginger, garlic, and vitamin C. It wasn‚Äôt just warm‚Äîit was ancestral. My gut thanked me. My brain rebooted. My joints softened their complaints.

What hit hardest? This entire meal was free of seed oils, gluten, and refined sugar. It didn‚Äôt just nourish‚Äîit upgraded.

In a world full of food that numbs, Springbone fuels. Approved for all my clients because it honors the code: intellect, precision, optimization, evolution.

reviews.author: Ariel Smith
reviews.text: Ordered the honey Dijon salmon bowl and this is what I got. The man helping me was extremely rude from start to finish and this portion is unacceptable for $18. I‚Äôve ordered from this restaurant before via uber eats and the food has been great but the in person experience was awful.

reviews.author: anna
reviews.text: Today I decided to try Springbone for the first time and the food was delicious and fresh and the customer service experience was amazing. A kind employee named Earl took my order and gave me great recommendations for my bowl which I greatly appreciate as I was not familiar with the options! As someone with food sensitivities and hoping to eat healthier the service and quality I received at this Springbone was very meaningful. I will definitely be returning!

reviews.author: Lee-Bee
reviews.text:
DELICIOUS !  Everything gluten free!  We spent about $39 for two people including a drink.
My kid got: Bone Broth with chicken, veggies, hot sauce and immunity mix. FABULOUS!
Mine was Grandma's chicken with rice (roasted carrots & veggies) Yummy!  Wish I'd gotten the bone broth to add to the chicken, one trial of that was heavenly. It was a bit dry without the hot sauce added, I got that on the side but adding it made it amazing.

Leftovers for 3 of us as a hearty snack later, 2 who hadn't been there, everyone really enjoyed it. And those 2 are picky.

Two workers there extremely nice.  One spoke English pretty well, though we had a small misunderstanding in the order, I caught it.  No big deal. She was so sweet helpful and efficient. Warm and kind person.  Other employee had little English, and was amazingly caring and attentive to her job and excellent, healthy delicious fast meals were provided to us and many others in short period of time. Most others were pickup or delivery, high volume handled well. For English speakers I recommend double checking the info and orders patiently and gracefully.  The intention to provide accurate excellent service is fully there, with the women we met.

This was yesterday, 6/26/24 around 7:45.  Even though it was so close to closing time, they balanced clean up and making sure we felt 100% welcomed every moment.  ¬°Muchas gracias!  Looking back wish I'd tipped more.  Give them both a bonus!

reviews.author: Jenna Kroeger
reviews.text: Hot Jalape√±o! Much love to the staff, especially our server and the live singer. I had beef fajita (27$ w tip in cash - credit card fee). So good; ate that UP! Our server kept us hydrated and was very nice and approachable. The singer invited us to do karaoke which I very much wanted to do but ultimately wasn‚Äôt up to it. I did make a song request which she honored, and I adored. So scrumptious all around. We loved the queso w chorizo!!!! What would be great is complimentary chips and salsa

reviews.author: Robin Mandel
reviews.text: Adorable restaurant with authentic Mexican food. I loved the outdoor patio and music. Good happy hour & Taco Tuesday. Get the guac!

reviews.author: Tip Tip
reviews.text: My husband and I stopped in here while hanging out in Harlem. The food was delicious! It was very flavorful, wonderfully seasoned. We had nachos, fajitas, enchiladas, tres leches cake, & churros. The desserts were the best I've had in years! I'd definitely recommend dining here and I'll absolutely be back.

reviews.author: Wendy LES
reviews.text: This place must use the grimiest oil to cook ever. I‚Äôm not one to have digestive issues. I‚Äôve come here 3 times and every time I get the worst heartburn, and I never get heartburn. Do as you please with this information. I would not recommend. Also the pre-made margaritas are weak.

reviews.author: Joe Steele
reviews.text: Great little Mexican place in East Harlem.  The happy hour has drinks discounted (from 4-7pm M-F I believe) and the drinks were very tasty.  We even came back the next night just for drinks.  The food and service was excellent.  The atmosphere was perfect and relaxing.  They do have a ramp over the entrance stairs.  I would highly recommend stopping by after work for some great food and tasty drinks.

reviews.author: Rowan
reviews.text: This place is SO GOOD!! Service is so fast and everything is delicious! The broth the tikka masala comes in is so good I could eat it like soup! Lovely atmosphere and gorgeous decorations.

reviews.author: Judy Hahn
reviews.text: It was a hot Saturday night at 6:30pm, and we had the most delicious, aromatic, perfectly plated, nicely served dinner. Our waiter answered our endless questions and shared great recommendations. We felt like the cook was thrilled that we ordered too much food because there weren't many people there.  Don't overlook the essential tomato salad. The salmon was perfect.  And the  fig& fire chicken tagine was an absolute star.  Our friends loved their food as well. Oh and even if you think you don't like couscous,which a couple of us were meh on, you have to try the couscous. Yuuummm.  An A is on the window, the music- perfect, the decor charming, & it is easy to get to.  We will go backüíØ

reviews.author: Jada Knight
reviews.text: If you're looking for Moroccan style food, but in a modern way, this is definitely your place to go with full flavors on your tongue, the best food in the city honestly, and very healthy too. Being Woman owned makes it 1000√ó times better! A must place to eat in the city, hands down, never disappoint üòé Check out our video and follow on Instagram @JadaExploresAll

reviews.author: He Wi
reviews.text: Perfection! Great food, great service, great ambiance, other patrons weren‚Äôt too loud (because the music wasn‚Äôt too loud!). We ordered chicken harissa for the appetizer then for the main course we ordered lamb shepherds pie and lamb kebab, all of which was very tasty and boy, their portion‚Äìfor the price‚Äìwas generous! On top of that, if you drink, the have all-day happy hour for 5 bucks! You can‚Äôt beat that. Service was very friendly, warm, profesional, and quick! Again, the volume of the music was so important because it was not too loud and everybody didn‚Äôt need to yell. What a perfect Friday afternoon. Thank you Tara Kitchen! Btw, since the portion was so generous, we didn‚Äôt have space to order dessert. Next time tho. Oh, and sorry if the photo of the chicken harissa was blurry.

reviews.author: Jovana Isevski
reviews.text: Wow, what an experience this was! This is definitely one of my favorite restaurants in NY, I wish I had discovered it earlier. The food was so delicious, I can‚Äôt quite name my favorite because all of them were favorite! We got some pita bread with dips, carrots with hummus (which was far from the ordinary), egg rolls (wow! maybe my favorite?), chicken sandwich, orange salad, mango dessert, and more. And I shouldn‚Äôt forget the cocktails! Go for the salt and pepper martini if you like non-sweet drinks. The service was also outstanding. Omar really made us feel welcomed and took great care of us. Will be counting days to my next visit‚Ä¶

reviews.author: Mia Huynh
reviews.text:
A LIC staple, this diner is open 24/7 and has been a consistent go to spot for my friends and I after a long night out. The interior has lots of seating, with both booth and table seating, and bright lights. The service here is fairly quick and staff are nice.

When my friend and I went, we got some wings and two sandwiches. The wings were pretty solid and came with a bleu cheese sauce. The sandwiches were also great (considering it was 4am). Both dishes came with fries, which I thought were alright (but I'm not the biggest fry person). Overall, decent and reliable spot for some good American diner food.

reviews.author: Alexandra F (Alex)
reviews.text: Very kind service, and an authentic American diner experience. Locals and tourists alike should visit. Menu was extensive, and everything tasted GOOD. Not your usual ‚Äúdecent diner food‚Äù. I had the best Belgian waffle here I‚Äôve ever had, and everything was absolutely delicious. Truly authentic American cuisine.

reviews.author: Food Soul
reviews.text: Amazing breakfast!!! The toasts were amazing!!! Perfect sweet, crispy on the ouside, soft and fluffy on the inside, warm and on top wirh icing. Eggs were also good. How perfect to start the day!! The atmosphere was nice and cozy. We got good service too. They also have all the condiments on the table for you.

reviews.author: trevon brow
reviews.text: Great vibes me and my wife we bought the calamari as Appetizer And then we had a triple-decker turkey sandwich that was good as well, but should‚Äôve bought something else but I love the experience a very great time. We went there at 12 o‚Äôclock at night. Definitely coming back with me and my wife. Definitely enjoyed it. Five stars for me.

reviews.author: DBe
reviews.text:
Came for a 4 am bite to eat after an evening out.
The place had a significant amount of people dining after a lively Friday. We were able to get a booth within a couple of minutes. We ordered a chicken noodle soup, waffle, chicken triple decker with curly fries and a cup of coffee. Everything was great. It was what was needed to get some energy to head home.
Glad we still can count on the court diner for 24hr food options.

name: Cantina Mexicana
address: 140, New Dorp Lane, Staten Island, NY, 10306

reviews.author: Yoyou
reviews.text:
We ordered the steak and blackened chicken fajitas.   The sangria was well made.   The staff, owners were very accommodating, gracious and friendly.
This was our 1st visit and it won't be our last.  We can't wait to dine there again!

reviews.author: Nancy I M
reviews.text:
With a diner-like appearance and colorful plates to add a southwestern palette, this place is like a Mexican / Diner hybrid. Upon entry, I noticed a cozy enclosed outdoor seating area, followed by a few steps up to the main entrance. Evening street parking was a breeze. Famished, we sat toward the back and commenced with two appetizers: guacamole with hearty tortillas chips (they don‚Äôt break when you scoop up the guacamole), and Choriqueso (melted cheese, chorizo, Picolo de gallo, guacamole, flour tortillas), I wasn‚Äôt crazy about the salsa, however, the guacamole was very good.
I decided to try the Toro Narte√±o (grilled steak, jalape√±o, pico de Galli, Monterey cheddar cheese). Which was very tasty, I found the jalape√±o to be very fresh and crunchy, and My husband ordered the Enchiladas Suizas (pulled chicken, green salsa, corn tortillas, cheddar cheese, Monterey, Avocado, pickled red onions, rice & black beans). I didn‚Äôt like it at all, the tortilla tasted like it was made with all-purpose flour and the chicken was soggy. Rice and beans were ok. Our friend ordered the Burrito Classico (ground beef, shrimp, steak), he liked it. Our waiter was very friendly and attentive. His recommendations for desserts that were made on premises were everything on the menu except the ice cream and mexican coffee cake. So we ordered the tres leches and the Mexican coffee cake (because I heard it‚Äôs made with mascarpone cheese! So it‚Äôs like tiramis√π without the coffee). They really aced the Tres Leches. As a side note, if you have a sensitivity to msg, you should let them know because they do use adobo in their cooking.

4 stars are for cleanliness, wait staff, appetizers and dessert.

reviews.author: David Wallman
reviews.text: Delicious local Mexican food! Sometimes when I visit my fianc√©‚Äôs family in SI we will come here for lunch and it never disappoints! Today we went with guac to start and then tacos. They refilled our chips multiple times for no charge! The Pina el pastor and el ranchero tacos were delicious and we‚Äôd definitely get them again!

reviews.author: J Cee
reviews.text: 20/10 recommend!!! Ordered from Grubhub and the food was still HOT!! Tacos and chimichangas are amazing!!! Definitely a new go to!!

reviews.author: Nicole Puma
reviews.text: Not only is the staff awesome they enjoyed Cinco de Mayo  they made are night...The food was outstanding short rib tacos, shrimp chicken and steal fajitas outrageous ....guacamole was soo fresh ... beef nachos were amazing  I will be coming back again and again love this place ...

reviews.author: Ray Wu Adventures
reviews.text:
Woooow such an amazing experience! Stepping into this restaurant was like going back in time 60 years to a bygone era of the godfather and goodfellas. Tuxedo clad waiters and a dress code with classy 1960s era of fine dining was such a cool experience. Our waiter Jerry was soooo classy, funny, and friendly! He was able to explain everything in the menu with detail and gave us awesome recommendations.

The food was spectacular 60s era Italian dining with baked clams, veal Parmesan, and an absolutely massive seafood pasta platter that they served on still in the pan.

Absolutely spectacular gargiulo‚Äôs is a must visit when you come to Coney Island, grazie mille!

reviews.author: Diane Stevers
reviews.text: We had just arrived in town and needed a nice meal. Wow, did we hit the jackpot! Greeted at the door by the owner, atmosphere was gorgeous yet comfortable, food was amazing, Emilio, our server, was not only professional, but friendly, and made our dining experience that much more special. Very reasonably priced for this quality of food and level of service.  On the way out we spoke to George, the bartender, I can‚Äôt wait to come back and try one of his espresso martinis! Thank you!

reviews.author: Rev Dr. Leon Daryl Williams, Jr
reviews.text: Held 60th Birthday, 10th Anniversary combined celebration. Had a great time. Service was outstanding and atmosphere perfect. Anthony and his team are to be commended. Reasonably priced also. Thanks again.

reviews.author: Douglas Considine
reviews.text: It's been way too long since my last visit to Gargiulo's. It was even better than I had remembered. We'll worth the trip, you won't be disappointed.

reviews.author: Jean Farrell
reviews.text: The food here is absolutely divine, and the atmosphere is simply electrifying! The live music adds a whole new level of excitement. It's impossible to resist the urge to jump up and dance! We decided to celebrate Valentine's Day here, and let me tell you, it was an exceptional experience. I cannot recommend this place enough.

reviews.author: Infinite Charmz
reviews.text: Top tier service and quality food/drinks. Every Wednesday night is Bingo and every Thursday is happy hour & karaoke and it‚Äôs always the absolute best.

reviews.author: Brian McKain
reviews.text:
My server was extraordinary. Such a nice kid and seemed genuinely interested in what this old man was doing in Astoria on a Monday evening.

And the Chano's Burrito was excellent. My server did recommend the Broccoli Burrito (not vegetarian) after I ordered.

And great prices on Happy Hour beers (this isn't Manhattan).

reviews.author: Tristen Huang
reviews.text: Very lovely place to dine. Food was delicious and the restaurant is very beautiful inside. Absolutely loved the mofongo, but every dish we ordered was awesome. The molcajete is great to try a bunch of different things, and it comes with tortillas. The sauce is quite salty and tangy, but still I highly recommend it. They have pretty generous ‚Äúhappy hour‚Äù hours, so before 7pm on weekdays you can get a good deal on some drinks!

reviews.author: Madeline Little
reviews.text:
Whatever you‚Äôre doing, whatever you THINK you know about great New York food - shut up and GO TO CHANOS.

It‚Äôs the best food you‚Äôve put in your mouth. Period.

It‚Äôs the best drinks you‚Äôve had. Period.

It‚Äôs the most fun you‚Äôll have, and if you don‚Äôt come back time and again feel free to @ me because you just don‚Äôt know what you‚Äôre missing.

Incredible. Chano cannot be beat. It‚Äôs one of those places that you think back to when you‚Äôre eating subpar Mexican for triple the cost. It‚Äôs the only place in nyc I recommend to everyone I can. I feel like a broken infomercial but I cannot deny how damn good ALL the food, drink, and deserts are!

Just go. Stop reading this, GO.

reviews.author: Gwisun Kim
reviews.text: If you're looking to enjoy a taste of Mexican-style decor and flavors, and want to savor simple summer dishes with a refreshing beer, I highly recommend this place!

reviews.author: Andr√©s Berl
reviews.text: Another average Italian restaurant on the UES

reviews.author: Lara
reviews.text: Lovely neighborhood spot for a date night! The pasta here is always on point! This restaurant has become one of our go to‚Äôs, will be back again soon.

reviews.author: Laura Grubb
reviews.text: We walked in with a reservation for Saturday lunch. The gnocchi was fantastic. As was the the ravioli. A short walk from Bloomingdales. Very romantic and the service was superb. Pricing  was reasonable for upper east side dining. The Gnocchi was  reasonably priced   for lunch at  $14.  The portion was generous. A must in upper east side. In a nutshell quiet and romantic setting with superb Italian fare.

reviews.author: MEGA_ nem
reviews.text: Wonderful hospitality and service. Great local spots with warm and welcoming staff ! Traditional italian eatery.

reviews.author: Casey Golden
reviews.text: The most kind gem in NYC, as a regular solo diner I find this the most cozy to treat myself to a very long dinner and enjoy whatever the chef selects. Perfect in summer outside and cozy in the winter. Prices are perfect and the food is always amazing. Servers‚Äî- ask for Charlie‚Äî so sweet and attentive.

reviews.author: Paulina
reviews.text:
I have had my fair share of tikka masala and biryani. To date, their version is one of the richest in flavor profile. The vegetable pakora is filling by itself. As for service, it is superb as our server was very attentive. He brought us sauces without us asking and our water was always full. The bathroom is all the way inside the kitchen. As you walk, the chefs in the back were so courteous.

I recommend paying a visit for some great indian food in the area.

reviews.author: Michael Fink
reviews.text: Great place for a healthy lunch.  Lunch specials are great.  I come here at least 2-3 times a month.

reviews.author: Salmaan Mulla
reviews.text:
Great experience we had James our server was very attentive and very kind throughout our experience.

The food was tasty we had some of the barbecue chicken which came with separate white rice which was very good. Pro tip ask for some hot chutney on the side. The chicken biryani was very flavorful. The garlic naan and paratha were great as well.

Special thanks to James for making our evening unforgettable.

reviews.author: G Frye
reviews.text: Our Indian family friends recommended this place and commented Mint Masala dishes were closed for what they had back home. We are so glad that we got to have lunch together there and enjoyed a wonderful with friends and delicious food. All the dishes were amazing: chicken tikka masala (red sauce), chicken tikka (no sauce), fish masala, garlic naan, and chicken vandaloo.

reviews.author: Luna Mart√≠nez
reviews.text: Cute, yummy, and cozy! Mint Masala is one of my regular go-to restaurants in the area. The different curries are creamy and delicious, and they can adjust the level of spiciness to your needs. Their vegetable samosas are great and their lentil soup is perfect for a winter day. They have a vegetarian section and other options that can be made vegetarian. It‚Äôs a small spot, so I recommend checking in before heading there!

reviews.author: Martha B.
reviews.text: Get great place to stop in for an inexpensive sandwich order to pick up a small coffee on the way to work. Expect to wait for food to be prepared.

reviews.author: Hiran Beatrine
reviews.text:
Best Food in the neighbour hood
Sucha humble crew

They chef is a nice guy
(Food is spectacular)
The lady at the counter so sweet and humble

The delivery guy
(He is awesome guy as well)

You guys earned a permanent customer

reviews.author: Eurybios ‚ÄúKado‚Äù
reviews.text: Second time grabbing food from this place ,first time i wasn't as vigilant as this second time around , i noticed the man Handling my food , he grabbed raw meat that he tossed in to fry, while waiying for my food to fry as well and even though he had gloves on he didn't change into a new pair or wash hands after being done with the raw meat. And proceeded to handle my food for serving . With raw meat juice still on the gloves ,holy cow man if thats not a red flag I don't know stay vigilant people . If only I hadn't seen that.

reviews.author: Edwin Enriquez
reviews.text: I love the food here! My mom put me on and LORDD it buss

reviews.author: AMF
reviews.text: What restaurant has a near perfect rating? I had to check it out and try something special. Could I have tried 2 eggs, bacon, and home fries? Anyone can cook that! I went with the traditional huevos rancheros. The black beans tasted like they came out of abuela‚Äôs pot at home. I will admit that I did not leave feeling completely full but every bit was perfect. Stop and say hello to the hard working friendly folks at Johnny‚Äôs Cafe.

reviews.author: Kristina Zhegunova
reviews.text: Pastrami Queen was great! The sandwiches were truly excellent ‚Äî especially the roast beef, tongue, and brisket. The beef broth served as a dipping sauce was rich and flavorful. The coleslaw was fresh and perfectly balanced, and the local soda was just the right touch. The place was clean (even the restroom!), we found a table right away, got served quickly, and finished our meal without any delays. The check for three was a bit over $100 ‚Äî definitely worth it for the quality and experience.

reviews.author: Neil Becker
reviews.text: Don‚Äôt get me wrong, I‚Äôm not complaining about the $50.00 per pound pastrami, that‚Äôs always delicious, BUT the packets of prepared mustard just cheapens the entire experience. Here‚Äôs some free advice: fill plastic souffl√© cups w/lids with the same brown, spicy mustard you serve at the tables. Isn‚Äôt that what you used to do? I‚Äôm sure it will be greatly appreciated by others as well.

reviews.author: Melissa Ribeiro
reviews.text: I really wanted to try a typical pastrami sandwich, and I think I chose a great place. It's very small and modest, but it has a unique and authentic atmosphere. The staff was very attentive and friendly. I ordered the traditional sandwich with fries, and there were two of us. It was very tasty.

reviews.author: Mae Bornillo
reviews.text: Loved this pastrami. My top pastrami place along with Katz. We had the pastrami sandwich with noodle soup. Soup was okay but sandwich was phenomenal. I like that they don't add sauce and you do it yourself to suit your taste. We had to wait a little for the table but worth it. Service is fast as well and efficient. They have a decent restroom. Prices are normal as per nyc standard. Would recommend ‚ú®

reviews.author: Donton
reviews.text:
Lets get right to it: $30 for the sandwich wasn‚Äôt worth it. Sandwich wasn‚Äôt horrible, a bit dry and had basic flavor but still edible (for $2 a bite of course) I just feel there shouldn‚Äôt be reviews or ravings of ‚Äúknown for huge sandwiches‚Äù. A huge sandwich should have me full or saving half for later. Im still hungry and Im definitely not a big back. I can appreciate great food for the price but this didn‚Äôt add up for me and I work all over the city to queens and brooklyn. Try it and form your own opinion of course but don‚Äôt go in with high expectations. I didn‚Äôt even have enough dressing to finish the other half of my sandwich.

Ps dont let the photo fool you, sandwich is barely 2 lbs Id say

reviews.author: Andy Kimball
reviews.text: I love this place!  They have amazing bagels.  My favorites are French Toast & Asiago.  Nothing better than a well made L-E-O (Lox, Egg & Onion) on an asiago bagel.  The offer locally sourced meats, wonderful coffee, both hot & cold brew.  A local staple!!!

reviews.author: Meagan Wilcox
reviews.text: Friendly young staff who always give service with a smile. Superior fresh bagels, amazing sandwiches, and cold brew coffee I would travel for. Also if you like flavored cream cheese their house made flavors are plentiful and better then store bought.

reviews.author: Heather Phillips
reviews.text:
They have some great bagels, Sundried Tomato is my go-to, but don't pass on the Emlnergy Wheat Bagel with Peanut Butter!

Get a cup of Recess Coffee while you are there. You won't be disappointed.

Stopped today after an appointment.  Got the Veggies lunch sandwich...lettuce, hummus, sprouts, tomatoes, and cucumber. A nice break from a salad.

reviews.author: Christopher Graham
reviews.text: Got lunch bagel special sandwich and was absolutely delicious, bagels are fresh and ingredients as well. Worth the stop and will visit again

reviews.author: Michael
reviews.text: Food has been excellent, reasonably priced and staff is friendly and great!

reviews.author: Krystal Gill
reviews.text: La  is a great pizza place. The people behind the counter were very attentive and helpful. My family and I ordered a plain pie, a buffalo chicken pie,a white slice and a chicken and broccoli Alfredo slice. They all were delicious. The front of the place is inviting as well. They also have seating area to dine in. It‚Äôs a great place to go for lunch or a quick dinner during the week.

reviews.author: Phil Gill
reviews.text: La Piazza in Staten Island is a standout destination for Italian-American cuisine, particularly renowned for its generous portions and specialty pizza slices. Located at 1445 Richmond Ave in the Stop & Shop Shopping Center, this pizzeria offers a diverse menu featuring classic dishes like pasta, salads, and sandwiches alongside their signature oversized slices loaded with toppings like chicken or calamari.

reviews.author: Kerie S
reviews.text: Great pizza and great service every time. It is our go to on Staten Island. I gave it five stars for everything.  Atmosphere is typical pizza place, not a fancy white glove restaurant but it‚Äôs clean and if you‚Äôre looking for a good old-fashioned pizza place, this is it.  They even know how to make a gluten-free pie taste good.  I already loved the regular pizza before I went gluten-free.  I‚Äôm glad there is still an option for me and there  is great food  for my whole family.

reviews.author: Donnamarie
reviews.text: USE to be my go to place..New owners...noticed soon as I got my delivery. The portions are half of what they were. Also, something tastes different in the all around quality. I dont know if they changed kitchen cook too however I will not be placing anymore orders...I do wish the New owner the best this is just my personal experience. And to the old owner..Thank you for the many years of providing excellent quality food & portions...Best of luck to all

reviews.author: Rare Warrior
reviews.text: I ordered delivery twice from this Pizzeria & Restaurant. I must say I‚Äôm highly impressed with the fresh ingredients, how good the the pizza is, the love the chef puts into the food, the service is good and the staff is extremely friendly which is a plus. I will definitely order from here again because I‚Äôam truly satisfied with everything.

reviews.author: Artem Bakatov
reviews.text:
Time out says that it is a #1 place for fried chicken in NYC. Well, they are wrong.

The chicken isn't bad but it's not the best and I know a good fried chicken when I have it. The seasoning is there but my thing is not juicy enough and at times it's dry. Plus they only have tenders - I want a bigger variety.

Buffalo chicken wrap is very nice - it's a bit spicy, it is juicy and saucy. I would get it again for sure.

The sauces are very nice. Fries are a bit soggy but they look and taste homemade. Biscuits are very good - I enjoyed them. I must add that the sweet iced tea is also delightful - not overly sweet but still feels sugary.

reviews.author: Jeffrey Gomez
reviews.text:
I initially tried the famous Bobwhite Counter chicken Caesar wrap at a food festival and it was pretty good but I never went to the actual restaurant until now.

Me and a friend decided to pull up and it did not disappoint.

Atmosphere is small with a limited amount of seating. Plus they have a kiosk where you can digitally order your food.

If you ask me, this is a better version of Chick-fil-A. They specialize in chicken but have a variety of flavors and options to choose from.

I wasn‚Äôt too hungry so I ordered the famous chicken Caesar wrap with a lemonade.

The Caesar wrap was nice and warm. With the perfect amount of dressing. That chicken was fresh, crispy, and juicy. I enjoyed this Caesar wrap. Also, it wasn‚Äôt too heavy.

The lemonade was sweet and refreshing. Can‚Äôt complain.

I ordered through the kiosk, but service is good here. My food didn‚Äôt take too long. Honestly they may see me again in the near future‚Ä¶

I came back a couple days after. I got the truffle chicken sandwich, Mac & cheese, and lemonade.

I love the simplicity of the menu I feel like I could come in here and order anything and be satisfied.

I brought a friend from out of town here and they got the same items as me. They enjoyed it too.

I forgot his name but shout out to the guy with the dreads who works here. He helped me decide to get the Mac & cheese which was really good.

reviews.author: Dezzie Symone
reviews.text: Even though my food came cold (long distance) it was still good. The barbecue sauce had a little kick to it and I see why people are saying it taste like Popeyes, but it‚Äôs BETTER. The biscuit was cold and it was still soft the pickles were good. I also ordered the chocolate pudding.

reviews.author: Willmary (Will)
reviews.text: Bobwhite food was amazing. Food was super fresh, yummy and satisfying. I order the jalape√±o guy burger with fries. spicy was perfect! The service was superb. My pictures are not the best as I already had taken a bite but believe me the best!

reviews.author: Patrick Zajac
reviews.text:
Y‚Äôall this wrap was FIREEEEE!!! I got the buffalo chicken caesar wrap y‚Äôall that ish was so refreshing yet the chicken stayed so crunchy I was actually impressed. The buffalo and the caesar dressing flavors worked perfectly and the wrap was a pretty decent size.

I also got the raspberry tea which on first sip felt a little watered down with not as much flavor as I‚Äôd hoped, but the more I ate the wrap the more the drink tasted so delicious.

reviews.author: Ivan Klugman
reviews.text: We returned to Nearys after a long break due to Covid and our relocation.  It's was an amazing evening seeing our old friends. Jimmy has passed but his legacy is in good hands with Mary and Una taking over the "Master of Ceremonies" position. All the staff is the same.  Let's talk about the food the Lamb Chops are legendary. We also love the French Onion soup , Prime Rib and Liver. Don't forget to leave room for desert and Irish Coffee !!  The Irish Coffee is fantastic !!

reviews.author: Valerie Mae
reviews.text: I had the Broiled Lamb Chops with mint jelly.  It was tasty and tender.  The baked potato tasted like it was just harvested.  My meal came out within 30 minutes, and it was worth the wait.  I will definitely return to try something else on the menu.

reviews.author: NYC Guide
reviews.text:
This is a classy place with great service. The best lamb chops I ever had!
Excellent service by  Eugenia and Mary. Don‚Äôt forget to wear your collared shirt.

reviews.author: Gail Melisa
reviews.text:
The calves liver with bacon and onions (first photo) is the tastiest one that I have ever had in The City.

The mashed potatoes (second photo) were a creamy delight.

Mary is one of the friendliest managers there is.
Rochelle, the waitress,  provided me good service.

I will return to try the famous lamb chops.

reviews.author: G Mek
reviews.text: A greatly underated establishment in New York. Superb customer service. The friendliest homliest bar/restaurant in New York. The staff are there years which speaks for itself but then so are the customers. You never know who you will meet when you drop in. Great front of house with Mary and Una. 2 brilliant and knowledgeable barmen. Overall 10/10 I'll be back

reviews.author: John Gonsalves
reviews.text:
Llama Inn is a beautiful restaurant with a really inviting and stylish atmosphere. The decor is stunning lots of warm tones, plants, and an overall design that feels both modern and cozy. There‚Äôs even a subtle smell of Palo Santo in the air, which adds a relaxing and unique touch to the experience.
I tried the mariscos dish, which was excellent very flavorful and perfectly balanced. The fried calamari on top was a nice surprise that added great texture. The tuna with cantaloupe ceviche was another standout sweet yet acidic in just the right way, refreshing and layered with flavor.
The staff was very friendly and attentive throughout the meal, making sure everything was just right. The only thing I would have liked to see was a larger variety of non-alcoholic drinks, as that part of the menu felt a bit limited. Overall though, it‚Äôs a wonderful place to dine, and I‚Äôd definitely come back again.

reviews.author: Isabella Grandic
reviews.text:
Very delish food. Ceviche was the STAR! Loved the skewers too. Modern restaurant and not too difficult to get a reservation. A little light on the seafood, wish there was more per dish, but that‚Äôs the nature of upscale dining I suppose üòÇ

Constantly changing menu, modern twists on Peruvian food

reviews.author: Cass
reviews.text:
Objectively fire food. The ceviche was my favorite thing - really tangy and fresh. Deliciously cooked octopus.
The chicken skewers were also great.
The paella was a bitttt creamy for my liking. But it‚Äôs still really good.  Seafood was of course really well cooked.
We could get a reservation for 3 ppl for Saturday night the same week.

reviews.author: Andreas Kaiser
reviews.text:
Another jewels of the ‚Äúin‚Äù scene of Brooklyn: Llama Inn, a Peruvian restaurant with cool ambiente, friendly and knowledgeable staff and spectacular dishes. Chicken Anticucho, Trout tartage, Ceviche caretillero, tuna ceviche, ¬Ω chicken, and Lomo saltado all were outstanding with beautiful presentation, super tenderness, and colorful flavors.

(Originally posted by me on yelp)

reviews.author: Yolandy D
reviews.text: Food was great, everyone was kind and had a relaxing time. Arroz con mariscos was my favorite, I like Lomo salteado but I will say is in the pricey side. Evrything else 10/10. Lemon pie GREAT.

reviews.author: Anne Vogt
reviews.text: The decor at casino creates a lovely setting, and you can tell they've put effort into the atmosphere. Unfortunately, the food didn't quite live up to the same standard. While the portions were substantial, the dishes were ultimately unremarkable and didn't offer anything particularly exciting or memorable. It felt a bit pretentious, with prices that seemed inflated for the quality of the food. This could be a decent choice for a special occasion where ambiance is a priority, but for a regular dining experience, it's not worth the cost. With so many incredible dining options in New York, this is likely a "one and done" for me. I'd prioritize trying other places before considering a second visit.

reviews.author: carlos borges
reviews.text:
Casino restaurant envelops diners in a warm, inviting atmosphere that perfectly sets the stage for an extraordinary meal.

The Insalata mista is perfect for salad lovers‚Äîsimple, fresh, and lightly dressed to let the ingredients shine. It‚Äôs a refreshing start that feels effortlessly balanced.

The Heritage chicken is a standout dish that keeps me coming back. Featuring a fragrant ajwain gastrique and a velvety Vidalia onion soubise, this dish is pure perfection. It's so good that I, someone who rarely orders chicken at restaurants, find myself craving it regularly. That alone speaks volumes about its quality.

I‚Äôm also endlessly impressed by their Romano Beans, available year-round. Somehow, Casino manages to make this humble ingredient a star in a dish I make a point to enjoy every single visit.

reviews.author: Clara Park
reviews.text: I came here for my friend‚Äôs bday dinner. First, food and vibes are really really great. But we were very disappointed by service. Our server James never came to check on us and we couldn‚Äôt ask/order things on right time. We also ordered three bottles and when we finally got it we poured our own drinks as nobody came to help us. Also we called ahead to ask for candles as we were celebrating a birthday and he said okay, but he didn‚Äôt provide it. We had to ask a manager to get the candles she was very nice and helpful. I would like to come back for food but not for service.

reviews.author: Meredith Goossen
reviews.text: Probably more of a 3.5. Pretty restaurant, upstairs and down. Very active noise level and very close to one another tables. Cocktails were good, appetizers (eggplant faratini, radicchio salad, gulf shrimp) fine. I had the pesto pasta and it was really under seasoned. My friend had the clam pasta. We shared the pavlova for dessert and it was, again, fine. Good not great but an energetic lively vibe. Probably worth a revisit in the future.

reviews.author: Daria Dunne
reviews.text:
The vibe was great, very beautiful interior and feels like you go back in time. The espresso martini was great, not sure if it‚Äôs worth its price though. Food was a 3.5 out of 5, can‚Äôt say I‚Äôll be coming back for a dinner, but for a drink and atmosphere I would. If I could leave 3.5 stars I‚Äôd do that. Overall not a bad experience, however the service could be better.

Updated: Don‚Äôt order the chicken dish.
